Essential Duties and Responsibilities  Work as part of an agile DevOps team, contributing towards the continued automation of Pason’s infrastructure and software deployments. Automate the deployment of new and existing services for CI, QA and Production environments Evaluate and implement cloud-orchestration tools and frameworks to support the ongoing management of Amazon Web Services such as EC2, ELB, S3, RDS, etc. Propose, validate and implement creative solutions to scaling, performance and cost problems associated with running production and test systems in AWS. Write code to improve the Continuous Delivery pipeline Write code to provision and manage infrastructure within the cloud Support the resolution of production issues Participate in design and code reviews Participate in the team’s 24/7 on-call rotation  Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities  Proficiency in either Python or Java on Linux Experience working with configuration management technologies such as Puppet and Ansible Working in cloud environments (AWS, Google Cloud, Azure, etc) Experience with the Git or equivalent Experience working in an agile development environment (Scrum/Kanban). Build automation / continuous integration / continuous delivery experience  Work Experience  3+ years’ of software development experience working on commercial software projects or software development internship Meaningful or sustained contributions to open source projects or experience with substantial      personal projects is considered an asset  Education  A bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, Electrical Engineering or Computer Engineering
Title: Software Developer (DevOps)

Job_Description: About this job Compensation: C$48k - 69k | EquityJob type: Full-timeExperience level: Junior, Mid-Level, LeadIndustry: Enterprise Software, Security Software, Software Development / EngineeringCompany size: 51-200 peopleCompany type: PrivateTechnologies .net, c#, database, enterprise, objective-c Job description Not your everyday software developer position. Challenging and fast moving, yet friendly and supportive: a career you will look forward to every day. Work with intelligent people in an exciting environment where every month is different.   Positions Available:  Multiple positions ranging from intermediate up to team lead level (based on skill, regardless of the amount of experience or education), opening up immediately and throughout the year. Additional positions for specialists (for example, Android programming, user interface programming, etc). Tell us your strengths and we’ll go from there. Other Positions: We are also hiring for other positions (software tester, business analyst, project manager, graphic designer, and front-end GUI designer). You may apply for multiple positions separately. If you know someone in any of these areas, please do them a quick and friendly favour by letting them know about this posting.  Position Overview:  Full time and permanent. Fast moving in terms of variety of work and expectations. Flexible hours (for example: choose to start your day between 6am and 10am, work late some days and shorter on others). Gain valuable career experience in the newest highlevel technologies (C#, .NET 5, Java, MVC7, WCF, web services, SOA, Swift/Objective-C, Xamarin, F#). Gain experience with many advanced software engineering tools and techniques (code generation, object relational mappers, advanced .NET reflection, etc). Gain experience with both small and large projects, with involvement throughout the product life-cycle. Opportunities to be involved with higher level architecture and design. Mentoring from experienced software architects and some of the smartest peers in the country, on exciting projects that you can really sink your teeth into. A blend of programming methodologies (deliberately part way between agile, Kanban, and waterfall plus occasional extreme and pair programming methodologies). Does not involve a lot of boring technical support or fixing broken legacy applications. Most of the learning is through hands-on trying and doing and collaborating. Meetings and formal training are minimized. Rarely requires meeting with a client for those who prefer not to. Environment allows for some privacy at your workstation as well as time to concentrate without distractions when you need it.  Requirements:  Highly intelligent. Fast learner and enjoys learning. Passionate about making software and very good at it. Gets deeply involved with challenges and will persevere at length to achieve victory. Takes pride in work. A deep appreciation for reusable code and the benefits of object oriented design. No specific requirements for formal education or industry experience. We evaluate each applicant based on merit rather than formalities.  Nice To Have:  Ability to see opportunities for improvement everywhere. Experience with .NET or mobile development. Pragmatic approach to balancing perfectionism with getting the job done.  About The Work Environment:  Friendly, non-threatening, and non-political environment. Mid-sized company but retaining the speed and flexibility of a smaller company. We are a great environment for both outgoing people and those who are very shy and introverted (applicable to non-client facing positions). We strive to have every employee sitting near a window for natural light and to have plenty of plants throughout the office; we care about employee health. Free onsite massage therapy. Private nap rooms for isolated thinking time or for taking a nap if you didn’t sleep well last night. Atrium to enjoy the sun during lunch. Social events worth remembering (fencing competitions, curling, video game or board game parties, coding competitions, commando combat training, robotics club coming soon, etc). An example of our culture: Lunch together is in a very comfy sofa room, and even the quiet types are comfortable there. Unlimited access to pillage our kitchens for caffeine, sugar, healthy snacks, soups, and more :) Additional perks that are cost-shared like motorized sit-stand desks. Task focused: everyone in the company heavily uses centralized to-do lists to stay organized, prioritize, and coordinate. Fast paced  Applying:  What do you have to lose by exploring the possibility? Applying does not take long and we keep your application confidential (never disclosed to existing employer). Apply online today at https://careers.pleasantsolutions.com Even if you don't have your resume updated or ready to go, apply anyways, we want to hear from you! Please do not apply via email, use only the https://careers.pleasantsolutions.com link to apply.
Title: Software Developer / Programmer (Exciting and great variety)

They have a team of industry veterans and software experts backing the team up to make sure there is a clear vision and the expertise to get there. The team is focused on making sure that the back end works well with the mobile applications and web platforms. You will start out learning the app and platform and work with the team to master and code for success, fix pesky bugs, and work with the team to solve difficult problems. Paid benefits, company events, and a casual office environment. If you are still reading we take it you may be interested, so you will also receive an above market base salary and lots of room for learning, and development. What you need to do now If you're interested in this role, click 'apply now' to forward an up-to-date copy of your CV, or call us now. If this job isn't quite right for you but you are looking for a new position, please contact us for a confidential discussion on your career.

Travel to our Houston office 1-2 weeks per year to spend time working in person with the technical team there  Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities  Expertise in any of the following programming languages: Python, JavaScript, Java, C/C++ or C# Experience with the React.js framework Familiarity with code versioning tools such as Git Proficiency in Linux Experience working with hardware / IoT device control systems Experience with Test Driven Development / Behavioral Driven Development Experience providing leadership in technical teams Experience working with protocols such as Modbus, CANbus, ZigBee etc. Familiar with RESTful APIs Familiar with container technologies (Docker) Familiar with messaging protocols such as MQTT or AMQP Build automation / continuous integration / continuous delivery experience NoSQL database experience (MongoDB, DynamoDB, InfluxDB, etc.) Working in cloud environments (AWS, Google Cloud, Azure, etc.) A knack for benchmarking and optimization Agile/Scrum experience Experience in integration and unit testing Ability to work in a team or as an individual   Education  A bachelor's or better in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, Computer Engineering or related field.  Work Experience  3 years or more of software development experience on commercial development teams
Title: Intermediate Software Developer (Pason Power)

Job_Description: About this job Compensation: C$80k - 95kJob type: Full-timeExperience level: SeniorRole: Full Stack DeveloperIndustry: Aerospace, Agile Software Development, Technical ServicesCompany size: 51-200 peopleCompany type: PublicTechnologies java, angularjs, mysql, mongodb, git Job description We are building a next generation aircraft monitoring and in-flight diagnostic solution. The solution consists of both FLYHT H/W and S/W executing on the aircraft, communicating over a satellite network to a Cloud based application stack processing and disseminating the information. Communication is bidirectional and enables our customers to diagnose issues on the aircraft in real-time (we see it as equivalent to putting a mechanic on the aircraft while it’s flying). In emergency situations, the system will stream blackbox data to be stored and processed on the ground, fast tracking the investigation of accidents where retrieval of the black box is challenging. The solution will enable our customers to visualize the information received from the aircraft. We need an Senior Enterprise Software Developer to fully productize the enterprise side of the system and put the foundation in place for extending the solution with new features. We need your implementation and mentoring skills to build out our Java based software solution. You have expertise in high availability, disaster recovery and scalability. You understand how to design and implement software components with testability front of mind. You work exceptionally well with all stakeholders and development team members; people enjoy working with you. You take a pragmatic approach and balance long term vision with near term opportunities. FLYHT primarily works with open source, Java based technologies (for our enterprise projects). Responsibilities:  To implement high quality (low defect rate) code on time and within estimates To mentor team members To implement within and drive improvements to FLYHT’s software development processes  Technical Proficiencies:  Expert in Java based technologies and frameworks Expert in Scrum based agile development Expert in Cloud hosted and Java based enterprise development projects Expert in both relational and no-sql databases Strong experience with messaging frameworks  Qualifications  Completion of a B. Sc. In Computer Science, Software Engineering, or a related discipline Minimum 6 years of software development experience in a professional environment Excellent English communication skills (verbal and written) Good knowledge and understanding of different development methodologies, practices and tools such as code repositories, testing frameworks, release practices, continuous integration, and automated build servers Successful track record of defining architecture and guiding the implementation to align to the architecture  Assets  Knowledge of aeronautic industry Knowledge of avionic software development guidelines (DO-178, DO-278)
Title: Senior Enterprise Software Developer

Job_Description: About this job Job type: Full-timeExperience level: Senior, LeadRole: Frontend DeveloperIndustry: Enterprise Software, Manufacturing, Supply Chain Management SoftwareCompany size: 1-10 peopleCompany type: PrivateTechnologies javascript, angularjs, sass, html, typescript Job description The Company Located in downtown Kirkland, Net-Inspect is an established software company that provides web-based quality improvement software for the aerospace and medical industries. Our customers range from small manufacturers to large Original Equipment Manufacturers (OEMs) like Boeing, Pratt & Whitney, Honeywell, and Bombardier. We are currently looking for an experienced Front-end Software Developer to help us grow our business. Net-Inspect is different from most companies. While we are perceived as a large company by our customers, we have worked hard to maintain a small, but agile company internal feel. This enables all employees to get broad exposure to the ins-and-outs of a small business and work side-by-side with our CIO and Executive Team. Our people are fun, passionate, self-motivated, and innovative change agents. Net-Inspect believes our people and company culture are critical to growing our business over the long term, so we invest in growing, developing, and retaining our talent. The Opportunity As a Front-end Software Developer, you will have the chance to help design and develop web applications. The perfect candidate should have industry experience in user interface development and a strong drive to learn more. At Net-Inspect, we pride ourselves for having an open mind about new technologies, thus one of your main responsibilities will be to seek out new technologies and solutions. The Talent Net-Inspect is seeking a candidate with a minimum of 5 years of experience in the following areas:  HTML/CSS JavaScript Web application development Git (preferred), or other version control  At least 2 years’ experience in the following areas:  Angular and AngularJS (preferred), or comparable JavaScript framework SASS/SCSS Modern build tools (Webpack, Gulp, npm) TypeScript or modern JavaScript  Bonus points if you have knowledge in the following areas:  Additional experience with any of the above Experience writing code and performing maintenance for enterprise or software-as-a-service web applications Familiarity with UI frameworks Experience with NodeJS Experience in mobile development Strong sense for visual and user experience design Knowledge of modern front-end tooling (languages, frameworks, build tools, module bundlers, etc.) Experience in .NET and MSSQL  The Requirements  Hard-working, self-motivated and willing to learn new things US citizen to work with our customers’ sensitive data Ability to work well within a team environment and/or with little supervision Aptitude/affinity to work with new, up-to-date technologies and software frameworks Minimum 5 years of experience in front-end development Fluent in English  If you are passionate about technology, love building software that can disrupt an entire industry and can enjoy working with a small, but young development team, this opportunity is for you!

Job_Description: About this job Location options: Paid relocationJob type: Full-timeExperience level: LeadRole: Frontend DeveloperIndustry: Computer Software, Healthcare, SaaSCompany size: 51-200 peopleCompany type: VC FundedTechnologies angularjs, javascript, html5, css3, gulp Job description Lead Front-End Developer The position requires an experienced lead front-end developer who will be concerned with the design, creation and maintenance of front-end for Clinicient’s specialized healthcare application. The Lead will:  Be responsible for front-end development architecture. Act as a front-end Architect in the scrum process. Partner with UX Designer, Product Team as part of the Scrum Process. Communicate daily with each engineer and provide technical support. Lead technical decisions and act as the decision maker if necessary for front-end architecture.  Why You Will Love This Job  You're passionate about solving problems with code. You're an active coder. You enjoy working with new technologies. You have no problem coding front-end deliverables.  You love the idea of working on cross-functional teams: you'll work in close quarters with your UX designer, Engineers, and Product Managers every step of the way.   ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES  Excellent leadership skills with a lead-by-example attitude Skilled in data presentation, communication, problem solving, strategic thinking Ability to develop collaborative networks among peers and cross functional teams quickly Draws upon process to maximize results in innovation-oriented culture Self-starter with excellent time management skills and entrepreneurial spirit Relies on data to justify technical decisions Ability to clearly explain technical issues and rationale Front-end design and development using primarily Angular, AngularJS and other technologies as needed. Fix production issues and offer solutions. Meet expectations and schedules established by yourself and your team within SCRUM process. Provide troubleshooting and root cause analysis for production issues that are escalated to the engineering team Develop cutting edge solutions to maximize the performance, scalability, and distributed processing capabilities of the system Work with development teams in an agile context as it relates to software development, including test driven development, automated unit testing and test fixtures, and sometimes pair programming Actively participate in code reviews with talented software engineers and management. Work closely with UX Designer and product management to ensure business vision and requirements are addressed correctly.  EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE  3+ years of Angular, AngularJS combined development experience. 5+ years of JavaScript, TypeScript combined development experience. Experience using HTML5/CSS3, Gulp.   NICE TO HAVE  Experience using Visual Studio. C# , WebAPI development experience. Mobile development experience. Strong OOP skills. Health-care industry experience.   SKILLS AND ABILITIES  Must be a role model of Clinicient’s Core Values: People; Client-Focused; Trust; Innovation; Fun; Excellence and Teamwork. Strong communication skills, ability to work collaboratively and independently. Software development lifecycle grounding, experience with one of (Waterfall, Spiral/Iterative, Agile/Scrum) Strong analytic skills, ability to decompose complex issues and work through problems. Strong SQL skills, ability to decompose stored procedures called from Delphi to solve bugs, develop solutions.  SCOPE AND ACCOUNTABILITY The position will interface primarily with internal staff and will have a high level of impact on customer satisfaction based on customers’ experience with Clinicient’s product, the release process, and customer service levels. The nature of the position entails frequent new and varied work situations with a high degree of complexity.  There are some established procedures, but the individual will expected operate with little direct supervision.

Job_Description: Are you a server development guru who sets up Linux servers for breakfast and designs complex database systems for lunch? Are you able to translate complex game design requirements into highly functional server solutions? Do you thrive in a fast-paced highly goal-oriented game development environment? If your answer is yes to these questions, then we need you! As a Backend Server Engineer at IUGO, you will be responsible for the development and maintenance of our high volume game servers. We offer an environment that is challenging, rewarding, and fosters personal and professional growth. Come show us what you’ve got! <br/><br/> The ideal candidate should be an expert in Linux server development and related network development technologies. They should also be highly self-motivated and display exceptional problem solving skills. Details are listed below. <br/><br/> <strong>RESPONSIBILITIES</strong>  <ul> <li>Design and develop Linux game server technologies using Node.js and other languages</li>  <li>Create and implement features for massive multiplayer mobile games</li>  <li>Develop server tools to aid in the development and deployment of backend systems</li>  <li>Work with our dynamic and highly-driven development teams</li> </ul> <strong>REQUIREMENTS</strong>  <ul> <li>Hardworking and highly self-motivated</li>  <li>Excellent communication skills and able to work in a team environment</li>  <li>3+ years of relevant professional development experience on Linux environments</li>  <li>2+ years of Node.js experience</li>  <li>Experience with Object Oriented Programming</li>  <li>Experience with both relational and nonrelational (NoSQL) databases</li>  <li>Experience with deployment and Continuous Integration tools such as Ansible, Jenkins, Rundeck, etc.</li>  <li>BS/MS in Computer Science or qualifications in a related technical discipline</li> </ul> <strong>BONUS</strong>  <ul> <li>Experience with Amazon Web Service technologies (EC2, S3, SQS, DynamoDB, etc.) or other Cloud Services</li>  <li>Handle setup and configuration, monitoring, and maintenance of large game server clusters</li>  <li>Experience with PHP</li>  <li>Experience with ECMAScript 2017 (ES6)</li>  <li>Experience with network load balancers and network security (firewalls/ACLs)</li>  <li>Experience with large scale distributed server infrastructure design and development</li>  <li>Experience in Linux server administration/setup</li>  <li>Networked games or Social games server development experience</li>  <li>TCP/IP, Websockets, REST API, and/or web interface experience</li>  <li>Analytics/Telemetry systems experience</li> </ul> <strong>PERKS OF WORKING AT IUGO!</strong>  <ul> <li>Fully stocked kitchen (half of Costco is in our kitchen)</li>  <li>Catered lunch every Friday</li>  <li>Comprehensive benefits package, premiums paid in full by IUGO</li>  <li>Wellness program (in-studio RMT sessions, gym subsidies)</li>   <li>RRSP Matching</li>  <li>MSP Contributions</li>  <li>Massage chair & relaxation room</li>   <li>Games tables & consoles</li>   <li>Company socials & team events</li>   <li>IUGO Guilds</li>  <li>Beer Fridays</li>  <li>Vitamix (who doesn’t love a Vitamix?!)</li> </ul> <strong>What Happens Next?</strong> Our team reviews all applications, however, because we receive such high volumes of talent, we are only able to reach out to those who closely match our needs. If you are not contacted right away, don’t be discouraged as we keep all applications on file, and will contact you should a suitable role open up. Thanks for your interest in IUGO! <br/><br/> Please keep an eye out for our opportunities on our careers page: http://www.iugome.com/careers.html <br/><br/> <strong>Follow Us!</strong> <br/><br/> Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/iugomobile/ <br/><br/> Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/iugome/?hl=en <br/><br/> Twitter: https://twitter.com/iugome

Job_Description: <div> We are looking for creative individuals who are eager to make a real impact on millions of people’s lives by helping us build and enhance our SaaS web application. As a backend developer, you work closely with our engineers who work on the Android and iOS platforms throughout all stages of the development cycle. You will help us maintain and improve our web application and our RESTful web service. You will help us build a mission-critical infrastructure that enables our engineers to iterate at the fastest pace. <br/><br/> The position requires strong coding skills as well as enthusiasm for the low-level operations of highly scalable SaaS application. We use Python, Django, Javascript/JQuery, HTML, CSS, Bootstrap, Apache, and MySQL everyday. <br/><br/> <strong>Requirements</strong>   <ul>   <li>Master’s or Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or a related field, or equivalent experience.</li> <li>Proficient in Python application development (Knowledge of Django is a plus).</li> <li>Experience in Backend MVC web application development.</li> <li>Working experience with Linux server administration and scripting languages.</li> <li>Strong experience in relational database (MySQL preferred).</li> <li>Experience building tools for development automation (building, testing, releasing or monitoring).</li> <li>Experience using source control tools (we use Git).</li> <li>Experience developing networked applications and using or building RESTful APIs.</li> <li>Experience with networking protocols and technologies (SSL, etc.) is a plus.</li> <li>Self-motivated, and good team working skills.</li> <li>Being able to write efficient and well-documented code.</li> <li>Experience in Apache, Memcache, Jboss, or Tomcat and other open source web server software is a plus.</li> <li>You are resourceful, a fast learner and curious about the latest tech and industry trends.</li> </ul>  <strong>Responsibilities</strong>   <ul>   <li>Enhancing and developing the backend software that powers our platform.</li> <li>Being responsible for tuning, refactoring, and optimizing our databases for high scale should excite you.</li> <li>Monitoring system performance and planning for future capacity and scaling.</li> <li>Creating a repeatable automated deployment process for internal and production environments.</li> <li>Investigating bugs, diagnosing issues, assisting the team in troubleshooting system issues in all environments.</li> decisions that shape our technology stack.</li> </ul>  </div>
Title: Backend Developer

Job_Description: <b>FACULTY OF LAW</b><br><br>Established in 1887, the Faculty of Law is one of the oldest professional faculties at the University of Toronto. Today, it is one of the world's great law schools, a dynamic academic and social community with more than 50 full-time faculty members and up to a dozen distinguished short-term visiting professors from the world's leading law schools, as well as 600 undergraduate and graduate students. <br><br> The Faculty's rich academic programs are complemented by its many legal clinics and public interest programs, and its close links to the Faculty's more than 6,000 alumni, who enjoy rewarding careers in every sector of Canadian society and remain involved in many aspects of life at the law school. The Faculty of Law is housed in the elegant, state-of-the-art new Jackman Law Building, along with two beautiful historic buildings, Flavelle House and Falconer Hall. <br><br> <strong>POSITION DESCRIPTION</strong> <br><br> Reporting to the Director, Technology Services, the Website Designer/Developer (WDD) provides support for all Law website related design, development and administration activities and coordinates IT website-related projects with the Director. Website key duties include: design, development, maintenance, performance and administration of all Faculty of Law related websites; administering all integrations with internal/external systems; collaboration with content editors & external communications & marketing teams. Project coordinator key duties include: tracking and reporting on the status of project milestones; participating in and record keeping of client engagement and analysis meetings (minute-taking, keeping notes and other meeting material such as records of design solutions and decisions); scheduling and logistical preparation for meetings; working with clients and members of the Faculty community to gather information, business needs, and functional specifications for projects; and contributing to the development of project plans, system specifications reports and contracts. <br><br> <strong>QUALIFICATIONS (Minimum):</strong> <br><br> <strong>Education:</strong> <br><br> Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, Information Technology, or acceptable equivalent combination of education and experience is required. Courses in project management and Human-Computer Interaction would be an asset. <br><br> <strong>Experience</strong>: <ul> <li>Minimum of 4 years’ comprehensive experience with designing, structuring, developing, and implementing interactive web sites and mobile data-driven applications.</li> <li>Minimum of 3+ years of experience developing for and maintaining enterprise Drupal multi-site installations, designing and building Web-based applications, including backend databases.</li> <li>Extensive knowledge and experience with Web technologies, languages, and tools - (1) PHP and MySQL mandatory, (2) HTML, HTML5, CSS, XML, XSL, Browser DOMs, (3) AJAX, JavaScript and jQuery, and (4) Codeception, PHPUnit, SimpleTest, Test:Unit, JUnit, or similar.</li> <li>Comprehensive understanding & working knowledge of Drupal 7/8 CMS and Drush.</li> <li>Experience creating custom Drupal modules.</li> <li>Experience working with caching technologies such as Varnish, ESI, Entity Cache.</li> <li>Knowledge of RESTful frameworks.</li> <li>Knowledge of Git version control.</li> <li>Experience designing, building and consuming web services and APIs.</li> <li>Experience integrating applications with third-party solutions including authentication, single sign on, access and identity Management (e.g. LDAP, SAML, Active Directory).</li> <li>Thorough understanding of application development methodologies including Agile</li> <li>Expertise with object and component methodology and technology..</li> <li>Experience with database development, physical and logical database design, and data conversion (e.g. PostgreSQL, SQL, MySQL).</li> <li>Experience in gathering and analyzing technical requirements.</li> <li>Knowledge of coding standards and practices, including web accessibility standards.</li> <li>Experience developing web sites for multiple platforms and screen dimensions.</li> <li>Experience and understanding of user experience issues, Internet design principles, W3C standards, accessibility standards, and Windows, UNIX and Apple OS/X interface standards.</li> <li>Significant experience with LAMP stack.</li> <li>Experience with other web development frameworks would be an asset.</li> <li>Knowledge of enterprise systems typical of those found at U of T (e.g., UTORAuth, ROSI, Blackboard, SAP) is preferred.</li> <li>Experience with analytic and advertising platforms (e.g. Google Analytics, AdWords, LinkedIn Campaign Manager, Facebook Business Manager, Hotjar etc.).</li> <li>Experience developing and maintaining system, project, and process documentation.</li> <li>Experience coordinating IT/Web based projects (including but not limited to gathering information, business needs and functional specifications; planning components of projects and workflows)</li> </ul> <strong>Other:</strong> <br><br> Excellent communication (both oral and written) and interpersonal skills; demonstrated superior organizational, analytical, and problem-solving skills; highly self-motivated and self-directed; strong service orientation; attention to detail and a commitment to achieving the highest-possible quality and accuracy; demonstrated ability to work independently, showing initiative and good judgment; demonstrated ability to prioritize tasks and responsibilities and to work well under pressure; ability to work with confidential information; ability to draft written materials for review and distribution; Adept at explaining technical concepts to a wide variety of non-technical users both orally and in writing; Ability to learn quickly from technical reference manuals and on-line help facilities; Strong team player with a sense of urgency when required; Ability to maintain technical knowledge of emerging web-related technologies and trend; Must be able to work with a large number of people from diverse backgrounds. Experience working in a team-oriented, collaborative environment, with exposure to mentoring or coaching staff. Knowledge with the operations of a university/college on a faculty administrative level is an asset. <br><br> <strong>APPOINTMENT DETAILS:</strong> <ul> <li>This posting is for a full-time, continuing appointment</li> <li>This position is part of the United Steelworkers Union Local 1998 employee group</li> <li>The hiring rate is $66,051 with an annual step progression to a maximum of $84,468</li> </ul> <strong>HOW TO APPLY:</strong> <br><br> Please visit the following link and Click the “Apply Online” button: https://utoronto.taleo.net/careersection/10000/jobdetail.ftl?job=1801142&tz=GMT-04%3A00 <br><br> <b>Job posting closing date:</b> June 10, 2018<br><br> Canada's leading teaching and research university, the University of Toronto is recognized as one of Canada's Top 100 Employers, one of Canada's Best Diversity Employers, and one of Canada's Top Employers for Canadians Over 40. U of T offers employees challenging work, flexible, family-friendly programs and opportunities for professional and career development. To learn more about the University of Toronto, please go to http://www.utoronto.ca/. To learn more about U of T as a place to work and develop a career, please visit http://www.hrandequity.utoronto.ca/ <br><br> The University of Toronto is strongly committed to diversity within its community and especially welcomes applications from racialized persons / persons of colour, women, Indigenous / Aboriginal People of North America, persons with disabilities, LGBTQ persons, and others who may contribute to the further diversification of ideas.

Job_Description: <strong>Company profile</strong> <br/><br/> Two Tall Totems is a world class mobile / software development Company working for a global client list in multiple industries. Over the past five years, we have built multiple applications and patented a portfolio of technologies. This experience puts us in the best position to cater larger accounts and launch our own products. <br/><br/> We are a family. We have fun. Design means everything to us and we have the technical chops to deliver what lesser programmers might describe as spooky magic. We expect amazing things from every TTT family member and drive each other to achieve greatness! <br/><br/> <strong>Role Summary - Backend Developer</strong> <br/><br/> We are looking for a talented backend developer… one who is meticulous with designing and then developing backend solutions and APIs for Two Tall Totem’s client projects. The ideal candidate should have a deep understanding of best practices when it comes to database models and frameworks. <br/><br/> <strong>Responsibilities</strong>  <ul> <li>Work closely with the engineering team</li>  <li>Backend programming and modelling</li>  <li>Directly conversing with clients and stakeholders</li>  <li>Bring new ideas and frameworks to the team</li> </ul> <strong>Skills/Qualifications</strong>  <ul> <li>Excellent command over the Java software language is a must</li>  <li>Experience building web applications using Java</li>  <li>Experience in relational and non-relational databases</li>  <li>Experience with Spring not needed but will be an asset</li>  <li>Understanding of REST APIs, OOP, and related best practices</li>  <li>Experience with NetflixOSS not needed but will be an asset.</li> </ul>
Title: Backend Developer

Job_Description: Are you a server development guru who sets up Linux servers for breakfast and designs complex database systems for lunch? Are you able to translate complex game design requirements into highly functional server solutions? Do you thrive in a fast-paced highly goal-oriented game development environment? If your answer is yes to these questions, then we need you! As a Backend Server Engineer at IUGO, you will be responsible for the development and maintenance of our high volume game servers. We offer an environment that is challenging, rewarding, and fosters personal and professional growth. Come show us what you’ve got! <br/><br/> The ideal candidate should be an expert in Linux server development and related network development technologies. They should also be highly self-motivated and display exceptional problem solving skills. Details are listed below. <br/><br/> <strong>RESPONSIBILITIES</strong>  <ul> <li>Design and develop Linux game server technologies</li>  <li>Create and implement features for massive multiplayer mobile games</li>  <li>Develop server tools for game features and live operations</li>  <li>Work with our dynamic and highly-driven game development teams</li> </ul> <strong>REQUIREMENTS</strong>  <ul> <li>Hardworking and highly self-motivated</li>  <li>Excellent communication skills and able to work in a team environment</li>  <li>3+ years of relevant professional development experience on Linux environments</li>  <li>Expert in a server side language - PHP, Python, Ruby, Java, Javascript</li>  <li>Proficient with relational database usage and configuration</li>  <li>BS/MS in Computer Science or qualifications in a related technical discipline</li> </ul> <strong>BONUS</strong>  <ul> <li>Experience with Amazon Web Service technologies</li>  <li>Experience with PHP Frameworks</li>  <li>Experience with Node.js (ES6 is a plus)</li>  <li>Experience with NoSQL database technologies</li>  <li>Experience in Linux server administration/setup</li>  <li>Knowledge of OAuth technology</li>  <li>Knowledgeable in Unix/Linux and core network services (DNS, http servers, NTP, SMTP, syslog)</li>  <li>Experience with network load balancers and network security (firewalls/ACLs)</li>  <li>Experience with large scale distributed server infrastructure design and development</li>  <li>Networked games or Social games server development experience</li>  <li>Sockets, REST API, web interface experience</li>  <li>Analytics/Telemetry systems experience</li> </ul> <strong>PERKS OF WORKING AT IUGO!</strong>  <ul> <li>Fully stocked kitchen (half of Costco is in our kitchen)</li>  <li>Catered lunch every Friday</li>  <li>Comprehensive benefits package, premiums paid in full by IUGO</li>  <li>Wellness program (in-studio RMT sessions, gym subsidies)</li>   <li>RRSP Matching</li>  <li>MSP Contributions</li>  <li>Massage chair & relaxation room</li>   <li>Games tables & consoles</li>   <li>Company socials & team events</li>   <li>IUGO Guilds</li>  <li>Beer Fridays</li>  <li>Vitamix (who doesn’t love a Vitamix?!)</li> </ul> <strong>What Happens Next?</strong> Our team reviews all applications, however, because we receive such high volumes of talent, we are only able to reach out to those who closely match our needs. If you are not contacted right away, don’t be discouraged as we keep all applications on file, and will contact you should a suitable role open up. Thanks for your interest in IUGO! <br/><br/> Please keep an eye out for our opportunities on our careers page: http://www.iugome.com/careers.html <br/><br/> <strong>Follow Us!</strong> <br/><br/> Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/iugomobile/ <br/><br/> Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/iugome/?hl=en <br/><br/> Twitter: https://twitter.com/iugome
Title: Backend Server Engineer - General Applications

Job_Description: Looking to work for an awesome team? You've come to the right place! Our developers are a tight-knit group, and we are pushing for substantial product development as we continue looking to grow the team in the next year. We value passion for quality, maintainable, and scalable code, and for building awesome products. A side benefit of developing for the restaurant industry is that once were done working hard, we have some great clients who can always provide amazing venues for unwinding with our close knit team. <br/><br/> TouchBistro is looking for several <strong>Backend Developers</strong> at the Intermediate or Senior level here in our Toronto office. Our POS system is evolving and our customers are demanding more product capabilities. As a member of our agile Technology team, you will have the chance to work on our current or next-Gen product's web features. Our current stack is ReactJS and NodeJS but if you have worked with other frameworks that is also sufficient. To apply for this position, you must possess a minimum 1+ years of production experience using NodeJS and SQL databases. The development team is poised for growth and along with that comes with many opportunities to learn different skills as well as have a growth path internally. <br/><br/> <strong>YOUR DAY-to-DAY</strong>  <ul> <li><strong>Using JavaScript</strong>, design & implement features to help our restaurant customers succeed</li> <li><strong>Create</strong> a new API using NodeJS and SQL databases on the backend</li> <li><strong>Keep Up-to-Date</strong> with best practices and tooling from the JavaScript community</li> <li><strong>Fearlessly Collaborate</strong> with your team to solve problems and learn from failures</li> </ul> <strong>ALL ABOUT YOU</strong>  <ul> <li>Knowledge of modern JavaScript, HTML5, CSS3</li> <li>1+ Years of Experience with NodeJS</li> <li>3+ Years of experience using a backend language (we use Node, but Java, Ruby on Rails, Python, etc. is also acceptable)</li> <li>Some exposure to SQL or NoSQL databases</li> <li>Test Driven Development</li> <li>Experience working on teams in an agile-scrum environment</li> <li>4 year College Diploma or University Degree</li> </ul> <strong>WHY CHOOSE US?</strong> <br/><br/> TouchBistro is an award-winning iPad Point of Sale system, built for restaurant people by restaurant people. Were a team of thinkers, builders, doers, and innovators. While many of us have experience working at restaurants, some of us just have a true passion for the industry. <br/><br/> Were venture backed by some of the best tech VCs in the world and are partnered with top innovators in the mobile, food, and payment industries. <br/><br/> Were global and growing! TouchBistro is used in more than 100 countries worldwide and has offices in NYC, Austin, Chicago, London and headquarters in Toronto. Were a fast-moving, ever-evolving company on a mission to change the way restaurateurs do business and help them succeed through our products and services, but we need talented, passionate people to help! <br/><br/> So, what do you say? Are you ready to become part of something awesome? <br/><br/> TouchBistro believes in fostering an inclusive workplace where all individuals have an opportunity to succeed. Requests for accommodation due to a disability can be made at any stage of the recruitment process.
Title: Backend Developer

Job_Description: We're looking for an experienced backend developer to help us build and improve AmpMe - the app that lets you sync phones with your friends to listen to music and watch videos at the same time! Weve also recently released remote parties and chatting - throwing some of world's biggest parties! <br/><br/> You will be an essential part of our team, helping scale AmpMe to the tens of millions of users across the world. Come join our awesome team that loves to work hard and play hard - were infamous for our team activities! <br/><br/> <strong>What were looking for:</strong> <ul> <li>Strong knowledge of  <ul> <li>Node.js and familiarity with Java, Go and Scala</li><li>Docker, orchestration (ex: Kubernetes) and microservices architecture</li><li>Relational and non-relational databases (MongoDB, MySQL)</li><li>Git and the GitHub Flow</li></ul></li> <li>Experience with high traffic and highly available systems</li><li>A strong desire to learn in a fast-paced environment</li><li>Good communication skills in English and French (asset)</li> </ul> <strong>Your role:</strong> <ul> <li>Develop and maintain AmpMe's backend infrastructure</li><li>Ensure the performance, scalability, availability, and responsiveness for AmpMe users</li><li>Collaborate with our team to define, design, build and ship awesome features</li><li>Take data-driven decisions regarding the future of our infrastructure</li><li>Maintain high code quality, organization, and automatization</li> </ul> <strong>What you deserve:</strong> <ul> <li>Competitive compensation for your exceptional work</li><li>Private health clinic and comprehensive health benefits</li><li>Up to 10% yearly team performance bonus</li><li>Stock options to make sure were all in this together</li><li>A vacation bonus, that can be spent on the destination of your choice</li><li>A brand new laptop of your choice and premium bluetooth headphones</li><li>A fun place to work in the heart of downtown Montreal with access to all of its amenities</li> </ul>  <strong>Qualifications</strong><br/><br/><strong>Education:</strong> College Degree in Computer Science or more <br/> <strong>Experience:</strong> 3+ years <br/><br/> <strong>Language:</strong> <ul> <li>English required</li><li>French a big plus</li>  </ul>  <strong>Skills</strong> <br/> Scala, Jenkins, GIT, DevOps, MongoDB, Google App Engine, Amazon Web Services (AWS), Java, Node.js, Infrastructure<strong>About AmpMe</strong><br/><br/>AmpMe launched in late 2015, bringing a spontaneous idea to reality, raised over 13 million dollars in funding to become the world's first social music platform. Named one of the most innovative apps by Google, AmpMe has been downloaded over 12 million times by music lovers across the globe. Our current world record is over 22,000 phones synced at the same time. Let's break it together!
Title: Backend Developer

Job_Description: We’re ecobee. Born and raised in Canada, we're making living more comfortable with simply designed smart home devices that aren’t just smart for our users—but for our planet too. We invented the world’s first smart Wi-Fi enabled thermostat and continue to innovate the next generation in technology that is connecting the home. <br/><br/> Our hive, headquartered in Toronto, is growing quickly and we are specifically looking for a Backend Developer for our fantastic Server Development team. <br/><br/> The team mindset is entrepreneurial and futuristic. We thrive on solving complex problems with elegant solutions - without taking shortcuts along the way. <br/><br/> <strong>Who you are:</strong> <br/><br/> You like to continuously challenge yourself by finding new and better ways to solve complex problems. You don’t mind learning new technologies if it means getting you there sooner. The bigger the challenge, the better. You have at least one year of experience coding in Java. <br/><br/> <strong>What you'll do:</strong> <br/><br/> As a Software Developer you’ll use leading edge technologies to innovate highly-concurrent, Java-based server applications that directly impact ecobee’s success. You may work on deploying applications within ecobee's infrastructure as well as AWS and Google Cloud Platform. We encourage the freedom to investigate and evaluate new technologies to solve complex problems. As a result, your input will have a significant impact on our company and products. <br/><br/> <strong>We look for experience in at least 2 of the following areas:</strong>  <ul> <li>Performance, unit testing, and debugging skills</li> <li>Writing scripts for automation</li> <li>Relational and NoSQL databases</li> <li>Software engineering fundamentals, such as: data structures (hash tables, lists, sets), algorithms and their time complexity, and computer architecture (registers, stack, heap, etc.)</li> </ul> <strong> Bonus marks if you have:</strong>  <ul> <li>Experience with Linux systems administration and theory (processes management, file systems and permissions, kernel tuning, package management, performance monitoring, selinux /apparmor, user security, and sudo)</li> <li>Knowledge of security best practices (encryption fundamentals, SQL injection, XSS, buffer overflow, and authentication/authorization strategies)</li> <li>Love for Open Source technologies</li> </ul> Are you the one we need? If so, we would love to hear from you! <br/><br/> ecobee is committed to workplace diversity and will provide accommodation to applicants with disabilities throughout the hiring process.
Title: Backend Developer

Job_Description: <strong>About us</strong> <br/><br/> At Uber, we believe that by solving some of the biggest problems of our time, we can create a future where there is limitless freedom of movement for people and things all across the world. Just talk to our people — and feel their passion, optimism and curiosity for building solutions every single day on behalf of drivers, riders, couriers, eaters and employees. <br/><br/> While these tough problems we face every day can be incredibly difficult to figure out, we believe those same problems enable us to personally grow the most. So we welcome people from all backgrounds who have the passion to change the world and also want to help create a supportive and collaborative environment. So that ultimately, we can learn together, solve together, build together, and move the world forward together. <br/><br/> <strong></strong> <br/><br/> Not that long ago we were just an app to request premium black cars in a few metropolitan areas. Now we’re a part of the logistical fabric of more than 600 cities around the world. Whether it’s a ride, a sandwich, or a package, we use technology to give people what they want, when they want it. <br/><br/> For our drivers and couriers, the Uber app represents a flexible way to earn money. For cities and communities, we help strengthen local economies, improve access to transportation, and make streets safer. And we’re thinking about the future, too with teams working on autonomous trucking and self-driving vehicles. <br/><br/> <strong></strong> <br/><br/> It’s tempting to want to join a company that looks like it has it all figured out<strong>.</strong> But those companies aren’t always the best place to learn. The truth is, the more problems a company has, the more opportunities there are to solve. And the more problems you solve, the more you learn. And the more you learn, the more you grow. <br/><br/> We need your skills and passion to help make it happen! Be sure to check out the Uber Engineering Blog to learn more about the team. <br/><br/> <strong> <br/> Uber is an equal opportunity employer and enthusiastically encourages people from a wide variety of backgrounds and experiences to apply. We don’t discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, sex (including pregnancy), gender, national origin, citizenship, age, mental or physical disability, veteran status, marital status, sexual orientation or any other basis prohibited by law.</strong> <br/><br/> <strong>The role</strong> <br/><br/> As a Backend Engineer at Uber, you’ll be working on code that’s closest to the business. Your work will impact live riders, eaters, driver-partners, and operations teams across the globe. Our teams span from the traditional ridesharing business to the new emerging products around UberEATS, our own Mapping technology, and Self-Driving cars. <br/><br/> You will build user-facing products, handle and store thousands of payment transactions per second, and develop intelligent fraud prevention strategies that scale. From building maps that help move millions of people, to the messaging systems that let us interact with them - the work you do will impact every single Uber request. <br/><br/> <strong>About you</strong> <ul> <li>Expertise in one or more object oriented programming language (e.g. Python, Go, Java, C++) and the eagerness to learn more</li><li>Experience with developing complex software systems scaling to millions of users with production quality deployment, monitoring and reliability.</li><li>Experience with large-scale distributed storage and database systems (SQL or NoSQL, e.g. MySQL, Cassandra)</li><li>Ability to decompose complex business problems and lead a team in solving them</li> </ul> <strong>Bonus points if</strong> <ul> <li>BS/MS/PhD in Computer Science or a related field</li>  </ul> <strong>Team-specific focus areas</strong> <br/><br/> Additionally, Uber has a variety of roles and teams for you depending on where your interests match best. <ul> <li>High performance systems - Experience with building high performance distributed systems that can scale to 100,000s QPS.</li><li>Core Infrastructure - Experience with developing and running large scale distributed storage systems, service oriented architectures, and reliable monitoring and deployment infrastructure.</li><li>Data Processing - experience with building and maintaining large scale and/or real-time complex data processing pipelines using Kafka, Hadoop, Hive, Storm, and Zookeeper</li><li>Machine Learning - experience with machine learning, information retrieval, algorithmic complexity, data mining, pricing, optimization.</li><li>Geospatial - Familiarity with geospatial datasets and services, such as maps, local search, points of interest and business listings data, mobile device location and GPS traces.</li> </ul> #SO-post
Title: Software Engineer - Backend

Job_Description: <div>League is the digital alternative to traditional health insurance. Led by serial entrepreneur and Kobo founder Michael Serbinis, we are bringing much-needed innovation to the stagnant health care industry. League enables employers to give employees access to health and wellness spending accounts, flexible and cost-effective group insurance plans and workplace health services, all through our website and mobile apps. Our mission is to help people live healthier, happier lives every day.</div> <br/> <div>Were looking for a backend developer to help us build scalable and reliable services to support our growing business. In this role, you will work as part of a small cross-functional team to iteratively deliver value to our customers. Each of our product delivery teams is responsible for shipping an important piece of our roadmap, as well as continually maintaining and improving a specific area of our product.</div><br/> <div>To thrive in this role, you are someone who works well in teams and enjoys collaborating. Furthermore, you understand the business impact of your code and enjoy incorporating the business objectives into your approach to development. You enjoy working with product management to find the best solution to the problem at hand, and can balance technical tradeoffs with delivering customer value quickly and iteratively.</div><br/> <div>Our platform and applications run on Google Cloud. We build backend services with Go and MongoDB, a web frontend with React and Redux, and native Android and iOS applications. We ship code to production multiple times per week, and were always looking to improve both the quality and speed of our releases.</div><br/> <div>You may not have expertise in our particular programming languages or technologies, but thats okay. Whats important to League is your ability to take ownership and solve problems, as well as your collaborative spirit and drive for professional growth.</div>You Will  <ul> <li>Work on a cross-functional, feature-driven development team</li><li>Participate in technical design and planning discussions</li><li>Implement new features and core services in the League platform</li><li>Uphold standards for quality by performing code reviews, fixing bugs, creating automated tests, and monitoring performance</li><li>Live our team values of ownership, pragmatism, cooperation, and empathy for our customers</li> </ul>  About You  <ul> <li>You enjoy delivering value to customers</li><li>You have experience building scalable, fault-tolerant web services</li><li>You know how to write high-quality, testable code, and understand the tradeoffs between expediency and maintainability</li><li>You understand how the web works and what a good API looks like</li><li>You are a strong communicator, and you can explain complex technical concepts to designers, support, and other developers without a problem</li><li>When things break, youre eager and able to help fix things</li> </ul>  Nice to Have  <ul> <li>Working knowledge of Go or MongoDB</li><li>Experience in a startup environment</li> </ul>  <div>Does this sound like you? Wed love to hear from you. Submit your application and someone from our recruitment team will be in touch.</div><br/> <div>We believe that diverse teams perform better, and that fostering an inclusive work environment is a key part of growing a successful team. We welcome people of diverse backgrounds, experiences, and perspectives. We are an equal opportunity employer, and we are committed to working with applicants requesting accommodation at any stage of the hiring process.</div>
Title: Backend Developer

Job_Description: Company Description<br/><br/>PureFacts is located in downtown Torontos financial district, offering services and solutions to more than 40 of Canadas premier wealth management companies. <br/><br/> At PureFacts, were wildly committed to delivering the best possible solutions on the planet. Were a talented team of math wizards, technology geeks, big thinkers, financial keeners, perfectionists, and go-getters. Were smart, fast and nimble. We partner with our clients and earn their trust by consistently providing long-term value. We aim to exceed their expectations at every turn and astound them with exceptional client experiences.<br/><br/>Job Description<br/><br/>PureFacts is looking for a C#/ASP.NET developer to join our team to help us build great software products for the wealth management industry. <br/><br/> The successful candidate will work as part of a larger team building products for our customers. A strong candidate will understand all aspects of product development, from usability to performance to security, as well as propose patterns and solutions to complex problems. A successful candidate will also be up to date with the latest .NET Core technologies as well as having used other technology stacks in his or her career.<br/><br/>Qualifications  <ul> <li>4+ years experience developing high quality C# code</li><li>Database experience with SQL Server and others such as MongoDB or Cassandra</li><li>Experience creating RESTful apis</li><li>Experience using O/RMs such as Entity Framework or Dapper</li><li>Experience with SOA/Microservice architecture</li><li>Experience using messaging brokers such as RabbitMQ/Kafka</li><li>Experience with .NET Core</li><li>Proficient using GIT and working in an agile environment</li><li>Excellent English communication skills: written and oral</li><li>Excellent problem solver</li> </ul> Nice-to-have skills and experience <ul> <li>Knowledge of investing and finance</li><li>Experience working with SSIS</li><li>Experience working with containerization technologies such as Docker and Kubernetes</li><li>Experience with Big Data technologies such as Hadoop or Spark</li> </ul>  Additional Information<br/><br/><strong>PureFacts looks for team members that are hungry, humble and smart. Our people have an independent, entrepreneurial spirit and can work with others in our growing, flexible workplace. Our colleagues are motivated by doing the best for our clients, and by being rewarded for their hard work.</strong> <br/><br/> We would like to thank all applicants, however only those selected for an interview will be contacted.

Job_Description: <p><strong>About Us:</strong></p> <p>Smilegate West Inc. is the North and South American publisher of its parent company Smilegate, headquartered in South Korea. The Company specializes in Free-to-Play online games including CrossFire, and Lost Saga. Founded in 2006 with a goal of becoming a leading publisher and digital media distributor of online video games, the Company is built on the principle that online, community-based video games offer unique and compelling gaming experiences with untapped mass market potential and wide social appeal.</p> <p>The Toronto office employs a staff of widely-talented and culturally diverse employees, led by an experienced and imaginative management team. In publishing CrossFire, one of the most played online FPS games worldwide, with over 6 million concurrent users and 500 million registered players, currently available in 80 countries including China, Vietnam, North & South America, and Europe, Smilegate West Inc. continues to deliver the highest quality free-to-play game experience through its proprietary gaming portals, Z8Games.</p> <p>For more information about the company and its current product offerings, please visit www.smilegatewest.com.</p> <p><strong>About You:</strong></p> <p>The Company is always seeking top talent with various skill sets to join our growing team.</p> <p>You are talented, hard-working, and excited by the idea of joining a Company where gaming at work is the norm. At this time, we are seeking a Web Developer who is responsible for the creation and implementation of a wide variety of Web-based products using PHP, HTML5, CSS3, JavaScript, MSSQL and MySQL. If you have qualifications and skills below, apply now!</p> <p> </p> <ul> <li>Must have minimum of 5+ yrs of solid hands on Web Development experience in frontend, backend, website development and portal development.</li> <li>Bachelor’s degree required in technical field or education + equivalent experience.</li> <li>Excellent coding ability of PHP, HTML5, CSS3, jQuery, React, REST API and web-based services</li> <li>MySQL/ MSSQL preferred</li> <li>experience in Java Spring an asset</li> <li>AngularJS / Laravel / Bootstrap / CI / TDD an asset</li> <li>Exceptional interpersonal & communication skills</li> <li>Highly driven, independent, analytical and problem solving leader</li> <li>Thorough knowledge or experience in launching online games, mobile games or other game entertainment related industries</li> <li>Must be a Team Player with a focus on reliability and punctuality</li> </ul> <p><strong> </strong></p> <p><strong>About the Job:</strong></p> <p><strong>Position Responsibilities:</strong></p> <ul> <li>Responsible for the creation and implementation of a wide variety of Web-based products using PHP, HTML5, CSS3, React, JQuery, RestAPI, MSSQL and MySQL.</li> <li>Follow industry best practices</li> <li>Work with QA team to ensure project meets desired objectives</li> <li>Troubleshooting and testing sources to make sure they are vital and that the content is displayed as intended</li> <li>Other duties as assigned</li> </ul> <p> </p> <p><strong>Contact information:</strong> Human Resources (Email: recruit@smilegatewest.com)</p> <p>We thank all applicants, however only those eligible to work in Ontario with a valid work permit and selected for an interview will be contacted.</p>
Title: Web Developer

You will create or enhance software products based on specifications developed in conjunction with subject matter experts within Gemalto .You will be involved in the entire software development lifecycle and will be expected to deliver your assignments with minimal supervision.</DIV> <DIV> </DIV> <DIV><B>A week in the life of a Development Engineer:</B></DIV> <UL> <LI> <DIV>You will design, code/debug and test new/existing software modules. </DIV> <LI> <DIV>You will contribute towards development of new approaches and techniques and perform code reviews for the team.</DIV> <LI> <DIV>You will participate in the development of larger modules which may also include requirements analysis, adhering to secure coding practices and detailing design aspects under the direction of experienced engineers. </DIV> <LI> <DIV>You will use source control tools and related processes/procedures and build mechanisms.</DIV></LI></UL> <DIV><B>Knowledge, Skills and Experience:</B></DIV> <UL> <LI> <DIV><B>To do this job, you must be</B> proficient in fundamentals of computer science, software engineering, operating systems and networking fundamentals, and must have knowledge of SDLC. You must have Java, JEE and Linux experience.</DIV> <LI> <DIV><B>It would be preferred if you have</B> JavaScript, AngularJS and CSS experience</DIV> <LI> <DIV><B>You must be</B> fluent in English.</DIV> <LI> <DIV> <B>We would like someone</B> to join our team who is goal oriented, focused and a dedicated individual, also has a good learning agility, with excellent analytical, and communication skills. </DIV> <LI> <DIV><B>You need to have</B> a BE/B. Tech/ M. Tech/MCA of equivalent degree.</DIV> <LI> <DIV><B>We are looking for someone with</B> 2-8 years of experience in software development using relevant skills.</DIV></LI></UL>
Title: Backend Developer

Job_Description: <p>Chronogolf is a fast growing VC-backed SaaS company based out of Montreal, Canada with satellite offices in Vancouver and Lyon. We provide cloud-based management solutions to over 450+ golf courses worldwide coupled with a marketplace for golfers that helps them book rounds of golf in real-time.</p> <p>We are a young and dynamic team of 30 people with a "work hard, play hard" attitude. We are results-driven, and we never forget to give ourselves a pat on the back for achieving our goals.</p> <p>Come work in our Montreal office, and help us change the golf industry one customer at a time.</p> <p>Visit pro.chronogolf.com for more information on our management solutions, and visit www.chronogolf.com for more information on our marketplace.<br><br></p> <p><b>The challenge</b></p> <p>We are looking for an experienced Angular developer who will immediately become a key member of our team. The job will involve working closely with the product lead and other developers. You'll play a major role in the continued development of our core application as we add new features and grow our customer base. Upon joining the company, you will be expected to contribute to design decisions and produce simple and elegant working code. We work in an agile fast paced environment.</p> <p>Our frontend stack is part on AngularJS and part on Angular, which ties with our backend development in Ruby (on Rails). We also develop our mobile apps with Nativescript and Angular.</p> <br> <p><b>About you</b></p> <p>- You are proficient with JavaScript core language features and functionality (including ES6 and ES7)</p> <p>- You can jump into pre-written AngularJS code, understanding, adding to, and improving it</p> <p>- You care about the overall user experience of the application and strive to constantly improve it</p> <p>- You can validate overall application design and conduct design, unit/integration testing, and code reviews</p> <p>- You can play a major role in the enhancing and maintaining of the front-end applications</p> <p>- You have a collaborative work ethic and the ability to work within a self-organized, cross-functional team</p> <br> <p><b>Qualifications</b></p> <p>- 2+ years of experience</p> <p>- AngularJS and Angular (Angular CLI, Typescript, RxJS)</p> <p>- State management libraries (@ngrx/store or Redux)</p> <p>- CSS & SCSS</p> <p>- Interfacing with REST APIs</p> <p>- Use of debugging tools</p> <p>- Unit and E2E (Protractor) testing</p> <p>- Familiarity with agile and scrum</p> <p>- Previous startup experience is a plus</p> <p>- Previous mobile experience is a plus (we use Nativescript)</p> <br> <p><b>Completely Unnecessary</b></p> <p>- Playing Golf</p> <p>- Ability to win at foosball</p> <p>- Appreciation for GIFs, Memes, and Emoticons</p> <br> <p><b>Benefits</b></p> <p>- IT welcome package</p> <p>- 20 days paid time off</p> <p>- Monthly health benefits</p> <p>- Flexibility to work from home when needed</p> <p>- Fun, casual, and relaxed work environment</p> <p>- Work with an enthusiastic team of entrepreneurs</p>
Title: Frontend Developer (Angular)
