Job_Description: <strong>Backend developer</strong> <br/><br/> Busbud is the bus travel booking app and website with the largest sellable coverage. Users can search, compare and buy tickets from hundreds of bus companies in over 16,000 cities and more than 1M different bus routes. <br/><br/> We're working hard to make the bus, one of the most environmentally friendly and sustainable modes of transportation, a great travel option for customers in dozens of languages in over 60 different countries. Our platform unites travelers, partners and bus companies throughout the world to move an increasingly large share of the entire industry online to increase access and improve the travel experience. <br/><br/> Our people, technology, and approach have been instrumental in getting us this far, but we have so much more to do, and that's where you come in. <br/><br/> <strong>What do we expect from you?</strong> <br/><br/> Busbud is looking for a Senior and Intermediate Backend Developer with a diversified experience to join our team of talented developers. Our challenges evolve, and as a data and API specialist, you'll have the greatest impact on the systems and platforms that support our customers, our partners, our products and our team. <br/><br/> Your initial focus will be to build fast, highly available, and easy to consume Javascript applications to bring the right data to customers of Busbud and have them successfully purchase their bus travel. You'll balance iteration and prototyping with risk-taking and greenfielding. You'll routinely work with modern tools like Node, Redis, Postgres and RabbitMQ (you'll use a few others for internal tools too). You'll share your wisdom with a team that values learning and experimenting. <br/><br/> Depending on the task, you may own the feature end to end, or work with other team members to bring it to life together. We expect you to feel at home on the server modeling data, in the profiler improving performance, in documentation explaining how to use your fine work and everywhere in between. <br/><br/> Given Busbud's all javascript stack (with some Typescript making an appearance), and depending on your interests, you'll also have the opportunity to work on preventing fraud, improving how we communicate with customers, how we interface with supplier systems, upgrading our global architecture, monitoring, and much more. We've got lots of challenges from which to choose! <br/><br/> <strong>How can you impress us?</strong> <br/><br/> You might recognize a few of these from Camille Fournier's RTR post, which we've used to build our own career path ladder. <br/><br/> As an Intermediate or Senior developer, you  <ul> <li>Have shaped broad architecture, having shipped multiple large services, complex libraries or major pieces of infrastructure (5+ years)</li> <li>Are sought out for technical guidance</li> <li>Are recognized as a prolific contributor to core and side projects</li> <li>Love what you do, and sweat the details</li> <li>You're comfortable with (or can quickly ramp up) with some key ingredients in our tech stack: Javascript, NodeJS, React, Redis, Postgres, CDNs and caches, REST APIs and Heroku</li> </ul> At Busbud, you will  <ul> <li>Be an owner and expert on large sections of our codebase, initially the website and related services</li> <li>Anticipate technical issues at the product level and make architectural and design decisions to avoid them</li> <li>Exemplify software development excellence balancing scope and deadlines to deliver on quality and speed with appropriate test coverage, monitoring and rollout plans</li> <li>Multiply the effectiveness of peers by facilitating cross-team work</li> <li>Make our pages and site fast, beautiful, accessible and great for our users</li> <li>Delight Google and other search engines with your thoughtful use of sitemaps, interlinking, annotated content and other tactics to help travelers find buses.</li> </ul> <strong>Whats in it for you?</strong>  <ul> <li>Compensation based on experience</li> <li>4 weeks of vacation (3 weeks + holiday season)</li> <li>Health Benefits</li> <li>Stock options</li> <li>Apple equipment</li> <li>Breakfast snacks, team lunch on Wednesdays, happy hour on Fridays</li> <li>Team events</li> <li>A beautiful office in Montreals burgeoning tech neighbourhood, Mile End</li> </ul> <strong>What's it like working as a Developer at Busbud?</strong>  <ul> <li>You get the tools you need to be successful: laptop, big screen, comfy chair and desk and whatever else you might need to do your best work</li> <li>We invest in our tool chain so you can focus on building: we've got instrumentation, monitoring, logging, continuous integration, continuous deployments, crowd testing, managed translations and much more. And since we use Javascript in almost all our projects, it's easy for anyone to jump across projects, provide a code review or contribute.</li> <li>We love our office and having most of the team there for high-bandwidth face-to-face communication, and we also have flexible work schedules and support for remote work in our DNA - Mike, our CTO, had spent most of his time in Busbud's early days working remotely out of New York using chat, Github and other async tools to great success in addition to Google Hangouts for 1-on-1s, and also larger team meetings. Our A/V setup isn't perfect (yet!), but it's gotten pretty good :)</li> <li>Many of us have kids, others hobbies, and sometimes both, so we encourage a sane work/life balance. If you want to work like crazy, we'll take that too - you'll be in good company with the team's night owls</li> <li>We use science (A/B tests) and customer feedback (interviews, support, live chat) to determine the impact of our work</li> <li>We serve over 10M bus departures daily through our API, website and apps, and we're constantly looking for ways to improve our performance and availability without overwhelming the bus companies that supply us with the data - there are lots of challenges in this area around failure mitigation, latency compensation, cache optimization and much more</li> <li>We help travelers in over 60 countries, so we have all kinds of competitors keeping us on our toes, and we need to find ways of providing value to our users to keep them coming back to Busbud to find and buy what is essentially a commodity product. This is a constant challenge which we meet with creativity and taking risks.</li> <li>As much as we can, we deploy explicit and intentional effort to improve diversity in tech and also help upskill the next generation of developers through internship programs, mentoring and hosting, organizing or sponsoring relevant events.</li> <li>There's a lot more, and if you're still reading, then you should hop over to the blog and our tech blog.</li> </ul> <em>"Busbud is committed to equal employment opportunity for all employees and to providing its team members with a work environment free from discrimination and harassment. All employment decisions at Busbud are based on business needs, job requirements and individual qualifications, regardless of race, colour, religion or belief, national, social or ethnic origin, sex, age, physical, mental or sensory disability, HIV status, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, marital, civil union or domestic partnership status, pregnancy, or any other status protected by the laws or regulations in the locations where we operate. Learn more about why we care about diversity."</em>
Title: Backend Developer

Job_Description: <strong>Back End Developer</strong><strong>About Us</strong> <br/>  <br/> Mavencare is a home care agency that specializes in providing high quality care for seniors using our proprietary technology. We are revolutionizing home healthcare by creating a world where people can live out their lives in the comfort of their own homes. Through technological innovation, we are reshaping health care delivery for an aging population! <br/>  <br/> Key Responsibilities <br/>  <br/> We are looking for a backend developer who can help us build, maintain and improve Mavencare’s platform. You will have the opportunity to play a pivotal role in Mavencare’s success as a part of the passionate and talented engineering team. <br/><br/> As a backend developer at Mavencare, you will plan, implement, deploy, and maintain our backend systems, while working with other developers to build new features and improve existing ones. You will play an important role in reshaping the lives of seniors through the products you work on. <br/>  <br/> <strong>Requirements</strong>  <ul> <li>You’ll need to have good computer science fundamentals, meaning you’ve got a degree in CS or something equivalent.</li><li>Solid fundamental understanding of web technologies including HTTP, RESTful services, and cloud platforms such as AWS</li><li>Complete comfort and familiarity with software development tools (git, Github, bug tracking)</li><li>Experience using, or familiarity with the MEAN Stack: MongoDB, Express, AngularJS and Node.JS</li><li>You have a strong interest in building complex algorithms using highly scalable and distributed technologies</li><li>You have strong debugging skills</li> </ul>  Nice to have  <ul> <li>You can show us some awesome work on your GitHub account.</li><li>Experience with machine learning algorithms</li><li>Previous experience in a startup or healthcare organization</li><li>You have experience building (and even better, managing and deploying) performant code on AWS</li> </ul>  <strong>Compensation</strong>  <ul> <li>Base salary (dependent on experience) and company stock option plan.</li><li>Opportunities for training and career development</li></ul>
Title: Back End Developer

Job_Description: <div> </div> <div> Backend Developer</div> <br/>At Adaware, we are building the next generation of smart monetization solutions for smart consumers. <br/><br/> The Adaware Team is comprised of creative thinkers and international professionals with diverse backgrounds. We hire socially-conscious people with a strong work ethic and a commitment to genuinely make a difference. At Adaware, we value personal and professional development, and our employees are encouraged to challenge themselves with new projects and responsibilities. If you would like to put your career on the fast track, come to Adaware to create solutions that help computer users worldwide.<br/> <div> <strong>The Challenge</strong></div>  <ul>  <li>Build high performance microservices and microservice architectures.</li> <li>Maintain current implementations in a high availability environment.</li>  <li>Manage, maintain and improve a broad base of services in a variety of languages.</li>  <li>Work in an environment with many different technologies.</li> <li>Work with a skilled team of engineers and architects and thrive within a group dynamic setting.</li> <li>Contribute to the team environment.</li>  </ul>  <div> <strong>More about you:</strong></div> <br/>You could be our ideal candidate if you present: <ul>  <li>Minimum 3-5 years of experience as a back-end developer (any language)</li> <li>Experience with SOA</li> <li>Hands-on, demonstrable knowledge of:</li>  <ul>  <li>Server side programming (ie. Node/Python/.NET/.NET CORE)</li> <li>Continuous Deployment (source code management, build systems, deployments)</li> </ul>  <li>Some experience with UI and client</li> </ul>  <ul> <li>1-2 years experience building and deploying production code with Node.js</li></ul>  <ul>  <li>Practical experience with SQL and/or NoSQL (MySQL, MongoDB, SQL Server, MemSQL).</li> <li>Practical experience with service busses (kafka, nats, nservicebus)</li> <li>Self-supporting (able to set up and maintain dev environment, build system, dockerfiles)</li> <li>Experience establishing integration standards and related processes.</li> <li>Good understanding of Linux environment.</li> <li>Effective verbal and written communication skills.</li> <li>Detail oriented</li> <li>Good documentation habits</li>  </ul> <strong>Even better if you have:</strong><ul> <li>Client-side: HTML5, CSS3, UI JavaScript (ie. Angular/React/jQuery)</li></ul>  <ul>  <li>Security conscious development, experience working with pen testing and security auditing.</li> <li>Test building for unit tests</li> <li>Conceptual tool experience (UML Diagramming, Flow)</li> <li>Experience with containers and container-based architectures.</li> <li>Working knowledge of cryptographic concepts.</li> <li>Git workflow (ideally a github account with public contributions)</li> <li>Working knowledge of packaging systems (Gulp/Grunt/Webpack).</li> <li>Experience with other languages C+,Go, Scala, Rust or similar.</li> <li>Bilingual Preferred (French & English)</li> <li>Experience with workflow management tools (Jira, Github Workflow, TFS)</li>  </ul>  <div> <strong>Location:</strong></div> <br/>The position is located in Montreal.<br/> <div><strong>Company Benefits:</strong></div> <br/>Employees at Adaware enjoy a full range of benefits, such as: <ul>  <li>3 weeks of vacation plus 1 week at Christmas;</li> <li>Health insurance with dental;</li> <li>Life insurance;</li> <li>Public transportation card;</li> <li>RRSP contribution match program.</li>  </ul>
Title: Backend Developer

Job_Description: <strong>It’s your experience that counts</strong><br/><br/>Rise is Canada’s complete HR-Payroll-Benefits solution that gives businesses everything they need to build loyal and productive teams — all in one place. <br/><br/> When you step through our doors, you’ll discover a workplace that brings people together to innovate and succeed. We’re a forward thinking group of individuals that believes in building strong relationships, challenging one another, and fostering an open environment of dialogue and creativity. <br/><br/> Headquartered in Vancouver, we serve hundreds of businesses and thousands of employees across Canada and have big plans to grow. We care deeply about our employee experiences and support each individual with our own HR + Benefits solution that we all trust. <br/><br/> At Rise, it goes without saying that we have a lot of fun, and we’d really love you to join us. We aim to provide you with the most positive, challenging, and transformative experience of your career.<br/><br/><strong>This could be you</strong><br/><br/>Managing people is core to every business. That’s why Rise is on a mission to dominate the people-management software market with powerful software that is a cut above the rest. Rise provides an experience that is unique in our market by focusing on modern, intuitive software and an outstanding client experience. <br/><br/> We are seeking a backend developer with at least three years of experience to work on the RESTful API services that power our front-end applications. The developer should be strongly familiar with Rails or a similar framework. <br/><br/> As an engineering organization, we always choose to get things done right over getting them done fast. We strongly believe that research and experimentation is fundamental to producing high-quality software and are not afraid to challenge conventional wisdom. We are looking for people who share these values and are strongly consistent with their own.<br/><br/><strong>Here’s what you’ll be doing</strong><br/><br/><strong>#1) <strong>Build a Winning Platform</strong></strong> <br/><br/> You’ll work directly with the Senior Backend Software Developer and the development team to execute on the product plan for the Rise platform. Using your extensive knowledge of software architecture, you’ll build product enhancements to the platform, improve the architecture, and develop, debug and design software applications and databases. <br/><br/> <strong>#2) <strong>Collaborate with the Development Team</strong></strong> <br/><br/> You’ll collaborate with the development team in the design, development, test, deployment and operation of the Rise platform. As a backend software developer, you’ll deliver fast and predictable results, adjusting in an agile fashion to provide what our customers need. <br/><br/> <strong>#3) <strong>Ensure Operational Excellence</strong></strong> <br/><br/> You have a proven track record of operational success with a high attention to detail. You’ll ensure sanity of architecture, operational excellence, and quality while delivering results on time.<br/><br/><strong>Your qualifications</strong>  <ul> <li>Minimum 3 years of experience building software</li><li>Deep full-stack knowledge of client, server, tools, and internet technologies</li><li>Advanced level experience with Ruby on Rails, PostgreSQL, and AWS (EC2, ECS, SNS, SQS, RDS, etc.), and Terraform</li><li>Strong working knowledge of Microservices, Docker, Lean development practices, Object Oriented Analysis and Design Patterns, testing and automation (TDD, BDD, Unit Testing, Selenium, Jenkins), and linting, debugging and profiling</li><li>Experience in managing products and agile methodologies with scrum</li><li>Bachelors in Computer Science or Engineering or equivalent experience</li><li>Exceptional verbal and written communication skills</li><li>Exceptional attention to detail and organizational skills</li><li>Deeply collaborative and enjoy working in a cross-departmental fashion</li><li>Driven and entrepreneurial, yet open and approachable</li><li>Willing to roll up sleeves and do whatever needs to be done to make this a great place to work</li><li>Technical knowledge and mobile app development expertise is a bonus</li> </ul>
Title: Backend Software Developer

Job_Description: MetricAid is a small, high-functioning team that operates in the healthcare field. We provide a service to hospitals that improves the quality of life for patients and physicians and we are growing. <br/><br/> We are looking to hire a talented backend developer to help expand our API and reporting services. We want somebody who loves to write server code: from security to database queries and everything in between. If you like to write efficient code that delivers results fast then this is the job for you. <br/><br/> <strong>You will require</strong>:  <ul> <li>A desire to build quality code that you can take pride in</li>  <li>The drive to learn new things and challenge yourself</li>  <li>Ability to follow direction independently</li>  <li>Experience with relational databases (PostgreSQL)</li>  <li>Experience working on HTTP servers</li> </ul> <strong>You should have</strong>:  <ul> <li>Experience writing in GO or a C-based language</li>  <li>Ability to write code that is easy to read and understand</li>  <li>A desire to work as part of a social and involved team</li>  <li>The capacity to learn new skills regularly</li>  <li>A love of board games</li> </ul> <strong>Your job will involve</strong>:  <ul> <li>Writing backend server code including</li>  <li>Database queries</li>  <li>HTTP route handlers</li>  <li>Support packages</li>  <li>Contributing to planning/implementation of features</li>  <li>Designing data structures and relationships</li>  <li>Working in a Scrum environment</li> </ul> If this sounds like you (or almost sounds like you) submit an application. We’d love to hear from you. <br/><br/> Some of the things being employed in this role provides...  <ul> <li>Benefits</li>  <li>15 paid days vacation per year (5 day work week) (pro-rated from hire date)</li>  <li>20 paid days vacation starting year 4</li>  <li>10 recognized statutory holidays</li>  <li>8 additional paid "holidays" that we combine with statutory holidays to make a longer "break"</li>  <li>We are invested and involved in our community through volunteering</li> </ul>
Title: Backend Developer

Job_Description: Dawn InfoTek Inc. is a professional IT consulting team that partners with major financial institutions, investment firms and government sectors. We have been dedicated in delivering cutting-edge consulting services and recruiting all levels of IT positions for our clients. <br/><br/> <strong>Job Description</strong> <br/><br/> We are currently seeking competent individuals to fill the role ofSeniorBackend/API Developeron our dynamic team for our client, a Bank among the five big banks in the GTA. <br/><br/> Term: Contract (6 months) <br/> Location: Scarborough <br/><br/> Skills and Qualifications <br/><br/> 5+ years of experience in Enterprise Application Development <br/> Expertise in Middleware development and application Enhancement <br/> 5+ years with the following technologies: Java/J2EE, Webservices (Restful and SOAP), XML, XSD and SQL, DB2 <br/> Experience with IBM infrastructure (WebSphere Application Server 6.x/AIX 6/1) <br/> Concrete Unix shell Scripting skills <br/> Experience withClearCase and RAD <br/> Working knowledge of the following operating Systems: AIX, Linux <br/> Working knowledge of jBoss <br/> Full software lifecycle experience and good trouble shooting skills. <br/> Application development experience including analysis, design, coding and testing. <br/> Ability to effectively manage time and prioritize tasks <br/> Ability to work independently as well as part of a team <br/> Most show initiative, take on tasks with little direction, and produce high-value deliverables in a fast-paced environment <br/> Strong communication and presentation skills. <br/><br/> Nice to Have <br/><br/> Experience with ETL and CRM tools is an asset <br/><br/> For an immediate consideration, please apply as soon as possible to this posting by submitting your Resume along with your AvailabilityDate and Expected Hourly Rate. <br/><br/> Referrals are more than welcome! <br/><br/> We thank all applicants for your interest and referral. However, only qualified candidates selected for an interview will be contacted. <br/><br/> For further information on our company, please visit: www.dawninfotek.com
Title: Backend / API Developer

Job_Description: <strong>Flexitive Design Cloud</strong> is the worlds leading AI driven visual communications platform. Flexitive is used by global brands, agencies and publishers to improve the quality of their visual communications and streamline workflow production. <br/><br/> As a Backend Developer, you will be responsible for designing and building out of our infrastructure at scale, serving 1+ billion impressions per month. Being a big part of a small team, you will have the opportunity to experiment with new technologies and contribute to the overall technical direction of the company. <br/><br/> <strong>Impact:</strong> <ul> <li>Writing back-end code in Javascript, possibly Python, that will improve our code base in meaningful ways</li><li>Designing new features, and rearchitecting current features to support our current and projected scaling requirements</li><li>Sharing knowledge and experience with other team members and provide mentorship to more junior engineers through code reviews and lunch and learns</li><li>Continue to develop and advance our automated testing infrastructure</li><li>Learning and growing constantly to feed your passion for self-improvement</li> </ul> <strong>What You Need to Succeed:</strong> <ul> <li>3+ years of relevant work experience in a backend or full stack role</li><li>Solid knowledge of databases and modelling; relational or otherwise</li><li>Strong understanding of REST, and experience with API design</li><li>Knowledge of cloud platforms (AWS, OpenStack, CE) and infrastructure design (HA, multi-AZ, etc)</li><li>Desire to work in a fast-paced, startup environment</li><li>A bachelors degree in Computer Science, or related field</li><li>Experience with Node.js, Angular.js, React or similar javascript frameworks.</li><li>Experience writing unit, integration or e2e tests.</li><li>Experience with AWS, Terraform, Ansible, Puppet, Debian Packaging, Vagrant, Packer, Docker, Kubernetes, Jenkins or Teamcity, Cucumber.js.</li> </ul> <strong>Why Flexitive?</strong> <br/><br/> You want to be part of a fast growing, passionate team. We offer all employees competitive compensation (including salary, bonus and stock options in the company) and invest in your personal growth and success. <ul> <li>Employee stock option plan</li><li>Medical and dental benefits</li><li>Bi-monthly hackdays, work on passion projects or make something cool in our VR Room</li><li>Our Toronto office is located right downtown next to College subway!</li><li>Flexible hours and relaxed dress code</li><li>Monthly game nights and quarterly team building events</li><li>Jax, our golden retriever loves hugs</li><li>Unlimited snacks!</li> </ul> <strong>We are looking for the best in the business - tell us why you are</strong> <strong>the one.</strong>

Job_Description: Nventive is looking for a 3 month contract to increase the capacity of our .NET Azure / AWS development team. <br/><br/> The context is very exciting because you have to build from A to Z a complete backend (API + storage) allowing a mobile solution with high utilization rate to store and use the data of the users of a system. <br/><br/> Everything is to be done in this project, the choice of technologies to use is not yet done (but we are moving forward so fast!) <br/><br/> And the architecture of the backend remains to be validated. We must explore ECommerce platforms, payment platforms, proof of concept to validate the integration of workflows between our system and known shipping platforms (like UPS). <br/><br/> The goal of all this is to build the mobile product + cloud + web that will be the basis of a startup in the field of online sales of specialty wine. Only pleasure in perspective! <br/><br/> The following prerequisites and qualifications are required for this position: <br/><br/> 8 to 15 years of experience in .NET development (C #) <br/> Knowledge of ASP.NET Core <br/> Knowledge of Azure App Services <br/> Knowledge of Azure SQL Database or DB NoSQL or MongoDB <br/> Knowledge of Azure Storage <br/> TypeScript knowledge <br/> You must be autonomous, resourceful and curious <br/> Knowledge of Azure Functions an asset <br/> Knowledge of Docker an asset <br/> Why are we a fantastic team? <br/><br/> Yes, we offer lunch, flexible hours, beer on Thursdays and Fridays, sloche at all times, a game of ping-pong in time and reimbursement of gym fees. Yes, you can come and work in shorts, sandals ... even in fangs if you wish. In addition, our team is composed of extremely stimulating people who will allow you to push your limits. We work with prestigious clients from different industries, ensuring that you work constantly on various mandates. You will have access to very advanced expertise and technologies thanks to our partnerships and our tools developed internally. <br/><br/> This employer is an equal opportunity employer committed to diversity and inclusion. We are pleased to consider all qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, protected veterans status, Aboriginal/Native American status or any other legally-protected factors. Disability-related accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process.<br/> <div><div><div></div><div><div><div><div><div>nventive <br/> 215 rue Saint-Jacques, bureau 500 <br/> Montréal, QC <br/> H2Y 1M6</div></div></div></div></div></div><div><div><div>+-</div></div><div><div>Leaflet | Map data © OpenStreetMap contributors</div></div></div></div>
Title: .NET Backend developer

Job_Description: <div>Born at Y Combinator in Silicon Valley and now based in Toronto, Taplytics is an intelligent customer experience company that A/B tests mobile & web applications and push notifications. Our software processes a huge amount of user data: over a trillion monthly events occurring on over a billion devices around the world. Growing our product from here is a complex & compelling challenge.</div><br/> <div>This exciting technical space is directly applicable to larger enterprise customers who have invested heavily by implementing Taplytics into their own applications. These large-sized deals have given our sales and support teams the chance to make a big impact on their businesses and to grow our company quickly.</div> <br/> <div>Taplytics is growing fast in Toronto and we are searching for the technical talent that can take on big architecture challenges and sales talent that can navigate large enterprise deals.</div><br/> <div>Taplytics has a bright future. Come grow your career with us.</div><br/> <div><strong>About the Role: Senior Backend Engineer</strong></div><br/> <div>Taplytics is growing and is looking to increase the teams experience base by adding a Senior Backend Engineer. This is a chance to both be a leader on our small team as well as tackle the huge challenge of managing our user scale.</div><br/> <div>We operate using a micro-service architecture with many services built using Node.js, GO, and Python. Our micro-services are powered by various backend systems, including: MongoDB, Redis, Kafka, PostgreSQL, and ElasticSearch. We run at petabyte scale delivering experiences to billions of devices, requiring unique scaling solutions. Our systems are hosted across AWS / GCP using Docker Containers and Terraform. We are consistently iterating and improving our systems and workflows to improve how we develop code with a focus on producing the best product possible.</div>What wed like you to do:  <ul> <li>Drive our team to design, implement, build and maintain our large and distributed, high availability micro-services</li><li>Write elegant yet strong code that will be at the core of our offering</li><li>Focus on quality with continuous integration and deployment</li><li>Create testing strategies</li><li>Participate in a wholesome approach to product development</li><li>Drive the architecture, product backlog and timelines</li><li>Embrace the challenges of dealing with, building and maintaining servers and applications that power all of our client's applications</li><li>Be a core member of a close-knit engineering team that ships code continuously</li><li>Manage and optimize operations procedures, get our deployments 100% automated</li> </ul>  <strong>What an incredible candidate looks like:</strong>  <ul> <li>+5 years experience developing</li><li>+2 years experience as a leader or in senior capacity</li><li>Experience deploying and maintaining continuous integration and deployment</li><li>A deeply rooted love for testing. Someone who knows the benefits of unit tests vs integration tests</li><li>Experience with server side development and deployment</li><li>High volume, high availability experience</li><li>Good handle on testing strategies: Integration vs. Unit, mocking tools and strategies, continuous integration, etc...</li><li>Collaborate with our Product, Engineering, and Customer Success teams to design, implement, build and maintain our micro-services</li><li>Be a core member of a close-knit engineering team that ships code continuously</li> </ul>  <div><strong>What youll get from us:</strong></div><br/> <div>Taplytics offers the chance to grow your career as we grow our company. Our culture of trying new processes, new tech and new ideas means youll add valuable experience to your resume quickly. While youre working to grow the company, well have your back with a competitive salary, unlimited vacation, health benefits starting day one and first rate Apple gear.</div>
Title: Backend Engineer

5 years professional experience in building and deploying production-ready web-based products<br/><br/>Business  <li> Excellent organization and time-management skills; ability to prioritize and multi-task; ability to clearly report statusto management</li> <li> Strong communication skills in French and/or English, written and spoken. Our teams are perfectly bilingual!</li> <li> Proven and creative problem-solving skills, with strong attention to detail</li> <li> Experience participating in the full software life cycle</li> <li> Naturally motivated to "get things done" in a fast-paced and evolving business environment</li>

Job_Description: If you're a skilled PHP/API Backend Developer looking for a company where you can have a real impact and work with a small and passionate team, look no further. <br/><br/> Audiobooks.com is looking for an experienced PHP/API Developer to make our website and native iOS & Android apps tick. We're looking for someone who is passionate about development and can design and implement new features. <br/><br/> We're an audiobook company on the outside but a tech company at our core, so expect a fast-paced and constantly evolving role. We're obsessed with experimenting and love trying new things. Got a great idea? Don't hold back. New projects and opportunities appear on a weekly basis-here, your job description is a launch pad, not a jail cell. Autonomy is a major part of our office culture, so we're looking for someone who works well in a team but doesn't need someone looking over their shoulder.<br/><br/><strong>Responsibilities</strong>  <ul> <li>Design, implement and test web application code</li><li>Work with mobile developers to write API calls that are lightweight and fast</li><li>Find and solve tricky bugs in legacy applications</li><li>Documenting your work</li><li>Problem solving. Collaborate with other teams to design creative solutions</li> </ul>  <strong>Qualifications</strong>  <ul> <li>2-5 years experience working on web applications, (LAMP stack ideally)</li><li>Experience writing API calls to support a native mobile app on Android or iOS</li><li>2+ years experience with any SQL language. Mysql, Postgres etc.</li><li>Familiarity with HTML, CSS, and Javascript (jQuery ideal)</li> </ul>  <strong>Skills</strong> <br/> SQL, Strong OOP familiarity, Comfortable using source control (Git ideal), Comfortable with AJAX.<strong>About Audiobooks.com</strong><br/><br/>Founded in 2011, Audiobooks.com is an app-based subscription retailer for audiobooks, delivering fast and easy access to over 100,000 titles to booklovers around the world. Our members can listen to best sellers, new releases and classic favourites on Apple and Android devices and via our partners: Sonos, GM, Jaguar and Land Rover. With a customer-first focus, we're constantly innovating and experimenting to create the best experiences for our listeners. Audiobooks.com is an RBmedia company.<br/><br/><strong>Other Information</strong><br/><br/>At Audiobooks.com, youll never feel tied to your desk. Weve got two stories of really bright, open space in a great location thats just a 10-minute walk from Appleby GO Station, and we offer free parking. We provide our employees with healthy snacks and bring in a massage therapist and a yoga/mindfulness instructor on a monthly basis. We offer full benefits, and an <strong>unlimited paid vacation policy</strong>. Our close-knit group runs a ping-pong league, a book club, and frequent lunch outings for our resident foodies. Everyone who works here is friendly, talented and passionate, and enjoys getting their hands dirty building amazing products. <br/><br/> <strong>Youll love where you work!</strong>

Job_Description: Company Profile <br/><br/> Morgan Stanley is a global financial services firm and a market leader in investment banking, securities, investment management and wealth management services. With offices in more than 43 countries, the people of Morgan Stanley are dedicated to providing our clients the finest thinking, products and services to help them achieve even the most challenging goals. <br/><br/> As a market leader, the talent and passion of our people is critical to our success. We embrace integrity, excellence, team work and giving back. <br/><br/> Technology <br/><br/> The Technology division partners with our business units and leading technology companies to redefine how we do business in ever more global and dynamic financial markets. <br/><br/> Our sizeable investment in technology results in leading-edge tools, software, and systems. Our insights, applications, and infrastructure give a competitive edge to clients’ businesses—and to our own. <br/><br/> Institutional Securities Technology (IST) develops and oversees the overall technology strategy and bespoke technology solutions to drive and enable the Institutional businesses and enterprise-wide functions. lines in a number of divisions across the firms. <br/><br/> The group is responsible for supporting all functions within each lending business, including underwriting, origination, securitization, loan servicing, asset management, and more. <br/><br/> Role Description <br/><br/> We are looking for a creative and talented Java developer with an eye for quality and detail to help the team build a modern lending platform that will combine and replace several internal systems, streamline business functions and open up business opportunities. <br/><br/> The candidate will work on a global team, with concentration in Montreal, New York, London, and India. <br/><br/> The platform will be built as a web application and will communicate with various back end data services. <br/><br/> Role and responsibilities <br/><br/> • Work with small, full-stack feature teams to deliver complete components for broader platform integration   <ul> <li>Communicate ideas, drive user demos, and work with business stakeholders to iterate development lifecycle</li> <li>Create self-contained, reusable, and testable modules and components</li> <li>Apply thorough understanding of the responsibilities of the platform, database, API, caching layer, proxies, and other web services used in the system <br/><br/> Required skills <br/><br/> • 5 years of strong software development experience in building Java REST services</li> <li>Strong core Java 8, J2EE tools, SpringBoot, Spring MVC</li> <li>Solid experience in working with Sybase/DB2/MySQL</li> <li>Strong knowledge of end-to-end testing tools and methodologies including JMock/Mockito</li> <li>Good knowledge of OO concepts and design patterns</li> <li>Professional, precise communication skills with client interaction</li> <li>Experience with troubleshooting web applications, familiarity with performance profiling tools</li> <li>Familiarity with source control systems including Git/Stash <br/><br/> Desired skills: <br/><br/> • Knowledge of C#, WinForms</li> <li>Knowledge of Angular2, TypeScript/JavaScript</li> <li>Agile/Scrum Methodologies <br/><br/> Knowledge of French and English are required. <br/><br/> Morgan Stanley is an equal opportunities employer. We work to provide a supportive and inclusive environment where all individuals can maximize their full potential.<br/><br/></li> </ul>

Job_Description: <strong>It’s your experience that counts</strong><br/><br/>Rise is Canada’s complete HR-Payroll-Benefits solution that gives businesses everything they need to build loyal and productive teams — all in one place. <br/><br/> When you step through our doors, you’ll discover a workplace that brings people together to innovate and succeed. We’re a forward thinking group of individuals that believes in building strong relationships, challenging one another, and fostering an open environment of dialogue and creativity. <br/><br/> Headquartered in Vancouver, we serve hundreds of businesses and thousands of employees across Canada and have big plans to grow. We care deeply about our employee experiences and support each individual with our own HR + Benefits solution that we all trust. <br/><br/> At Rise, it goes without saying that we have a lot of fun, and we’d really love you to join us. We aim to provide you with the most positive, challenging, and transformative experience of your career.<br/><br/><strong>This could be you</strong><br/><br/>Managing people is core to every business. That’s why Rise is on a mission to dominate the people-management software market with powerful software that is a cut above the rest. Rise provides an experience that is unique in our market by focusing on modern, intuitive software and an outstanding client experience. <br/><br/> We are seeking a senior backend developer with at least six years of experience to work on the RESTful API services that power our front-end applications. The developer should be strongly familiar with Rails or a similar framework. <br/><br/> As an engineering organization, we always choose to get things done right over getting them done fast. We strongly believe that research and experimentation is fundamental to producing high-quality software and are not afraid to challenge conventional wisdom. We are looking for people who share these values and are strongly consistent with their own.<br/><br/><strong>Here’s what you’ll be doing</strong><br/><br/><strong>#1) <strong>Build a Winning Platform</strong></strong> <br/><br/> You’ll work directly with the Head of Development and provide leadership to the development team to execute on the product plan for the Rise platform. Using your extensive knowledge of software architecture, you’ll build product enhancements to the platform, improve the architecture, and develop, debug and design software applications and databases. <br/><br/> <strong>#2) <strong>Guide the Development Team</strong></strong> <br/><br/> You’ll guide the development team in the design, development, test, deployment and operation of the Rise platform. As a senior backend software developer, you’ll deliver fast and predictable results, adjusting in an agile fashion to provide what our customers need. <br/><br/> <strong>#3) <strong>Ensure Operational Excellence</strong></strong> <br/><br/> You have a proven track record of operational success with a high attention to detail. You’ll ensure sanity of architecture, operational excellence, and quality while delivering results on time.<br/><br/><strong>Your qualifications</strong>  <ul> <li>Minimum 6 years of experience building software</li><li>Deep full-stack knowledge of client, server, tools, and internet technologies</li><li>Advanced level experience with Ruby on Rails, PostgreSQL, and AWS (EC2, ECS, SNS, SQS, RDS, etc.), and Terraform</li><li>Strong working knowledge of Microservices, Docker, Lean development practices, Object Oriented Analysis and Design Patterns, testing and automation (TDD, BDD, Unit Testing, Selenium, Jenkins), and linting, debugging and profiling</li><li>Experience in managing products and agile methodologies with scrum</li><li>Bachelors in Computer Science or Engineering or equivalent experience</li><li>Exceptional verbal and written communication skills</li><li>Exceptional attention to detail and organizational skills</li><li>Deeply collaborative and enjoy working in a cross-departmental fashion</li><li>Driven and entrepreneurial, yet open and approachable</li><li>Willing to roll up sleeves and do whatever needs to be done to make this a great place to work</li><li>Technical knowledge and mobile app development expertise is a bonus</li> </ul>

Here are just a few examples: flexible schedule, BBQ lunches, fitness room, massages, mini-clinic and a ton of team activities.</div>  <br/>

Job_Description: Job Description<br/><br/><strong>Why autoTRADER.ca?</strong> <br/><br/> autoTRADER.ca is Canada's #1 Automotive Marketplace, with the #1 App and is one of Canada's most iconic brands. We are a leader in the automotive industry and one of Canada’s largest digital businesses with unrivaled consumer and dealer brand recognition. Our technology solutions help our dealers drive their business forward and helps Canadians to buy and sell like pros. autoTRADER.ca traffic has tripled over the last 3 years, generating more than 5.5 million unique visitors a month. It’s where Canadians Click with Cars! <br/><br/> <strong>What does autoTRADER.ca offer you?</strong>  <ul> <li>The opportunity to work with some of the Industry's best minds</li>  <li>Benefits from day one!</li>  <li>Casual Dress Environment</li>  <li>Free Membership to On-Site Gym</li>  <li>Free Parking</li>  <li>Tuition Reimbursement</li>  <li>Regular Employee Appreciation Events</li>  <li>Employee Vehicle Purchase Discounts</li> </ul> We recognize that each employee brings a unique set of skills and experience to help us achieve success. We want to hear your story. <br/><br/> Under general direction, responsible for web-based application and related systems development. Responsible for development of application modules in a team environment that meet performance, scalability, architectural, quality and business requirements. Responsible for all stages of development, application/database design, coding, testing, and related documentation. <br/><br/> <strong>Key Areas of Responsibility</strong><ul> <li>Designs and develops interactive web technology in support of sales and marketing strategies for online product sales and marketing.</li>  <li>This includes coding of the elegant backend and front end cloud solutions, unit testing, technical analysis, debugging and integration.</li>  <li>Performs root cause analysis on system/user errors and identifies corrective action and liaises with production support to resolve issues where applicable.</li>  <li>Provide thorough documentation and technical support for existing applications where necessary.</li>  <li>Provide basic system administration and support in the development environment.</li>  <li>Review business requirements and provide estimates</li>  <li>Resolve bugs, and implement unit tests to improve quality</li>  <li>Maintain Continuous Integration/Continuous Deployment for the applications and API’s</li> </ul>  Required Skills   <ul> <li>Innovation Management: Requires strong conceptualization skills.</li>  <li>Priority Setting.</li>  <li>Strong Organizational and Time Management skills.</li>  <li>Quality Management.</li> </ul>  Required Experience   <ul> <li>Bachelor's degree in computer science or equivalent.</li>  <li>4-6 years of programming experience.</li>  <li>2 years experience in online development.</li>  <li>Strong knowledge of Microsoft Azure cloud solutions and technologies, C#, Microsoft ASP.NET platform, Web API, Microsoft SQL Server, Visual Studio, Internet technologies, HTML, XML, JSON as well as security techniques and web server familiarity.</li> </ul>  Job Location <br/><br/> Greater Toronto Area, Ontario, Canada <br/><br/> Position Type <br/><br/> Full-Time/Regular
Title: Full-Stack Developer

Job_Description: <p><strong>Title: Quality Assurance Developer</strong></p> <p><strong>Function:</strong> Quality Assurance </p> <p><strong>Reports To:</strong> Director, Quality Assurance</p> <p><strong>Location: </strong>Toronto</p> <p><strong>Type: </strong>Full-time</p> <p> </p> Role Overview <p>The Quality Assurance Developer is responsible for partnering with the software development team in a continuous delivery environment to ensure releases on our core platform and all client facing applications flawlessly meet business and technical requirements. The ideal candidate is a software developer at heart with a passion for quality and a hunger to continuously learn. Working on the Quality Assurance team as part of the software development lifecycle, the Quality Assurance Developer will search for, investigate, reproduce, document, and track issues through resolution. Never satisfied with the status quo, the Quality Assurance Developer is driven to constantly improve test coverage in an automated pipeline for REST APIs, message based architectures and user interfaces. Responsible to create, update and execute new and existing test plans and programmatically design new automated test assets, ensuring Exchange Solutions is consistently producing quality software. The ideal candidate will have a passion for QA, have a DevOps mindset and driven to automate integration, performance and security testing in to a continuous integration delivery pipeline.</p> <p><strong> </strong></p> Primary Responsibilities  <ul> <li>Automate full regression tests and performance load tests in to a continuous delivery build pipeline.</li> <li>Work closely with software developers, IT operations, technical solutions architects and product managers to review product requirements and system design from a testing perspective.</li> <li>Establish and build test plans, test requirement matrices, test design/specifications and test cases as required.</li> <li>Test software builds, detect all deficiencies, document and track them in Jira through resolution.</li> <li>Share your expertise and collaborate with the Quality Assurance team members in the execution of all testing assignments.</li> <li>Operate as a self-starter and possess the technical aptitude in troubleshooting both software and environment issues.</li> <li>Be a catalyst for continuous improvement aiding in implementing new test strategies and process improvements.</li> </ul> <p><strong> </strong></p> <p><strong>Capability Requirements – education, skills & experience</strong></p> <ul> <li>Degree in Computer Engineering/Science or equivalent knowledge/capability from other disciplines and/or equivalent professional experience.</li> <li>1- 2 years of experience in a QA automation role.</li> <li> Experience with one or more automated test frameworks (i.e. Selenium, Robot, Cucumber, etc.)</li> <li> Expertise in performance and load testing of front and backend systems using JMeter.</li> <li>1 – 2 years of progressively responsible experience working in team based software development shop with a solid foundation in at least one or more of the following languages: Java, C, C++, Python, PHP, Ruby, or JavaScript.</li> <li>Experience with or a demonstrable ability to quickly learn containers, orchestration frameworks and infrastructure automation tooling, i.e., Docker, Kubernetes, and Ansible is a great asset.</li> <li>Comfortable in agile development environments and team structures using scrum.</li> <li>Experience using source code management systems, i.e., Git.</li> <li> Well versed in REST and message base microservice architectures, and HTTP protocol.</li> <li>Proficient in UNIX/Linux environments and shell scripting.</li> <li>Proficient in basic SQL operations such as joins and views.</li> <li>Experience with Atlassian suite of products, i.e., Jira, Confluence, Stash, and Bamboo a great asset.</li> <li>Ability to play well with others, motivate other team members, and thrive in a fast paced and challenging work environment.</li> <li>Able to set goals, make and keep commitments to achieve scheduled deadlines.</li> <li>Excellent verbal and written communication skills are a must.</li> </ul>
Title: Quality Assurance Developer

Job_Description: PSP Investments is one of Canada’s largest pension investment managers, with $135.6 billion of assets under management as at March 31, 2017. We invest funds for the pension plans of the Public Service, the Canadian Armed Forces, the Royal Canadian Mounted Police and the Reserve Force. <br/> Our skilled and dedicated team of more than 750 professionals manages a diversified global portfolio including stocks, bonds and other fixed-income securities, and investments in Private Equity, Real Estate, Infrastructure, Natural Resources and Private Debt. <br/> Our business offices are in Montreal, New York and London. Our head office is in Ottawa. <br/><br/> PSP Investments is an equal opportunity employer. It is the Company's policy to recruit and select applicants for employment on the basis of their qualifications, with emphasis on selecting the best qualified person for the job. PSP Investments does not discriminate against applicants based on race, color, sex, religion, national origin, disability or any other status or condition protected by applicable law. <br/><br/> As part of its Student Employment Program for Fall 2018, PSP Investments is currently seeking an: <br/><br/> <strong>Title:</strong> Intern, .NET Backend Developer <br/><br/> <strong>Supervisor:</strong> Senior Solution Designer, Integration and Data Services <br/><br/> <strong>Duration:</strong>September to December 2018 <br/><br/> <strong>Application deadline: May 31st, 2018</strong> <br/><br/> <strong><em>Please note that only applications including a cover letter, a résumé and a copy of the applicant’s most recent (unofficial) transcript will be considered.</em></strong><strong><em> You must equally be authorized to work in Canada.</em></strong> <br/><br/> <strong>CORE ACCOUNTABILITY</strong> <br/><br/> Work with the .NET, .NET Core and T-SQL language framework in order to integrate the various business platforms into the enterprise service bus (ESB). The incumbent will work in an Agile delivery context. He or she will be part of a team devoted to meeting the organization’s data needs via an event-driven ESB linked with an operational data store (ODS) and to integrating certain strategic applications. <br/><br/> <strong>PRIMARY RESPONSIBILITIES</strong><ul> <li>Participate in the development phases: analysis, design, implementation, tests, documentation and deployment.</li> <li>Help design solutions, make recommendations, and develop, test and prepare migration of the solutions.</li> <li>Produce high-quality code in keeping with best practices and existing design models.</li> <li>Provide complete, up-to-date documents on all supported components.</li> <li>Maintain existing applications and their components.</li> <li>Participate actively in team meetings.</li> </ul> <strong>PROFESSIONAL REQUIREMENTS</strong> <br/><br/> <strong>Education</strong><ul> <li>Bachelor’s student in computer science, software engineering or equivalent</li> <li>Good academic standing</li> </ul> <strong>Knowledge and Skills</strong><ul> <li>Interest in developing .NET Framework 4.x solutions with C# and using MSTest, NUnit or xUnit unit tests</li> <li>Interest in backend Web development (ASP.NET Core 2.0, RESTful API, JSON, reverse proxy)</li> <li>Good understanding of object-oriented programming concepts</li> <li>Good understanding of the use of transactions, blocking mechanisms and performance optimization with SQL Server/T-SQL 2012 or more recent</li> <li>Knowledge of JSON, XML, XSLT and XPath</li> <li>Knowledge of event-driven architecture</li> <li>Practical experience with Dapper, Reactive Extensions, Serilog, RabbitMQ, Autofac, Moq, an asset</li> <li>Experience with continuous integration (CI), continuous deployment (CD) and/or DevOps</li> <li>Practical experience with an Agile delivery team, preferably in a Scrum framework</li> <li>Practical experience in cloud computing (gcloud, AWS, Azure) and containerization, an asset</li> <li>Practical experience with NoSQL databases, an asset</li> <li>Knowledge of scripting languages (PowerShell, TypeScript, Python), an asset</li> <li>Knowledge of the financial field, an asset</li> <li>Solid proficiency in spoken and written English and French</li> <li>Focus on results and customer satisfaction</li> <li>Analytical mind, structured approach and focus on quality</li> <li>Dynamic, self-reliant and highly motivated by new challenges</li> <li>Aptitude for fostering trusting relations with people at various levels within the organization</li> <li>Excellent team spirit</li> <li>Ability to succeed in a fast-changing environment and adapt to change</li> <li>Ethical with professional integrity</li> </ul> <em>Please note that this position is located in our offices in Montreal.</em>
Title: Intern, .NET Backend Developer

Job_Description: @font-face {} @font-face {} p.MsoNormal, li.MsoNormal, div.MsoNormal {  margin: 0cm;  font-size: 12pt;  font-family: "Calibri", sans-serif } .MsoChpDefault {  font-family: "Calibri", sans-serif } div.WordSection1 {  page: WordSection1 }        <p>Do you want to work on state of the art vehicle and IoT solutions? Join our client and be part of the adventure as a server-side (backend) development team! They are developing cloud services for both web and mobile front ends, as well as generating hardware interactions from the backend to a fleet of cloud-connected cars. They are aficionados of Agile, test-driven development and CI with an eye to CD. The software group is big on continuous improvement.</p>  <p> </p>  <p>Reporting to the Director of Engineering Software Development, you will design, develop and evolve end-to-end cloud services used to monitor and control some motorized vehicle behaviors. The end-to-end system is composed of in-car devices, smartphone & web apps, and backend systems. Your server-side developer background will help you guide the overall system architecture as well as actively develop the backend and interact with the frontend team.</p>  <p> </p>  <p><b><u>Qualifications:</u></b></p>  <p></p><ul><li>Bachelors degree in computer science or equivalent</li><li>10 years + of professional experience in server-side software development</li><li>Experience in Client-server architecture development</li><li>Experience with Java based technologies</li><li>Micro service architectures including Spring Boot, Spring REST & JPA</li><li>Experience in design of systems using web services (REST, SOAP, XML/JSON)</li><li>Experience with service-oriented architecture (SOA)</li><li>Excellent communication verbal/written skills (English and French)</li></ul><p></p>                <p> </p>  <p><b><u>Pluses:</u></b></p>  <p></p><ul><li>Integration of 24/7 high-availability telematics service (backend and presentation)</li><li>Vehicle telematics messaging platform experience (GPS message processing, alert processing, OTA device configuration)</li><li>At least one of the following:</li><ul><li>MVNO or telecom carrier network integration</li><li>High volume message processing - Kafka, JMS, ActiveMQ, Camel</li><li>NoSQL based message storage - NoSQL, MongoDB, DynamoDB, Cassandra o message processing, search and analytics - Elasticsearch, Hadoop Ecosystem</li></ul><li>Experience with Amazon Web Services technologies including EC2, ECS, RDS, DynamoDB, CloudWatch</li><li>Experience with Docker application deployment and container management</li><li>Experience with Linux</li><li>Knowledge of Target Process or Jira, Confluence, SVN/Git, Jenkins</li><li>Experience with Microsoft technologies (ASP.NET, IIS, C#, Visual Studio, MSSQL, etc.)</li></ul><p></p>  <p><b><u>Strengths and skills:</u></b></p>  <p></p><ul><li>Proactive</li><li>Result-oriented</li><li>Organized, methodical</li><li>Works well under pressure</li><li>Strong analytical skills, system approach;</li><li>Ability to focus on established priorities;</li><li>Ability to troubleshoot, test-driven approaches/methodologies;</li><li>Enjoy working as part of a dynamic team</li><li>Ability to suggest/present solution approaches and reach consensus when needed;</li><li>Attention to detail</li><li>Able to interface with 3rd party development partners and directly with the customer technical contacts for specifications, testing, integration challenges</li></ul><p></p>
Title: Sr. Backend Developer

Job_Description: BBG Management Corporation is looking to hire a Backend .Net Web Application Developer in Vancouver, BC. <br/><br/> <strong>Requirements:</strong>   <ul> <li>Strong experience in Updating & maintaining existing C# & VB .NET applications</li> <li>Deep knowledge in developing new functionality in C# .NET applications.</li> <li>Strong experience with monitoring and troubleshooting windows service applications.</li> <li>Deep working knowledge of configuration management tools and systems within a MS Windows Servers OS.</li> <li>Proven hands-on technical experience in using Git.</li> <li>A deep understanding of network protocols and infrastructure systems.</li> <li>Strong experience in scripting and adjusting code for new & existing software.</li> <li>Experience with creating & maintaining code documentation.</li> <li>Ability to uncover and communicate technical problems, processes and solutions using the established bug tracking software.</li> <li>Strong communication skills.</li> </ul>  Experience working with PowerShell and continuous Integration(CI).   <ul> <li>A proven understanding of Object Orientated Programming.</li> <li>Strong experience developing web applications using C# and VB .NET.</li> <li>A experience working with big data sets.</li> <li>Know SQL with experience of Microsoft SQL Server.</li> <li>Deep knowledge working with MVC and ASP.Net web forms.</li> <li>Experience using version control systems (GIT and SVN).</li> <li>Deep knowledge of JavaScript, jQuery and other AJAX techniques.</li> <li>Experience in big data migrations of SQL to another.</li> <li>Deep experience in building web applications.</li> <li>Good knowledge in mobile system design and App architecture.</li> </ul>  If you feel that you are a great fit for this position, please contact Sam Xie at sam.xie@bbgmanagement.com. <br/><br/> <em>BBG Management welcomes and encourages applications from people with disabilities. Accommodations for disabilities in relation to the job selection process are available upon request.</em>
Title: Backend .Net Web Application Developer

Job_Description: <div><div>About Us <br/>  <br/> ScopeMedia is an artificial intelligence company with a focus on proprietary computer vision technology. After being founded in Vancouver in 2013, ScopeMedia went on to open offices in Beijing and Hangzhou, China. For developers and entrepreneurs alike, ScopeMedia’s image and video recognition technology is easily adaptable to any project. <br/><br/> With customer behaviour and sentiment constantly evolving, accessibility to image based information has never been more vital. <br/>  <br/> About the Job <br/>  <br/> We are currently looking for a <strong>junior Java backend developer</strong> with both build and release engineering experience. By joining our team as a Java Developer, you will participate in the entire development process. Not only will you implement new features, but you will also be responsible for managing and deploying all builds and releases of the software components. <br/>  <br/> <strong>Responsibilities</strong>   <ul> <li>Work with team members to prototype, design, implement, and document product features</li> <li>Build and manage the continuous integration system</li> <li>Manage deployment of software to AWS and other clouds</li> <li>Software unittest and validation</li> </ul>  <strong>Requirements</strong>   <ul> <li>Experienced at Java, familiar with Eclipse</li> <li>Familiar with service oriented design and analysis, REST, JSON</li> <li>Familiar with object-oriented analysis, design, and programming skills</li> <li>Experience with cloud computing technology, AWS</li> <li>Experience with Jenkins</li> <li>Familiar with relational database design, SQL, and database operations</li> <li>Experience with Agile software development methodologies</li> <li>Experience with source code management, such as git</li> <li>A self-starter who wants to grow within our company</li> </ul>  Method of Application <br/>  <br/> ScopeMedia Headquarters is located in downtown Vancouver, British Columbia. To qualify, applicants must be legally authorized to work in Canada. <br/><br/> We thank all candidates who apply, however, only those being considered will be contacted. <br/><br/> Please send all cover letters and resumes to the email listed below. <br/><br/> careers@scopemedia.com</div> </div>
Title: Jr. Java Backend Developer

Job_Description: The telecom industry has far too long been dominated by the big, the bureaucratic and the unimaginative. Now is the time for someone to take this industry on with something better. <br/><br/> We are changing the industry by providing what others cannot - a better user experience, better customer service, continual innovation, and most importantly – transparent pricing. <br/><br/> <em><strong>Join us to make a BIG impact as part of the disrupting force that's changing telecommunications forever.</strong></em> <ul>  <li>Develop RESTful APIs using Ruby, PHP and related web frameworks</li> <li>Work together with our infrastructure team to design, scale, and optimize our SOA backend</li> <li>Deploy your features to millions of users – your work will have an immediate impact</li> <li>Work in an agile environment, continuously evaluating and adapting to be more effective</li> <li>Take full ownership of projects from design to deployment</li> </ul> <strong>Requirements</strong> <ul>  <li>5+ years in a similar development role.</li> <li>Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Software Engineering, or equivalent practical experience</li> <li>Strong fundamentals - You are competent in data structures, algorithms, and OO design</li> <li>You have experience developing high-performance scalable web services and architectures</li> <li>You are knowledgeable and passionate about designing rich, well defined APIs for other teams and clients to consume</li>  <li>Not afraid to pull out your ninja SQL skills to get the answers you need</li> <li>Have a favourite programming language that you’re a master in - but you know when it’s not the right tool for the job</li> <li>Experience with Git and unit testing</li> <li>Bonus  <ul>  <li>You know our stack: we build our services in Ruby and PHP, supported by MariaDB, Nginx & Redis</li> <li>You have knowledge of SMS, MMS, and VoIP technologies</li></ul> </li> </ul> <strong>Feel like you can’t tick all the boxes above? If you have some of the skills and experience that we’re looking for and are willing to use your talent to learn the rest, we encourage you to apply!</strong> <br/><br/> <strong>Benefits</strong> <ul>  <li>Impactful work</li> <li>Competitive total compensation package</li> <li>Catered breakfast & lunch</li> <li>Professional development</li> <li>Onsite personal trainer, massage therapist, and Yoga instructor!</li> </ul> <em>TextNow is committed to fostering a welcoming, accessible, respectful and inclusive environment ensuring equal access and participation for people with disabilities. We are committed to treating people with disabilities in a way that allows them to maintain their dignity and independence.</em> <br/><br/> <em> <br/> We believe in integration, and we are committed to meeting the needs of people with disabilities in a timely manner and creating a barrier-free environment. We will do so by removing and preventing barriers to accessibility and by meeting our accessibility requirements under Ontario’s accessibility laws. Please let us know if you have an accessibility need at accessibility@textnow.com</em>
Title: Senior Backend Developer

Job_Description: <div><div>Join us as we pursue our disruptive new vision to make machine data accessible, usable and valuable to everyone. We are a company filled with people who are passionate about our product and seek to deliver the best experience for our customers. At Splunk, we’re committed to our work, customers, having fun and most importantly to each other’s success. Learn more about Splunk careers and how you can become a part of our journey! <br/><br/> Splunk's Machine Learning Incubation group is looking for a Senior Software Engineer to design and build innovative solutions that enable rapid analysis of massive amounts of behavioral data in real time. We're working on the cutting edge of data analysis and correlation, letting our customers have a single pane of glass for their data from sensors to web servers. <ul> <li>You will work with a tight-knit super smart bunch of engineers who are doing state of the art development work (both frontend and backend) in areas of Machine Learning and Data Analytics across silos of data to build best in class business analytics software.</li> <li>You will be interacting with product management and customers on the bleeding edge of technology to understand detailed requirements and create new products for the market.</li>  </ul> Requirements: <ul> <li>You have 7+years related experience in designing and building scalable high quality high performance software that processes massive amounts of data in real-time</li><li>You have worked in a collaborative multi-functional team (PM, QA, UX)</li><li>You have expert skills in Python or Scala or Java and Object Oriented Programming</li> <li>You have a proven foundation in RESTful APIs, data structures, algorithms, software design and security</li><li>You have good understanding of Systems Programming (network stack, file system, OS services)</li><li>You are comfortable developing cross platform software in a CI/CD environment and practicing test-driven development.</li><li>You have the ability to learn new technologies quickly and mentor junior team members</li><li>You have strong communication skills, verbal, written and whiteboard</li><li>You have a BS CS/EE or equivalent</li> </ul> Additional Skills would be a plus: <ul> <li>Working knowledge of Javascript, HTML and CSS</li><li>Development experience with Go, or C++</li><li>Knowledge of machine learning (how to use and integrate to)</li><li>Experience with Big Data technologies such as Spark, Hadoop, Flink or Splunk</li><li>Experience with at least one Cloud platform</li> </ul> What we offer you: <ul> <li>A constant stream of new things to learn. We're always expanding into new areas, bringing in open source projects and contributing back, and exploring new technologies.</li><li>A set of exceptionally talented and dedicated peers, all the way from engineering and QA to product management and customer support.</li><li>Breadth and depth. You want to work on an area that spans backend and frontend and SDKs? We have that.</li><li>Growth and mentorship. We believe in growing engineers through ownership and leadership opportunities. We also believe mentors help both sides of the equation.</li><li>A stable, collaborative and supportive work environment. We work in an open environment, have a shared kitchen and sit down for a quick sync every morning.</li><li>We don't expect people to work 12 hour days. We want you to have a successful time outside of work too. Want to work from home sometimes? No problem. We trust our colleagues to be responsible with their time and dedication, and believe that balance helps cultivate a great environment.</li> </ul> We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status</div></div>
Title: Senior Software Engineer - Backend

Job_Description: <strong>About Breather</strong><br/><br/>Breather creates and curates a network of beautiful, on-demand private spaces that you can reserve and unlock via our web and mobile apps. We are live in 10 cities across 3 countries and backed by some of the best investors in NYC and Silicon Valley. We enable top companies to do more productive and inspired work and are growing quickly! We're venture-backed; we have big ambitions, and we want you to help us achieve them.<br/><br/><strong>What to expect</strong><br/><br/>Breathers engineering and product is organized in small, autonomous, self-directed teams, called pods, that are empowered to solve their customers needs. You will be part of the Booking & Access pod, whose mission encompasses a broad spectrum of the user journey, from making a reservation on the platform, through payment and accessing the room, generally ensuring that the user has the best experience possible. <br/><br/> Our stack includes:  <ul> <li>Node.js</li> <li>MongoDB</li> <li>RabbitMQ</li> <li>ElasticSearch</li> <li>Redis</li> <li>AWS</li> </ul>  <strong>In this role, you will:</strong>   <ul> <li><strong>Build</strong>: In collaboration with your cross-functional pod, you will design, build and iterate on new features that solve your customers problems and make them happy. You will architect backend systems that are fast, scalable and reliable, and design apis that are enjoyable to use.</li> <li><strong>Code</strong>: At Breather, we want great developers who love and care about the craft of computer programming. You will write clean, tested, and maintainable code.</li>   <li><strong>Lead</strong>: You will help your teammates grow through example, code reviews, and mentoring.</li> <li><strong>Plan</strong>: You will elaborate the roadmap with your teammates. As part of the backend functional team, you will help drive the long-term direction of our systems architecture.</li> </ul>  <strong>About You:</strong><br/><br/>You are highly motivated and enjoy programming and building things. You know how to make backend services fast, scalable, maintainable, and enjoyable to use. You care about the craft of writing clean code. You see beauty in HTTP headers and JSON output. You have a solid understanding of networking, distributed systems, and UNIX. Ideally, you will also have experience with systems-level programming, Docker, and DevOps. <br/><br/> In addition to experience with some of the technologies we use, you have the following:  <ul> <li>A bachelors degree in Computer Science/Engineering, or equivalent</li> <li>5 or more years in an engineering or development role</li> <li>Excellent communication and interpersonal skills</li> <li>The need to keep your skillset current; a thirst for knowledge</li> </ul> Bonus Points:  <ul> <li>Links to live, on-the-web examples of your work (Github, Stack Overflow, etc.)</li> <li>You're familiar with our product and have some ideas on things you'd want to add or change</li> </ul>  <strong>What We Value</strong><br/><br/>At Breather, our company values are not only the principles that link us together in the way we work, but they also keep us aligned on the same path, all working towards connected goals. These standards are what guide us on our collective journey through space(s).<br/><br/><strong>Perks and Benefits</strong><br/><br/>We hope that you're excited by all the possibilities that come with working at Breather! In addition to our unique culture, we also offer these fun perks and benefits:  <ul> <li>Be part of a well-funded, proven startup with big ambitions, competitive salary and company equity</li> <li>Work when you want, where you want, with the tools you want</li> <li>Company-funded travel to conferences & professional development events that interest you and benefit your career growth</li> <li>Access to comprehensive medical, vision, and dental coverage. Oh, and its on us</li> <li>Free access to the Breather network of over 400 spaces (and growing, fast!)</li> <li>Dog-friendly office - bring your dog to work, theyll find plenty of friends waiting to play with them!</li> </ul>
Title: Senior Backend Software Engineer - Booking & Access

Job_Description: Job Purpose<br/><br/>Are you a Developer looking to working at forefront of technology and innovative products supporting millions of players? <br/><br/> As you will be developing and maintaining systems to enable people to have fun, we strongly believe you in turn should have fun doing this. We have a recreation room with Foosball/Table Tennis/Pool table and Yoga classes. <br/><br/> Focusing more on the job itself, as one of our highly skilled Developers, you will analyse user requirements and produce corresponding development tasks, ensuring their completion by putting together a robust end to end process. You will maintain our existing systems, develop new system applications and improve functionality to ensure high quality in any software releases. <br/><br/> You will be working on innovative project of Real Time CRM and dashboards for our business customers, etc. <br/><br/> The Backend Developer job is based in our Toronto service office forming part of our Software Development Services team. As part of this team, you will provide contract research and development services to our gaming companies. And trust us, there are plenty of pioneering projects across the Group.<br/><br/>Skills and Qualifications:<br/><br/>As our ideal candidate, it is essential that you have solid experience with the following technologies: C/C++, TCP/IP, Multi-Threading, Windows Kernel. You will also have an in-depth knowledge of RDBMS and SQL. <br/><br/> You will be building applications supporting millions of people and therefore, have previously worked on designing these for large volume usage by end users.  <ul> <li>Bachelor's Degree in one of: Engineering, Computer Science, or Mathematics</li> <li>Well versed in software engineering principles, frameworks and technologies</li> <li>Highly skilled in C/C++</li> <li>Exceptional understanding of OOP</li> <li>Expert knowledge of Windows OS internals (WIN32 API and Multi-threading)</li> <li>Expert knowledge of computer networking and distributed applications</li> <li>Experience with systems that operate 24/7/365</li> <li>Excellent coding skills, ability to produce clean, robust, and accurate code that meets the specs</li> <li>Experience in designing of efficient algorithms</li> <li>Expert knowledge of STL library</li> <li>Ability to work under pressure and meet deadlines</li> <li>Familiar with Git and best practices in Source Control Management</li> <li>Solid communication skills, solid writing skills and solid people skills</li> <li>Achiever - you say what you do and then do what you say</li> </ul>  What We Offer<br/><br/>If you are looking for an exciting yet challenging career within a growing, people focused software development environment, then Stars Technologies is for you. Hiring the top people in the industry, Stars Technologies prides itself in its talented and dedicated employees. With virtually non-existent turnover, competitive compensation, and benefits and multiple perks. The environment allows its employees to enjoy coming to work every day. The results speak for themselves: a growing company with a positive culture, winning Canada's Best Workplaces Award for 4 consecutive years. <br/><br/> <em>We operate in a highly regulated environment and all successful candidates are therefore subject to a background screening programme. You will be made aware during the recruitment process of the specific checks that are carried out in relation to the role you have applied for and how this process is delivered by our third party provider. No checks are undertaken at selection stage, only if a conditional offer is made to you.</em> <br/><br/> Apply Now
