Job_Description: <div><div>About Us</div><br/> <div>Greenfield Labs is the Canadian R&D hub for Zenreach.</div> <br/> <div>Zenreach was created to solve one of the most important problems in the modern economy—the majority of our time is being spent online, yet over 93% of purchasing still happens offline — and there is no link between the two systems. Brick-and-mortar merchants are working decades behind their online counterparts without essential data and tools. We created Zenreach to give them the same level of technology and transparency that anyone operating online has come to expect.</div> <br/> <div>Zenreach is backed by leading investors with decades of experience in building enterprise hardware and software. We were also featured as one of the top breakout startups of 2017!</div> </div><div><div>Position Summary  <ul>   <ul> <li>Our product team in our Kitchener office is a small, tightly-knit crew working on building the smartest analytics and marketing outreach platform ever. What Google did with cost-per-click for online marketing, we're doing for the offline world. If you want to build something that's never been done before and help thousands of local businesses in the process, join us!</li> </ul> </ul>  </div> </div><div><div>What you'll do here...  <ul>   <ul> <li>Work at all levels of the stack - starting from the front end code our customers see all the way down to the REST endpoints, backend business logic and databases that make the magic happen.</li> <li>Interact frequently not only with the Engineering team but also with your peers in Product, Design, Sales, Account Management and Marketing.</li><li>Solve real problems being faced by thousands of brick and mortar businesses around the world.</li> </ul> </ul>  </div> </div><div><div>About you...  <ul>   <ul> <li>You have experience at all levels of the stack and aren’t afraid to jump in wherever is needed.</li><li>You have experience in front end web development helping to create beautiful and useful user interfaces. Experience with ReactJS is a huge plus.</li> <li>You’re comfortable with Python, Go, MongoDB and Cassandra or the desire to learn these technologies.</li> <li>You thrive in a fast paced environment and like to get things done!</li> <li>We like to get new features to our customers as soon as possible.</li> <li>You love solving challenging problems and pushing yourself out of your comfort zone.</li> <li>You have a strong technical aptitude and you love learning new technologies and keeping up to date on the latest trends.</li> </ul> </ul>  </div> </div><div><div>Perks & Benefits  <ul>   <ul> <li>Bright and open workspace which includes a ping-pong table, fully stocked kitchen with healthy (and unhealthy) snacks</li> <li>Catered lunches on Thursdays</li><li>Flexible hours of work (we want you to have a life outside of work!)</li><li>Flexible vacation plan</li><li>Enhanced paternity and maternity leaves</li><li>Organized volunteer events to give back to our community and plenty of off-sites and happy hours to relax and unwind.</li></ul> </ul>  </div> </div><div><div>Not ready to apply, or have some questions first? Feel free to email our Recruiter, Gary Good, directly at gary@zenreach.com.</div><br/> <div>Zenreach is an Equal Opportunity Employer and considers applicants for employment without regard to race, colour, religion, sex, orientation, national origin, age, disability, genetics or any other basis forbidden under federal, provincial, or local law. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process.</div></div>
Title: Fullstack Software Developer (Greenfield Labs)

Job_Description: As a Python Developer for our Toronto headquarters, you will engineer restful web services. You'll be required to assist in architect, code, debug problematic code, as well as execute general troubleshooting and problem-solving. You'll work alongside our talented project managers, engineers and designers to create award-winning properties. <br/><br/> <strong>Responsibilities:</strong> <ul> <li>Develop responsive web services.</li><li>Design, implement, and test</li> <li>Debug problematic code</li> <li>Work alongside mobile designers and implement the design with attention to detail</li> <li>Document source code</li> <li>Problem-solving and debugging</li> </ul> <strong>Desired Skills:</strong> <ul> <li>+3 years' experience with Python</li><li>+3 years' experience with PHP, RoR or Java</li><li>Experience in working within a team environment</li><li>Experience with REST/SOAP web services</li> <li>Experience with Codeigniter, CakePHP or Zend is plus</li><li>Experience with GAE is plus</li> <li>Hands-on Experience working in a Mac or Unix environment</li> <li>high level of experience with parsing / writing XML, JSON</li> <li>Comfortable with OO programming</li><li>Familiar with source code control systems</li> </ul> <strong>Employee Perks:</strong> <ul> <li>Comprehensive Health Benets</li> <li>A fun, open working environment</li> <li>Enjoy ping pong, foosball, or challenge a colleague on the Wii</li><li>Breakfast every week where we enjoy bagels or pancakes and share interesting topics</li><li>The chance to be a part of our Innovation Lab, where we explore and experiment with emerging technologies</li> </ul>  <strong>Company Description:</strong><br/><br/>Plastic is a mobile agency dedicated to helping our clients create and launch successful mobile experiences. We exclusively work with companies that are looking to make a difference in the mobile space and make it an integral part of their customers' lives. We specialize in ideating, designing and engineering apps and sites for smartphones, tablets, and devices everywhere for commerce, loyalty, payment, wallets, location-based and transactional branded experiences. <br/><br/> Plastic Mobile is headquartered out of Toronto, Montreal and New York City powered by the best creative minds, mobile strategists and software engineers designing and building world-class mobile experiences. <br/><br/> Find us on the Web: http://www.plasticmobile.com

Job_Description: The recruitment team at Myticas Consulting is looking for an experienced Java Back-End Software Developer, who would be interested in a long-term contract role within the Ottawa region. <br/><br/> We are looking for people who:  <ul> <li>Have a degree in Computer Science or Engineering.</li> <li>Are comfortable with agile development and work iteratively.</li> <li>Work well in a team environment, teach and learn from their teammates.</li> <li>Take ownership and see initiatives through.</li> <li>Have a desire and ability to learn in a fast paced and innovative environment.</li> </ul> You’ll need to have experience in:  <ul> <li>Building backend web services with RESTful APIs.</li> <li>In Java 8 programming including the Stream API, concurrency API and lambda expressions.</li> <li>Building event-driven applications in a Pub/Sub architecture.</li> <li>Working with relational databases, JDBC, JPA and SQL.</li> <li>Working with UNIX/Linux environments.</li> <li>Delivering well tested user-focused software in a continuous integration environment.</li> </ul> Candidates wishing to apply for this role are to send us a detailed model of their resume in confidence. Our recruitment team will formally follow up at the conclusion of the review process.

Job_Description: <strong>POSITION OVERVIEW</strong> <br/><br/> A rapidly expanding, entrepreneurial technology company, Alarm.com, is seeking an ambitious, talented, mid-level Firmware Device Engineer to work in our office in Ottawa, Ontario, Canada. Very few small companies innovate and develop across such a broad range of technologies as Alarm.com. <br/><br/> The Firmware Developer position is ideal for candidates who want to get hands-on exposure to leading-edge IoT based products and want to work with technologies including low power sensors, image capturing sensors, home automation, and wireless protocols (LTE, WiFi, BLE, Z-wave). <br/><br/> <strong>RESPONSIBILITIES</strong> <br/><br/> Collaborate and work alongside Hardware, Mobile App and Cloud developers focused on designing and building Alarm.coms expanding and leading-edge portfolio of next generation IoT based products targeting the life safety and home automation markets. <ul> <li>Own the specification, design, implementation and test of embedded firmware for ultra-low power applications and components used in Alarm.com products.</li><li>Research advanced sensor technology solutions and components targeted to work in constrained, low power, and harsh environments to meet rigorous specifications.</li><li>Build systems that balance resources, constraints, requirements, and complexity by analyzing all possible options for designing and deriving the best solution based on sound analytical judgment.</li> </ul> <strong>MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS</strong> <br/><br/> Bachelor's degree or equivalent in Electrical Engineering or Computer Engineering/Science <ul> <li>4+ years programming experience in C/C++ and Python</li><li>Shell programming experience, with one or more of the following languages: Bash, PHP, Python</li><li>Extensive experience with Linux and RTOS development environments, with knowledge of OS underpinnings including the kernel, device drivers, services and other user-space software</li><li>Strong familiarity with ARM or related embedded processors</li><li>Strong analytical and problem-solving skills</li><li>Strong debugging skills and methodology for isolating and resolving hardware/firmware integration issues during development, and field related product issues</li><li>Results oriented, positive attitude, and works well with small teams of developers and testers</li><li>Ability to stay task and schedule focused</li><li>Ability to work effectively in a fast paced and dynamic environment, and as part of a geographically disbursed development team</li><li>Ability to occasionally travel to other US based Alarm.com offices for project and development collaboration</li> </ul> <strong>NICE-TO-HAVES</strong> <br/><br/> Programming experience in PHP and/or Java <ul> <li>Experience with FreeRTOS</li><li>Experience with Debian and/or Ubuntu Linux distributions</li><li>Experience with source control environments such as Git or SVN</li><li>Experience working with SQL or other relational databases</li><li>Knowledge of home automation and wireless protocols (BLE, WiFi, Z-wave, LTE)</li> </ul> <strong>WHY WORK FOR ALARM.COM?</strong> <ul> <li><strong>Collaborate with outstanding people</strong>: We hire only the best. Our quality standards are high and our employees enjoy working alongside other high achievers.</li> <li><strong>Make an immediate impact</strong>: New employees can expect to be given responsibility for bringing new technologies to the marketplace within weeks. You are empowered to perform as soon as you join the Alarm.com team!</li> <li><strong>Gain well-rounded experience</strong>: Alarm.com offers a diverse and dynamic environment where you will get the chance to work directly with executives and gain a broad knowledge base across multiple areas of the business.</li> <li><strong>Work with latest technologies</strong>: As we continue to lead the industry, we require expertise across a broad spectrum of technologies including short and long-range wireless communication, video surveillance, lighting and HVAC automation, web development, and backend application development and hosting.</li> <li><strong>Focus on fun</strong>: Alarm.com places a high value on our team culture. We even have a committee dedicated to hosting a stand-out holiday party, happy hours, and an annual corporate retreat.</li>  </ul> <strong>COMPANY INFO</strong> <br/><br/> Alarm.com is the leading cloud-based platform for the smart home. Millions of home and business owners depend on our technology every day to make their properties safer, smarter and more efficient. We make the Smart Home broadly accessible by enabling easy automation and control across a range of connected devices through our single, intuitive user interface. <br/><br/> Alarm.com earned the Top Workplace award for its employee culture and the meaningful work we do every day to develop and bring to market new technology that will make millions of people safer and help them use energy more efficiently. Were seeking those who are passionate about creating change through technology and who want to make a lasting impact on the world around them. <br/><br/> Our solutions are exclusively distributed through a network of authorized service providers. For more information, please visit www.alarm.com. <br/><br/> <strong>COMPANY BENEFITS</strong> <br/><br/> Alarm.com offers competitive pay and a generous benefits package starting on day one of employment including 100% paid medical for employees, a health savings account option with company contribution, waiver allowance, 401(k) with employer match, paid holidays, paid time off starting at 4 weeks and increasing with tenure and paid maternity/paternity leave. We offer a casual dress work environment, annual company retreat, gym subsidy, education assistance program, and in-suite bike racks and showers. <br/><br/> <strong>Alarm.com is an Equal Opportunity Employer</strong>

We are growing, so come join the team now and help make a big impact on where we are headed.</div><br/> <div><strong>The role</strong></div><div>We are looking for a Developer - Backend in a full-time role who will be a high-impact contributor in an evolving and fast-paced environment.</div><br/> <div><strong>What you’ll do as a Developer - Backend</strong></div>  <ul> <li>Execute full lifecycle software development</li><li>Develop well-designed, testable, efficient code</li><li>Produce specifications and determine operational feasibility</li><li>Troubleshoot and resolve issues in existing software</li><li>Analyze business and user requirements for clarity, completeness, scope, and technical feasibility</li><li>Decompose requirements into system and software functional designs</li><li>Analyze and assist junior developers in identifying security, performance, and general misbehavior of implementations</li><li>Provide technical mentoring for junior development staff</li><li>Prepare design documentation</li><li>Write and maintain technical documentation to describe program development, logic, coding, testing, changes and corrections</li><li>Participate and contribute to code reviews, demos, and sprint planning sessions according to Agile best practices</li><li>Learn and understand the key business processes and contribute to team knowledge</li><li>Research and evaluate new technologies, code libraries and third-party products</li> </ul>  <br/> <div><strong>Super important stuff we need</strong></div>  <ul> <li>Demonstrating critical-thinking with capacity to learn and problem solve quickly on-the-fly</li><li>Proven ability to work well in a close-knit team</li><li>Experienced in .NET Web API, .NET Core, C#</li> <li>Experience with design and development of high-performance/availability RESTful APIs</li><li>Experienced in an Agile dev environment</li> </ul>  <br/> <div><strong>Would be even better if you have</strong></div>  <ul> <li>Ability to deliver high-quality code including refactoring, automated testing, etc</li><li>Ability to create and amend detailed documentation and technical specifications</li><li>Experience with AWS, React.js,Redux, Javascript, and NoSQL</li><li>Experience building an Enterprise SaaS product in public cloud</li><li>Mentor/team lead experience</li> </ul>  <br/>

Job_Description: Backend Software Developer  <br/> <br/>  Category: Research & Development<br/><br/>Are you ready to join a team of tech-savvy music lovers and watch your career take off in an exciting, fast-paced, and innovative work environment? <br/><br/> If you are resourceful, independent, accountable and have the ability to adapt to new situations, we want to hear from you! <br/><br/> Our development team is currently looking for a <strong>backend software developer</strong> to work on a wide variety of multimedia projects on cutting edge platforms and technologies. You will have the opportunity to be part of the creation and development of generic interactive and multimedia application servers for Web, mobile and smart tv platforms. We’re looking for smart, curious and multi-talented people who and want to create exceptional products. <br/><br/> <strong>What You’ll Do</strong> <ul> <li>Participate actively in the elaboration and design of the product;</li> <li>Design and implement software functionalities;</li> <li>Support and maintain the systems you designed;</li> <li>Work closely with artists, managers and teammates.</li> </ul> <strong>What We Are Looking For</strong> <ul> <li>Bachelor's degree in software engineering or computer sciences (or equivalent working experience);</li> <li>Exceptional programming skills in at least one language (Java, C++, C#, etc.);</li> <li>Experience in Windows and Linux programming;</li> <li>Strong analytical and problem solving skills;</li> <li>Independence and ability to learn fast;</li> <li>Great ability to adapt to changes;</li> <li>Excellent written and oral communication skills in English and French;</li> <li>Curiosity and desire to learn new technologies (Java 8, Grails, Play Framework, Akka, Guice, Guava).</li> </ul> <strong>Even Better If You Have</strong> <ul> <li>Experience in the development with Web Application servers. (Tomcat, JBoss, etc.);</li> <li>Experience with SQL database and NoSql (DyanamoDB, Cassandra);</li> <li>Experience with Amazon Web Services (S3, DynamoDB, EC2, SQS, etc.);</li> <li>Experience with Caching Server (Memcache, Redis, etc.);</li> <li>Experience with different Java Framework (Play Framework, Grails, Spring, etc.);</li> <li>Experience in Concurrent Programming (Actor-Based / Event-Based);</li> <li>Experience with a continuous integration tool (Jenkins, Bamboo, Hudson, etc.);</li> <li>Experience with micro services (Docker, ECS).</li> </ul> If you are looking for an exceptional work atmosphere and possess the required profile, please send us your resume at jobsdev@stingray.com <br/><br/> Not the job for you? Check out our Careers page to consult other available positions and learn more about Stingray. We’re always on the lookout for new talent.
Title: Backend Software Developer

Job_Description: <strong>About Breather</strong><br/><br/>Breather creates and curates a network of beautiful, on-demand private spaces that you can reserve and unlock via our web and mobile apps. We are live in 10 cities across 3 countries and backed by some of the best investors in NYC and Silicon Valley. We enable top companies to do more productive and inspired work and are growing quickly! We're venture-backed; we have big ambitions, and we want you to help us achieve them.<br/><br/><strong>What to expect</strong><br/><br/>Breathers engineering and product is organized in small, autonomous, self-directed teams, called pods, that are empowered to solve their customers needs. You will be part of the Booking & Access pod, whose mission encompasses a broad spectrum of the user journey, from making a reservation on the platform, through payment and accessing the room, generally ensuring that the user has the best experience possible. <br/><br/> Our stack includes:  <ul> <li>Node.js</li> <li>MongoDB</li> <li>RabbitMQ</li> <li>ElasticSearch</li> <li>Redis</li> <li>AWS</li> </ul>  <strong>In this role, you will:</strong>   <ul> <li><strong>Build</strong>: In collaboration with your cross-functional pod, you will design, build and iterate on new features that solve your customers problems and make them happy. You will architect backend systems that are fast, scalable and reliable, and design apis that are enjoyable to use.</li> <li><strong>Code</strong>: At Breather, we want great developers who love and care about the craft of computer programming. You will write clean, tested, and maintainable code.</li>   <li><strong>Plan</strong>: You will elaborate the roadmap with your teammates. As part of the backend functional team, you will help drive the long-term direction of our systems architecture.</li> </ul>  <strong>About You:</strong><br/><br/>You are highly motivated and enjoy programming and building things. You know how to make backend services fast, scalable, maintainable, and enjoyable to use. You care about the craft of writing clean code. You see beauty in HTTP headers and JSON output. You have a solid understanding of networking, distributed systems, and UNIX. Ideally, you will also have experience with systems-level programming, Docker, and DevOps. <br/><br/> In addition to experience with some of the technologies we use, you have the following:  <ul> <li>A bachelors degree in Computer Science/Engineering, or equivalent</li> <li>3 or more years in an engineering or development role</li> <li>Excellent communication and interpersonal skills</li> <li>The need to keep your skillset current; a thirst for knowledge</li> </ul> Bonus Points:  <ul> <li>Links to live, on-the-web examples of your work (Github, Stack Overflow, etc.)</li> <li>You're familiar with our product and have some ideas on things you'd want to add or change</li> </ul>  <strong>What We Value</strong><br/><br/>At Breather, our company values are not only the principles that link us together in the way we work, but they also keep us aligned on the same path, all working towards connected goals. These standards are what guide us on our collective journey through space(s).<br/><br/><strong>Perks and Benefits</strong><br/><br/>We hope that you're excited by all the possibilities that come with working at Breather! In addition to our unique culture, we also offer these fun perks and benefits:  <ul> <li>Be part of a well-funded, proven startup with big ambitions, competitive salary and company equity</li> <li>Work when you want, where you want, with the tools you want</li> <li>Company-funded travel to conferences & professional development events that interest you and benefit your career growth</li> <li>Access to comprehensive medical, vision, and dental coverage. Oh, and its on us</li> <li>Free access to the Breather network of over 400 spaces (and growing, fast!)</li> <li>Dog-friendly office - bring your dog to work, theyll find plenty of friends waiting to play with them!</li> </ul>
Title: Backend Software Engineer - Booking & Access

Mozzaz sells its offering to providers of behavioral health services in United States and Canada.<br/><br/>About What We Offer<br/><br/>Mozzaz offers you the opportunity to be part of a fast growing, interesting, innovative, company, a highly competitive compensation package which includes salary, Group Health Benefits, stock options. Job_Description: We are looking for a strong Senior Full-Stack Software Developer, who will help us build a highly scalable and performant Walmart.ca eCommerce platform to match our exponential growth. You will have an opportunity to design and develop new innovative features on our current platform and help in transitioning our platform to micro-app architecture using next-gen technologies. You will be responsible to actively participate in the design and architectural discussions for Frontend and API gateway layer. You will also work closely with the Product Owners to develop innovative customer experiences and user interfaces  <ul> <li>BS/MS degree in Computer Science or closely related field or equivalent practical experience.</li><li>6-8 years of software development experience working in Scala, Java or Python.</li><li>Strong knowledge working with Big data technologies like Spark ETLs, Hadoop, Hive and Kafka.</li><li>Experience in building and designing scalable Data pipeline.</li><li>Familiarity with containerization with Docker</li><li>Building CI/CD pipeline for deploying spark jobs.</li><li>Have a strong passion for developing elegant and well-designed frameworks.</li><li>A history of open-source contribution is an asset.</li> </ul>
Title: Senior Software Developer (Backend)

Job_Description: ICE Health Systems is a Calgary based software company, in which we build web based software for the healthcare industry. Please visit our web site at www.icehealthsystems.com to learn about ICE and our partnerships with leading universities in the United States. <br/><br/> <strong>POSITION SUMMARY:</strong> <br/><br/> We are currently expanding our development team and are looking to hire one individual with a passion for software development and developing API's. You will be working in a full time, salaried position, helping to maintain and expand the current feature sets of our online web applications. Collaborating with our team of developers to assist in developing web applications. <br/><br/> <strong>QUALIFICATIONS:</strong> <br/><br/> Degree in Computer Science or equivalent education/experience. <br/> Thorough understanding of object-oriented software design principles. <br/> Ability to reliably plan, describe and implement a solution to software problems. <br/> Flexibility in the adoption of standard tools. <br/><br/> <strong>PREFERRED SKILLS:</strong> <br/><br/> Ability to design APIs to be used by UI developers. <br/> Knowledge of Java web frameworks, specifically Spring MVC. <br/> Experience using MySQL to build web applications. <br/> Experience using an ORM such as Hibernate to interact with the database. <br/> Experience programming Windows services may be an asset. <br/> Understanding of testing methodologies and experiencing writing tests to verify the functionality of your code. <br/> Knowledge of version control systems such as Git and Mercurial is preferred. <br/> Comfortable working with front end JavaScript code when necessary. <br/><br/> <strong>ASSETS:</strong> <br/><br/> Self-starter who is able to research and learn on their own. <br/> Creative problem solver and detail driven. <br/> Ability to discuss and identify priorities. <br/> Excellent communication skills and an ability to adapt to a diverse team. <br/> Comfortable in a dynamic environment. <br/> Strong organizational skills. <br/><br/> <strong>WORKING ENVIRONMENT:</strong> <br/><br/> Office Environment, with the ability to work remotely. <br/> Hours of work, Monday to Friday, 7.5 hours/day. <br/> Shortlisted candidates will be expected to Complete a security clearance. <br/> Competitive base salary and comprehensive benefits package.
Title: Web Developer - Backend

Job_Description: Localised is a new company reimagining the cross-border ecommerce experience, and how brands and shoppers transact across borders, languages, currencies and cultures. Our Global Ecommerce as a Service platform builds highly localised ecommerce sites in distant markets on behalf of coveted U.S. and U.K. brands and retailers, helping them look, feel and behave “local” from the perspective of today’s empowered global shopper. <br/><br/> We are based in NYC with teams in Toronto, London, Warsaw, Bucharest and Hong Kong. <br/><br/> We live, obsess over, and celebrate the following core values:  <ul>  <li><strong>Brave</strong>. We are bold and ambitious. We are not afraid to test new ideas. We are resourceful. We solve hard problems in clever ways.</li>    <li><strong>Empathetic</strong>. We don’t pretend to know what all customers want. We listen intently. We are objective. We put ourselves in our customers’ shoes.</li>    <li><strong>Accountable</strong>. We got this. We do what we need to do. We don’t let each other down. We make commitments and keep them.</li>    <li><strong>Focused</strong>. We have very high standards. We don’t cut corners. We are specialists, not generalists. We choose depth over breadth.</li>    </ul> We’re looking for a Backend Developer to join our Labs Development team as our primary interface into Operations. In this role, you will have one foot in our product development team and one foot in our production support team. You will work closely with operations and development engineers throughout the entire service lifecycle, from design through the development process to production support. This role will require learning how our platform works end to end so that you can take control of operational work and coordinate the team participation required to resolve. <br/><br/> As a Backend Developer – Operations Interface, you will  <ul>  <li>Act as primary escalation point for operations once they have exhausted known remedies for production support incidences</li>    <li>Perform triage and identify root causes, as well as, solution and remedy options for production support incidences</li>    <li>Be the voice of operations through the product development process</li>    <li>Advocate for best practices in development practices, application logging and support consistency</li>    <li>Work closely with Product Managers on prioritization, solution preferences and any blocking decision making</li>    <li>Manage prioritization, feature/task backlog, and trade-offs</li>    <li>Drive continuous testing and measurement to improve the performance of the platform we manage</li>    <li>Bring latest thinking, trends and market developments to inform development operations strategy</li>    </ul> <br/><br/> This might be a perfect fit for you if  <ul>  <li>You have 5 years of experience in software development</li>    <li>You have experience in ecommerce, parcel logistics, content management domains</li>    <li>You have proven success in delivering beautiful and thoughtful consumer-facing products</li>    <li>You favor iterative, rapid development to get products to market early and often</li>    <li>You pay close attention to detail, evidenced by you noticing this spelling mistke</li>    <li>You can communicate effectively and clearly across any channel or medium</li>    <li>You enjoy working in a fast-paced and hard-working environment where the impact you make is immediate, obvious, significant and rewarding</li>    <li>You think hard problems are the most fun problems</li>    <li>You have experience using, and enjoy using, the following technologies and tools: Jira, New Relic, Splunk, Bitbucket, Docker, AWS</li>    <li>You have experience working with different DBMS (e.g. Postgres, MySql), comfortable with writing SQL queries and perform simple DBA tasks (e.g. backup and restore)</li>    <li>You have an BA/BS degree in Business, Engineering, Computer Science or Mathematics</li>    </ul>
Title: Backend Developer - Operations Interface

Job_Description: <p>Our R&D department is looking for a creative, talented and motivated senior front-end developer. Based at our Montreal headquarters, you are the ideal candidate if you are a team player with a strong drive and a broad front-end experience. Aside from you front-end UI/UX team, you will be sharing ideas with software architects as well as backend java developers in order solve architecture challenges across different stacks of the applications. You will work within a test-driven environment where you’ll help design and develop the next generation of the UI/UX of our software ecosystem. You will be part of a scrum team focused on the continuous improvement of their methodologies, tools, practices and teamwork.<br><br>How will you contribute to the team effort?</p> <ul> <li>Be a subject matter expert in order to guide requirements, design and implementing decisions with front end frameworks and architecture.</li> <li>Develop and test UI interfaces and components that are scalable and provide the greatest user experience.</li> <li>Provide feedback and recommendations on ways to enhance the coherence, productivity and efficiency of the team and organization;</li> <li>Be part of highly talented agile development team that truly believes in collaboration and team victories.</li> </ul> <p>We are looking for someone who has:</p> <ul> <li>Strong problem solving skills and a systematic approach.</li> <li>Broad knowledge and hands-on experience of major Javascript frameworks (Angular 2/4, React, nodeJs, etc).</li> <li>Deep understanding of responsive design techniques for desktop, tablets & mobile.</li> <li>Demonstrated success building beautiful but pragmatic user interfaces on large and complex applications.</li> <li>Webpack, npm, Git, relational databases (SQL Server, PostgreSQL, etc).</li> <li>Excellent understanding and practical expertise of REST services and architecture.</li> <li>Hands on development using design patterns.</li> <li>Excellent written and verbal communication skills.</li> <li>University degree in Computer Science or Software Engineering.</li> </ul> <p>What else could give you an edge when applying?</p> <ul> <li>Continuous integration/continuous delivery practices and tools;</li> <li>Experience with Java.</li> <li>Experience in developing ERP applications;</li> <li>Knowledge of Scrum or XP;</li> <li>Knowledge of automated testing tools and methodologies (PhantomJS, Jasmine, etc);</li> <li>Bilingual.</li> </ul> <p>Could this be the life-changing, skill and career building opportunity you've been waiting for? Don't be left wondering about what could have been. This is a growth-oriented position in an elite organization that respects and values key contributors. Act now and submit your resume.<br><br><br><br></p> <p>Notre service de recherche et développement est à la recherche d’un développeur <em>front-end </em>principal créatif, talentueux et motivé. Basé à notre siège de Montréal, vous êtes le candidat idéal si vous avez un esprit d’équipe hors pair, si vous êtes fortement motivé et si vous possédez une vaste expérience en matière de développement et architecture <em>front-end</em>. Vous aurez à résoudre des défis d'architecture de haut niveau en travaillant de pair avec votre équipe UI/UX, les architectes logiciels ainsi que les développeurs Java backend. Vous évoluerez dans un environnement TDD dans lequel vous contribuerez à concevoir et développer la nouvelle génération de l'interface utilisateur de notre suite de logiciels. Vous ferez partie d’une équipe Scrum qui se concentre sur l’amélioration continue de ses méthodologies, de ses outils et de ses pratiques.<br><br>Quelle sera votre contribution aux efforts de l’équipe?</p> <ul> <li>Vous serez une référence en ce qui a trait à la prise des besoin, l'architecture, la conception et le développement des solutions front-end.</li> <li>Développer et tester les interfaces et les composants d’interface utilisateur évolutifs; offrir la meilleure expérience d’utilisateur.</li> <li>Offrir de la rétroaction ainsi que des recommandations dans le but d’améliorer la cohérence, la productivité et l’efficacité de l’équipe et de l’entreprise.</li> <li>Faire partie d’une équipe de développement agile incroyablement talentueuse, qui croit fermement en la collaboration et prêche par les victoires d’équipe.</li> </ul> <p>Nous cherchons quelqu’un qui possède :</p> <ul> <li>D’excellentes compétences de résolution de problèmes et une approche systématique.</li> <li>De fortes connaissances et de l’expérience pratique avec les principaux <em>frameworks </em>JavaScript (Angular 2/4, React, Node.js, etc.).</li> <li>Une profonde compréhension des techniques de conception réactives (<em>responsive design</em>) pour les ordinateurs, les tablettes et les appareils mobiles.</li> <li>Un succès éprouvé en conception d’IU élégantes, mais pragmatiques, pour des applications web complexes.</li> <li>Des connaissances de Webpack, npm, Git, et des bases de données relationnelles (SQL Server, PostgreSQL, etc.).</li> <li>Une excellente compréhension et une expérience pratique des services web et de l’architecture REST.</li> <li>Une expérience pratique en développement utilisant des patrons de conception (<em>design patterns</em>).</li> <li>De solides compétences en communication orale et écrite.</li> <li>Un diplôme universitaire en informatique ou en génie logiciel.</li> </ul> <p>Qu’est-ce qui pourrait vous donner un avantage concurrentiel?</p> <ul> <li>Une connaissance de l’intégration continue, des pratiques et des outils de livraison</li> <li>Une expérience avec Java.</li> <li>Une expérience en développement d’applications de progiciels de gestion intégrés.</li> <li>Une connaissance de Scrum ou de XP.</li> <li>Une connaissance des outils et des méthodologies en matière d’essais automatisés (PhantomJS, Jasmine).</li> <li>Le fait d’être bilingue</li> </ul> <p>Serait-ce l’occasion tant attendue pour vous d’effectuer un changement majeur, de perfectionner vos compétences et de faire avancer vos possibilités de carrière? Oui. Par conséquent, ne faites pas partie de ceux qui s’interrogeront sur ce qui aurait pu être. Cette offre d’emploi est axée sur la croissance au sein d’une entreprise d’élite qui respecte et valorise les contributeurs clés. Passez à l’action maintenant et soumettez votre CV.</p> <p><br><br></p>
Title: Senior Front End Developer / Développeur front end principal

Job_Description: We are looking for a strong Staff Software Developer, will have an opportunity to be a technical lead and mentor for the team in developing and designing Backend and Data pipeline systems. You will also help us build a highly scalable and performant Walmart.ca eCommerce platform to match our exponential growth. As a Staff Software Developer, you will be responsible for building technical roadmaps for the team and help building microservices which will enable data delivery in near real-time using next-gen technologies. You will also be leading design and architectural discussions to build scalable and performant systems. Additionally, you will also be responsible for mentoring and coaching junior members of the team.  <ul> <li>BS/MS degree in Computer Science or closely related field or equivalent practical experience.</li><li>9-12 years of software development experience working in Scala, Java or Python.</li><li>Strong knowledge working with Big data technologies like Spark ETLs, Hadoop, Hive and Kafka.</li><li>Experience in building and designing scalable Data pipeline.</li><li>Familiarity with containerization with Docker</li><li>Building CI/CD pipeline for deploying spark jobs.</li><li>Have a strong passion for developing elegant and well-designed frameworks.</li><li>A history of open-source contribution is an asset.</li> </ul>

Whether that comes in the form of building a unique sales solution or innovating and evolving our product...we look to our employees to disrupt the norm and make their mark on the world.</div><br/> <div>We are looking for amazing <strong>Senior Backend Java Developers</strong> who have a passion to code, and create world class products. Well support and push you to a new level not only from a training perspective but also with certifications and other industry tools to ensure you are always ahead of the curve.</div>Requirements:  <ul> <li>Bachelors degree in Computer Science, Engineering or equivalent</li><li>Minimum 5 years experience of Java development building large scalable applications</li><li>Experience implementing REST-based APIs</li><li>Excellent skills and experience in some or all of following tech stacks:</li><li>Back-end: Node.js, Java, Spring, Hibernate, Groovy, relational databases (eg. PostgreSQL,MySQL) and non-relational data storage (eg. MongoDB, Redis)</li> </ul>  <div><strong>How We Support You:</strong></div><div>With Great Skills comes Great Responsibilities. We understand that in order to attain and maintain amazing coding skills, it needs to be continually up to date, so we make sure youre all covered when it comes to any professional development, conferences, and licenses. Its on us.</div><br/> <div>Take a look at our other benefits here:http://work.traderev.com/</div><br/> <div><strong>Why Work with Us?</strong></div><div>Our CIO and CTO are developers as well and work intimately with the team on all the apps, so your voice and work will be heard and recognized by the key decision-makers.</div> <div>Youll be given the opportunity to own your project and have room to create and see your code in action.</div><div>Growth is what were all about and that includes you and your career. Well let you carve out your niche as a member of our dev team.</div><div>Freedom to be involved in delivering an exciting, disruptive product to an age-old industry and drive it into a new direction.</div><br/> <div><strong>Our Core Values:</strong> Fun. Honest. Accountable. Brave.</div><br/> <div><strong>Our Tech Stack</strong></div><div>Java, Angular.js, Node.js, HTML5, CSS3, Android, iOS (Swift), AWS, Spring, Groovy, NoSQL db, Elasticsearch, Redis/Memcached</div><br/> <div><strong>We thank all applicants for their interest. Only candidates selected for an interview will be considered.</strong></div><br/> <div>TradeRev is an equal opportunity employer committed to diversity.</div><div>TradeRev is committed to providing employment in accordance with the Ontario Human Rights Code and the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act. Any assessment and selection materials or processes used during the recruitment process will be available in an accessible format to applicants with disabilities, upon request. If contacted for an interview, please advise Human Resources if you require disability-related accommodation.</div>
Title: Senior Java Backend Developer

Job_Description: Drop is the first flexible, consumer-led, intelligent mobile rewards platform focusing on the user experience. With over 1 million members, Drop is one of the fastest growing apps and recently hit top 3 in the App Store under Lifestyle. Through the app, members link their debit and credit cards to automatically earn points, eliminating the need to scan receipts, enter promo codes or sign up for additional loyalty programs. Drop lets members earn points and instantly redeem rewards while shopping at all their favourite brands. <br/><br/> Headquartered in the heart of Downtown Toronto, Drop is building the next generation rewards platform. Drop is disrupting the $40+ billion loyalty market with a strong focus on design, user experience, and engineering. We are executing fast, with plans to grow our current team that consists of experienced talent from Airbnb, Amazon, Facebook, Microsoft, and Goldman Sachs. We are looking to grow our top-tier, diverse team that embodies a culture of passion, grit, humility and hustle. <br/><br/> <strong>Software Engineering at Drop:</strong> <br/><br/> Engineering is at the core of Drop’s ability to scale. We strive for automation, intelligence, and simplicity in all of our products and infrastructure. <br/><br/> We are responsible for continuously processing hundreds of millions of financial transactions while delivering a polished and engaging experience for users. Our product challenges span across both the consumer space (B2C) and the retailer space (B2B). <br/><br/> Our approach to development and collaboration welcomes engineers whom are full stack and/or specialize in a particular domain (frontend, backend, data, etc). We operate at all levels of the stack: building mobile-first apps with technologies like React Native to deliver elegant UIs, scaling highly parallelized APIs and banking integrations to get a 360-degree view of user spending habits and share of wallet, developing data infrastructure to deliver insights and enable the business to efficiently drive impact, and more. <br/><br/> As an Engineering team, we value code quality, testability, scalable engineering design, and continuous process improvement. We leverage modern technologies, such as React Native, Ruby/Rails, Postgres, Redshift, Docker, Kubernetes, and more. We maintain an efficient development environment to keep productive and rapidly innovate. Our key collaborators are product managers, designers, and other stakeholders (marketing, business development, customer support) who partner as entrepreneurial peers on a daily basis. <br/><br/> <strong>Requirements</strong> <br/><br/> <strong>What kinds of challenges are Backend engineers working on at Drop?</strong> <ul>  <li>Implement robust monitoring systems to ensure users are efficiently earning points, discovering offers, linking cards, and more to sustain a healthy platform.</li> <li>Enable deeper exploration of spending patterns for offer optimization through the re-architecture of our data stores.</li> <li>Improve our Kubernetes clusters to enable easy zero downtime deployment of our various services for a culture of continuous deployment.</li> <li>Scale systems to ingest hundreds of gigabytes of transaction data streamed from financial institutions while efficiently calculating and distributing points.</li> <li>Categorize millions of transactions for offer personalization and point distribution.</li> <li>Detect and prevent instances of fraud based on attributes of spending and much more.</li> </ul> <strong>The following Backend experience is relevant to us:</strong> <ul>  <li>You have at least 5 years of experience in software engineering.</li> <li>You are comfortable working on different parts of the backend stack and applying architectural patterns.</li> <li>You have experience building in a production environment using modern web frameworks, service oriented architectures, and scalable datastores.</li> <li>You write testable and maintainable code to produce quality systems using engineering best practices.</li> <li>You thrive in a fast-paced environment; startup experience is not a strict requirement but a bonus. Drop welcomes people from all work backgrounds and recognizes the value of diversity.</li> <li>You’re passionate about building the next generation loyalty product to make life more rewarding.</li> <li>Bonus: You’ve worked with Ruby/Rails, Postgres, Redshift, Docker, or Kubernetes.</li> <li>Bonus: You have experience scaling architecture and working on products with millions of users.</li> <li>Bonus: You’ve built financial, loyalty, or rewards systems.</li> </ul> <strong>Benefits</strong> <br/><br/> At Drop, we're committed to providing an enjoyable and meaningful environment for every member of our team. We operate under a flat structure with minimal hierarchy where everyone’s opinion is valued equally. We are looking for team members with an entrepreneurial mindset who will thrive in a fast-paced and rewarding environment. <br/><br/> <strong>Benefits:</strong> <ul>  <li>Company stock</li> <li>Competitive salaries</li> <li>Flexible vacations</li> <li>Transportation perks</li> <li>Health and dental benefits</li> <li>Team retreats</li> <li>Catered lunches three times a week</li> <li>Unlimited snacks and coffee</li> <li>Company-sponsored happy hours</li> <li>And much more!</li> </ul> Drop Technologies, Inc. is proud to be a diverse and equal opportunity employer and as such does not discriminate on the basis of race, colour, religion, sex, national origins, age, sexual orientation, disability or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws. Selection decisions are solely based on job-related factors.
Title: Software Engineer, Backend

Job_Description: Hello! <br/><br/> Glad you stumbled on our job posting, now lets see if this is a good fit for you. <br/><br/> Are you <strong>a team player bursting with knowledge and ready to share it with your team</strong> ? Do you get a thrill when there is a challenge brought to your attention and you are mandated to find a solution? This may just be the perfect match for you. We are looking for a Laravel / Web Developer with advanced programming skills, who is ready to work on custom projects. <br/><br/> Let’s get right into the fun stuff, as a Design Shopp team member you will benefit from group insurance, <strong>including health and dental</strong>. You will have VIP access to our <strong>game room</strong> (video games, board games, Netflix, and more) and work in <strong>a lively and open work environment</strong>. You will always have the support of a young and passionate team. We have a <strong>gym in our Montreal office</strong> (in case you feel like relocating - this is always a possibility!), and we can hook you up with a <strong>group discount membership</strong> the day you start. Nothing better than a quick workout at lunch time or early before work! <br/><br/> Since this is a job posting, let’s get right to it! <strong>As a Web Developer at Design Shopp</strong>, you will be working with a team, helping planning the information architecture and infrastructure of large-scale custom web projects and making it come to life. You will work closely with other Programmers and Developers on websites and web applications. You will also be working with Project Managers. We expect our team members to be resourceful, positive and forward thinking individuals. We want you to contribute to the team and help us grow. <br/><br/> <strong>Requirements</strong> <br/><br/> <strong>What we’re looking for:</strong> <br/><br/> <strong> <br/> The “Must-have”:</strong> <ul>  <li>4+ years experience developing web applications, preferably using a PHP MVC framework (Laravel is a plus)</li> <li>Advanced knowledge of object-oriented programming languages, preferably PHP and vanilla JavaScript</li> <li>Experience with relational (SQL) databases, preferably MySQL</li> <li>Knowledge of good practices and design patterns</li> <li>Skills in optimization and debugging</li> <li>Knowledge of Linux/Unix</li> <li>Excellent communication skills</li> <li>Good knowledge of Git</li> <li>Comfortable in a fast-paced work environment</li> </ul> <strong> <br/> You should have knowledge or experience with:</strong> <ul>  <li>PHPunit</li> <li>CI/CD</li> <li>Jira/Confluence</li> <li>Laravel</li> <li>Docker</li> <li>Experience building APIs</li> <li>Experience with WordPress</li> <li>JavaScript (Vuejs, Angular.js or React.js is a plus)</li> </ul> <strong> <br/> Your general tasks will consist of:</strong> <ul>  <li>Working as part of a team to deliver high quality, custom-made web applications</li> <li>Understanding client requirements and translating it into conceptual and detailed designs with estimates</li> <li>Building efficient and reusable PHP modules</li> <li>Helping design & architect software for a wide range of services and systems according to the client’s specifications</li> <li>Developing clean, maintainable code</li> <li>Planning and creating database schemas that represent and support the application</li> <li>Actively providing constructive feedback to other developers and helping the team grow together</li> <li>Helping troubleshoot software problems as well as implementing bug fixes</li> </ul> We’re looking to fill this position ASAP, so we hope to hear from you soon! <br/><br/> Now... send us a fun email that will make you stand out from the crowd! <br/><br/> Make sure to include a personal note about yourself and how you would be a great fit for our team. <br/><br/> Looking forward to meeting you! <br/><br/> <strong> <br/> P.S.</strong> Because we get many many applicants on a daily basis, we can't reply to everyone quickly enough - although we wish we could! Sit tight, we will call you if you are a good match and get on a quick call to discuss the position together.
Title: Web Backend Developer

You’re serious about rising as far and as fast as your work and achievements can take you. And you’re ready to write the next chapter of your career story: a challenging and rewarding role as a Capco Back-End Developer. <br/><br/> <strong>A Word About Us</strong> <br/><br/> <strong>Capco – Forming the Future of Finance</strong> <br/><br/> Capco is a distinctly and positively different place to work. development team to work on a number of projects and applications within the Digital practise. <br/><br/> We are looking for Developers, particularly with Java experience, who can Work on multiple projects for different clients to design, develop and support back end services, integrating with a variety of external services and products exposing restful apis for a variety of consumer applications. <br/><br/> Fitting that description, you will also need to be supremely personally motivated to work in a team where clients become colleagues too. <br/><br/> <strong>Responsibilities</strong> <br/><br/> • Mentor and train junior developers <br/><br/> • Produces high quality complex deliverables with minimal input from stakeholders <br/><br/> • Manage full software lifecycle for medium complexity projects from requirements, to design, to implementation, to testing <br/><br/> • Develop and maintain back end solutions using cutting edge technologies and products <br/><br/> • Work with Scrum Masters and product owners to priorities and deliver solutions using an Agile environment <br/><br/> • Build reusable code and libraries for future use and follow emerging technologies <br/><br/> <strong>Show Us What You’ve Got</strong> <br/><br/> It will be very useful if you have some or all of the following skills and experience: <br/><br/> • Background working with object oriented programming languages <br/><br/> • Strong organizational and communication skills <br/><br/> • Experience building, testing and troubleshooting microservices and RESTful APIs <br/><br/> • Exceptional knowledge of Database technologies – RDBMS or NoSQL <br/><br/> • Experience working in an Agile environment <br/><br/> • Experience working with code versioning tools <br/><br/> • Experience working with cloud technologies <br/><br/> • Experience working with build, packaging and continuous integration tools and frameworks <br/><br/> Professional experience is important. But it’s paramount you share our belief in disruptive innovation that puts clients ahead in a tough market. From Day One, your key skill will be to perceive new and better ways of doing things to give your clients an unfair advantage. <br/><br/> <strong>Now Take The Next Step</strong> <br/><br/> If you’re looking forward to progressing your career with us, then we’re looking forward to receiving your application.
Title: CAPCO Backend Developer

Job_Description: <div> <div> <div> <div>SigFig is tearing down the barriers to investing. We've raised $60 million to support our growth as the #1 Online Investment Advisor for large Financial Institutions. To meet the rapidly growing demand and interest in our investment solution, we have recently set-up a development center in Calgary. Come join a fast growing San Francisco based-company and help build SigFig Calgarys team. Help us define the next generation of investing!</div> <br/> <div>As a Software Engineer at SigFig, you will work with a team of brilliant developers to build solutions that analyze billions in investor assets, running complex algorithms and recommendations software to help people make better investment decisions. Youll help us Platformize (yes thats a word) our code, build high-impact features, and make it more easily configurable and customizable for a diverse set of needs. Its not easy, but its an incredible opportunity for people who like technical, people and business challenges.</div></div> </div><br/>  <div> <div><strong>WHAT YOU'LL BE DOING:</strong></div><div>   <ul> <li>Design, develop, test, deploy and maintain services around SigFigs Wealth Management Platform.</li> <li>Integrate SigFigs Wealth Management systems into a diverse set of third-party enterprise systems.</li> <li>Interact with engineering members across the organization to ensure consistency in engineering practices and foster active exchange of ideas. We have development centers in San Francisco, Tucson, Singapore and India and the ability to work with distributed teams is a key skill.</li> <li>Perform peer code reviews. Review performance, security and flexibility of the code.</li> <li>Participating in SigFigs agile ceremonies (e.g. daily standup, release and sprint planning, demos, scrum of scrums).</li> </ul> <strong>WE'RE LOOKING FOR SOMEONE WITH:</strong>  <ul> <li>You possess a BTech/BE in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related technical field or equivalent practical experience. Strong Computer Science fundamentals - you understand data structures, algorithms and software design practices.</li> <li>Good experience with JVM languages (Scala, Java) and relational databases (ability to design, query, transform and optimize).</li> <li>Great Communication Skills You have excellent communication skills and are able to clearly articulate your thoughts during verbal and written communications. The work we do here is very collaborative (and globally distributed), so team players and an experience with fast moving projects is a big plus as well.</li> <li>Self starters with the interest and ability to learn other coding languages as needed.</li> <li>Knowledge of modern web technologies including Javascript, AngularJS is a plus.</li> <li>Familiarity working with SSO solutions (SAML, OAuth, OpenID), CRM vendors, email systems, e-signature providers, or financial data (FIX, OFX), web infrastructure (firewalls, VPNs, proxies) and hosting is a plus.</li> <li>Domain Experience is a plus You understand the financial services domain and have executed projects involving implementation and integration of software solutions with other systems in financial institutions. You understand the need for strong security, audits and performance criteria that are associated with the banking and financial services industry.</li> <li>Passion for finance and investing is a plus.</li> </ul>  </div> </div><br/>  <div> <div><strong>ABOUT SIGFIG</strong></div> <br/> <div>SigFig is dedicated to making high-quality investment advice more accessible and affordable to investors of all wealth levels. Using a combination of design, data science, and technology, SigFig helps empower investors with the information and guidance they need to achieve their personal financial goals. Through partnerships with some of the worlds largest and most innovative financial institutions, SigFig seeks to help investors and advisors better manage their investments. Its enterprise technology accelerates time to market for its partners, while doing so in a secure, scalable, and compliant way. Its product, design, and growth labs fuel innovation, accelerate adoption, and create delight for clients.</div> <br/> <div>Founded in 2007, SigFig is backed by leading financial institutions including Eaton Vance, Comerica Bank, New York Life, Santander InnoVentures, and UBS, as well as top-tier venture capital firms, including Bain Capital Ventures, DCM Ventures, Nyca Partners, and Union Square Ventures. The company is headquartered in San Francisco, California. Learn more at www.sigfig.com.</div></div> </div> <br/>
Title: Backend Software Engineer

Job_Description: <strong>Everyday is a trip, your adventure starts here.</strong> <br/> <strong>Come fly with us!!!</strong><br/><br/><em>We are looking for a <strong>Backend PHP Developer.</strong> Lets keep it simple: write, maintain and deploy great code for our Phone Sales Squad. This Squad is responsible for creating our in-house CRM tool which our Customer Service Agents use on a daily basis. <strong>We work fast and need our code to do the same.</strong></em> <br/><br/> We are a group of passionate people who work hard and move quickly in the goal of redefining the flight shopping experience for the entire world. We get high off seeing progress and we strive to be the best at what we do. Why just have a job when you can be a part of something bigger? <br/><br/> <strong>TO BE SUCCESSFUL IN THIS ROLE, YOU'LL NEED:</strong>  <ul> <li>2+ years of experience in web application development</li> <li>A solid understanding of modern PHP and OOP principles</li> <li>Knowledge of at least one PHP MVC frameworks (Symfony, Laravel, CakePHP, etc)</li> <li>Experience with SQL (MySQL, PostgreSQL, etc) and performant database design</li> <li>Experience working in an Agile software development environment</li> <li>A solid understanding of HTML and CSS *asset*</li> </ul> <strong>BENEFITS:</strong>  <ul> <li>Access to group insurance benefits, including health and dental</li> <li>Advanced, platform agnostic workstations (we are happy to provide you with your preferred hardware and operating system to help you do your best work)</li> <li>Generous subsidies for your monthly public transit passes and for a variety of electric/hybrid cars</li> <li>Free Starbucks or Café Depot coffee/tea and numerous company lunches and events</li> <li>Exceptional contribution towards fitness classes/ your personal gym OR a fully paid annual gym membership to GOLDS GYM located right next to our office (you can workout at lunch)</li> <li>A fully stocked kitchen with healthy yummy snacks</li> <li>Convenient location with free parking and easily accessible via public transit, also close to various restaurants and stores</li> <li>Positive and diverse work environment, with an outgoing and collaborative team</li> </ul> <strong>If you feel like this opportunity could be a great fit for you, click here for your one-way ticket!</strong> <br/><br/> <strong> IF YOU KNOW SOMEONE WHO COULD FIT THIS JOB DESCRIPTION, CHECK OUT OUR</strong> REFERRAL PROGRAM:) <br/><br/> <strong><em>(please note that additional responsibilities may apply)</em></strong>
Title: Backend PHP Developer

de déploiement de logiciels</li> <li>Maintenir les applications back-end de SSENSE</li> <li>Participer activement aux revues de code et de conception</li> <li>Développer des tests unitaires et des tests fonctionnels</li> <li>Documenter toutes les activités d’applications et de R&D</li><li>Rester à l'affût des dernières technologies et des tendances de l’industrie, les appliquant aux opérations Git</li> <li>Maîtrise de Linux / SSH CLI un atout</li><li>Solide compréhension des systèmes de contrôle de version Git et des modèles à branches tels Git Flow, un atout</li><li>Maîtrise de l’anglais tant à l’oral qu'à l’écrit, français un atout</li> </ul> COMPÉTENCES <ul> <li>Capacité à s’adapter rapidement au sein d’un environnement technique existant</li> <li>Sens aigu des affaires</li> <li>Capacité à comprendre les besoins d’affaires présents et futurs et identifier des opportunités</li> <li>Habileté à réussir dans un environnement au rythme rapide et de maîtriser les techniques et
