Job_Description: DESCRIPTION<br/><br/><strong>About Ritual</strong>  <ul> <li>Ritual is a technology company that makes a smartphone app which provides instant access to a complete assortment of everyday coffee and food items from local spots - at the push of a button.</li> <li>On another level, Ritual is about applying mobile technology, CRM, and world-class operations teams to redefine the way millions of people interact with local businesses everyday.</li> </ul> Everyone at Ritual has the passion, drive, and creativity to shape the future of mobile commerce. In an industry where sideways momentum and common products & services are the norm, we have the rare opportunity to make everyday extraordinary for our customers. <br/><br/> Visit http://www.ritual.co for more details. <br/><br/> <strong>Backend Growth Software Engineering @ Ritual</strong> <br/><br/> The growth team is fundamentally involved in all aspects of the company, from optimizing the mobile app's flows, to experimenting with marketing strategies, to developing entirely new product features, and more. We operate on the principle that all these challenges and opportunities are best approached with a data-driven approach and hard numbers. <br/><br/> As a consequence, one of the core focuses of of growth-engineering is collecting, storing, and analysing product data. The job is never done and we are always making improvements (whether infrastructure, algorithm, or process) that can give us the extra insight into the problems we face. <br/><br/> Some of our other recent projects include implementing scalable ETL pipelines, applying machine learning for referral recommendations, and developing powerful and extensible reporting tools. <br/><br/> As the company continues to scale, the growth team is building a self-sufficient and high-paced team that is able to take concepts from ideation to execution to success. If you are excited to tackle a large variety of difficult problems and eager to see your work have direct impact on the business, we're looking for you.<br/><br/>REQUIREMENTS   <ul> <li>BS/MS in Computer Science or equivalent</li> <li>Experience with SQL, RDBMS, NoSQL, and others will prove highly useful</li> <li>Enthusiasm for solving interesting problems and a willingness to take on new product features</li> <li>A solid foundation in computer science, with strong competencies in data structures, algorithms, and software design</li> <li>Strong coding ability, regardless of which language you use or how you learned it</li> <li>Belief in good software design - you are able to balance the present and the future</li> <li>You enjoy collaboration with others - our work isnt carried out in a vacuum, and everyone contributes to get the job done</li> <li>You understand that making mistakes means youre learning</li> <li>You have a constant desire to grow and develop</li> <li>You are comfortable in a high-paced environment, and can respond to urgent requests</li> </ul> <strong>You must be</strong>  <ul> <li><strong>Fast learner.</strong> We're looking for software engineers who thrive on learning new technologies and dont believe in one size fits all solutions. You should be able to adapt easily to meet the needs of our rapidly evolving business environment</li> <li><strong>Versatile.</strong> In addition to having an intimate knowledge of the your area of specialty, you understand how all the pieces fit together (front-end, database, network layer, etc.) and how they impact performance of your application.</li> <li><strong>Strong architecture chops.</strong> You know how to build scalable, robust and fault-tolerant services. You stay up to date with the latest architectural trends.</li> <li><strong>Passionate.</strong> You feel complete and absolute ownership over everything you ship; you seek to understand all aspects of your work, and are always on the lookout for ways to do it better.</li> <li><strong>A team player.</strong> You believe that you can achieve more on a team - that the whole is greater than sum of its parts. You rely on others candid feedback for continuous improvement.</li> <li><strong>Design and business acumen.</strong> You understand requirements beyond the written word. You understand how to be pragmatic. Whether you are working on a small feature or massive system level project, your attention to detail leads to a delightful user experience</li> </ul> <strong>Bonus points if you have</strong>  <ul> <li>Insightful opinions about startup growth and data analytics</li> <li>Intuitive understanding of user behaviours and ux patterns</li> <li>Past experience with warehousing data and database management</li> <li>A Github account with cool projects in it</li> <li>Scary amazing debugging skills</li> </ul>
Title: Backend Software Engineer

Job_Description: <strong>PHP DEVELOPER</strong><br/> <div>As a Backend Developer for our Toronto headquarters, you will engineer restful web services. You'll be required to assist in architect, code, debug problematic code, as well as execute general troubleshooting and problem solving. You'll work alongside our talented project managers, engineers and designers to create award-winning properties. <br/><br/> <strong>Responsibilities:</strong> <br/><br/> - Develop responsive web services. <br/><br/> - Design, implement, and test <br/><br/> - Debug problematic code <br/><br/> - Work alongside mobile designers and implement design with attention to detail <br/><br/> - Document source code <br/><br/> - Problem solving and debugging <br/><br/> <strong>Desires Skills:</strong> <br/><br/> - 2-3 years experience with PHP, Python, RoR or Java <br/><br/> - Experience in working within a team environment <br/><br/> - Experience with REST/SOAP web services <br/><br/> - Experience with codeigniter, cakephp or zend is plus <br/><br/> - Experience with GAE is plus <br/><br/> - Experience working in a Mac or Unix environment <br/><br/> - Experience with parsing / writing XML, JSON <br/><br/> - Comfortable with OO programming <br/><br/> - Familiar with source code control systems <br/><br/> Please Note: This is an in-House only opportunity. <br/><br/> <strong>Employee Perks:</strong> <br/><br/> - Comprehensive Health Benets <br/><br/> - A fun, open working environment <br/><br/> - Enjoy ping pong, foosball, or challenge a colleague on the Wii <br/><br/> - Breakfast every week where we enjoy bagels or pancakes and share interesting topics <br/><br/> - Join our Plastic sports team and challenge yourself in sports like volleyball and ultimate Frisbee <br/><br/> - The chance to be a part of our Innovation Lab, where we explore and experiment with emerging technologies<br/><br/><strong>Company Description</strong><br/><br/>Havas/Plastic is a mobile agency dedicated to helping our clients create and launch successful mobile experiences. We exclusively work with companies that are looking to make a difference in the mobile space and make it an integral part of their customers' lives. We specialize in ideating, designing and engineering apps and sites for smartphones, tablets, and devices everywhere for commerce, loyalty, payment, wallets, location-based and transactional branded experiences. <br/><br/> Plastic Mobile is headquartered out of Toronto and New York City powered by the best creative minds, mobile strategists and software engineers designing and building world-class mobile experiences. <br/><br/> Find us on the Web: http://www.plasticmobile.com</div>
Title: Backend Developer - PHP / Python

Job_Description: <strong>About NestReady</strong> <br/><br/> NestReady is looking for ambitious, highly motivated, driven professionals with strong technical skills to join our team! We are a real estate technology company with over 6 years of experience in building innovative tools to empower the next generation to enter the real estate market. Our environment is fast-paced, demanding, and ultimately very rewarding for the right person. <br/><br/> <strong>Our product</strong> <br/><br/> NestReady is a real estate platform that brings all parts of the home-buying experience together. It is a digital platform that removes the stress from the homebuying process creating transparency and accessibility every step of the way. NestReady transforms the customer experience through data processing and user pattern identification. We define a systematic journey from beginning to end that allows us to provide the best in class home buying guidance. <br/><br/> Our platform is built to be integrated within financial institutions platforms to help our partners provide a full home buying experience - from discovery to financing. <br/><br/> <strong>Who you’ll work with</strong> <br/><br/> You’ll be surrounded by other driven professionals who thrive in rapid growth and change. We work hard, dream big and celebrate our wins. Every team member has the power to influence our success, and we settle for nothing less but industry disruption. If you have what it takes to work at a fast growing startup that will change the industry forever, apply to this position. <br/><br/> <strong>Outside of Canada?</strong> <br/><br/> We are open to sponsor applicants with a desire to move to Montreal, Canada! <br/><br/> The salary range for this position is between $60,000-$90,000 CAD per year. <br/><br/> <strong>What you’ll be working on</strong>  <ul>  <li>Develop a platform that helps homebuyers find the home of their dreams using Ruby, Python or Node.JS</li>    <li>Design and develop versioned JSON Endpoints to streamline user and search information</li>    <li>Design and implement robust features that perform and scale for millions of users</li>    <li>Architecture and performance optimization of complex customizable software apps</li>    <li>Constantly seek and advocate for adopting new bold technologies for our product</li>    <li>Support planning and documentation of technical architecture</li>    <li>Collaborate with Front End, Product and other teams to ensure we ship world-class bullet-proof features</li>    </ul> <br/> <strong>What you have</strong>  <ul>  <li>3+ years experience of development using one of the following languages: Ruby, Python, NodeJS, GO</li>    <li>Professional experience with Rails framework or other full-stack frameworks</li>    <li>Knowledge of MongoDB, Graphs, and Geoprocessing</li>   </ul>    <ul>  <li>Able to work independently with little to no supervision</li>    <li>Coaching and leadership acumen</li>    </ul> <strong>It would be great if you had</strong>  <ul>  <li>Strong knowledge of Javascript</li>    <li>Experience with startup environment</li>    <li>Map/Reduce, Aggregations and other complex MongoDB queries</li>    <li>Appreciation for agile development and efficient code</li>    <li>Have experience leading teams</li>    <li>Have experience creating technical documentation</li>    <li>Previously contributed to open source projects</li>    </ul> <strong>What We Offer</strong>  <ul> <li>Sponsorship for Canadian work visa</li>   <li>Flexible work schedule</li>  <li>Casual dress code</li>  <li>Open office space in Old Port</li>  <li>Free coffee, snacks, and drinks</li>  <li>Fun parties and team building activities</li>  <li>Opportunities for advancement</li> </ul> <strong>*******************************************************************</strong> <br/><br/> <strong>Un peu d’info sur NestReady</strong> <br/><br/> NestReady est à la recherche de professionnels ambitieux, acharnés, et hautement motivés, possédant des compétences techniques avancées, qui désirent se joindre à notre équipe! Nous sommes une entreprise de technologie immobilière, qui a établi une réputation sur plus de 6 ans dans la création d’outils innovateurs qui ont le potentiel de redonner à la génération qui suit la capacité de mettre un pied dans le marché immobilier. Notre environnement de travail est rapide, exigeant, mais aussi très fructueux pour le candidat adéquat. <br/><br/> <strong>Notre produit</strong> <br/><br/> NestReady est une plateforme immobilière qui intègre avec fluidité toutes les étapes de l’expérience d’achat d’un domicile. C’est une plateforme numérique qui élimine le stress du processus d’achat immobilier, et qui offre transparence et accessibilité à chaque étape. NestReady révolutionne l’expérience client grâce au traitement de données et l’identification du comportement de l’utilisateur. Nous identifions un cheminement systématique du début à la fin de ce processus, qui nous permet d’offrir une expérience hors classe dans l’achat de demeures haute gamme. <br/><br/> Notre plateforme a été conçue pour fonctionner de paire avec les plateformes des institutions financières, afin de permettre à nos partenaires d’offrir une expérience d’achat immobilier intégrée – de la découverte de la propriété à son financement. <br/><br/> <strong>Vos futurs collègues de travail</strong> <br/><br/> Vous serez entouré de cadres qui s’épanouissent dans un environnement rapide et sans cesse changeant. Nous travaillons dur, rêvons gros, et arosons nos succès. Chaque membre de l’équipe à l’opportunité de contribuer à notre prestige, et nous visons tous foncièrement un chambardement de l’industrie dans son ensemble – rien de moins! Si vous vous pensez à la hauteur, et que vous voyez votre place dans l’environnement effervescent d’une startup en plein essor, qui laissera sa marque sur l’industrie telle que nous la connaissons, sautez sur l’occasion et faites nous parvenir votre candidature sans plus tarder. <br/><br/> <strong>Vous êtes actuellement situé à l’étranger?</strong> <br/><br/> Nous sommes en mesure de parrainer les candidats qui désireraient immigrer au Canada et déménager à Montréal! <br/><br/> L'échelle salariale pour ce poste se situe entre 60 000 $ et 90 000 $ CAN par année. <br/><br/> <strong>Vos tâches</strong>  <ul>  <li>Développer une plateforme numérique qui permette aux acheteurs immobiliers de trouver la demeure de leurs rêves en utilisant Ruby, Python ou Node.JS.</li>    <li>Concevoir et développer des versions adaptées de points d'arrivés JSON, afin de rationaliser les données de l‘utilisateur et les données de recherche.</li>    <li>Concevoir et mettre en place des fonctionnalités solides qui opèrent efficacement et permettent une expansion à grande échelle et une utilisation par des millions d’utilisateurs.</li>    <li>Améliorer l'architecture et optimiser les performances de systèmes logiciels personnalisables très complexes.</li>    <li>Explorer quotidiennement, et promouvoir activement, de nouvelles technologies innovatrices pour servir nos produits.</li>    <li>Soutenir la planification et la documentation de l'architecture technique.</li>    <li>Collaborer avec les équipes Front-End, Produit et autres afin de garantir que nous livrons des produits infaillibles, à la fine pointe du développement.</li>    </ul> <strong>Ce que nous recherchons</strong>  <ul>  <li>3 ans et plus d'expérience en développement à l'aide de l'une des langues suivantes: Ruby, Python, NodeJS, GO.</li>    <li>Expérience professionnelle avec le framework Rails ou d'autres frameworks complets.</li>    <li>Connaissance approfondie de MongoDB, Graphiques et Geoprocessing.</li>    <li>Capacité de travailler de manière autonome, avec peu de/ sans supervision.</li>    <li>Un talent intuitif pour le coaching ou le mentorat.</li>    </ul> <strong>Les atouts qui vous placeront en tête</strong>  <ul>  <li>Connaissance solides de Javascript</li>    <li>Une certaine aise dans le milieu des startups</li>    <li>Habiletés à l’égard de Map/ Reduce, Aggregation et autres requêtes complexes MongoDB.</li>    <li>Une bonne compréhension du développement agile et du code efficace.</li>    <li>Une solide expertise en gestion d’équipe</li>    <li>Une expertise prouvée dans la conception de documents techniques</li>    <li>Des contributions antérieures à des projets “open source”</li>    </ul> <strong>Ce que nous offrons</strong>  <ul>  <li>Un parrainage dans le cadre de la demande de visa de travail au Canada</li>    <li>Un horaire flexible</li>    <li>Code vestimentaire décontracté</li>    <li>Un bureau en concept espace ouvert dans le Vieux port</li>    <li>Café gratuit, collations et boissons</li>    <li>Des partys de bureau qui sont le fun et des activités de consolidation d’équipe</li>    <li>Des opportunités de promotion</li>    </ul>
Title: Backend Developer / Développeur Back-End

Job_Description: Lookout is a cybersecurity company that makes it possible for individuals and enterprises to be both mobile and secure. With 100 million mobile sensors fueling a dataset of virtually all the mobile code in the world, the Lookout Security Cloud can identify connections that would otherwise go unseen -- predicting and stopping mobile attacks before they do harm. The worlds leading mobile network operators, including AT&T, Deutsche Telekom, EE, KDDI, Orange, Sprint, T-Mobile and Telstra, have selected Lookout as its preferred mobile security solution. Lookout is also partnered with such enterprise leaders as Microsoft, AirWatch, Ingram Micro and MobileIron. Headquartered in San Francisco, Lookout has offices in Amsterdam, Boston, London, Sydney, Tokyo, Toronto and Washington, D.C. To learn more, visit www.lookout.com <br/><br/> We believe in agile software development, metrics, short feedback loops, test driven development, automation everywhere. We have a culture of minimizing friction to focus on solving the big problems for our users. We're looking for senior engineers who share our values, particularly those who have experience building, monitoring, and maintaining high-volume, low-latency, distributed transactional platforms. You will be a member of the team that is responsible for a massively scalable platform that enables ingestion of security events, dynamic and near-real-time analysis and delivery of data sets to internal and user-facing applications. You will be a member of a team that will work on new security features and solutions. <br/><br/> <strong>Responsibilities:</strong> <br/><br/> Youll be tasked with research, design, implementation and deployment of security features that are part of Lookouts expanding Product Portfolio. Lookout infrastructure, which is deployed in Amazon Web Services, runs complex highly security sensitive services, at significant scale. <br/><br/> You will be challenged every day to:  <ul> <li>Push the boundaries of security technology to create defences for large scale production infrastructure and networks.</li> <li>Provide subject matter expertise on network architecture and security controls</li> <li>Harden our infrastructure from attack</li> <li>Develop new features and feature extensions</li> <li>Define and implement innovative monitoring and alerting systems to enable detection of intrusions</li> <li>Create services and tools to manage the security of our infrastructure</li> </ul> <strong>Desired qualities:</strong><ul> <li>You value quality, automated tests, and reducing technical debt.</li> <li>You think at scale, and with high availability.</li>   <li>You live service-oriented, distributed web platforms.</li> <li>You insist on clean APIs to surface complex services that front rich datasets and powerful underlying technologies.</li> <li>You are a strong software engineer, thinking in frameworks and clean interfaces.</li> <li>Youve worked with networking protocols at L3-L7 like CDNs, routers and switches.</li> <li>You can drive features from conception to deployment in an agile team with continual delivery</li>   <li>You select the right tools to solve the right problems, and known when to build vs when to incorporate the work of others.</li> <li>You have developed products and features that have been deployed by customers and used at scale.</li> </ul> <strong>Skills and Qualifications:</strong><ul> <li>JRuby/Ruby, MySQL, Hadoop, Kafka, Storm, AWS deployment pipelines, NoSQL databases</li> <li>Experience with the design and implementation of Service-oriented Architecture and/or development of service infrastructure at high scale</li> <li>Experience with any of the following technologies: Kafka (or other message bus or distributed log infrastructure), Storm, Cassandra, SQL databases, AWS deployment pipelines.</li> <li>3+ years of experience with AWS development and associated services/technologies for large scale computation and data analytics projects is highly desirable</li> <li>6+years of development experience overall</li> <li>BS degree in Computer Science or Engineering discipline</li>  <strong><li>Nice to have:</li>  </strong>   <ul> <li>Java, Scala programming experience, Infrastructure automation with Spinnaker</li>   <li>Security background</li></ul>   </ul>
Title: Staff Backend Engineer

Job_Description: Financial Information Systems Developer (12-month Contract) <br/><br/> About Rakuten Kobo Inc. <br/> Created by booklovers for booklovers in 2009, Toronto-based Rakuten Kobo Inc. is one of the world’s leading and most innovative eReading services, offering a world-class catalogue of over 5 million eBooks to millions of customers in 190 countries. Kobo delivers the best digital reading experience through creative innovation, award-winning eReaders, and top-ranking mobile apps. Kobo is a part of the Rakuten group of companies. Kobo offers the opportunity to work in a cutting edge, lightning-fast startup environment where you’ll have a decisive hand in building the next big thing in eReading using the latest technology available. <br/><br/> The Job <br/> Rakuten Kobo Finance team is looking for Financial Information Systems Developer. They will lead the design and architecture of information systems and data flows for finance. The ideal candidate will thrive in a fast-past culture, navigate dynamic structures, and be focused on data management, reporting, and process improvement. This role is perfect for a diligent, creative-minded person who enjoys challenges and a changing environment. <br/><br/> The Person <ul> <li>Design and develop backend services across multiple platforms</li><li>Collaborate with Finance and business teams to architect and design new software services</li><li>Participate in financial controls & process re-engineering initiatives</li><li>Passionate dedication to continual identification and implementation of process improvements</li><li>Excellent communication skills to explain complex data flows to non-technical business users</li> </ul>  The Skillset  <ul> <li>Advanced knowledge of SQL, Python, and .Net frameworks</li><li>Knowledge of Javascript, C#, browser development tools (HTML, CSS, REST, etc.), and web service clients is an asset</li><li>Experience in designing, building and testing Windows applications, back-end components</li><li>Some finance/business knowledge and/or BI Tool (like Tableau) is an asset, but not required</li><li>Self-motivated with a belief in the philosophy of accountability and desire to continuously improve</li> </ul> Rakuten Kobo Inc. is an equal opportunity employer. Accessibility accommodations for candidates with disabilities participating in the selection process are available on request. Any information received related to accommodation needs of applicants will be addressed confidentially. <br/><br/> Rakuten Kobo would like to thank all applicants for their interest in this role however only qualified candidates will be shortlisted
Title: Financial Information Systems Developer (12-month Contract)

Job_Description: You've read job posts that promise you'll change the world. Then you discover they're for yet another social media app, marketing agency, or consulting firm. You click away. And you wonder: "Aren't there opportunities where I can make a big impact? While I earn recognition and rewards for my efforts? And get to work with exceptional people on exciting new technology?" If that sounds like you, meet BenchSci. You will be a great fit. <br/><br/> <strong>About us</strong> <br/><br/> We use machine learning to accelerate drug discovery by helping scientists execute successful experiments. <br/><br/> <strong>We focus on a huge problem in drug discovery</strong> <br/><br/> Each year, biomedical researchers waste over a billion combined hours. The problem is with products they purchase to influence and measure proteins. There are millions of them, from hundreds of vendors. Finding the right products for specific experiments is tough. Researchers spend hours and sometimes days searching through published papers for guidance. But even then, many products they buy don't work. Some aren't right for a specific experiment. Others are poor quality. This delays scientific discoveries by weeks or months. And it slows availability of breakthrough treatments, while making them more expensive. <br/><br/> <strong>We apply artificial intelligence to solve it</strong> <br/><br/> Thanks to improvements in machine learning, we can now solve this problem. We spent more than two years teaching a computer to read science papers like a human scientist. It decodes the information, which we present to researchers in an easy-to-use, web-based platform. They can then find products for experiments in minutes, not days, and see data that builds trust. The time and money they save has led to rapid adoption by top pharmaceutical companies and hundreds of academic institutions. <br/><br/> <strong>Product video</strong>: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=fPs5xzYYHSs <br/><br/> <strong>About you</strong> <br/><br/> If our story excites you, let us describe who we would love on our team. You are passionate about machine learning, science, and making a positive impact. You are high-reaching, results-focused, and always learning. You act fast. You are open, honest, and transparent. You come to work inspired. You take your job seriously, but not yourself. You leave work satisfied. You wonder how to make every single day better than the last. <br/><br/> <strong>Your responsibilities:</strong> <br/><br/> As an experienced Backend Engineer, you will be a technical expert in BenchSci's backend team which is responsible for BenchSci's data and computation pipeline, and scientific data management system. You will work closely with BenchSci's Head of Engineering and Chief Data Officer on improving BenchSci's data pipeline and use your knowledge to mentor junior engineers for development best practices. As part of the role you will:<ul> <li>Become a technical leader in BenchSci's backend team which is responsible for the data and computation pipeline development</li>  <li>Collaborate closely with other engineers to solve interesting and challenging data problems</li>  <li>Ensure product and technical features are delivered to spec and on-time</li>  <li>Continuously improve the performance, scalability, and stability of BenchSci's data pipeline</li>  <li>Advocate for code and process improvements across your team, and help to define best practices based on personal industry experience and research</li>  <li>Participate in sprint planning, estimation and reviews. Take ownership of deliverables, and work with teammates to ensure high-quality deliverables.</li> </ul> <strong>Qualifications:</strong> <br/><br/> <ul> <li>Bachelor’s degree or higher in Computer Science or Software Engineering</li>  <li>Background in Life Science</li>  <li>6+ years of experience of strong development skills</li>  <li>Proficient with JavaScript, Python and Python Web Frameworks such as Django</li>  <li>Proficient with shell scripting</li>  <li>Experience working in Agile teams</li>  <li>Experience working with cloud-based solutions</li>  <li>Experience using test-driven development</li>  <li>Experience with SQL, NoSQL, and graph DBs (Postgres, Neo4J)</li>   <li>Experience with Elasticsearch</li>  <li>Experience with workflow management platforms such as Airflow</li>  <li>Experience with big data frameworks such as Hadoop and Spark</li>  <li>Good understanding of system design, data structures, and algorithms</li>  <li>You have a constant desire to grow and develop</li>  <li>You care about quality and you know what it means to ship high-quality code</li>  <li>You have strong cross-team communication and collaboration skills</li>  <li>You are a doer, a curious learner, and can get shit done!</li> </ul> <strong>Nice to have:</strong> <br/><br/> <ul> <li>Degree in Life Science</li>  <li>Experience with React</li> </ul> <strong>What you get:</strong> <br/><br/> <ul> <li>Competitive salary and options at a well-funded startup</li>  <li>Benefits package that includes medical, vision, dental and life insurance</li>  <li>High-growth position in the early stage of a promising company</li>  <li>Key placement with important responsibilities in the organization</li>  <li>Alignment of your professional growth with the company’s growth</li>  <li>An opportunity to help transform and improve scientific research</li> </ul> <strong>How to apply</strong> <br/><br/> Please submit a resume and a short paragraph stating why you are interested in BenchSci. <br/><br/> <strong>A bit more about us</strong> <br/><br/> BenchSci was one of three finalists for "New Startup" in the sixth annual Canadian Startup Awards. As one of the leading machine learning startups in Canada, we raised over $2,700,000 in a seed round from preeminent Canadian and American venture capitalists. We are affiliated with top machine learning researchers at the University of Toronto, including advisor Richard Zemel, research director of the Vector Institute. Our office is located in downtown Toronto (aka “the 6”), near great coffee shops, restaurants, and summer patios. <br/><br/> <strong>At BenchSci we value the following:</strong>  <ul> <li>Freedom and accountability. We do not want or have time to micromanage.</li>  <li>Hard work. We have an amazing and rare opportunity to make an impact and we work hard to make sure we capture it.</li>  <li>Personal growth. We put aside a growth budget for each employee.</li>  <li>No bullshit. No politics. Just results.</li> </ul> BenchSci is an equal opportunity employer. We value diversity and are committed to fostering an inclusive environment. All four of our co-founders are immigrants to Canada, as are more than 75% of our employees. We welcome your fresh perspectives and ideas.
Title: Senior Backend Engineer

Job_Description: Located in the heart of downtown Toronto, we’re the strategic services arm of Symbility Solutions, one of Canada’s rare 100 Million+ publicly traded technology companies. We work with startups, gaming companies, technology giants, and fortune 100 clients. <br/><br/> A day at Symbility Intersect is never the same. <br/><br/> <strong>As our</strong> <strong>Senior Android Engineer,</strong> <strong>you will be responsible for the following:</strong> <ul>  <li>Developing high quality, UX rich mobile applications for Android</li>  <li>Working with a multi-disciplinary team to understand system/application requirements and recommend appropriate solutions; including Designers, Backend Developers, and QA Analysts</li> <li>Working independently, and as part of a team, to develop software solutions that meet client’s needs and perform efficiently and as designed</li> <li>Optimizing applications for performance and memory usage</li> <li>Consistently delivering high-quality output</li> <li>Tracking and planning project progress through a Project Management System (Pivotal Tracker)</li> <li>Keeping up with the latest trends in the mobile industry</li> </ul> <strong>Requirements</strong> <ul>  <li>Experience in full life cycle development of mobile applications in Android.</li> <li>Experience in Object oriented programming and should have been using languages like Java</li> <li>Experience working with Android SDK.</li> <li>Experience in developing mobile applications and libraries for various Android platforms including latest OS versions</li> <li>Experience with Eclipse IDE</li> </ul> As our <strong>Senior Android Engineer</strong>, you will possess the following skills, attributes and experience: <ul>  <li>Degree in Computer Science or related field</li> <li>Two years practical experience developing natively in Android</li> <li>Desire and ability to learn new mobile platforms</li> <li>Experience with Android Studio and XCode IDE’s</li> <li>High degree of knowledge with Social API’s, especially Facebook</li> <li>Knowledgeable of Web technologies such as HTML, CSS, JavaScript and JSON</li> <li>Self-motivated and willing to take initiative</li> <li>A willingness to share experience with others</li> <li>A passion for code quality and adherence to standards</li> <li>Experience working with a version control system, especially GIT</li> <li>Excellent communications skills</li> <li>Keen eye for details and quality at both the code level and the overall application UX</li> </ul> <strong>Benefits</strong> <br/><br/> FLEXIBLE HOURS AND UNLIMITED VACATION POLICY <br/><br/> Need a break? No problem. Employees can take time off in the way that works best for them and their teams. Work remotely when you need to. <br/><br/> HEALTH AND WELLNESS <br/> Comprehensive extended health care coverage, energy pod, and standing desks. Take care of yourself. <br/><br/> FUN <br/> Off-site adventures, ping-pong, unique traditions, monthly birthday celebrations, Fancy Fridays, Lunch and Learns. <br/><br/> OFFICE MEALS <br/> Catered lunches, healthy snacks, freshly-ground coffee, and Beer O’clock <br/><br/> TOWN HALL <br/> To stay connected we have weekly town halls to celebrate milestones, share updates, welcome new hires, present apps of the week, and crown the QA Star of the Week. <br/><br/> WORKATION <br/> We like to work hard and play hard, and as such we offer yearly Workations for employees to unwind and spend non-work time with coworkers. <br/><br/> Interested in learning more? <br/> Our Culture: <strong>https://www.symbilitysolutions.com/symbility-inter...</strong> <br/> Check out our 3D office tour: <strong>https://www.symbilitysolutions.com/symbility-inter...</strong> <br/><br/> Symbility Intersect welcomes and encourages applications from people with disabilities. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process. <br/><br/> If you’re interested in being on the bleeding edge of technology, tackling exciting problems from different industries, and constantly being pushed to learn --- apply below!
Title: Android Developer

Job_Description: <strong>ACL Impact</strong> <br/><br/> ACL exists to help makes the world a safer and more ethical place. By enabling Governance, Risk, and Compliance (GRC) professionals that use our software to be recognized for the value they bring to their organizations, we aim to be game-changers: to provide organizations with the software tools, support, and knowledge to dive deep into their data, identify anomalies, and manage GRC across the entire organization. From helping a national agency track down missing children to helping banks find suspicious patterns in their data and state agencies stamp out fraudulent activities, ACL has been at the heart of many investigations that have helped save people and millionstalk about impact! <br/><br/> <strong>The ACL R&D Team</strong> <br/><br/> The R&D team extends beyond the walls of ACL and stands on the shoulders of giants. We use the innovation of technology partners like Amazon, select OEMs, and the Open Source Community to ensure were meeting our challenges with the most current and effective technologies. We give back by contributing time, code and support to our engineers and across the community. <br/><br/> To understand more about software development at ACL, read Landing your Software Engineering Dream Job. To look through the window into R&D, check out our blog or read these articles: Inside ACL R&D Part IBrigades, and R&D Baymax Team Spirit. <br/><br/> As a DevOps shop, we own what we build. We do not pass it off to others. We maintain it. We continually work to reduce the time required to build and safely deploy software. Security, integrity and performance are not an afterthought. They are built into our development process. We design for growing use. We use tools to continually scan our code base and stay current on patches and upgrades. If a serious vulnerability is discovered we pause everything else and immediately resolve it. <br/><br/> We have a product development group of 70+ and counting (the company has over 300 employees and counting). We work in small brigades comprised of 5 or so Software Engineers, 2 QA Engineers, a Manager, a UX Designer, UX Developer and a Product Manager. Its our version of a scrum team. <br/><br/> <strong>The Challenge Ahead</strong> <br/><br/> Were searching for a <strong>Backend Software Engineer</strong> who has good backend experience to build robust and scalable backend APIs and modules that integrates with our visually stunning front-end interfaces. <br/><br/> You will help our team to build seamless integrations across our modules and services while also partnering closely with our product and UX teams to create and maintain new user features in our GRC platform. <br/><br/> <strong>What Will You Get Out of This?</strong>   <ul> <li>An amazing dynamic startup environment within a financially stable company (did we mention we just celebrated our 30th anniversary?)</li> <li>Some of the best benefits in the industry (asking for more information can be a great first question for us in the interview process)</li> <li>Working with an awesome team of professional software engineers with plenty of room to learn and grow.</li> </ul>  <strong>Skills for Success at ACL</strong>   <ul> <li>You have a Bachelors degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, or equivalent experience.</li> <li>You have experience delivering large-scale, high availability, secure web applications. Bonus if youve built them with Ruby on Rails in an agile environment.</li> <li>You have experience building and consuming RESTful APIs, working with relational databases and SQL (ideally PostgresSQL).</li> <li>You care deeply about code quality, are a TDD ninja, and detest having bugs slip through to production.</li> <li>You are passionate about learning and continuous improvement.</li> <li>You have creative ideas, a collaborative attitude and strong work ethic.</li> </ul>  <strong>Bonus</strong>   <ul> <li>You have an interest in learning or have experience with backend technologies such as Ruby on Rails, relational databases and AWS services.</li> <li>You are actively involved in local meetups and contribute to open source project we can look at on Github.</li>  </ul>

Our platform will be used by private jet operators, across the world, to manage their entire business operation so it needs to be performant and fault tolerant.<br/><br/><strong>Who We're Looking For:</strong>   <ul>  	<li>You are passionate about technology</li>  <li>You make your team better</li>  <li>You are highly motivated, with excellent communication skills</li>  <li>You have Framework (Boot, Cloud, Security, MVC, Streams, etc) or equivalent JEE framework</li>  <li>Strong understanding of object oriented programming and domain driven design</li>  <li>Agile development experience using Scrum/Kanban</li> </ul>  <strong>Nice to Haves:</strong>   <ul>  	<li>Experience with full stack development</li>  <li>Knowledge of and experience with Microservice architecture and tools</li>  <li>Hands on experience with distributed multi-tenant cloud native applications, their design and challenges.</li>  <li>Experience with Netflix OSS stack (Eureka, Zuul, Ribbon, Feign)</li>  <li>Experience with messaging driven services using AMQP/RabbitMQ/Kafka</li> </ul>  <strong>Perks:</strong>   <ul>  	<li>Flexible vacation policy</li>  <li>Competitive salary & equity This is a great opportunity for anyone looking for a hot-start-up, challenging development work and a high impact role. Above all, your work will impact the way the world will access mental health. <br/><br/> <strong>The Role:</strong>  <ul> <li>Be a technical leader with the team you work with and within the company in general</li> <li>Coordinate and execute on technical projects</li> <li>Facilitate collaboration with other engineers, product owners, and designers to solve interesting and challenging problems</li> <li>Be a valued member of an autonomous, cross-functional agile team</li> <li>Architect, design, develop, deploy and operate services that serve millions of users in a DevOps manner</li> </ul> <strong>Requirements:</strong>  <ul> <li>You are an experienced developer with a minimum of 2 years of experience.</li>   <li>You have experience with NodeJS, Mongo DB + Postgres and Redis</li> <li>You have a deep understanding of system design, data structures, and algorithms</li> <li>You care about quality and you know what it means to ship high-quality code</li> </ul> <strong>Nice to have skills:</strong>  <ul> <li>General experience or interest in Dev-Ops</li> <li>Experience or true interest in platform architecture</li> <li>You are experienced with deploying and operating services on Microsoft Azure</li> </ul> <strong>How to apply?</strong> <br/><br/> Interested parties should apply directly to gord.marriage@talentlab.com or through our website www.talentlab.com</div> <br/>

Job_Description: Who are we? <br/><br/> We are Canada's 11th, and North America's 52nd Fastest Growing Tech Company (PROFIT 500), and Canada's (#2) Best Place to Work (SMB, 2017). <br/><br/> At Unata, we’re shaping the future of the retail experience. We power digital experiences for some of North America’s most well-respected grocery chains. Our white-label platform powers award-winning e-commerce experiences, digital flyers and digital loyalty programs, allowing the retailer to automatically tailor each shopper’s experience at an individual level so that they can deliver 1-to-1 personalized content and offers. <br/><br/> In other words, we enable customer experiences that make shopping easier and more personal, such as allowing shoppers to order their groceries online and pick up in-store / have them delivered, and allowing shoppers to receive a completely personalized version of the Flyer based on their purchase history. <br/><br/> We are one of Canada's 50 fastest growing companies, and were listed as one of Canada's top 20 most innovative companies. And we have no plans on slowing down! We are absolutely committed to continuous innovation, bringing together a team of Canada’s brightest developers, designers, project managers and marketers. <br/><br/> Acquired by Instacart in 2018, Unata operates as a independent subsidiary headquartered in Toronto, Canada. With over 75 employees and plans to keep growing, our team includes some of the best, brightest and most driven minds from across the world in systems integrations, software development, data science, product management, design, and customer success. <br/><br/> Acquired by Instacart in 2018, we’ve joined forces to provide the most comprehensive, innovative digital grocery solution in the industry. Want to join a talented team of people changing the way the world grocery shops? Visit www.unata.com/careers/. To learn more about our parent, please visit www.instacart.com. <br/><br/> Want to be part of the future of retail? We’d love to hear from you! <br/><br/> Why This Opportunity is Cool <br/><br/> The Backend Team is responsible for building the backend services that power Unata’s core platform features. Our product roadmap is full of challenging projects that require innovative engineering solutions. Alongside a team of designers, engineers and data scientists, you’ll be building scalable and robust distributed systems that power the best digital grocery experience in the market. <br/><br/> Our Best Backend Engineers  <ul> <li>Have a degree in Software Engineering, Computer Science, etc.</li> <li>Are proficient in object-oriented software design, and have strong knowledge of Python (+ for Flask, SQL Alchemy).</li> <li>Bring a solid grasp of computer science concepts, such as data structures, algorithms, and programming paradigms. We are very keen on implementing red-black trees here at Unata.</li> <li>Understand and implement engineering best practices, including automated testing, version control systems, documentation, continuous integration, duct tape redundancy, etc.</li> <li>Are at home in a Unix development environment</li> <li>Can clearly communicate complex technical concepts</li> <li>Have built and shipped real software</li> <li>Demonstrate their willingness to learn new things</li> <li>Are accomplished, seasoned, battle-scarred engineers with a history of shipped systems under their belts, with an emphasis on designing async messaging systems, big data architecture and web services</li> </ul> What This Opportunity Gives You  <ul> <li>The chance to help shape the technical future of our product as we scale to scores of retail partners and millions of users</li> <li>Learn and work with technologies like Python, PostgreSQL, ElasticSearch, Cassandra, Redis, Memcached and more!</li> <li>Time to attend various developer conferences, like PyCon, where our Team is regularly selected to present</li> <li>A dedicated team filled with people that want to make an impact - this ain’t no “another-day-another-dollar” gig!</li> <li>A working environment where your opinions are valued</li> <li>A place within a company that appreciates learning new technologies and implementing them when they make sense</li> <li>… and more!</li> </ul> What Are You Waiting For? <br/><br/> Apply today with a copy of your resume, and let us know why you're a great fit for the position!
Title: Senior Backend Engineer

Job_Description: <strong>About Us</strong> <br/><br/> Messagepoint is a leader in developing and delivering innovative software and services within the Customer Communications Management market. The Messagepoint solution is the 2016 SIIA CODiE winner for the Best Multi-channel Publishing Platform. Messagepoint helps companies strengthen their customer communications by enabling business users to control the entire messaging life-cycle for all print or digital communications without burdening IT. <br/><br/> <strong>Summary</strong> <br/><br/> Messagepoint is in the midst of significant growth and we are currently seeking a Senior Java, C++ Back-end Developer based in Toronto, Ontario. <br/><br/> <strong>Responsibilities</strong> <br/><br/> Develop and maintain our flagship SaaS-based Java application Messagepoint.com and its supporting backend applications <br/> Model and develop data structures using Hibernate and Oracle <br/> Develop supporting control structures using Java/Spring MVC <br/> Develop supporting back-end application using C++ and Python <br/> Develop and configure WEB services in cloud environment <br/> Troubleshoot and fix production issues <br/> Carry out other related tasks and projects as assigned <br/> Work as part of a development team in a fast paced environment <br/><br/> <strong>Qualifications and Skills</strong> <br/><br/> 10+ years of experience building server-side Java and C++ applications <br/> Advanced skills using J2EE framework and libraries specifically: Spring, Hibernate <br/> Database development experience including SQL programming, solid understanding of relational database technologies with focus on Oracle systems <br/> Experience with WEB application server JBoss and tools such as Eclipse, Ant, SVN <br/> Experience with C++ and Python development <br/> Experience with developing SOAP and/or REST based web services <br/> Ability to write high-performance, reusable code and performance troubleshooting <br/> Experience with different OS (Windows, Unix/Linux, OS X) and their configurations <br/> Knowledge of version control systems <br/> Enthusiastic and self-motivated <br/> Experience with IBM Mainframe is a plus <br/> Experience with cloud based technologies is a plus <br/><br/> We thank you for your interest but only those who qualify for an interview will be contacted.
Title: Senior Java, C++ Backend Developer

Job_Description: <strong>Backend Software Engineer</strong><br/><br/>We are looking for Full Stack Software Engineers who can help us to architect, design and implement a software system to build Bot Application that power conversational marketing experiences. A complex system Based on bleeding edge technologies (`Scala`, `Akka`, `Spray`, `Cats`, `Reactive Programming`, `Kubernetes`, `Docker`...), a modern architectural style (`Micro Services`, `CQRS`, `Event Sourcing`, `Eventual Consistency`), and a clean codebase (`Clean Code`, `Domain Driven Design`…) -- emphasis on the “Engineer” over the “Full Stack” part , you’ll work in kanban style with multidisciplinary teams (Business people , Marketing people, Front-developers, AI engineers) to deliver software at the best ratio user value vs cost .<br/><br/><strong>Profile</strong> <br/> <ul>    <li>Proficient with computer science fundamentals in object-oriented development, data structures, and algorithms</li>  <li>Proficient with GIT</li>  <li>Experienced in Functional Programing (Scala, Haskell)</li>  <li>Familiarity with Functional Reactive Programming (Event Sourcing, Streaming, CQRS, Domain Driven Design ...)</li>  </ul>  <br/> <strong>A plus</strong> <br/> <ul>    <li>DevOps engineering (Docker, Kubernetes, Microservices, Continuous Integration,Ansible..)</li>  <li>AI engineering (Mathematical, Statistics, Probability, Deep Learning, Machine Learning, Natural Language Processing, Large Scale Data Mining)</li>  </ul>  <br/> <strong>About Automat</strong><br/><br/>Automat is helping companies use AI to talk to their customers, to understand them and serve them better. We're the first Conversational Marketing platform powered by artificial intelligence and we believe in a world where every company can have a personalized one-on-one conversation with every customer, fan, and follower.  <ul>    <li>https://www.linkedin.com/pulse/announcing-automats-series-a-funding-andy-mauro</li>  <li>https://www.marketingweek.com/2017/04/24/loreal-artificial-intelligence/#.WP4nl5Nz8O4.twitter</li>  <li>http://betakit.com/10-montreal-tech-companies-to-watch-in-2017/</li>  <li>http://finance.yahoo.com/news/cb-insights-reveals-ai-100-150000872.html</li>  <li>http://www.cbc.ca/news/technology/canada-artificial-intelligence-companies-montreal-talent-1.3890556</li>  <li>http://adage.com/article/digital/covergirl-chatbot/307052/</li>  <li>https://medium.com/slack-developer-blog/investing-in-the-future-of-work-d4ffb87f985#.es1xu0yjm</li>  <li>http://fortune.com/2016/07/19/slack-app-investment-fund-2/</li>  </ul> Learn more at www.automat.ai, or message us at m.me/automatinc
