Founded by The Vanbex Group, a global leader in blockchain-based products and services, Etherparty is developing a platform that allows users to create smart contracts on any compatible blockchain without having any programming knowledge.</div><br/>  <div><strong>Were growing</strong></div><br/> <div>Having conducted one of the most successful ICOs in Canada last year, our team is growing quickly. Were looking for an exceptional Backend Golang Engineer who wants to build great products.</div> <br/> <div>As the ideal new addition to our software development team, you are an expert in your field and can teach us a thing or two about Golang. You love team collaboration and and knowledge sharing, and you take pride in shipping high quality, well-tested code. Of course, you also have passion for blockchain technology because youll be a part of discussions and debates on the changing technology and industry.</div>On a day-to-day, you will:  <ul> <li>Work on the core platform, developing in Golang to build scalable and robust services and work on challenges associated with distributed systems running at scale</li><li>Write high-caliber code on a daily basis to satisfy product requirements</li> <li>Own feature implementations and maintain a continuous integration pipeline</li><li>Document best practices and act as a knowledgeable resource for engineering and problem solving</li> <li>Work with our Product team to design new and compelling end user services and products</li><li>Collaborate with engineers in an agile environment to develop exciting new solutions with blockchain technologies</li> <li>Partner with our team to define architecture and best practices</li> <li>Provide technical leadership and mentorship to your peers</li> </ul>  <strong>As an ideal candidate, you have:</strong>  <ul> <li>Expert knowledge and experience in Golang and Web Development (youre a full-stack developer)</li><li>Sample code or projects to show (if your work is proprietary please tell us what you did)</li><li>Strong understanding of REST APIs and adhere to the test driven development technique (TDD/BDD)</li><li>Experience with databases such as MySQL, MongoDB etc.</li><li>Experience in one or more of the following web technologies: Node.js, Python, React, Redux, VueJS, Bootstrap, Docker, CoreOS, PSQL, RabbitMQ, CockroachDB, Redis</li> </ul>  Bonus  <ul> <li>Experience, understanding, or strong interest in smart contracts, cryptography and Ethereum or have developed in Solidity</li> </ul>  <div>If this role sounds like a match, we want to hear from you! Send us a link to your GitHub account and anything else that would showcase your code.</div><br/>  <div><strong>More about Us</strong></div><br/> <div>Etherparty conducted one of the most successful ICOs in Canada in the fall of 2017 and our team is growing quickly. Beyond providing an environment that encourages innovation of blockchain technology, we also offer competitive compensation and vacation days, research and experimentation time for the entire team, transit passes, subsidized lunches, and more.</div><br/>  <div><strong>Company Culture</strong></div><br/> <div>Were a pet-friendly environment and even have a resident robot that occasionally competes with more than one dog (and cat) for mascot rights. We consider our petsperhaps not the robotto be part of the team. We work hard, yet value work-life balance and we encourage a respectful, supportive, and team-oriented atmosphere.</div><br/> <div>Etherparty provides competitive benefits that include extended medical, vision, and dental. We offer referral bonuses, and even a paid day when you volunteer. There will be ongoing opportunities to support and benefit from conferences or other events in the blockchain space.</div>
Title: Backend Engineer (Golang)

Job_Description: <strong>Benchmark Tech Recruitment</strong> is urgently searching for an <strong>Intermediate/Senior Java Developer</strong> for a 12-month contract. This position can be based in the clients Vancouver or Toronto office, and even remote work with in Canada is an option. Financial protocols and stock exchange messaging knowledge (FIX) is a MUST HAVE. <br/><br/> <strong>Description:</strong> <br/><br/> Our client is a rapidly growing brokerage and wealth management firm. The Globe and Mail ranked it first out of Canadian online brokerages in its online broker ratings and they were ranked highly in the “providing market intelligence” category but ranked other brokerages as superior for ease of use, record keeping, and banking integration…and that’s were you come in! You will work in a rapidly growing team:  <ul>  	<li>Building web-based brokerage trading applications, web service-based architectures/middleware</li>   <li>Integrating trading functionality between various trading partnering organizations</li> <li>Creating and maintaining technical documentation.</li>  </ul> <strong>Qualifications:</strong>  <ul>  	<li>Must hold a degree or diploma in either computer science or engineering from a recognized institution</li> <li>Must have 5-10 years of enterprise Java development experience in the areas of web application development, swing application development, and backend middleware development.</li>   <li>Must have the ability to multi-task and demonstrate a proven ability to deliver in a fast paced, dynamic technical environment.</li> <li>Software process knowledge</li>   <li>Prior experience in the construction of brokerage trading applications is mandatory.</li> <li>Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal, are also mandatory.</li>  </ul> <strong>Required Skills/Knowledge:</strong>  <ul>  	<li>JEE (Java, JSP, Servlets, JDBC, Spring)</li> <li>HTML, DHTML, Java script</li> <li>SQL Databases (Oracle 11g & SQL Server 2005/2008)</li> <li>Application Servers (BEA WebLogic 10.3 or JBoss 5.0 or Tomcat 6)</li> <li>Web Application Frameworks (Jakarta Struts / GWT)</li> <li>Swing / Web Start</li> <li>JEE Design Patterns</li> <li>Web Services & SOA (ESB/WSDL/XSD/UDDI/JAX-B/JAX-RPC)</li> <li>IntelliJ IDEA or Eclipse or NetBeans IDE</li> <li>Clustering / Load Balancing methodologies</li> <li>Brokerage Trading Methodologies</li> <li>Version Control Systems/Methodologies (CVS)</li> <li>Windows, Linux</li> </ul> <strong>Desired Skills:</strong>  <ul>  	<li>Caching technologies</li>   <li>Smart order routing / multi-marketplace knowledge</li> <li>Financial protocols and stock exchange messaging knowledge (FIX)</li> <li>Trade order management system methodologies and architectures</li> </ul>
Title: Intermediate/Senior Java Developer - 12 Month Contract

Job_Description: <strong>Backend Server Programmer</strong> <br/><br/> Bethesda Game Studios®, located in Montreal, is looking for great talented senior Backend/Server Engineer to develop and maintain scalable and high performance platform services that support gaming experiences. The role focuses on hands on programming and architecture contributions while interfacing with multiple engineering and design teams. <br/><br/> <strong>Responsibilities:</strong> <br/><br/> · Develop clean, maintainable code that is suitable for continuous integration and continuous deployment which respects best practices and software guidelines; <br/><br/> · Design, architect and develop software for a wide range of services and systems; <br/><br/> · Collaborate with other developers to ensure smooth deployment, continual operation and support of quality software; <br/><br/> · Actively provide code review feedback to other developers; <br/><br/> · Perform under minimal supervision on significantly complex assignments; <br/><br/> <strong>Requirements:</strong>  <ul> <li>4+ years of experience building reliable, highly available and scalable online services;</li> <li>Experience building in a cloud environment (ideally AWS, Google Cloud);</li> <li>4+ years of experience with one of the following languages: Java , C#, C++ or Go;</li> <li>Strong experience in designing software using design patterns and OOP;</li> <li>Experience with at least 1 (2 would be ideal) of the following programming languages / technologies (Python, Go, JavaScript/NodeJS, Java, C#, C++);</li> <li>Strong relational database fundamentals, hands-on experience with non-relational/NoSQL alternatives, and solid grasp of which to use according to the situation;</li> <li>Strong skills in server side resource profiling, optimization and debugging;</li> <li>Experience with designing and automating unit and load tests;</li> <li>Experience with message queuing frameworks;</li> <li>Experience working with Unix/Linux environment;</li> <li>Experience with third party API integration;</li> </ul> <strong>Desired:</strong> <br/><br/> · Experience working in video game industry, integrating online services; <br/><br/> · Experience working in a micro-service based infrastructure; <br/><br/> · Experience with application containerization and container orchestration; <br/><br/> · Experience in developing RESTful API; <br/><br/> · Experience with load management (balancing) and network security; <br/><br/> · Experience with TCP or/and UDP protocols; <br/><br/> · Experience working with game engines such as Unity3D, Unreal etc.; <br/><br/> · Bilingual. <br/><br/> <strong>Programmeur Backend Serveur</strong> <br/><br/> Bethesda Game Studios®, ayant ouvert un tout nouveau studio dans le Vieux-Montréal, recherche son prochain super Programmeur Senior backend Serveur pour développer et maintenir une plateforme de services évolutive et de haute performance. Son attention se portera sur la programmation ainsi que la contribution à l’architecture tout en faisant l’interface avec les équipes d’ingénierie et de design. <br/><br/> <strong>Responsabilités:</strong> <br/><br/> · Développer du code propre et maintenable, adapté à l’intégration continue ainsi qu’au déploiement continu et qui respecte les meilleures pratiques ainsi que les lignes directrices logicielles; <br/><br/> · Assurer la conception, l’architecture et le développement logiciel pour un large panel de services et systèmes; <br/><br/> · Collaborer avec les autres programmeurs pour assurer un déploiement facile, un fonctionnement en continu et un support de la qualité logicielle; <br/><br/> · Fournir activement des retours sur la révision du code aux autres programmeurs; <br/><br/> · Effectuer d’importantes tâches complexes sous un minimum de supervision; <br/><br/> <strong>Qualifications:</strong> <br/><br/> · Minimum 4 ans d’expérience dans la construction de plateformes fiables, hautement disponibles et évolutives; <br/><br/> · Expérience de construction dans un environnement cloud (idéalement AWS, Google Cloud); <br/><br/> · Au moins 4 ans d’expérience avec un des langages suivants : Java, C, C++ ou Go; <br/><br/> · Solide expérience dans la conception logicielle en utilisant les patrons de conception et la programmation orientée objet; <br/><br/> · Expérience avec au moins 1 (2 serait idéal) des langages de programmation / technologies suivantes : Python, Go, JavaScript/NodeJS, Java, C, C++; <br/><br/> · Bonnes maîtrise des bases de données relationnelles, expérience pratique avec les alternatives non relationnelles / NoSQL et solide capacité à déterminer quel type utiliser selon la situation; <br/><br/> · Fortes compétences dans le profilage, l'optimisation et le débogage des ressources côté serveur; <br/><br/> · Expérience dans la conception et l’automatisation de tests unitaires ainsi que des tests de performance; <br/><br/> · Expérience dans les frameworks de messagerie; <br/><br/> · Expérience de travail en environnement Unix/Linux; <br/><br/> · Expérience dans l’intégration avec des API tierces; <br/><br/> <strong>Atouts:</strong>  <ul> <li>Expérience en intégration de services en ligne dans le secteur des jeux vidéo;</li> <li>Expérience de travail dans une infrastructure basée sur le micro-service;</li> <li>Expérience en matière d’application containerization et d’orchestration de container;</li> <li>Expérience en développement d’API RESTful;</li> <li>Expérience en gestion de performance (balancing) et sécurité de réseau;</li> <li>Expérience avec le gameplay sur les protocoles TCP et/ou UDP;</li> <li>Expérience avec les moteurs de jeu tels que Unity3D, Unreal, etc.;</li> <li>Bilingue français / anglais.</li> </ul>
Title: Backend Server Programmer / Programmeur Backend Serveur

Job_Description: <div>  </div>    <div>  Job Information    <div>  <p>City</p>  Edmonton  </div>     <div>  <p>Work Experience</p>  4-5 years  </div>     </div>           	<div>       <div>    Job Description   <p>   </p><div>  Gfycat is the worlds largest platform for user generated GIFs, using HTML5 video technology to deliver great content to our users. Our content is engaging and viral and our users love to watch and share it. Our users consume these amazing videos on Reddit, Imgur, Twitter and Facebook.<div><br><div>We are looking for a backend engineer who will improve our platform. We deliver hundreds of millions of page views and need to get ready to 10x that. You describe yourself as a self-starting engineer with strong developing experience. You know web frameworks and feel comfortable making decisions, testing and launching quickly. You feel comfortable using a test framework to measure success. You like data and how it tells a story about how users are consuming your product. You are great at scoping a project size and working in a small team to improve our platform. You must want to work in a start-up environment, be a self-starter and be passionate about everything!</div><div><br></div><div>You will be responsible for the creation of high quality, world-class web content for desktop and mobile devices. You will engineer backend components that will present information in new, innovative, and creative ways. Your work will require a focus on compatibility, accessibility, and internationalization. </div><div><br>Your components should be modular, reusable, and well documented. You will experiment with emerging technologies and discuss their merits with fellow team members.</div><div><br></div><div>If you are interested in joining a team of passionate people, who like to work hard and play hard, we look forward to hearing from you! </div><div><br></div><div>Responsibilities:</div><div>- You will work in a development environment with other developers to design, develop and deliver world-class software solutions.</div><div>- You will build efficient and reusable services that can scale to support large numbers of users.</div><div>- Optimization of the application for maximum speed and scalability</div><div>- You are a motivated self-starter who is highly results driven, takes enormous pride in your work & demonstrates a high degree of enthusiasm for engineering excellence & ongoing self development</div><div><br></div><div>Requirements:</div><div>- B.S. or M.S. Computer Science or Eng. related field 3+ years of object-oriented software development experience</div><div>- Experience in nosql, highly scalable, highly concurrent, large datasets-- dynamodb, mongodb, cassandra, or similar</div><div>- Experienced in structuring applications through Message Queues. Amazon SQS, RabbitMQ or similar</div><div>- Production AWS or Azure deployments</div><div>- Experience designing clean and maintainable APIs</div><div>- Experience with container-based deployment - e.g., Docker</div><div>- Expert in real time data pipelines, and offline processing and analyzing of large datasets through Hadoop or other approaches</div><div>- Experience with Bootstrap and React is a plus</div><div>- Experience in PHP Symfony2 framework or other similar architectures (Django, Rails, etc). </div><div>- Knowledgeable building high volume infrastructure with Varnish/HAProxy, Memcache/Redis, Nginx/Apache, tuning and managing Linux clusters. </div><div>- Experience writing unit tests and testable code</div><div>- Knowledge of web performance tools and optimization techniques</div><div>- Excellent problem solving, critical thinking and communication skills</div></div>  </div>  <p></p>    </div>	   	    	   	 	   	</div>  	<div></div>
Title: Backend Engineer Full time

Job_Description: <div>Come drive the transformation of financial services, solve big problems and make a meaningful difference in peoples lives.</div> <div>Upgrade, Inc. is a new consumer credit platform that combines personal loans with tools that help consumers understand, monitor and improve their credit. The company raised $60 million in its first capital raise last year, which remains the largest Series A round ever raised by a Fintech company. While the founding team is very accomplished and the business model has been well established, we are still in the early days of this new platform and there is still an opportunity to have a very significant impact.</div><div>Upgrade has been named a 'Best Place to Work in the Bay Area' by the San Francisco Business Times and Silicon Valley Business Journal. The Company was also recently named the #1 Personal Loan option in Q4 2017 by LendingTree customers.</div><div>We are looking for new team members who get excited about creating, designing and implementing new and better solutions to join a team of just over 250 talented and passionate Fintech engineers, product, credit, finance, legal, compliance, design, operations and marketing professionals.</div> <br/> <div><strong>Responsibilities:</strong> </div> <br/> <div><strong>As a SME of the platform, you will work closely with multiple stakeholders to help shape its direction and implement new features. You will be responsible for all technical aspects of the system, including:</strong></div><div>· Developing complex application software using modern continuous integration tools like JIRA/Git/Jenkins</div> <div>· Maintaining best practices for code hygiene and health, including test coverage and deployment</div><div>· Supporting a robust test framework and architecture, including integration with third parties</div><div>· Contributing to documentation of the system</div><div>· Helping with trouble-shooting and problem solving</div> <br/> <div><strong>Skills:</strong> </div><div>· Excellent Java programming experience</div><div>· Knowledge of unit testing methodologies</div><div>· SQL and database programming expertise</div><div>· Knowledge of Maven, Hibernate, ORM frameworks, and the Spring family of frameworks</div><div>· Experience working on AWS is highly desirable</div><div>· Familiarity with Microsoft Windows Server environments, especially scripts and job schedules, and working knowledge of Microsoft SQL Server</div><br/> <div><strong>Benefits/Perks:</strong> </div><div>· Downtown office location across from the Bell Centre</div><div>· Comprehensive benefits package including medical, dental, & vision</div><div>· Kitchen stocked with beverages, snacks & treats</div> <br/> <div>We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.</div><br/>
Title: Senior Software Engineer - Backend

Job_Description: You've read job posts that promise you'll change the world. Then you discover they're for yet another social media app, marketing agency, or consulting firm. You click away. And you wonder: "Aren't there opportunities where I can make a big impact? While I earn recognition and rewards for my efforts? And get to work with exceptional people on exciting new technology?" If that sounds like you, meet BenchSci. You will be a great fit. <br/><br/> <strong>About us</strong> <br/><br/> We use machine learning to accelerate drug discovery by helping scientists execute successful experiments. <br/><br/> <strong>We focus on a huge problem in drug discovery</strong> <br/><br/> Each year, biomedical researchers waste over a billion combined hours. The problem is with products they purchase to influence and measure proteins. There are millions of them, from hundreds of vendors. Finding the right products for specific experiments is tough. Researchers spend hours and sometimes days searching through published papers for guidance. But even then, many products they buy don't work. Some aren't right for a specific experiment. Others are poor quality. This delays scientific discoveries by weeks or months. And it slows availability of breakthrough treatments, while making them more expensive. <br/><br/> <strong>We apply artificial intelligence to solve it</strong> <br/><br/> Thanks to improvements in machine learning, we can now solve this problem. We spent more than two years teaching a computer to read science papers like a human scientist. It decodes the information, which we present to researchers in an easy-to-use, web-based platform. They can then find products for experiments in minutes, not days, and see data that builds trust. The time and money they save has led to rapid adoption by top pharmaceutical companies and hundreds of academic institutions. <br/><br/> <strong>Product video</strong>: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=fPs5xzYYHSs <br/><br/> <strong>About you</strong> <br/><br/> If our story excites you, let us describe who we would love on our team. You are passionate about machine learning, science, and making a positive impact. You are high-reaching, results-focused, and always learning. You act fast. You are open, honest, and transparent. You come to work inspired. You take your job seriously, but not yourself. You leave work satisfied. You wonder how to make every single day better than the last. <br/><br/> <strong>Your responsibilities:</strong> <br/><br/> As an experienced Backend Engineer and Team Lead, you will have the freedom to build and shape BenchSci's backend team. You will manage a team of highly talented software engineers who are working on BenchSci's backend development of data and computation pipeline, and scientific data management system. You will work closely with BenchSci's Head of Engineering and Chief Data Officer to discuss product backend priorities and roadmap. As part of the role you will:  <ul> <li>Lead sprint planning, estimation and reviews. Take ownership of deliverables, and work with your team to ensure high-quality deliverables.</li>  <li>Work closely with Science and Machine Learning teams to improve BenchSci's backend platforms, data management and processes</li>  <li>Proactively define and lead R&D agile methodologies</li>  <li>Ensure product and technical features are delivered to spec and on-time</li>  <li>Continuously improve the performance, scalability, and stability of BenchSci's data pipeline and data structures</li>  <li>Advocate for code and process improvements across your team, and help to define best practices based on personal industry experience and research</li> </ul> <strong>Qualifications:</strong>  <ul> <li>Bachelor’s degree or higher in Computer Science or Software Engineering</li>  <li>Background in Life Science</li>  <li>3+ years of experience in managing and growing a software team</li>  <li>8+ years of experience of strong development skills</li>  <li>Proficient with JavaScript, Python and Python Web Frameworks such as Django</li>  <li>Proficient with shell scripting</li>  <li>Experience working in Agile teams</li>  <li>Experience working with cloud-based solutions</li>  <li>Experience using test-driven development</li>  <li>Experience with SQL, NoSQL, and graph DBs (Postgres, Neo4J)</li>   <li>Experience with Elasticsearch</li>  <li>Experience with workflow management platforms such as Airflow</li>  <li>Experience with big data frameworks such as Hadoop and Spark</li>  <li>Good understanding of system design, data structures, and algorithms</li>  <li>You have a constant desire to grow and develop</li>  <li>You care about quality and you know what it means to ship high-quality code</li>  <li>You have strong cross-team communication and collaboration skills</li>  <li>You are a doer, a curious learner, and can get shit done!</li> </ul> <strong>Nice to have:</strong>  <ul> <li>Degree in Life Science</li>  <li>Experience with React</li> </ul> <strong>What you get:</strong>  <ul> <li>Competitive salary and options at a well-funded startup</li>  <li>Benefits package that includes medical, vision, dental and life insurance</li>  <li>High-growth position in the early stage of a promising company</li>  <li>Key placement with important responsibilities in the organization</li>  <li>Alignment of your professional growth with the company’s growth</li>  <li>An opportunity to help transform and improve scientific research</li> </ul> <strong>How to apply</strong> <br/><br/> Please submit a one-page resume and a short paragraph stating why you are interested in BenchSci. <br/><br/> <strong>A bit more about us</strong> <br/><br/> BenchSci was one of three finalists for "New Startup" in the sixth annual Canadian Startup Awards. As one of the leading machine learning startups in Canada, we raised over $2,700,000 in a seed round from preeminent Canadian and American venture capitalists. We are affiliated with top machine learning researchers at the University of Toronto, including advisor Richard Zemel, research director of the Vector Institute. Our office is located in downtown Toronto (aka “the 6”), near great coffee shops, restaurants, and summer patios. <br/><br/> <strong>At BenchSci we value the following:</strong>  <ul> <li>Freedom and accountability. We do not want or have time to micromanage.</li>  <li>Hard work. We have an amazing and rare opportunity to make an impact and we work hard to make sure we capture it.</li>  <li>Personal growth. We put aside a growth budget for each employee.</li>  <li>No bullshit. No politics. Just results.</li> </ul> BenchSci is an equal opportunity employer. We value diversity and are committed to fostering an inclusive environment. All four of our co-founders are immigrants to Canada, as are more than 75% of our employees. We welcome your fresh perspectives and ideas.
Title: Backend Team Lead

Job_Description: About the role<br/>   <div>Shopify is the world’s fastest growing commerce platform, with no plans to slow down. We’re on a mission to scale our platform while simultaneously improving performance, reliability, and resiliency. To do this, we need the help of dedicated, methodical, and versatile developers! <br/><br/> We’re looking for senior back-end and full stack developers with a passion for solving tough problems with performant code. We ship on quality instead of on time. Our teams deploy new code many times a day, and our production scale is massive. We’re talking hundreds of thousands of online stores, and hundreds of millions of requests a day. Thousands of merchants will see your work within seconds – a tough but incredibly rewarding responsibility. <br/><br/> We’re growing quickly, so there are plenty of opportunities to learn and advance. You’ll have the creative freedom to make a real difference in the world of commerce, the support to bring your whole self to work, and the chance to work with the best in the business. We've listed some of our team who are looking to grow - take a look and if any of these teams seem particularly interesting, we'd love to hear from you! <br/><br/> <strong>Channels, Online Store</strong> <br/><br/> People want to buy wherever they are and however they want. Checkout is part of it all: online, on mobile, in-store, on marketplaces, on social media, and in VR/AR. During the Black Friday Cyber Monday weekend, $1 billion of GMV went through our platform with a peak of $1 million of orders processed per minute. Our limits are constantly being pushed. This is a role where you can think big! What is the future of checkout? How can Shopify build the best buying experiences on the planet (and beyond)? <br/><br/> <strong>Core</strong> <br/><br/> Core is at the very heart of Shopify, and at the heart of our merchants' businesses as well. We create tools that give even the most inexperienced entrepreneur the best chance to succeed, and at the same time, we design products that help some of the world’s leading businesses manage enormous complexity. <br/><br/> Our Core team enables merchants to carry out day to day tasks like adding new products, managing inventory, fulfilling orders and more using the Shopify web admin as the central place to run their business. We also provide insights on their products and customers to let them maximize the impact of their store and free up time to focus on the things they really love doing. <br/><br/> Core is the foundation on which all other Shopify teams are able to build, and we set standards to ensure that they can do it thoughtfully and seamlessly using tools like our design system, Polaris. <br/><br/> <strong>Internationalization</strong> <br/><br/> We want to make commerce better for everyone, everywhere. Countries differ in many ways in term of language, culture, and how people engage with commerce. We want to embrace these differences and make sure Shopify is the right platform for all merchants. Our small team has already experimented with different approaches in India and Japan, and we’re now ready to apply those learnings to more international markets. <br/><br/> Our focus towards markets we haven't explored will have important repercussions on how we, developers, build things, but also how we think about new features and projects.As a member of this team, your responsibilities will be to make sure we do this in a sane, sustainable, reusable way. <br/><br/> <strong>Money</strong> <br/><br/> The Shopify Money team is responsible for all systems that move money between Shopify, our merchants and their buyers, and Shopify Partners. This includes payment processing, billing, capital advances, account balances and evaluating risk. Issues that involve money can seem complicated and even scary. The goal of the entire team is to demystify this process, and make all our financial processes simpler and friendlier to use.</div> <br/>  <div> <div> <div> You’ll need to have extensive experience with:<br/>   <div>  <ul> <li>Building backend web services using several languages and frameworks (some tools we use include Ruby, UNIX commands, Go, Kafka, Python, …)</li><li>Working with relational databases and SQL (we’re mostly on MySQL with some Postgres)</li><li>Working with Rails or the desire to learn it quickly</li><li>Building and scaling user-focused web applications and/or mobile applications using different technologies (React, Angular, Backbone, Bootstrap, Swift, Android, …)</li></ul></div> </div></div> <div> <div> It’d be amazing if you have:<br/>   <div>  <ul> <li>A history of contributing to our community through code, documentation, mentoring, teaching, speaking, or organizing</li><li>Experience building resilient, scalable services and concepts like SLA, fault tolerance, circuit breakers ring a bell</li><li>Experience with development on a leading cloud provider (GCE, AWS, Azure, …)</li><li>A commitment and drive for quality, excellence and results</li><li>A passion for helping growing development teams and making others better</li></ul></div> </div></div></div> <br/>We know that applying to a new role takes a lot of work and we truly value your time. Shaneis looking forward to reading your application.
Title: Senior Software Developer

Job_Description: <strong>About SurveyMonkey</strong> <br/><br/> SurveyMonkey is the world's leading provider of web-based survey solutions, but there's really much more to us than that. We're a smart, passionate group of people who work hard to deliver the best survey experience on the planet, period. We do this because we believe everyone deserves easy access to the insights and information they need to make better, more informed decisions. <br/><br/> We're also proud to admit that despite our incredible growth over the past 15 years, we refuse to grow up. We are still small and nimble; everyone plays an impactful role; and when we say good ideas can come from anyone, we mean it. <br/><br/> SurveyMonkey is trusted by millions of customers, including 99% of the Fortune 500, as well as other businesses, academic institutions and organizations of all shapes and sizes. We collect 2.8 million survey responses daily from people in all countries around the world. <br/><br/> If this sounds like home to you, and you're ready to make your work matter to millions, we'd love to meet you. <br/><br/> <strong>The Role</strong> <br/><br/> SurveyMonkey is looking for a talented and experienced engineer who has a passion for solving challenging technical problems. We work closely with our product owners and our customers, iterating quickly to ensure we build the best solution for our users. <br/><br/> As part of our Enterprise team, you will be responsible for designing, building, and maintaining the enterprise services. You will also be working with other engineering teams to enable SurveyMonkey to add more features and functionalities for our users. <br/><br/> <strong>Responsibilities:</strong>  <ul> <li>Build and maintain our enterprise services</li> <li>Top-to-bottom ownership of new features, including crafting technical specs, writing readable and extendible code, and keeping tabs on post-release metrics</li> <li>Participate in code reviews to validate best practices and logical designs</li> <li>Investigate and address issues with performance, scalability, and maintainability on both production and development environments</li> <li>Foster the spirit of continuous improvement and learning amongst fellow engineers</li> </ul> <strong>Qualifications:</strong>  <ul> <li>Minimum of 5 years in backend programming experience in a professional environment (Python preferred)</li> <li>Experience with Python web frameworks, like Pyramid or Django; or for other languages, like Ruby on Rails</li> <li>Able to write efficient SQL queries and design schemas for relational databases (MySQL experience is a plus)</li> <li>Culture of code reviews, writing tech specs, and collaborating closely with other people (not a solo hacker)</li> <li>Bachelors or Masters in Computer Science or a related field</li> <li>Ability to work on in agile environments with frequent deployments</li> <li>Practices automated testing, believes and enforces good code quality and best engineering practices</li> </ul> Must be able to obtain and hold government security clearance at the Reliability level. <br/><br/> At SurveyMonkey, we offer competitive salaries, medical/dental benefits, PTO, RRSP matching, paid holidays and equity compensation. <br/><br/> SurveyMonkey is an equal opportunity employer. Accommodations are available for applicants with disabilities. <br/><br/> We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.
Title: Software Developer - Back End

Job_Description: <strong>Who Are We?</strong> <br/><br/> We are Canada's 11th, and North America's 52nd Fastest Growing Tech Company (PROFIT 500), and Canada's (#2) Best Place to Work (SMB, 2017). <br/><br/> At Unata, were shaping the future of the retail experience. We power digital experiences for some of North Americas most well-respected grocery chains. Our white-label platform powers award-winning e-commerce experiences, digital flyers and digital loyalty programs, allowing the retailer to automatically tailor each shoppers experience at an individual level so that they can deliver 1-to-1 personalized content and offers. <br/><br/> In other words, we enable customer experiences that make shopping easier and more personal, such as allowing shoppers to order their groceries online and pick up in-store / have them delivered, and allowing shoppers to receive a completely personalized version of the Flyer based on their purchase history. <br/><br/> We are one of Canada's 50 fastest growing companies, and were listed as one of Canada's top 20 most innovative companies. And we have no plans on slowing down! We are absolutely committed to continuous innovation, bringing together a team of Canadas brightest developers, designers, project managers and marketers. <br/><br/> Acquired by Instacart in 2018, Unata operates as a independent subsidiary headquartered in Toronto, Canada. With over 75 employees and plans to keep growing, our team includes some of the best, brightest and most driven minds from across the world in systems integrations, software development, data science, product management, design, and customer success. Weve joined forces to provide the most comprehensive, innovative digital grocery solution in the industry. Want to join a talented team of people changing the way the world grocery shops? Visit www.unata.com/careers/. To learn more about our parent, please visit www.instacart.com. <br/><br/> Want to be part of the future of retail? Wed love to hear from you! <br/><br/> <strong>Why This Opportunity is Cool</strong> <br/><br/> The Backend Team is responsible for building the backend services that power Unatas core platform features. Our product roadmap is full of challenging projects that require innovative engineering solutions. Alongside a team of designers, engineers and data scientists, youll be building scalable and robust distributed systems that power the best digital grocery experience in the market. <br/><br/> <strong>Our Best Backend Engineers</strong>  <ul> <li>Have a degree in Software Engineering, Computer Science, etc.</li> <li>Are proficient in object-oriented software design, and have strong knowledge of Python (+ for Flask, SQL Alchemy).</li> <li>Bring a solid grasp of computer science concepts, such as data structures, algorithms, and programming paradigms. We are very keen on implementing red-black trees here at Unata.</li> <li>Understand and implement engineering best practices, including automated testing, version control systems, documentation, continuous integration, duct tape redundancy, etc.</li> <li>Are at home in a Unix development environment</li> <li>Can clearly communicate complex technical concepts</li> <li>Have built and shipped real software</li> <li>Demonstrate their willingness to learn new things</li> <li>Are accomplished, seasoned, battle-scarred engineers with a history of shipped systems under their belts, with an emphasis on designing async messaging systems, big data architecture and web services</li> </ul> <strong>What This Opportunity Gives You</strong>  <ul> <li>The chance to help shape the technical future of our product as we scale to scores of retail partners and millions of users</li> <li>Learn and work with technologies like Python, PostgreSQL, ElasticSearch, Cassandra, Redis, Memcached and more!</li> <li>Participation in daily stand-up (providing a status of work completed and in-progress), team sprint planning and solution design meetings; as well as in all aspects of software development including design, implementation, and deployment</li> <li>Presenting work performed to other team members for constructive review. Communicating design decisions and solutions to other teams in the form of tech circles in effort of improving awareness, and soliciting feedback and buy in on approach.</li> <li>Providing retrospective feedback for failures and errors in development and/or processes.</li> <li>Ensuring development practices and process is followed along with compliance to company standards.</li> <li>The opportunity to mentor junior engineers via pairing, design review, participation in code reviews to help maintain best practices.</li> <li>Takes initiative to identify and solve important problems, coordinating with others on cross-cutting technical issues</li> <li>Time to attend various developer conferences, like PyCon, where our Team is regularly selected to present</li> <li>A dedicated team filled with people that want to make an impact - this aint no another-day-another-dollar gig!</li> <li>A working environment where your opinions are valued</li> <li>A place within a company that appreciates learning new technologies and implementing them when they make sense</li> <li> and more!</li> </ul> <strong>What Are You Waiting For?</strong> <br/><br/> Apply today with a copy of your resume, and let us know why you're a great fit for the position!

Job_Description: <br> Position Title: .NET Developer (Consultant) in Core Infrastructure Development (CID) focused on Security & SDLC.<br> <br> Company Profile<br> <br> Brokerage is a leading global financial services firm providing a wide range of investment banking, securities, investment management and wealth management services. The Firm's employees serve clients worldwide including corporations, governments and individuals from more than 1,200 offices in 43 countries. As a market leader, the talent and passion of our people is critical to our success. Together, we share a common set of values rooted in integrity, excellence and strong team ethic. Brokerage can provide a superior foundation for building a professional career - a place for people to learn, to achieve and grow. A philosophy that balances personal lifestyles, perspectives and needs is an important part of our culture.<br> <br> Technology<br> <br> Technology works as a strategic partner with Brokerage business units and the world's leading technology companies to redefine how we do business in ever more global, complex, and dynamic financial markets. Brokerage's sizeable investment in technology results in quantitative trading systems, cutting-edge modeling and simulation software, comprehensive risk and security systems, and robust client-relationship capabilities, plus the worldwide infrastructure that forms the backbone of these systems and tools.<br> <br> Our insights, our applications and infrastructure give a competitive edge to clients' businesses'and to our own. Core Infrastructure Development (CID)The CID team owns a large number of client facing and backend applications that are used by all Firm employees during their day-to-day activities, including but not limited to Exchange related tooling, global software distribution and configuration, user facing data leakage prevention tooling, e-mail productivity tools, operating system deployment and testing tools, various management systems for the Firm's virtual environment, and remote connectivity tooling.<br> <br> Key Responsibilities<br> <br> -As a developer, a successful candidate will be responsible for design, engineering, hands-on development, and deployment of security related functionality for the Windows Desktop and Server Platform. Products in this space are developed using various languages, including C#, JavaScript, PowerShell and using SQL Server databases.<br> -The candidate should have expertise with security-related topics such as authentication, entitlements, identity management, data protection, data leakage prevention, validation checking, encryption, hashing, principle of least privilege, software attack methodologies, secure data transfer, secure data storage, secure development, defensive coding, etc.<br> -A successful candidate will be aware of SDLC process and implement them within the work responsibilities.<br> -Candidate will also work on defining a proposal for a Developer Desktop that is segregated from a Productivity Desktop as part of the Defense in Depth program focused on security and reducing risks of cyber threats.<br> <br> -Will require candidate to partner with platform, network, engineering, and development teams across the organization to work thru benefits as well as the considerations of a segregated Developer Desktop.<br> <br> Required Technical Skills<br> <br> -5+ Years' experience with C#, ASP.Net, ADO.Net, SQL Server, JavaScript frameworks<br> -2+ years' experience with web services, APIs, and REST<br> -Hands-on experience with distributed, large scale, highly available systems<br> -Hands-on experience with Continuous Integration systems (Jenkins, Team City)<br> -Hands-on experience with SDLC, Agile, TDD, and various levels of automated testing<br> -Knowledge of design patters and anti-patterns<br> <br> Preferred Technical Skills but not required:<br> <br> Windows Active Directory and LDAP knowledge<br> PowerShell knowledge<br> Knowledge of micro-services architecture and containerization (eg. Docker)<br> <br> Experience with Citrix products (XenApp, XenDesktop) & virtualization technologies (VMWare, Hyper-V)<br> Experience with configuration management tools like SCCM, Chef, etc.<br> Experience in the financial industry and familiarity with the regulatory aspects of technology<br> <br> Required Leadership Skills:<br> <br> -Excellent Global Communication & Coordination skills<br> - Ability to clearly express (verbally and written) status, design, thoughts & ideas to varying audiences from junior developers to senior management & stakeholders across multiple regions in Asia & outside Asia including Budapest, London, Montreal & NY.<br> -Strong Collaboration mindset to partner with Global technology managers across Engineering, Product Management, & Operations and define short term and long-term strategy and goals based on functional & technical vision for end user computing products.<br> -Responsible for project estimates, task management & balancing prioritization across multiple streams of development for applications owned by the team.<br> -Reduce the effort of Production Support done by Development team with dedicated focus on completing handover to Operational support, reduction of technical debt, and decommissioning of legacy products.

Job_Description: <strong>About Breather</strong><br/><br/>Breather creates and curates a network of beautiful, on-demand private spaces that you can reserve and unlock via our web and mobile apps. We are live in 10 cities across 3 countries and backed by some of the best investors in NYC and Silicon Valley. We enable top companies to do more productive and inspired work and are growing quickly! We're venture-backed; we have big ambitions, and we want you to help us achieve them.<br/><br/><strong>What to expect</strong><br/><br/>Breather’s engineering and product is organized in small, autonomous, self-directed teams that are empowered to solve their customers’ needs. You will be part of the InfoSys team, whose mission is to develop the internal systems used by our employees. Breather’s software is deeply enmeshed in the physical world and we strive to build systems that make our logistics, support and sales operations smoother and more efficient. As a senior backend engineer on that team, your key responsibilities will be to build develop the business logic through data models, services and REST apis. <br/><br/> Our stack includes:  <ul> <li>Node.js</li> <li>MongoDB</li> <li>RabbitMQ</li> <li>ElasticSearch</li> <li>Redis</li> <li>AWS</li> </ul>  <strong>In this role, you will:</strong>   <ul> <li><strong>Build</strong>: In collaboration with your cross-functional team, you will design, build and iterate on new features that solve your customers’ problems and make them happy. You will architect backend systems that are fast, scalable and reliable, and design apis that are enjoyable to use.</li> <li><strong>Code</strong>: At Breather, we want great developers who love and care about the craft of computer programming. You will write clean, tested, and maintainable code.</li>   <li><strong>Lead</strong>: You will help your teammates grow through example, code reviews, and mentoring.</li> <li><strong>Plan</strong>: You will elaborate the roadmap with your teammates. As part of the backend functional team, you will help drive the long-term direction of our systems’ architecture.</li> </ul>  <strong>About You:</strong><br/><br/>You are highly motivated and enjoy programming and building things. You know how to make backend services fast, scalable, maintainable, and enjoyable to use. You care about the craft of writing clean code. You see beauty in HTTP headers and JSON output. You have a solid understanding of networking, distributed systems, and UNIX. Ideally, you will also have experience with systems-level programming, Docker, and DevOps. <br/><br/> In addition to experience with some of the technologies we use, you have the following:  <ul> <li>A bachelor’s degree in Computer Science/Engineering, or equivalent</li> <li>5 or more years in an engineering or development role</li> <li>Excellent communication and interpersonal skills</li> <li>The need to keep your skillset current; a thirst for knowledge</li> </ul> Bonus Points:  <ul> <li>Links to live, on-the-web examples of your work (Github, Stack Overflow, etc.)</li> <li>You're familiar with our product and have some ideas on things you'd want to add or change</li> </ul>  <strong>What We Value</strong><br/><br/>At Breather, our company values are not only the principles that link us together in the way we work, but they also keep us aligned on the same path, all working towards connected goals. These standards are what guide us on our collective journey through space(s).<br/><br/><strong>Perks and Benefits</strong><br/><br/>We hope that you're excited by all the possibilities that come with working at Breather! In addition to our unique culture, we also offer these fun perks and benefits:  <ul> <li>Be part of a well-funded, proven startup with big ambitions, competitive salary and company equity</li> <li>Work when you want, where you want, with the tools you want</li> <li>Company-funded travel to conferences & professional development events that interest you and benefit your career growth</li> <li>Access to comprehensive medical, vision, and dental coverage. Oh, and it’s on us</li> <li>Free access to the Breather network of over 400 spaces (and growing, fast!)</li> <li>Dog-friendly office - bring your dog to work, they’ll find plenty of friends waiting to play with them!</li> </ul>
Title: Sr. Backend Software Engineer

Job_Description: <div> About HOOPP HOOPP's core values - professional, accountable, collaborative, compassionate and trustworthy - guide its every interaction with HOOPP members and employees. As one of Canada's largest and most respected multi-employer pension plans, HOOPP invests the net assets of its $77.8 billion Fund, administers the Plan and pays approximately $2.3 billion in pension benefits per year. With over 339,328 members and pensioners, and more than 548 participating employers, HOOPP's mission to deliver on the pension promise remains strong.<br/><br/>To remain one of the leading pension plans in Canada, we must continually challenge ourselves to improve our product, services and investment performance. HOOPP offers a professional environment designed to bring out the best in its employees. The organization's size and structure bring decision-making, accountability and ownership to the individual employee level. HOOPP employees are flexible and adaptable to work in cross-divisional teams in a fast-paced, rewarding environment. <br/><br/> HOOPP is an equal opportunity employer. We recruit and select applicants for employment solely on the basis of their qualifications. Should you require accommodation because of a disability during the recruitment and selection process, please contact Human Resources. Our HR team will consult with you so that arrangements can be made for reasonable accommodation.</div> <div> Summary<br/><br/>The Investment Services Group at HOOPP is looking for a developer to help deliver interactive real-time web applications for traders, portfolio managers, middle office, and securities operations. The candidate is able to demonstrate working in a very collaborative agile environment. Excellent communication is a very important asset as well as the desire to learn and solve problems as a team. The developer will work with a team of mixed roles focusing on delivering high quality solutions to our stakeholders.</div> <div> Duties and Responsibilities<br/><br/>· Work in a highly agile team, collaborating with Business Analysts and fellow developers. This involves sharing information, providing and receiving inputs on designs and code, as well as working on shared codebase with other developers. <br/><br/> · Participate in Agile Scrum practices such as daily standups, grooming, planning and sprint retrospectives <br/><br/> · Build, maintain and troubleshoot web applications built with React / Typescript and backend applications built with TIBCO Streambase <br/><br/> · Design and support back-end API endpoints built with SQL Server, Spring / Kotlin / Java in an AWS Elastic Beanstalk environment. <br/><br/> · Seek opportunities to improve UI, back-end code, overall system design, development practices, and automated tooling. <br/><br/> · Build unit tests in Kotlin / Java and TypeScript. <br/><br/> · Maintain and improve automated builds and deployments. <br/><br/> · Work closely with HOOPP business partners and other IT teams to help refine requirements, prototype solutions, and provide demos.</div> <div> Qualifications and Skills<br/><br/>· Diploma or degree in Computer Science, or equivalent work experience <br/><br/> · High enthusiasm with a sense of urgency to get things done. <br/><br/> · Experience with Java, C#, Kotlin, or other object-oriented language. <br/><br/> · Experience working on applications using Angular, React, Knockout, or other JavaScript MVVM frameworks. A working knowledge of CSS and Yarn is also preferred. <br/><br/> · Strong understanding of web technologies, server side data processing and optimization. <br/><br/> · Experience with source management and build automation such as git and TFS <br/><br/> · Experience working in an agile team and demonstrable knowledge of agile roles</div>
Title: Systems Developer

Job_Description: <strong>General Description</strong> <br/>  <div>General Description: <br/> Technical professionals are defined by what they create. Samsung has the risk taking corporate culture, strategic R&D investments and global know-how to imagine, develop and market products that lead the industry. Samsung’s Smart TV Services group located in Mountain View, CA is currently recruiting world-class engineers who share our “Innovation through passion” philosophy and thrive in a well-paced, results-driven environment.  <br/> <br/> Samsung’s VD Content & Services Division is now hiring experience engineers for its Platform cluster. The cluster is responsible for powering Samsung’s Smart TVs features like Search and Recommendations using Backend Services TVs communicate with and by providing Metadata to other Samsung's engineering groups. We are looking for TV passionate engineers who would like to contribute and improve Samsung’s Smart TV experience by developing new features and work in a challenging and advance environment.</div>   <br/><strong>Necessary Skills / Attributes</strong> <br/>  <div>Necessary Skills / Attributes    <ul> <li>Bachelor's degree in Computer Science/Engineering or related field. </li> <li>8-12 years directly related experience. </li> <li>8+ years’ experience in Server/Backend development for large scale services. </li> <li>Experience with Databases (SQL/NoSQL) </li> <li>Experience with RESTful APIs (design and implementation) </li> <li>Caching implementations (Redis, Memcached) </li> <li>Experience with AWS Cloud tools and services (EC2, RDS, DynamoDB, CloudFront, etc.) </li> <li>Experience in Object Oriented Design and Development </li> <li>Fast learner and construable to work in a fast paced, ever changing environment. </li> <li>Strong interest and knowledge in media (TV/Movies). </li> <li>Experience in Functional Programing. </li> <li>Full stack engineering experience </li> <li>Experience with RoR (Ruby on Rails)/Node.js </li> <li>Devops experience (build/deploy using chef, terraform, docker, etc.). </li>  </ul>  Languages :    <ul> <li>Scala (strong knowledge) </li> <li>Java </li> <li>Ruby </li> <li>C++</div> </li>  </ul>  <strong>Company Information</strong> <br/>  <div>Founded in October 1988, Samsung Research America (SRA) is a wholly-owned subsidiary of Samsung Electronics Co. Ltd, South Korea. SRA is headquartered in Silicon Valley, CA. with offices across the US. SRA is engaged in researching emerging technologies to create new businesses, and developing core technologies to enhance the competitiveness of Samsung's products. SRA offers a competitive compensation package for R&D achievements so that researchers can focus on developing cutting edge technology. The primary research areas of SRA include: advanced software, content/services, user experience as well as other new and emerging technologies. <br/><br/> Samsung Research America (SRA) plays a pivotal role in developing the next generation of discovery in software, user experience and services for future products that can enrich your life. <br/><br/> Our mission is to research and develop new technologies by partnering with the best and brightest and creating a collaborative environment between industry and academia. Headquartered in Silicon Valley, with locations in many technology centers in North America, SRA is driven to build a culture of innovation that rapidly translates research and new ideas into the unexpected.</div>

Job_Description: Electronic Arts Inc. is a leading global interactive entertainment software company. EA delivers games, content and online services for Internet-connected consoles, personal computers, mobile phones and tablets. <br/><br/> <strong>Software Engineer, Developer Experience - EA Digital Platform (EADP)</strong> <br/><br/> <strong>We are EA</strong> <br/><br/> Electronic Arts is more than you’ve ever realized. We’re more than a company, or a headline, or even a clever catchphrase – we’re a vibrant community of over 8,000 artists, storytellers, technologists and innovators working toward a shared vision: to inspire and unite through play. <br/><br/> While headquartered in Redwood City, EA's platform engineering, game development, and publishing operations take place in a network of locations, stretching from Shanghai to Stockholm, Melbourne to Vancouver. No matter which of our studio locations you join, you’ll feel the energy and support of EA’s global brand, while immersing yourself in a culture that inspires you to thrive, take risks and dream big. Our unique studios create amazingly creative and fun games - fast paced puzzles, adrenaline filled warfare, galaxy spanning adventures, high speed racing, and sports so realistic you can practically feel the grass under your feet. <br/><br/> This is an especially great time for the video game industry, as we’re currently going through an exciting digital transformation. The effects of this on EA’s business have been profound. In fiscal year 2014, 45% ($1.8 billion) of our non-GAAP net revenues came from digital offerings. The global gaming audience has also never been bigger, with industry revenue projected to reach $86 billion in 2016. <br/><br/> Since its founding in 1982, EA has helped shape the way over 300 million registered players consume and enjoy interactive media. No other company can deliver EA’s portfolio of amazing games and services, across multiple platforms, to players around the world. It is an exciting era in games, and an exciting time to join the team at EA! <br/><br/> <strong>The Challenge Ahead:</strong> <br/><br/> EA’s Digital Platform (EADP) organization is responsible for driving critical technology decisions and investments for EA on a global basis, across all divisions and studio teams. Technology and engineering leadership at EA is critical to making the industry’s best games and services and the EADP team is leading the way to providing cross-platform infrastructure that will keep our consumers connected with our games anytime, anywhere with anyone.. <br/><br/> <strong>What a Software Engineer, Developer Experience does at EA:</strong> <br/><br/> This unique role will be perfect for an individual who is passionate about engineering ease of use and reducing friction in tech integration. The team will focus on building a product that unifies integrator onboarding and support and provides apps to optimize the entire game development and live game management life cycle. The team will also build a framework that enables shared services to provide the right experiences, tools and documentation support to enable better integration. <br/><br/> <strong>Responsibilities:</strong> <br/><br/> The Software Engineer will play a key role in developing tools and services to support the platform in providing a world class developer experience. Typical activities include: <ul> <li>Develop web apps, components, prototypes, or proofs of concept (POC’s)</li><li>Participate in all aspects of an iterative, agile software development process, including scoping, detailed design, effort estimation, coding, testing, debugging, maintenance and support</li><li>Define and tune frontend technology stack</li><li>Collaborate with the design and product management team to build applications that delight users.</li><li>Document and present designs for peer technical review and provide feedback on others’ designs</li><li>Work on the application framework that includes backend common services (e.g. authentication, authorization etc)</li><li>Develop Real-time data collection and analytics on client/server platforms</li><li>Work cross teams to identify key requirements, define key metrics and setup benchmarks for engineering ease of use</li><li>Analyze the complex technical architecture across EA’s shared services and platform to understand the underlying drivers of engineering friction and drive fixes</li><li>Partner closely with game studios to understand their key requirements and concerns for integration</li><li>Partner closely with platform teams to understand what common functionality they need in a framework to build the best possible integration experiences</li> </ul> <strong>The next great EA Software Engineer, Developer Experience also needs:</strong> <ul> <li>Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science</li><li>Expertise in object oriented design/programming</li><li>Knowledgeable in the area of scalable platform architecture, end to end systems design and architecture</li><li>A passion for gaming and a good problem solver and creative thinker</li><li>Experience with web frontend technologies like React, Angular, Javascript, CSS and HTML is a plus</li><li>Familiarity with new web frameworks and tools (e.g. Grunt, Bower, Bootstrap, JSHint) is a plus</li><li>Able to work and problem solve independently, to organize workload and priorities, high-quality execution, technical innovation/adaptation, and initiative</li><li>Understanding of the realities of working with complex distributed client/server systems</li><li>Experience working in Agile/Scrum based development environments</li><li>Understanding of HTTP/HTTPS requests</li><li>Familiarity with Linux based systems</li> </ul> <strong>What’s in it for you? Glad you asked!</strong> <br/><br/> We love to brag about our great perks like comprehensive health and benefit packages, tuition reimbursement, 401k with company match and, of course, free video games. And since we realize it takes world-class people to make world-class games, we offer competitive compensation packages and a culture that thrives off of creativity and individuality. At EA, we live the “work hard/play hard” credo every day. <br/><br/> <strong>Don’t Just Play It – Create It!</strong>
Title: Sr. Software Engineer - Developer Experience

Job_Description: Kijiji, part of the fast-growing eBay Classifieds Group at eBay, is the number 1 online Classifieds site in Canada. Reaching half of the monthly on-line population, we are one of Canadas Top 10 digital properties and a leader in helping people find and trade goods and services, including Autos, Real Estate and Jobs. We have succeeded because we behave like a dynamic start-up, have end-to-end control of our business, and hire the best and brightest people. We have a fun, unique, and engaging culture in our new, stylish office located in the historic King and Spadina neighborhood in Torontos hub of innovation. <br/><br/> Kijijis technology team is the engine behind Kijiji.ca and is charged with developing, testing, and operating one of the largest e-commerce sites in the country. The Software Engineer will work with a team of talented software engineers focused on building large-scale web applications in an agile, cross-functional environment. <br/><br/> <strong>Responsibilities</strong> <ul> <li>Write clean, well tested and efficient code</li><li>Engage with the engineering team in technical decisions around designs, languages and frameworks</li><li>Contribute to keeping the technology stack healthy and maintainable through monitoring and documentation</li><li>Work closely with cross functional product teams on evolving the Kijiji product offering</li><li>Provide support and guidance to more junior developers</li> </ul> <strong>Preferred Qualifications</strong> <ul> <li>Strong experience with Java programming</li><li>Experience with functional and object oriented programming</li><li>Experience with DevOps tools and environments</li><li>Experience with agile methodologies</li> </ul> <strong>Job Requirements</strong> <ul> <li>Flexible, adaptable, and able to autonomously manage multiple tasks in a dynamic, fast-paced, iterative development environment with short turn-around times</li><li>Self-motivated, passionate for technology, and strong driver for results and continual improvement</li><li>Team player - work well independently and in multi-group cross-discipline environment</li><li>5+ years of experience in software development with a focus on web/internet</li><li>Degree in computer science or equivalent knowledge and experience</li> </ul> This website uses cookies to enhance your experience. By continuing to browse the site, you agree to our use of cookies <br/><br/> View our privacy policy <br/><br/> View our <u>accessibility info</u> <br/><br/> eBay Inc. is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, veteran status, and disability, or other legally protected status. If you are unable to submit an application because of incompatible assistive technology or a disability, please contact us at talent@ebay.com. We will make every effort to respond to your request for disability assistance as soon as possible. <br/><br/> For more information see: <br/><br/> EEO is the Law Poster <br/><br/> EEO is the Law Poster Supplement<br/><br/>R0025036
