Job_Description: <div>Auto req ID 195416BR </div><div> Job Title Developer, Portfolio Analytics </div><div> Report Location Toronto </div><div> Country Canada </div><div> Province/State Ontario </div><div> City1 Toronto </div><div> TD Description <p>Tell us your story. Don't go unnoticed. Explain why you're a winning candidate. Think "TD" if you crave meaningful work and embrace change like we do. We are a trusted North American leader that cares about people and inspires them to grow and move forward.</p><p>Stay current and competitive. Carve out a career for yourself. Grow with us. Here's our story: jobs.td.com</p> </div><div> Department Overview <p>TD Asset Management (TDAM) is a member of TD Bank Financial Group and is one of Canada’s largest investment management firms. As of June 30, 2017, TDAM and its affiliates manage over $347 billion in assets on behalf of pension, insurance, endowment/foundation and corporate clients, as well as high-net worth clients and retail mutual funds, across both active fundamental and quantitative-based solutions. A cornerstone of TDAM’s success has been the ability to partner with its clients to develop customized solutions that meet their evolving needs and objectives.<br> <br>In attaining this client commitment, TDAM has built one of Canada’s largest and most respected investment management and research teams with more than 100 Investment professionals and offices in New York, Toronto, and Montreal. A team approach to portfolio management enables TDAM to leverage the expertise of all its broad investment platform, capitalizing on their wealth of knowledge and ideas. Members with expertise in fixed income and equities, specializing in different industries and countries, come together to discuss and debate the pertinent issues affecting the markets and funds.</p> </div><div> Job Type Regular </div><div> Job Status Full Time </div><div> Hours Mon - Fri, 8am start </div><div> Business line TD Asset Management </div><div> Job Category - Primary Asset Management </div><div> Job Category(s) Asset Management </div><div> Job Description We are seeking a Developer to join the TD Asset Management Portfolio Research & Analytics team. The Portfolio Research & Analytics team is a small and dynamic team which works directly with the Portfolio Managers to develop sophisticated portfolio management tools and quantitative models. The applications are used to monitor hundreds of portfolios, model trades, assess risk and provide timely client reporting. <br> <br>The Developer will be responsible for the design and development of applications for Portfolio Managers, and providing daily operational support for the system.<br><strong> <br>The ideal candidate will:</strong><ul><li>Demonstrate a passion for applying technology to solve real world problems,</li><li>Actively engage to understand the business, working directly with various teams to find solutions and following through to completion,</li><li>Have a strong interest in building a career in financial markets and the opportunity to work for an industry leader,</li><li>Enjoy a multi-faceted developer role providing the opportunity to work on both the front end and back end of the system,</li><li>Have a desire to learn new tools and technologies.</li></ul>You will be working on a platform developed primarily in Python with a SQL Server backend and a web based front end. Applications make heavy use of the Python libraries NumPy and Pandas for data manipulation and calculations. Interested candidates lacking specific experience in Python or SQL Server but who have solid software development expertise in another language are encouraged to apply as long as they have a keen interest in learning new technologies.<br><br><strong>Key Accountabilities include:</strong><ul><li>Design and develop applications and supporting infrastructure on our platform, working directly with the business to create solutions.</li><li>Work with Portfolio Managers on developing analytics and reports for portfolio management as well as client proposals.</li><li>Respond to ad hoc requests for data, reports and analytics as well as administrative tasks associated with the maintenance of the platform.</li><li>Maintain high data quality standards, proactively improving data processing routines and algorithms, and addressing data issues raised by users.</li><li>Proactively improve calculations of security and portfolio level metrics. You will also analyze data and develop tools and platform enhancements to improve efficiency of how we manage assets.</li><li>Monitor and resolve issues with daily processes and support requests from users.</li><li>Coordinate with IT and Business Analyst teams to integrate third party data.</li></ul> </div><div> Job Requirements <strong>Job Requirements</strong><ul><li>Strong software development skills are a must for this role. Previous experience with the following technologies will be preferred:<ul><li>Python</li><li>SQL and database design (with any major RDBMS). </li><li>JavaScript (specially React and Redux frameworks)</li><li>Issue tracking, code review and source control with JIRA and GIT.</li><li>Familiarity with software development in a Linux based environment.</li></ul></li><li>Strong interpersonal and communication skills with the ability to explain complex technical issues to a general audience. </li><li>This role necessitates the ability to work comfortably without being provided specifications. Being self-driven and having strong time management skills will further aid in this objective.</li><li>Ability to establish and maintain strong working relationships with internal partners in investment management, technology, risk and client service.</li><li>Keen interest in expanding your finance and investing knowledge. Previous financial experience is not required but is considered an asset.</li><li>8AM start in order to meet support requirements for the portfolio managers on the trading desk.</li><li>Occasional travel to US to work with business and team.</li></ul><strong>Education and Accreditation</strong><ul><li>Bachelor's degree in a technical discipline such as Computer Science, Engineering or Mathematics.</li><li>Progress towards CFA program is considered an asset and supported by the firm.</li></ul><strong>Experience</strong><br>The successful candidate will have demonstrated real world software development experience. Internship and co-op experience will also be considered.<br><br><strong>#LI-POST</strong> </div><div> Additional Information Please note that an 8AM start is required in order to meet support requirements for the portfolio managers on the trading desk. </div><div> Inclusiveness <p>At TD, we are committed to fostering an inclusive, accessible environment, where all employees and customers feel valued, respected and supported. We are dedicated to building a workforce that reflects the diversity of our customers and communities in which we live and serve. If you require an accommodation for the recruitment/interview process (including alternate formats of materials, or accessible meeting rooms or other accommodation), please let us know and we will work with you to meet your needs.</p> </div><div> **Province/State (Primary) Ontario </div><div> City (Primary) Toronto </div><div> <div></div></div>
Title: Developer, Portfolio Analytics

Job_Description: <p>Electronic Arts Inc. is a leading global interactive entertainment software company. EA delivers games, content and online services for Internet-connected consoles, personal computers, mobile phones and tablets.</p> <p><strong>ENGLISH FOLLOWS</strong></p> <p> </p> <p>La motivation nourrit notre industrie – le désir de donner vie à une idée, d’inclure du jamais vu dans un jeu. C’est ce qui donne la force motrice de l’équipe Motive. Nos seules limites sont celles de notre imagination. Motive est un nouveau studio créatif, dirigé par Jade Raymond et une équipe de vétérans de l’industrie. Le studio Motive vise à redéfinir les jeux d’action et à proposer aux adeptes des jeux novateurs de qualité supérieure. Quoi de mieux que d’avoir la possibilité de créer la prochaine franchise à succès, de collaborer à un jeu Star Wars et de participer aux débuts d’un tout nouveau studio? Si les jeux vous passionnent et que vous souhaitez repousser les limites de votre art, profitez de cette occasion unique.</p> <p> </p> <p>Motive est à la recherche d’un(e) <strong>Programmeur(euse) En Ligne</strong> pour se joindre à son équipe.</p> <p> </p> <p><strong>Responsabilités Principales :</strong></p> <ul><li>Collaborer avec les membres de l’équipe à la conception et implémentation des fonctionnalités en-ligne</li><li>En partenariat avec l’équipe Serveurs, assurer l’intégration dans le jeu des fonctionnalités en-ligne</li><li>Tester et auditer le code et les systèmes en-ligne tout au long du développement</li></ul> <p> </p> <p><strong>Exigences :</strong></p> <ul><li>Minimum de 3 ans d’expérience en développement d’applications client/serveur en C++</li><li>Expérience de travail avec une équipe d’ingénieurs dans le cycle complet de développement d’un titre AAA</li><li>Excellente connaissance du C++ et expérience de travail avec des bases de code très étendues</li><li>Capacité de travailler de façon autonome et autodirigée</li><li>Excellentes aptitudes pour le travail d’équipe et la communication</li><li>Passion pour le jeu et la création de jeux novateurs</li></ul> <p> </p> <p><strong>Atouts :</strong></p> <ul><li>Expérience en programmation asynchrone et multithread</li><li>Expérience de travail avec les bases de donnes et le langage SQL ou équivalent</li><li>Connaissance des protocoles réseaux tels que HTTPS et TCP/IP</li><li>Connaissance des systèmes d’exploitation Windows et Linux</li><li>Connaissance d’autres langages de programmation, notamment Perl, Python ou Bash</li><li>Baccalauréat en informatique ou en génie informatique</li></ul> <p> </p> <p><strong>Qu’avons-nous à vous offrir ? Bonne question !</strong></p> <p>Nous adorons vanter les avantages que nous offrons comme des régimes d’assurance-maladie et d’avantages sociaux complets, le remboursement des frais de cours, un régime d’épargne-retraite avec cotisation équivalente et, bien sûr, plusieurs autres à-côtés. Nous savons que pour créer des jeux de renommée mondiale, il nous faut des talents de classe mondiale. C’est pourquoi nous offrons une rémunération concurrentielle ainsi qu’une culture basée sur la créativité et l’individualité. Chez EA, nous incarnons le modèle « travail-loisir » chaque jour.</p> <p> </p> <p>Plus sur notre emplacement : http://careers.ea.com/our-locations/montreal</p> <p>Contacter notre recruteur: <strong>Audrey Berendsen</strong> aberendsen@ea.com</p> <p><strong>Motive vous offre les moyens et l’occasion. Venez découvrir ce dont vous êtes capable!</strong></p> <p> </p> <p>Everyone in our industry has a Motive - an idea they want to bring to life, something they’ve never seen before in a game that they want to make a reality. This is what drives everyone at Motive. The only limit here is the team’s imagination. Motive is a new creative-driven studio, led by Jade Raymond and a team of industry veterans, Motive aims to redefine action games and bring the highest quality innovative games to players. What could be better than getting to create the world’s next block buster franchise, work on a Star Wars game and be part of building a brand-new studio from the ground up? If you are passionate about games and motivated to push your craft further this is the opportunity of a lifetime.</p> <p> </p> <p>Motive is seeking an <strong>Online Developer</strong> to join its team.</p> <p> </p> <p><strong>Primary Responsibilities:</strong></p> <ul><li>Collaborate with team members to design and implement online features</li><li>Partner with the backend team to integrate online features into the game</li><li>Test and monitor online game systems throughout the development cycle</li></ul> <p> </p> <p><strong>Requirements:</strong></p> <ul><li>At least 3 years of experience developing client/server applications in C++</li><li>Experience working with a team of engineers throughout the full development cycle on an AAA title</li><li>Advanced knowledge of C++ and experience working with extended code bases</li><li>Ability to work independently and to be self-directing</li><li>Excellent teamwork and communication skills</li><li>Passion for making and playing innovative games</li></ul> <p> </p> <p><strong>Assets:</strong></p> <ul><li>Experience with asynchronous and multithreaded programming</li><li>Experience working with databases and SQL or equivalent</li><li>Knowledge of network protocols, such as HTTPS and TCP/IP</li><li>Knowledge of Windows and Linux operating systems</li><li>Knowledge of any other programming languages, especially Perl, Python or Bash</li><li>B.S. in Computer Science or Computer Science Engineering</li></ul> <p> </p> <p><strong>What’s in it for you? Glad you asked!</strong></p> <p>We love to brag about our great perks like comprehensive health and benefit packages, tuition reimbursement, RRSP company match and, of course, many other perks! And since we realize it takes world-class people to make world-class games, we offer competitive compensation packages and a culture that thrives from creativity and individuality. At EA, we live the “work hard/play hard” credo every day.</p> <p> </p> <p>More about our location: http://careers.ea.com/our-locations/montreal</p> <p>Contact our Recruiter:<strong>Audrey Berendsen</strong> aberendsen@ea.com</p> <p><strong>Motive has the means and opportunity. Come see what you can do!</strong></p> <p> </p>
Title: Motive: développeur online / Online Developer

Job_Description: <strong>Ecosystem Technology</strong> <br/><br/> RBC is in the process of changing how people think about and interact with the bank on a daily basis. No longer do we want to be transactional and episodic, but instead find interesting ways to be a part of everyones daily lives in some way. In order to achieve this, Ecosystems groups will be thinking and acting like startups to find interesting new ideas that will be in many cases, completely unrelated to traditional banking products. <br/><br/> <strong>What We Are Looking For</strong> <br/><br/> RBC Ecosystems is seeking a talented and passionate Sr. JavaScript Engineer to join our team. We want vocal futurists that can advocate their vision, who will be excited about creative problem-solving as part of a cross-functional team; will obsess over writing smart, simple clean code; will tirelessly strive for the best end-user experience and will have the drive and desire to keep learning the latest development techniques. <br/><br/> <strong>What you will do?</strong> <ul> <li>Create intuitive, robust and reusable APIs using modern frameworks</li><li>Work with modern backend JavaScript frameworks like Express and KOA2</li><li>Code, test and implement solutions to meet business needs</li><li>Maintain code quality and best practices across the backend team</li><li>Work within a cross functional team aimed at delivering high valued solutions</li> </ul> <strong>About You</strong> <ul> <li>You think digital first and believe all customer experiences should be simple and effective</li><li>A creative problem solver that can develop a plan, take ownership of tasks, and are outcome focused</li><li>A team player, technical mentor, keen to coach others and share ideas with your team</li><li>An exceptional communicator able to articulate technical issues in plain language</li><li>You keep up to date on web and mobile development trends and understanding how it applies to our customers needs</li><li>You understand web and application security</li> </ul> <strong>What do you need to succeed?</strong> <br/><br/> Must Haves: <ul> <li>Post-secondary degree or diploma in a computer or design related program</li><li>4+ years of JavaScript experience building web API</li><li>4+ years of experience backend development in Node.js building API / Microservices</li><li>Experience with source control (e.g. Git, SVN) and working with data-handling using AJAX, JSON, and REST API</li> </ul> <strong>Nice to Haves</strong> <ul> <li>Experience building and deploying solutions to cloud infrastructure including AWS</li><li>Experience at a Financial Institution and product/process knowledge</li><li>Experience working with startup companies and working in an agile environment</li> </ul> SFDG <br/><br/> <strong>Learn more about RBC Tech Jobs</strong> <br/><br/> <strong>About RBC</strong> <br/> Royal Bank of Canada is Canadas largest bank, and one of the largest banks in the world, based on market capitalization. We are one of North Americas leading diversified financial services companies, and provide personal and commercial banking, wealth management, insurance, investor services and capital markets products and services on a global basis. We have over 80,000 full- and part-time employees who serve more than 16 million personal, business, public sector and institutional clients through offices in Canada, the U.S. and 37 other countries. For more information, please visit rbc.com. <br/><br/> <strong>Join our Talent Community</strong> <br/><br/> Stay in-the-know about great career opportunities at RBC. Sign up and get customized info on our latest jobs, career tips and Recruitment events that matter to you. <br/><br/> Expand your limits and create a new future together at RBC. Find out how we use our passion and drive to enhance the well-being of our clients and communities at rbc.com/careers. <br/><br/> <strong>Inclusion and Equal Opportunity Employment</strong> <br/> RBC is an equal opportunity employer committed to diversity and inclusion. We are pleased to consider all qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, protected veterans status, Aboriginal/Native American status or any other legally-protected factors. Disability-related accommodations during the application process are available upon request. <br/><br/> <u><strong>JOB SUMMARY</strong></u> <br/> <strong>City:</strong>  Toronto <br/> <strong>Address:</strong> 20 Bay Street <br/> <strong>Work Hours/Week:</strong> 37.5 <br/> <strong>Work Environment:</strong>  Office <br/> <strong>Employment Type:</strong> Permanent <br/> <strong>Career Level:</strong>  Experienced Hire/Professional <br/> <strong>Pay Type:</strong> Salaried <br/> <strong>Required Travel(%):</strong> 0-25 <br/> <strong>Exempt/Non-Exempt:</strong> N/A <br/> <strong>People Manager:</strong>  No <br/> <strong>Application Deadline:</strong>  2018-05-28 <br/> <strong>Req ID:</strong> 163482 <br/><br/> <em>Posting Notes: [[mfield1]]</em>

Job_Description: <strong>About Symantec and SurfEasy:</strong> <br/><br/> SurfEasy is a leading Virtual Private Network (VPN) provider that delivers easy-to-use solutions for online privacy and security on smartphones, tablets and computers. <br/><br/> VPN technology encrypts consumers’ communications online, which can include sensitive information such as passwords and credit card information, and helps to protect that information from being intercepted by cybercriminals. <br/><br/> SurfEasy was recently acquired by Symantec Corporation, but has been powering Symantec’s Norton WiFi Privacy product with VPN technology for the last 2 years. <br/><br/> As a leading Fortune 500 Technology & Security Company, Symantec already protects more than a billion IoT devices. This puts Symantec among the biggest providers of IoT security today, and the first to deliver a comprehensive security reference architecture for how to build-in security to make your IoT systems “secure by design.” Symantec brings an unrivaled breadth of leading security solutions for device protection, encryption, authentication, key management, and code signing. Symantec also has unmatched depth in security expertise from monitoring, analyzing and processing more than 10 trillion security events per year worldwide for Symantec’s Global Intelligence Network. <br/><br/> Working at SurfEasy means you are a part of a company that has been experiencing steady growth, great reviews and financial success and comes with the promise that you will always have access to the latest technology, challenging projects and a role in helping organizations, governments and people protect and secure their most important data wherever it lives. <br/><br/> <strong>About the Role:</strong> <br/><br/> We’re looking for someone who has experience building, developing, and managing a team of developers, who will build and provide operational support for systems and applications that are supporting our VPN solutions. <br/><br/> This role is ideal if you have:  <ul> <li>Demonstrated success working closely with IT partner teams on multiple projects and enhancements with a focus on customer experience, at a company that managed a large cloud based network or a high-volume website</li>   <li>Software development background for a global cloud based application or a high-volume website</li> <li>Proven experience delivering world class software solutions using Agile/DevOps methods</li> <li>An understanding of software development best practices</li> <li>Are highly responsible, self-motivated and able to thrive in an energetic, fast-paced, creative environment</li> <li>A strong work ethic and the ability to work effectively independently and in a team environment</li> <li>Creative problem solving skills and an ability to apply business logic to development requirements</li> <li>Are passionate about technology, apps, online security and VPN’s (big plus!)</li> </ul> <strong>Essential Duties and Responsibilities:</strong> <br/><br/> As a development manager, you will lead a team of engineers, within an Agile development framework. You will be involved in the software development lifecycle from strategy, architecture, design, implementation, testing and release. With a focus on delivering solutions against business goals, technical requirements and Symantec engineering standards.  <ul> <li>You will work closely with the experienced backend development team to understand and define technical requirements, manage projects based on business and technical priorities and schedule work with development staff</li> <li>Effectively manage the team to achieve results by providing appropriate direction, timely developmental feedback and coaching, and conducting performance reviews and conversations</li> <li>Plans for and ensures that management and development staff have tools/skills required to perform job functions</li>   <li>Recommends new technology directions in collaboration with Development and Architecture teams</li>   <li>Constantly improves the development processes , tools and methodologies used in the development group</li>   <li>Delivers high quality features and products on time and within budget</li> <li>Have the opportunity to contribute to product enhancements and create unique IP to better our product</li> <li>Provides coaching and direction to the team that drives action and enables achievement of performance and operational goals</li> <li>Build staffing plans that ensure development teams are staffed with skill sets required to enhance existing systems as well as deliver new systems functionality required by the business and participate in interview and hiring of qualified team members</li>  </ul> ​<strong>Know</strong><strong>ledge & Experience:</strong>  <ul> <li>A Bachelor’s degree in business or technical discipline, or related area</li> <li>5+ years’ experience developing and leading large scale software development teams using Agile best practices/standards, and practicing continuous testing, integration and deployment strategies</li>   <li>3+ years’ of management experience with engineering staff including leadership, planning, and coordination of development work for large projects</li> <li>Experience or exposure to some combination of Linux, Ruby, Python, Golang, Java, Puppet, Chef, Docker or Kubernetes and backend scripting</li> <li>Deep knowledge of software development best practices with direct hands-on experience</li> <li>Deep experience managing teams of software developers, designers, and working collaboratively with product managers on solution delivery</li> <li>Proven understanding and direct experience of working within an Agile framework – including implementing and using Scrum and/or Kanban</li> <li>Major input to the planning process with specific responsibility for estimates and risks, with justification, for own work and that of the team</li> <li>Demonstrated ability to mentor technical management and technical professionals</li> <li>Ability to organize several teams and focus on best practices, particularly regarding coding standards and quality assurance</li> <li>Ability to work effectively in a fast-paced environment</li>   <li>Self-starter with a high degree of self-management and commitment to delivery timelines</li> <li>Proven interpersonal, communication and presentation skills</li> <li>Ability to clearly explain technical concepts and analysis implications to a wide audience</li> </ul> <strong>Compensation & Perks:</strong>  <ul> <li>A compensation package that includes competitive salaries, an annual incentive plan, an internal rewards program and optional participation in a Pension/Group RRSP program</li> <li>Comprehensive health and wellbeing offerings that include medical, dental and vision with no waiting period</li> <li>Flexible vacation policy that gives you the freedom to take the time you need, when you need it</li>   <li>Contribute to patentable technology development</li> <li>Work alongside an amazing team in our downtown Toronto office</li> <li>Free snacks and drinks in the office, everyday</li> <li>The opportunity to learn about the business and play a role in improving the user experience of future products as well as contributing to patentable technology development</li> </ul> <strong>How to apply:</strong> <br/> Please include your resume, cover letter with a little about yourself and your experiences and URLs of your LinkedIn, Github, Angellist, Stack Overflow, and Bitbucket profiles (where available).
Title: Dev Manager, Backend

Job_Description: Job Description      <p>Under general direction, responsible for web-based application and related systems development. Responsible for development of application modules in a team environment that meet performance, scalability, architectural, quality and business requirements. Responsible for all stages of development, application/database design, coding, testing, and related documentation.</p> <p>Key Areas of Responsibility</p> <ul> <li>Designs and develops interactive web technology in support of sales and marketing strategies for online product sales and marketing.</li> <li>This includes coding of the elegant backend and front end cloud solutions, unit testing, technical analysis, debugging and integration.</li> <li>Performs root cause analysis on system/user errors and identifies corrective action and liaises with production support to resolve issues where applicable.</li> <li>Provide thorough documentation and technical support for existing applications where necessary.</li> <li>Provide basic system administration and support in the development environment.</li> <li>Review business requirements and provide estimates</li> <li>Resolve bugs, and implement unit tests to improve quality</li> <li>Maintain Continuous Integration/Continuous Deployment for the applications and API’s</li> </ul>          Required Skills      <ul> <li>Innovation Management: Requires strong conceptualization skills.</li> <li>Priority Setting.</li> <li>Strong Organizational and Time Management skills.</li> <li>Quality Management.</li> </ul>        Required Experience      <ul> <li>Bachelor's degree in computer science or equivalent.</li> <li>4-6 years of programming experience.</li> <li>2 years experience in online development.</li> <li>Strong knowledge of Javascript, AngularJS, jQuery, Bootstrap, HTML5/CSS/LESS/SASS, C#, Microsoft ASP.NET platform, Web API, Microsoft SQL Server, Visual Studio, Internet technologies, XML, JSON, Microsoft Azure cloud solutions and technologies, as well as security techniques and web server familiarity.</li> </ul> <p>Please email your resume to jalynn.andersen@trader.ca</p>        Job Location      Burnaby, British Columbia, Canada        Position Type      Full-Time/Regular

Job_Description: <div> About HOOPP HOOPP's core values - professional, accountable, collaborative, compassionate and trustworthy - guide its every interaction with HOOPP members and employees. As one of Canada's largest and most respected multi-employer pension plans, HOOPP invests the net assets of its $77.8 billion Fund, administers the Plan and pays approximately $2.3 billion in pension benefits per year. With over 339,328 members and pensioners, and more than 548 participating employers, HOOPP's mission to deliver on the pension promise remains strong.<br/><br/>To remain one of the leading pension plans in Canada, we must continually challenge ourselves to improve our product, services and investment performance. HOOPP offers a professional environment designed to bring out the best in its employees. The organization's size and structure bring decision-making, accountability and ownership to the individual employee level. HOOPP employees are flexible and adaptable to work in cross-divisional teams in a fast-paced, rewarding environment. <br/><br/> HOOPP is an equal opportunity employer. We recruit and select applicants for employment solely on the basis of their qualifications. Should you require accommodation because of a disability during the recruitment and selection process, please contact Human Resources. Our HR team will consult with you so that arrangements can be made for reasonable accommodation.</div> <div> Summary<br/><br/>The Collateral Team is looking for a systems developer with experience building and maintaining business line web applications. The candidate is able to demonstrate working in a very collaborative agile environment. Excellent communication is a very important asset as well as the desire to learn and solve problems as a team. The developer will work with a team of mixed roles focusing on delivering high quality solutions to various business problems in the funding and liquidity asset management space.</div> <div> Duties and Responsibilities<br/><br/>· Work in a high performing agile team, collaborating with analysts, developers and clients. This involves sharing information, design brainstorming, and working on a shared codebase <br/><br/> · Participate in Agile Scrum practices such as daily standups, grooming, planning and sprint retrospectives <br/><br/> · Develop strong working relationship with business partners and other ISG teams to facilitate requirements gathering, solution design/implementation and to triage and fix production issues <br/><br/> · Continually seek opportunities to improve UI, backend code, overall system design, development practices and automated tooling <br/><br/> · Develop high quality, readable, testable and scalable code</div><div> Qualifications and Skills<br/><br/>· Diploma or degree in Computer Science with 5-10 years in software development experience. <br/><br/> · Creative and innovative problem solver. <br/><br/> · High enthusiasm with a sense of urgency to get things done. <br/><br/> · Diploma or degree in Computer Science, or equivalent work experience. <br/><br/> · Experience with JavaScript/Typescript. <br/><br/> · Experience with C#, or other object-oriented language. <br/><br/> · Experience working with React, KnockoutJS or Angular. <br/><br/> · Experience with source management and build automation such as git and TFS. <br/><br/> · Strong understanding of web technologies, server side data processing and optimization. <br/><br/> · Experience working in an agile team and demonstrable knowledge of agile roles.</div>
Title: Full Stack Systems Developer

Job_Description: <div> <div>One of our client located in the old port of Montreal is looking for a Junior Java developer for a contract ending on December 31th, 2018. <br/><br/> If you are a Java Developer seeking new exciting challenges, where you can make an impact, look no further. Our client is seeking Developers with a passion for solving complicated problems with the latest technologies. <br/><br/> In this role, you will look forward to research and use the most suitable technologies to solve our client’s current business and technical problems. If you were to join their team today,  <ul> <li>you would be part of an Agile/Kanban team, working closely with your fellow engineers and product owners to build Java and <strong>Kotlin-based applications</strong> using <strong>Spring-Boot 2</strong>, deploying them in the <strong>Amazon Cloud (AWS)</strong> using <strong>Docker containers</strong>.</li><li>You'd have to use deep learning models trained in house by data scientists.</li><li>You’d be responsible to test your code, see it through production, monitor it, and keep on improving it.</li>  </ul>  <strong>Required Skills:</strong>   <ul> <li>1 to 3 years of experience as a software developer</li> <li>Good knowledge of Java</li> <li>A strong interest in learning new technologies</li> <li>An excellent team spirit</li> <li>Interest in working on backend services</li> <li>Interest in devops culture/practices</div></li> </ul>  </div>

Job_Description: <strong>Job Description</strong> <br/> <strong>START DATES FOR THIS POSITION ARE MAY 2018 AND LATER.</strong> <br/><br/> At IBM we have an amazing opportunity to transform the world with cognitive technology. By using the vast amounts of information available today to identify new patterns and make new discoveries, we are helping cities become smarter, hospitals transform patient care, financial institutions minimize risk, and pharmaceuticals find cures for rare diseases. Join the forward-thinking teams at IBM solving some of the worlds most complex problems there is no better place to grow your career! <br/><br/> Software Developers at IBM can work in a variety of areas. As such, you might be involved in any of these specialties:  <ul> <li>Backend, Server Systems, or Cloud-Based Development Design and code servers, services, applications and databases that are reusable, scalable and meet critical architecture goals. Create Application Programming Interfaces (APIs) that are clean, well-documented, and easy to use. Create and configure Infrastructure as a Service (IaaS), Platform as a Service (PaaS) and Software as a Service (SaaS) applications. Design and implement large scale systems and Service Oriented Architectures (SOA) that enable continuous delivery.</li><li>Client-Facing Assistance and Solution Development Own the customer experience by solving complex business problems for the world's leading clients. Work directly with the customer to understand and troubleshoot issues, collect data, elicit detailed requirements, then design and implement innovative solutions across multiple industries and sectors, as well as governments and agencies.</li><li>Automation Development and Testing Enable continuous deployment and availability by designing, developing and creating automated frameworks, processes and test cases based on functional and non-functional requirements. Build and manage testing environments, assisting in debugging application issues.</li><li>Firmware Development Work with industry experts to design, develop and test fast and efficient software that directly manages and controls the hardware. Firmware may exist anywhere in a computing system from the central computing complex to management consoles, power supplies, and I/O adapters.</li><li>Front End Development Create high-quality web and mobile apps containing rich content and user interface components by working closely with user experience designers to take wireframes and mockups from conception to implementation. Identify specific issues in the user interface, recommending and implementing solutions that influence and improve the design of products that provide a delightful user experience along with high performance, security, quality, and stability.</li> <li>Full Stack Development Work across the entire system architecture, from backend to front end, to design, develop, and support high quality and scalable products. Create everything from mockups and UI components to algorithms and data structures as you deliver a complete minimally viable product.</li>  </ul>  Entry-Level Software Developers are in demand across IBM's growth areas. You'll be matched and deployed to a development team in a strategic business, based on your skills. <br/><br/> <strong>What Youll Do:</strong>  <ul> <li>Youll work in an Agile, collaborative environment to understand requirements, design, code and test innovative applications, and support those applications for our highly valued customers.</li> <li>Youll employ IBMs Design Thinking to create products that provide a great user experience along with high performance, security, quality, and stability.</li> <li>Youll work with a variety of relational databases (SQL, Postgres, DB2, MongoDB), operating systems (Linux, Windows, iOS, Android), and modern UI frameworks (Backbone.js, AngularJS, React, Ember.js, Bootstrap, Node.js, and JQuery).</li>  </ul>  <strong>Who You Are:</strong>  <ul> <li>You are highly motivated and have a passion for creating and supporting great products.</li> <li>You thrive on collaboration, working side by side with people of all backgrounds and disciplines, and you have very strong verbal and written communication skills.</li> <li>You are great at solving problems, debugging, troubleshooting, designing and implementing solutions to complex technical issues.</li><li>You have a basic understanding of software development and programming in a language such as Java, Javascript, C, C++, or Python.</li> </ul>  This role will involve working with technology that is covered by embargo Export Regulations. If you are a Foreign National from any of the following embargoed countries (Cuba, Iran, North Korea, Sudan, and Syria) on a work permit, you are not eligible for employment in this position. <br/><br/> Required Technical and Professional Expertise  <ul> <li>Must have basic knowledge in one of the following technology areas: Java, Javascript, C, C++, or Python</li> </ul>  Preferred Tech and Prof Experience  <ul> <li>Willing to travel up to 10%</li><li>Bachelors or Masters Degree</li> </ul>  EO Statement <br/> IBM is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status. IBM is also committed to compliance with all fair employment practices regarding citizenship and immigration status. <br/><br/>
Title: Entry-Level Software Developer

Job_Description: <div><div>Be part of the team that connects different technologies together into  <br/> brilliant, easy-to-use, customer-focused solutions. Our team leverages Ross  <br/> Video’s Emmy-Award-winning DashBoard user interface technology to create  <br/> customized applications that allows one or more operators to do everything from  <br/> playing video clips on a 58-foot tall wrap-around score board, to blasting water  <br/> cannons 75-feet to the sky, to sending a robotic camera zooming across the stage  <br/> of a concert.</div>  <br/> <div> </div> <br/> <strong><div>Responsibilities:</div>  <br/></strong>   <ul> <li>Participate in the full software development lifecycle – requirements  <br/> gathering, scoping, design, implementation, documentation, testing and  <br/> maintenance</li>   <li>Write code across the full stack – UI, back end services, and data storage</li>   <li>Provide design reviews and code reviews for fellow team members promoting  <br/> high-quality work, sound software methodologies and attention to detail</li>    </ul>  <div> </div> <br/> <strong><div>Basic Qualifications:</div>  <br/></strong>   <ul> <li>Backend development experience with a thorough understanding of object  <br/> oriented software design, data structures, algorithms and data storage</li>   <li>Excellent software development skills in an object-oriented language such as  <br/> Java with strong debugging skills</li>   <li>Experience with JavaScript, JSON, RESTful APIs and HTTP protocols</li>   <li>Understanding of user interface development, TCP/IP, and UDP</li>   <li>Knowledge of HTML and CSS</li> </ul></div> <br/>
Title: Software Developer - DashBoard

Job_Description: <div><div><div>Title Senior Backend Software Engineer</div> <div>Location Sandvine Waterloo</div> <div>Department Name Core R&D</div> <div>External Description <div> <div><div><strong>Want to help build a Smarter Internet?</strong></div><br/>  <div><strong>The Opportunity</strong>  <br/> In your role as a Senior Backend Software Engineer you’ll be part of a dynamic team creating the next generation web application for management, monitoring and configuration of network elements. You will contribute new ideas and provide simple yet elegant designs to complex problems with a focus on high availability and fast response times. You are someone passionate who keeps up with latest web development technologies and is ready to pick up any language or tools necessary to deliver your vision. <br/><br/> <strong>The Job</strong> </div>  <ul> <li>Work on a cross-functional team composed of Engineers (frontend, backend and full stack), a Product Manager and a UX Designer</li> <li>Own major features from requirements definition through design, coding, testing, deployment and support</li><li>Develop highly available, scalable back end services</li><li>Organize and participate in code reviews</li><li>Help other team members grow</li> </ul>  <strong><div> What skills you bring:</div>  <br/></strong>  <ul> <li>3+ years of experience designing & developing backend services</li><li>Extensive backend programming experience in Java</li><li>Experience in one or more: Go, C/C++, Python, Scala a definite asset</li><li>Good understanding of front-end technologies and platforms, such as JavaScript, HTML5, and CSS3</li><li>Proficient understanding of code versioning tools, such as Git</li><li>Solid knowledge and experience with relational databases</li><li>Fan of unit testing</li><li>Motivation and passion for reliable and scalable backend infrastructure</li><li>Knowledge of network management protocols, such as NETCONF</li><li>Strong collaboration skills</li><li>Familiar with Agile/Scrum</li><li>BSCS, BSEE, MSEE or MSCS, PhD or similar technical degree.</li> </ul>  <div> <strong>The Company</strong>  <br/> At Sandvine, we’re really smart people doing a really hard, important job. We’re building a smarter Internet. Communication service providers use our products to deploy new subscriber services, engage with subscribers and gain insight into, optimize and secure network traffic. We are a global organization over 300 customers in more than 100 different countries. <br/> Recognized as one of Canada’s Best Workplaces by Great Places to Work® Institute 10 times, our Team Members have the opportunity to innovate, take on new challenges, and make a difference in delivering products that have a real business impact to our global customers. Their ideas are heard and quickly translated into reality, helping to shape tomorrow's smarter Internet. <br/><br/> <strong>What can you expect from us</strong></div>  <ul> <li>Casual & Collaborative work environment</li> <li>Employee development - training programs, lunch and learns, and education reimbursement</li> <li>Fun Work Environment that includes team events, sports leagues, on-site gaming + complementary drinks and snacks</li> <li>International travel opportunities</li> <li>Onsite service such as hair stylist, chiropractor, massage therapist, lunch delivery and financial advisors</li>  </ul>  <div> Thank-you for your interest in Sandvine. While we’re not able to reach out to everyone who applies, we will contact you if your skills and experience are a match for the role. Otherwise, we’ll keep your resume in case there is a match with future opportunities. <br/><br/> In the meantime, if you want to learn more about life at Sandvine, follow us on Twitter (@Sandvine) and Facebook (Facebook.com/Sandvine). <br/> Sandvine is committed to supporting a culture of inclusion, diversity and accessibility to employment for all. We are proud to operate as an equal opportunity employer.</div>  <li>The Sandvine Global Talent Acquisition Team</li>  </div> </div> </div>  </div></div>
Title: Senior Backend Software Engineer

Job_Description: <div>Be part of the team that powers the core of news production whether that’s via traditional broadcasts, social media or a content management system. Our team helps engage vast online audiences and allows their social interactions to appear in a live production. <br/><br/> Responsibilities:  <ul>  	 <li>Participate in the full software development <br/> lifecycle – requirements gathering, scoping, design, implementation, <br/> documentation, testing and maintenance</li>  <li>Write code across the full stack – UI, back end <br/> services, and data storage</li>  <li>Provide design reviews and code reviews for fellow <br/> team members promoting high-quality work, sound software methodologies and <br/> attention to detail</li>  </ul> Basic qualifications:  <ul>  	 <li>Backend development experience with a thorough <br/> understanding of object-oriented software design, data structures, algorithms <br/> and data storage</li>  <li>Excellent software development skills in an object-oriented <br/> language such as Java with strong debugging skills</li>  <li>Experience with JavaScript, JSON, RESTful APIs and <br/> HTTP protocols</li>  <li>Understanding of user interface development, TCP/IP, <br/> and UDP</li>  <li>Knowledge of HTML and CSS</li>  </ul> Preferred qualifications:  <ul>  	 <li>Experience with any of the following Java <br/> frameworks and technologies:  <ul>    <li>Hibernate ORM, Equinox OSGi, Struts II</li>  </ul>   </li> <li>Front end development with any of the following <br/> libraries and frameworks:  <ul>    <li>jQuery, React</li>  </ul>   </li> </ul> <strong>WE'RE GROWING FAST</strong> <br/><br/> That means we are always looking for better ways to adapt our work environment and processes to meet the high demands of our customers. Our roles morph, we volunteer for extra tasks, we all care a lot about helping good things happen. If you don't like change, you’re in the wrong place. But if you do, then you can be part of an incredible journey. <br/>   <br/><br/> <strong>WHY WORK FOR ROSS VIDEO?</strong> <br/>   <br/><br/> Because we can help you flourish. You will get to develop and deliver cutting edge technological solutions for the entertainment industry. You will be part of the Ross Video team working together to make that happen, and we find that a pretty energizing environment to be a part of. <br/><br/> We value our people and listen to their feedback. We also offer great perks, flexible hours, free coffee and soft drinks (and a commercial espresso machine for when you need that extra jolt), team building events, BBQ's, and other fun activities. You'll also get to work on real-world projects that have a meaningful impact to our customers and are in use all over the world, every day. <br/><br/> <strong> <br/> <strong>LOCATION</strong> <br/>   <br/><br/> Ottawa, Canada. It's the Nation’s Capital with the longest skating rink (the Rideau Canal) in the winter, waterways in the summer, and hills for skiing and hiking 30 minutes from the office. Ottawa posts vibrant urban neighbourhoods, as well as numerous recreational possibilities.</div> <br/>
Title: Software Developer, Inception

Job_Description: <P>As a Development Engineer for the Crypto Command Center team, you will conduct product research leading to new or improved products. You will create or enhance software products based on specifications developed in conjunction with subject matter experts within Gemalto .You will be involved in the entire software development lifecycle and will be expected to deliver your assignments with minimal supervision.</P> <P> </P> <P><B>A week in the life of a Development Engineer:</B></P> <P>· You will design, code/debug and test new/existing software modules. </P> <P>· You will contribute towards development of new approaches and techniques and perform code reviews for the team.</P> <P>· You will participate in the development of larger modules which may also include requirements analysis, adhering to secure coding practices and detailing design aspects under the direction of experienced engineers. </P> <P>· You will use source control tools and related processes/procedures and build mechanisms.</P> <BR> <DIV><B>Knowledge, Skills and Experience:</B></DIV> <UL> <LI> <DIV><B>To do this job, you must be</B> proficient in fundamentals of computer science, software engineering, operating systems and networking fundamentals, and must have knowledge of SDLC. You must have JavaScript, AngularJS and CSS experience.</DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV><B>It would be preferred if you have</B> backend Java/JEE and Linux experience.</DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV><B>You must be</B> fluent in English.</DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV> <B>We would like someone</B> to join our team who is goal oriented, focused and a dedicated individual, also has a good learning agility, with excellent analytical, and communication skills. </DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV><B>You need to have</B> a BE/B. Tech/ M. Tech/MCA of equivalent degree.</DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV><B>We are looking for someone with</B> 2-5 years of experience in software development using relevant skills.</DIV></LI></UL> <DIV> </DIV>

Job_Description: <strong>Flexitive Design Cloud</strong> is the worlds leading AI driven visual communications platform. Flexitive is used by global brands, agencies and publishers to improve the quality of their visual communications and streamline workflow production. <br/><br/> As part of the Core Platform team you will be instrumental in driving forward new features and solving issues as we scale. Being a big part of a small team, you will have the opportunity to experiment with new technologies and contribute to the overall technical direction of the company. <br/><br/> <strong>Impact:</strong> <ul> <li>Writing front-end and/or back-end code in Javascript, possibly Python, that will improve our code base in meaningful ways</li><li>Sharing knowledge and experience with other team members and provide mentorship to more junior engineers</li><li>Continue to develop and advance our automated testing infrastructure</li><li>Learning and growing constantly to feed your passion for self-improvement</li> </ul> <strong>What You Need to Succeed:</strong> <ul> <li>4+ years of relevant work experience in a backend or full stack role</li><li>Solid knowledge of databases and modelling; relational or otherwise</li><li>Strong understanding of REST, and experience with API design</li><li>Desire to work in a fast-paced, startup environment</li><li>A bachelors degree in Computer Science, or related field</li><li>Experience with Node.js, Angular.js, React or similar frameworks</li><li>Experience writing unit, integration or e2e tests</li> </ul> <strong>Why Flexitive?</strong> <br/><br/> You want to be part of a fast growing, passionate team. We offer all employees competitive compensation (including salary, bonus and stock options in the company) and invest in your personal growth and success. <ul> <li>Employee stock option plan</li><li>Medical and dental benefits</li><li>Bi-monthly hackdays, work on passion projects or make something cool in our VR Room</li><li>Our Toronto office is located right downtown next to College subway!</li><li>Flexible hours and relaxed dress code</li><li>Monthly game nights and quarterly team building events</li><li>Jax, our golden retriever loves hugs</li><li>Unlimited snacks!</li> </ul> <strong>We are looking for the best in your field - tell us why you are</strong> <strong>the one!</strong>

This is a chance to join an established, industry leading company with leaders are some of the most successful in tech.</div>   <br/><strong><div>Company Overview:</div>  <br/></strong>  <li>Established, industry leading Cloud/SaaS company in the B2B space.</li> <li>Toronto-based product development team for a large tech company.
