Job_Description: About Mazu <br/><br/> Mazu is a youth engagement company helping professional sports teams across the major leagues as well as other large brands communicate with their younger audience. Through the use of our B2B and B2C products Mazu’s mission is to reconnect brands and families. We take a value based approach in delivering innovative and engaging content and solutions. <br/><br/> The staff at Mazu enjoy a fun, open and energetic atmosphere. Most of our team is located in Kelowna, BC with a sprinkling of remote workers throughout North America. Our clients are some of the most interesting brands and are eager to try new innovative solutions. <br/><br/> You will work on the full stack, front end to backend to create dynamically driven mobile applications. You will work with the latest mobile technologies like Ionic, Cordova, IOS, Android and Progressive Web Applications. Responsibilities will include (but are not limited to): requirements, systems analysis, code creation, unit testing, feature planning and technical documentation. Code must be designed per responsive mobile design techniques to run across a wide range of devices. <br/><br/> Requirements  <ul>  <li>2+ years hands-on experience building highly scalable, secure, robust mobile applications.</li>    <li>Extensive experience with JavaScript.</li>    <li>Familiar with mobile cross platform development tools like Cordova / Ionic</li>    <li>Wide experience in the handling and writing of APIs and JSON data structures</li>    <li>Proven experience in backend systems design</li>    <li>Must be able to take initiative, work independently and be innovative</li>    <li>Demonstrated ability to meet project timelines and collaborate in a small team.</li>    </ul> <br/><br/> Desired Skills  <ul>  <li>Worked mobile applications</li>    <li>Experience working with database design and administration.</li>    <li>Experience working with Linux environments.</li>    <li>Basic knowledge of Progressive Web Apps</li>    <li>Experience working with HTML, CSS, XML, JQuery and MVC Frameworks</li>    <li>Familiar with Agile Methodologies (SCRUM)</li>    <li>Solid understanding of the full mobile development life cycle</li>    <li>Experience in testing and debugging</li>    <li>Experience working with tools like Git, JIRA and Confluence.</li>    </ul> <br/><br/> What You Will Be Doing  <ul>  <li>Design and develop world-class applications based on requirements generated by the, business stakeholders as well as technology department staff</li>    <li>Integrate newly developed apps with existing software.</li>    </ul> Location: Kelowna, British Columbia (must be willing to relocate and must be eligible to work in Canada) <br/><br/> Department: Development <br/><br/> Employment Type: Full Time <br/><br/> Minimum Experience: Mid-level
Title: Software Developer

Job_Description: Embrace and Lead<br/><br/>You have spent countless hours over the years learning to solve hard problems in mathematics, data structures, statistics with a variety of software languages. Your passion for problem solving led you to a career in computer science and engineering. As a self-taught hobbyist you have gathered experience in your field and you are anxious to follow your passion as a profession. At ZetaTango we encourage everyone to trust themselves, stop holding back and use your acquired knowledge to influence your future. <br/><br/> Everyone in the team is an integral contributor to our products, working with our customers to collaborate and design the best solutions. Our open work culture provides the opportunity for you to contribute to all aspects of our business: customer engagement, product ownership, software, QA, devops and 24/7 cloud service deployment. <br/><br/> As a key member of our development team your passion to learn will help us design, develop and deploy our integrated cloud services that help small businesses succeed:  <ul>  <li>Participate in the full product lifecycle</li>    <li>Develop secure code for APIs, frontend, backend, web, mobile, partner integration</li>    <li>Learn and adapt new technologies to real problems</li>    <li>Application of machine learning and analytics to online financial services</li>    </ul> <br/><br/>What You Bring   <ul>  <li>Passion for solving hard problems</li>    <li>Algorithms, data structures, statistics, computational mathematics</li>    <li>Ruby on Rails or other web application frameworks</li>    <li>Relational databases such as PostgresQL, MySQL</li>    <li>Proficiency with Linux command-line</li>    <li>Working autonomously and being highly resourceful</li>    <li>BSC, MSC or PHD in computer science or engineering</li>    </ul> <br/><br/>Other Valued Skills & Knowledge   <ul>  <li>Git or other version control systems</li>    <li>Security & Cryptography</li>    <li>Machine Learning and Artificial Intelligence</li>    </ul> <br/><br/> <strong>What You Can Expect From Us</strong> <br/><br/> At ZetaTango we hire for fit. Fit with our values of openness, agility and respect. Fit with the knowledge and skills needed to excel both individually and as part of a larger team so that we can continue to serve our customers. Fit with an insatiable need to improve, learn and discover. What you’ll get in return is the opportunity to work with others who are top in the industry and who possess an incredible amount of knowledge and enthusiasm for building a world class company. <br/><br/> If you are looking for a challenging career and the opportunity to be part of a successful and high growth company, ZetaTango is the ideal place for you. <br/><br/> <em><strong>We want our candidates and our employees to be set up for success. During every part of the recruiting process you will have the opportunity to get in touch with our People & Culture team with any questions, concerns or requests for accommodations.</strong></em>
Title: New Grad Developer

Job_Description: We are seeking intermediate level front-end web developers to work with us. If you love JavaScript, have experiences to share, are passionate about all things JS related and want to learn from us, we’d love to chat. Submit a CV and fill out the application form on our site. <br/><br/> As a Front-end Developer, you’ll work directly with a group of passionate co-workers engaged in distilling objectives industry leading clients have engaged us in. We are here to listen, absorb, tinker, discover and build on these objectives, shape project direction and craft applications to surprise and delight. <br/><br/> Located in the Mount Pleasant area of Vancouver, as part of the POWERSHiFTER team you will have access to some of the brightest minds in design, technology, strategy and data science. You will work in an environment that values people, process and performance, collaborating with team members in both Vancouver and Toronto.<br/><br/>Your mission<br/><br/>We believe that when you put people at the centre of digital experiences, you achieve better outcomes. You champion this through your passion of writing secure and responsive interfaces in an environment that values rapid delivery and highly maintainable code. You eagerly collaborate with your team members, no matter the project or department. Cool, calm and collected, your passion for technology is at the core of everything you do. If you appreciate great design thinking in addition to development, you’ll find a home here.<br/><br/>Responsibilities   <ul> <li>Contribute to project planning, as requested, providing estimates, risk assessments, and diagramming solutions</li>  <li>Contribute to technical design sessions, providing a rounded Front-end perspective.</li>  <li>Contributing to POWERSHiFTER community engagement and thought leadership through blog and article writing, as requested</li>  <li>Mentoring junior team members, providing thoughtful feedback and direction, as appropriate</li>  <li>Knowledge-sharing with peers in workshop and day-to-day settings</li>  <li>Participate in technical brainstorms sessions and client meetings</li>  <li>Deliver high-quality, maintainable, performant and human-readable code/markup using (not not limited to); HTML, Vanilla JavaScript/ES6, SASS, SCSS, CSS</li>  <li>Style interfaces using component-based CSS, implementing accepted approaches, as per agreed design</li>  <li>Optimize delivery of web-based applications and experience using code-splitting, compression, and modular design, as per best practices</li>  <li>Ensure delivered code and applications are search-engine optimized and accessible, as per best practices</li>  <li>Ensure delivered interfaces and applications are responsive, rendering as designed across required devices and browsers utilizing principles of progress enhancement and/or graceful degradation, as per agreed-to design</li>  <li>Establish and maintain front-end workflows using Gulp or Grunt</li>  <li>Deliver interfaces and single-page applications using appropriate, accepted design paradigms including (but not limited to) MVC / MVVM / MV*</li>  <li>Deliver interfaces and single-page applications using appropriate, current, and accepted frameworks including (but not limited to) React, Vue.js, or Angular2</li>  <li>Integrate to back-end systems, APIs, and CMS, as needed, as per agreed-to designs</li>  <li>Implement unit testing and integrate into continuous integration tools as needed and directed</li>  <li>Version work appropriately using git, as directed, with thoughtful and thorough commit messages</li>  <li>Seek peer review on work before submitting to testing</li>  <li>Test all work on local environments prior to seeking peer review via pull-requests</li>  <li>Reviewing pull-requests as needed</li>  <li>Submitting all work for testing by QA prior to deployment</li>  <li>Fixing code and other issues in QA and regression tests</li>  <li>Work under pressure and deliver on-time.</li>  <li>Have fun!</li> </ul>  Requirements   <ul> <li>Minimum experience requirements: 1-2 years</li>  <li>Preferably a Computer Science degree or relevant school & experience</li>  <li>Exceptional analytical and troubleshooting skills</li>  <li>Keen attention to details</li>  <li>Demonstrated ability to be proactive when dealing with issues and challenges</li>  <li>Experience in one of the following Middleware platforms: PHP, Ruby, Python</li>  <li>Expertise in PHP, Vanilla JavaScript/ES6 (Node), and at least one other language and related frameworks (Ruby/Rails, Python/Flask, #C/.Net, Java/Spring)</li>  <li>We like ES5 a lot. We love ES6 even more. You should too</li>  <li>Understand development workflows with task builders like gulp/webpack</li>  <li>Expert in HTML Semantics</li>  <li>Can work with templating on various middleware and backend frameworks</li>  <li>Expert level understanding of CSS</li>  <li>You have a strong understanding of how APIs and REST works</li>  <li>Demonstrate a solid understanding of wireframes and how they work to describe the plans for building great internet.</li>  <li>Understanding tools such as Sketch, Photoshop, Invision (nice to have)</li>  <li>Can talk to Progressive Enhancement / Graceful Degradation</li>  <li>Can show experience Responsive Web Design and mobile first thinking.</li>  <li>A good understanding on SEO</li>  <li>A good understanding of databases and how sql works</li>  <li>Understand a QA workflow</li>  <li>Minimum education requirements: Computer Science degree or equivalent experience</li>  <li>No jerks</li> </ul>  Benefits   <ul> <li>This is a full time, permanent position</li>  <li>Medical and dental benefits</li>  <li>An exciting, yet highly collaborative work environment with amazing peers</li>  <li>Flexible work/life balance</li>  <li>Extended long weekends during the summer</li>  <li>Paid December holiday office closure</li> </ul>
Title: Intermediate Front-End Developer

Job_Description: Backend Software Developer, Asset Management System – Automation Team  <br/> <br/>  Category: Research & Development<br/><br/>Are you ready to join a team of tech-savvy music lovers and watch your career take off in an exciting, fast-paced, and innovative work environment? <br/><br/> If you are a smart, curious and multi-talented developer who wants to create robust and exceptional systems, we want to hear from you! <br/><br/> Our development team is currently looking for a <strong>S</strong><strong>oftware Developer</strong> to work in a micro-services ecosystem that supports our multimedia data platform (Dispatching, transformation, transcoding and management). You will join the Stingray Asset Management – Automation development team. You will join an active development team working on a platform that has a quick deployment cycle and that encourages creativity. <br/><br/> <strong>What You’ll Do</strong> <ul> <li>Participate actively in the elaboration and design of the operational systems;</li> <li>Design and implement software functionalities related to our asset management system and other internal products developed at Stingray;</li> <li>Participate in the evolution and maintain the systems managed by the team;</li> <li>Investigate issues reported by users;</li> <li>Investigate operational issues related to performance and/or evolution of the system;</li> <li>Work closely with (internal) users, project managers and other departments.</li> </ul> <strong>Who You are</strong> <ul> <li>Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or a related field;</li> <li>Great knowledge in object-oriented software development;</li> <li>Minimum of 3-5 years of experience in a related field;</li> <li>Great programming skills in Java (or related language);</li> <li>Nice to have: Knowledge of Amazon AWS (EC2, S3) environments;</li> <li>Nice to have: Knowledge of REST architectural style and HTTP layer;</li> <li>Nice to have: Knowledge of Windows and Linux environments;</li> <li>Nice to have: Be able to design distributed, asynchronous and parallel systems;</li> <li>Nice to haves: Experience in Micro-services development.</li> </ul> <strong>What You’re Good At</strong> <ul> <li>Strong analytical and problem-solving skills;</li> <li>Initiative and ability to learn fast;</li> <li>Thorough and responsible for his actions;</li> <li>Excellent written and oral communication skills in English and French.</li> </ul> If you are looking for an exceptional workplace and have what it takes to fill this role, please send us your resume at jobsdev@stingray.com <br/><br/> Not the job for you? Check out our Careers page to consult other available positions and learn more about Stingray. We’re always on the lookout for new talent.
Title: Backend Software Developer, Asset Management System – Automation Team

Job_Description: <strong>Flexitive Design Cloud</strong> is the worlds leading AI driven visual communications platform. Flexitive is used by global brands, agencies and publishers to improve the quality of their visual communications and streamline workflow production. <br/><br/> As a Senior Developer/Team Lead, you will be directly responsible for managing the output, code quality and happiness for a team of 5-10 developers. You will be coordinating releases, and ensuring that the team is on track to deliver their sprint objectives. <br/><br/> <strong>Impact:</strong> <ul> <li>Providing technical guidance and leadership for your team</li><li>Writing code in Javascript, possibly Python, that will improve our code base in meaningful ways</li><li>Sharing your knowledge and experience with the team members and providing mentorship through code reviews and lunch and learns</li><li>Acting as the bridge between your team and the product team, to provide estimates and develop realistic deadlines</li><li>Championing code quality, unit tests, and agile best-practices</li> </ul> <strong>What You Need to Succeed:</strong> <ul> <li>Solid understanding of the Agile processes and servant leadership.</li><li>A proven ability to lead and scale a software team.</li><li>5+ years of relevant work experience in a backend or full stack developer role.</li><li>Solid ability in designing scalable web application features and systems.</li><li>Desire to work in a fast-paced, startup environment</li><li>A bachelors degree in Computer Science, or related field.</li><li>Experience with Node.js, Angular.js, React or similar javascript frameworks.</li> </ul> <strong>Why Flexitive?</strong> <br/><br/> You want to be part of a fast growing, passionate team. We offer all employees competitive compensation (including salary, bonus and stock options in the company) and invest in your personal growth and success. <ul> <li>Employee stock option plan</li><li>Medical and dental benefits</li><li>Bi-monthly hackdays, work on passion projects or make something cool in our VR Room</li><li>Our Toronto office is located right downtown next to College subway!</li><li>Flexible hours and relaxed dress code</li><li>Monthly game nights and quarterly team building events</li><li>Jax, our golden retriever loves hugs</li><li>Unlimited snacks!</li> </ul> <br/><br/> <strong>We are looking for the best in the business - tell us why you are</strong> <strong>the one.</strong>
Title: Senior Developer/Team Lead

Job_Description: <div>We’re seeking an in-house Web Developer to join our team on a full-time basis. We are looking for people who look at the world differently and can create innovative technology for our internal and external customers. You will have direct interaction with all levels of the company, including members of our executive team. <br/><br/> <strong>What You’ll Be Doing:</strong>   <ul> <li>Collaborate with designers, developers, and marketers in an open, creative environment</li> <li>Making the UX / UIsimpler, more elegant, and more usable</li> <li>Adding new features, improvements, and even developing new ideas</li> <li>Invent novel solutions to challenging problems</li> <li>Update our National and factory store websites using WordPress</li> </ul>  <strong>Requirements:</strong>   <ul> <li>Strong command of HTML5, CSS3, JavaScript (LESS, SASS, jQuery, PHP and Ruby a plus) and cross-browser development</li> <li>Strong understanding of frontend and backend development</li> <li>Experience hacking existing frameworks</div></li> </ul>  <div>• Experience managing, monitoring, and optimizing AWS instances for peak performance.   <ul> <li>Experience developing for Salesforce (Apex/Visualforce/Lightning Components) a huge plus.</div></li> </ul>  <div>• Experience developing with 3rd party APIs   <ul> <li>WordPress and experience with other open source CMS</li> <li>Adobe Creative Suite experience a huge plus</li> <li>Experience building mobile first responsive websites</li> <li>Detail and visually oriented and precise in code and communication</li> <li>Are a pragmatic problem solver</li> <li>Work well in small teams with a clear mission</div></li> </ul>  <strong><div> Salary:</strong> <br/> $55,000 to $65,000 depending on skills and experience</div>
Title: Web Developer

Job_Description: <strong>ABOUT US</strong> <br/><br/> Ratehub is Canadas leading financial product comparison platform. We build modern web applications and services for the Canadian personal finance market. We have big plans for the future with many interesting engineering challenges ahead and we're looking for an ambitious engineer to join us. You will work closely with our senior engineers, product owners, designers and the other members of our team to extend our existing user experiences and platform services, and create brand new ones. It's an exciting start-up environment with many opportunities to learn and grow in your career while working on something that millions of Canadian consumers use. <br/><br/> At Ratehub we believe in financial transparency, product innovation, entrepreneurship and community. Helping Canadians save money by empowering them with the tools to make smart financial decisions is what drives our work each day. <br/><br/> <strong>CULTURE FIT</strong>  <ul> <li>Passionate: You inspire others with your thirst for excellence</li> <li>Resourceful: You dont have all the answers, but you know how to get them</li> <li>Meticulous: Youre borderline obsessive about quality of work and ensuring users get the best possible experience</li> </ul> <strong>RESPONSIBILITIES</strong>  <ul> <li>Maintain/Improve Ratehub backend code</li> <li>Write Unit/Functional tests for existing code</li> <li>Upgrade/Decouple backend components</li> <li>Maintain Front-end components</li> </ul> <strong> DESIRED SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE</strong>  <ul> <li>PHP:This is our main language for Ratehub.ca.</li> <li>Linux: Our development office is a Linux office. Some proficiency would be nice, but can be learned</li> <li>SQL: This is how we retrieve all of our data, the new hire will need to create and alter queries to maintain code as well as develop in their local environment</li> <li>HTML templating languages and front-end frameworks: this is how we build our front-end</li> <li>Agile/SOLID design principles: These are the principles of good software development and will be used to ensure that code developed by this hire is flexible and maintainable.</li> </ul>
Title: Back End Developer

Job_Description: <strong>About ThinkData</strong> <br/><br/> ThinkData helps organisations turn any data into fuel for their business. With the most diverse catalogue of data in the world, ThinkData pulls public data from everywhere. We are an emerging force in enterprise data management and we hold a unique space above our competitors. <br/><br/> Companies of all sizes are only just beginning to tap into the potential of available data. With internal data being made more accessible through the adoption of proper warehousing, and new streams of external data published daily, the world of data management has never been more dynamic and cumbersome but there has also never been more opportunity. <br/><br/> Our mission at ThinkData is to significantly increase the amount of data accessible within an organization. We are creating a standard way to access the disparate world of data and organizations are relying on our platform to power their decision science. <br/><br/> <strong>We need a Polyglot Developer to join our team</strong>. Someone with expertise in Java, Go or Ruby. A Polyglot Developer who wants to focus on scaling our big data processing pipeline to further increase the load it can take. Just one of six projects we have on the go, another being our transformation engine, this is a challenging environment where we are changing the way organisations think about data. <br/><br/> At ThinkData, we dont want to put you in a box before you get here. We are looking for people who are passionate about programming and who love learning and using new tools and languages. If you are a highly skilled developer, we will capitalize on your strengths. <br/><br/> <strong>Whats in it for you?</strong>  <ul> <li><strong>The chance to make an impact</strong>. You will be empowered to make decisions and make a difference as a driving force on the team.</li> <li><strong>Access to new tech</strong>. At ThinkData we dont shy away from bleeding edge tech. We encourage you to experiment, test and push the boundaries through research and development.</li> <li><strong>New builds</strong>. You will utilize open source tech to build new, unique product features, addressing change requests and incorporating user feedback into the product roadmap.</li> <li><strong>A clean slate</strong>. We have new ideas to develop and we are open to new concepts. This is a chance to develop products and APIs on a virtual blank page and introduce your own ideas for future products.</li> <li><strong>A dynamic environment</strong>. We are a startup that works with enterprise companies. That means complex challenges that are continuously changing. Its projects that quickly evolve as we respond to the demands of the environment and innovate to solve problems that might not even exist yet.</li> </ul> <strong>So, how do we know thats you? You can:</strong>  <ul> <li><strong>Push us to the next level.</strong> With three years hands-on experience developing enterprise apps and exposure to data analytics products, you bring expertise in Java, Go or Ruby (on and off Rails). Your backend expertise is well rounded to include other open source tech such as MongoDB, elasticsearch and PostgreSQL. You can work across our full stack, pick up new tech easily and build out features for our platform. Familiarity with Docker, RabbitMQ, Angular and React is an asset.</li> <li><strong>Innovate solutions to complex problems</strong>. Communication and decisiveness are key as is the ability to weigh the opinions of others. You can confidently make software design decisions.</li> <li><strong>Collaborate</strong>. You can mentor the team, work autonomously and as a contributing team member.</li> <li><strong>Evolve with us.</strong> The landscape is being built under our feet as we move forward, so we need people who can channel their passion, learn quickly and navigate the unknown at top speed.</li> <li><strong>Rock climb or rock out</strong>. With a Joe Rockheads across the street, most of our engineering team has a love for solving the puzzle of getting up the walls efficiently. There are also a shocking number of musicians floating around. Were guessing its a precision art-perfectionist thing.</li> </ul> <strong>Need more reasons to join?</strong> <br/><br/> We may be technologically driven, but like any good Canadian we know the best ideas are thought of up north in a cottage. We currently take two 3-day retreats for mission setting, aligning with our goals, product management and team building. We usually do a spring and fall one up at a cottage. Were not saying this involves a beer keg, guitars and campfires. But were not saying it doesnt. <br/><br/> We are managing our growth. We continue to promote and nurture the open, collaborative nature of who we are and how we work. And we dont just support each other in the office. The number of musicians in-house is pretty overwhelming, from big band trumpeters to death metal guitarists. Theres always a co-worker with a gig coming up and we go out to cheer them on. <br/><br/> If being a pioneer in the world of data and solving real-world problems sounds like a future you want to be part of, express your interest here or follow us on Twitter or LinkedIn to learn more about us. <br/><br/> ThinkData Works welcomes and encourages applications from people with disabilities. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process
Title: Polyglot Developer

Job_Description: Hey! We’re Radical I/O Technology, a software development lab & consultancy that loves to mix interesting tech with doing good in the world. We attract clients and employees who share many of our same values of integrity, honesty, approachability, quality, community, and collaboration. <br/><br/> We're on the lookout for <strong>1-2 senior and/or intermediate backend, API & integration developers</strong> for a 4-6 month full time contract, potentially starting some time in May 2018. This is a great opportunity to use this time to see if we all work well together. <br/><br/> <em>Even if we are don't call you in for an interview right away, we often have projects start fairly quickly with new clients, so we will always look through our applicant database first. We'd also love to keep a small roster of people we trust and who we can easily reach out to during these times.</em> <br/><br/> <strong>Requirements</strong> <br/><br/> To become a backend developer with Radical I/O, we'd love to see your experience in: <ul>  <li>backend and middleware app development using NodeJS or Java <em>(depending on our clients' needs, you might switch between projects that require JavaScript vs Java skills)</em></li>  <li>RESTful API design & development</li> <li>data integrations between various legacy on-premise systems, SAAS apps, and APIs</li> <li>NodeJS frameworks such as Hapi, Express</li> <li>Java: J2EE/J2SE and Spring frameworks; messaging and JMS; JDBC, JPA/Hibernate, ORM; knowledge of design patterns, and Dependency Injection vs. Inversion of Control concepts.</li> <li>NoSQL databases, like MongoDB</li>  <li>relational databases, like MySQL/MariaDB, Oracle, MS SQL Server</li> <li>Docker containerization and deployment</li> <li>AWS cloud services</li> <li>having Git repos as your version control of choice</li> <li>using build tools such as Ant, Maven, or Gradle, and working with continuous integration tools and processes</li> </ul> Bonus/nice to have's (but not required): <ul>  <li>ESB integration platform experience, like TIBCO and others</li> <li>Identity management platform experience, like ForgeRock and others</li> <li>using popular frontend JavaScript frameworks like React, Angular, etc</li> </ul> We also look for people who: <ul>  <li>write clean code, have written unit tests, and who adhere to effective software design principles</li> <li>have worked within agile processes like Scrum or Kanban, and used tools like JIRA or similar</li> <li>are comfortable working professionally with clients in varying industries</li> <li>are continuously learning</li> <li>communicate and collaborate well and often</li> <li>want to build community and/or make a difference in the world <em>(be sure to include more info about this in the summary section or your cover letter)</em></li>  </ul> THE OTHER STUFF <br/><br/> Local Vancouver, BC applicants are preferred, particularly those who can work in our office at least 50% of the time. <br/><br/> We are actively working towards changing the gender imbalance in the tech industry (see our work with App Camp For Girls), and we highly encourage devs whose identities are under-represented in this field to apply. If you don’t match 100% of the job requirements, but are passionate about what you do and eager to learn, we want to hear from you. <br/><br/> Please only apply if you are authorized to work full-time in Canada for any employer. We welcome applicants on working holiday visas and post-graduate work permits. <br/><br/> <strong>Benefits</strong> <br/><br/> We offer a flexible and inclusive space to work where we welcome your unique self, including: <ul>  <li>Inviting office in downtown Vancouver at Beatty and Robson, close to all skytrain lines, shopping, restaurants, the seawall, and entertainment.</li> <li>Encouraging participation in professional events, meetups, conferences, and giving back to the community.</li> <li>Regular team social events and meals, including unlimited daily drinks and snacks.</li> <li>Excellent time off policy and flexibility.</li> </ul> Whether you're very experienced or new to the field, we look beyond cookie-cutter requirements and instead focus on your potential. We hire skilled teammates who are hungry to learn and grow, and who really care about the quality of work they produce. We want you to be proud of working on our team, and we want to feel privileged to know you.
Title: Backend, API & integration developers (JavaScript & Java)

Job_Description: <strong>#WhyVenngo?</strong> At Venngo, we drive the well-being of employees and members at some of the worlds most respected organizations by providing exciting health and happiness perks. Simply put, the teams at Venngo spend their days thinking of ways to make people happy, save money with discounts and bring a smile to someones face. As the leader in group discounts and employee perks in the Canadian market, were on an accelerated growth path. Right now, we are looking to add a new<strong> PHP Developer</strong> to our team to support the internal applications for our company. This is a chance to join a rapidly growing, fast-paced company, learn new technologies and gain marketable skills. <br/><br/> <strong>The opportunity</strong> <br/><br/> The PHP Developer is responsible for the functional and technical analysis, design, programming, testing and maintenance of the company's web-based software products and internally developed support systems. Our new PHP Developer will be part of a highly skilled tight-knit team of three, focused on the implementation of new product initiatives. You will work closely with the Team Lead and a Developer to modify and maintain existing applications. <br/><br/> On a day-to-day basis, the PHP Developer and the team lead will work together to resolve the issues identified on support tasks and assigned by the VP Information Technology. You will maintain open lines of communication to closely follow-up on issues and to ensure a transparent and efficient resolution. You will own the technical aspects of your deliverables and keep a close eye on estimates, status, productivity and code quality. <br/><br/> Venngo is undergoing an exciting growth period and as a smaller company, there is a lot of innovative work to be done. With this expansion, we are moving people and giving them more responsibility. Joining now is an opportunity to increase your visibility and have your strengths recognized and applied to new and varied projects. <br/><br/> <strong>Whats in it for you?</strong>  <ul> <li>An incredible learning opportunity and the chance to grow. This is a chance to learn new technologies, expand your troubleshooting skills and gain exposure working on the application platform.</li> <li>An unequivocal level of job satisfaction. We make people happy. Ultimately, we help organizations increase employee engagement and boost morale. With over 300 health and wellness discounts, our clients can trust that they will have happier employees with less absenteeism.</li> <li>An open door. From individual career counselling to weekly company lunches Venngo has a transparent culture where we fully support the career development of our people. After 18 years in existence, we know a thing or two about making our own team happy.</li> </ul> <strong>Heres what you bring:</strong>  <ul> <li><strong>Experience and knowledge.</strong> You have a minimum of 2-3 years in LAMP development and a proven track record of programming dynamic web applications that utilize a backend database for persistent data storage. You have hands-on experience designing, coding and unit testing web applications for desktops and mobile devices including:   <ul> <li>Knowledge of modern programming and scripting languages utilized in web environments including PHP7, MySQL, JavaScript/AJAX and HTML4/5 and the Laravel framework.</li> <li>Understanding of web-related protocols such as HTTP, SSL/SSH, FTP and TCP.</li> <li>Exposure to database technologies such as SQL.</li> <li>Experience developing mobile web-based applications for Apple iOS and Android.</li> </ul>  </li> <li><strong>Communication and translation.</strong> You will be working closely with internal and external clients to resolve technical issues. Your written and verbal communication skills - including the ability to listen and reflect back - need to be impressive.</li> <li><strong>Motivation, drive and passion.</strong> You love the idea of coming into the office and actively solving problems. You have a thirst for technical knowledge and a desire to contribute however you can.</li> </ul> <strong>Who we are</strong> <br/><br/> Simply put, the team at Venngo spends their days thinking of ways to make people happy, save money with discounts and bring a smile to someones face. <br/><br/> We believe strongly in the value of what we are doing and our capacity to make work better for everyone. And that starts internally. From access to our own amazing perks to professional development to a genuine respect for ideas from every single person here. We ensure that everyones accomplishments are acknowledged out loud on a regular basis and we prioritize helping our own people grow their careers. <br/><br/> <strong>Join us.</strong> <br/><br/> At Venngo we know that not everyone takes the same path when it comes to building their skills. If you feel you meet all or most of the qualifications we are seeking; and you are excited by the possibility of growing our company, take a chance and express your interest here. To learn more about how we are, follow us on Twitter, Facebook and LinkedIn. <br/><br/> Venngo welcomes and encourages applications from people with disabilities. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process.
Title: PHP Developer

Job_Description: Position: Senior .NET Developer (2 positions)<br/><br/>About BioConnect <br/><br/> BioConnect is a rapidly-growing biometric technology and software company. We have set out on a mission to change the way society verifies identity. We believe that people want to use their true, biometric identity to verify who they are instead of relying on approximations of identity like keys, fobs, passwords and PINs that can be lost, forgotten or stolen. <br/><br/> BioConnect has an incredibly unique vision and way of doings things, much like our team members. Our team is forward thinking, self-fuelled, relentlessly passionate and centered around unbeatable customer service. Our modern, open-concept office in the heart of Liberty Village, Toronto, is filled with energy, passion, and… dare we say it? Fun. <br/><br/> What you’ll do:  <ul> <li>Design and develop back-end components and services in C#</li>  <li>Take ownership of key components and provide feedback during Sprints</li>  <li>Be deeply involved in the defining of requirements, specifications, and the design of the product from a technical point of view</li>  <li>Manage deliverable timelines and expectations to ensure timely delivery of releases and functions/features</li>  <li>Collaborate with other like-minded high performers within an Agile environment</li> </ul> Key Responsibilities/Requirements:  <ul> <li>Understanding of .NET development, from Framework 3.0 to .NET Core 2.0</li>  <li>Knowledge of C#, SQL, WCF and other backend items</li>  <li>Understanding of best practices for Agile development</li>  <li>3+ years in a multi-faceted .NET development team</li>  <li>Strong background in unit testing</li>  <li>Excellent oral and written communications skills</li> </ul> <strong>So, do you think you have what it takes to join this fast-growing team?</strong> <br/><br/> Please contact us at careers@bioconnect.com to apply for this position or visit www.bioconnect.com/careers to apply online. We appreciate all expressed interest in this position, however, only the candidates selected for interview will be contacted. <br/><br/> If you require any accommodation during the interview process, please let the recruiter know at the time you are contacted and we will do our best to accommodate you.
Title: Sr. .NET Developer

Job_Description: <strong>About Symantec and SurfEasy:</strong> <br/><br/> SurfEasy is a leading Virtual Private Network (VPN) provider that delivers easy-to-use solutions for online privacy and security on smartphones, tablets and computers. <br/><br/> VPN technology encrypts consumers’ communications online, which can include sensitive information such as passwords and credit card information, and helps to protect that information from being intercepted by cybercriminals. <br/><br/> SurfEasy was recently acquired by Symantec Corporation, but has been powering Symantec’s Norton WiFi Privacy product with VPN technology for the last 2 years. <br/><br/> As a leading Fortune 500 Technology & Security Company, Symantec already protects more than a billion IoT devices. This puts Symantec among the biggest providers of IoT security today, and the first to deliver a comprehensive security reference architecture for how to build-in security to make your IoT systems “secure by design.” Symantec brings an unrivaled breadth of leading security solutions for device protection, encryption, authentication, key management, and code signing. Symantec also has unmatched depth in security expertise from monitoring, analyzing and processing more than 10 trillion security events per year worldwide for Symantec’s Global Intelligence Network. <br/><br/> Working at SurfEasy means you are a part of a company that has been experiencing steady growth, great reviews and financial success and comes with the promise that you will always have access to the latest technology, challenging projects and a role in helping organizations, governments and people protect and secure their most important data wherever it lives. <br/><br/> <strong>About the Role:</strong> <br/><br/> Our secure VPN network is the heart of our product. It is tightly integrated with our software client and is the focus of much of our intellectual property. We need a talented individual who can straddle the worlds of Network Operations and Development to ensure our network is stable and yet evolving to meet our customer’s needs. <br/><br/> As an ideal candidate you have a passion for:  <ul> <li>Deploying, automating, maintaining and managing Amazon Web Services and cloud based production systems, to ensure the availability, performance, scalability and security</li> <li>Build, release and configuration management of production systems</li> <li>System troubleshooting and problem solving across platform and application domains</li> <li>Suggesting architecture improvements, recommending process improvements</li> <li>Evaluate new technology options and vendor products</li> <li>Ensuring critical system security through the use of best in class cloud security solutions</li> <li>Help drive out a production class monitoring and metrics system as well as processes</li> <li>Participate in an on-call rotation</li> <li>Ensure scalability for future growth</li> </ul> <strong>Qualifications:</strong>  <ul> <li>Amazon Web Services: 2+ years experience using a broad range of AWS technologies (e.g. EC2, RDS, ELB, EBS, S3, VPC, IAM, CloudWatch) to develop and maintain an AWS based cloud solution, with an emphasis on best practice cloud security</li> <li>DevOps: Solid experience as a DevOps Engineer in a 24x7 uptime Cloud based environment, including automation experience with various configuration management tools</li> <li>Operating Systems: Deep understanding of Linux systems and administration</li> <li>Continuous Integration & Delivery Tools: Extensive understanding of CI/CD automation tools such as chef, puppet, Jenkins, Dockerhub, GitLab</li> <li>Monitoring Tools: Experience with system monitoring tools (Prometheus, Nagios etc.)</li> <li>Problem Solving: Ability to analyze and resolve complex infrastructure resource and application deployment issues</li> <li>Scripting/Programming Skills: Solid programming/scripting ability in any of the following: Bash, Ruby, Go, Python, Java, Scala</li> <li>Database Skills: 2+ years administration experience (Postgresql, MySQL, Aurora)</li> <li>Data Store: Some knowledge of Cassandra, HBase, Graphs etc. would be an asset</li> <li>Agile Methodologies: Experience with Agile software development, project management methodologies</li> <li>Version Control: Experience administrating version control systems such as Github/Bitbucket</li> <li>Networking: Deep understanding of network topologies and common network protocols and services. (VPN, SSL, SSH, DNS, HTTPS)</li>   <li>Are highly responsible, self-motivated and able to thrive in an energetic, fast-paced, creative environment</li> <li>A strong work ethic and the ability to work effectively independently and in a team environment</li> <li>Creative problem solving skills and an ability to apply business logic to development requirements</li> <li>Excited to work in an environment focused on building the right solution by encouraging our engineers to invest in the right technologies and architectural improvements to help us innovate faster</li> <li>Are passionate about technology, apps, online security and VPN’s (big plus!)</li> </ul> <strong>Essential Duties and Responsibilities:</strong>  <ul> <li>You will work closely with the experienced backend development team on a day to day basis providing mentoring and guidance to various team members</li> <li>Have the opportunity to contribute to product enhancements and create unique IP to better our product</li> <li>Develop robust solutions using a test driven approach</li> <li>Proactively find ways of improving services, systems and code and work with the team to define future product features</li> <li>Release high quality software to production</li> <li>Assist support staff in resolving any technical issues with our software</li> </ul> <strong>Knowledge & Experience:</strong>  <ul> <li>A degree in Computer Science or related area is a plus</li> <li>A strong Ruby developer with experience both on Rails websites as well as backend scripting</li> <li>Must have experience with Golang or back-end ruby experience</li> <li>Comfortable creating scripts to deploy, monitor and manage a network of servers</li> <li>Have hands on experiences deploying, monitoring, and managing a network in the cloud using AWS, Rackspace, etc.,</li> <li>Experience with Puppet, Chef or a similar tool to deploy servers to the cloud in an automated way</li> <li>Experience in Docker, Kubernetes, etc.</li> <li>Comfortable collaborating with enterprise level clients on integration projects and with open source</li> <li>Experience scaling a solution both at the website and the database level</li> <li>Management of Linux servers in a production environment</li> <li>Demonstrated ability to mentor technical management and technical professionals</li>  </ul> <strong>Compensation & Perks:</strong>  <ul> <li>A compensation package that includes competitive salaries, an annual incentive plan, an internal rewards program and optional participation in a Pension/Group RRSP program</li> <li>Comprehensive health and wellbeing offerings that include medical, dental and vision with no waiting period</li> <li>Flexible vacation policy that gives you the freedom to take the time you need, when you need it</li>   <li>Contribute to patentable technology development</li> <li>Work alongside an amazing team in our downtown Toronto office</li> <li>Free snacks and drinks in the Title: Developer

Job_Description: Company Profile <br/><br/> Morgan Stanley is a global financial services firm and a market leader in investment banking, securities, investment management and wealth management services. With offices in more than 43 countries, the people of Morgan Stanley are dedicated to providing our clients the finest thinking, products and services to help them achieve even the most challenging goals. <br/><br/> As a market leader, the talent and passion of our people is critical to our success. We embrace integrity, excellence, team work and giving back. <br/><br/> Technology <br/><br/> The Technology division partners with our business units and leading technology companies to redefine how we do business in ever more global and dynamic financial markets. <br/><br/> Our sizeable investment in technology results in leading-edge tools, software, and systems. Our insights, applications, and infrastructure give a competitive edge to clients’ businesses—and to our own. <br/><br/> Enterprise Technology & Risk (ETR) is comprised of five primary areas <br/><br/> •Core Infrastructure (CI) manages the infrastructure technology solutions to support the Firm’s daily operations, enable our businesses to expand to new markets, offer new client products, and comply with evolving regulations.   <ul> <li>End User Technology (EUT) delivers core communication, collaboration and productivity tools across the Firm, including desktop and mobile devices, remote computing solutions, and multimedia services.</li> <li>Quality Assurance & Production Management (QAPM) provides production management, quality assurance, and end user services for Institutional Securities and Support Services. QAPM also manages the Enterprise Command Center, Enterprise Systems Management, and Technology Disaster Recovery services.</li> <li>Technology & Information Risk (TIR) delivers first-line defenses to manage risks to Firm technology. TIR oversees programs that protect and enable the business, ensure secure delivery of services to our clients, address the risks presented by an evolving threat landscape, and meet regulatory expectations.</li> <li>Technology Business Development (TechBD) manages the Firm’s strategic relationships with external technology companies. <br/><br/> Position Description: <br/><br/> Morgan Stanley is looking for a developer with a background in either core Java of C# (server side) to assist in building its domain-aligned production monitoring toolset. The toolset includes functions like real-time infrastructure (e.g., server, network) and business (e.g., electronic order flow) metrics monitoring. The grand task at hand is to “turn data into useful information”. Our tools process vast amounts of data from many sources enabling our users to identify risks before they turn into issues and manage our trading environment. The toolset’s technology is centered around a Complex Event Processing (CEP) backend, so experience in TIBCO Stream Base CEP or similar is a plus, but not required. The candidate will be responsible for development of server side applications that process business data in real time. On occasional basis, he may need to program custom adapters: tiny modules that take input from various sources as databases, export files, publish-subscribe API, REST services, etc. and make it available to the main application. The role also assumes creating and updating visual dashboards using data analytics tools as Panopticon Data Watch and/or in house developed UI components using HTML5/CSS/JavaScript stack. <br/><br/> Skills Required: <br/><br/> - Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Systems or related technical disciplines</li> <li>5 years of experience as a core Java or .Net developer</li> <li>Strong problem solving and analytical skills</li> <li>Knowledge of data structures and algorithms</li> <li>Good communication skills; both written and verbal</li> <li>Working knowledge of relational and NoSQL databases</li> <li>Version control (git)</li> <li>Linux shell scripting <br/><br/> Skills Desired: <br/><br/> - Experience with Complex Event Processing (CEP) systems</li> <li>User Interface development with HTML5/CSS/JavaScript modern frameworks</li> <li>Experience with Data Analytics tools as Panopticon, Tableau, LiveView Web, D3.js</li> <li>User Experience design skills</li> <li>Basic comprehension of Financial Services industry with conceptual knowledge of Institutional Securities and Order Flow <br/><br/> Knowledge of French and English are required. <br/><br/> Morgan Stanley is an equal opportunities employer. We work to provide a supportive and inclusive environment where all individuals can maximize their full potential.<br/><br/></li> </ul>
Title: Software Developer - Java/.Net

Join our team and make a difference!</div>  </div> </div>  </div> <div> <div> Your Job</div>  </div> <div> <div> <div> <div><strong><em>About us</em></strong> <br/> How do you imagine life at an insurance company - its people, its culture, its offices? Title: Back-end developer

Job_Description: Are you a result-oriented, self-motivated PHP software developer looking for flexibility? <br/><br/> TapClicks, a fast-growing software company with a team of engineers working from Montreal, Boston and San Jose (California), is looking for a new engineer to work on its reporting and order management platform for digital marketing agencies. <br/><br/> Our core product currently integrates with over 60 third-party data sources to fetch data and report it in a unified dashboard for agencies and their clients, saving them time and allowing them to make better decisions. Based on client needs, we also built a new order management and workflow system to let them enter their clients' orders and process them based on custom product definitions and workflows. That way, they can use our platform from start to finish (enter their orders, have campaigns created in third-party platforms via APIs, and then use our existing reporting capabilities). <br/><br/> As part of our growth, we're now looking for a full-stack developer who will be able to add new features to the application, working both on the PHP backend and the Angular frontend. <br/><br/> Ideally, we'd like a software developer with at least 3 years of experience who:   <ul> <li>Is smart and self-motivated;</li> <li>Is familiar with the LAMP development stack;</li> <li>Is experienced with the Angular framework;</li> <li>Is detail-oriented;</li> <li>Is a fast learner;</li> <li>Can innovate/make improvements without always needing a precise spec;</li> <li>Is a great communicator (we're a distributed team);</li> <li>Has a bachelor degree or higher (nice to have - not required);</li> <li>Has experience with third-party APIs (nice to have - not required);</li> <li>Has previous experience with digital marketing and/or order entry system (nice to have - not required).</li> </ul>  Is this something that could interest you? If so, please contact plsoucy@tapclicks.com with questions or with your CV/LinkedIn profile for more details. <br/><br/> We offer a competitive salary and a possibility of stock options. <br/><br/> We're looking for people in the Montreal, Boston and San Jose (California) areas. <br/><br/> <strong>======</strong> <br/><br/> P.S. Here's a list of some of the technologies we use: <br/> Backend code: PHP 5.6 <br/> Frontend code: AngularJS <br/> Database: MySQL (InnoDB with foreign keys) <br/> Web server: Apache <br/> Servers: Dedicated servers at OVH + AWS (S3 and Route 53, mostly) <br/> Version control: SVN <br/> Bug tracking: Trac <br/> Some of the APIs we currently have integrations with: Google Adwords, Google Analytics, Facebook Ads, Facebook Insights, Bing Ads, MailChimp, Constant Contact, Twitter, Foursquare, Marchex, Moz, StepRep.
Title: Full-stack LAMP (PHP)/Angular Intermediate/Senior Developer

Connect with Genesys via www.genesys.com, Twitter, Facebook, YouTube, LinkedIn, and the Genesys blog. <br/><br/> <strong>Genesys is an equal opportunity employer committed to diversity in the workplace. Job_Description: Are you an experienced software developer with a passion for building cutting edge software solutions? Do you love using the latest technology and working in a fast-paced, agile, and innovative environment? Are you a team player who loves to collaborate with others? Then SolarWinds could be the new rewarding challenge you are looking for. <br/><br/> SolarWinds is the leading global provider of complete IT management and Automation solutions for Managed Service Providers (MSPs). Our award-winning product suite includes the industry’s #1 RMM Service Automation Platform and has a proven track record of helping MSPs standardize and automate the setup and delivery of IT services in order to achieve true scalability. We believe that the MSPs who use our products everyday should be excited about them. That's why we put our users first in everything we do and strive to deliver powerful functionality while making their jobs easier. <br/><br/> We are looking for a Developer to join the Data Platform team in Ottawa, ON to work on new solutions for data collection, storage, management, analytics, and reporting. If you enjoy working in a team of smart people and share the same passion for engineering with them we'd love to talk to you! <ul> <li>Work in a team of talented developers willing to share best practices</li><li>Investigate and resolve complex technical issues with simple and elegant solutions</li><li>Continually identify areas of improvement with respect to product supportability and quality</li><li>Design, implement, and test new features with minimal supervision</li><li>Mentor junior team members, provide technical guidance, and share best practices</li><li>Build secure, scalable, distributed and fault-tolerant cloud-based systems</li><li>Be self-driven, helping the team meet sprint goals and overall project delivery milestones</li> </ul> <strong>Required Skills:</strong> <ul> <li>Relational database design, development and data warehousing experience</li><li>Demonstrated proficiency in multiple areas of software development (e.g. backend development, concurrency, design patterns, SOLID principles, etc)</li><li>Experience with good source control concepts and tools (Git or similar)</li><li>Experience running large applications on AWS</li><li>Ability to learn new products and programming languages quickly</li><li>Excellent problem-solving skills; can triage and resolve critical issues independently and collaboratively</li><li>Should have excellent communications skills, a good attitude, and a friendly personality</li><li>Experience with PostgreSQL and/or MySQL</li><li>Automated unit testing experience</li> </ul> <strong>Desired Skills:</strong> <ul> <li>Programming experience with Java, Python, C#</li><li>Experience with Agile development processes</li><li>Experience with message buses (Kafka, Rabbit, or similar)</li><li>Experience with Docker, Kubernetes, Terraform</li><li>Working knowledge of the Hadoop ecosystem</li><li>Experience with SQL Server and T-SQL</li><li>Experience with AWS Redshift</li><li>Familiarity with microservices and serverless architectures</li><li>Working knowledge of the Microsoft BI Suite – SSRS, SSAS and SSIS</li><li>Experience with NET, Microsoft MVC and Microsoft WCF</li> </ul> <strong>Qualifications:</strong> <ul> <li>BS or MS in Computer Science or equivalent</li><li>4+ years of experience designing and developing commercial software</li> </ul>
