Job_Description: The Role<br/><br/>The Pason Power team focuses on the monitoring and intelligent control of distributed energy storage systems. There will be a number of potential applications ranging from installation of energy storage with solar/PV systems to utility companies looking to build a responsive and adaptable electrical grid. You will have the opportunity to combine your experience with Pason’s in data acquisition and embedded control systems combined with cutting edge Internet of Things (IoT) and cloud technologies to provide a best in class solution.<br/><br/>Essential Duties and Responsibilities   <ul> <li>Work as a part of an agile scrum team, contributing to the development of the Pason Power product line</li> <li>Provide mentorship and guidance to other software developers</li> <li>Develop Pason Power web applications</li> <li>Participate in Code Reviews</li> <li>Integrate web applications with backend services, including AWS hosted web-services, Lambdas, databases (relational and NoSQL), as well as IoT transport mechanisms</li> <li>Interface with the UX team to deliver visually appealing and easily approachable web applications</li> <li>Troubleshoot and provide timely solutions to production issues</li> <li>Participate in team technical discussions, challenge ideas and present solutions and approaches to be considered by the team</li> <li>Participate and contribute in weekly Agile meetings, discuss and present work accomplished and provide constructive feedback to help improve the team</li> <li>Contribute to our evolving development environment through research, experiment with new technologies and attend conferences or courses. Educate your peers on what you have learned.</li> <li>Maintain and expand our suite of automated tests</li> <li>Implement security best practices and protections in our web applications and with our customer data</li> <li>Understand and contribute to the development of system architecture</li> <li>Travel to Houston 1-2 weeks per year to work in person with our technical team there</li> </ul>  Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities   <ul> <li>Proficient with JavaScript</li> <li>Proficient in Python, Java, C/C++/C#, or other back-end languages</li> <li>Understanding of React.js or similar web frameworks</li> <li>Experience with databases (relational and NoSQL)</li> <li>Experience with RESTful APIs</li> <li>Familiarity with code versioning tools such as Git</li> <li>Proficient in Linux</li> <li>Experience in integration and unit testing</li> <li>Ability to work in a team or as an individual</li> <li>Experience with common front-end development tools such as Babel, Webpack, NPM, etc.</li> <li>Experience working with hardware / Internet of Things (IoT) device control systems</li> <li>Familiar with container technologies (Docker)</li> <li>Familiar with messaging protocols such as MQTT or AMQP</li> <li>Build automation / continuous integration / continuous delivery experience</li> <li>Experience Working in cloud environments (AWS, Google Cloud, Azure, etc)</li> </ul>
Title: Senior Software Developer (Full Stack Developer)

Job_Description: Embrace and Lead<br/><br/>You have spent countless hours over the years learning the academic and practical skills to be great at what you do. Working professionally and as a hobbyist you have gathered experience in the security field so you know what to do and what not to do. At ZetaTango we encourage everyone to trust themselves, stop holding back and use their acquired knowledge. <br/><br/> Everyone in the team is an integral contributor to our products, working with our customers to collaborate and design the best solutions. Our open work culture provides the opportunity for you to contribute to all aspects of our business: customer engagement, product ownership, software, security, QA, devops and 24/7 cloud service deployment. <br/><br/> As a key member of our security team you will lead through collaboration to design, develop and deploy advanced security solutions to keep our integrated cloud services trusted, safe and secure. As a financial technology company we deploy cutting edge security solutions to deter highly sophisticated attackers from theft and fraud. <br/><br/> As a Security Developer you will be expected to:  <ul>  <li>Drive ZetaTango’s security platform forward as a security developer</li>    <li>Design complete security and cryptographic solutions</li>    <li>Develop secure code to protect our APIs, frontend, backend, web, mobile and partner integration platforms</li>    <li>Fully automate large scale solutions to detect advanced threats to our online financial services</li>    <li>Develop and deploy security policies, standards, guidelines, tools and frameworks</li>    <li>Perform threat modelling to prioritize the design and development of appropriate mitigations</li>    </ul> <br/><br/> <strong>What Experience You Bring:</strong>  <ul>  <li>Computer, network and communications security</li>    <li>Security analysis of web applications</li>    <li>Secure software development using web application frameworks</li>    <li>Relational databases such as PostgresQL, MySQL</li>    <li>Proficiency with Linux/UNIX command-line</li>    <li>Working autonomously and being highly resourceful</li>    <li>Experience with agile, test driven design methodology</li>    <li>BSC, MSC or PHD in computer science or engineering</li>    </ul> <br/><br/>Other Valued Skills & Knowledge:   <ul>  <li>Ruby on Rails</li>    <li>Node.js, JavaScript and front-end development frameworks</li>    <li>Git or other version control systems</li>    <li>Building a RESTful API</li>    <li>Heroku, Kubernetes, Docker for production deployment</li>    <li>Accounting, payment, billing or other finance solutions</li>    </ul> <br/><br/> <strong>What You Can Expect From Us</strong> <br/><br/> At ZetaTango we hire for fit. Fit with our values of openness, agility and respect. Fit with the knowledge and skills needed to excel both individually and as part of a larger team so that we can continue to serve our customers. Fit with an insatiable need to improve, learn and discover. What you’ll get in return is the opportunity to work with others who are top in the industry and who possess an incredible amount of knowledge and enthusiasm for building a world class company. <br/><br/> If you are looking for a challenging career and the opportunity to be part of a successful and high growth company, ZetaTango is the ideal place for you. We want our candidates and our employees to be set up for success. During every part of the recruiting process you will have the opportunity to get in touch with our People & Culture team with any questions, concerns or requests for accommodations.
Title: Security Developer

Job_Description: Job Description<br/><br/>Under general direction, responsible for web-based application and related systems development. Responsible for development of application modules in a team environment that meet performance, scalability, architectural, quality and business requirements. Responsible for all stages of development, application/database design, coding, testing, and related documentation. <br/><br/> <strong>Key Areas of Responsibility</strong> <br/><br/> Working within an Agile team you will:  <ul> <li>Code elegant backend and front end cloud solutions</li>  <li>Design, update and maintain Automation Framework and Automation Tests</li>  <li>Review business requirements and provide estimates</li>  <li>Resolve bugs, and implement unit tests to improve quality</li>  <li>Maintain Continuous Integration/Continuous Deployment for API’</li> </ul>  Required Skills   <ul> <li>C# for Net Web API & WCF Services.</li>  <li>Automation Testing (Selenium would be an asset)</li>  <li>Confidence in coding JavaScript for the frontend side with some of the JavaScript and CSS libraries.</li>  <li>Experience with various relational DBs specifically Sql Server.</li>   <li>Unit testing and TDD with knowledge of one or more libraries: NUnit, QUnit, XUnit and NSubstitute</li>  <li>Can-do attitude, problem solver, collaborator in small Agile teams.</li>  <li>Knowledge of Agile and SOLID Principles and practices.</li> </ul>  Required Experience   <ul> <li>Bachelor's degree in computer science or equivalent.</li>  <li>2+ years of programming experience.</li>  <li>2 years experience in online development.</li>  <li>Strong knowledge of C#, Microsoft SQL Server, Microsoft ASP.NET platform, Visual Studio, Internet technologies, HTML, XML as well as security techniques and web server familiarity.</li>  <li>Experience in automated unit testing and TDD approach to development.</li>  <li>Knowledge of REST, SOAP and other application integration technologies.</li> </ul>  Job Location <br/><br/> Burnaby, British Columbia, Canada <br/><br/> Position Type <br/><br/> Full-Time/Regular
Title: ASP.Net Developer

Job_Description: <div>In the last 5 years, Prodigy has gone from 3,000 to over 30,000,000 students across North America (including 80% of all Ontario students), and is currently the fastest growing educational startup in North America. By joining our team, you will have the opportunity to help an entire generation of students to LOVE learning while working alongside some of the brightest and most passionate people in education and gaming.</div> <br/><strong>What youll do:</strong>  <ul> <li>Assist in guiding and supporting a new development team in downtown Toronto</li><li>Lead and mentor multiple development teams and Technical Leads; enabling them to improve the product, ship code faster, and further their careers</li><li>Make architectural decisions that will help us scale our product for the next 10 million students</li><li>Work cross-functionally with an agile team including Product, UX & Design, Development, and QA</li><li>Provide input on technical design and product features</li><li>And much more...</li> </ul>  <strong>What youll need:</strong>  <ul> <li>Excellent communication skills</li><li>A passion for user experience and performance</li><li>Experience leading and managing product teams</li><li>Experience designing high availability systems</li><li>A solid understanding of JavaScript and HTML5</li><li>Experience with one or more JavaScript frameworks (Backbone, React, Angular, Vue.js, Ember, etc.)</li><li>Experience writing API endpoints and working with databases (PostgreSQL, Dynamo DB, etc.)</li><li>A love for learning and staying on top of the latest in web development</li> </ul>  <strong>Our core technologies:</strong>  <ul> <li>Backend: Node.js, GraphQL, Postgres, Dynamo DB, Redis, AWS</li><li>Frontend: React, Backbone (legacy), ES6, SASS & BEM</li> </ul>  <strong>We Offer:</strong>  <ul> <li>Full health benefits</li><li>A really generous gym and learning allowance</li><li>Flexible working hours</li><li>Opportunities for career growth</li><li>The ability to impact the lives of millions of kids</li><li>Snacks and a really good coffee machine</li> </ul>  <div>We are an equal opportunity employer and are committed to providing employment accommodation in accordance with the Ontario Human Rights Code and the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act, 2005 (AODA). Prodigy Game will provide accommodations to job applicants with disabilities throughout the recruitment process. If you require an accommodation, please notify us and we will work with you to meet your needs.</div>
Title: Developer Manager Of Full Stack Development

Job_Description: <strong>Who we are</strong> <br/><br/> Creating a planet fueled by reliable, clean energy isnt what keeps us up at night; its what gets us out of bed. At Opus One Solutions, we pursue solutions that will change how countries access and distribute electrical energy. From microgrids that keep things running in the event of an outage to how Tesla's latest batteries can help accelerate the integration of renewable energy. From how electric utilities can optimize their operations and reduce their carbon footprint to how every homeowner will feed energy into a power grid fueling the electrical sharing economy. <br/><br/> At Opus One Solutions, we believe some of the best talent in the tech industry share our passion for delivering technology that matters and that will make a difference, in our lifetime and beyond. We want to work with people who love the complexities of software; who believe in its power to transform the world to a better place. <br/><br/> Good people know that great ideas are everywhere and what matters most is practical execution. Turning vision into reality is the hard part. But, when its creating technical solutions that support access to renewable energy, its an engineering feat worth contributing to. <br/><br/> <strong>Our tech stack</strong> <br/><br/> Our tech stack is deep because we interact with real things in the real world where the outcome matters. Our systems collect, analyze and interact with other systems in real-time. Internally, the tools we use include Python3, C+11, Javascript/React/Leaflet, PostgreSQL, Redmine, GitLab, Jenkins, and Docker, all hosted on AWS. <br/><br/> <strong>The opportunity</strong> <br/><br/> Opus One Solutions is looking for a Python Developer who wants to be a key player on our GridOS team. The GridOS team at Opus One builds our flagship product, GridOS. Its a cross-functional team with expertise in frontend, backend and power system analysis. Our new Python Developer will be an active contributor to our products cutting edge Python backend. <br/><br/> <strong>Who are you?</strong> <br/><br/> You are a strong Python developer and you enjoy working autonomously to solve complex problems. You have developed database-backed web services. Youre familiar with software security and deployment workflows. You have experience with software that gets deployed on the cloud and maybe even on-premises within a customers datacenter. <br/><br/> This is an exciting opportunity for someone who wants to think creatively and be innovative. Someone ready to step out of their comfort zone. Someone eager to build a robust, resilient and high-availability product. This is a chance to be on the forefront of new technology. <br/><br/> <strong>Whats in it for you?</strong> <br/><br/> <strong>Challenges.</strong> The electrical power grid is a lifeline to millions of people. Quite literally, this is a system that cannot go down when it comes to hospitals, traffic controls and more. Your challenge is to build a product that reaches that level of quality and reliability. <br/><br/> <strong>Personal and professional satisfaction.</strong> You want to do meaningful work. You dont just want to build and analyze things. You want to directly contribute to technology solutions that matter. <br/><br/> <strong>Knowledge.</strong> This is a great team, passionate about technology. You will have an opportunity to broaden your technical knowledge using new back and front end technologies: JavaScript, C++, React and Docker to name a few. <br/><br/> <strong>What will our new Python Developer work on? You will:</strong>  <ul> <li>Design and implement high quality, robust, and reusable software using multiple languages and technologies conforming to industry best practices.</li> <li>Evaluate emerging technologies and open source libraries to provide recommendations.</li> <li>Support testing processes, troubleshoot and resolve issues.</li> <li>Participate in architectural design sessions and product discussions.</li> <li>Work closely with other developers with a diverse skill set and technology expertise to provide scalable solutions.</li> <li>Work in an Agile/SCRUM team setting including cross-functional structures and varying levels of management.</li> </ul> <strong>Heres what you bring:</strong>  <ul> <li>The education. You have a degree in Computer Science or equivalent.</li> <li>The experience. You have 2+ years developing Python webapps. Youre familiar with version control systems and Python testing frameworks.</li> <li>The technical expertise. You have expertise in Python. Your programming skills are strong and you can quickly learn new technologies.</li> <li>The passion. You are equally passionate about clean tech as you are about quality coding.</li> <li>The vision. You can focus on the big picture and the details. Robust, reliable and scalable is your motto.</li> <li>The communication. You have exceptional written and oral communication skills. You are a strong presenter.</li> <li>The energy. You thrive in a high volume, fast paced environment.</li> <li>The innovation. You have the ability to anticipate problems and provide creative, quick - and reliable - solutions.</li> </ul> <strong>Why join Opus One Solutions?</strong> <br/><br/> Opus One is growing! After spending the last four years under the radar focused on research and pilot projects were ready to shine as one of Canadas top 10 game-changers named by CIX Cleantech! We are deploying exciting microgrid projects in North America and have partnerships with leading energy players such as Tesla and Advanced Microgrid Solutions. <br/><br/> Collectively, we are fanatical about the work we do. Our leadership has assembled carefully selected teams with some of the best strategic visionaries - and executors - in technology and the clean energy space. From the newest team member to the company founders, we are all driven by one common goal: to accelerate the integration of clean and sustainable energy in North America and the world. <br/><br/> As a team and a company, we are committed to working with like-minded people, with opinions and thoughts of their own that will contribute to our innovation and evolution. We equally want to work with people who like to get outside and spend time together on team outings, special events, to grab lunch or take part in off-site brainstorming retreats. Theres a lot of humility at Opus One Solutions. No one person is going to know it all its too complicated. We must work and innovate together to get the job done. <br/><br/> At Opus One Solutions we understand that not everyone develops their talent and hones their skills in a traditional way. Different paths and experiences are part of the diversity we know we need to succeed. If you feel you meet all or most of the qualifications we are seeking; and you are excited by the possibility of growing our company, take a chance and express your interest here. <br/><br/> Opus One Solutions welcomes and encourages applications from people with disabilities. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process.
Title: Python Developer

Job_Description: <strong>Location:</strong><br/><br/>40 Hanna Ave, Toronto, Ontario, M6K 0C3<br/><br/>At Loblaw Digital, we know that our customers expect the best from us. Whether that means building the best, most innovative online shopping experience, or designing an app that will impact the lives of people across the country, we’re up for the challenge. From our office in Downtown Toronto, we’ve created leading eCommerce experiences in the online grocery shopping, beauty, pharmacy, and apparel spaces, and we’re only just getting started. <br/><br/> <strong>Why is this role important?</strong> <br/><br/> Looking for a challenge? Good. Love an innovative work environment? Even better. <br/><br/> At Loblaw Digital, we know that our customers expect the best from us. Whether that means building the best, most innovative online shopping experience, or designing an app that will impact the lives of people across the country, we’re up for the challenge. From our office in Downtown Toronto, we’ve created leading eCommerce experiences in the online grocery shopping, beauty, pharmacy, and apparel spaces, and we’re only just getting started. <br/><br/> We’re able to keep innovating because our colleagues are passionate about their work and excited about the future of eCommerce. If you have big ideas, undeniable enthusiasm, and thrive in a collaborative, creative, and diverse group, we’ll get along just fine. <br/><br/> Working from our downtown office, you will report to the E-Commerce Technology Lead and will assist in building, improving and maintaining a world-class, multi-channel e-commerce platform. This is a hands-on role in the E-Commerce Development Team where you will develop software across the full-stack of a multi-channel platform from HTML, CSS & Javascript to server-side Java. <br/> What You'll Do: <ul> <li>Java Development on the hybris e-commerce platform</li><li>Write server-side code for web-based applications, create robust high-volume production applications, and develop prototypes quickly.</li><li>Participate in code and architecture reviews.</li><li>Responsive front-end Development using Javascript, CSS, HTML in a Spring framework</li><li>Translate wireframes, creative design, and functional requirements into functional xHTML/ CSS / Javascript</li><li>Develop JavaScript using standard frameworks (jQuery, Backbone.js, node.js etc.)</li><li>Construct design documents and documentation to aid in maintenance and code reuse.</li><li>Confirms program operation with testing; modifying program logic and performance tuning while guaranteeing quality assurance.</li><li>Closely work with the Quality Control and Technical Communication team members to ensure high quality deliverables</li><li>Provides input to status reports on the “health” of the application.</li><li>Provides support by ensuring stability of the application and addressing and resolving business issues in a timely manner.</li> </ul> What You'll Need: <ul> <li>Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering or similar</li><li>3+ years of experience in software engineering.</li><li>1+ years’ experience in object oriented design and development in Java.</li><li>Some experience developing with the Spring Framework would be preferred.</li><li>Some experience with an e-commerce platform (hybris, ATG, Websphere etc.) would be preferred.</li><li>Advanced skills using J2EE Frameworks and Libraries specifically such as Hibernate, JPA and JDO</li><li>Database development skills including SQL programming, solid understanding of relational database technologies, logical and physical data modeling. Preferably on an Oracle database.</li><li>Backend and Frontend/Web development experience with JSP, JavaScript, JSON, jQuery, HTML, CSS</li><li>Experience with web app servers, such as Tomcat, JBoss, Websphere, and Weblogic</li><li>Experience using standard development tools, such as Eclipse, Ant, Git</li><li>Experience developing REST based web services</li> </ul> #LI-ST1 <br/><br/> <strong>How You’ll Succeed:</strong> <br/><br/> At Loblaw Digital, we seek great people to continually strengthen our culture. We believe great people model our values, are authentic, build trust and make connections. <br/><br/> We’re able to keep innovating because our colleagues are passionate about their work and excited about the future of eCommerce. <br/><br/> If you have big ideas, undeniable enthusiasm, and thrive in a collaborative, creative, and diverse group, we’ll get along just fine. <br/><br/> Looking for a challenge? Good. Love an innovative work environment? Even better. <br/><br/> Apply today. <br/><br/> <strong><strong>Employment Type:</strong></strong><br/><br/>Full time<br/><br/><strong><strong>Type of Role:</strong></strong><br/><br/>Regular<br/><br/>Loblaw Digital recognizes Canada's diversity as a source of national pride and strength. We have made it a priority to reflect our nation’s evolving diversity in the products we sell, the people we hire, and the culture we create in our organization. Accommodation is available upon request for applicants with disabilities in the recruitment and assessment process and when hired.<br/><br/><strong>Please Note: If you have Employee Self Service (ESS) on Workday, apply to this job via the Workday application.</strong>
Title: Developer II

Job_Description: <strong>About Mazu</strong> <br/><br/> Mazu is a youth engagement company helping professional sports teams across the major leagues as well as other large brands communicate with their younger audience. Through the use of our B2B and B2C products Mazu’s mission is to reconnect brands and families. We take a value based approach in delivering innovative and engaging content and solutions. <br/><br/> The staff at Mazu enjoy a fun, open and energetic atmosphere. Most of our team is located in Kelowna, BC with a sprinkling of remote workers throughout North America. Our clients are some of the most interesting brands and are eager to try new innovative solutions. <br/><br/> Leading a team of developers working with the full stack, front end to backend to create dynamically driven mobile applications. You will work with the latest mobile technologies like Ionic, Cordova, IOS, Android and Progressive Web Applications. Responsibilities will include (but are not limited to): requirements, systems analysis, code creation, unit testing, feature planning and technical documentation. Code must be designed per responsive mobile design techniques to run across a wide range of devices. <br/><br/> Requirements  <ul>  <li>7+ years hands-on experience building highly scalable, secure, robust applications.</li>    <li>Demonstrated ability to lead, develop and deliver projects on time</li>    <li>Be collaborative and an empowering leader.</li>    <li>Be diligent, demonstrating clear ownership of assigned responsibilities.</li>    <li>Extensive experience with JavaScript, Node.</li>    <li>Familiar with mobile development tools like Cordova / Ionic</li>    <li>Wide experience in the handling and writing of APIs and JSON data structures</li>    <li>Proven experience in backend systems design</li>    <li>Must be able to lead a small team of developers with varying experience and expertise.</li>    </ul> <br/><br/> <strong>Desired Skills</strong>  <ul>  <li>Knowledge of common design patterns and their application.</li>    <li>Working knowledge of Android and IOS OS Application development.</li>    <li>Experience working with MySQL database design and administration. Working knowledge of Cassandra would be a bonus!</li>    <li>Experience working with Typescript.</li>    <li>Basic knowledge of Progressive Web Apps.</li>    <li>Experience working with HTML, CSS, XML, JQuery and MVC Frameworks</li>    <li>Familiar with Agile Methodologies (SCRUM)</li>    <li>Solid understanding of the full mobile development life cycle</li>    <li>Experience in testing and debugging</li>    <li>Experience working with JIRA and Confluence.</li>    </ul> Location: Kelowna, British Columbia (Must be willing to relocate and eligible to work in Canada) <br/><br/> Department: Development <br/><br/> Employment Type: Full Time <br/><br/> Minimum Experience: Senior-level
Title: Lead Developer

Job_Description: About Us:<br/><br/>Global Relay is the leading provider of cloud-based archiving, supervision, eDiscovery, and analytics for the global financial sector. We deliver services to 23,000 customers in 90 countries, including 22 of the top 25 global banks. Our market-leading archiving service supports email, instant messaging, Bloomberg®, Thomson Reuters, social media, mobile messaging, and more – with mobile, Outlook, and web access. <br/><br/> Our Global Operations & Development Center is located in Vancouver, BC, Canada. In addition, we have offices in six other cities across the world, including major financial centers like New York, Chicago, and London. <br/><br/> Over the years, we have won several major awards, including:  <ul>   <li>Company of the Year from the BC Tech Association (2016)</li> <li>Canada’s 50 Best Small and Medium Employers (2014, 2015)</li> <li>Canada’s Top Employers for Young People (2014)</li> <li>Canada’s Top 10 Most Admired Corporate Cultures (2013, 2016)</li> <li>Canada’s Best Managed Companies (2013 - present)</li> </ul> We provide fantastic opportunities to individuals passionate about business and technology. For those with international business aspirations, we offer invaluable opportunities for doing business with some of the world’s largest, most influential firms. Our company is also perfect for those who want to create cool technology using massively scalable, big-data architecture, with a strong focus on mobile. <br/><br/> To learn more about our business, culture, and community involvement, visit www.globalrelay.com.<br/><br/>The Role:<br/><br/>The Software Development Engineer in Test (SDET) is a developer who specializes in writing code to test the product. They are responsible for the overall test coverage, test code, and automation frameworks within their Agile team. <br/><br/> As a Senior SDET, you will drive growth in your team’s automation coverage while mentoring other SDETs in the team on automation and test practices. You will work directly with code in an established automation framework to test back-end services for large scale data processing. You will support the team’s testing efforts while proposing and implementing improvements in the automation coverage and frameworks. <br/><br/> <strong>Role Responsibilities:</strong>  <ul>   <li>Design, develop and maintain automation frameworks, infrastructure and tools</li> <li>Define and automate test cases that verify product requirements</li> <li>Participate in team planning and story grooming</li> <li>Participate in test execution, issue identification and resolution in support of the release</li> <li>Provide suggestions to improve automation and test processes, infrastructure</li> <li>Develop and maintain shared testing libraries</li> <li>Provide training, mentorship and support to other members on the team</li> <li>Conduct code reviews, improve and maintain quality of the automation code</li> <li>Document the automation framework, tools and infrastructure</li> </ul> <strong>Technical Skills Requirements:</strong>  <ul>   <li>Minimum 8 years of experience in software testing</li> <li>Minimum 5 years of experience in test development</li> <li>Strong understanding of Java or C# languages</li> <li>Strong understanding of testing practices in an agile environment</li> <li>Experience with web services technology such as REST, JSON or Thrift</li> <li>Experience with multi-threaded programming</li> <li>Experience with design patterns</li> </ul> <strong>Desirable:</strong>  <ul>   <li>Experience with big data technology such as Hadoop, MongoDB or Kafka</li> <li>Experience with network protocols such as HTTP, TLS and TCP</li> <li>Experience with continuous integration systems such as Bamboo or Jenkins</li> <li>Experience with continuous delivery concepts</li> </ul> <strong>To Apply:</strong> <br/><br/> Think you’re a great fit for this job? Apply today with your cover letter and resume in <strong>one PDF document</strong>. No phone calls please. Applicants must be eligible to work in Canada.
Title: Senior Software Development Engineer in Test (Backend)

Job_Description: RetslyAbout the roleZillow Group's Vancouver office is looking for an intermediate-senior level Backend Developer to join our talented team of engineers. We build tools and products that shape the real estate industry. This includes the chance to: <br/><br/> Build software solutions involving data at a massive scale <br/> Design RESTful APIs to service dozens of 3rd party applications <br/> Grow your career in a fun, fast-paced environmentAbout the teamWe are a small inventive tech startup located in Yaletown, Vancouver, BC. <br/> In 2014, our rapid success quickly caught the attention of the largest real-estate marketplace of the United States, Zillow Group. Since the acquisition, we now have the resources, benefits, work-life balance, and support of a Fortune organization, but the ability to still build innovative technology, learn new things, and have a massive impact. <br/> Join us for the unique opportunity to be part of a small start-up culture while still having the stability and perks of "big corporate".Who you are3+ years building backend software systems at scale <br/> Advanced knowledge in Javascript or other scripting languages <br/> Experience with both SQL and NoSQL databases <br/> Strong foundations in shell scripting <br/> Familiarity with Docker or other container technologies <br/> Experience provisioning Linux based AWS infrastructure <br/> Experience configuring CI/CD pipelines for containerized servicesGet to know usZillow Group houses a portfolio of the largest and most vibrant real estate and home-related brands on the web and mobile. Our mission is to build the largest, most trusted and vibrant home-related marketplace in the world.<br/><br/>Zillow Group is owned, fueled and grown by innovators who help people make better, smarter decisions around all things home. We encourage one another at every level, and our efforts are supported by employee-driven, world-class benefits that enable us to enjoy our lives outside the office while building fulfilling careers that impact millions of individuals every day. <br/><br/> Zillow Group is an equal opportunity employer committed to fostering an inclusive, innovative environment with the best employees. Therefore, we provide employment opportunities without regard to age, race, color, ancestry, national origin, religion, disability, sex, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, or any other protected status in accordance with applicable law. If there are preparations we can make to help ensure you have a comfortable and positive interview experience, please let us know.
Title: Software Developer

Job_Description: Requisition ID: 25859 <br/><br/> The Digital Factory is an innovation hub with a clear and well-supported mandate to transform the way banking technology is delivered, by re-imaging the customer experience, to deliver new digital value propositions. We have the support and experience of one of the world’s largest banks behind us and a talented, and growing, team of industry leaders driving us forward. <br/> Do you want to help us reinvent how people bank? At the Scotiabank Digital Factory, we are passionate about transforming the customer experience. <br/><br/> We're looking to fill our team with influencers, makers, creators and leaders who are flexible, curious, adventurous, versatile and responsive; and who are ready to roll up their sleeves in a collaborative and productive environment to get things done. As the Backend Java Developer, you'll be working on a Scrum team that is modernizing all of our services, building microservices on the cloud. <br/><br/>   <br/><br/> <strong>Are</strong> <strong>you</strong> <strong>the</strong> <strong>right</strong> <strong>person</strong> <strong>for</strong> <strong>this</strong> <strong>role?</strong> <ul> <li>You're not afraid to challenge the status quo</li><li>You have a deep pride in quality craftsmanship, with user-centered design, that delights customers</li><li>You're able to pivot and adapt to change</li><li>You spend your free time tinkering with new technologies or building apps on the side</li><li>You want to find a solution to real-life problems that will flip the multi-billion dollar financial industry on its head</li><li>High aptitude for diving in, taking ownership and picking up new things</li><li>Eager to mentor, teach and share your ideas in a team environment</li><li>Open and transparent communication, including the ability to distill technical details into human terms</li> </ul>   <br/><br/> <strong>Do you have the skills that will enable you to succeed in this role?</strong> <ul> <li>Experience programming in Java </li><li>Experience building scalable, enterprise-level technology stacks and web applications</li><li>Experience with any database, SQL and/or NoSQL</li><li>Experience with software architecture design and security design</li><li>Experience in leading a group of 3-5 software developers for software implementation <br/>  </li> </ul> <strong>What's in it for you?</strong> <ul> <li>We have an inclusive and collaborative working environment that encourages creativity, curiosity, and celebrates success!</li><li>We provide you with the tools and technology needed to create beautiful customer experiences</li><li>Dress codes don't apply here, being comfortable does</li><li>You'll get to work with and learn from diverse industry leaders, who have hailed from top technology companies around the world</li><li>This isn't your typical "corporate" job. We work hard and we have fun!</li><li>We offer a competitive total rewards package that includes a base salary, a performance bonus, company matching programs (on pension & profit sharing), 4 weeks of vacation, personal & sick days, paternity/maternity leave top-ups and much more.</li> </ul> Location(s): Canada : Ontario : Toronto  <br/><br/> As Canada’s international bank, we are a leader when it comes to inclusion. Scotiabankers hail from over 120 countries, speak more than 100 languages and serve over 23 million customers globally. As a highly diverse company, we know that an inclusive environment for employees and customers helps everyone achieve their best. We value the unique skills and experiences each individual brings to the bank, and are committed to creating and maintaining an inclusive and accessible environment for everyone. Candidates selected for an interview will be contacted directly. If you require accommodation during the recruitment and selection process, please let us know. We will work with you to provide a positive recruitment experience.
Title: Senior Java Developer, Digital Factory

Job_Description: At Interaxon, we develop engaging experiences using brain sensing technology. We are a passionate team of researchers, technical experts and scientists building the world’s leading science-based brain platform to empower personal transformation through human-centered innovation. Our flagship product is the Muse headband, a brain sensing headband that is designed to make meditation easier and provides real-time audio and visual feedback on your meditative state through the Muse companion app. More information is available at www.choosemuse.com. <br/><br/> As a <strong>Senior Cloud Developer</strong> at Interaxon, you’ll help us build APIs used by cross-platform mobile apps, revenue-generating web apps, and big data infrastructure that enables our neuroscientists to comb through our enormous brain data set. You are someone with a keen eye for detail, who thrives in a fast paced environment, and have extensive experience of architecting and building scalable distributed backend systems. <br/><br/> <strong>What you‘ll be doing:</strong>  <ul> <li>Architect and build scalable distributed backend systems.</li>  <li>Look out for and evaluate promising technologies/services most suitable for the task.</li>  <li>Test your code, ensuring high coverage and shipping features that you are proud of.</li>  <li>Collaborate with Product Managers and Designers to ensure the specifications make sense.</li>  <li>Review code from others in a collaborative way. No stone goes unturned.</li>  <li>Participate in Sprint rituals, especially story point estimation.</li>  <li>Share your opinion and experience in technical design sessions.</li>  <li>Bring your ideas to continuously improve our processes and practices.</li>  <li>Coach junior developers, raising the bar for everyone on the team.</li>  <li>Develop your craft as you learn something new and grow while on our team.</li> </ul> <strong>Your skills and experience:</strong>  <ul> <li>5+ years of experience working with cloud platforms, preferably Google Cloud, building large distributed systems</li>  <li>5+ years of experience with Python, Node, Go, PHP, or Ruby, working in a team environment.</li>  <li>Built applications using both SQL and NoSQL databases, has solid understanding of different design principles and trade-offs.</li>  <li>DevOps mindset, experience with operating code in production.</li>  <li>Expert in Git.</li>  <li>Experience with CI/CD tools.</li>  <li>Computer Science degree or similar degree.</li> </ul> <strong>What we offer:</strong> <br/><br/> Our collaborative and inclusive culture is an extension of our vision to empower personal transformation to improve lives and change the world. We have a flexible working environment, great benefits package, meditation space, onsite gym with subsidized membership, a kitchen full of snacks, a variety of food nearby on King Street / Queen Street, onsite bicycle parking and easy access to the TTC. Join a team passionate about making a difference!
Title: Senior Cloud Developer

Job_Description: <div>SparkLIT is looking for an exceptional intermediate to senior level front end web developer. HTML, you got it. CSS, you can SASS or LESS with ease (though we all know SASS is better, right?). Cross browser quirks, you love them. Server side code to make processes flow, no sweat. <br/><br/> Being a small team we look for people with a lot to contribute, you won’t be sitting in a corner doing the same thing every day. You will need strong analytical, design, and troubleshooting skills as well as the ability to collaborate and take ownership of projects. <br/><br/> We value independent thinkers, creativity, and people who can self-manage. With our rapid development cycle, you’ll continuously push code and see it working for millions of people. We openly encourage new ideas and concepts that will help increase our knowledge depth and allow the company to grow and expand. <br/><br/> We are looking for someone with excellent front end web dev skills...  <ul>   <li>with excellent problem solving and communication skills</li> <li>who enjoys working in a high-energy, slightly unstructured environment on small teams to design and build amazing products used by millions of people.</li> <li>who will help shape our engineering culture by improving our processes and codebases</li> <li>who has a history of constant learning and self-improvement</li> <li>who enjoys a wide variety of tasks, such as:</li>   <ul>   <li>Working with our designer to make an amazing front end to our powerful backend.</li> <li>Building interesting and useful interfaces</li> <li>and more!</li></ul>   </ul>  </div><br/>   <div>Some points we are looking for:  <ul>   <li>Exceptional ability to put together a web-based UI</li> <li>Strong working knowledge of PHP or other high-level languages</li> <li>Strong HTML/CSS skills</li> <li>Understanding of and ability to use asynchronous requests/AJAX/etc.</li> <li>Git version control</li> <li>Understanding of automation toolkits such as Gulp</li> <li>Understanding of CSS language extensions such as SASS or LESS</li> <li>Detail oriented and an appreciation of end-to-end testing</li> <li>Experience working with RESTful APIs would be an asset</li> <li>Champion of optimization and performance best practices</li> <li>Familiar with good software design practices</li> <li>Self-motivated and able to work in a small team with minimal supervision</li> <li>BSc or MSc Computer Science or related field, or related experience</li> <li>Solid team player</li> </ul>   </div><br/>   <div>Nice to have:  <ul>   <li>Working knowledge of Javascript libraries and MVC frameworks</li> </ul>   </div><br/>   <div>Position Location:  <ul>   <li>This posting is for a position working in our office in Victoria, BC.</li> </ul> SparkLIT is a rock solid SaaS operation with a creative team of developers, designers, and support staff dedicated to producing and supporting a suite of amazing web apps. We embrace a healthy work-life balance and random ping-pong challenges, but our passion is building seriously awesome software that our customers love.</div> <br/>

This Squad is responsible for creating our in-house CRM tool which our Customer Service Agents use on a daily basis. <strong>We work fast and need our code to do the same.</strong></em> <br/><br/> We are a group of passionate people who work hard and move quickly in the goal of redefining the flight shopping experience for the entire world. Job_Description: We are looking to add a SalesForce & CPQ Platform Developer (Technical Analyst) focused on day to day oversight of ClearSlide & Corel’s Salesforce.com ecosystem. This is a highly strategic role that will have direct (measurable!) impact on the focus areas (ClearSlide’s Quote to Cash and Corel’s B2B sales ecosystem). Ultimately it Is your job to ensure there is clean data flowing through the various systems that will enable effective sales and never would a system or backend limitation come in the way of sales success. <br/><br/> This is a highly technical role that will interface with our business sponsors on daily basis. You will become a resident technical expert on our CRM (Salesforce), marketing automation (Marketo), CPQ (Tyso) & Billing Subscription (Zuora), as well as our customer success (Gainsight) platforms and a few other bells and whistles within Salesforce that come with some years of customization. This role will work closely with the rest of the Sales & Business Operations team to ensure consistency across processes and systems that are being followed by the entire business. <br/><br/> <strong><u>You Will</u></strong><strong></strong> <ul> <li>Drive and implement a Salesforce development lifecycle including but not limited to standard practices, QA and code reviews. Perform development, testing, implementation and documentation as it relates to Salesforce.com software and the Force.com platform.</li> <li>Design and implement enhancements including creation of custom objects, pages, Apex classes, triggers, processes, flows, workflows, reports, etc.</li> <li>Design, develop and maintain Visualforce, AppExchange, Force.com pages and integration with on-premise or third party solutions using web services, APIs, etc.</li> <li>Perform system administration including administering user accounts, security roles, profiles, workflows, etc.</li> <li>Enforcement and assistance of all Governance (including but not limited to Security and Compliance)</li> <li>Drive and implement a Salesforce development lifecycle including but not limited to standard practices, QA and code reviews.</li> <li>Develop and complete unit test scripts, to develop user acceptance test scripts, to develop resulting deployment packages and any applicable training materials</li> <li>Develop and maintain all system documentation.</li> <li>Communicate ideas clearly, both orally and in writing, to executive staff, business sponsors, business analysts and technical resources in concise language that is the parlance of each group.</li> <li>Develop custom applications using Salesforce.com and integrating Salesforce.com with other systems like NetSuite, Docusign etc</li> <li>As a Developer for our Salesforce platform you will work on a variety of projects related to our growing business. In addition to Apex and Visualforce, you will also work extensively with SQL, HTML/CSS, and JavaScript.</li> </ul> <strong><u>You Have</u></strong><ul> <li>A Bachelors degree with 7+ years of experience or, an equivalent combination of education and experience sufficient to successfully perform the essential functions of the job.</li> <li>7+ years of CRM experience</li> <li>3+ years of Salesforce platform experience</li> <li>Extensive experience with Salesforce Sales, Enterprise, Lightning & Service Cloud offerings</li> <li>Extensive development experience using Apex, Visualforce, etc.</li> <li>Proven ability to design and optimize business processes and integrate business processes across multiple systems</li> <li>Competent to work at the highest technical level of all phases of the Application Development Life Cycle</li> <li>Experience leading a development team through the project life cycle, be it internally or external consultants.</li> <li>Attends training and/or industry seminars as appropriate, to stay abreast of current technologies, trends and directions</li> <li>Strong organizational skills, quick responsiveness, and act with a sense of urgency</li> <li>Excellent data analytics skills and attention to detail.</li> <li>Experience with any of the following tools a nice to have: Zendesk, data.com, Jira, Tyso</li> <li>DocuSign, GainSight, Zuora and NetSuite are <strong><u>MUST</u></strong> have skills</li> <li>Bonus Points: Salesforce.com Certified Platform Developer II</li> </ul> It is the policy and practice of the Company to offer equal employment opportunities to all qualified applicants and employees without regard to race, color, age, religion, national origin, sex, political affiliation, sexual orientation, marital status, disability, veteran status, genetics, or any other protected characteristic. <br/><br/> Corel offers a competitive compensation and benefits package<br/><br/>
Title: Salesforce Developers with CPQ

Bring your dog to work!</li> <li>A competitive salary including a bonus</li> </ul> <p> </p> <p>Please visit our website at www.matchboxhr.com, the job is also posted on our Career Portal at http://www.matchboxhr.com/careerportal/#/jobs/2030.</p> <p> </p> <p>FOLLOW MatchBox on LinkedIn at https://www.linkedin.com/company/matchbox-recruitment/</p> <p> </p> <p>Headquartered in downtown Vancouver and serving clients nationally, MatchBox is a recruitment and solutions firm that specializes in the fields of IT & Technology, Engineering & Technical and Accounting & Finance. <br> <br> We offer unrivaled expertise with a team that has many years of experience in the recruitment and professional services industry. Title: Back End Developer

Job_Description: PayByPhone is looking to hire a Software Developer to join our growing platform development team to design and develop major components of the backend APIs that power our consumer apps. <br/><br/> As a Software Developer at PayByPhone, you will work in an agile development environment with multiple production deployments per week and work closely with other developers and domain experts. <br/><br/> You take pride and ownership of the quality work you and your team create, you are inquisitive and enjoy solving challenging technical problems, and you are always willing to lend a helping hand. <br/><br/> <strong>You will:</strong>  <ul> <li>Write and test-drive code for new features and bugfixes</li>   <li>Participate in designing and developing automated test suites, refining acceptance criteria, and establishing test plans with your team</li> <li>Participate in code reviews to share knowledge and learn from other team members, ensure code quality, and maintain compliance with industry regulations</li> <li>Build and deploy software through an automated CI/CD pipeline, help refine the process continuously</li> <li>Provision and maintain cloud infrastructure for your teams products</li> <li>Monitor the success of your teams products through application and system metrics</li> <li>Contribute to technical documentation</li> <li>Have full ownership of the systems you and your team develop. This includes monitoring, investigating issues, and supporting the service during outages</li> <li>Track time according to company policy</li> </ul> <strong>You have:</strong>  <ul> <li>2 + years experience designing and developing clean, maintainable software that stands up to real-world users and production conditions</li> <li>Experienced coding ability and familiarity with several languages such as C#, Java, Node.JS, Go, Python, Ruby</li> <li>Worked in an agile development environment using processes like Kanban or Scrum</li> <li>Experience with automated unit testing, and an interest in techniques such as TDD and BDD</li> <li>Excellent understanding of software engineering principles</li> </ul> <strong>It would be nice if you had:</strong>  <ul> <li>Bachelors degree in Computer Science or Software Engineering</li> <li>Experience with cloud applications like AWS/Azure</li> <li>Experience with service-oriented or microservices architecture</li> </ul> <strong>Working For PayByPhone</strong> <br/><br/> PayByPhone values collaboration, innovation, learning, and fun.  <ul> <li>We encourage each other to try out new ideas and adopt the ones that work.</li> <li>We are culturally diverse.</li> <li>We deeply value supporting a flexible work/life balance.</li> <li>We invest in professional growth. We attend conferences such as AWS re:Invent, ng-conf, .NET Fringe, HashiConf, and more!</li> <li>We have company-sponsored social events and are well-represented in local events, such as the Sun Run and Bike to Work weeks.</li> </ul>  <strong>About PayByPhone</strong><br/><br/>PayByPhone is one of the fastest-growing mobile payment companies in the world. We process over 70 million parking, transit, and bike-share transactions a year in cities across North America, Europe and Australia. PayByPhone helps millions of consumers easily and securely pay for parking and transportation without the hassles of waiting in line, carrying change, or risking costly fines. <br/><br/> Cities such as San Francisco, Seattle, Miami, Vancouver, London, and Paris have entrusted PayByPhone with driving their parking operations forward, through unrivaled uptime and reliability, 24/7/365 customer support, seamless integrations, and deep data insights. With our recent acquisition by Volkswagen Financial Services, part of the largest auto manufacturing group in the world, PayByPhone has access to unmatched marketing resources, funding, and drivers. <br/><br/> By helping transportation agencies and parking operators tap into the latest advancements in secure mobile payment, data analysis, and location technologies, PayByPhone reduces costs while increasing revenue. To learn more, visit www.paybyphone.com or download our app for iOS or Android.
Title: Software Developer

Job_Description: We are looking to add a SalesForce & CPQ Platform Developer (Technical Analyst) focused on day to day oversight of ClearSlide & Corel’s Salesforce.com ecosystem. This is a highly strategic role that will have direct (measurable!) impact on the focus areas (ClearSlide’s Quote to Cash and Corel’s B2B sales ecosystem). Ultimately it Is your job to ensure there is clean data flowing through the various systems that will enable effective sales and never would a system or backend limitation come in the way of sales success. <br/><br/> This is a highly technical role that will interface with our business sponsors on daily basis. You will become a resident technical expert on our CRM (Salesforce), marketing automation (Marketo), CPQ (Tyso) & Billing Subscription (Zuora), as well as our customer success (Gainsight) platforms and a few other bells and whistles within Salesforce that come with some years of customization. This role will work closely with the rest of the Sales & Business Operations team to ensure consistency across processes and systems that are being followed by the entire business. <br/><br/> <strong><u>You Will</u></strong><strong></strong> <ul> <li>Drive and implement a Salesforce development lifecycle including but not limited to standard practices, QA and code reviews. Perform development, testing, implementation and documentation as it relates to Salesforce.com software and the Force.com platform.</li> <li>Design and implement enhancements including creation of custom objects, pages, Apex classes, triggers, processes, flows, workflows, reports, etc.</li> <li>Design, develop and maintain Visualforce, AppExchange, Force.com pages and integration with on-premise or third party solutions using web services, APIs, etc.</li> <li>Perform system administration including administering user accounts, security roles, profiles, workflows, etc.</li> <li>Enforcement and assistance of all Governance (including but not limited to Security and Compliance)</li> <li>Drive and implement a Salesforce development lifecycle including but not limited to standard practices, QA and code reviews.</li> <li>Develop and complete unit test scripts, to develop user acceptance test scripts, to develop resulting deployment packages and any applicable training materials</li> <li>Develop and maintain all system documentation.</li> <li>Communicate ideas clearly, both orally and in writing, to executive staff, business sponsors, business analysts and technical resources in concise language that is the parlance of each group.</li> <li>Develop custom applications using Salesforce.com and integrating Salesforce.com with other systems like NetSuite, Docusign etc</li> <li>As a Developer for our Salesforce platform you will work on a variety of projects related to our growing business. In addition to Apex and Visualforce, you will also work extensively with SQL, HTML/CSS, and JavaScript.</li> </ul> <strong><u>You Have</u></strong><ul> <li>A Bachelors degree with 7+ years of experience or, an equivalent combination of education and experience sufficient to successfully perform the essential functions of the job.</li> <li>7+ years of CRM experience</li> <li>3+ years of Salesforce platform experience</li> <li>Extensive experience with Salesforce Sales, Enterprise, Lightning & Service Cloud offerings</li> <li>Extensive development experience using Apex, Visualforce, etc.</li> <li>Proven ability to design and optimize business processes and integrate business processes across multiple systems</li> <li>Competent to work at the highest technical level of all phases of the Application Development Life Cycle</li> <li>Experience leading a development team through the project life cycle, be it internally or external consultants.</li> <li>Attends training and/or industry seminars as appropriate, to stay abreast of current technologies, trends and directions</li> <li>Strong organizational skills, quick responsiveness, and act with a sense of urgency</li> <li>Excellent data analytics skills and attention to detail.</li> <li>Experience with any of the following tools a nice to have: Zendesk, data.com, Jira, Tyso</li> <li>DocuSign, GainSight, Zuora and NetSuite are <strong><u>MUST</u></strong> have skills</li> <li>Bonus Points: Salesforce.com Certified Platform Developer II</li> </ul> It is the policy and practice of the Company to offer equal employment opportunities to all qualified applicants and employees without regard to race, color, age, religion, national origin, sex, political affiliation, sexual orientation, marital status, disability, veteran status, genetics, or any other protected characteristic. <br/><br/> Corel offers a competitive compensation and benefits package<br/><br/>
Title: Salesforce Developers with CPQ

Job_Description: As a Senior Full Stack Developer at Universe, you will apply your passion for technology and live events in your quest to build a world-class Event Ticketing platform. In this deeply technical and business-minded position, youll architect, implement, and evolve our frontend and backend systems with a talented team of like-minded peers. As a senior developer with great influence on our product, youll be challenged with the rewarding tasks of understanding our customers with strong empathy, curating an amazing product experience, and championing our vision to new heights. <br/><br/> <strong>What your day would look like:</strong>  <ul> <li>Writing new application code for our core product API and client (especially transactional pieces)</li> <li>Advocating best practices for development and testing</li> <li>Performance profiling new and existing features in both our server processes and in the browser</li> <li>Mentoring junior developers on the team and promoting skill growth</li> </ul> <strong>What were looking for:</strong>  <ul> <li>Experience with patterns-based web servers like: Ruby on Rails, Sinatra, Django, Flask, Express, Phoenix, Spring</li> <li>Experience with a scripting language like: Ruby, Python, Javascript</li> <li>Experience with a client-side web application framework like: React, Ember, Angular, Backbone</li> <li>Experience with a persistent data store like: PostgreSQL, Monogo, Redis, MySQL, SQL Server, Elasticsearch</li>  </ul> <strong>Nice to have:</strong>  <ul> <li>Hands-on experience in DevOps and running microservices in production at Web Scale</li> <li>A flair for visually designing beautiful products and user experiences</li> <li>Can effortlessly navigate sophisticated databases and external APIs</li> </ul> <strong>You should work at Universe if:</strong>  <ul> <li>Youre a hacker at heart who lovingly crafts elegant solutions with pride</li> <li>You are an independent, fast-learning, self-starter who takes ownership over solving hard problems</li> <li>Youre energetic, passionate, and driven</li> </ul> <strong>Here's why you'll love working at Universe:</strong>  <ul> <li>You'll work with veteran engineers, who will challenge you to ship frequently</li> <li>You'll work with amazing designers, who will challenge you to implement beautiful interactions and user interfaces</li> <li>You'll be at the helm of your own career, shaping it with your own innovative contributions to a nascent team and product</li> <li>You'll enjoy the culture and perks of a startup, with the stability of a fortune 500 company. Perks include local sake and cold brew coffee on tap, 2 tickets to see a concert of your choice every year, unlimited access to Amphitheatre shows in North America for you and a friend, and 4 weeks vacation (2 weeks during the Christmas holidays & 2 weeks of your choice)</li>  </ul>
Title: Senior Full Stack Developer

Job_Description: Mazu is a youth engagement company helping professional sports teams across the major leagues as well as other large brands communicate with their younger audience. Through the use of our B2B and B2C products Mazu’s mission is to reconnect brands and families. We take a value based approach in delivering innovative and engaging content and solutions. <br/><br/> The staff at Mazu enjoy a fun, open and energetic atmosphere. Most of our team is located in Kelowna, BC with a sprinkling of remote workers throughout North America. Our clients are some of the most interesting brands and are eager to try new innovative solutions. <br/><br/> You will work on the full stack, front end to backend to create dynamically driven mobile applications. You will work with the latest mobile technologies like Ionic, Cordova, IOS, Android and Progressive Web Applications. Responsibilities will include (but are not limited to): requirements, systems analysis, code creation, unit testing, feature planning and technical documentation. Code must be designed per responsive mobile design techniques to run across a wide range of devices. <br/><br/> Requirements  <ul>  <li>5+ years hands-on experience building highly scalable, secure, robust mobile applications.</li>    <li>Extensive experience with Angular and Node.</li>    <li>Familiar with mobile cross platform development tools like Cordova / Ionic</li>    <li>Wide experience in the handling and writing of APIs and JSON data structures</li>    <li>Proven experience in backend systems design</li>    <li>Must be able to take initiative, work independently and be innovative</li>    <li>Demonstrated ability to meet project timelines and collaborate in a small team</li>    </ul> Desired Skills  <ul>  <li>Worked Android and IOS OS Applications</li>    <li>Experience working with MySQL database design and administration</li>    <li>Experience working with Typescript.</li>    <li>Basic knowledge of Progressive Web Apps</li>    <li>Experience working with HTML, CSS, XML, JQuery and MVC Frameworks</li>    <li>Familiar with Agile Methodologies (SCRUM)</li>    <li>Solid understanding of the full mobile development life cycle</li>    <li>Experience in testing and debugging</li>    <li>Experience working with JIRA and Confluence</li>    </ul> What You Will Be Doing  <ul>  <li>Design and develop world-class applications based on requirements generated by the, business stake holders as well as technology department staff</li>    <li>Integrate newly developed apps with existing software</li>    </ul>
Title: Senior Software Developer

skills...  <ul>   <li>with excellent problem solving and communication skills</li> <li>who enjoys working in a high-energy, slightly unstructured environment on small teams to design and build amazing products used by millions of people.</li> <li>who will help shape our engineering culture by improving our processes and codebases</li> <li>who has a history of constant learning and self-improvement</li> <li>who enjoys a wide variety of tasks, such as:</li>   <ul>   <li>Working with our designer to make an amazing front end to our powerful backend.</li> <li>Building interesting and useful interfaces</li> <li>and more!</li></ul>   </ul>  </div><br/>   <div>Some points we are looking for:  <ul>   <li>Exceptional ability to put together a web-based UI</li> <li>Strong working knowledge of PHP or other high-level languages</li> <li>Strong HTML/CSS skills</li> <li>Understanding of and ability to use asynchronous requests/AJAX/etc.</li> <li>Git version control</li> <li>Understanding of automation toolkits such as Gulp</li> <li>Understanding of CSS language extensions such as SASS or LESS</li> <li>Detail oriented and an appreciation of end-to-end testing</li> <li>Experience working with RESTful APIs would be an asset</li> <li>Champion of optimization and performance best practices</li> <li>Familiar with good software design practices</li> <li>Self-motivated and able to work in a small team with minimal supervision</li> <li>BSc or MSc Computer Science or related field, or related experience</li> <li>Solid team player</li> </ul>   </div><br/>   <div>Nice to have:  <ul>   <li>Working knowledge of Javascript libraries and MVC frameworks</li> </ul>   </div><br/>   <div>Position Location:  <ul>   <li>This posting is for a position working in our office in Victoria, BC.</li> </ul> SparkLIT is a rock solid SaaS operation with a creative team of developers, designers, and support staff dedicated to producing and supporting a suite of amazing web apps. We embrace a healthy work-life balance and random ping-pong challenges, but our passion is building seriously awesome software that our customers love.</div> <br/>

Job_Description: <strong>Groundswell Cloud Solutions</strong> is a rapidly-growing boutique consulting firm located in the heart of Vancouver. We were founded in 2012 by a long-time veteran of Salesforce.com who delivered Professional Services and managed a team of Technical Architects at the SFDC headquarters in San Francisco before returning to his native Vancouver. <br/><br/> The <strong>Groundswell</strong> culture is shaped by passion-driven innovation, teamwork and a relentless pursuit of quality. We collaborate globally with top-tier professionals in the field to provide ingenious and elegant cloud-based technical solutions for our clients’ business needs. We are passionate about seeing people empowered to realize their full potential, and we pursue that goal for our clients, team members and young entrepreneurs in our local community. <br/><br/> We also offer the experience of being an integral part of a fast-growing, agile team working on cutting-edge projects. This is an exciting time at Groundswell, and you have a unique opportunity to be a valued influencer of our company culture and growth. <br/><br/> Check out our team video: https://www.gscloudsolutions.com/careers<br/> <div><strong>Responsibilities</strong><br/> <div>   <ul> <li>Use your Salesforce expertise to build tailored custom solutions</li>  <li>Apply your strong coding experience/expertise Apex, Lightning, front-end, backend code</li>  <li>Create mock-ups, data models, slide presentations, pseudo code, and process flows</li>  <li>Perform Data Migrations from source to target system including: data strategy, data mapping, SQL scripts and ETL processes</li>  <li>Integrate Salesforce.com with various other systems using standard ETL tools customizations to meet customer requirements</li>  <li>Produce quality deliverables within hard deadlines under minimal guidance</li>  <li>Contribute to internal strategic projects</li> </ul>  </div> </div><br/>  <div><strong>Required Skills / Experience</strong>  <ul> <li>Minimum of 2 years experience in software design, systems integration and software development</li>  <li>Consulting background is greatly preferred</li>  <li>Structured development approach: Object Oriented Design & Programming, SCRUM / Agile methodologies, Design-Build-Test-Deploy</li>  <li>Strong Programming background: preferably Computer Science degree, experience with common cloud-based technologies/languages: Javascript, JS Libraries (e.g. jQuery, Angular, Ext JS), Bootstrap, LESS, CSS, HTML5, Node.js, SOAP and REST web services, OAUTH, SSO, APIs, Java, Ruby</li>  <li>Salesforce.com Certifications: Administrator, Developer and Advanced Developer certifications highly desired</li>  <li>Salesforce.com/Force.com experience: Apex, Visualforce, APIs (SOAP, REST, Meta-data, Streaming, Bulk), Declarative features</li>  <li>Data migration experience: Data mapping, Data conversions, Data cleansing and transformation</li>  <li>Data Tools: MS Sql Server, Oracle, MySql, mySQL, Postgres, BI Tools, Unstructured Data (e.g. NoSQL)</li>  <li>Integration Tools: Informatica Cloud, Boomi, Cast Iron, Pervasive, Jitterbit, Talend, SSIS</li>  <li>Ability to research answers and solve problems independently</li>  <li>Excellent written and verbal communication</li>  <li>Outstanding time degree). Business minor focus is preferred</li> </ul>  </div><br/>  <div><strong>Compensation</strong>  <ul> <li>Work visa sponsorship to Canada</li>   <li>Competitive salary</li>  <li>Target-based bonus</li>  <li>MSP and Extended Health Benefits (Eye exams, Dental, Accidental, Travel) for you, your spouse and your children</li>  <li>15 days paid time-off plus 10 days BC Statutory Holidays</li>  <li>Your own designated sit-stand workstation, Macbook with 1-2 monitors</li>  <li>Sponsored Salesforce certifications</li>   <li>Friday retrospectives with happy hour!</li>  <li>Great office views of mountains and waterfront!</li>  <li>Lunch & Learn sessions</li>  <li>Beverages and snacks from the kitchen</li>  <li>On-site gym pass with shower facilities</li>  <li>Bike locker if you want to bike to work</li> </ul>  </div> <br/>
