Title: Android Developer

Job_Description: <div>League is the digital alternative to traditional health insurance. Led by serial entrepreneur and Kobo founder Michael Serbinis, we are bringing much-needed innovation to the stagnant health care industry. League enables employers to give employees access to health and wellness spending accounts, flexible and cost-effective group insurance plans and workplace health services, all through our website and mobile apps. Our mission is to help people live healthier, happier lives every day.</div> <br/> <div>Were looking for a platform developer to help build the tools and systems that enable our development team to regularly and reliably ship products to our customers. In this role, you will work as part of a small team of developers to deliver and manage the infrastructure underlying our platform, as well as the tooling and automation needed to enable a DevOps culture across our organization. This means working closely with our product delivery teams to understand their bottlenecks, and to mentor them on operational ownership.</div><br/> <div>Our platform and applications run on Google Cloud. We build backend services with Go and MongoDB, a web frontend with React and Redux, and native Android and iOS applications. We ship code to production multiple times per week, and were always looking to improve both the quality and speed of our releases.</div><br/> <div>You may not have expertise in our particular programming languages or technologies, but thats okay. Whats important to League is your ability to take ownership and solve problems, as well as your collaborative spirit and drive for professional growth.</div>You Will  <ul> <li>Build and maintain Leagues server infrastructure, following infrastructure-as-code principles</li><li>Develop tools to support continuous delivery and developer empowerment</li><li>Diagnose and resolve production issues with software development teams</li><li>Participate in an on-call rotation, including incident management</li><li>Live our team values of ownership, pragmatism, cooperation, and empathy for our customers</li> </ul>  About You  <ul> <li>Youre knowledgeable about cloud-based infrastructure</li><li>You have experience with configuration management and deployment automation</li><li>Youre comfortable working in at least one programming language</li><li>You have a focus on security in the delivery of all levels of a system</li><li>When things break, youre eager and able to help fix things</li> </ul>  Nice to Have  <ul> <li>Experience with Google Cloud and/or Docker</li><li>Experience in a startup environment</li> </ul>  <div>Does this sound like you? Wed love to hear from you. Submit your application and someone from our recruitment team will be in touch.</div><br/> <div>We believe that diverse teams perform better, and that fostering an inclusive work environment is a key part of growing a successful team. We welcome people of diverse backgrounds, experiences, and perspectives. We are an equal opportunity employer, and we are committed to working with applicants requesting accommodation at any stage of the hiring process.</div>
Title: Platform Developer

Job_Description: <strong>Who You Are</strong> <br/><br/> You are a passionate Software Developer, with 3-5 years of application development experience, who can easily switch between the front-end and back-end. You're comfortable collaborating in small teams to design, build and ship high-quality software and are familiar with iterating in an agile fashion. <br/><br/> You enjoy working closely with designers, product managers, and other stakeholders to build both awesome UI/UX components, as well as backend services and APIs. You have experience liaising and collaborating with other departments in determining requirements and specifications. <br/><br/> You love to learn and improve and have a passion for technology and writing code. <br/><br/> You want to join us in using technology to build the next generation of products that enable organizations to power human connections at scale. <br/><br/> You thrive in working collaboratively with a small team of passionate and skilled developers. Youre excited by working on a diverse range of high-value projects across multiple product areas and have a passion for product and conversion optimization. <br/><br/> You are super smart and have a BSc, BCS, BASc or comparable degree in a relevant program, or have equivalent work experience. <br/><br/> <strong>Youre Great at...</strong>  <ul> <li>Working on high-volume, highly available, scalable and extensible websites/applications</li> <li>Web foundations - HTML, CSS and Javascript</li> <li>You have a fundamental understanding of Object Oriented concepts and MVC frameworks</li> <li>Working with REST APIs</li> <li>Writing tests to ensure quality in your code</li> <li>Optimizing and applying best practices</li> <li>Learning and evolving your technical capabilities</li> <li>Working in a fast paced and continuously evolving environment</li> </ul> <strong>Bonus Points</strong>  <ul> <li>Knowledge of Unix based systems</li> <li>Experience with Go and/or Python</li> <li>Experience with infrastructure orchestration and/or infrastructure as code (Ansible, Terraform, Docker, Kubernetes, etc.)</li> <li>Experience with React, ES6, Angular</li> <li>Experience in an agile environment and methodologies</li> <li>You have open source contributions or personal projects youve shipped successfully</li> </ul> <em>Hootsuite is an inclusive employer. Every effort will be made to provide accommodations requested by candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process.</em> <br/><br/> #LI-TG1
Title: Software Developer

Job_Description: Full-Time Position - Markham <br/><br/> Hiring a full-time Full Stack Developer in Markham, ON! Our client is looking for a full stack developer for a full-time perm opportunity. As a member of their product development team, you will involved in the development of web-based applications that are critical to the support of their cloud-based customer services. <br/><br/> Perks You'll Love   <ul> <li>Innovative Company</li> <li>Collaborative environment</li> <li>Dynamic team with leading industry experience</li> </ul>  What You're Bringing   <ul> <li>Minimum of 4 years of relevant development experience</li> <li>Strong experience in object-oriented programming</li> <li>Experience in C#, C++, Java or similar languages</li> <li>Front-end development using modern JavaScript frameworks/libraries such as AngularJS, React</li> <li>Experience with backend integration using HTTP REST-based API</li> <li>Strong communication skills</li> <li>Bachelors degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, or related disciplines</li> </ul>  Bonus Skills We'd Love to See   <ul> <li>Experience building distributed applications for the cloud.</li> <li>Knowledge in microservices</li> <li>Continuous Integration</li> </ul>  We Are An Equal Opportunity Employer <br/> All qualified applicants will receive equal consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status. <br/><br/> Canadian Work Authorization <br/> All applicants MUST be authorized to work in Canada. Any applicants not meeting this criteria will not be notified and will not be considered eligible for the position.
Title: Full Stack Developer

Job_Description: <div><div><strong>**Please note that applications will not be reviewed until the week of January 8, 2018. Thank you for patience over the holidays!**</strong> </div><br/> <div>Shopify is the world’s fastest growing commerce platform and we have no plans to slow down. We’re on a mission to scale our platform while simultaneously improving performance, reliability, and resiliency. To do this, we need the help of dedicated, methodical, and versatile engineers.</div> <br/> <div>Shopify is the longest continuously developed Rails app on the planet. Many core Rails features were actually developed at Shopify, and we’re constantly improving our codebase to make it better or leaner. We’re looking for backend developers with a passion for solving tough problems with performant code. If you’re interested in helping us build the future of Shopify this job’s for you. We ship on quality instead of on time. Our teams deploy new code many times a day, and our production scale is massive. We host tens of thousands of online stores, and see hundreds of millions of requests a day. Thousands of merchants will see your work within seconds – a tough but incredibly rewarding responsibility.</div></div>  <br/><strong><div><div>You'll need to have:</strong>  <ul>   <ul> <li>Technical leadership and/or management experience</li><li>A commitment and drive for quality, excellence and results</li><li>A passion for helping growing development teams and making others better</li><li>Proficiency with UNIX commands</li><li>Experience with relational databases and SQL (we’re mostly on MySQL with some Postgres)</li><li>Experience building and scaling user-focused web applications</li></ul>   </ul>  </div></div><div><div>It'd be great if you have experience with:  <ul>   <ul> <li>Experience with Rails OR the desire to learn it quickly</li><li>Experience contributing to our community through code, documentation, mentoring, teaching, speaking, or organizing events</li></ul>   </ul>  </div><div><div>You'll be working on things like:</strong>  <ul>   <ul> <li>Writing back-end code in Ruby and possibly Go</li><li>Learning and growing constantly to feed your passion for self-improvement and make those around you better</li><li>Providing beautiful and fast code that improves our code base in meaningful ways</li><li>Using TDD to write well-tested code</li><li>Fixing bugs fast and taking your time to solve hard problems well</li><li>Contributing back to the open source community</li><li>Collaborating with other Shopify leaders and executives to shape the vision of Shopify Discounts engine</li></ul>   </ul>  </div></div><div> <div><strong>Here's how to apply:</strong></div><br/> <div>If you’re interested in helping us shape the future of commerce, click the “Apply now” button to submit your application. Please address your cover letter to Leah.</div><br/> <div><strong>Experience comes in many forms, many skills are transferable, and passion goes a long way. If your experience is this close to what we’re looking for, consider applying. We know that diversity of thought makes for the best problem-solving and creative thinking, which is why we're dedicated to adding new perspectives to the team and encourage everyone to apply.</strong></div></div></div>
Title: Lead Software Developer

Job_Description: At Interaxon, we develop engaging experiences using brain sensing technology. We are a passionate team of researchers, technical experts and scientists building the world’s leading science-based brain platform to empower personal transformation through human-centered innovation. Our flagship product is the Muse headband, a brain sensing headband that is designed to make meditation easier and provides real-time audio and visual feedback on your meditative state through the Muse companion app. More information is available at www.choosemuse.com. <br/><br/> As a <strong>Senior Cloud Developer</strong> at Interaxon, you’ll help us build APIs used by cross-platform mobile apps, revenue-generating web apps, and big data infrastructure that enables our neuroscientists to comb through our enormous brain data set. You are someone with a keen eye for detail, who thrives in a fast paced environment, and have extensive experience of architecting and building scalable distributed backend systems. <br/><br/> <strong>What you‘ll be doing:</strong>  <ul> <li>Architect and build scalable distributed backend systems.</li>  <li>Look out for and evaluate promising technologies/services most suitable for the task.</li>  <li>Test your code, ensuring high coverage and shipping features that you are proud of.</li>  <li>Collaborate with Product Managers and Designers to ensure the specifications make sense.</li>  <li>Review code from others in a collaborative way. No stone goes unturned.</li>  <li>Participate in Sprint rituals, especially story point estimation.</li>  <li>Share your opinion and experience in technical design sessions.</li>  <li>Bring your ideas to continuously improve our processes and practices.</li>  <li>Coach junior developers, raising the bar for everyone on the team.</li>  <li>Develop your craft as you learn something new and grow while on our team.</li> </ul> <strong>Your skills and experience:</strong>  <ul> <li>5+ years of experience working with cloud platforms, preferably Google Cloud, building large distributed systems</li>  <li>5+ years of experience with Python, Node, Go, PHP, or Ruby, working in a team environment.</li>  <li>Built applications using both SQL and NoSQL databases, has solid understanding of different design principles and trade-offs.</li>  <li>DevOps mindset, experience with operating code in production.</li>  <li>Expert in Git.</li>  <li>Experience with CI/CD tools.</li>  <li>Computer Science degree or similar degree.</li> </ul> <strong>What we offer:</strong> <br/><br/> Our collaborative and inclusive culture is an extension of our vision to empower personal transformation to improve lives and change the world. We have a flexible working environment, great benefits package, meditation space, onsite gym with subsidized membership, a kitchen full of snacks, a variety of food nearby on King Street / Queen Street, onsite bicycle parking and easy access to the TTC. Join a team passionate about making a difference!
Title: Senior Cloud Developer

Job_Description: <strong>Snapshot</strong> <br/><br/> Employment Term: Full-time <br/> Experience: 5+ Years <br/> Location: Toronto, ON <br/><br/> <strong>Overview:</strong> <br/><br/> Loopio is looking for intelligent and passionate Senior Front-end Software Developers to join our growing technology team. Youll help push the front-end technology and architecture to deliver a world-class product that customers love. <br/><br/> <strong>Details</strong> <br/><br/> <u>Design</u>  <ul> <li>You understand the basics of good UX and design and collaborate closely with the UX team. At Loopio, we believe developers should have a lot of input in what they create. The Development and UX teams work as tight unit where all opinions are heard and valued.</li> <li>You have eagle eyes and notice when things arent pixel perfect</li> <li>You can break down visual UI mockups or sketches in terms of re-usable front-end components</li> <li>You have high standards for clean code and for how your UI components are organized and tested</li> </ul> <u>Javascript</u>  <ul> <li>You have a strong understanding of JS fundamentals. You know how and when to use things like this, prototypes, and closures</li> <li>Youve probably read Dougie Crockfords Javascript: The Good Parts!</li> <li>You have successfully built reusable plugins</li> </ul> <u>Frameworks and Tools</u>  <ul> <li>Youve mastered a Javascript framework like Angular or React and have a preference for using one over the other. You arent afraid to debate us on this!</li> <li>You understand how to build a good front-end pipeline and can offer suggestions about what tools to use</li> </ul> <u>CSS & HTML</u>  <ul> <li>You have strong opinions on how stylesheets should be organized. Youve probably heard of BEM or SMACSS and have a preference for what strategy is best</li> <li>You've replaced vanilla css stylesheets with a SASS or LESS framework in the past</li> <li>You have battled some of the common browser gotchas and found good solutions</li> </ul> <u>Mentorship</u>  <ul> <li>Youre a natural teacher and see the value in showing the team new technologies and ideas</li> <li>You genuinely care about the team and their career growth</li> <li>You are able to talk about technology with others. Regardless of team or role, you can break down technical jargon and acronym soup</li> </ul> <u>Performance</u>  <ul> <li>You are a front-end debugging wizard and are comfortable with a variety of browsers and tools</li> <li>You are the first person to call out the low hanging front-end performance issues and propose great solutions</li> <li>You push the team to prioritize front-end tech debt</li> </ul> <u>API & Backend</u>  <ul> <li>You understand how to write a good API and particularly how it relates to your front-end design</li> </ul> <strong>Skills & Requirements:</strong>  <ul> <li>University degree or equivalent</li> <li>5+ years in development roles of increasing responsibility</li> <li>2+ years experience with a front-end framework (React, Angular etc.)</li> <li>Experience with front-end testing frameworks (e.g. Jest)</li> <li>Experience with Agile Software Development</li> <li>A great eye for UX and design</li> <li>Expert Javascript skills</li> <li>Experience with a front-end framework like Angular or React</li> <li>React experience is a ++</li> <li>Experience working a multi-tenant SaaS platform is a ++</li> </ul> <strong>Perks</strong>  <ul> <li>You'll have a manager who coaches you through goal setting, frequent 1-on-1s, and real-time feedback</li> <li>Youll have tons of autonomy and responsibility; we have a results-driven environment</li> <li>Youll work in the heart of Torontos famous and trendy King West neighbourhood</li> <li>Youll learn more than you thought was possible; our team is obsessed with personal and professional growth (we even have a Loopio Book Club)</li> <li>Youll have a piece of the pie; every Loopio employee participates in our stock option plan!</li> <li>Youll participate in a health and benefits plan that kicks in on day one!</li> </ul>
Title: Senior Front-End Software Developer

Job_Description: <p><strong>About Pepper.com:</strong> <br>Pepper.com, the world’s largest shopping community, was founded in 2014. Through international partnerships and conversations, Pepper.com gives smart shoppers around the world a voice to share deals, tips and ideas, connecting members in 14 countries on 3 continents. <br></p> <p>The Pepper.com group is headquartered in Berlin, with offices in Belo Horizonte/Brazil, Guadalajara/Mexico, London /United Kingdom, Lyon/France and Mumbai/India, Winnipeg/Canada and runs market-leading platforms such as Dealabs (France), hotukdeals (United Kingdom), mydealz (Germany) and 11 more around the globe. These platforms are currently used by more than 25 million smart shoppers every month and influence 12,000 buying decisions every minute.</p> <p><strong>Your Profile:</strong><br>Are you an experienced and passionate Frontend Developer who knows how browsers work below the surface? Do you enjoy solving complex problems and value quality and maintainability? Do you want to work long-term in Berlin with awesome people from all over the world in a growing environment? If your answer to these questions is yes, then join our team and experience a wide range of new and exciting challenges!</p> <p><strong>Your responsibilities would include:</strong></p> <ul> <li>Plan web components together with designers and backend engineers</li> <li>Implement reusable and solid responsive frontend components</li> <li>Identify and fix performance and maintenance problems</li> <li>Ongoing improvement of our frontend infrastructure</li> <li>Stay up to date with new frontend technologies and best-practices and share them with the team</li> </ul> <p><strong>The qualities we are looking for are:</strong></p> <ul> <li>At least 3 years working experience as a full frontend developer</li> <li>Proponent of progressive enhancement and web standards</li> <li>Strong sense of code reuse and maintainability</li> <li>Extensive cross browser CSS and JavaScript knowledge</li> <li>Experience with responsive layouts and CSS preprocessors (we use Sass)</li> <li>Experience with JavaScript libraries/frameworks (we use jQuery and vue.js)</li> <li>Experience with module loaders (we use RequireJS)</li> <li>Ability to write/architect good HTML templates (we use Twig)</li> <li>Good English language skills</li> </ul> <p><strong>Bonus points for:</strong></p> <ul> <li>Experience with CSS methodologies (we use BEM)</li> <li>Experience with MV libraries/frameworks (we use vue.js and angular)</li> <li>Experience with style guides / component libraries</li> <li>Experience with writing JavaScript unit tests</li> <li>Experience with task runners (we use Grunt)</li> <li>Experience with ES6 (we use Babel)</li> </ul> <p><strong>Some perks of working for Pepper.com are:</strong></p> <ul> <li>Flexible working hours</li> <li>Be apart of an awesome team of passionate and skilled developers</li> <li>Great office space in the heart of the exchange district</li> <li>Regular “Hack Days” to learn new technologies and skills</li> <li>A very competitive compensation package<br></li> </ul> <p><strong>Are you the person we are looking for?</strong> <br>We're looking forward to receiving your application including your motivation letter and your CV.</p>
Title: Frontend Developer /

Job_Description: <u><strong>Full-Stack Java Application Developer:</strong></u> <br/><br/> <strong>We've partnered with a client in Toronto specializing in Customer Communications Management and are looking for an experienced full-stack Java Developer for a mission critical role.</strong> <br/><br/> <strong>Location:</strong> Toronto, Ontario, Canada <br/><br/> <strong>Department:</strong> Research and Development <br/><br/> <strong>Type:</strong> Full Time <br/><br/> <strong>Min. Experience:</strong> 5 years <br/><br/> <strong>Responsibilities</strong> <br/><br/> Develop and maintain our flagship SaaS-based Java application and its supporting backend applications <br/> Model and develop data structures using Hibernate and Oracle <br/> Develop supporting control structures using Java/Spring MVC <br/> Develop supporting back-end application using C++ and Python <br/> Develop and configure WEB services in cloud environment <br/> Troubleshoot and fix production issues <br/> Carry out other related tasks and projects as assigned <br/> Work as part of a development team in a fast paced environment <br/><br/> <strong>Qualifications and Skills</strong> <br/><br/> 5+ years of experience building server-side Java and C++ applications <br/> Advanced skills using J2EE framework and libraries specifically: Spring, Hibernate <br/> Database development experience including SQL programming, solid understanding of relational database technologies with focus on Oracle systems <br/> Experience with WEB application server JBoss and tools such as Eclipse, Ant, SVN <br/> Experience with C++ and Python development <br/> Experience with developing SOAP and/or REST based web services <br/> Ability to write high-performance, reusable code and performance troubleshooting <br/> Experience with different OS (Windows, Unix/Linux, OS X) and their configurations <br/> Knowledge of version control systems <br/> Enthusiastic and self-motivated <br/> Experience with IBM Mainframe is a plus <br/> Experience with cloud based technologies is a plus <br/><br/> <strong>*** Interested applicants should apply directly to gord.marriage@talentlab.com with an up to date resume titled with your full name.</strong>

In Canada, we have 445 sales representatives servicing various customers coast to coast.Our goal at Wurth Canada - To be the leader in our industry by setting standards, which always exceed the expectations of our customers and employees. Our Vision - Becoming the number 1 in the eyes of our customers as the best and most qualified sales team. We love selling. We inspire our customers. <br/><br/> At Wurth Canada we continue to expand and grow. $200 million in sales, 1,000 employees by the year 2020! These figures are not just a dream but are in fact an objective that we are driven to obtain! MOVE2020 is the name of this strategy and it is well underway at Wurth Canada! <br/><br/> <strong> <br/> About the role</strong> <br/><br/> We are looking for a Mid-to-Senior level full-stack developer to join and play an important role on our digital team. In this unique role, you will be doing a combination of back-end and supportive frontend development. <br/><br/> This in-house Web Developer will continue to develop our very own exclusive e-commerce platform at Wurth Canada. <br/><br/> <strong>You will be responsible for:</strong> <ul>  <li>Utilizing the .Net web stack including C#, ASP.Net, JavaScript to develop and implement functionality and enhancements to shop.wurth.ca</li> <li>Researching, recommending, and planning for upgrades and new implementations in web technology;</li> <li>Developing / enhancing the backend technical components of our e-commerce applications;</li> <li>You will work with the digital team to design and create functionality for the best user shopping experience.</li> <li>Strong knowledge and hands on experience in analysis, design and development of web services and web applications under the .NET framework.</li> <li>Working with designers on creating functionality considering UX and conversion.</li> <li>Working with the Front End Developer to take designs (in HTML format) and develop with functionality</li> <li>Providing web expertise and actively participating with fellow Web Developers, Designers.</li> <li>Developing responsive web pages for multiple platforms, mobile devices and browsers</li></ul></div> </div><br/>  <div> <div> Job Requirements<br/><br/><strong>Our ideal candidate:</strong> <ul>  <li>Post-secondary degree BSC in Computer Science or relevant education in software development</li></ul>  <ul>  <li>At Least 3 Years of experience and knowledge of: C# / .Net Development ASP.Net web development experience Windows Server Javascript / Jquery CSS MySQL Server Databases MVC Framework Systems architecture and application</li> <li>Experience in working development collaboration software (Team Foundation Server, SourceSafe)</li> <li>Understanding of current web standards, cross platform compatibility</li> <li>Visual Studio</li> <li>Javascript (jQuery, Angular)</li> <li>Version Control</li> <li>Browser Compatibility Testing</li> <li>Bilingualism in French and English is an asset</li> <li>Creative and technical with the ability to prioritize</li> <li>Intermediate working experience in front-end development languages and tools, including: HTML 5 & CSS3</li> </ul>  <strong> <br/> What We Can Offer You</strong>  <ul>  <li>Competitive compensation plan plus bonus</li> <li>A comprehensive benefits package</li>  <li>Contribution to a Pension Plan</li> <li>Opportunities for ongoing training and professional development</li>  <li>A commitment to openness, diversity and work-life balance.</li> </ul> <strong> <br/> If you are the person we are looking for please send your resume to</strong> <strong>hr-internal@wurth.ca</strong><strong> with reference EWD</strong>**No agencies please** <br/><br/> Wurth Canada is an equal employer and we are committed to fostering an inclusive and barrier-free environment to all employees and candidates. We offer a competitive compensation package and a fun working environment. <br/>  <br/> Your mission   <ul> <li>Work with the development team to design new application architectures leveraging Microsoft .NET, Azure and Dynamics CRM technologies.</li> <li>Develop process integration modules to interface with internals systems through APIs</li> <li>Integrate functionalities in existing suite of applications</li> </ul>  You’ll need to be ...   <ul> <li>Proficient in C# 6 and later</li> <li>Knowledge of major .NET frameworks</li>   <li>Knowledge of major JavaScript frameworks and libraries such as jQuery, Angular or React</li> <li>Familiarity with secure RESTful web services and authentication mechanisms</li> <li>Knowledge in HTML5 and CSS</li> <li>Familiarity with Agile methodologies and teamwork</li> <li>Excellent analytical, problem-solving and communication skills</li> <li>Experience with working with relational database or ORM systems</li> <li>Experience with Microsoft Dynamics CRM is a great asset</li> </ul>  </div></div><div>What’s in it for you? <br/>  #module-1458-idm140344008369264 .markdown ul li:before { <br/>  background-color: #f0674f; <br/> <strong> }</strong> <br/>  #module-1458-idm140344008369264 .markdown <br/>  ol li:before { <br/>  color: #f0674f; <br/> <strong> }</strong> <br/>  #module-1458-idm140344008369264 .markdown <br/>  blockquote:before { <br/>  border-left-color: #f0674f; <br/> <strong> }</strong> <br/>  <div>   <ul> <li>Competitive salary</li> <li>Flexible schedule (and a summer schedule!)</li> <li>3 weeks of vacation time</li>   <li>Extra time off between Christmas and New Year</li> <li>Beautiful modern open-concept office</li>   <li>Monthly social activities (bagel breakfast, summer BBQ, cocktail competition and more)</li> <li>Healthy snacks</li> <li>And much more!</li> </ul>  </div></div><div>About district m<div>district m is a digital technology company that provides unique solutions for publishers and advertisers. Our exclusive and proprietary technology segments data and user profiles, which allows our clients the ability to reach diverse and specific audiences at the right time. <br/><br/> Becoming a districter means you will join a team full of inspiring people who are always working to go above and beyond expectations. At district m, we pride ourselves on having a friendly and open environment where employees are encouraged to share new ideas and where all opinions are valued. <br/><br/> If you’ve been looking to work for a company where you won’t just be an employee among many, and where you would collaborate with other ambitious and success-oriented professionals, then we would like to meet you!</div> </div><div><div>You're the one?</div><div><div><div>Apply now</div></div></div></div><div>You really like what you see but you feel under-qualified?<div>Please consider applying anyway. As a result, technical skills aside, the person in this role will have to be very flexible and possess a big picture perspective to bring solutions to the table that are durable and scalable. Job_Description: Apply <br/>  Web Application Developer<br/><br/>Everest Clinical Research ("Everest") is a full-service contract research organization (CRO) providing a broad range of expertise-based clinical research services to worldwide pharmaceutical, biotechnology, and medical device industries. We serve some of the best-known companies and work with many of the most advanced drugs, biologics, and medical devices in development today. <br/><br/> Everest has been an independent CRO since 2004 with a strong foundation as a statistical and data management center of excellence. Building on this foundation, Everest has successfully developed and established itself as a full-service CRO. Operating primarily in North America, with headquarters located in Markham (Greater Toronto Area), Ontario, Canada and an office in Little Falls (Greater New York City Area), New Jersey, USA, Everest is known in the industry for its high quality deliverables, superior customer service, and flexibility in meeting clients’ needs. A dynamic organization with an entrepreneurial origin, Everest continues to experience exceptional growth and great success. <br/><br/> Quality is our backbone, customer-focus is our tradition, flexibility is our strength...that’s us…that’s Everest. <br/><br/> To drive continued success in this exciting clinical research field, we are seeking a committed, skilled, and customer-focused individual to join our winning team as a:<br/><br/>Clinical Trials Web Application Developer<br/><br/><strong>Key Responsibilities:</strong> <br/><br/> As a Clinical Trials Web Application Developer, you will be responsible for developing and maintaining high quality clinical trials web applications used for patient randomization, drug assignment and supply management, trial administration and operational monitoring. You will work closely with business/functional and technical leads to review and clarify user and system requirements, design and configure trial-specific functions and features, program and test the application, and support the ongoing maintenance of the application throughout the clinical trial through to trial close. You will own the design and development of entire study-specific applications from backend through to the UI and will optimize your quality and efficiency by using pre-validated study application templates provided by Everest. <br/><br/> In addition to providing high quality web application development services, you will also support the ongoing enhancement of the application architecture, develop new features and Proof of Concepts with direction from the business / functional leads, and implement initiatives to strengthen the technical and non-functional aspects of the application platform. You will also help influence design, programming and broader technical decisions and support the rapid expansion of Everest clinical trials application portfolio to meet market / competitive demand. <br/><br/> The following is a summary of your key responsibilities:  <ul> <li>Design, development, unit testing, systems testing, maintenance and deployment of custom built Java/J2EE applications to meet client and system requirements.</li> <li>Work closely with clients, and cross-functional team members to understand and analyze business and technical requirements that drive the analysis and design of technical solutions.</li> <li>Review technical specifications to ensure base and enhanced requirements are met.</li> <li>Provide client support and consultation for development, integration as well as advice in areas of expertise. Perform unit, component and assembly testing of system components and bug fixes.</li> <li>Develop detailed design of application components, and write maintainable, high quality code in a timely fashion.</li> <li>Participate and support user training and client demonstrations/UAT of the web application products on an as-needed basis.</li> <li>Perform system maintenance activities in accordance with Everest policies, standard operating procedures (SOPs) and working documents specific to Web Technologies development, maintenance and broader IT and Corporate SOPs where applicable. Support system validation initiatives where necessary.</li> <li>Perform database change updates required by users during the support / maintenance phase after a clinical trial application is launched.</li> <li>Identify functional and technical application enhancements based on system performance, client feedback, internal reviews and industry leading practices and help to prioritize, plan and execute ongoing enhancements for the betterment of the system / product.</li> <li>Support in special web development and IT initiatives, as needed. Initiatives may include</li> <li>Evaluation and upgrade of server operating systems, hardware, and operational / development software</li> <li>Implementation of improved encryption standards for communications to and from secure server applications</li> <li>Optimization of web security infrastructure for user authentication and authorization of controlled components.</li> <li>Web User Interface re-design and refresh.</li> </ul> <strong>Qualifications and Experience:</strong>  <ul> <li>University Degree in Computer Science or Computer Engineering with a minimum of 5 to 10+ years’ experience.</li> <li>OOD (Object-Oriented Design), OOP (Object-Oriented Paradigm) and Architecture & Design Patterns.</li> <li>Java and J2EE application development.</li> <li>J2SE/Java programming.</li> <li>JSP, Servlet and web development.</li> <li>Relational databases including Oracle/MySQL.</li> <li>PL/SQL, Trigger, and store procedure.</li> <li>UI Technologies: HTML 5, CSS 3, XSLT, JQuery, JavaScript.</li> <li>Web Service and API design and development using XML or JSON</li> <li>Windows and UNIX environments.</li> <li>Java IDE (preferably Eclipse).</li> <li>Tomcat 6/7 Application Server</li> <li>Oracle DB 11g / 12c Database Technologies</li> <li>Adaptive UI Design (Mobile, Tablet)</li> <li>Knowledge of software development QC and QA methodologies.</li> <li>Development frameworks such as Struts/TILE.</li> <li>Knowledge of object/relational persistence and query service such as Hibernate.</li> <li>Perl and/or Shell Script.</li> <li>Working knowledge of User Interfaces Design.</li> <li>Experience working in the CRO or pharmaceutical industries is an asset.</li> <li>Good organizational and time management skills with the ability to manage concurrent projects and adjust to changing priorities.</li> <li>Detail-oriented, customer and quality-focused.</li> <li>Excellent communication, interpersonal, and teamwork skills.</li> <li>Proven flexibility and adaptability when working in a team and independently, using good judgment in making decisions.</li> </ul> <strong>How to Apply</strong> <br/><br/> Please complete the on-line form, or send your application, indicating the position to which you are applying to careers@ecrscorp.com <br/><br/> We are an equal opportunity employer. We thank all interested applicants, however, only those selected for an interview will be contacted. <br/><br/> Everest is committed to upholding the principles of dignity, independence, integration, and equal opportunity. We welcome and encourage applications from people with disabilities and upon request, we will provide accommodations for candidates participating in any part of our recruitment and selection process. <br/><br/> ‹ Back
Title: Web Application Developer

Job_Description: About Us:<br/><br/>Global Relay is the leading provider of cloud-based archiving, supervision, eDiscovery, and analytics for the global financial sector. We deliver services to 23,000 customers in 90 countries, including 22 of the top 25 global banks. Our market-leading archiving service supports email, instant messaging, Bloomberg®, Thomson Reuters, social media, mobile messaging, and more – with mobile, Outlook, and web access. <br/><br/> Our Global Operations & Development Center is located in Vancouver, BC, Canada. In addition, we have offices in six other cities across the world, including major financial centers like New York, Chicago, and London. <br/><br/> Over the years, we have won several major awards, including:  <ul>   <li>Company of the Year from the BC Tech Association (2016)</li> <li>Canada’s 50 Best Small and Medium Employers (2014, 2015)</li> <li>Canada’s Top Employers for Young People (2014)</li> <li>Canada’s Top 10 Most Admired Corporate Cultures (2013, 2016)</li> <li>Canada’s Best Managed Companies (2013 - present)</li> </ul> We provide fantastic opportunities to individuals passionate about business and technology. For those with international business aspirations, we offer invaluable opportunities for doing business with some of the world’s largest, most influential firms. Our company is also perfect for those who want to create cool technology using massively scalable, big-data architecture, with a strong focus on mobile. <br/><br/> To learn more about our business, culture, and community involvement, visit www.globalrelay.com.<br/><br/>The Role:<br/><br/>The Software Development Engineer in Test (SDET) is a developer who specializes in writing code to test the product. They are responsible for the overall test coverage, test code, and automation frameworks within their Agile team. <br/><br/> In this role you will be working directly with code in an established automation framework to test back-end services for large scale data processing. You will support the team’s release and testing efforts while growing and maintaining automated coverage and frameworks. <br/><br/> <strong>Role Responsibilities:</strong>  <ul>   <li>Define and automate test cases that verify product requirements</li> <li>Write code to support development of automated frameworks and tests</li> <li>Execute test cases using both automated and manual techniques</li> <li>Identify, report and verify software defects</li> <li>Maintain test infrastructure and tools</li> <li>Participate in team planning and story grooming</li> <li>Conduct code reviews, improve and maintain quality of the automation code</li> <li>Document the automation framework, tools and infrastructure</li> </ul> <strong>Technical Skills Requirements:</strong>  <ul>   <li>Minimum 3 years of test development experience.</li> <li>Strong understanding of either Java or C# programming languages.</li> <li>Experience with backend systems or APIs.</li> <li>Experience with testing practices in an agile environment.</li> <li>Experience with any of the following is an asset:</li>   <ul>   <li>big data technology such as Hadoop, MongoDB, Kafka or SQL</li> <li>performance testing with JMeter or similar tools</li> <li>web services technology such as REST, JSON or Thrift</li> <li>network protocols such as HTTP, TLS and TCP</li> <li>continuous integration systems such as Bamboo or Jenkins</li> <li>frontend automation with Selenium WebDriver</li> <li>web technologies such as CSS3, HTML5 or Extend.JS (Sencha)</li> <li>multi-threaded programming</li> <li>design patterns</li></ul>   </ul> <strong>To Apply:</strong> <br/><br/> Think you’re a great fit for this job? Apply today with your cover letter and resume in <strong>one PDF document</strong>. No phone calls please. Applicants must be eligible to work in Canada.
Title: Intermediate Software Development Engineer in Test (Backend)

Job_Description: <div><div><strong>POSITION</strong>: Senior Developer</div><div><strong>LOCATION</strong>: Toronto, ON (M5J 0A3)</div> <div><strong>STATUS</strong>: Full-time</div><br/> <div><strong>JOB OVERVIEW</strong></div><div></div><div><div>We are currently seeking a Senior (Backend) Developer (Internally as Programmer Analyst II) to join our Shareholder Systems Information Technology team. In this role, the successful candidate is expected to write new programs and reports for our back end systems, maintain and support existing code, and write technical documentation. Our team takes great pride in being responsive to user needs in the ever changing financial services landscape.</div></div><div></div><div><strong>WHAT YOU WILL DO</strong> </div><div>  <ul> <li>Develop new applications, reports and processes for the CI's fee and rebate based programs</li><li>Ensure the ongoing maintenance and support for current database applications and processes</li><li>Document new systems and ensure that newly implemented system features or enhancements meet user needs as documented in specifications</li> <li>Coding overnight transaction procedures in database</li> <li>Ensure continued integrity of existing production systems</li> <li>Participate in the investigation and resolution of production problems</li></ul></div> <br/> <div><strong>WHAT YOU WILL BRING</strong> </div><div>  <ul> <li>Post-Secondary education and/or training in Computer Science</li> <li>3 to 5 years of experience in relational database programming with SQL and Kornshell scripting</li><li>Highly experienced with database, including the use and design of stored procedures a must</li> <li>Experience with SQR is a plus</li><li>Working knowledge of mutual fund processes and concepts including fee and rebate based systems</li><li>Exposure to C or ability to learn it</li> <li>Familiarity with multi-platform environments such as Windows, UNIX, and RDMS</li><li>Highly proficient with Microsoft Office applications – particularly Excel</li><li>Ability to design and modify applications to user specifications</li> <li>Excellent oral and written communication skills</li> <li>Strong organizational and analytical skills</li> <li>Excellent multi-tasking skills and ability to work effectively with project deadlines</li></ul></div> <br/> <div></div><div><strong>WHAT YOU CAN EXPECT FROM US</strong></div><div>  <ul> <li>Collaborative and friendly team environment</li> <li>Opportunities to develop and grow within the company</li> <li>Health and Wellness programs including corporate fitness membership and nutritional seminars</li> <li>Modern, conveniently-located facilities</li> <li>Community involvement including OneWalk to Conquer Cancer, Bay Street Hoops and more.</li> </ul> </div><br/>  <div>If you are a passionate, committed and dynamic individual, please submit your resume in confidence by clicking “<strong>Apply</strong>”.</div><br/> <div>Only qualified candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.</div><br/> <div>CI Financial Corp. and all of our affiliates (“CI”) are committed to fair and accessible employment practices and we are committed to providing accommodations for persons with disabilities. If you require accommodations in order to apply for any job opportunities, or require this posting in an additional format, please contact us at accessible.recruitment@ci.com, or call 416-681-4747. If you are contacted by CI regarding a job opportunity or testing and require accommodation in any stage of the recruitment process, please use the above contact information. We will work with all applicants to determine appropriate accommodation for individual accessibility needs.</div> <div></div></div>
Title: Senior Developer

Job_Description: <div><strong>Léquipe en bref:</strong></div><div>Chez AppDirect, notre but est de changer la manière de trouver, acheter et utiliser des logiciels! Notre équipe d'ingénieurs crée la plateforme SAAS qui est utilisée par plusieurs des meilleures entreprise du monde. Il est difficile de changer le monde mais nous ne voudrions pas qu'il en soit autrement!</div> <br/> <div>La mission de l'équipe plateforme-frontend est de fournir aux développeurs des outils leur permettant d'augmenter leur productivité, la qualité de leurs livrables et de s'assurer de la bonne santé et de l'évolution des technologies frontend d'Appdirect.</div><br/>  <div><strong>À propos de vous:</strong></div><div>Nous sommes la recherche dun développeur qui aime travailler de manière autonome et développer des outils et bibliothèques internes. Vous êtes laise avec une combinaison de technologies dinterface et vous êtes idéalement un développeur «full-stack». Vous souhaitez travailler au sein dune équipe qui vous aidera relever de nouveaux défis, tout en étant motivé chercher et explorer de manière indépendante.</div><br/>  <div><strong>Ce que vous ferez et ce qui vous fera briller:</strong></div>  <li>Développer et améliorer une bibliothèque complète de composants pour React</li> <li>Participer lentretien de nos bibliothèques de type Sass</li> <li>Aider les développeurs contribuer notre bibliothèque de composants Marionette</li> <li>Guider les équipes dans leur transition vers le développement basé sur React</li> <li>Soutenir les équipes de produits pour répondre aux problèmes et spécifications dinterface les plus pointus</li>  <strong><div>Votre profil:</div> <br/> </strong>  <li>Vous avez de fortes compétences en "vanilla" JavaScript</li> <li>Vous avez quelques années d'expérience en création d'applications web</li> <li>Vous avez une compréhension approfondie d'au moins un framework d'application, idéalement plus d'un</li> <li>Vous connaissez NodeJS (backend, build systems, etc)</li>  <strong><div>Bonus:</div> <br/> </strong>  <li>Vous êtes familier avec Java stack</li>  <strong><div><em>AppDirect en bref:</em></div> <br/> </strong> <br/> <div><em>AppDirect est la plateforme de référence pour la vente, la distribution et la gestion de produits et services infonuagiques. Sa technologie flexible et modulaire permet toutes les entreprises, quelle que soit leur taille, dentrer sur le marché rapidement selon une approche qui répond leurs besoins spécifiques, et ce, moindre coût. Les platformes de commerce en ligne AppMarket, de distribution et dassistance technique avancée alimentés par AppDirect permettent de nombreux fournisseurs dont Comcast, ADP, Zendesk, Deutsche Telekom et plusieurs autres de connecter plus de 30 millions dentreprises aux solutions offertes par Microsoft, Google, GoDaddy et plusieurs autres. AppDirect est basée San Francisco et compte 13 bureaux travers le monde.</em></div> <br/> <div><em>Chez AppDirect, nous croyons que ce sont les contributions uniques de chaque «AppDirecteur» qui forgent notre réussite. Afin de nous assurer que nos produits et notre culture continuent de refléter les perspectives et les expériences de tous, nous ne faisons aucune discrimination en fonction de la race, la religion, la nationalité, lidentité ou lorientation sexuelle, lâge, létat matrimonial, statut dancien combattant ou du statut d'handicapé.</em></div><br/>  <div><strong>About the team:</strong></div><div>At AppDirect our goal is to change the way the world finds, buys and uses software! Our Engineering team creates the SAAS platform used by many of the world's top companies to meet this goal. It's hard to change the world, but we wouldn't want it any other way.</div> <br/> <div>The front-end platform team's mission is to provide developers with tools that increase their productivity, the quality of their deliverables and their happiness, and to ensure the health and evolution of AppDirect's front-end technologies.</div><br/>  <div><strong>About you:</strong></div><div>We are looking for a highly autonomous developer who loves to work on internal tooling and libraries. You are comfortable with a mix of front-end technologies and are ideally a "full-stack" developer. You want to work with a team that will challenge you, but you are driven to research and explore on your own.</div><br/>  <div><strong>How youll make an impact & what youll do:</strong></div>  <li>Developing and improving a fully featured component library for React</li> <li>Participate in the maintenance of our Sass styles library</li> <li>Help developers contribute to our Marionette component library</li> <li>Guide teams through their transition to React based development</li> <li>Provide support to the product teams with challenging front-end issues and requirements</li>  <strong><div>What youll need:</div> <br/> </strong>  <li>Strong "vanilla" JavaScript skills</li> <li>A few years of experience building web applications</li> <li>A solid grasp of at least one application framework, ideally more than one</li> <li>Some experience with NodeJS (backend, build systems, etc)</li> <li>Familiarity with Java stack an asset</li>  <strong><div><em>About AppDirect:</em></div> <br/> </strong> <br/> <div><em>AppDirect is the leading platform for selling, distributing, and managing cloud-based products and services. Its flexible, modular technology enables organizations of all sizes to get to market quickly and cost effectively with an offering that meets their individual business needs. AppDirect-powered marketplaces, billing, distribution, reselling, and premium technical support services help providersincluding Comcast, ADP, Zendesk, Deutsche Telekom and othersconnect more than 30 million businesses to solutions from Microsoft, Google, GoDaddy, and more. AppDirect is headquartered in San Francisco with 13 global offices.</em></div> <br/> <div><em>We believe that the unique contributions of all AppDirectors is the driver of our success. To make sure that our products and culture continue to incorporate everyone's perspectives and experience we never discriminate on the basis of race, religion, national origin, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, or marital, veteran, or disability status.</em></div> <br/> <strong>#LI-EG1</strong>
Title: Développeur sénior, frontend (Platforme) / Senior Frontend Developer (Platform)

Job_Description: <br/><br/> Requisition ID: 28956 <br/><br/> Join the Global Community of Scotiabankers to help customers become better off. <br/><br/> <strong>What your role will be...</strong> <br/><br/> Senior Full Stack Software Developer <br/><br/>   <br/><br/> <strong>Purpose of Job</strong> <br/><br/> As an API engineer, you will be working as part of a smaller, but efficient team to deliver services for use in both internal and external applications. The successful candidate considers themselves a full-stack engineer with a preference for the backend details. They can modify UI components, write a RESTful API, and implement a data backend, write high-performance software, and micro-service architecture. <br/><br/>   <br/><br/> <strong>Key Job Accountabilities</strong> <br/><br/> - 5+ years programming full-stack applications <br/><br/> - Experience storing, querying, searching, streaming, and manipulating big data sets <br/><br/> - Experience with micro-service architecture and cloud infrastructure <br/><br/> - Experience writing and integrating RESTful APIs <br/><br/> - Knowledge and experience with JavaScript is mandatory <br/><br/> - Good knowledge of at least one of the following programming languages: Java, Python <br/><br/> - Good knowledge of at least one API frameworks, languages, tools, specification, frameworks, development & client tools: Express.js, JSON, Swagger, Java, Python, Docker, Kubernetes <br/><br/> - Experience using Vue.js, Node.js, and/or GoLang a plus <br/><br/> - A positive attitude and a reliable, self-motivated, team player with excellent communication skills <br/><br/> - A track record in employing and ensuring industry best practices for software development <br/><br/> - Knowledge of software development lifecycle, CI, and Agile development practices <br/><br/> - A history of adopting and evangelizing new technologies and motivated to do new and interesting things <br/><br/> - Comfortable working as part of a distributed team <br/><br/>   <br/><br/> <strong>Education and Other Requirements</strong> <br/><br/> - Bachelor (equivalent or higher) degree in Computer Science, Engineering or related discipline <br/><br/> - 2-3 years of banking/financial industry experience. <br/><br/> - Experience working in an Agile environment <br/><br/>   <br/><br/> Location(s): Canada : Ontario : Toronto <br/><br/> As Canada’s International Bank, we are a leader when it comes to inclusion. We are a diverse and global team, speaking more than 100 languages with backgrounds from more than 120 countries. We value the unique skills and experiences each individual brings to the bank, and are committed to creating and maintaining an inclusive and accessible environment for everyone. Candidates selected for an interview will be contacted directly. If you require accommodation during the recruitment and selection process, please let us know. We will work with you to provide as seamless a recruitment experience as possible.
Title: Senior Full Stack Software Developer

Job_Description: This is a permanent position, yearly auto-renewable contract.<br/><br/>Who we are:<br/><br/>TELUS Digital is a team of highly skilled professionals dedicated to building innovative, data-driven, customer centric digital experiences. We run like a start-up, weve embraced lean and agile methodologies. We celebrate our failures and see them as opportunities to learn. Our culture fosters collaborative learning and out-of-the-box thinking in a relaxed environment. <br/><br/> We invest in our team members and culture first, by focusing on enablement and empowerment, we foster creativity and champion experimentation, Our team members are leaders in local and global technology communities, we value and support communities such as: Tech Masters, NodeSchool, Ladies Learning Code, Women Who Code TO, FreeCodeCamp and many more! <br/><br/> Our team members are contributors to many open-source projects & core libraries used globally across our industry, We encourage and support open-source contributions & run hackathons for all team members, our culture is tailored towards work-life balance, we keep core hours, and work from home when needed to keep productivity high and protect maker time.<br/><br/>What youll do:<br/><br/>You are an experienced, hands-on lead developer and operator, who has led teams in shipping and supporting large-scale applications. You are a mentor and guiding voice for developers, who can balance day-to-day workload, with an eye for future improvements of your team and their work. <br/><br/> As a Senior Platform developer with TELUS Digital, you will be responsible for designing, building and running a suite of development acceleration tooling, which enables our many outcome teams at TELUS Digital to deliver value quickly and safely. <br/><br/> You will be working as part of a friendly, cross-discipline agile team who helps each other solve problems across all functions. As a custodian of customer trust, you will employ best practice in development, security, accessibility and design to achieve the highest quality of service for our customers. <br/><br/> We use a range of technologies to get the job done: Kubernetes, OpenShift, AWS, Google Cloud Platform, Terraform, while our RESTful APIs are built with Node.js. Quality is a primary concern and we test our applications at multiple levels with sophisticated build and release pipelines, supporting automation testers and Product Owners embedded within teams.<br/><br/>What youll be responsible for:  <ul> <li>Design scalable systems with performance and security in mind</li><li>Diagnose and evolve container-based build pipelines for your team</li><li>Challenge, mentor and guide the team to implement best practices</li><li>Dedicate time to mentor junior developers on the team</li><li>Advocate the use of unit testing and test driven development to drive design and development</li><li>Implement & Advocate accessibility best practices (We believe in an accessible web for everyone)</li><li>Champion documentation and knowledge sharing</li><li>Battle technical debt and avoid decision silos</li><li>Lead technical team members in an agile environment (We use Kanban)</li><li>Evaluate technology choices and rapidly test solutions</li><li>Providing guidance to the business on ideal technical approaches and investment</li><li>Setting the technical vision for your team, and working with the technical leadership to define the roadmap for the applications that your team supports</li><li>Work closely with your team to solve architectural challenges</li><li>Work with product owners to support translating business deliverables into technical outcomes</li><li>Adapt and influence the team to create the best outcome for not only the project but also for our customers</li> </ul>  <strong>What youll need to be successful:</strong> <br/>  Minimum qualifications  <ul> <li>Experience with clustering technologies (we use Kubernetes and OpenShift)</li><li>Experience with the Docker ecosystem</li><li>Experience with Infrastructure as Code and Configuration Management tools (We use terraform and ansible)</li><li>Proven Experience in building scalable production services and monitoring performance (we use Kibana, NewRelic)</li><li>Experience with cloud providers (We use AWS EC2 and GCP)</li><li>Experience with CI/CD tools (We use Jenkins)</li><li>Experience designing and load-testing highly available systems</li><li>Proven History of excelling in a team based collaborative environment</li><li>Experience mentoring junior team members, overseeing code quality and evangelizing best practices</li><li>Experience in translating technical concepts and requirements for non-technical stakeholders</li><li>Intermediate level knowledge of backend development (we use Node.js, PostgreSQL, Redis)</li></ul>  <ul> <li>Intermediate level knowledge of client-side testing best practices and tooling (we use Jest)</li><li>Proven Experience designing and documenting APIs (we use Node.js, Express, OpenAPI Spec)</li></ul>  <ul> <li>Experience with FRP (functional, reactive programming)</li> </ul>  Preferred qualifications  <ul> <li>Experience with securing applications to common security threats (OWASP Standards)</li><li>Familiar with accessibility (WCAG 2) best practices</li><li>Experience with Web/HTTP security controls (CORS, CSP, TLS, etc ...)</li><li>Experience designing, building, and maintaining High Availability systems</li><li>Experience in creating and socializing technology roadmaps</li> </ul>  <strong>About TELUS Digital:</strong> <br/>  Our Mission<br/><br/>TELUS strategic intent is to unleash the power of the Internet to deliver the best solutions to Canadians at home, the workplace or on the move. At TELUS Digital, we do this by enabling our customers and team members to do what they want easily.<br/><br/>Accessibility<br/><br/>TELUS is proud to foster an inclusive culture that embraces diversity. We are committed to fair employment practices and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment. <br/><br/> We offer accommodation for applicants with disabilities, as required.<br/><br/>Our Principles<br/><br/>Our Principles describe the values we prioritize to guide our decisions and the habits we employ to achieve our mission and deliver on TELUS strategy.<br/><br/>Focus on customer first<br/><br/>Customers expect to be able to do what they want in a way that fits their life. We think like our customers, anticipating their needs and crafting seamless, personalized experiences that span physical and digital customer journeys.<br/><br/>Value data over opinions<br/><br/>The best decisions are those that are informed by customer and team member feedback. We build products with results we can measure, informing our decisions with data rather than just listening to the loudest voice in the room.<br/><br/>Deliver outcomes over outputs<br/><br/>Customers and team members want products that simplify their lives over those filled with unnecessary features. We prioritize building experiences that deliver tangible results for our customers and teams over feature development.<br/><br/>Take risks and be lean<br/><br/>Our customers needs change quickly and can be difficult to predict. We embrace ambiguity with agility by experimenting, taking calculated risks and celebrating failures to pivot quickly and continuously improve.<br/><br/>Build for quality and reuse<br/><br/>Customers want high quality experiences delivered quickly without errors and complexity. We showcase our work, reuse solutions, leverage shared platforms and automate development practices to meet our leading customer experience standards.<br/><br/>Be an owner<br/><br/>Owners are curious, create long-term value, and constantly challenge the status quo. We collaborate beyond our individual functions and lines of business, pursue high value ideas in our teams and individually and respectfully assert ourselves when we disagree.<br/><br/>Attract and develop leaders<br/><br/>Leaders tackle the most ambiguous and complex challenges while helping our team scale. We constantly raise the talent bar by seeking out exceptional, passionate people and providing them with development opportunities that enable them to choose their own career path.<br/><br/>Embrace inclusivity<br/><br/>Diversity breeds new ideas, innovation, and a better working environment. We respect and empathize with each other, fostering an inclusive culture where everyone can express their ideas and be their authentic self.<br/><br/>Strengthen communities around us<br/><br/>Creating shared value in our communities benefits TELUS and Canada. We invest in our team members so that they can drive positive social impact in the areas of health, education, environment and digital literacy.<br/><br/>What you can expect from us:  <ul> <li>An environment where youre encouraged to share and act on your ideas</li> <li>Flexible work hours in a central downtown location</li> <li>A welcoming, relaxed office with a casual dress code</li> <li>A culture committed to giving; every year we donate time and resources in our communities</li><li>Weekly lunches with an unending supply of healthy snacks</li><li>A fun, dynamic team that works and plays every day; great ideas can come as easily during an impromptu hallway soccer match or social team outing</li> </ul>  We want to work with people who:  <ul> <li>Share our passion for all things digital</li><li>Thrive in an agile, lean and fast-paced environment</li><li>Clearly see things from the perspective of our customers</li><li>Are curious, experiment and never stop learning</li><li>View collaboration as essential to your work</li><li>Utilize the power of data to inform decisions</li><li>Embrace diversity and new ideas</li> </ul>
Title: Platform Developer

Job_Description: Company Profile <br/><br/> Morgan Stanley is a global financial services firm and a market leader in investment banking, securities, investment management and wealth management services. With offices in more than 43 countries, the people of Morgan Stanley are dedicated to providing our clients the finest thinking, products and services to help them achieve even the most challenging goals. <br/><br/> As a market leader, the talent and passion of our people is critical to our success. We embrace integrity, excellence, team work and giving back. <br/><br/> Technology <br/><br/> The Technology division partners with our business units and leading technology companies to redefine how we do business in ever more global and dynamic financial markets. <br/><br/> Our sizeable investment in technology results in leading-edge tools, software, and systems. Our insights, applications, and infrastructure give a competitive edge to clients’ businesses—and to our own. <br/><br/> Institutional Securities Technology (IST) develops and oversees the overall technology strategy and bespoke technology solutions to drive and enable the institutional businesses and enterprise-wide functions. Our clients include Fixed Income, Equities, Commodities, Investment Banking, Research and Global Capital Markets. <br/><br/> We are also responsible for Pioneer and Application Infrastructure groups that look to develop foundational strategies, tools and technologies that are leveraged across Technology, as well as standardized data and enterprise-wide services to provide leverage to the Firm's businesses. <br/><br/> Position Description <br/><br/> We are looking for a smart, innovative, results-oriented individual to join our global backend development team. The role involves business and technical requirement analysis, design, hands-on development in a distributed architecture environment. An ideal candidate will have a good knowledge of data structures, algorithms, object-oriented concepts, multithreading / synchronization issues, networking, and relational databases. <br/><br/> The successful candidate is expected to work with the colleagues around the globe and hence excellent communication skills (verbal and written) are a must. Knowledge of the financial industry or Equity Swaps would be nice to have, but not a requirement. The primary focus of the role will be on global trading engines written in C , which facilitate trading and hedging the Equity Swaps order as well as managing the FX exposure associated to that business. <br/><br/> Skills Required <br/><br/> • 3-5 years core development experience   <ul> <li>Solid software engineering principles (data structures & algorithms, OO, design patterns, multithreading, networking)</li> <li>Great C/C skills</li> <li>Good trouble shooting and debugging skills</li> <li>Proficiency in XML, SOAP and Linux/Unix; e.g. shell scripting, process management</li> <li>Working knowledge of database concepts (SQL, stored procs, schema design)</li> <li>Working knowledge of a scripting language; Python and/or Perl preferred</li> <li>Experience in formal software development lifecycle (SDLC)</li> <li>Excellent written and verbal communication skills</li> <li>Experience in test driven development <br/><br/> Skills Desired <br/><br/> • Experience designing and developing large scale distributed client/server systems a bonus</li> <li>Front Office (Sales & Trading) development experience</li> <li>Knowledge of FIX protocol related to order management</li> <li>Project management abilities <br/><br/> Knowledge of French and English are required. <br/><br/> Morgan Stanley is an equal opportunities employer. We work to provide a supportive and inclusive environment where all individuals can maximize their full potential. <br/><br/> </li> </ul>
Title: Developer C

Job_Description: <p><strong>The bazinga! process</strong></p>  <p>At bazinga!, we foster a culture of ongoing improvement - in everything we do. Our work environment is cross-functional - we work collaboratively from engineers to executives - and also across teams from marketing, product and development. We believe great products are envisioned, designed, built, tested, nurtured, improved and rethought regularly by passionate teams.</p>  <p> </p>  <p><strong>What we're looking for</strong></p>  <p>We're looking for people who can help build out our new backend architecture. This means you are comfortable with building scalable APIs and the pipelines to deploy them. You also care about developer experience and championing it across a team. Through your past experience, you've learned how to juggle multiple projects, know how to frequently and incrementally ship products, and have a solid understanding of engineering best practices.</p>  <p> </p>  <p>In the fast-paced world of a disruptive and innovative SaaS product, you are:</p>  <p> </p>  <ul> <li>Able to wear multiple hats (and fit them all)</li> <li>Ambitious and curious - you love learning new things</li> <li>A team player with a love for collaboration</li> <li>Able to excel as a self-starter</li> <li>Someone with a strong analytical mindset who loves breaking down walls</li> </ul>  <p> </p>  <p><strong>Skills you possess</strong></p>  <p>We are looking for an engineer with experience in functional programming technologies to help us build the future of our web platform. Your skills and experience should include:</p>  <ul> <li>Interest in functional programming and basic knowledge of at least one functional language (e.g. Scala, OCaml, F#, Haskell, Elixer)</li> <li>Unit and functional testing as an ingrained part of your workflow</li> <li>Experience working on a distributed platform</li> <li>Good judgment on making technical tradeoffs</li> <li>A demonstrated ability and interest in picking up new technologies</li> </ul>  <p>Things that aren't required but would raise you above the rest:</p>  <ul> <li>Experience championing Continuous Integration/Continuous Delivery tools and methodologies</li> <li>Experience building distributed systems in the cloud</li> <li>Experience with Domain Driven Design and complex domain modeling</li> <li>Knowledge of Linux and containerization technologies such as Docker.</li> <li>Experience with Postgresql, Graph databases.</li> </ul>  <p> </p>  <p><strong>What we value</strong></p>  <p>We value transparency, honesty, clear communication, hard work, positivity, patience, empathy and compassion. We are looking for people who appreciate, understand and share these values.</p>  <p> </p>  <p><strong>Where you'll work</strong></p>  <p>Bazinga's mission is creating amazing living communities. We strive to embody that mission by creating an amazing work culture, where you can achieve great results through a healthy work/life balance. We offer a great work environment that is collaborative, empowering and fun. Everyone on our team strives to deliver stellar results, and we expect the same from you. This role is based in our Vancouver office. This role will require you to develop a solid understanding of our users and their challenges. In this critical role, you will be a core member of Bazinga's data-driven development team.</p>  <p> </p>  <p><strong>The perks</strong></p>  <ul> <li>Competitive salary based on experience ($80K - $115K)</li> <li>Participation in employee stock option plan after 6 months</li> <li>Great benefits package for you and your family</li> <li>Flexible vacation options</li> <li>Friday socials</li> <li>Great office space</li> <li>Chance to work on something amazing that impacts real people</li> </ul>  <p> </p>  <p><strong>How to apply</strong></p>  <p>If you are still reading this, like what you see and feel confident you have the chops/are who we're looking for, get in touch with us at http://mybazinga.com/careers/. We only select candidates based on overall fit, and you can expect a multi-phase hiring process.</p>
Title: Functional Developer

Job_Description: Requisition ID: 25859 <br/><br/> The Digital Factory is an innovation hub with a clear and well-supported mandate to transform the way banking technology is delivered, by re-imaging the customer experience, to deliver new digital value propositions. We have the support and experience of one of the world’s largest banks behind us and a talented, and growing, team of industry leaders driving us forward. <br/> Do you want to help us reinvent how people bank? At the Scotiabank Digital Factory, we are passionate about transforming the customer experience. <br/><br/> We're looking to fill our team with influencers, makers, creators and leaders who are flexible, curious, adventurous, versatile and responsive; and who are ready to roll up their sleeves in a collaborative and productive environment to get things done. As the Backend Java Developer, you'll be working on a Scrum team that is modernizing all of our services, building microservices on the cloud. <br/><br/>   <br/><br/> <strong>Are</strong> <strong>you</strong> <strong>the</strong> <strong>right</strong> <strong>person</strong> <strong>for</strong> <strong>this</strong> <strong>role?</strong> <ul> <li>You're not afraid to challenge the status quo</li><li>You have a deep pride in quality craftsmanship, with user-centered design, that delights customers</li><li>You're able to pivot and adapt to change</li><li>You spend your free time tinkering with new technologies or building apps on the side</li><li>You want to find a solution to real-life problems that will flip the multi-billion dollar financial industry on its head</li><li>High aptitude for diving in, taking ownership and picking up new things</li><li>Eager to mentor, teach and share your ideas in a team environment</li><li>Open and transparent communication, including the ability to distill technical details into human terms</li> </ul>   <br/><br/> <strong>Do you have the skills that will enable you to succeed in this role?</strong> <ul> <li>Experience programming in Java </li><li>Experience building scalable, enterprise-level technology stacks and web applications</li><li>Experience with any database, SQL and/or NoSQL</li><li>Experience with software architecture design and security design</li><li>Experience in leading a group of 3-5 software developers for software implementation <br/>  </li> </ul> <strong>What's in it for you?</strong> <ul> <li>We have an inclusive and collaborative working environment that encourages creativity, curiosity, and celebrates success!</li><li>We provide you with the tools and technology needed to create beautiful customer experiences</li><li>Dress codes don't apply here, being comfortable does</li><li>You'll get to work with and learn from diverse industry leaders, who have hailed from top technology companies around the world</li><li>This isn't your typical "corporate" job. We work hard and we have fun!</li><li>We offer a competitive total rewards package that includes a base salary, a performance bonus, company matching programs (on pension & profit sharing), 4 weeks of vacation, personal & sick days, paternity/maternity leave top-ups and much more.</li> </ul> Location(s): Canada : Ontario : Toronto  <br/><br/> As Canada’s international bank, we are a leader when it comes to inclusion. Scotiabankers hail from over 120 countries, speak more than 100 languages and serve over 23 million customers globally. As a highly diverse company, we know that an inclusive environment for employees and customers helps everyone achieve their best. We value the unique skills and experiences each individual brings to the bank, and are committed to creating and maintaining an inclusive and accessible environment for everyone. Candidates selected for an interview will be contacted directly. If you require accommodation during the recruitment and selection process, please let us know. We will work with you to provide a positive recruitment experience.
Title: Senior Java Developer, Digital Factory

Job_Description: <strong>Create awesome experiences for our customers!</strong><br/>  <div><strong>Join our team!</strong></div>  <br/>Have you heard about TELUS being the best Canadian network in 2017? <br/><br/> We are on a mission to optimize TELUS’s network further - making it the fastest and the most reliable! Additionally, with 5G on the horizon, our Wireless network is undergoing major transformations at an unprecedented rate. <br/><br/> The National Core Performance and Optimizations Engineering team is one of the instrumental teams that are working to make this all happen.Our team has the privilege of working with latest technologies with variety of stakeholders across the company. We are responsible for defining technology strategy, design and solutions optimizations, as well as for a holistic architectural evolution. <br/><br/> <strong>Here’s the impact you’ll make and what we’ll accomplish together!</strong> <br/><br/> As a member of the Mobile Broadband Networks Engineering team and as a full-stack software engineer, you will work in a team of talented networking engineers and software developers. <br/><br/> You will be responsible to architect and develop software frameworks and applications for variety of backend and mobile platforms in order to provide best possible performance of TELUS network.<br/>  <div><strong>Here's how...</strong></div>   <ul>   <li>Analyze business requirements, evaluate design approaches and provide estimates of work effort</li> <li>Design technical documentation, produce best-in-class code, implement proper logging, monitoring and manageability</li> <li>Test and debug software modules, integrate the code with other program modules and systems</li> <li>Provide expertise on all technical questions related to development</li> <li>Collaborate with team members, end users and/or other cross functional stakeholders as required</li> <li>Mentor junior team members, drive high performance and highly engaged culture</li> </ul>  <div><strong>You're the missing piece of the puzzle...</strong></div>  <br/><strong><div>With:</div>  <br/></strong>   <ul>   <li>Proficiency in Java (or other OO languages), Python in Linux environment</li> <li>Proficiency in Mobile (Android), Backend and Web (Node JS, Angular) development environments building scalable services with carrier grade reliability and performance</li> <li>Experience with relational databases (MySQL, Oracle) and MongoDB</li> <li>Experience using web services and other technologies such as REST, JSON, XML, HTML5, AJAX, CSS, HTTP, SOAP, AWS</li> <li>Experience with Agile or Scrum development environments</li> <li>Experience with commercial and/or open-source code repository (Git), configuration management, building and deployment (Jenkins, Maven, Docker, Vagrant) and monitoring (Splunk) tools and frameworks</li> <li>Fundamental knowledge of networking including TCP/IP ports and firewalls, network protocols, and IP networks</li> <li>Proficiency in providing reliable work-time estimates</li> <li>Ability to adapt and thrive in high pace and rapidly changing environment</li> <li>Strong desire to continuously update technical expertise to keep abreast of new services and technologies</li> <li>Bachelor
