degree in Computer Science or a related discipline required</li> <li>Master of Computer Science degree or a related discipline preferred</li> <li>8 years of relevant Software Development experience with active participation in complex projects</li> </ul>  <div><strong>Great-to-have’s...</strong></div>   <ul>   <li>Knowledge of 3GPP (LTE/UMTS/HSPA) Wireless standards is an asset</li> <li>Experience with OpenStack is an asset</li> </ul>  <div><strong>Who is TELUS?</strong></div> <br/> <div>We're a high-performing team of individuals who collectively make TELUS one of the leading telecommunications companies in Canada. Our competitive consumer offerings include wireline, wireless, internet and Optik TV™. We also deliver a compelling range of products and services for small, medium and large businesses; and have carved out a leadership position in the health, energy, finance and public sector markets with innovative industry specific solutions.</div> <br/> <div>Everyone belongs at TELUS. It doesn’t matter who you are, what you do or how you do it, at TELUS, your unique contribution and talents will be valued and respected. Because the more diverse perspectives we have the more likely we are to crack the code on what our customers want and our communities need.</div> <br/> <div>Do you share our passion?</div> <br/> <div>At TELUS, <strong>you</strong> create future friendly® possibilities.</div> <br/> <div>At TELUS, we are committed to diversity and equitable access to employment opportunities based on ability.</div>
Title: Senior Developer Analyst ( Mobile Developer)

Job_Description: <div>League is the digital alternative to traditional health insurance. Led by serial entrepreneur and Kobo founder Michael Serbinis, we are bringing much-needed innovation to the stagnant health care industry. League enables employers to give employees access to health and wellness spending accounts, flexible and cost-effective group insurance plans and workplace health services, all through our website and mobile apps. Our mission is to help people live healthier, happier lives every day.</div> <br/> <div>Were looking for a platform developer to help build the tools and systems that enable our development team to regularly and reliably ship products to our customers. In this role, you will work as part of a small team of developers to deliver and manage the infrastructure underlying our platform, as well as the tooling and automation needed to enable a DevOps culture across our organization. This means working closely with our product delivery teams to understand their bottlenecks, and to mentor them on operational ownership.</div><br/> <div>Our platform and applications run on Google Cloud. We build backend services with Go and MongoDB, a web frontend with React and Redux, and native Android and iOS applications. We ship code to production multiple times per week, and were always looking to improve both the quality and speed of our releases.</div><br/> <div>You may not have expertise in our particular programming languages or technologies, but thats okay. Whats important to League is your ability to take ownership and solve problems, as well as your collaborative spirit and drive for professional growth.</div>You Will  <ul> <li>Build and maintain Leagues server infrastructure, following infrastructure-as-code principles</li><li>Develop tools to support continuous delivery and developer empowerment</li><li>Diagnose and resolve production issues with software development teams</li><li>Participate in an on-call rotation, including incident management</li><li>Live our team values of ownership, pragmatism, cooperation, and empathy for our customers</li> </ul>  About You  <ul> <li>Youre knowledgeable about cloud-based infrastructure</li><li>You have experience with configuration management and deployment automation</li><li>Youre comfortable working in at least one programming language</li><li>You have a focus on security in the delivery of all levels of a system</li><li>When things break, youre eager and able to help fix things</li> </ul>  Nice to Have  <ul> <li>Experience with Google Cloud and/or Docker</li><li>Experience in a startup environment</li> </ul>  <div>Does this sound like you? Wed love to hear from you. Submit your application and someone from our recruitment team will be in touch.</div><br/> <div>We believe that diverse teams perform better, and that fostering an inclusive work environment is a key part of growing a successful team. We welcome people of diverse backgrounds, experiences, and perspectives. We are an equal opportunity employer, and we are committed to working with applicants requesting accommodation at any stage of the hiring process.</div>
Title: Platform Developer

Job_Description: <strong>Software Engineer, Developer Experience - EA Digital Platform (EADP)</strong> <br/><br/> <strong>We are EA</strong> <br/><br/> Electronic Arts is more than youve ever realized. Were more than a company, or a headline, or even a clever catchphrase were a vibrant community of over 8,000 artists, storytellers, technologists and innovators working toward a shared vision: to inspire and unite through play. <br/><br/> While headquartered in Redwood City, EA's platform engineering, game development, and publishing operations take place in a network of locations, stretching from Shanghai to Stockholm, Melbourne to Vancouver. No matter which of our studio locations you join, youll feel the energy and support of EAs global brand, while immersing yourself in a culture that inspires you to thrive, take risks and dream big. Our unique studios create amazingly creative and fun games - fast paced puzzles, adrenaline filled warfare, galaxy spanning adventures, high speed racing, and sports so realistic you can practically feel the grass under your feet. <br/><br/> This is an especially great time for the video game industry, as were currently going through an exciting digital transformation. The effects of this on EAs business have been profound. In fiscal year 2014, 45% ($1.8 billion) of our non-GAAP net revenues came from digital offerings. The global gaming audience has also never been bigger, with industry revenue projected to reach $86 billion in 2016. <br/><br/> Since its founding in 1982, EA has helped shape the way over 300 million registered players consume and enjoy interactive media. No other company can deliver EAs portfolio of amazing games and services, across multiple platforms, to players around the world. It is an exciting era in games, and an exciting time to join the team at EA! <br/><br/> <strong>The Challenge Ahead:</strong> <br/><br/> EAs Digital Platform (EADP) organization is responsible for driving critical technology decisions and investments for EA on a global basis, across all divisions and studio teams. Technology and engineering leadership at EA is critical to making the industrys best games and services and the EADP team is leading the way to providing cross-platform infrastructure that will keep our consumers connected with our games anytime, anywhere with anyone.. <br/><br/> <strong>What a Software Engineer, Developer Experience does at EA:</strong> <br/><br/> This unique role will be perfect for an individual who is passionate about engineering ease of use and reducing friction in tech integration. The team will focus on building a product that unifies integrator onboarding and support and provides apps to optimize the entire game development and live game management life cycle. The team will also build a framework that enables shared services to provide the right experiences, tools and documentation support to enable better integration. <br/><br/> <strong>Responsibilities:</strong> <br/><br/> The Software Engineer will play a key role in developing tools and services to support the platform in providing a world class developer experience. Typical activities include: <ul> <li>Develop web apps, components, prototypes, or proofs of concept (POCs)</li><li>Participate in all aspects of an iterative, agile software development process, including scoping, detailed design, effort estimation, coding, testing, debugging, maintenance and support</li><li>Define and tune frontend technology stack</li><li>Collaborate with the design and product management team to build applications that delight users.</li><li>Document and present designs for peer technical review and provide feedback on others designs</li><li>Work on the application framework that includes backend common services (e.g. authentication, authorization etc)</li><li>Develop Real-time data collection and analytics on client/server platforms</li><li>Work cross teams to identify key requirements, define key metrics and setup benchmarks for engineering ease of use</li><li>Analyze the complex technical architecture across EAs shared services and platform to understand the underlying drivers of engineering friction and drive fixes</li><li>Partner closely with game studios to understand their key requirements and concerns for integration</li><li>Partner closely with platform teams to understand what common functionality they need in a framework to build the best possible integration experiences</li> </ul> <strong>The next great EA Software Engineer, Developer Experience also needs:</strong> <ul> <li>Bachelors degree in Computer Science</li><li>Expertise in object oriented design/programming</li><li>Knowledgeable in the area of scalable platform architecture, end to end systems design and architecture</li><li>A passion for gaming and a good problem solver and creative thinker</li><li>Experience with web frontend technologies like React, Angular, Javascript, CSS and HTML is a plus</li><li>Familiarity with new web frameworks and tools (e.g. Grunt, Bower, Bootstrap, JSHint) is a plus</li><li>Able to work and problem solve independently, to organize workload and priorities, high-quality execution, technical innovation/adaptation, and initiative</li><li>Understanding of the realities of working with complex distributed client/server systems</li><li>Experience working in Agile/Scrum based development environments</li><li>Understanding of HTTP/HTTPS requests</li><li>Familiarity with Linux based systems</li> </ul> <strong>Whats in it for you? Glad you asked!</strong> <br/><br/> We love to brag about our great perks like comprehensive health and benefit packages, tuition reimbursement, 401k with company match and, of course, free video games. And since we realize it takes world-class people to make world-class games, we offer competitive compensation packages and a culture that thrives off of creativity and individuality. At EA, we live the work hard/play hard credo every day. <br/><br/> <strong>Dont Just Play It Create It!</strong>
Title: Sr. Software Engineer - Developer Experience

Job_Description: About Us:<br/><br/>Global Relay is the leading provider of cloud-based archiving, supervision, eDiscovery, and analytics for the global financial sector. We deliver services to 23,000 customers in 90 countries, including 22 of the top 25 global banks. Our market-leading archiving service supports email, instant messaging, Bloomberg®, Thomson Reuters, social media, mobile messaging, and more – with mobile, Outlook, and web access. <br/><br/> Our Global Operations & Development Center is located in Vancouver, BC, Canada. In addition, we have offices in six other cities across the world, including major financial centers like New York, Chicago, and London. <br/><br/> Over the years, we have won several major awards, including:  <ul>   <li>Company of the Year from the BC Tech Association (2016)</li> <li>Canada’s 50 Best Small and Medium Employers (2014, 2015)</li> <li>Canada’s Top Employers for Young People (2014)</li> <li>Canada’s Top 10 Most Admired Corporate Cultures (2013, 2016)</li> <li>Canada’s Best Managed Companies (2013 - present)</li> </ul> We provide fantastic opportunities to individuals passionate about business and technology. For those with international business aspirations, we offer invaluable opportunities for doing business with some of the world’s largest, most influential firms. Our company is also perfect for those who want to create cool technology using massively scalable, big-data architecture, with a strong focus on mobile. <br/><br/> To learn more about our business, culture, and community involvement, visit www.globalrelay.com.<br/><br/>The Role:<br/><br/>The Senior Backend Developer, Messaging Platform is a member of a small, highly focused team, responsible for building services for a highly scalable and robust messaging system, using leading edge technologies. This is an opportunity to work alongside some of the best Java developers in Vancouver and apply your craft in an environment that encourages creative thinking and autonomy. We encourage our developers to think beyond a single component to build complete system solutions. Challenge yourself by learning new technologies, and apply your skills across our different projects and application domains. If you are committed to code that is clean, well-tested, well-reviewed, performant and secure then you’ll fit in around here. <br/><br/> <strong>Role Responsibilities:</strong>  <ul>   <li>Design, implement and provide architectural guidance in deploying microservices as a part of an agile development team</li> <li>Migrate existing services to microservices, with the goal of reducing complexity at the design and architecture level</li> <li>Write unit and integration tests for your Java code</li> <li>Collaborate with testers in development of test cases for Java code</li> <li>Develop deployment systems for Java based systems</li> <li>Collaborate with product owners on user story generation and refinement</li> <li>Monitor and support the operation of production systems</li> <li>Participate in knowledge sharing activities with colleagues</li> </ul> <strong>Technical Skills Requirements:</strong>  <ul>   <li>Minimum 8 years of Java development experience in an Agile environment, building scalable, multi-threaded applications and services</li>   <li>API development experience in service and resource-oriented architectures</li> <li>Fluency with Linux</li> <li>Experience building:</li> <li>   <ul>   <li>3rd generation messaging systems</li> <li>Backends for mobile messaging systems</li> <li>Soft real-time systems</li> </ul>   </li> <li>Familiarity with SIP or XMPP</li> <li>Experience doing performance tuning</li> <li>Passion for Test Driven Development</li> <li>Understanding of network protocols such as HTTP, TLS, TCP</li> <li>Experience with any of the following is an asset:</li> <li>   <ul>   <li>Big Data technologies, such as Hadoop, Kafka, and Cassandra, to build applications that contain petabytes of data and process millions of transactions per day</li> <li>Cloud computing, virtualization and containerization</li> <li>Continuous integration systems</li> <li>Deployment technology such as Ansible</li>  </ul>   </li> </ul> <strong>To Apply:</strong> <br/><br/> Think you’re a great fit for this job? Apply today with your cover letter and resume in <strong>one PDF document</strong>. No phone calls please. Applicants must be eligible to work in Canada.
Title: Senior Developer, Messaging Platform (Java)

Job_Description: <strong>Who You Are</strong> <br/><br/> You are a passionate Software Developer, with 3-5 years of application development experience, who can easily switch between the front-end and back-end. You're comfortable collaborating in small teams to design, build and ship high-quality software and are familiar with iterating in an agile fashion. <br/><br/> You enjoy working closely with designers, product managers, and other stakeholders to build both awesome UI/UX components, as well as backend services and APIs. You have experience liaising and collaborating with other departments in determining requirements and specifications. <br/><br/> You love to learn and improve and have a passion for technology and writing code. <br/><br/> You want to join us in using technology to build the next generation of products that enable organizations to power human connections at scale. <br/><br/> You thrive in working collaboratively with a small team of passionate and skilled developers. Youre excited by working on a diverse range of high-value projects across multiple product areas and have a passion for product and conversion optimization. <br/><br/> You are super smart and have a BSc, BCS, BASc or comparable degree in a relevant program, or have equivalent work experience. <br/><br/> <strong>Youre Great at...</strong>  <ul> <li>Working on high-volume, highly available, scalable and extensible websites/applications</li> <li>Web foundations - HTML, CSS and Javascript</li> <li>You have a fundamental understanding of Object Oriented concepts and MVC frameworks</li> <li>Working with REST APIs</li> <li>Writing tests to ensure quality in your code</li> <li>Optimizing and applying best practices</li> <li>Learning and evolving your technical capabilities</li> <li>Working in a fast paced and continuously evolving environment</li> </ul> <strong>Bonus Points</strong>  <ul> <li>Knowledge of Unix based systems</li> <li>Experience with Go and/or Python</li> <li>Experience with infrastructure orchestration and/or infrastructure as code (Ansible, Terraform, Docker, Kubernetes, etc.)</li> <li>Experience with React, ES6, Angular</li> <li>Experience in an agile environment and methodologies</li> <li>You have open source contributions or personal projects youve shipped successfully</li> </ul> <em>Hootsuite is an inclusive employer. Every effort will be made to provide accommodations requested by candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process.</em> <br/><br/> #LI-TG1
Title: Software Developer

Job_Description: <strong>Who You Are</strong> <br/><br/> You're an experienced Software Developer, with more than 5 years of web application development experience, who has experience designing system architectures, including microservices and service-oriented architectures. You're comfortable collaborating in small teams to design, build and ship high-quality software and experienced in iterating in an agile fashion. You have knowledge of issues related to building Cloud infrastructures and have prior hands-on experience in developing and deploying Microservices solutions on Cloud infrastructure. <br/><br/> Youre comfortable working closely with designers and outside stakeholders to build both awesome UI/UX components and systems, as well as backend services and APIs that can process millions of request per day. You have experience liaising and collaborating with other departments in determining requirements and specifications. <br/><br/> You love to coach, lead and nurture the development of more junior developers while sharing your knowledge within the team along with the broader technical community, all the while shaping our software development culture by improving our processes and codebases. <br/><br/> You want to join us in using exciting new technologies to build the next generation of one of the most visible, and prominently placed components of the Hootsuite product. You are super smart and have a Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science or Engineering, or have equivalent work experience. <br/><br/> Read about some of the things we're doing here: http://code.hootsuite.com <br/><br/> <strong>Youre Great At</strong>  <ul> <li>Building high-volume, highly available, and distributed server applications, hence you have a portfolio of web apps youve played a key role in shipping</li> <li>Building microservices in Go and have experience with container and orchestration technologies such as Docker, Mesos, Kubernetes</li> <li>Experience with event-based and message-driven distributed system</li> <li>Working with Big Data, utilizing SQL and noSQL databases, data warehouse technologies, and familiarity with data lakes and data marts.</li> <li>Working with REST APIs (bonus if youve worked with Twitter or Facebook APIs)</li> <li>Creating automated test suites and ensuring quality in your code</li> <li>Optimizing and applying best practices</li> </ul> <strong>Bonus Points</strong>  <ul> <li>Interest in startups and passion for social media</li>   <li>Drive to succeed in a fast pace and continuously evolving environment</li> <li>You have open source contributions or personal projects youve shipped successfully</li> </ul> <em>Hootsuite is an inclusive employer. Every effort will be made to provide accommodations requested by candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process.</em> <br/><br/> <strong><em>#LI-TG1</em></strong>
Title: Senior Software Developer

Job_Description: <div><div><strong>POSITION</strong>: Senior Developer</div><div><strong>LOCATION</strong>: Toronto, ON (M5J 0A3)</div> <div><strong>STATUS</strong>: Full-time</div><br/> <div><strong>JOB OVERVIEW</strong></div><div></div><div><div>We are currently seeking a Senior (Backend) Developer (Internally as Programmer Analyst II) to join our Shareholder Systems Information Technology team. In this role, the successful candidate is expected to write new programs and reports for our back end systems, maintain and support existing code, and write technical documentation. Our team takes great pride in being responsive to user needs in the ever changing financial services landscape.</div></div><div></div><div><strong>WHAT YOU WILL DO</strong> </div><div>  <ul> <li>Develop new applications, reports and processes for the CI's fee and rebate based programs</li><li>Ensure the ongoing maintenance and support for current database applications and processes</li><li>Document new systems and ensure that newly implemented system features or enhancements meet user needs as documented in specifications</li> <li>Coding overnight transaction procedures in database</li> <li>Ensure continued integrity of existing production systems</li> <li>Participate in the investigation and resolution of production problems</li></ul></div> <br/> <div><strong>WHAT YOU WILL BRING</strong> </div><div>  <ul> <li>Post-Secondary education and/or training in Computer Science</li> <li>3 to 5 years of experience in relational database programming with SQL and Kornshell scripting</li><li>Highly experienced with database, including the use and design of stored procedures a must</li> <li>Experience with SQR is a plus</li><li>Working knowledge of mutual fund processes and concepts including fee and rebate based systems</li><li>Exposure to C or ability to learn it</li> <li>Familiarity with multi-platform environments such as Windows, UNIX, and RDMS</li><li>Highly proficient with Microsoft Office applications – particularly Excel</li><li>Ability to design and modify applications to user specifications</li> <li>Excellent oral and written communication skills</li> <li>Strong organizational and analytical skills</li> <li>Excellent multi-tasking skills and ability to work effectively with project deadlines</li></ul></div> <br/> <div></div><div><strong>WHAT YOU CAN EXPECT FROM US</strong></div><div>  <ul> <li>Collaborative and friendly team environment</li> <li>Opportunities to develop and grow within the company</li> <li>Health and Wellness programs including corporate fitness membership and nutritional seminars</li> <li>Modern, conveniently-located facilities</li> <li>Community involvement including OneWalk to Conquer Cancer, Bay Street Hoops and more.</li> </ul> </div><br/>  <div>If you are a passionate, committed and dynamic individual, please submit your resume in confidence by clicking “<strong>Apply</strong>”.</div><br/> <div>Only qualified candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.</div><br/> <div>CI Financial Corp. and all of our affiliates (“CI”) are committed to fair and accessible employment practices and we are committed to providing accommodations for persons with disabilities. If you require accommodations in order to apply for any job opportunities, or require this posting in an additional format, please contact us at accessible.recruitment@ci.com, or call 416-681-4747. If you are contacted by CI regarding a job opportunity or testing and require accommodation in any stage of the recruitment process, please use the above contact information. We will work with all applicants to determine appropriate accommodation for individual accessibility needs.</div> <div></div></div>
Title: Senior Developer

Job_Description: <strong>Snapshot</strong> <br/><br/> Employment Term: Full-time <br/> Experience: 5+ Years <br/> Location: Toronto, ON <br/><br/> <strong>Overview:</strong> <br/><br/> Loopio is looking for intelligent and passionate Senior Front-end Software Developers to join our growing technology team. Youll help push the front-end technology and architecture to deliver a world-class product that customers love. <br/><br/> <strong>Details</strong> <br/><br/> <u>Design</u>  <ul> <li>You understand the basics of good UX and design and collaborate closely with the UX team. At Loopio, we believe developers should have a lot of input in what they create. The Development and UX teams work as tight unit where all opinions are heard and valued.</li> <li>You have eagle eyes and notice when things arent pixel perfect</li> <li>You can break down visual UI mockups or sketches in terms of re-usable front-end components</li> <li>You have high standards for clean code and for how your UI components are organized and tested</li> </ul> <u>Javascript</u>  <ul> <li>You have a strong understanding of JS fundamentals. You know how and when to use things like this, prototypes, and closures</li> <li>Youve probably read Dougie Crockfords Javascript: The Good Parts!</li> <li>You have successfully built reusable plugins</li> </ul> <u>Frameworks and Tools</u>  <ul> <li>Youve mastered a Javascript framework like Angular or React and have a preference for using one over the other. You arent afraid to debate us on this!</li> <li>You understand how to build a good front-end pipeline and can offer suggestions about what tools to use</li> </ul> <u>CSS & HTML</u>  <ul> <li>You have strong opinions on how stylesheets should be organized. Youve probably heard of BEM or SMACSS and have a preference for what strategy is best</li> <li>You've replaced vanilla css stylesheets with a SASS or LESS framework in the past</li> <li>You have battled some of the common browser gotchas and found good solutions</li> </ul> <u>Mentorship</u>  <ul> <li>Youre a natural teacher and see the value in showing the team new technologies and ideas</li> <li>You genuinely care about the team and their career growth</li> <li>You are able to talk about technology with others. Regardless of team or role, you can break down technical jargon and acronym soup</li> </ul> <u>Performance</u>  <ul> <li>You are a front-end debugging wizard and are comfortable with a variety of browsers and tools</li> <li>You are the first person to call out the low hanging front-end performance issues and propose great solutions</li> <li>You push the team to prioritize front-end tech debt</li> </ul> <u>API & Backend</u>  <ul> <li>You understand how to write a good API and particularly how it relates to your front-end design</li> </ul> <strong>Skills & Requirements:</strong>  <ul> <li>University degree or equivalent</li> <li>5+ years in development roles of increasing responsibility</li> <li>2+ years experience with a front-end framework (React, Angular etc.)</li> <li>Experience with front-end testing frameworks (e.g. Jest)</li> <li>Experience with Agile Software Development</li> <li>A great eye for UX and design</li> <li>Expert Javascript skills</li> <li>Experience with a front-end framework like Angular or React</li> <li>React experience is a ++</li> <li>Experience working a multi-tenant SaaS platform is a ++</li> </ul> <strong>Perks</strong>  <ul> <li>You'll have a manager who coaches you through goal setting, frequent 1-on-1s, and real-time feedback</li> <li>Youll have tons of autonomy and responsibility; we have a results-driven environment</li> <li>Youll work in the heart of Torontos famous and trendy King West neighbourhood</li> <li>Youll learn more than you thought was possible; our team is obsessed with personal and professional growth (we even have a Loopio Book Club)</li> <li>Youll have a piece of the pie; every Loopio employee participates in our stock option plan!</li> <li>Youll participate in a health and benefits plan that kicks in on day one!</li> </ul>
Title: Senior Front-End Software Developer

Job_Description: <div><strong>Léquipe en bref:</strong></div><div>Chez AppDirect, notre but est de changer la manière de trouver, acheter et utiliser des logiciels! Notre équipe d'ingénieurs crée la plateforme SAAS qui est utilisée par plusieurs des meilleures entreprise du monde. Il est difficile de changer le monde mais nous ne voudrions pas qu'il en soit autrement!</div> <br/> <div>La mission de l'équipe plateforme-frontend est de fournir aux développeurs des outils leur permettant d'augmenter leur productivité, la qualité de leurs livrables et de s'assurer de la bonne santé et de l'évolution des technologies frontend d'Appdirect.</div><br/>  <div><strong>À propos de vous:</strong></div><div>Nous sommes la recherche dun développeur qui aime travailler de manière autonome et développer des outils et bibliothèques internes. Vous êtes laise avec une combinaison de technologies dinterface et vous êtes idéalement un développeur «full-stack». Vous souhaitez travailler au sein dune équipe qui vous aidera relever de nouveaux défis, tout en étant motivé chercher et explorer de manière indépendante.</div><br/>  <div><strong>Ce que vous ferez et ce qui vous fera briller:</strong></div>  <li>Développer et améliorer une bibliothèque complète de composants pour React</li> <li>Participer lentretien de nos bibliothèques de type Sass</li> <li>Aider les développeurs contribuer notre bibliothèque de composants Marionette</li> <li>Guider les équipes dans leur transition vers le développement basé sur React</li> <li>Soutenir les équipes de produits pour répondre aux problèmes et spécifications dinterface les plus pointus</li>  <strong><div>Votre profil:</div> <br/> </strong>  <li>Vous avez de fortes compétences en "vanilla" JavaScript</li> <li>Vous avez quelques années d'expérience en création d'applications web</li> <li>Vous avez une compréhension approfondie d'au moins un framework d'application, idéalement plus d'un</li> <li>Vous connaissez NodeJS (backend, build systems, etc)</li>  <strong><div>Bonus:</div> <br/> </strong>  <li>Vous êtes familier avec Java stack</li>  <strong><div><em>AppDirect en bref:</em></div> <br/> </strong> <br/> <div><em>AppDirect est la plateforme de référence pour la vente, la distribution et la gestion de produits et services infonuagiques. Sa technologie flexible et modulaire permet toutes les entreprises, quelle que soit leur taille, dentrer sur le marché rapidement selon une approche qui répond leurs besoins spécifiques, et ce, moindre coût. Les platformes de commerce en ligne AppMarket, de distribution et dassistance technique avancée alimentés par AppDirect permettent de nombreux fournisseurs dont Comcast, ADP, Zendesk, Deutsche Telekom et plusieurs autres de connecter plus de 30 millions dentreprises aux solutions offertes par Microsoft, Google, GoDaddy et plusieurs autres. AppDirect est basée San Francisco et compte 13 bureaux travers le monde.</em></div> <br/> <div><em>Chez AppDirect, nous croyons que ce sont les contributions uniques de chaque «AppDirecteur» qui forgent notre réussite. Afin de nous assurer que nos produits et notre culture continuent de refléter les perspectives et les expériences de tous, nous ne faisons aucune discrimination en fonction de la race, la religion, la nationalité, lidentité ou lorientation sexuelle, lâge, létat matrimonial, statut dancien combattant ou du statut d'handicapé.</em></div><br/>  <div><strong>About the team:</strong></div><div>At AppDirect our goal is to change the way the world finds, buys and uses software! Our Engineering team creates the SAAS platform used by many of the world's top companies to meet this goal. It's hard to change the world, but we wouldn't want it any other way.</div> <br/> <div>The front-end platform team's mission is to provide developers with tools that increase their productivity, the quality of their deliverables and their happiness, and to ensure the health and evolution of AppDirect's front-end technologies.</div><br/>  <div><strong>About you:</strong></div><div>We are looking for a highly autonomous developer who loves to work on internal tooling and libraries. You are comfortable with a mix of front-end technologies and are ideally a "full-stack" developer. You want to work with a team that will challenge you, but you are driven to research and explore on your own.</div><br/>  <div><strong>How youll make an impact & what youll do:</strong></div>  <li>Developing and improving a fully featured component library for React</li> <li>Participate in the maintenance of our Sass styles library</li> <li>Help developers contribute to our Marionette component library</li> <li>Guide teams through their transition to React based development</li> <li>Provide support to the product teams with challenging front-end issues and requirements</li>  <strong><div>What youll need:</div> <br/> </strong>  <li>Strong "vanilla" JavaScript skills</li> <li>A few years of experience building web applications</li> <li>A solid grasp of at least one application framework, ideally more than one</li> <li>Some experience with NodeJS (backend, build systems, etc)</li> <li>Familiarity with Java stack an asset</li>  <strong><div><em>About AppDirect:</em></div> <br/> </strong> <br/> <div><em>AppDirect is the leading platform for selling, distributing, and managing cloud-based products and services. Its flexible, modular technology enables organizations of all sizes to get to market quickly and cost effectively with an offering that meets their individual business needs. AppDirect-powered marketplaces, billing, distribution, reselling, and premium technical support services help providersincluding Comcast, ADP, Zendesk, Deutsche Telekom and othersconnect more than 30 million businesses to solutions from Microsoft, Google, GoDaddy, and more. AppDirect is headquartered in San Francisco with 13 global offices.</em></div> <br/> <div><em>We believe that the unique contributions of all AppDirectors is the driver of our success. To make sure that our products and culture continue to incorporate everyone's perspectives and experience we never discriminate on the basis of race, religion, national origin, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, or marital, veteran, or disability status.</em></div> <br/> <strong>#LI-EG1</strong>

Job_Description: <strong>Create awesome experiences for our customers!</strong><br/>  <div><strong>Join our team!</strong></div>  <br/>Have you heard about TELUS being the best Canadian network in 2017? <br/><br/> We are on a mission to optimize TELUS’s network further - making it the fastest and the most reliable! Additionally, with 5G on the horizon, our Wireless network is undergoing major transformations at an unprecedented rate. <br/><br/> The National Core Performance and Optimizations Engineering team is one of the instrumental teams that are working to make this all happen.Our team has the privilege of working with latest technologies with variety of stakeholders across the company. We are responsible for defining technology strategy, design and solutions optimizations, as well as for a holistic architectural evolution. <br/><br/> <strong>Here’s the impact you’ll make and what we’ll accomplish together!</strong> <br/><br/> As a member of the Mobile Broadband Networks Engineering team and as a full-stack software engineer, you will work in a team of talented networking engineers and software developers. <br/><br/> You will be responsible to architect and develop software frameworks and applications for variety of backend and mobile platforms in order to provide best possible performance of TELUS network.<br/>  <div><strong>Here's how...</strong></div>   <ul>   <li>Analyze business requirements, evaluate design approaches and provide estimates of work effort</li> <li>Design technical documentation, produce best-in-class code, implement proper logging, monitoring and manageability</li> <li>Test and debug software modules, integrate the code with other program modules and systems</li> <li>Provide expertise on all technical questions related to development</li> <li>Collaborate with team members, end users and/or other cross functional stakeholders as required</li> <li>Mentor junior team members, drive high performance and highly engaged culture</li> </ul>  <div><strong>You're the missing piece of the puzzle...</strong></div>  <br/><strong><div>With:</div>  <br/></strong>   <ul>   <li>Proficiency in Java (or other OO languages), Python in Linux environment</li> <li>Proficiency in Mobile (Android), Backend and Web (Node JS, Angular) development environments building scalable services with carrier grade reliability and performance</li> <li>Experience with relational databases (MySQL, Oracle) and MongoDB</li> <li>Experience using web services and other technologies such as REST, JSON, XML, HTML5, AJAX, CSS, HTTP, SOAP, AWS</li> <li>Experience with Agile or Scrum development environments</li> <li>Experience with commercial and/or open-source code repository (Git), configuration management, building and deployment (Jenkins, Maven, Docker, Vagrant) and monitoring (Splunk) tools and frameworks</li> <li>Fundamental knowledge of networking including TCP/IP ports and firewalls, network protocols, and IP networks</li> <li>Proficiency in providing reliable work-time estimates</li> <li>Ability to adapt and thrive in high pace and rapidly changing environment</li> <li>Strong desire to continuously update technical expertise to keep abreast of new services and technologies</li> <li>Bachelor degree in Computer Science or a related discipline required</li> <li>Master of Computer Science degree or a related discipline preferred</li> <li>8 years of relevant Software Development experience with active participation in complex projects</li> </ul>  <div><strong>Great-to-have’s...</strong></div>   <ul>   <li>Knowledge of 3GPP (LTE/UMTS/HSPA) Wireless standards is an asset</li> <li>Experience with OpenStack is an asset</li> </ul>  <div><strong>Who is TELUS?</strong></div> <br/> <div>We're a high-performing team of individuals who collectively make TELUS one of the leading telecommunications companies in Canada. Our competitive consumer offerings include wireline, wireless, internet and Optik TV™. We also deliver a compelling range of products and services for small, medium and large businesses; and have carved out a leadership position in the health, energy, finance and public sector markets with innovative industry specific solutions.</div> <br/> <div>Everyone belongs at TELUS. It doesn’t matter who you are, what you do or how you do it, at TELUS, your unique contribution and talents will be valued and respected. Because the more diverse perspectives we have the more likely we are to crack the code on what our customers want and our communities need.</div> <br/> <div>Do you share our passion?</div> <br/> <div>At TELUS, <strong>you</strong> create future friendly® possibilities.</div> <br/> <div>At TELUS, we are committed to diversity and equitable access to employment opportunities based on ability.</div>
Title: Senior Developer Analyst ( Mobile Developer)

Job_Description: <strong>Mobile Developer</strong> <br/><br/> Location: Toronto, Canada <br/><br/> <strong>Guestlogix is Making Air Travel a Great Experience Again!</strong> <br/><br/> Chances are youve been an airline passenger at some point in your life. Youve likely had a similar on-board experience on every flight, and rarely found it to be modern and personalized. Guestlogix is changing how consumers feel about travel and how airlines provide a personalized and high-impact onboard retail experience for their passengers, while increasing revenues and profitability and boosting passenger loyalty like no other industry provider can. Check us out at www.guestlogix.com. <br/><br/> We're looking for talented, innovative leaders who want to join our crew to make it happen. Our crew gets the job done by owning problems and collaborating on solutions, with a customer first sense of urgency, and passion and dedication to make air travel a great experience again. <br/><br/> <strong>Your Mission</strong> <br/><br/> Were looking for a passionate Mobile Developer who can work in a tightly knit Agile team environment. Youll be joining a multi-disciplinary team, working closely with other software engineers and product managers who share your drive for excellence and desire to build great products. <br/><br/> You are an experienced Mobile Developer with an entrepreneurial spirit. Your work related, or personal project experience, means you know how to build a product from scratch. <br/><br/> What were working on right now is so exciting that we sincerely believe no passenger will travel by plane the same way again - and we want you to be a part of it! <br/><br/> At Guestlogix, you wont be limited to a specific part of the product, youll have the opportunity to be fully involved in all aspects of product decisions. If you want to grow your career, make recommendations and expand your exposure to developing a product end-to-end, this is the role for you. <br/><br/> <strong>As a crew member, your role is to:</strong>  <ul> <li>Build something brand new. You will get to see the things you have built be deployed and be part of the team that actively improved the travelling experience of thousands of people.</li> <li>Be involved in the SDLC. Your experience as a Mobile Developer will enable you to contribute to everything from requirements to proposed designs, coding to writing unit tests.</li> <li>Be a problem solver. When faced with a problem, you can easily identify the steps needed to resolve it in an effective manner.</li> <li>Be a key contributor to the team. You will design and build new features in collaboration with the Architect and Product team. You will work closely across teams to identify and maximize opportunities to produce scalable, reusable enterprise grade applications and features.</li> <li>Be passionate. We want you to love what you do, thats our biggest ask. Building cool applications and making ideas come to fruition is what gets you out of bed in the morning - and youre looking for a team of equally passionate people to do this with.</li> </ul> <strong>The right crew member will have:</strong>  <ul> <li>A degree or diploma in Computer Science, Engineering or equivalent experience is required.</li> <li>The experience. You have been working in mobile development for 3+ years in a professional capacity or on personal projects. We understand not everyone hones their development skills at work. If youve created awesome things in your spare time, wed love to see them!</li> <li>The technical expertise. Experience with native development and cross-platform write once run anywhere frameworks. Working knowledge of Xamarin, Objective-C and/or Swift is a plus.</li> <li>A collaborative approach. You understand that everyone needs to do whatever it takes to meet deadlines and deliver promises. But you bring with you a need for perfection and to uphold a reputation.</li> </ul> <strong>Working with our crew at Guestlogix:</strong> <br/><br/> Join us on our journey to make air travel a great experience again. Our crew enjoys a comfortable, open and casual environment, collaborating with an exceptional team of Agile based technology innovators. You have the flexibility and autonomy to innovate within small teams to build the first to market, mobile-first platform, using modern tools and methods. As if that is not enough, we provide you with a competitive salary and benefits, and provide you with the flexibility to manage work and life, along with virtually unlimited developmental opportunities to grow your skills and learn together on our journey. <br/><br/> At Guestlogix, you wont be limited to a specific part of the product; youll have the opportunity to be fully involved in all aspects of product decisions. You will have a chance to:  <ul> <li>Make recommendations and see them implemented as part of our new product development.</li> <li>Be involved in the end-to-end product development expanding your marketable skills in Front End, Backend or Mobile.</li> <li>Learn from senior team members through one-on-one mentorship and career coaching.</li> </ul> Grow with us - as we scale, you will be in a prime position to scale with us. <br/><br/> Joining Guestlogix now is the chance to share in the excitement of building an amazing global technology business that has a huge impact on the industry. <br/><br/> Guestlogix welcomes and encourages applications from people with disabilities. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process.

<strong>Responsibilities</strong> <ul> <li>Design, implement, deliver, and test web applications while understanding our products from both a technical and business perspective in the context of our larger business</li><li>Build and deploy features with limited or no reliance on QA</li><li>Actively contribute to the adoption of strong software architecture, development best practices and new technologies</li><li>Implement and maintain Python server backend</li><li>Perform R&D for the new business logic for the product</li><li>Handling database migration and software update</li><li>Manage cloud computing system on AWS</li> </ul> <strong>Key Requirements and Skills</strong> <ul> <li>BS or higher in Computer Science, Math, or similar technical degree</li><li>Strong background in basic devices.</li><li>Design skill to create user interface with good user experience and usability</li></ul>  <ul> <li>Experience in Python RESTFul server development</li><li>Experience with Flask, Pip, and aiohttp is an asset</li><li>Good understanding about Web server using Nginx, RESTFul APIs, JSON, Security and Docker</li><li>Strong knowledge about how to utilize relational database such as PostgreSQL, MySQL</li><li>Experience with NoSQL such as firebase, MongoDB, and couchbase is an asset</li><li>OO design and development and design patterns</li><li>Experience with cloud computing such as AWS and Digital Ocean</li><li>Strong debugging skills</li> </ul> <strong>Additional</strong> <ul> <li>Excellent analytical and time management skills</li><li>Teamwork skills with a problem-solving attitude</li><li>Previous experience in a startup or healthcare organization preferred</li><li>Experience with Jira and Bitbucket</li></ul></div> <br/> Company Description<div>North60 Technologies Inc, the technology and innovation division of a Canadian retail chain, was established to develop the most disruptive and exciting technologies in the field of healthcare, retail and tourism. North60 Tech is the hub for generating and developing impactful ideas and taking them to market. Our ideas stem from combining existing and well-understood trends with cutting edge technologies to create a significant societal impact leading to positive lifestyle enhancements, while making things simpler, efficient and certainly more effective than the current alternatives. We aim not only to change but to revolutionize applications and technology that already exist.</div>

Job_Description: <div>  <div> <p><strong>Software Developer - High Performance Web and Network Architecture<br></strong></p> <p><strong>Développeur Logiciel - Architecture web et réseau à haute performance<br></strong></p> <p></p> </div> </div><div> <p><strong></strong></p> <p></p> <p></p> <p></p> <p></p> <p></p> <p><strong>Software Developer - High Performance Web and Network Architecture </strong></p> <p><strong>Dakis Inc. | Montreal (Qc), Canada </strong></p> <p></p> <p></p> <p><strong></strong> </p> <p><strong>Job description & responsibilities </strong></p> <p>You will be responsible to develop Dakis’ web and network architecture based on Cloud Computing principals and utilising Software Oriented Architecture (SOA) principals for the transmission of a great quantity of requests, web pages, images and videos. This includes primarily the management of modern Data Bases, to develop APIs in a SOA mode, Web Workers, integrating Application Performance Management (APM) solutions and to develop all application security aspects.</p> <p> </p>  <div> <ul> <li> <div>Your role will be to develop Dakis’ web and network architecture, and to connect the backend to Dakis’ core eCommerce and Photo products. </div> </li><li> <div>You will be highly involved in all phases of the software’s development and will be responsible for planning features, designing its components, programming and more</div> </li><li> <div>You will take part in defining and planning your projects</div></li></ul> </div> <p> </p> <p>This is one of the most interesting project available and a dream job. Ready for a real challenge? Let’s get in touch! </p> <p></p> <p> </p> <p><strong>Main qualifications and desired skills</strong></p> <p> </p>  <div> <ul> <li> <div>Demonstrable experience and have successfully built and managed a high performance and traffic platform/architecture/network</div> </li><li> <div>Experienced with Rails and MySQL</div> </li><li> <div>Nginx and Apache web servers </div> </li><li> <div>Experienced Ruby, JavaScript, Angular, HTML and CSS skills </div> </li><li> <div>Have previously built web applications from A to Z</div></li></ul> <ul> <li> <div>Experienced building and scaling high traffic web applications</div> </li><li> <div> <p>Developped APIs in SOA mode</p></div> </li><li> <div> <p>Web Workers</p></div> </li><li> <div>Attention to details and strong commitment to quality</div> </li><li> <div>Experienced with modern software development principles and processes, frameworks, and version control systems </div></li></ul> </div> <p> </p> <p><strong>Complementary skill set</strong></p> <p><strong></strong> </p><strong></strong>  <div> <ul> <li> <div>Good understanding of responsive front-end framework, cross-browser user interfaces / browser limitations, modern web technologies, web security, SEO and more</div> </li><li> <div>Modern web technologies and languages </div> </li><li> <div>Debian Linux and/or Unix operating systems </div> </li><li> <div>Facebook, Social Medias and Web Services APIs </div> </li><li> <div>Mobile Apps </div></li></ul> </div> <p> </p> <p><strong>About Dakis </strong></p> <p>Dakis is a SMB and rapidly growing private Software Development Company. We are assisting retailers and manufacturers across the globe with easy to use and well adapted Managed Websites, WebStores, Product Information and Photo Solutions. </p> <p></p> <p></p> <p> </p> <p>We are looking for talented and motivated Software Developers to join our agile tech team to develop Dakis’ next generation of products including the Responsive Front-End Framework & Web-CMS, SaaS Multi-Channel WebStores & Product Information Management SOA Platform, Web Photo Solutions, Photo Kiosks and Mobile Photo Apps. Let’s get in touch! </p> <p> </p> <p><strong>Apply </strong></p> <p>We value talented and motivated individuals that truly love what they do. Interested to shape the future? Send us your CV, links or code sample and salary expectations at cv@dakis.com. </p> <p> </p> <p> </p> <p><strong>Développeur Logiciel - Architecture Web et Réseau à Haute Performance </strong></p> <p><strong>Dakis Inc. | Montreal (Qc), Canada </strong></p> <p> </p> <p><strong>Description & responsabilités </strong></p> <p>Vous serez responsable du développement de l’architecture web et réseau haute performance de Dakis basé sur des principes de Cloud Computing et en mode Software Oriented Architecture (SOA) pour la transmission d’une grande quantité de requêtes, de pages web, d’images et de vidéos. Ceci inclus principalement la gestion des bases de données modernes, le développement d’APIs en mode SOA, de Web Workers, l’intégration des systèmes d’Application Perfomance Management (APM) et le développement de l’aspect sécurité applicatif.</p> <p> </p>  <div> <ul> <li> <div>Votre rôle sera de développer l’architecture web et réseau, et de faire la connexion côté backend avec les autres produits de Dakis incluant nos solutions eCommerce et photos </div> </li><li> <div>Vous serez impliqué dans toutes les phases de développement du logiciel et serez responsable de la planification des caractéristiques, la conception de ses composantes, la programmation et plus encore</div> </li><li> <div>Vous contribuerez à la définition et la planification des projets</div></li></ul> </div> <p> </p> <p>Ce projet est l’un des plus intéressants et offre une carrière rêvée. Êtes-vous prêt à relever un important défi? Contactez-nous! </p> <p> </p> <p><strong>Principales qualifications</strong></p> <p><strong> </strong></p>  <div> <ul> <li> <div>Expérience démontrable pour développer et gérer avec succès une plateforme/architecture/réseau ayant un fort volume de vidéos et contenu</div> </li><li> <div>Maîtrise de Rails et MySQL </div> </li><li> <div>Nginx et Apache web servers </div> </li><li> <div>Maîtrise de Ruby, JavaScript, Angular, HTML et CSS </div> </li><li> <div>Avoir bâti des applications web de A à Z </div> </li><li> <div>Faire évoluer des applications web à haut trafique</div> </li><li> <div> <p>Développement d'APIs en mode SOA</p></div> </li><li> <div> <p>Web Workers</p></div> </li><li> <div>Attention aux détails et fierté de livrer un produit de qualité </div> </li><li> <div>Expérimenté avec les principes et processus modernes de développement logiciel, frameworks et version control systems </div></li></ul> </div> <p> </p> <p><strong>Expertise complémentaire </strong></p> <p><strong></strong> </p>  <div> <ul> <li> <div>Bonne compréhension des responsive front-end framework, limitations des fureteurs, technologies web modernes, sécurité web, SEO et plus encore </div> </li><li> <div>Technologies et langages web modernes </div> </li><li> <div>Debian Linux et/ou Systèmes d’Opération Unix </div> </li><li> <div>API Facebook, médias sociaux et services web </div> </li><li> <div>App Mobile </div></li></ul> </div> <p> </p> <p></p> <p> </p> <p><strong>À Propos de Dakis </strong></p> <p>Dakis est une PME du domaine du développement logiciel en phase de croissance rapide. Nous contribuons au succès des détaillants et des manufacturiers du monde entier en leur fournissant des solutions de Sites Web Gérés, WebStore, Information Produit et des Solutions Photos qui sont simples d’utilisation et bien adaptées. </p> <p></p> <p> </p> <p>Nous recherchons des développeurs logiciels talentueux et motivés pour joindre notre équipe tech pour développer les prochaines générations des produits de Dakis y compris notre Responsive front-end framework & Web-CMS, SaaS eCommerce Multi-Canaux & Gestion de l’Information Produit SOA Platform, Solutions Photo Web, Bornes Photo et Applications Photos Mobiles. Contactez-nous! </p> <p></p> <p> </p> <p><strong>Appliquez </strong></p> <p>Nous apprécions les individus talentueux et motivés qui aiment vraiment ce qu'ils font. Intéressé à façonner l'avenir? Faites-nous parvenir votre CV, des liens ou des exemples de code et vos attentes salariales à cv@dakis.com . </p> <p></p> <p> </p> </div>
Title: Software Developer - Web and Network Architecture

Job_Description: <strong>ENGLISH FOLLOWS</strong> <br/><br/> La motivation nourrit notre industrie le désir de donner vie une idée, dinclure du jamais vu dans un jeu. Cest ce qui donne la force motrice de léquipe Motive. Nos seules limites sont celles de notre imagination. Motive est un nouveau studio créatif, dirigé par Jade Raymond et une équipe de vétérans de lindustrie. Le studio Motive vise redéfinir les jeux daction et proposer aux adeptes des jeux novateurs de qualité supérieure. Quoi de mieux que davoir la possibilité de créer la prochaine franchise succès, de collaborer un jeu Star Wars et de participer aux débuts dun tout nouveau studio? Si les jeux vous passionnent et que vous souhaitez repousser les limites de votre art, profitez de cette occasion unique. <br/><br/> Motive est la recherche dun(e) <strong>Programmeur(euse) En Ligne</strong> pour se joindre son équipe. <br/><br/> <strong>Responsabilités Principales :</strong> <ul> <li>Collaborer avec les membres de léquipe la conception et implémentation des fonctionnalités en-ligne</li><li>En partenariat avec léquipe Serveurs, assurer lintégration dans le jeu des fonctionnalités en-ligne</li><li>Tester et auditer le code et les systèmes en-ligne tout au long du développement</li> </ul> <strong>Exigences :</strong> <ul> <li>Minimum de 3 ans dexpérience en développement dapplications client/serveur en C++</li><li>Expérience de travail avec une équipe dingénieurs dans le cycle complet de développement dun titre AAA</li><li>Excellente connaissance du C++ et expérience de travail avec des bases de code très étendues</li><li>Capacité de travailler de façon autonome et autodirigée</li><li>Excellentes aptitudes pour le travail déquipe et la communication</li><li>Passion pour le jeu et la création de jeux novateurs</li> </ul> <strong>Atouts :</strong> <ul> <li>Expérience en programmation asynchrone et multithread</li><li>Expérience de travail avec les bases de donnes et le langage SQL ou équivalent</li><li>Connaissance des protocoles réseaux tels que HTTPS et TCP/IP</li><li>Connaissance des systèmes dexploitation Windows et Linux</li><li>Connaissance dautres langages de programmation, notamment Perl, Python ou Bash</li><li>Baccalauréat en informatique ou en génie informatique</li> </ul> <strong>Quavons-nous vous offrir ? Bonne question !</strong> <br/><br/> Nous adorons vanter les avantages que nous offrons comme des régimes dassurance-maladie et davantages sociaux complets, le remboursement des frais de cours, un régime dépargne-retraite avec cotisation équivalente et, bien sûr, plusieurs autres -côtés. Nous savons que pour créer des jeux de renommée mondiale, il nous faut des talents de classe mondiale. Cest pourquoi nous offrons une rémunération concurrentielle ainsi quune culture basée sur la créativité et lindividualité. Chez EA, nous incarnons le modèle « travail-loisir » chaque jour. <br/><br/> Plus sur notre emplacement : http://careers.ea.com/our-locations/montreal <br/><br/> Contacter notre recruteur: <strong>Audrey Berendsen</strong> aberendsen@ea.com <br/><br/> <strong>Motive vous offre les moyens et loccasion. Venez découvrir ce dont vous êtes capable!</strong> <br/><br/> Everyone in our industry has a Motive - an idea they want to bring to life, something theyve never seen before in a game that they want to make a reality. This is what drives everyone at Motive. The only limit here is the teams imagination. Motive is a new creative-driven studio, led by Jade Raymond and a team of industry veterans, Motive aims to redefine action games and bring the highest quality innovative games to players. What could be better than getting to create the worlds next block buster franchise, work on a Star Wars game and be part of building a brand-new studio from the ground up? If you are passionate about games and motivated to push your craft further this is the opportunity of a lifetime. <br/><br/> Motive is seeking an <strong>Online Developer</strong> to join its team. <br/><br/> <strong>Primary Responsibilities:</strong> <ul> <li>Collaborate with team members to design and implement online features</li><li>Partner with the backend team to integrate online features into the game</li><li>Test and monitor online game systems throughout the development cycle</li> </ul> <strong>Requirements:</strong> <ul> <li>At least 3 years of experience developing client/server applications in C++</li><li>Experience working with a team of engineers throughout the full development cycle on an AAA title</li><li>Advanced knowledge of C++ and experience working with extended code bases</li><li>Ability to work independently and to be self-directing</li><li>Excellent teamwork and communication skills</li><li>Passion for making and playing innovative games</li> </ul> <strong>Assets:</strong> <ul> <li>Experience with asynchronous and multithreaded programming</li><li>Experience working with databases and SQL or equivalent</li><li>Knowledge of network protocols, such as HTTPS and TCP/IP</li><li>Knowledge of Windows and Linux operating systems</li><li>Knowledge of any other programming languages, especially Perl, Python or Bash</li><li>B.S. in Computer Science or Computer Science Engineering</li> </ul> <strong>Whats in it for you? Glad you asked!</strong> <br/><br/> We love to brag about our great perks like comprehensive health and benefit packages, tuition reimbursement, RRSP company match and, of course, many other perks! And since we realize it takes world-class people to make world-class games, we offer competitive compensation packages and a culture that thrives from creativity and individuality. At EA, we live the work hard/play hard credo every day. <br/><br/> More about our location: http://careers.ea.com/our-locations/montreal <br/><br/> Contact our Recruiter:<strong>Audrey Berendsen</strong> aberendsen@ea.com <br/><br/> <strong>Motive has the means and opportunity. Come see what you can do!</strong>
Title: Motive: développeur online / Online Developer

Job_Description: Full-Time Position - Markham <br/><br/> Hiring a full-time Full Stack Developer in Markham, ON! Our client is looking for a full stack developer for a full-time perm opportunity. As a member of their product development team, you will involved in the development of web-based applications that are critical to the support of their cloud-based customer services. <br/><br/> Perks You'll Love   <ul> <li>Innovative Company</li> <li>Collaborative environment</li> <li>Dynamic team with leading industry experience</li> </ul>  What You're Bringing   <ul> <li>Minimum of 4 years of relevant development experience</li> <li>Strong experience in object-oriented programming</li> <li>Experience in C#, C++, Java or similar languages</li> <li>Front-end development using modern JavaScript frameworks/libraries such as AngularJS, React</li> <li>Experience with backend integration using HTTP REST-based API</li> <li>Strong communication skills</li> <li>Bachelors degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, or related disciplines</li> </ul>  Bonus Skills We'd Love to See   <ul> <li>Experience building distributed applications for the cloud.</li> <li>Knowledge in microservices</li> <li>Continuous Integration</li> </ul>  We Are An Equal Opportunity Employer <br/> All qualified applicants will receive equal consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status. <br/><br/> Canadian Work Authorization <br/> All applicants MUST be authorized to work in Canada. Any applicants not meeting this criteria will not be notified and will not be considered eligible for the position.
