Job_Description: <strong>Platform Developer - Avrij Analytics - Fredericton NB</strong> <br/><br/> Avrij is a data analytics company working with professional sports teams, to help them manage and understand the ever-growing stream of publically shared information affecting their organizations. <br/><br/> We are looking for a new team member to join us, in the position of a platform developer. You will work on a new project idea, developing a data analysis, presentation & collaboration platform, that will enable our users to make vital business decisions for their organizations. <br/><br/> In this role, you’ll be involved in platform development, working on backend product design and implementation, using components available in cloud platforms to construct data processing pipelines. You will also take part in fostering growth and culture in our team and contributing to the advancement in data analytics in our region. <br/><br/> <strong>Requirements for this position include:</strong>  <ul>  <li>Bachelor's or Master’s Degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering or equivalent.</li>    <li>2+ years of platform & application development experience</li>    <li>1+ years CI/CD development experience</li>    <li>1+ years experience of Javascript frameworks (Ember, Angular, React, etc) in a production environment</li>    <li>1+ years experience with agile development practices, source control platforms, IDE development platforms (IntelliJ, Eclipse)</li>    <li>Experience with building backend platforms and explanation of these platforms with other members of the team.</li>    </ul> <strong>Skills highly desired for this position, but not required, include:</strong>  <ul>  <li>1+ years development experience in cloud platforms, such as AWS, Azure, GCP</li>    <li>1+ years working with and implementing RESTful APIs</li>    <li>Experience with review and integration of user feedback, scoping new features, and implementation into production systems</li>    <li>Experience with analyzing and migrating prototype code/concept implementations into production platforms & products</li>    <li>Experience assisting and mentoring junior team members</li>    </ul> <strong>Position:</strong>  Full time, <br/><br/> <strong>Location:</strong> Fredericton, NB <br/><br/> <strong>Start Date:</strong>  Fall 2018
Title: Platform Developer

Job_Description: Apply <br/>  Web Application Developer<br/><br/>Everest Clinical Research ("Everest") is a full-service contract research organization (CRO) providing a broad range of expertise-based clinical research services to worldwide pharmaceutical, biotechnology, and medical device industries. We serve some of the best-known companies and work with many of the most advanced drugs, biologics, and medical devices in development today. <br/><br/> Everest has been an independent CRO since 2004 with a strong foundation as a statistical and data management center of excellence. Building on this foundation, Everest has successfully developed and established itself as a full-service CRO. Operating primarily in North America, with headquarters located in Markham (Greater Toronto Area), Ontario, Canada and an office in Little Falls (Greater New York City Area), New Jersey, USA, Everest is known in the industry for its high quality deliverables, superior customer service, and flexibility in meeting clients’ needs. A dynamic organization with an entrepreneurial origin, Everest continues to experience exceptional growth and great success. <br/><br/> Quality is our backbone, customer-focus is our tradition, flexibility is our strength...that’s us…that’s Everest. <br/><br/> To drive continued success in this exciting clinical research field, we are seeking a committed, skilled, and customer-focused individual to join our winning team as a:<br/><br/>Clinical Trials Web Application Developer<br/><br/><strong>Key Responsibilities:</strong> <br/><br/> As a Clinical Trials Web Application Developer, you will be responsible for developing and maintaining high quality clinical trials web applications used for patient randomization, drug assignment and supply management, trial administration and operational monitoring. You will work closely with business/functional and technical leads to review and clarify user and system requirements, design and configure trial-specific functions and features, program and test the application, and support the ongoing maintenance of the application throughout the clinical trial through to trial close. You will own the design and development of entire study-specific applications from backend through to the UI and will optimize your quality and efficiency by using pre-validated study application templates provided by Everest. <br/><br/> In addition to providing high quality web application development services, you will also support the ongoing enhancement of the application architecture, develop new features and Proof of Concepts with direction from the business / functional leads, and implement initiatives to strengthen the technical and non-functional aspects of the application platform. You will also help influence design, programming and broader technical decisions and support the rapid expansion of Everest clinical trials application portfolio to meet market / competitive demand. <br/><br/> The following is a summary of your key responsibilities:  <ul> <li>Design, development, unit testing, systems testing, maintenance and deployment of custom built Java/J2EE applications to meet client and system requirements.</li> <li>Work closely with clients, and cross-functional team members to understand and analyze business and technical requirements that drive the analysis and design of technical solutions.</li> <li>Review technical specifications to ensure base and enhanced requirements are met.</li> <li>Provide client support and consultation for development, integration as well as advice in areas of expertise. Perform unit, component and assembly testing of system components and bug fixes.</li> <li>Develop detailed design of application components, and write maintainable, high quality code in a timely fashion.</li> <li>Participate and support user training and client demonstrations/UAT of the web application products on an as-needed basis.</li> <li>Perform system maintenance activities in accordance with Everest policies, standard operating procedures (SOPs) and working documents specific to Web Technologies development, maintenance and broader IT and Corporate SOPs where applicable. Support system validation initiatives where necessary.</li> <li>Perform database change updates required by users during the support / maintenance phase after a clinical trial application is launched.</li> <li>Identify functional and technical application enhancements based on system performance, client feedback, internal reviews and industry leading practices and help to prioritize, plan and execute ongoing enhancements for the betterment of the system / product.</li> <li>Support in special web development and IT initiatives, as needed. Initiatives may include</li> <li>Evaluation and upgrade of server operating systems, hardware, and operational / development software</li> <li>Implementation of improved encryption standards for communications to and from secure server applications</li> <li>Optimization of web security infrastructure for user authentication and authorization of controlled components.</li> <li>Web User Interface re-design and refresh.</li> </ul> <strong>Qualifications and Experience:</strong>  <ul> <li>University Degree in Computer Science or Computer Engineering with a minimum of 5 to 10+ years’ experience.</li> <li>OOD (Object-Oriented Design), OOP (Object-Oriented Paradigm) and Architecture & Design Patterns.</li> <li>Java and J2EE application development.</li> <li>J2SE/Java programming.</li> <li>JSP, Servlet and web development.</li> <li>Relational databases including Oracle/MySQL.</li> <li>PL/SQL, Trigger, and store procedure.</li> <li>UI Technologies: HTML 5, CSS 3, XSLT, JQuery, JavaScript.</li> <li>Web Service and API design and development using XML or JSON</li> <li>Windows and UNIX environments.</li> <li>Java IDE (preferably Eclipse).</li> <li>Tomcat 6/7 Application Server</li> <li>Oracle DB 11g / 12c Database Technologies</li> <li>Adaptive UI Design (Mobile, Tablet)</li> <li>Knowledge of software development QC and QA methodologies.</li> <li>Development frameworks such as Struts/TILE.</li> <li>Knowledge of object/relational persistence and query service such as Hibernate.</li> <li>Perl and/or Shell Script.</li> <li>Working knowledge of User Interfaces Design.</li> <li>Experience working in the CRO or pharmaceutical industries is an asset.</li> <li>Good organizational and time management skills with the ability to manage concurrent projects and adjust to changing priorities.</li> <li>Detail-oriented, customer and quality-focused.</li> <li>Excellent communication, interpersonal, and teamwork skills.</li> <li>Proven flexibility and adaptability when working in a team and independently, using good judgment in making decisions.</li> </ul> <strong>How to Apply</strong> <br/><br/> Please complete the on-line form, or send your application, indicating the position to which you are applying to careers@ecrscorp.com <br/><br/> We are an equal opportunity employer. We thank all interested applicants, however, only those selected for an interview will be contacted. <br/><br/> Everest is committed to upholding the principles of dignity, independence, integration, and equal opportunity. We welcome and encourage applications from people with disabilities and upon request, we will provide accommodations for candidates participating in any part of our recruitment and selection process. <br/><br/> ‹ Back
Title: Web Application Developer

Job_Description: Job Description<br/><br/><strong>Change the world at IBM.</strong> There arent many companies who can say they have been an integral part of the global business landscape for more than a century. While the world has changed considerably over the past 100 years, IBM, our people and our offerings have continuously led the way with business and technology innovation. <br/><br/> Today, we are more than a hardware, software and services provider, yet we remain true to our heritage as a team of collaborative forward-thinkers, focused on making business and society work better. We are part of the fabric of everyday life and stand for world-changing progress. <br/><br/> Join a company where you can make an impact and literally change the world. With so many different opportunities available the sky is the limit!   <ul> <li>This position resides in <strong>Ottawa, ON</strong> and is a <strong>4 or 8 (co-op)</strong> month work term commencing <strong>September 2018</strong>. It is <strong>mandatory</strong> that all applicants are enrolled in <strong>full-time</strong> studies at a post-secondary institution and returning to full-time studies upon completion of the work term.</li> </ul>  <strong>What IBM Offers You?</strong> <ul> <li>Work directly on product and services that affect our clients, while having access to cutting edge software technology</li><li>Work on projects which are challenging, innovative and rewarding</li><li>A business casual dress code and flexible work hours, to ensure work-life balance</li><li>Access to the Future Blue Community - IBMs large student community that provides networking opportunities, sporting and social events.</li> </ul> <strong>It is a mandatory requirement for students to apply online at www.ibm.com/jobs</strong> <br/><br/> <strong>Closing Date: Open Until Filled</strong>  <br/><br/> The Software Developer will be an integral part of IBMs Security Intelligence QRadar software development team that is responsible for delivering new and enhanced feature functionality for the SI product line. To achieve this were seeking talented Front End Web Developer and backend Java developer who will create interface design concepts, build prototypes and deliver final products.<br/><br/>Required Technical and Professional Expertise  <ul> <li>Co-op or internship program enrollment is mandatory</li><li>Knowledge of at least one programming language, preferably Java</li><li>Basic knowledge of database</li><li>Basic knowledge of HTML</li> </ul>  Preferred Tech and Prof Experience  <ul> <li>Java</li><li>Javascript</li><li>HTML</li><li>CSS</li> </ul>  EO Statement <br/> IBM is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status. IBM is also committed to compliance with all fair employment practices regarding citizenship and immigration status. <br/><br/>
Title: Software Developer - Coop

Job_Description: TELUS Health and Payment Solutions is currently looking for a talented Developer Analyst to join the Pharmacy Solutions team building an API to connect pharmacies with patients. <br/><br/> As a Developer Analyst, you will actively contribute to the optimization and evolution of TELUS PharmaSpace platform backed by the Kroll and Ubik pharmacy management systems.<br/>  <div><strong>What YOU Get to Do…</strong></div>  <ul>  <li>Design and code Web API and related backend functionality to support other teams building website and mobile app</li> <li>Add features to Kroll or Ubik pharmacy management systems to support business features exposed by the API to mobile and web platforms</li> <li>In collaboration with the Architect, participate in the technical evolution of our products</li> <li>Grow within a team in an Agile development environment</li> </ul>  <div><strong>You're the missing piece of the puzzle…</strong></div>  <ul>  <li>5 years’ of Software Development experience</li> <li>Proficiency with Microsoft (MS) development environment: C#, VB.NET, ASP.NET MVC Core, .NET Framework</li> <li>Full understanding of HTTP request pipeline</li> <li>Experience with delegated identity/authorization protocols (OpenID Connect, OAuth2)</li> <li>Web API development experience (HTTP JSON, swagger, etc.)</li> <li>Experience with relational databases MSSQL, PostgreSQL</li> <li>Practical experience with tools such as Bitbucket, Git, Jenkins, Jira, Gradle</li> <li>Working knowledge of various software development methodologies (Waterfall, Scrum, Kanban)</li> <li>Courage to challenge status quo with new ideas that lead to innovation and process improvement</li> <li>Bachelor degree in Computer Science or Computer Engineering or related experience</li> </ul>  <div><strong>Great-to-haves…</strong></div>  <ul>  <li>Web development experience using HTML, CSS, JavaScript</li> <li>Experience with container and container orchestration technologies such as Docker, Kubernetes</li> <li>Experience with JavaScript and related frameworks (Angular, React, Express, Node.js)</li> <li>Experience designing and documenting APIs</li> <li>Hands on experience working and contributing to an Agile Environment</li> <li>Knowledge of the pharmacy industry</li> </ul>  <div><strong>Where WE are looking…</strong></div>  <ul>  <li>Toronto</li> </ul>  <div><strong>Who is TELUS?</strong></div><br/>  <div>We're a high-performing team of individuals who collectively make TELUS one of the leading telecommunications companies in Canada. Our competitive consumer offerings include wireline, wireless, internet and Optik TV™. We also deliver a compelling range of products and services for small, medium and large businesses; and have carved out a leadership position in the health, energy, finance and public sector markets with innovative industry specific solutions.</div> <br/>  <div>TELUS Health is an IT leader in Canada that focuses on the health sector. Our mission is to improve the way information is being used along the continuum of care to better the health of citizens in Canada and in selected countries.</div> <br/>  <div>Everyone belongs at TELUS. It doesn’t matter who you are, what you do or how you do it, at TELUS, your unique contribution and talents will be valued and respected. Because the more diverse perspectives we have the more likely we are to crack the code on what our customers want and our communities need.</div> <br/>  <div>Do you share our passion?</div><br/>   <div>At TELUS, <strong>you</strong> create future friendly® possibilities.</div> <br/>  <div>At TELUS, we are committed to diversity and equitable access to employment opportunities based on ability.</div> <br/>  <div><strong>Disclaimer:</strong> In accordance with the TELUS Health Solutions Data Center Security Policy, as a condition of employment, all personnel whose job functions require they work at a Data Center and/or have access to detailed knowledge of technology related to client service delivery, are subject to a Personnel Security Screening conducted through the Government of Canada.</div>   <li>LI-TE</li>
Title: Developer Analyst III – TELUS Health

Job_Description: <p><strong>The bazinga! process</strong></p>  <p>At bazinga!, we foster a culture of ongoing improvement - in everything we do. Our work environment is cross-functional - we work collaboratively from engineers to executives - and also across teams from marketing, product and development. We believe great products are envisioned, designed, built, tested, nurtured, improved and rethought regularly by passionate teams.</p>  <p> </p>  <p><strong>What we're looking for</strong></p>  <p>We're looking for people who can help build out our new backend architecture. This means you are comfortable with building scalable APIs and the pipelines to deploy them. You also care about developer experience and championing it across a team. Through your past experience, you've learned how to juggle multiple projects, know how to frequently and incrementally ship products, and have a solid understanding of engineering best practices.</p>  <p> </p>  <p>In the fast-paced world of a disruptive and innovative SaaS product, you are:</p>  <p> </p>  <ul> <li>Able to wear multiple hats (and fit them all)</li> <li>Ambitious and curious - you love learning new things</li> <li>A team player with a love for collaboration</li> <li>Able to excel as a self-starter</li> <li>Someone with a strong analytical mindset who loves breaking down walls</li> </ul>  <p> </p>  <p><strong>Skills you possess</strong></p>  <p>We are looking for an engineer with experience in functional programming technologies to help us build the future of our web platform. Your skills and experience should include:</p>  <ul> <li>Interest in functional programming and basic knowledge of at least one functional language (e.g. Scala, OCaml, F#, Haskell, Elixer)</li> <li>Unit and functional testing as an ingrained part of your workflow</li> <li>Experience working on a distributed platform</li> <li>Good judgment on making technical tradeoffs</li> <li>A demonstrated ability and interest in picking up new technologies</li> </ul>  <p>Things that aren't required but would raise you above the rest:</p>  <ul> <li>Experience championing Continuous Integration/Continuous Delivery tools and methodologies</li> <li>Experience building distributed systems in the cloud</li> <li>Experience with Domain Driven Design and complex domain modeling</li> <li>Knowledge of Linux and containerization technologies such as Docker.</li> <li>Experience with Postgresql, Graph databases.</li> </ul>  <p> </p>  <p><strong>What we value</strong></p>  <p>We value transparency, honesty, clear communication, hard work, positivity, patience, empathy and compassion. We are looking for people who appreciate, understand and share these values.</p>  <p> </p>  <p><strong>Where you'll work</strong></p>  <p>Bazinga's mission is creating amazing living communities. We strive to embody that mission by creating an amazing work culture, where you can achieve great results through a healthy work/life balance. We offer a great work environment that is collaborative, empowering and fun. Everyone on our team strives to deliver stellar results, and we expect the same from you. This role is based in our Vancouver office. This role will require you to develop a solid understanding of our users and their challenges. In this critical role, you will be a core member of Bazinga's data-driven development team.</p>  <p> </p>  <p><strong>The perks</strong></p>  <ul> <li>Competitive salary based on experience ($80K - $115K)</li> <li>Participation in employee stock option plan after 6 months</li> <li>Great benefits package for you and your family</li> <li>Flexible vacation options</li> <li>Friday socials</li> <li>Great office space</li> <li>Chance to work on something amazing that impacts real people</li> </ul>  <p> </p>  <p><strong>How to apply</strong></p>  <p>If you are still reading this, like what you see and feel confident you have the chops/are who we're looking for, get in touch with us at http://mybazinga.com/careers/. We only select candidates based on overall fit, and you can expect a multi-phase hiring process.</p>
Title: Functional Developer

Job_Description: About Us:<br/><br/>Global Relay is the leading provider of cloud-based archiving, supervision, eDiscovery, and analytics for the global financial sector. We deliver services to 23,000 customers in 90 countries, including 22 of the top 25 global banks. Our market-leading archiving service supports email, instant messaging, Bloomberg®, Thomson Reuters, social media, mobile messaging, and more – with mobile, Outlook, and web access. <br/><br/> Our Global Operations & Development Center is located in Vancouver, BC, Canada. In addition, we have offices in six other cities across the world, including major financial centers like New York, Chicago, and London. <br/><br/> Over the years, we have won several major awards, including:  <ul>   <li>Company of the Year from the BC Tech Association (2016)</li> <li>Canada’s 50 Best Small and Medium Employers (2014, 2015)</li> <li>Canada’s Top Employers for Young People (2014)</li> <li>Canada’s Top 10 Most Admired Corporate Cultures (2013, 2016)</li> <li>Canada’s Best Managed Companies (2013 - present)</li> </ul> We provide fantastic opportunities to individuals passionate about business and technology. For those with international business aspirations, we offer invaluable opportunities for doing business with some of the world’s largest, most influential firms. Our company is also perfect for those who want to create cool technology using massively scalable, big-data architecture, with a strong focus on mobile. <br/><br/> To learn more about our business, culture, and community involvement, visit www.globalrelay.com.<br/><br/>The Role:<br/><br/>The Software Development Engineer in Test (SDET) is a developer who specializes in writing code to test the product. They are responsible for the overall test coverage, test code, and automation frameworks within their Agile team. <br/><br/> In this role you will be working directly with code in an established automation framework to test back-end services for large scale data processing. You will support the team’s release and testing efforts while growing and maintaining automated coverage and frameworks. <br/><br/> <strong>Role Responsibilities:</strong>  <ul>   <li>Define and automate test cases that verify product requirements</li> <li>Write code to support development of automated frameworks and tests</li> <li>Execute test cases using both automated and manual techniques</li> <li>Identify, report and verify software defects</li> <li>Maintain test infrastructure and tools</li> <li>Participate in team planning and story grooming</li> <li>Conduct code reviews, improve and maintain quality of the automation code</li> <li>Document the automation framework, tools and infrastructure</li> </ul> <strong>Technical Skills Requirements:</strong>  <ul>   <li>Minimum 3 years of test development experience.</li> <li>Strong understanding of either Java or C# programming languages.</li> <li>Experience with backend systems or APIs.</li> <li>Experience with testing practices in an agile environment.</li> <li>Experience with any of the following is an asset:</li>   <ul>   <li>big data technology such as Hadoop, MongoDB, Kafka or SQL</li> <li>performance testing with JMeter or similar tools</li> <li>web services technology such as REST, JSON or Thrift</li> <li>network protocols such as HTTP, TLS and TCP</li> <li>continuous integration systems such as Bamboo or Jenkins</li> <li>frontend automation with Selenium WebDriver</li> <li>web technologies such as CSS3, HTML5 or Extend.JS (Sencha)</li> <li>multi-threaded programming</li> <li>design patterns</li></ul>   </ul> <strong>To Apply:</strong> <br/><br/> Think you’re a great fit for this job? Apply today with your cover letter and resume in <strong>one PDF document</strong>. No phone calls please. Applicants must be eligible to work in Canada.
Title: Intermediate Software Development Engineer in Test (Backend)

Job_Description: This is a permanent position, yearly auto-renewable contract.<br/><br/>Who we are:<br/><br/>TELUS Digital is a team of highly skilled professionals dedicated to building innovative, data-driven, customer centric digital experiences. We run like a start-up, weve embraced lean and agile methodologies. We celebrate our failures and see them as opportunities to learn. Our culture fosters collaborative learning and out-of-the-box thinking in a relaxed environment. <br/><br/> We invest in our team members and culture first, by focusing on enablement and empowerment, we foster creativity and champion experimentation, Our team members are leaders in local and global technology communities, we value and support communities such as: Tech Masters, NodeSchool, Ladies Learning Code, Women Who Code TO, FreeCodeCamp and many more! <br/><br/> Our team members are contributors to many open-source projects & core libraries used globally across our industry, We encourage and support open-source contributions & run hackathons for all team members, our culture is tailored towards work-life balance, we keep core hours, and work from home when needed to keep productivity high and protect maker time.<br/><br/>What youll do:<br/><br/>You are an experienced, hands-on lead developer and operator, who has led teams in shipping and supporting large-scale applications. You are a mentor and guiding voice for developers, who can balance day-to-day workload, with an eye for future improvements of your team and their work. <br/><br/> As a Senior Platform developer with TELUS Digital, you will be responsible for designing, building and running a suite of development acceleration tooling, which enables our many outcome teams at TELUS Digital to deliver value quickly and safely. <br/><br/> You will be working as part of a friendly, cross-discipline agile team who helps each other solve problems across all functions. As a custodian of customer trust, you will employ best practice in development, security, accessibility and design to achieve the highest quality of service for our customers. <br/><br/> We use a range of technologies to get the job done: Kubernetes, OpenShift, AWS, Google Cloud Platform, Terraform, while our RESTful APIs are built with Node.js. Quality is a primary concern and we test our applications at multiple levels with sophisticated build and release pipelines, supporting automation testers and Product Owners embedded within teams.<br/><br/>What youll be responsible for:  <ul> <li>Design scalable systems with performance and security in mind</li><li>Diagnose and evolve container-based build pipelines for your team</li><li>Challenge, mentor and guide the team to implement best practices</li><li>Dedicate time to mentor junior developers on the team</li><li>Advocate the use of unit testing and test driven development to drive design and development</li><li>Implement & Advocate accessibility best practices (We believe in an accessible web for everyone)</li><li>Champion documentation and knowledge sharing</li><li>Battle technical debt and avoid decision silos</li><li>Lead technical team members in an agile environment (We use Kanban)</li><li>Evaluate technology choices and rapidly test solutions</li><li>Providing guidance to the business on ideal technical approaches and investment</li><li>Setting the technical vision for your team, and working with the technical leadership to define the roadmap for the applications that your team supports</li><li>Work closely with your team to solve architectural challenges</li><li>Work with product owners to support translating business deliverables into technical outcomes</li><li>Adapt and influence the team to create the best outcome for not only the project but also for our customers</li> </ul>  <strong>What youll need to be successful:</strong> <br/>  Minimum qualifications  <ul> <li>Experience with clustering technologies (we use Kubernetes and OpenShift)</li><li>Experience with the Docker ecosystem</li><li>Experience with Infrastructure as Code and Configuration Management tools (We use terraform and ansible)</li><li>Proven Experience in building scalable production services and monitoring performance (we use Kibana, NewRelic)</li><li>Experience with cloud providers (We use AWS EC2 and GCP)</li><li>Experience with CI/CD tools (We use Jenkins)</li><li>Experience designing and load-testing highly available systems</li><li>Proven History of excelling in a team based collaborative environment</li><li>Experience mentoring junior team members, overseeing code quality and evangelizing best practices</li><li>Experience in translating technical concepts and requirements for non-technical stakeholders</li><li>Intermediate level knowledge of backend development (we use Node.js, PostgreSQL, Redis)</li></ul>  <ul> <li>Intermediate level knowledge of client-side testing best practices and tooling (we use Jest)</li><li>Proven Experience designing and documenting APIs (we use Node.js, Express, OpenAPI Spec)</li></ul>  <ul> <li>Experience with FRP (functional, reactive programming)</li> </ul>  Preferred qualifications  <ul> <li>Experience with securing applications to common security threats (OWASP Standards)</li><li>Familiar with accessibility (WCAG 2) best practices</li><li>Experience with Web/HTTP security controls (CORS, CSP, TLS, etc ...)</li><li>Experience designing, building, and maintaining High Availability systems</li><li>Experience in creating and socializing technology roadmaps</li> </ul>  <strong>About TELUS Digital:</strong> <br/>  Our Mission<br/><br/>TELUS strategic intent is to unleash the power of the Internet to deliver the best solutions to Canadians at home, the workplace or on the move. At TELUS Digital, we do this by enabling our customers and team members to do what they want easily.<br/><br/>Accessibility<br/><br/>TELUS is proud to foster an inclusive culture that embraces diversity. We are committed to fair employment practices and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment. <br/><br/> We offer accommodation for applicants with disabilities, as required.<br/><br/>Our Principles<br/><br/>Our Principles describe the values we prioritize to guide our decisions and the habits we employ to achieve our mission and deliver on TELUS strategy.<br/><br/>Focus on customer first<br/><br/>Customers expect to be able to do what they want in a way that fits their life. We think like our customers, anticipating their needs and crafting seamless, personalized experiences that span physical and digital customer journeys.<br/><br/>Value data over opinions<br/><br/>The best decisions are those that are informed by customer and team member feedback. We build products with results we can measure, informing our decisions with data rather than just listening to the loudest voice in the room.<br/><br/>Deliver outcomes over outputs<br/><br/>Customers and team members want products that simplify their lives over those filled with unnecessary features. We prioritize building experiences that deliver tangible results for our customers and teams over feature development.<br/><br/>Take risks and be lean<br/><br/>Our customers needs change quickly and can be difficult to predict. We embrace ambiguity with agility by experimenting, taking calculated risks and celebrating failures to pivot quickly and continuously improve.<br/><br/>Build for quality and reuse<br/><br/>Customers want high quality experiences delivered quickly without errors and complexity. We showcase our work, reuse solutions, leverage shared platforms and automate development practices to meet our leading customer experience standards.<br/><br/>Be an owner<br/><br/>Owners are curious, create long-term value, and constantly challenge the status quo. We collaborate beyond our individual functions and lines of business, pursue high value ideas in our teams and individually and respectfully assert ourselves when we disagree.<br/><br/>Attract and develop leaders<br/><br/>Leaders tackle the most ambiguous and complex challenges while helping our team scale. We constantly raise the talent bar by seeking out exceptional, passionate people and providing them with development opportunities that enable them to choose their own career path.<br/><br/>Embrace inclusivity<br/><br/>Diversity breeds new ideas, innovation, and a better working environment. We respect and empathize with each other, fostering an inclusive culture where everyone can express their ideas and be their authentic self.<br/><br/>Strengthen communities around us<br/><br/>Creating shared value in our communities benefits TELUS and Canada. We invest in our team members so that they can drive positive social impact in the areas of health, education, environment and digital literacy.<br/><br/>What you can expect from us:  <ul> <li>An environment where youre encouraged to share and act on your ideas</li> <li>Flexible work hours in a central downtown location</li> <li>A welcoming, relaxed office with a casual dress code</li> <li>A culture committed to giving; every year we donate time and resources in our communities</li><li>Weekly lunches with an unending supply of healthy snacks</li><li>A fun, dynamic team that works and plays every day; great ideas can come as easily during an impromptu hallway soccer match or social team outing</li> </ul>  We want to work with people who:  <ul> <li>Share our passion for all things digital</li><li>Thrive in an agile, lean and fast-paced environment</li><li>Clearly see things from the perspective of our customers</li><li>Are curious, experiment and never stop learning</li><li>View collaboration as essential to your work</li><li>Utilize the power of data to inform decisions</li><li>Embrace diversity and new ideas</li> </ul>
Title: Platform Developer

Job_Description: Company Profile <br/><br/> Morgan Stanley is a global financial services firm and a market leader in investment banking, securities, investment management and wealth management services. With offices in more than 43 countries, the people of Morgan Stanley are dedicated to providing our clients the finest thinking, products and services to help them achieve even the most challenging goals. <br/><br/> As a market leader, the talent and passion of our people is critical to our success. We embrace integrity, excellence, team work and giving back. <br/><br/> Technology <br/><br/> The Technology division partners with our business units and leading technology companies to redefine how we do business in ever more global and dynamic financial markets. <br/><br/> Our sizeable investment in technology results in leading-edge tools, software, and systems. Our insights, applications, and infrastructure give a competitive edge to clients’ businesses—and to our own. <br/><br/> Institutional Securities Technology (IST) develops and oversees the overall technology strategy and bespoke technology solutions to drive and enable the institutional businesses and enterprise-wide functions. Our clients include Fixed Income, Equities, Commodities, Investment Banking, Research and Global Capital Markets. <br/><br/> We are also responsible for Pioneer and Application Infrastructure groups that look to develop foundational strategies, tools and technologies that are leveraged across Technology, as well as standardized data and enterprise-wide services to provide leverage to the Firm's businesses. <br/><br/> Position Description <br/><br/> We are looking for a smart, innovative, results-oriented individual to join our global backend development team. The role involves business and technical requirement analysis, design, hands-on development in a distributed architecture environment. An ideal candidate will have a good knowledge of data structures, algorithms, object-oriented concepts, multithreading / synchronization issues, networking, and relational databases. <br/><br/> The successful candidate is expected to work with the colleagues around the globe and hence excellent communication skills (verbal and written) are a must. Knowledge of the financial industry or Equity Swaps would be nice to have, but not a requirement. The primary focus of the role will be on global trading engines written in C , which facilitate trading and hedging the Equity Swaps order as well as managing the FX exposure associated to that business. <br/><br/> Skills Required <br/><br/> • 3-5 years core development experience   <ul> <li>Solid software engineering principles (data structures & algorithms, OO, design patterns, multithreading, networking)</li> <li>Great C/C skills</li> <li>Good trouble shooting and debugging skills</li> <li>Proficiency in XML, SOAP and Linux/Unix; e.g. shell scripting, process management</li> <li>Working knowledge of database concepts (SQL, stored procs, schema design)</li> <li>Working knowledge of a scripting language; Python and/or Perl preferred</li> <li>Experience in formal software development lifecycle (SDLC)</li> <li>Excellent written and verbal communication skills</li> <li>Experience in test driven development <br/><br/> Skills Desired <br/><br/> • Experience designing and developing large scale distributed client/server systems a bonus</li> <li>Front Office (Sales & Trading) development experience</li> <li>Knowledge of FIX protocol related to order management</li> <li>Project management abilities <br/><br/> Knowledge of French and English are required. <br/><br/> Morgan Stanley is an equal opportunities employer. We work to provide a supportive and inclusive environment where all individuals can maximize their full potential. <br/><br/> </li> </ul>
Title: Developer C

Job_Description: PayByPhone is looking to hire a Software Developer to join our growing platform development team to design and develop major components of the backend APIs that power our consumer apps. <br/><br/> As a Software Developer at PayByPhone, you will work in an agile development environment with multiple production deployments per week and work closely with other developers and domain experts. <br/><br/> You take pride and ownership of the quality work you and your team create, you are inquisitive and enjoy solving challenging technical problems, and you are always willing to lend a helping hand. <br/><br/> <strong>You will:</strong>  <ul> <li>Write and test-drive code for new features and bugfixes</li>   <li>Participate in designing and developing automated test suites, refining acceptance criteria, and establishing test plans with your team</li> <li>Participate in code reviews to share knowledge and learn from other team members, ensure code quality, and maintain compliance with industry regulations</li> <li>Build and deploy software through an automated CI/CD pipeline, help refine the process continuously</li> <li>Provision and maintain cloud infrastructure for your teams products</li> <li>Monitor the success of your teams products through application and system metrics</li> <li>Contribute to technical documentation</li> <li>Have full ownership of the systems you and your team develop. This includes monitoring, investigating issues, and supporting the service during outages</li> <li>Track time according to company policy</li> </ul> <strong>You have:</strong>  <ul> <li>2 + years experience designing and developing clean, maintainable software that stands up to real-world users and production conditions</li> <li>Experienced coding ability and familiarity with several languages such as C#, Java, Node.JS, Go, Python, Ruby</li> <li>Worked in an agile development environment using processes like Kanban or Scrum</li> <li>Experience with automated unit testing, and an interest in techniques such as TDD and BDD</li> <li>Excellent understanding of software engineering principles</li> </ul> <strong>It would be nice if you had:</strong>  <ul> <li>Bachelors degree in Computer Science or Software Engineering</li> <li>Experience with cloud applications like AWS/Azure</li> <li>Experience with service-oriented or microservices architecture</li> </ul> <strong>Working For PayByPhone</strong> <br/><br/> PayByPhone values collaboration, innovation, learning, and fun.  <ul> <li>We encourage each other to try out new ideas and adopt the ones that work.</li> <li>We are culturally diverse.</li> <li>We deeply value supporting a flexible work/life balance.</li> <li>We invest in professional growth. We attend conferences such as AWS re:Invent, ng-conf, .NET Fringe, HashiConf, and more!</li> <li>We have company-sponsored social events and are well-represented in local events, such as the Sun Run and Bike to Work weeks.</li> </ul>  <strong>About PayByPhone</strong><br/><br/>PayByPhone is one of the fastest-growing mobile payment companies in the world. We process over 70 million parking, transit, and bike-share transactions a year in cities across North America, Europe and Australia. PayByPhone helps millions of consumers easily and securely pay for parking and transportation without the hassles of waiting in line, carrying change, or risking costly fines. <br/><br/> Cities such as San Francisco, Seattle, Miami, Vancouver, London, and Paris have entrusted PayByPhone with driving their parking operations forward, through unrivaled uptime and reliability, 24/7/365 customer support, seamless integrations, and deep data insights. With our recent acquisition by Volkswagen Financial Services, part of the largest auto manufacturing group in the world, PayByPhone has access to unmatched marketing resources, funding, and drivers. <br/><br/> By helping transportation agencies and parking operators tap into the latest advancements in secure mobile payment, data analysis, and location technologies, PayByPhone reduces costs while increasing revenue. To learn more, visit www.paybyphone.com or download our app for iOS or Android.

We collaborate globally with top-tier professionals in the field to provide ingenious and elegant cloud-based technical solutions for our clients’ business needs. We are passionate about seeing people empowered to realize their full potential, and we pursue that goal for our clients, team members and young entrepreneurs in our local community. <br/><br/> We also offer the experience of being an integral part of a fast-growing, agile team working on cutting-edge projects. Migrations from source to target system including: data strategy, data mapping, SQL scripts and ETL processes</li>  <li>Integrate Salesforce.com with various other systems using standard ETL tools customizations to meet customer requirements</li>  <li>Produce quality deliverables within hard deadlines under minimal guidance</li>  <li>Contribute to internal strategic projects</li> </ul> management</li>  <li>Ability to lead meeting and gather requirements</li>  <li>Outstanding professionalism and customer facing skills</li>  <li>Minimum Bachelors Computer Science (or equivalent degree). Business minor focus is preferred</li> </ul>  </div><br/>  <div><strong>Compensation</strong>  <ul> <li>Work visa sponsorship to Canada</li>   <li>Competitive salary</li>  <li>Target-based bonus</li>  <li>MSP and Extended Health Benefits (Eye exams, Dental, Accidental, Travel) for you, your spouse and your children</li>  <li>15 days paid time-off plus 10 days BC Statutory Holidays</li>  <li>Your own designated sit-stand workstation, Macbook with 1-2 monitors</li>  <li>Sponsored Salesforce certifications</li>   <li>Friday retrospectives with happy hour!</li>  <li>Great office views of mountains and waterfront!</li>  <li>Lunch & Learn sessions</li>  <li>Beverages and snacks from the kitchen</li>  <li>On-site gym pass with shower facilities</li>  <li>Bike locker if you want to bike to work</li> </ul>  </div> <br/>

Job_Description: On behalf of our client, Affinity Staffing is looking for a highly motivated Software Engineer with a proven knowledge of design patterns and Software Engineering techniques. <br/><br/> If you like working in a small and fun start-up environment, take full ownership and responsibility to deliver tangible results, this is the right place for you! We are looking for a Senior (5 to 7+ years) .NET/C# Developer, to join the engineering team. You will design, develop, and maintain the APIs and Hosted Application. Our current development stack is:   <ul> <li>.NET/C#, ASP.NET MVC and WebAPI for backend services and web development</li>  <li>HTML5, CSS3, AngularJS, ReactJS and Gulp automation for frontend development</li>  <li>Microsoft Azure as a cloud platform</li>  <li>Mix of SQL and NoSQL for database (MS SQL Server, Redis, Azure Table/Blob storage, MongoDB)</li> </ul>  This is a young, fast moving company so it is essential that you have a can-do, entrepreneurial spirit - ideas are good but execution is better (especially when its executing on good ideas)! We are a small team, we are good at what we do and we like working together. You will have autonomy and respect from day one. Learning and keeping abreast of new technology and sharing with the rest of the team are activities we all enjoy and encourage. <br/><br/> <u>Skills & Requirements</u>   <ul> <li>University Degree in Computer Science/Engineering</li>  <li>Minimum 5 years of experience in C# programming</li>  <li>Minimum 4 years of development experience with ASP.NET Web API, JavaScript, jQuery, Ajax, CSS, DHTML, T-SQL</li>  <li>Solid understanding and experience using both relational (MS SQL) and NoSQL data stores (Mongo, Redis), cloud platforms (Microsoft Azure, Amazon AWS)</li>  <li>Proven mentorship and knowledge transfer ability</li>  <li>Ability to multitask and prioritize multiple concurrent assignments</li>  <li>Ability to learn quickly and effectively apply new knowledge</li> </ul>
Title: .NET Full Stack Developer

Job_Description: <strong>What is the Opportunity?</strong> <br/><br/> In this role, you will partner across IT and with assigned business line(s) to assess, research, and analyze business, technical and system needs in order to resolve business systems issues. Recommends technology solutions that meet sponsor / stakeholder needs. You will also provide senior production support to the application and their users. You will require utilizing a pager to provide production support. <br/><br/> <strong>What will you do?</strong> <ul> <li>Assess, understand and analyze technical needs related to business scope and system needs, explore alternative options, recommend technology solutions and designs that meet sponsor needs and project life cycle (PLC) deliverables including, where applicable, component reusability, data sharing and security.</li><li>Prepare detailed technical specifications for small to medium projects in accordance with PLC, security and architecture documentation objectives.</li><li>Ensure thorough technical documentation in respect of test plans and all documentation required as part of the systems development life cycle (SDLC) process. .</li><li>Develop detailed plan and accurate estimates for completion of build, system testing and implementation phases of project. Provide overall module assistance for frontend and backend operations.</li><li>Enhance, debug, Build interfaces for third party modules and applications to integrate with the Calypso vendor application. Develop on custom Calypso vendor application, as per the clients requirement (skilled in Java, MQ, adapter technology using Oracle backend database).</li><li>Perform performance tuning to improve performance over multiple functions. Coordinates testing with external vendors, as/if required.</li><li>Provide input and co-ordinates with database administrator in modifying existing database structures based on required functionality. Organize and participate in walkthrough reviews of all technical specifications, programs and unit test plans.</li><li>Perform production support tasks for 25% of allocation server patching, moves, technology upgrades, participate in disaster recovery exercises, and fulfill compliance obligations on server, SOX and other related compliance duties. Be an active SME, providing support to production support team.</li> </ul> <strong>What do you need to succeed?</strong> <br/><br/> <strong>Must have:</strong> <ul> <li>5 years of consistent experience In-depth knowledge of Java API, MQ, adapter technology using Oracle backend database on Linux environment</li><li>Very Skilled in developing and maintaining interface designs for applications</li><li>Experienced with working on development modules specifically on Linux operating systems</li><li>Experience with trading applications with enterprise cross-asset platform impact; conversant with enterprise architecture and technology tools in the financial services industry specifically banking</li><li>Systems knowledge including different programming languages, multiple platforms, IT standards, methodologies, capability maturity model (CMM), audit requirements, and middleware technologies</li><li>Ability to clearly communicate and work within a team environment as a team player not merely an individual contributor.</li> </ul> <strong>Nice to have:</strong> <ul> <li>Undergraduate degree in computer science, math or physics or computer applications</li><li>3 5 years of experience on applications with multiple functions, preferably Capital Markets OR any Trading platform, Worked on Treasury Applications related to forex, bonds, loans, swap products, interest rate products.</li><li>Work experience of 1-2 years working with, interfacing or using the Calypso or Murex trading applications</li><li>Experience communicating directly, working with market traders on the exchange trading floor.</li><li>Experience working in an Agile environment using Jira, where roles and responsibilities may frequently swapped</li>  </ul> <strong>Whats in it for you?</strong> <br/><br/> We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual. <ul> <li>A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits, competitive compensation, commissions, and stock where applicable</li><li>Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities</li><li>Ability to make a difference and lasting impact</li> <li>Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team</li> <li>Opportunities to do challenging work</li> </ul> <strong>Learn more about RBC Tech Jobs</strong> <br/><br/> <strong>About RBC</strong> <br/> Royal Bank of Canada is Canadas largest bank, and one of the largest banks in the world, based on market capitalization. We are one of North Americas leading diversified financial services companies, and provide personal and commercial banking, wealth management, insurance, investor services and capital markets products and services on a global basis. We have over 80,000 full- and part-time employees who serve more than 16 million personal, business, public sector and institutional clients through offices in Canada, the U.S. and 37 other countries. For more information, please visit rbc.com. <br/><br/> <strong>Join our Talent Community</strong> <br/><br/> Stay in-the-know about great career opportunities at RBC. Sign up and get customized info on our latest jobs, career tips and Recruitment events that matter to you. <br/><br/> Expand your limits and create a new future together at RBC. Find out how we use our passion and drive to enhance the well-being of our clients and communities at rbc.com/careers. <br/><br/> <strong>Inclusion and Equal Opportunity Employment</strong> <br/> RBC is an equal opportunity employer committed to diversity and inclusion. We are pleased to consider all qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, protected veterans status, Aboriginal/Native American status or any other legally-protected factors. Disability-related accommodations during the application process are available upon request. <br/><br/> <u><strong>JOB SUMMARY</strong></u> <br/> <strong>City:</strong>  Toronto <br/> <strong>Address:</strong> 155 Wellington St. <br/> <strong>Work Hours/Week:</strong> 37.5 <br/> <strong>Work Environment:</strong>  Office <br/> <strong>Employment Type:</strong> Permanent <br/> <strong>Career Level:</strong>  Experienced Hire/Professional <br/> <strong>Pay Type:</strong> Salaried <br/> <strong>Required Travel(%):</strong> 0 <br/> <strong>Exempt/Non-Exempt:</strong> N/A <br/> <strong>People Manager:</strong>  No <br/> <strong>Application Deadline:</strong>  2018-05-08 <br/> <strong>Req ID:</strong> 162377 <br/><br/> <em>Posting Notes: [[mfield1]]</em><br/><br/>Apply Now!

Job_Description: <strong>About Pepper.com:</strong> <br/><br/> Pepper.com, the world’s largest shopping community, was founded in 2014. Through international partnerships and conversations, Pepper.com gives smart shoppers around the world a voice to share deals, tips and ideas, connecting members in twelve countries on three continents. <br/><br/> The Pepper.com group is headquartered in Berlin, with offices in Belo Horizonte/Brazil, Guadalajara/Mexico, London /United Kingdom, Lyon/France, Mumbai/India and Winnipeg/Canada and runs market-leading platforms such as Dealabs (France), hotukdeals (United Kingdom), mydealz (Germany) and nine more around the globe. These platforms are currently used by more than 25 million smart shoppers every month and influence 12,000 buying decisions every minute. <br/><br/> <strong>Your profile:</strong> <br/> We are looking for a skilled and experienced engineer who will join our development team in Winnipeg in a senior role. The ideal candidates will be flexible, enthusiastic, and innovative with a very strong background in web development with at least 3 years of relevant experience. <br/><br/> <strong>Your responsibilities would include:</strong>    <ul> <li>Implement features and fix bugs in our Pepper platform</li> <li>Identify and fix performance and maintenance problems</li> <li>Ongoing improvement of our backend infrastructure</li> <li>Stay current with new web development technologies and best-practices and share them with the team <br/><br/> <strong>The qualities we are looking for are:</strong> </li> <li>At least 3 years working experience as a PHP web developer</li> <li>Proponent of progressive enhancement and web standards</li> <li>Strong sense for code reuse and maintainability</li> <li>Good English language skills • Knowledge of relational databases (MySQL, postgresql, etc)</li> <li>Experience with PHP frameworks (Laravel, Yii, FuelPHP, Symfony 2, Zend 2)</li> <li>Experience with Memcache, CouchDB, or Redis</li> <li>Knowledge of OO programming and design patterns</li> <li>Experience with unit testing and integration tests</li> </ul>  <strong>Bonus points for:</strong>   <ul> <li>TDD (PHPUnit) or BDD (Behat or Codeception)</li> <li>AngularJS / Node / SASS / LESS • Composer / Packagist (double bonus points for having a package on packagist)</li> <li>Continuous integration (with Jenkins, TravisCI, etc..)</li> </ul>  <strong>Some perks of working for Pepper.com are:</strong>    <ul> <li>Flexible working hours</li> <li>Kitchen stocked with snacks and beverages</li> <li>Monthly transit credit</li> <li>Be apart of an awesome team of passionate and skilled developers</li> <li>Great office space in the heart of the exchange district</li> <li>Regular 'hack days’ to learn new technologies and skills</li> <li>We also offer a very competitive compensation package <br/><br/> <strong>Are you the person we are looking for?</strong></li> Job_Description: Our Calgary location is currently looking for a <strong><u>full-time Software Developer</u></strong> to be part of a team that is responsible for delivering timely, high quality releases that delight our customers in the upstream oil & gas sector. You’d be designing, coding and testing enhancements to our Harmony desktop application which is mostly written in C++ but uses some C# and is looking into expanding into web technologies. <br/><br/> <strong>About You:</strong>  <ul> <li><strong>You’re highly collaborative</strong> - you have an affinity for finding solutions through discussions with team members</li><li><strong>You’re a problem solver</strong> – you enjoy solving complex problems, and are comfortable exploring them even if the problem and solution are not yet well-defined</li><li><strong>You’re always improving something</strong> – whether it’s learning a new programming language, or finding better ways to do things in your team or organizationally, continuous improvement is important to you</li><li><strong>You’re practical</strong> – you assess the circumstances and make the best decision based on the facts</li> </ul>  <strong>Some of the things you’d be doing as a developer on our team:</strong>  <ul> <li>Be an active and collaborative team member as part of an agile development team of 5-9 people</li><li>Design, code and test enhancements for a Windows-based desktop application written in C++ and/or C#, with SQL Server as its backend database</li><li>Work closely with customer stakeholders to ensure we’re adding value for our users</li><li>Work closely with other developers, for example by pair programming and participating in code reviews</li><li>Troubleshoot and fix bugs</li><li>Contribute to testing of user stories, features and releases</li><li>Assist our customer facing support team in solving client issues, when necessary</li><li>Contribute insights and suggestions as part of our continuous improvement</li><li>Generally pitch in wherever needed to help get a high quality release out on time</li> </ul>  <strong>Qualifications that would make you a good fit for this role:</strong>  <ul> <li>Minimum B.Sc. in software engineering, computer engineering, computer science, or equivalent experience</li></ul>  <ul> <li>Experience writing code in a high-level object-oriented programming language, ideally C++ and/or C#</li><li>Experience with WPF and XAML</li></ul>  <ul> <li>Experience with SQL Server databases</li><li>Experience in web development (particularly Angular and/or React, Javascript, CSS)</li><li>Familiarity with object oriented software design</li><li>Experience with unit testing</li><li>Familiarity with, or interest in, agile principles, values and practices</li> </ul>  We are proud to be an EEO/AA employer M/F/Disability/Veterans. Title: Software Developer

Job_Description: <div>In the role of Sr. Developer youll help create and build beautiful software that matters using modern JavaScript and software development best practices (Agile, TDD, Continuous Delivery). As a developer for Rangle.io, youll be joining a diverse community of people who are passionate about modern JavaScript and its ability to change the world. Youll get to work on a wide range of projects, using the latest JS frameworks building for the web & mobile, working with a tight knit team of talented individuals.</div><br/> <div><strong>YOUR IMPACT</strong></div><li>Opportunity to work with one of the most exciting modern JavaScript software companies in the world.</li> <li>Play a big part in the success of Rangle.io. Were helping shape the Tech scene in Toronto and modern web and mobile development across the world.</li>  <br/> <div><strong>YOUR GROWTH</strong></div>  <li>We have built a strong community that supports and encourages learning and continuous improvement. Were highly active in the tech community: in Toronto and globally. We run several of the most popular tech meetups in Toronto.</li> <li>We have a variety of programs that help everyone improve, include several initiated by our own staff (ex. Rangle U, Lunch & Learns, Hack Nights). We encourage everyone to attend a conference every year (and we pay for it). Everyone gets a coach/mentor to help you grow in your career. And we also contribute to open source.</li> <li>Youll be a part of a small impactful team - because we use agile/scrum, youll be personally involved in decisions on how well build out our products for our clients.</li>  <strong>HOW WE WORK</strong>  <ul> <li>Youll join a tightly-knit team consisting of JS Developers, Designers, Business Quality Analysts and Scrum Masters, who collaborate to build web and mobile apps (Ionic/Cordova, React Native) for our clients. Most projects are new and wont require you to deal with a lot of legacy code.</li><li>We work with modern JavaScript across a range of frameworks and technologies, on the client as well as on the server: Angular, Angular 2, React, NodeJS, TypeScript, ES6, Babel, Flux. (You dont need to be proficient with all of those things to start).</li><li>Our approach to making software stresses teamwork and close interaction with our clients. We rely on a well thought-out process based on Scrum, continuous delivery, and test-driven development. This process allows us to build software in a way that sets you up for success, allowing you to exercise your creativity and building software that matters without all the red tape, hierarchy and politics.</li><li>We avoid sharply defined roles: everyone gets to partake in all aspects of their project and to try their hand at new things. Our developers do not just develop: they also help our clients think through product features, contribute to design, and test.</li><li>We work for many clients in an exciting range of industries: social media, e-commerce, manufacturing, transportation, alternative energy, wellness. Any company that we feel helps make the world a better place.</li> </ul>  <strong>WHAT YOU BRING TO THE TEAM</strong>  <ul> <li>Solid understanding of JavaScript. (Alternatively: really solid backend experience + some JavaScript + ability to learn JavaScript really fast.)</li><li>5+ years experience in web application development, bonus points if you have experience working directly with clients or a product owner.</li><li>Bonus points if you have previous experience building apps in Angular, React or Node.</li><li>Great interpersonal skills - we are a close knit team and work together to solve problems.</li><li>A desire to follow a software development process that helps you sleep better at night</li><li>Bonus points if you have server side experience.</li><li>Bonus points if you have an eye for design. (BTW, all our designers can code.)</li><li>Great problem solver and ability to reinvent oneself - We are always looking at ways we can do things better, sometimes there is no path to follow.</li><li>Proactive and self starter - we hire folks that have a deep desire to do better and be better, you wont be micromanaged in this role. (We want to hear your voice.)</li><li>Passionate about learning - Youll help identify new technologies and approaches to problems. (Web development and especially JS is always evolving.)</li> </ul>  <div><strong>ABOUT US</strong></div><br/> <div>Based out of Toronto, Canada, Rangle.io is changing how software is built, designed, developed and delivered. The web is undergoing a massive transformation in how web and mobile applications are being built, and Rangle is the expert in this next generation of the web.</div><br/> <div>We are dedicated to helping startups and enterprises move to the modern web. We specialize in using modern JavaScript frameworks (such as Angular 2, React, and Node) and a User-Experience driven development process to build applications that deliver a compelling user experience for significantly less development effort compared to legacy server-side web development techniques.</div><br/> <div>Our agile development process, and continuous delivery of working software to build beautiful modern web and mobile applications ensures our clients are never more than a moment away from jumping on the next business opportunity or responding to the next market event.</div><br/> <div>Rangle is an equal opportunity employer. If you are contacted for an interview and require accommodation during the interviewing process, please let us know.</div>
Title: Sr. Modern JavaScript Developer (Angular, React, Node)

<br/><br/> The overall responsibilities would involve:  <ul> <li>Architect and design Android solutions for the workforce mobility program</li> <li>Collaborate with cross-functional teams (Program Management, Application Developers, Service Providers, Test Teams and End Users) in order to contribute to an effective roll-out of the Android platform</li> <li>Contribute to making the Android solution a useable, robust, reliable and optimally performing mobile application</li> <li>Provide hands-on help in bug fixing and improving application performance</li> <li>Contribute to discovering, evaluating and implementing new technologies and design patterns to improve efficiency and robustness of the Android devices</li> </ul> Mandatory Skills and Experience:  <ul> <li>Minimum 3+ years of hands on Android application development experience</li> <li>Proven experience in developing Android applications, with a strong understanding of the platform’s design patterns, best practices in coding and the user interface (UI)</li> <li>Strong Java programming skills in many of the following: UI design, Material Design for Android, Wireframes, Android Native and Hybrid approaches like Xamarin</li> <li>Experience with common APIs and protocols like JSON/REST</li> <li>Experience working with and integrating into backend technologies (cellular, Wi-Fi, queues, web servers, databases)</li> <li>Demonstrated testing and debugging skills</li> <li>Strong collaboration and communication skills</li> </ul> Nice to have:  <ul> <li>Experience at having published apps in Android Play store or a private store is an asset</li> <li>Experience with ruggedized devices and designing for power constrained environments is an asset</li> <li>Message queuing (MQ) and MQTT</li> <li>Working with Agile project environment</li> <li>Proficiency in using tools e.g. JIRA, Confluence, GitBucket</li> </ul> Candidates looking to inquire further information, or to apply for the role, are to send us an updated version of their resume in confidence. Our professional recruitment team will formally follow up at the conclusion of the review process.

You have a habit of writing tests for every functionality you write. You have experience building applications that run at scale on AWS. guidelines</li> <li>Building interactive and modern web based user interfaces</li> <li>Building responsive interfaces that look and work at any size, on any device</li> <li>Implementing the UI for new features and initiatives</li> <li>Modify and maintain interface components based on platform requirements</li> <li>Troubleshoot and resolve bugs reported by clients and team members</li> </ul> framework such as AngularJS, ReactJS, VueJS or other comparable</li> <li>Excellent knowledge of JavaScript</li> <li>Understanding of responsive design and fluid layout</li> <li>Experience using CSS preprocessors such as SASS or LESS</li> <li>Experience using grid-based frameworks such as Bootstrap</li> <li>Know Backbone (or other MVC frameworks)</li> <li>Strong understanding of web services and APIs, experience interacting with backend teams</li> <li>Solid experience working with Service-Oriented Architectures and integrations with third party APIs (XML, JSON, REST)</li> <li>Bachelor’s degree in computer science or equivalent relevant work experience</li> <li><em>Nice-to- have, but not required</em>: Experience in PHP and MySQL</li> <li>Great communication and interpersonal skills</li> <li>Independent, energetic, and capable of driving for results under pressure and ambiguity</li> </ul> <strong>TrackTik Perks</strong>  <ul> <li>Access to group insurance benefits, including health & dental</li> <li>Registered Retirement Savings Plan</li> <li>Don’t bring your lunch Tuesdays</li> <li>Ping pong table to help you unwind</li> <li>A “convenience” station stocked with snacks</li> <li>Casual work environment: open-space office to fuel a collaborative environment and communication</li> <li>Easily accessible via public transit</li> </ul> Forget about suits, ties and 9 to 5. If you are motivated to make a difference and thrive on teamwork, creativity and problem solving, we want you as part of our family. <br/><br/> <strong>About TrackTik</strong> <br/><br/> TrackTik develops innovative workforce management solutions and mobile applications that help transform industries and improve the way people work.
