Title: Front-End Developer

Job_Description: Autodata Solutions is looking for a <strong>Senior Front-End Web Developer</strong> in our Calgary, AB office! <br/><br/> We are looking for a Front-End Web Developer who is motivated to combine the art of design with the art of programming. This is an opportunity for a Senior Leader manage both sides and define not only how the application looks, but how it works. You will translate the UI/UX design wireframes to actual code that will produce visual elements of the application while integrating SEO principals into your design. Through collaboration with our backend developers, you will integrate REST service endpoints to the UI through AJAX calls and design the expected output from the services. MUST have solid previous experience with ReactJS to join this project. <br/><br/> <strong>Responsibilities:</strong>  <ul> <li>Develop new user-facing features while buiding reusable code and libraries for future use</li> <li>Ensure the technical feasibility of UI/UX designs</li> <li>Optimize application for maximum speed and scalability</li> <li>Integrate user interfaces with backend REST services</li> <li>Execute effectively in a high-volume, fast-changing work environment while managing multiple time-critical issues</li> <li>Act as technical advisor to business owners, project management, UX Designers</li> <li>Troubleshoot issues with code, integrations, and other related website properties</li>  </ul> <strong>Qualifications:</strong>  <ul> <li>2+ years of hands-on experience designing and building React.js applications</li> <li>5+ years professional experience with web markup, including HTML5, CSS3, and Javascript up to and including ECMAScript 6</li> <li>Demonstrable experience implementing SEO principles and ensuring that the application will adhere to them</li> <li>Good understanding of build tools, including Gulp, Bower, Webpack, and Yeoman</li> <li>Proficient understanding of client-side scripting and JavaScript frameworks, including jQuery</li> <li>Good understanding of other advanced JavaScript libraries and frameworks, such as AngularJS (vs 1 and 2), KnockoutJS, BackboneJS, Meteor, DurandalJS etc.</li> <li>Good understanding of asynchronous request handling, partial page updates, and AJAX</li> <li>Basic knowledge of image authoring tools, to be able to crop, resize, or perform small adjustments on an image. Familiarity with tools such as Gimp or Photoshop is a plus</li> <li>Working knowledge of NodeJS, including Express, Meteor, and other modules</li> <li>Proficient understanding of code versioning tools, such as Git / Mercurial / SVN</li> </ul> For more information about Autodata, please visit our company website: www.autodata.net. <br/><br/> We thank all applicants for their interest however only those selected for an interview will be notified. Autodata Solutions is an equal opportunity employer. We are compliant with AODA legislation; if you require work related accommodations, please specify.
Title: Front-End Web Developer

Job_Description: Our client is the world’s largest independent security software company and strives to make the world a safer place by protecting digital information. They offer solutions for consumers, businesses and governments that provide layered security to protect information on mobile devices, endpoints, gateways, servers and the cloud. Our client enables the smart protection of information, with innovative technology that is simple to deploy and manage, and security that fits an evolving ecosystem. Their solutions are supported by over 5000 employees in over 50 countries and powered by the world’s most advanced cloud-based, global threat intelligence network. <br/><br/> If you are an experienced Back End Developer, Engineer looking for an exciting challenge then consider joining our client’s Application Security team. Our client’s Application Security team processes millions of security events on a continuous basis protecting a large array of web applications. As a member of the team, you will share responsibility for the architecture, development, operation and evolution of a world-class Saas (Software as a Service) running in the Amazon AWS cloud. You will get to participate in the entire product lifecycle on a daily basis, as part of our continuous delivery, contributing to our high-caliber multi-disciplinary team of back-end, front end, agents and quality experts. <br/><br/> <strong>Duties & Responsibilities</strong>   <ul> <li>Collaborate and contribute to the service architecture leveraging your strong expertise and experience.</li> <li>Develop and contribute to the deployment of backend micro-services applications.</li> <li>Ensure the service performance, availability and reliability of all servers and services within the Saas: maintaining a high SLA.</li> <li>Provide operational support and contribute to operations infrastructure development as well as automation tools leveraging industry best tools and practices.</li> <li>Build back-end frameworks that are maintainable, flexible and scalable.</li> <li>Be part of the Agile development team, participate to scrum meeting and stand up and contribute to planning.</li> <li>Be passionate about cloud computing, research and implement new technologies and processes as they become available with the goal of learning and improving service quality and reducing costs.</li> <li>Be ready for disasters so that customers know recovery is not only possible, it’s guaranteed.</li> </ul>  <strong>Requirements:</strong>   <ul> <li>At least five years experience with cloud computing. Experience is with AWS is a strong asset.</li> <li>Ten years experience building highly reliable, high capacity and high throughput software.</li> <li>Three years experience with demonstrable lessons learned and a deep understanding of various approaches and best practices on micro services application with the event-streaming core.</li> <li>Demonstrable experience working with Kafka with high throughput, event-based applications is a strong asset.</li> <li>At least two years of successful experience in a large-scale service build out and operation.</li> <li>Hands on infrastructure, systems and application architecture experience in large scale, web-based applications.</li> <li>Excellent Linux skills.</li> <li>String proficiency with a high-level programming language such as Java or Python</li> <li>Experience with testing micro services based applications.</li> <li>Understanding of load testing, monitoring and performance management tools for every layer of the environment.</li> <li>Strong customer focus with the ability to provide service to all levels of the organization.</li> <li>Bachelor of Science degree in related discipline, advanced degree desired</li> </ul>  <strong>About our Client in Montreal</strong> <br/><br/> Our client’s Application Security R&D team is a multi-disciplinary team that takes ownership for various areas of our product and services. The teams work hard innovating to make the best software imaginable. The atmosphere is relaxed and spacious. Work/life balance and continued learning are highly valued. A few specifics:   <ul> <li>Collaborative workspaces with unique and spacious lounge areas</li> <li>Flexible hours</li> <li>Regular Hack Days!</li> <li>Opportunities to pursue training, industry events and conferences</li> <li>Global company, global opportunities</li> </ul>  Our client provides equal employment opportunity for all applicants and employees. Our client does not unlawfully discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, pregnancy and childbirth or related medical conditions, national origin, ancestry, age, physical or mental disability, medical condition, family care leave status, veteran status, marital status, sexual orientation, or gender identity.
Title: Back End Developer

Job_Description: At Procurify, our team is reinventing the way companies spend - Procurify is a powerful spend management software that helps businesses achieve greater visibility into their company's spend, track purchases across their organization, and gain insights on their spend data with certainty. <br/><br/> As a Senior Back End Software Developer, you’ll be working in a squad of amazing, empowered people who specialize in Front End Development, Product Design, and Quality Assurance. Together, you will collaborate throughout the development process to gather requirements and deliver polished features for the world to see! <br/><br/> <strong>W</strong><strong>hat you’ll do</strong>  <ul>  <li>Work with our product teams to build our platform that manages a large variety of company spending across our clients.</li>    <li>Challenge our assumptions and tackle problems in a well-thought-out manner</li>    <li>Drive high-quality by writing scalable unit, functional, and performance tests</li>    <li>Partner with internal teams to continually improve our products and features offerings</li>    <li>Mentor junior engineers and collaborate with multi-functional teams</li>    <li>Keep up to date and lead on best practices to help us craft guidelines and maintain standards for the team</li>    </ul>  <strong>What you’ll need</strong><br/><br/>We are an equal opportunity employer, and truly believe your potential and value are not solely based on your background. We are looking for phenomenal people who can diversify our team with new skills and specializations, however, the following will help propel your success as a Senior Software Developer.  <ul>  <li>A minimum of 2+ years experience with Python software development</li>    <li>Excellent attention to detail - with a holistic approach in problem solving</li>    <li>5+ years of experience as a software engineer shipping code into production environments</li>    <li>Experience building and deploying a Django app</li>    <li>A strong grasp of commonly used algorithms and data structures</li>    </ul> <strong>Alone you can go fast, together you can go far</strong> <br/><br/> As a self-proclaimed group of “misfits that fit”, our team is made up of remarkable, creative humans from all walks of life (truly, we welcome everyone from ex-boat-captains, to swing-dancers, to competitive gamers and novelists.) Everyone has a story, but no matter how different our lives outside the office may be, we all share the same core values: humility, fearlessness, inspiration, empowerment, empathy, and, of course, teamwork, that drive us to work together to find happiness and purpose in our work. We work for each other so that we can celebrate together. <br/><br/> Procurify is a place where your personal growth is a real priority; where our values help us make big decisions, mistakes are expected, being true to yourself is encouraged, and our goal to improve people’s work lives isn’t just a catchy phrase, because it actually guides everything we do. We also offer a couple of awesome things for you to enjoy:  <ul>  <li>Uncapped responsible time off, parental leave, flexible working hours, and the opportunity to work from home when it makes balancing life easier.</li>    <li>Extended health, dental, and vision benefits.</li>    <li>Fun office treats, which include snacks, company lunches and events, and gym & transit subsidies.</li>   <li>The ability to grow your knowledge by taking courses, classes, or attending events that you are passionate about, covered by Procurify.</li> </ul> <strong>Misfits that fit</strong> <br/><br/> We appreciate unique people and with that, we appreciate a unique approach. Apply with your resume and, link(s) to your Github/Bitbucket repository. We receive a lot of applications, so show us how you stand out! <br/><br/> <strong>Want to Learn More?</strong> <br/><br/> Get to know our Lead Backend Developer through our Meet Us Monday videos: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=2TwIsSOcaSg&t=5s <br/><br/> Check out what our clients are saying about us: <br/> https://www.procurify.com/testimonials
Title: Senior Back End Software Developer

Job_Description: <strong>Location:</strong><br/><br/>40 Hanna Ave, Toronto, Ontario, M6K 0C3<br/><br/>The decision to join a company is a big one. We have opportunities for hard working, energetic and reliable people just like you. <br/><br/> <strong>Why is this role important?</strong> <br/><br/> Looking for a challenge? Good. Love an innovative work environment? Even better. <br/><br/> At Loblaw Digital, we know that our customers expect the best from us. Whether that means building the best, most innovative online shopping experience, or designing an app that will impact the lives of people across the country, we’re up for the challenge. From our office in Downtown Toronto, we’ve created leading eCommerce experiences in the online grocery shopping, beauty, pharmacy, and apparel spaces, and we’re only just getting started. <br/><br/> We’re able to keep innovating because our colleagues are passionate about their work and excited about the future of eCommerce. If you have big ideas, undeniable enthusiasm, and thrive in a collaborative, creative, and diverse group, we’ll get along just fine. <br/><br/> Working from our downtown office, you will report to the E-Commerce Technology Lead and will assist in building, improving and maintaining a world-class, multi-channel e-commerce platform. This is a hands-on role in the E-Commerce Development Team where you will develop software across the full-stack of a multi-channel platform from HTML, CSS & Javascript to server-side Java. <br/> What You'll Do: <ul> <li>Java Development on the hybris e-commerce platform</li><li>Write server-side code for web-based applications, create robust high-volume production applications, and develop prototypes quickly.</li><li>Participate in code and architecture reviews.</li><li>Responsive front-end Development using Javascript, CSS, HTML in a Spring framework</li><li>Translate wireframes, creative design, and functional requirements into functional xHTML/ CSS / Javascript</li><li>Develop JavaScript using standard frameworks (jQuery, Backbone.js, node.js etc.)</li><li>Construct design documents and documentation to aid in maintenance and code reuse.</li><li>Confirms program operation with testing; modifying program logic and performance tuning while guaranteeing quality assurance.</li><li>Closely work with the Quality Control and Technical Communication team members to ensure high quality deliverables</li><li>Provides input to status reports on the “health” of the application.</li><li>Provides support by ensuring stability of the application and addressing and resolving business issues in a timely manner.</li> </ul> What You'll Need: <ul> <li>Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering or similar</li><li>3+ years of experience in software engineering.</li><li>1+ years’ experience in object oriented design and development in Java.</li><li>Some experience developing with the Spring Framework would be preferred.</li><li>Some experience with an e-commerce platform (hybris, ATG, Websphere etc.) would be preferred.</li><li>Advanced skills using J2EE Frameworks and Libraries specifically such as Hibernate, JPA and JDO</li><li>Database development skills including SQL programming, solid understanding of relational database technologies, logical and physical data modeling. Preferably on an Oracle database.</li><li>Backend and Frontend/Web development experience with JSP, JavaScript, JSON, jQuery, HTML, CSS</li><li>Experience with web app servers, such as Tomcat, JBoss, Websphere, and Weblogic</li><li>Experience using standard development tools, such as Eclipse, Ant, Git</li><li>Experience developing REST based web services</li> </ul> #LI-ST1 <br/><br/> <strong>How You’ll Succeed:</strong> <br/><br/> At Loblaw, we seek great people to continually strengthen our culture. We believe great people model our values, are authentic, build trust and make connections. <br/><br/> If that sounds like you, and you are open-minded, responsive to change and up to the challenges provided in a fast-paced retail environment, apply today. <br/><br/> <strong>Employment Type:</strong><br/><br/>Full time<br/><br/><strong><strong>Type of Role:</strong></strong><br/><br/>Regular<br/><br/>Loblaw recognizes Canada's diversity as a source of national pride and strength. We have made it a priority to reflect our nation’s evolving diversity in the products we sell, the people we hire, and the culture we create in our organization. Accommodation is available upon request for applicants with disabilities in the recruitment and assessment process and when hired.<br/><br/>Please Note: If you have Employee Self Service (ESS) on Workday, apply to this job via the Workday application.
Title: Developer II

Job_Description: Job Description<br/><br/>Our mobile team is looking for a motivated and hardworking iOS developer. The successful candidate will work alongside our existing developers to maintain and improve our highly successful apps. <br/><br/> Key Responsibilities:  <ul> <li>Develop iOS applications for mobile phone and tablet devices</li>  <li>Reach consensus with the backend developers on data models and communication protocols using JSON, and implement according to spec</li>  <li>Proactively identify issues with the codebase and development practices, and work with the team to address them</li>  <li>Work closely with other developers, QA, and project managers to ensure alignment of priorities, deliverables and deadlines</li>  <li>Be an enthusiastic and positive representative of our team as you interact with a variety of business partners</li> </ul>  Required Skills   <ul> <li>Advanced knowledge of Swift and JSON</li>  <li>Knowledge of modern iOS development practices such as hierarchy, modularization using frameworks, iOS Human Interface Guidelines, battery and performance optimization, etc</li>  <li>Initiative to work independently, proactively identify work that needs to be done, as well as identify issues or potential improvements and following through with solutions</li>  <li>Leadership and ability to positively influence others</li>  <li>Bachelor of Computer Science or equivalent degree</li>  <li>Strong English skills, both written and oral.</li> </ul>  Required Experience   <ul> <li>One or more published native iOS applications</li>  <li>5+ years of development experience</li>  <li>3+ years of iOS development experience.</li> </ul>  Job Location <br/><br/> Burnaby, British Columbia, Canada <br/><br/> Position Type <br/><br/> Full-Time/Regular

Job_Description: Uken is looking for an experienced <strong>Software Developer (Front End)</strong> to become a member of the Platform team. This position writes beautiful, maintainable code that creates tools used by teams across the org. <br/><br/> You'd be <strong>working on</strong> meaningful things like:  <ul> <li>Writing and maintaining front end code for a live game that can be easily shared</li> <li>Researching and choosing tools and libraries and assessing their utility</li>   <li>Working alongside developers in the architecting of entire features</li> <li>Taking ownership/accountability for all aspects of a certain area of a codebase and promoting automated testing methodologies</li> <li>Breaking down product or technical features</li>   <li>Innovating and promoting best practices across Uken</li> <li>Sharing knowledge across team and across the org</li> </ul> Your <strong>background</strong> should include:  <ul> <li>Experience with the AngularJS, React</li> <li>An appetite to learn, grow, and take on increasingly more responsibility</li> <li>Computer Science degree or equivalent experience</li> <li>Knowledge of algorithms, data structures and other fundamentals</li> <li>Contributions to an open source project (include a portfolio or Github profile)</li> <li>MySQL, Redis or experience with other databases</li> </ul> It'd be a <strong>big plus</strong> if you have:  <ul> <li>Java, Scala, Spring and other backend development experience</li> <li>Amazon AWS and general devops experience</li> </ul> We believe in a fun & meaningful <strong>work environment</strong>:  <ul> <li>You'll be equipped with a high-end laptop, monitor and mobile device</li> <li>Competitive salary and stock options</li> <li>Full health, dental and vision coverage</li> <li>Fully catered breakfast, lunch and snack-filled kitchen</li> <li>Uken social nights including movie night, pub night and more…</li> <li>Convenient location at the corner of King & Duncan</li> </ul> <strong>About Us</strong> <br/><br/> Uken builds beautiful social games that make people stare, smile, jump, and feel awesome inside. We consider ourselves designers and technologists, storytellers and artists. Through collaboration, we pair the craft of design with feedback and data to deliver a pace and rhythm in each game that ends in delight. Our games are enjoyed by millions of people everywhere and we’re just getting started. <br/><br/> <em>Uken welcomes applications from visible minority group members, women, Aboriginal persons, persons with disabilities, members of sexual minority groups, and others who would contribute to the further diversification of our team.</em> <br/><br/> <em>Uken is committed to offering reasonable accommodation to job applicants with disabilities. If you need assistance or accommodation due to a disability, please contact us at jobs@uken.com</em>
Title: Software Developer (Front End)

Job_Description: At Joist, we’re on a mission to make contractors heroes! Joist is already the #1 platform for contractors worldwide, but there’s still work to be done. We have incredible adoption from contractors, top-tier venture partners from Toronto, San Francisco, and Boston, and a gritty team that truly cares about what they're working on. <br/><br/> Joist is looking for an experienced Full-Stack Engineer to help design and implement the platform that powers Joist on its mission. You will be responsible for taking projects from inception to deployment and beyond. As we move to a distributed service oriented architecture we need to rapidly define services that meet the need of the business and power uncompromising experiences for homeowners and contractors. You will be responsible for working with other team members to design the services and apply techniques of distributed computing to ensure they scale to millions of users. <br/><br/> Joist for Android: https://play.google.com/store/apps/joist <br/><br/> Joist for iOS: https://itunes.apple.com/app/id592163563 <br/><br/> Joist for Web: https://my.joistapp.com/login <br/><br/> <strong>Requirements</strong> <br/><br/> <strong>What you need to know/have:</strong> <br/><br/> <strong>Architecture</strong> You have a strong understanding of the building blocks of a robust and scalable system. You are able to dissect business problems into well designed systems. You have the experience to know what to build and the discipline to know what not to. <br/><br/> <strong>CS Fundamentals</strong> You have an understanding of algorithms, data structures, design patterns and persistence technologies. You are able to select the right tool for the right job. <br/><br/> <strong>Distributed Systems</strong> You know how to build, debug, and monitor independently scalable and autonomous systems. You understand how to leverage messaging to encourage loosely-coupled coordination between systems. <br/><br/> <strong>Delivery Focused</strong> Code on a laptop doesn't solve problems. You know that a project is only done once it's delivered and validated. Residential construction is a large problem to tackle. You are driven to complete a project because you know that 5 more problems are waiting to be tackled, and you do it all without sacrificing quality. <br/><br/> <strong>Passion</strong> Hard problems are not solved overnight. It takes a special kind of attitude and hunger to disrupt an entrenched industry. Your passion is what you share with every teammate at Joist. Passion for technology, passion for change, and passion for building an industry revolutionizing product. <br/><br/> <strong>Web Technologies</strong> You have a strong understanding of the latest HTML / CSS / JavaScript tools and techniques. You have used JavaScript frameworks such as Angular, Backbone, Ember, or React. <br/><br/> <strong>Design Sense</strong> You excel at taking a mockup design and furiously translating it into a working site. You provide continuous feedback to ensure designs are providing the best user experience possible. <br/><br/> <strong>About Joist:</strong> <br/><br/> Started in 2013, Joist is an end to end vertical software platform for small & medium sized trades contractors. Joist gives trades contractors the software tools & best practices needed to deliver incredible home renovation experiences, and connects them with homeowners looking for home improvement work. We've got the largest contractor network in the world using Joist to power their business, and we have major growth planned. <br/><br/> <strong> <br/> Tools of the Trade:</strong> <ul>  <li>Experience with distributed systems. Event-driven architecture / SOA / microservices</li> <li>Worked with messaging technologies such RabbitMQ or similar</li> <li>Experience with a variety of persistence technologies (PostgreSQL, Redis, Memcached, NoSQL)</li> <li>Experience designing and evolving APIs</li> <li>Experience with backend MVC web frameworks such as Ruby on Rails or .NET MVC</li> <li>Experience building mobile applications is a plus</li> <li>Expert knowledge of HTML / CSS / JavaScript.</li> <li>Experience with front-end frameworks such as ReactJS</li> <li>Awareness of cross-browser compatibility issues and client-side performance considerations</li> </ul> <strong>Benefits</strong> <br/><br/> <strong>What makes working here awesome:</strong> <ul>  <li>Unlimited Vacation & Flexible Work Hours</li> <li>Healthcare & Dental Benefits</li> <li>Health & Wellness Credit</li> <li>Quarterly Team Events</li> <li>Work from any of our office locations</li> <li>Joist swag to make you feel right at home</li> <li>Take ownership in the company you work for! Roles include full stock option plans for all full-time team members.</li> </ul>
Title: Full Stack Developer

Job_Description: Position Location: London, Ontario <br/><br/> Voices.com offers talented and motivated Web Developers the opportunity to work in a dynamic and growing company. As the ideal Web Developer, you will work from an open concept environment and be set-up with a suite of Web development tools. Through internal advancement opportunities and a competitive salary you'll have the chance to create a career that you can be proud of. Don't miss your chance to join our winning team! <br/>  <br/> Essential Job Functions & Responsibilities   <ul>   <li>Design and implement our web backend platform, fast</li> <li>Evaluate and spec out new product development opportunities</li> <li>Rapidly iterate on software projects</li> <li>Research and advise on new technologies and improvements</li> <li>Desire to work in a fast paced environment</li> <li>Strong collaborative skills and ability to fulfill multiple roles</li> <li>Attention to detail and quality</li> </ul>  Skills Required   <ul>   <li>Experience in development of video/multimedia sites, community sites, or other web applications</li> <li>Knowledge of social media, social networking and modern web apps</li> <li>Familiar with Javascript, CSS, DHTML, XML, AJAX</li> <li>In-depth knowledge of PHP, MySQL, and Apache</li> <li>Expertise in Linux</li> <li>Excellent presentation skills, relational skills, communication (telephone and email), dependable, reliable, ambitious, driven</li> </ul>  Educational Requirements   <ul>   <li>3+ years experience in database-driven web site development</li> <li>BS or MS in Computer Science or equivalent work experience</li> </ul>  Equal Employment Opportunities <br/>  <br/> Voices.com values diversity. We're proud to be an equal opportunity employer and consider qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, ancestry, age, genetic information, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital or family status, veteran status, medical condition or disability. <br/>  <br/> Accommodation <br/>  <br/> Voices.com is committed to providing accommodation for applicants with disabilities; please let us know if you require an accommodation during the recruitment process.
Title: Web Developer

Job_Description: <div><strong>Full Stack Developer (React, .NET)</strong> </div> <br/> <div><strong>Position Overview</strong></div> <br/> <div>Delvinia is currently seeking a <strong>Full Stack Developer (React, .NET)</strong>. <br/><br/> Our team is transforming the way organizations collect consumer data. We are challenging the status quo in the research and marketing industries by applying new technologies in innovative ways, enabling companies to gain valuable insights – which, we believe, leads to better and more-informed business decisions. <br/><br/> At Delvinia, we own and operate a portfolio of innovative companies that offer a range of data collection services to marketers and market researchers across Canada, throughout North America, and around the globe. <br/><br/> Our AskingCanadians online data collection company provides access to an online research community or more than one million Canadians who have opted in to share their opinions; AskingAmericans provides a variety of data collection services in the US market; Delvinia Custom Solutions uses new and emerging technologies to help clients collect, visualize and enable data; and Methodify, our research automation company, provides the ability to gain customer insights through our one-of-a-kind online platform in a matter of hours. <br/><br/> <strong>Our Values</strong> <br/> Our team believes in delving in and digging deep. Passion, patience, perseverance, perspective and people are our core values. We promote a culture of openness, authenticity and trust. We believe in being accountable, being committed to ongoing learning, and demonstrating excellence and leadership in all that we do. We consider ourselves to be a pretty formidable team with a close-knit work environment and an entrepreneurial spirit.</div><br/>  <div><strong>Job Description</strong></div><br/>  <div><strong>We are looking for someone who can join our Development Team and hit the ground running. As a member of our development and innovation team you will:</strong></div> <ul> <li>Create beautiful and modern web applications with the latest technologies.</li> <li>Work closely with other members of our innovation team to deliver responsive web apps to our clients.</li> <li>Extend our existing React apps and help develop new ones.</li> <li>Work with React, Angular2 and other modern JS frameworks.</li> <li>Interact with our API’s and help design new RESTful services.</li> <li>Help design the next generation of web tools for the market research community.</li> <li>Work with our backend infrastructure to create new features and enhance existing solutions.</li> </ul>  <div><strong>Desired Experience</strong></div><br/>  <div><strong>Our ideal candidate has 2-3 years of experience developing and maintaining modern web pages. In addition, we are looking for talented individuals who have:</strong></div> <ul> <li>Experience in Full-Stack development.</li> <li>A good working knowledge of the Software Development Life Cycle.</li> <li>Exceptional communication skills, with the ability to clearly explain technical ideas to a wide audience.</li> <li>The ability to create software systems given a set of technical designs.</li> <li>Experience navigating through an existing codebase and making improvements to it.</li> <li>An ability to adapt to shifting priorities, demands and timelines.</li> <li>Experience with implementing, configuring and developing web services.</li> <li>Experience with SQL.</li> <li>Knowledge of secure coding practices, especially as related to web technologies.</li> <li>Experience working with version control software such as Git, TFS, or SVN.</li> <li>The ability to learn new technologies and skills quickly.</li> </ul>  <div><strong>Qualifications</strong></div><br/>  <div><strong>To be considered for this role, we are looking for candidates that have:</strong></div> <ul> <li>A Degree and/or Diploma in Computer Science, or related field.</li> <li>At least 2-3 years overall experience with multiple IT platforms and languages, such as:   <ul> <li>.NET Ecosystem & ASP.NET, MVC Architecture, RESTful Web Services, Experience with modern JavaScript frameworks (in particular React and AngularJS), Node.js, jQuery. Databases such as MySQL and MS SQL Server</li> </ul>  </li> <li>It would be great if you also have:   <ul> <li>Experience with a modern JavaScript tech stack (i.e. JS files, Babel, Webpack/Browserify)</li> <li>Experience working within a version control system, ideally git and/or TFS.</li> <li>Experience working on multiple projects with conflicting timelines.</li> <li>Experience working on small and large scale development projects, including designing and implementing large-scale web and mobile-specific systems, including tier architectures.</li> <li>Systems architecture, design and development experience.</li> <li>Exposure to complex database concepts.</li> </ul>  </li> </ul> <strong>How to Apply</strong> <br/> If this sounds like the role for you and you are up to the challenge, please register to join us at our upcoming Career Fair on Wednesday, April 25th. <br/><br/> Sign up here: Career Fair Registration
Title: Full Stack Developer, Delvinia

Job_Description: Clearly is seeking a dynamic individual to add to the success of our Information Technology team as a Front End Web Developer. <br/><br/> Founded in 2000 in Vancouver, Canada, Clearly has become the worlds largest online eyewear and contact lenses company. Clearly designs, produces and retails the largest selection of eyeglasses on the internet. We serve customers in more than 150 countries through the Clearly family of websites: our team is responsible for systems and support for multiple warehouses and web properties across Canada, the United States, Australia, New Zealand and Japan. <br/><br/> <u><strong>What You Will Be Responsible For:</strong></u>  <ul> <li>Working closely with web designers and other creative specialists on customer facing E-Commerce websites</li> <li>Interacting with the backend developers to integrate solutions and delivery bug-free features</li> <li>Working with the Analytical team on 3rd party JavaScript pixels implementation, providing feedback and recommendations on optimizing solutions</li> <li>Writing clean, structured, efficient and well documented code, always strive for maximum web page performance</li> <li>Contributing regularly to discussions regarding internal process and system improvements in order to ensure maximum efficiency across the company, including suggesting technical solutions to problems</li> <li>Following consistent processes set by the team while looking to offer constructive suggestions around new tools and ideas to enhance processes</li> <li>Taking on DevOps responsibilities, such as troubleshooting and debugging applications after hours when there are urgent issues on production environment</li> <li>Evaluating new technologies, digging into the code to highlight and execute performance optimizations and more</li> <li>Handling client support issues as quickly and efficiently as possible with an appropriate resolution</li> <li>To be aware and open to the latest software development technologies and methodologies</li> </ul> <u><strong>What You Need To Do Your Job:</strong></u>  <ul> <li>3 years minimum experience in software development and solid understanding of development life cycle</li> <li>Comprehensive understanding of computer science fundamentals</li> <li>Strong skills in HTML5, JavaScript, ES6, and CSS (SASS/LESS pre-processor)</li> <li>Working experience with Foundation or Bootstrap frameworks</li> <li>Ability to write vanilla JavaScript without IDE and experience with frameworks/libraries such as React, Redux, JQuery, RequireJS</li> <li>Experience with node.js, Gulp, Grunt, Maven and Ant</li> <li>Experience with at least one version control system, preferably Git</li> <li>Experience with Test Driven Development and writing unit tests</li> <li>SEO knowledge specifically related to onsite optimization (desirable)</li> <li>Experience in Agile/Scrum software development methodologies.</li> <li>Strong development capability with client-side, object oriented and a passion for UI</li> <li>Self-starter with strong self-management skills</li> <li>Ability to organize and manage multiple priorities</li> </ul> <u><strong>What We Offer You:</strong></u>  <ul> <li>Group Retirement Savings and Employee Shareholding programs</li>   <li>Extended health, dental and vision benefits</li>   <li>100% MSP coverage</li> <li>Flexible spending account</li>   <li>Progressive paid vacation plan</li> <li>Open concept Vancouver office, designed to inspire collaboration and innovation</li> <li>Gym for a nominal cost and free secure bike cages available in our building; across the street from Renfrew Skytrain station and the Central Valley Greenway bike path</li> <li>Underground secure parking</li> <li>Opportunities for career growth and development</li>   <li>Company discount on contact lenses and glasses</li> <li>A company that celebrates successes and recognizes its team</li> </ul> Our progressive employee benefits, thriving corporate culture and engaging work environment led to our recognition as one of Canada's 10 Most Admired Corporate Cultures. Our innovative programming and Development and Diversity initiatives have been recognized with the YWCA Women of Distinction Award. Our team's continued efforts to change the way the world sees, especially through our Change the View project, has been recognized as the Best in the Biz Most Socially Responsible Company of the Year. <br/><br/> To succeed on our team you must have an entrepreneurial mindset that embraces challenges, and understands the potential of the Internet as an innovative tool to buy eyewear. <br/><br/> Applying for this position will allow you to be a part of something incredible. Clearly is a company that thrives on a culture where we believe if you can envision it, you can do it. We thank everyone who took the time to apply for this position, however, only qualified applicants will be contacted.
Title: Front End Web Developer

Job_Description: <div>We have a new exciting PERMANENT opportunity for a Full-Stack Developer with our public health client located at Yonge & Sheppard. The IT team is quite small, thus there will be a lot of room for growth in this position. The client is union-based, and will be offering 3 weeks' vacation, competitive benefits, pension, flexible hours and opportunities to work remote. <br/><br/> The successful candidate will be part of the IT team responsible for building web applications to accommodate the client's changing requirements. Responsibilities will include the development of all server-side logic, APIs, good knowledge of WordPress and Apostrophe CMS and the ability to implement front-end technologies. This position is responsible for developing and maintaining the integration between website, eLearning system and internally hosted applications, such as Microsoft Dynamics CRM. <br/><br/> <strong>Roles and Responsibilities</strong>   <ul> <li>Design, implement and test web application code</li> <li>Implementation of a robust set of services and APIs to power the web application</li> <li>Building reusable code and libraries for future use</li> <li>Optimization of the application for maximum speed and scalability</li> <li>Implementation of security and data protection</li> <li>Extract and analyze existing traffic, logs and usage metrics to proactively scan for issues or improvements for monitoring purposes and to assess and optimize for speed and scalability</li> <li>Develop documentation, flowcharts, diagrams, code comments and training manuals</li> <li>Explain the technical trade-offs of different approaches, including estimating how long each will take to build</li> <li>Project estimating using work back schedules and time management with the ability to prioritize based on deadlines</li> <li>Data migration, transformation, and scripting</li> <li>Setup and administration of website backups</li> <li>Create and modify reports</li> <li>Train Shop Managers for data entry and financial report gathering</li> <li>Excellent diagnostic and problem solving ability</li> <li>Manage the hosting environment, including database administration, web server administration and scaling of applications to support load changes</li> </ul>  <strong>Qualifications and Experience</strong>   <ul> <li>A degree in computer science or related discipline or equivalent education and experience</li> <li>Minimum 10 years of solid experience in Front end development including JavaScript, HTML5 and CSS3</li> <li>Experience in Node.js backend development</li> <li>Minimum 7 years of experience in database design and development such as MYSQL, MSSQL, MongoDB and PostgreSQL</li> <li>Minimum 2 years of experience in PHP</li> <li>Working knowledge of creating full stack web application using ReactJS, Relay and GraphQL</li> <li>Ability to use and integrate with APIs on any platform</li> <li>Solid understanding of UI and UX design</li> <li>Ability to build responsive/adaptive solutions</li> <li>Ability to work with creative team to implement or improve website features</li> <li>Advanced comfort level with technical change management, its affects, results and consequences on current code base</li> <li>Excellent debugging and troubleshooting skills</li> <li>Good understanding of accessibility considerations and web standards</li> <li>Experience using software versioning and revision control system SVN + or GIT</li> <li>Other tools include: Gitlab, AWS console, Docker, API design and development, and RESTful services</li> </ul>  </div> <br/>
Title: Full-Stack Developer

Job_Description: <div><div><strong> <br/> Senior Software Developer</strong><br/>  <div> <div> Location <br/><br/> <strong> <br/> Vancouver</strong> </div><br/>  <div> Job Code <br/><br/> <strong>140</strong> </div><br/>  <div> # of openings <br/><br/> <strong>1</strong> </div> </div> </div>  <br/>Apply Now</div><br/>  <div>We are looking for an experienced technology professional with excellent communication skills to join our Vancouver team reporting to the Vice President, Technology Solutions. We are looking for a talented Windows stack developer with a focus on the backend and business logic layers who is also excited to learn new technologies to support our growing business. As a Senior Software Developer, you will have an opportunity to grow a long, rewarding career with us. If you can drive innovative solutions using your strong communication skills and your demonstrated ability to distill complex business requirements into essential technology solutions in partnership with key business leaders, this position is for you! <br/><br/> We are Canada’s Mortgage Company. Founded in 1974, CMLS Financial is one of Canada’s largest, independently owned mortgage services companies. Over 40 years, 10 000 customers and 10 billion in assets. Over the last decade, CMLS has demonstrated a growth path in products and services. The CMLS Technology Solutions team provides technical expertise and development for all in-house created technology. The ability to work as a part of a highly skilled team combined with demonstrated technology and communication skills is a must. <br/><br/> <strong>To succeed in this role, you must be proficient in ALL of the following technologies:</strong>  <ul>  <li>Developing SharePoint 2013+ Custom Solutions (5+ years)</li>    <li>C#.NET (5+ years)</li>    <li>Transact-SQL (5+ years)</li>    <li>JavaScript/jQuery (5+ years)</li>    <li>PowerShell scripting and deployment automation (2+ years)</li>    <li>XML (5+years)</li>    <li>Test Driven Development (TDD) (2+ years)</li>    <li>Object-Oriented Development</li>    <li>Proficiency with different application and design patterns</li>    </ul> <strong>The following technologies would be considered an asset:</strong>  <ul>  <li>SharePoint 2013 Configuration and Administration</li>    <li>SSRS</li>    <li>SOA</li>    <li>ASP.NET Web API</li>    <li>SQL Server Administration</li>    <li>IIS</li>    <li>React</li>    </ul> <strong>Who are we?</strong> <br/><br/> We are Canada’s Mortgage Company. Founded in 1974, CMLS Financial is one of Canada’s largest, independently owned mortgage services companies. Over 40 years, 10 000 customers and 10 billion in assets. We are committed to providing our people with a challenging and rewarding career because our employees set us apart and we know it. <br/><br/> <strong>You will love working here</strong> <br/> Employees tell us that they love that we strike the balance in creating an incredibly professional, yet dynamic and enjoyable corporate culture. We work in a fluid and fast-paced environment that is supportive of energetic and motivated individuals who pride themselves on being flexible and results-driven. Business is booming and that means that our employees get valuable exposure, lots of learning opportunities, and can truly have a positive effect on our business. We are committed to providing our people with a challenging and rewarding career because our employees are what set us apart and we know it.</div>
Title: Senior Software Developer

Job_Description: Full-Time Position - Toronto <br/><br/> Hiring a full-time Senior Developer in Toronto, ON! Our client is looking to build a financial reporting and business analytics platform. This infrastructure platform will host financial models. You will gain valuable experience with BigData technologies. This is a Full-stack .NET/Angular role, with the majority of the work being back end (80-90%). <br/><br/> This is a senior role, and you will be involved full-life cycle ( gathering requirements, to design, development, testing, deployment). You must have strong articulation and communication skills, and have excelled working in a team environment. <br/><br/> Perks You'll Love   <ul> <li>Defined Pension plan</li> <li>Join an award-winning Global organization (including Forbes Global 2000 list)</li> <li>Generous Benefits & Bonus plans</li> </ul>  Required Skills & Background   <ul> <li>At least 5-7+ years in C#, .Net, SQL Server (80-90% Backend work, strong SQL connectivity experience, simple stored procedures)</li> <li>Strong multi-threading experience</li> <li>Focus on performance optimization and low latency</li> <li>Designing algorithms</li> <li>Responsive applications</li> <li>AngularJS , 10-20% front-end work must have modern JS framework experience</li> <li>Tableau</li> <li>SSIS, SSAS, SSRS</li> <li>Big Data technologies (ex.NoSQL)</li> <li>Experience with RabbitMQ</li> <li>Capital Markets experience</li> </ul>  We Are An Equal Opportunity Employer <br/> All qualified applicants will receive equal consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status. <br/><br/> Canadian Work Authorization <br/> All applicants MUST be authorized to work in Canada. Any applicants not meeting this criteria will not be notified and will not be considered eligible for the position.

Job_Description: <strong>Welcome!</strong> Certent is looking for a Senior .NET Software Developer who will help develop products for our Disclosure Management team using the latest technology, architecture and User Experience principles. <br/><br/> <strong>The Team</strong>. We are expanding and as the .NET Software Developer, you will be an integral part of our Disclosure Management development process. You will be a part of a growing remote, multi-site global team. <br/><br/> The technology stack youll be working with includes (but not limited to): .NET, C#, Visual Studio, .NET Core, MVC, Entity Framework, Bootstrap and Angular. <br/><br/> To Be a Good Fit, You: <ul> <li>Work comfortably with remote, multi-site global teams and work autonomously</li><li>Are highly intelligent, with a humble nature we value critical thinkers who are open to ideas and feedback</li><li>Look forward to contributing to the teams success and watching Certent grow</li><li>Are driven to embrace new technologies; hungry to learn; hungry to share; hungry to advance</li>  </ul> What Youll Need: <ul> <li>Working in Agile environment, comfortable with iterational SDLC ( Scrum based )</li><li>Experience with Web Services ( WCF, SOAP )</li><li>.NET Core, Web API.</li><li>Nuget, Git.</li><li>TFS 2017.</li><li>Highly skilled C# developer intimate with generics, delegates, events, anonymous functions (in-memory data manipulation experience desirable) with Oracle as the backend database</li><li>JSON, CSS, JavaScript/TypeScript extensions like Angular, Bootstrap, Node, and JQuery</li><li>ASP.NET and .NET-based MVC</li><li>MVC, MVP, or MVVM patterns</li><li>Architecture experience with Micro Services</li><li>Distributed Applications or Cloud Experience</li> </ul> Preferred Skills include: <ul> <li>Full SDLC experience with object-oriented, well structured, modern, commercial web app (Single Page Application experience preferable)</li><li>Entity Framework; SQL Databases</li><li>SSO, exchange and consumption of SAML, OAuth2 tokens</li><li>ASP.NET</li> </ul> <strong>Want to chat about your career goals and see if this is a good fit?</strong> Click Apply, and if you are <strong>a critical thinker with a passion for development and using the latest and greatest technology stack</strong>, we'll be in touch to get the conversation started. In the meantime, head over to our Certent website to get to know us better.

visualizations that sing. <br/><br/> You’ll be responsible for developing core features from front-end UI to backend DB on a new and ambitious SaaS product looking to change the education landscape in teams to design and develop new product features.</li> <li>Execute the full lifecycle of software development from initial design through development and testing to deployment.</li> <li>Write well build database designs, implementation, refactoring and optimization efforts.</li> <li>Segment portions of functionality into modularized services for long term reliability.</li>  </ul> Train the padawans <ul>  <li>Review & test other developers code and provide feedback.</li> <li>Focus on self-improvement and productivity gains for yourself and others.</li> <li>Coach and mentor junior developers to solve things faster and achieve higher velocity.</li>  </ul> <strong>Your qualifications</strong> <br/><br/> Required <ul>  <li>Bachelor’s degree or equivalent in Computer Science or Software Engineering.</li> <li>3+ years professional experience using PHP frameworks such as Laravel or Symfony.</li> <li>Comfortable working on the front-end and with responsive design.</li> <li>3+ years experience with object oriented programming, PHP, MySQL, HTML5, CSS3, JavaScript / jQuery.</li> <li>Familiarity with front end build tools such as Grunt, Webpack, Gulp, Sass, etc.</li> <li>Experience using package management systems (i.e. composer, npm).</li> <li>Thorough understanding of relational database design and implementation.</li> <li>Professional experience working within a LAMP stack development environment.</li> <li>Strong understanding of UI/UX best practices.</li> <li>Comfortable utilizing a version control system, such as Git or Bitbucket.</li>  </ul> Bonus experience <ul>  <li>Design and implementation of Data visualizations with large data sets.</li> <li>Hands-on experience of writing, debugging, and optimizing ETL processes.</li> <li>Continuous integration knowledge involving Jenkins or equivalent integration tools.</li> <li>Familiarity with AWS technologies and Big Data.</li> <li>Mobile design using Angular and Ionic framework.</li> <li>Experience with REST API development and security.</li> <li>Site performance improvement and optimization knowledge.</li>  </ul> <strong>The perks</strong> <br/><br/> At one45, we thrive on shared values and a constant desire to delight our customers beyond their wildest expectations. Working at one45, you’ll meet some of the brightest and most enthusiastic people the tech scene has to offer. <br/><br/> Benefits <ul>  <li>Top notch employer paid extended healthcare, MSP coverage, dental, and life insurance.</li> <li>Personal days and flexible hours.</li> <li>Above industry average paid vacation each year.</li> <li>Weekly personal 1:1s with a focus on developing your career in the direction you want to go.</li> <li>Fully stocked kitchen with limitless snacks, sodas, fruit, etc.</li> <li>Legendary summer and winter staff parties.</li> <li>Monthly team events (team lunches, hikes, yearly Vancouver Sun Run Team, etc).</li> <li>In-office beer/wine + games (darts, board games, etc) for those quiet Friday afternoons.</li>  </ul> <strong>Apply Now</strong> <br/><br/> Sound like a fit? If so, we want to hear from you. Send us your resume to jobs@one45.com. When applying, please make the subject line “Full-Stack Developer (CPR) - Your Name”. Shortlisted candidates will be contacted for next steps. No phone calls or agencies please.</div>Company Description<div>one45 has been a leader in cloud-based solutions for medical education management in North America since 2002.
