Company: HomeX Labs - a division of Home Experience LLC
Job_Description: We're looking for a front-end developer and JavaScript Jedi with elite skills, someone who is passionate about building stellar user experiences and great products through elegant code. Working closely with an interaction designer and product manager, you will be helping to develop the ‘client-side’ as we build new customer-facing and technician-facing web applications and mobile apps. You will have a key role in translating our company and customer needs into functional and appealing interactive applications. We expect you to be a tech-savvy professional who is curious about new digital technologies and aspires to combine usability with visual design. Ultimately, you should be able to create a functional, attractive and inventive digital face to make innovative user experiences come to life. <br/><br/> You will be empowered to invent and innovate, and given clear ownership of engineering problems and solutions in a technology-led environment. <br/><br/> Having the chance to be involved in the early stages of a company dedicated to re-inventing an experience with universal reach is rare. The opportunity to do it with intensity but without the burndown charts or limited runway of a conventional start-up is what makes joining our team unique. <br/><br/> Our solid foundation, ambitious vision and experienced leadership team give us the means to quickly but uncompromisingly create experiences that will transform an entire industry. <br/><br/> <strong>As a front-end developer you will:</strong>  <ul>  <li>Develop a great product experience, while leveraging the latest web technologies</li> <li>Work closely with other team members to develop industry leading solutions for the home services market</li> <li>Develop state-of-the art user experiences using your experience with Javascript, HTML and CSS</li> <li>Leverage best UI/UX practices to build an industry leading, cutting edge and award-winning product</li> <li>Be an integral part of an elite, energetic team of Architects, Product Managers, Developers, Business Analysts where collaboration across all groups is integral to success</li> </ul> <strong>Requirements</strong> <ul>  <li>Minimum 2-3 years relevant full-time hands-on experience in developing robust interfaces and user experiences, and optimizing performance in web applications.</li> <li>Extensive experience with modern Javascript Libraries - preferably React</li> <li>Elite HTML/CSS skills</li> <li>Agile/Scrum experience</li> <li>In-depth understanding of the entire web development process (design, development and deployment)</li> <li>Knowledge of SEO principles, usability best practices and layout aesthetics</li> <li>Strong collaboration skills, whether working with backend developers, interaction designers, product managers, or architects</li> <li>Passionate about and engaged in the user experience and business outcomes</li></ul>   <ul> <li>BSc degree in Computer Science or related field</li> </ul> <strong>Benefits</strong> <ul>  <li>Greenfield development - collaborate with other talented people to build something great from the ground up</li> <li>Fun and positive working environment</li> <li>Experienced, people-first leaders with a clear plan and a track record of success</li> <li>Competitive compensation and performance-based incentives</li> <li>Full health care benefits</li> <li>Transportation allowance</li> <li>Complimentary snacks and beverages</li> <li>Beautiful offices in the heart of Toronto's entertainment district</li> <li>Unlimited vacation</li> </ul>
Title: Front-end Developer

Job_Description: Company Description<div><p><b>About the company:</b></p><p><b></b></p><p>Thinking Capital is the leader in the Canadian Alternative Lending space, using technology to be at the forefront of the FinTech industry. Since 2006, they have helped more than 10,000 small-to-medium sized Canadian businesses reach their full potential. By combining their people and technology, We are transforming the way business owners get the capital they need to grow. For more information, visit www.thinkingcapital.ca </p></div>Job Description<div><p><b>Your role: </b></p><p>As an active member of the technology department, you will work within the agile team and be responsible for the growth and development of our systems and software that directly impact the success in the daily functions of the business. As an ideal candidate, you will have a proven track record, have the ability and desire to make a difference in a fast-paced talented team and are capable of demonstrating excellent coding ability within an award winning development team. <br><br></p><p><b>Your tasks:</b></p><ul><li>Proven ability to independently perform development, testing, implementation, documentation and updating as it relates to the SalesForce.com software and system administration; </li><li>Implement new enhancements including creation of custom objects, workflows;</li><li> Develop and maintain visualforce, Apex, AppExchanges apps and integration to other third party solutions; </li><li>Maintain multiple user roles, security, profiles, workflow rules, etc; <br></li><li>Participate in cross-functional teams that address strategic business issues involving CRM and sales operations;</li><li>Demonstrated ability to effectively communicate technical issues and resolve problems at all levels of the organization both internally and externally; </li><li>Identify SFDC usage problems and craft technical / communication plans to IT/business teams;</li><li>Must be comfortable in rapidly changing and sometimes ambiguous work situations. Ability to work independently and engage supervisor as needed.<br></li></ul></div>Qualifications<div><p><b>Apply if you have the following skillset: </b></p><ul><li>Bachelor’s degree (preferred Computer Science); </li><li>3 - 5 years of experience functioning as a developer; </li><li>Good Experience in Java Technologies;</li><li>JEE, Spring Framework; </li><li>XML and JSON;</li><li>Amazon Cloud (asset);</li><li>UI development in JQUERY, AngularJS (asset) ;</li><li>Web Services SOAP/REST;</li><li>Good understanding of data structures, data modelling, No SQL; </li><li>Good Experience in Design Patterns; </li><li>Experience with UML design and methodology an asset; </li><li>Experience in Agile development methodology/Scrum is preferred;</li><li>Experience with technologies that work with Salesforce.com including: Apex, Visual Force, Workflows, etc (asset);<br></li></ul><p></p></div>Additional Information<div><p><b>Why work for Thinking Capital:</b></p><ul><li><b>Our Mission: </b><br>To own the rails on which small businesses access credit in Canada.</li><li><b>Great Team:</b> <br>Surround yourself with high-performing, energetic and passionate group of people dedicated to the Thinking Capital Mission;<br></li><li><b>FinTech Revolution: </b><br>Be part of a team that is revolutionizing the financial system and redefining how Canadian small businesses access capital;<br></li><li><b>Our Stack:</b><br>Our backend is a sophisticated service oriented architecture developed mostly in Java with a Spring framework. On the frontend side, our application is developed on an AngularJS framework. We use Git in coordination with the best DevOps practices for Continuous Integration and Deployment to our AWS cloud infrastructure.<br></li><li><b>Fast-Paced Environment: </b><br>Take on complex projects in a start-up like collaborative environment;<br></li><li><b>Amazing Culture: </b><br>Amazing work spaces, advanced technology tools, subsidized lunches, Foosball table, super fun work events (Amazing Race, Murder mystery wine and cheeses, Wacky Olympics, Casino nights and legendary holiday parties and more). Take a look at our career page for more information!<br></li><li><b>Thinking Capital Academy: </b><br>Get the opportunity to grow and advance in the company through continuous professional training;<br></li><li><b>Diverse Team: </b><br>Join an “at-will” equal opportunity team that prides itself on its diversity and harmony;</li></ul></div>I'm interested
Title: Java Developer

Job_Description: Interested in being a part of a team that is leading the evolution of retail in Canada? <br/><br/> Embracing and driving change is critical to our success. The complexity and rate at which the retail industry is transforming has increased exponentially in recent years and we are committed to being a leader in the industry. As such we are relentlessly focused on innovating at every level of our business, investing in new technologies and products, and doubling down on the best talent to drive the company forward. It is an especially exciting time to join the Canadian Tire Family of Companies. <br/><br/> Our IT team plays a critical role in our evolution, specifically as we transition to an omni-retailer where digital complements the physical. Our commitment to being a world-class digital organization is evident in how we are using cutting-edge technologies to bring our digital strategy to life in-store, online and on your mobile devices, ultimately improving customer experiences, driving traffic, and boosting loyalty. <br/><br/> The App DevOps team enables our consumers to experience Canadian tire through new and emerging digital channels. Retail is changing in Canada and Canadian Tire is on the leading edge of this transformation. To us, culture comes first and is based on support and teamwork. <br/><br/> In Winnipeg, we are investing in creative people to build world-leading software to enhance the Canadian Tire retail experience and continue to support and augment them in an evolving industry. We expect our Winnipeg lab to refocus the lens retail is experienced through by revitalizing current applications and cultivate new digital experiences. <br/><br/> <strong>What you’ll do</strong> <ul> <li>To be a part of the team, you must have experience in building applications with high performance connecting to several backend Web Services exchanging data with complex systems.</li> <li>Strong knowledge of modern best practices for professional software development including secure coding standards, code reviews, source control management, build processes, testing, and operations.</li><li>Experience developing native mobile applications connecting to Secured Web Services and familiarity with security standards for API’s, SSL, and Tokens is highly preferred.</li><li>Design patterns while creating the functionality outlined in the requirement document and convert functional requirements into user interface designs and prototypes, and developed application(s). Work closely with the UI/UX design team to ensure feasibility of implementation of designs.</li><li>Utilize different languages & web platforms to create scalable web and mobile applications based on business requirements.</li><li>Interface with internal project owners, creative team members and developers to ensure that the applications, experiences and websites display and function as expected.</li><li>Able to code and develop features that leverage in-app purchases, eCommerce, engaging experiences and social media integration.</li><li>Convert Mobile App, Digital Display and Website design specifications (wireframes and mock-ups) into working software.</li><li>Provide recommendations and solutions that meet business needs while ensuring an intuitive and best-in-class end user experience.</li><li>Play an active role and take ownership of optimization and performance activities for our interactive digital experiences.</li><li>Collaborate within the App DevOps team and key stakeholders to incorporate the business requirements based on research informed solutions for both psychological and physical elements that will enhance the customer journey and overall experience</li><li>Participate at all phases of the software development life cycle and work with the team via Agile programming practices (such as Scrum or Kanban) to drive team delivery.</li><li>Leverage your past experience with version control software, such as Git or Perforce to communicate and enforce sound code control practices within the development team.</li><li>Effectively develops and encourages clean, well structured, easily maintainable code bases.</li><li>Executes a regular cadence of Code Reviews and shares feedback throughout the team.</li><li>Consult on browser capability and rendering to ensure that proposals and development will work on specified platforms.</li> </ul> <strong>What you’ve done</strong> <ul> <li>Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science, Engineering preferred or equivalent Software Development industry experience.</li><li>5 years of Web or App development experience.</li><li>Holds a passion for client-side development and a strong background in building highly dynamic web apps leveraging a Javascript stack with HTML5, REST, CSS3, jQuery, and working knowledge of Cordova.</li> <li>Has practical knowledge and experience with Git, Gulp, and Node.JS.</li><li>Functional and practical understanding of JavaScript MVC frameworks leveraging Ionic and Angular.</li><li>Experience with CSS frameworks and pre-processor’s similar to Bootstrap, Sass or Less.</li><li>Development experience on server side JavaScript.</li><li>Experienced with software architecture and design patterns.</li><li>Adapted to leveraging a Scrum/Agile development methodology and is passionate about optimizing process to keep agility high.</li><li>Experience with testing frameworks, continuous integration and build tools (i.e. jUnit, DBUnit, Jenkins/Hudson)</li><li>Proficient in writing automated Unit tests (Jasmine / Karma).</li><li>Advanced knowledge of JavaScript Single Page Applications and related tools.</li><li>Experienced using and automating tests, documentation, builds and deployment.</li><li>Large scale application development an asset.</li><li>Experience developing reusable APIs, consuming web services (REST) and processing data (XML/JSON)</li><li>Experience with both iOS Objective-C and Swift 2.0 required, Swift 3.0 or Android Studio, Android SDK, and related languages (Java) a big plus!</li> </ul> <strong>Why us</strong> <br/><br/> Canadian Tire is one of Canada’s most iconic and diversified companies. Our culture and values uphold our pledge to sustainable practices, and commitment to our local communities through Jumpstart cannot be beat. <br/><br/> To learn more about this team and the Canadian Tire Family of Companies follow us on LinkedIn.<br/><br/>Canadian Tire is an equal opportunity employer. We are committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace for all. We recognize that our future success depends on the perspectives and contributions of all our employees -- their diverse backgrounds, abilities and experiences make our business stronger. If you are contacted for a job opportunity, please advise us of any accommodations needed to ensure fair and equitable access throughout the recruitment and selection process. All accommodation information provided will be treated as confidential and used only for the purpose of providing an accessible candidate experience.
Title: Senior DevOps App Developer - Canadian Tire - Winnipeg, MB

Job_Description: Full-Time Position - Toronto <br/><br/> Hiring a full-time UI/UX Developer in Toronto, ON! Our client is an investment bank and financial service provider. You will be involved with the design and development of user interfaces for trading systems, risk platforms etc. This is a challenging position and where you can truly make an impact. <br/><br/> Perks You'll Love   <ul> <li>Defined Pension plan</li> <li>Join an award-winning Global organization (including Forbes Global 2000 list)</li> <li>Generous Benefits & Bonus plans (Bonus of 10.5% with chance of getting 200% of bonus!!)</li> </ul>  Required Skills & Background   <ul> <li>Contribute to UI design and development</li> <li>Contribute to the development team as a senior UI developer .</li> <li>Interaction with developers building the backend services</li> <li>Participate in design, development and support of the platforms</li> <li>Build Responsive Design, intuitive and standards compliant Front Ends for a variety of web based applications accessed through a variety of platforms</li> <li>Work in a highly Agile and flexible way, supporting a diverse range of client, business and technical requirements utilising TDD and BDD methods</li> </ul>  Required Skills & Background   <ul> <li>Design: HTML, responsive design</li> <li>Language: JavaScript, TypeScript</li> <li>Frameworks: AngularJS/Angular (4.0.0)</li> <li>Build tools: gulp, grunt, npm</li> <li>CSS tools: less, sass</li> <li>Testing tools: Karma, Jasmine, Protractor</li> <li>Methodology: Test Driven Development</li> <li>Other: Wireframes</li> </ul>  We Are An Equal Opportunity Employer <br/> All qualified applicants will receive equal consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status. <br/><br/> Canadian Work Authorization <br/> All applicants MUST be authorized to work in Canada. Any applicants not meeting this criteria will not be notified and will not be considered eligible for the position.
Title: UI/UX Developer

Job_Description: Client is a leading, global ten provider of custom information technology, consulting and business process outsourcing services, and serves primarily Global 2000 companies. The firm employs more than 150,000 people and works with 805 active clients across banking & financial services, insurance, healthcare, life sciences, retail/consumer, manufacturing, energy, communications, and media. Since being spun-out as a public entity in 1998, the company has grown at an unprecedented rate, with anticipated revenue of $8, making the fastest growing IT services company over the last 10 years, and certainly the most profitable now featuring a market capitalization greater than $18B. Client is a member of the NASDAQ-100 Index and the S&P 500 Index and part of Fortune 500 list. <br/><br/> <strong>Position type: Full Time. <br/><br/> Technical Java Developer to support successful execution of Capital Markets Operations and initiatives. <br/> An ideal candidate should be able to demonstrate US securities regulatory expertise (order, transaction & position reporting rules) as well as a proven track record in designing, development and implementation <br/> Candidate will be part of a team responsible for making changes to a trade warehouse used for regulatory reporting. Monthly sprints will make changes to historical and incoming data based on changing business requirements. <br/> Candidate will be part of a team of 5 developers to rewrite a regulatory reporting application on an accelerated timeline. <br/> Primary skill area for the team include: Front End, Dashboard, Workflow, Java Services, Database <br/><br/> Candidate should have good hands on into Collections, Multithreading, Garbage Collection, memory management in JVM • Have good hands on experience with one of the following backend: SQL server or Sybase • Have good hands on experience on Messaging systems such as JMS, MQ or RV or EMS or Solace • Caching experience is a plus • Prior experience in Application Development in Fixed Income or Equities space • Should have excellent communication skills.</strong> <br/><br/> If you bring willingness, flexibility and a desire to impress please apply now. <br/><br/> <strong>Resource Manager:</strong> Kapil Bhatia <br/> <strong>Email:</strong> kapil@reqroute.com <br/> <strong>Phone:</strong> 408-834-7000
Title: 7000 Java lead Developer

Job_Description: Busbud is the bus travel booking app and website with the largest sellable coverage. Users can search, compare and buy tickets from hundreds of bus companies in over 16,000 cities and more than 1M different bus routes. <br/><br/> We're working hard to make the bus, one of the most environmentally friendly and sustainable modes of transportation, a great travel option for customers in dozens of languages in over 60 different countries. Our platform unites travelers, partners and bus companies throughout the world to move an increasingly large share of the entire industry online to increase access and improve the travel experience. <br/><br/> Our people, technology and approach have been instrumental in getting us this far, but we have so much more to do, and that's where you come in. <br/><br/> <strong>What do we expect from you?</strong> <br/><br/> Busbud is looking for a <strong>senior Developer</strong> with a diversified experience to join our team of talented developers. Our challenges evolve, and as a generalist, you'll have the greatest impact on the team and our customers. <br/><br/> Your initial focus will be to build fast, rich Javascript applications and style beautiful pages to bring the right users to Busbud and have them successfully purchase their bus travel. You'll balance iteration and A/B testing with risk-taking and greenfielding. You'll routinely work with modern tools like React, Node and SASS on the frontend, and Node, Redis and Postgres on the backend. You'll share your wisdom with a team that values learning and experimenting. <br/><br/> Depending on the task, you may own the feature end to end, or work with other team members to bring it to life together. We expect you to feel at home on the frontend in user experience land as much as on the backend modeling data and everywhere in between. <br/><br/> As a full stack developer, and depending on your interests, you'll also have the opportunity to work on preventing fraud, improving how we communicate with customers, how we interface with supplier systems, upgrading our global architecture, monitoring, and much more. We've got lots of challenges from which to choose! <br/><br/> <strong>How can you impress us?</strong> <br/><br/> You might recognize a few of these from Camille Fournier's RTR post, which we've used to build our own career path ladder. <br/><br/> As a Senior developer, you  <ul> <li>Have shaped broad architecture, having shipped multiple large services, complex libraries or major pieces of infrastructure (5+ years)</li> <li>Are sought out for technical guidance</li> <li>Are recognized as a prolific contributor to core and side projects</li> <li>Love what you do, and sweat the details</li> <li>You're comfortable with (or can quickly ramp up) with some key ingredients in our tech stack: Javascript, NodeJS, React, Redis, Postgres, CDNs and caches, REST APIs and Heroku</li> </ul> At Busbud, you will  <ul> <li>Be an owner and expert on large sections of our codebase, initially the website and related services</li> <li>Anticipate technical issues at the product level and make architectural and design decisions to avoid them</li> <li>Exemplify software development excellence balancing scope and deadlines to deliver on quality and speed with appropriate test coverage, monitoring and rollout plans</li> <li>Multiply the effectiveness of peers by facilitating cross-team work</li> <li>Make our pages and site fast, beautiful, accessible and great for our users</li> <li>Delight Google and other search engines with your thoughtful use of sitemaps, interlinking, annotated content and other tactics to help travelers find buses.</li> </ul> <strong>Whats in it for you?</strong>  <ul> <li>Compensation based on experience</li> <li>4 weeks of vacation (3 weeks + holiday season)</li> <li>Health Benefits * Stock options</li> <li>Apple equipment</li> <li>Breakfast snacks, team lunch on Wednesdays, happy hour on Fridays</li> <li>Team events</li> <li>A beautiful office in Montreals burgeoning tech neighbourhood, Mile End</li> </ul> <strong>What's it like working as a Developer at Busbud?</strong>  <ul> <li>You get the tools you need to be successful: laptop, big screen, comfy chair and desk and whatever else you might need to do your best work</li> <li>We invest in outool chain so you can focus on building: we've got instrumentation, monitoring, logging, continuous integration, continuous deployments, crowd testing, managed translations and much more. And since we use Javascript in almost all our projects, it's easy for anyone to jump across projects, provide a code review or contribute.</li> <li>We love our office and having most of the team there for high-bandwidth face-to-face communication, and we also have flexible work schedules and support for remote work in our DNA - Mike, our CTO, had spent most of his time in Busbud's early days working remotely out of New York using chat, Github and other async tools to great success in addition to Google Hangouts for 1-on-1s, and also larger team meetings. Our A/V setup isn't perfect (yet!), but it's gotten pretty good :)</li> <li>Many of us have kids, others hobbies, and sometimes both, so we encourage a sane work/life balance. If you want to work like crazy, we'll take that too - you'll be in good company with the team's night owls</li>   <li>We use science (A/B tests) and customer feedback (interviews, support, live chat) to determine the impact of our work</li> <li>We serve over 10M bus departures daily through our API, website and apps, and we're constantly looking for ways to improve our performance and availability without overwhelming the bus companies that supply us with the data - there are lots of challenges in this area around failure mitigation, latency compensation, cache optimization and much more</li> <li>We help travelers in over 60 countries, so we have all kinds of competitors keeping us on our toes, and we need to find ways of providing value to our users to keep them coming back to Busbud to find and buy what is essentially a commodity product. This is a constant challenge which we meet with creativity and taking risks. As much as we can, we deploy explicit and intentional effort to improve diversity in tech and also help upskill the next generation of developers through internship programs, mentoring and hosting, organizing or sponsoring relevant events.</li> <li>There's a lot more, and if you're still reading, then you should hop over to the blog and our tech blog.</li> </ul> <em>Busbud is committed to equal employment opportunity for all employees and to providing its team members with a work environment free from discrimination and harassment. All employment decisions at Busbud are based on business needs, job requirements and individual qualifications, regardless of race, colour, religion or belief, national, social or ethnic origin, sex, age, physical, mental or sensory disability, HIV status, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, marital, civil union or domestic partnership status, pregnancy, or any other status protected by the laws or regulations in the locations where we operate. Learn more about why we care about diversity.</em>

Title: .Net Developer

Job_Description: <strong>What youll do:</strong> <br/><br/> Youre an experienced, senior backend developer whos passionate about creating meaningful experiences through well-engineered products. You are a mentor and guiding voice for developers, who can balance day-to-day workload, with an eye for future improvements of your team. <br/><br/> As a developer within TELUS Digital, you will be working on leading edge microservice APIs, supporting TELUS employees and growing our digital footprint - what you help build will be the underlying systems that help our team achieve better customer experiences. The services you will build will need to be both performant and resilient. <br/><br/> <strong>What youll be responsible for:</strong> <br/><br/> You will be working as part of a friendly, agile team who helps each other solve problems across all functions. As a coal-shoveler in the engine room, you will employ best practices in development, security, accessibility and design to achieve the highest quality of service for our customers. Youre also interested in constantly learning and growing - both building your own skill set and helping develop the people around you. <br/><br/> <strong>What youll need to be successful:</strong> <ul> <li>A passion for emerging technologies, youve kept up to date on top trends and love to bring new ideas to your team</li><li>Experience in architecture of microservices</li><li>Expertise in writing RESTful APIs</li><li>Experience with incident management</li><li>Experience using Nodejs</li><li>Familiarity with creating and implementing unit and integration tests</li><li>Comfort working with SOAP APIs</li><li>Familiarity with security and authentication standards such as OAuth & JWT</li><li>Experience working in an Agile or Scrum environment</li> </ul> This is a full-time, renewable 1-year contract position. <br/><br/> <strong>About TELUS Digital</strong>  <br/> Were a customer-driven and product-minded team within TELUS, responsible for our companys digital evolution. We simplify the path to production so teams can focus on what matters most. <br/><br/> TELUS Digitals mission is to make life easier for millions of customers and for our team. We build smart, customer-centric and data-driven experiences for telus.com, business.telus.com and the My Account app. <br/><br/> Our team includes a passionate group of strategists, UX and visual designers, full stack developers, content managers, scrum masters, testers, product owners, people experience specialists, and other digital experts. <br/><br/> <strong>Were looking for team members who</strong>: <ul> <li>Share our passion for all things digital</li><li>Thrive in an agile, lean and fast-paced environment</li><li>Clearly see things from the perspective of our customers</li><li>Are curious, experiment and never stop learning</li><li>Embrace diversity and new ideas</li> </ul> <strong>What you can expect from us:</strong> <ul> <li>An environment where youre encouraged to share and act on your ideas</li> <li>Flexible work hours in a central downtown location</li> <li>A welcoming, relaxed office with a casual dress code</li> <li>A culture committed to giving; every year we donate time and resources in our communities</li><li>Team lunches with a generous supply of healthy snacks</li><li>A fun, dynamic team that works and plays every day; great ideas can come as easily during an impromptu hallway soccer match or social team outing</li> </ul> We aspire to build the best products. Were always a work in progress and looking for people to join us and help digitize the telco. Learn about our team at telus.com/digital. <br/><br/> <strong>Accessibility</strong> <br/><br/> At TELUS, we are committed to diversity and equitable access to employment opportunities based on ability. <br/><br/> <strong>Bonus points</strong> <br/><br/> Check out labs.telus.com/blog to see how we solve challenging problems for millions of customers with innovative tools.

Job_Description: <div>At <strong>Makespace,</strong> we are changing the way people think about their belongings and saving them from ever having to visit a storage unit again by offering a technology solution for physical storage. Listed among the top 10 most innovative consumer electronics companies in the world in 2015 (Fast Company), we provide a convenient, simple, and full-service storage solution that takes the "self" out of "self-storage."</div><br/> <div>As a <strong>Senior Software Developer</strong>:</div>What Youll Do - Function  <ul> <li>Join a small infrastructure team focused on writing clean, reusable code for multipurpose services like logins, monitoring, or logging.</li><li>Gain rewarding experience in breaking up a monolith into a Service-Oriented Architecture with an opportunity to use the latest and greatest tools from the start.</li> </ul>  What You Bring - Experience  <ul> <li>You have 5+ years of professional software engineering experience.</li><li>Youre motivated by a desire for deep involvement in product definition.</li><li>You write, test, document and deploy clean code in an asynchronous architecture that ensures the integrity of our operations and unique user experience.</li><li>You have built platform applications with Python/Ruby/Java.</li><li>You maintain a willingness to learn, teach and step outside of your comfort zone.</li><li>You design and update RESTful APIs and their documentations.</li><li>You collaborate with our exceptional design & engineering teams for the best UX.</li> </ul>  What You Have - Skill  <ul> <li>Backend: Python, Django/DRF, Celery</li><li>Infrastructure: EC2, MySQL, RabbitMQ, Redis, Consul</li><li>Devops Tools: Ansible, Terraform, Jenkins</li><li>Frontend: ES6, React, Redux</li> </ul>  <div>Makespace is partnering with Terminal to grow and scale in the Canadian market.</div><br/> <div>At Terminal, we identify emerging tech hubs around the globe, and connect the top engineers with the most compelling companies. We provide complete operations and services to give companies all the benefits of a new office without any of the hassle.</div> <br/> <div>We are focused on building a diverse and inclusive workforce. Terminal is an Equal Opportunity Employer and considers applicants for employment without regard to race, colour, religion, sex, orientation, national origin, age, disability, genetics or any other basis forbidden under federal, provincial, or local law.</div><br/> <div>We thank all applicants for their interest.</div>

Job_Description: <strong>Senior MakeSpace Engineer</strong> <br/><br/> MakeSpace is the technology solution for physical storage. We are taking on the $34B storage industry with a combined product and engineering team of 20 people. By changing the way people think about their belongings and saving them from ever having to visit a storage unit again, we are delivering a modern solution to an archaic industry. <br/><br/> <strong>The Projects:</strong>  <ul> <li>Join a small infrastructure team focused on writing clean, reusable code for multipurpose services like logins, monitoring, or logging.</li> <li>Gain rewarding experience in breaking up a monolith into a Service-Oriented Architecture with an opportunity to use the latest and greatest tools from the start.</li> </ul> <strong>The Gig:</strong>  <ul> <li>You have 5+ years of professional software engineering experience.</li> <li>Youre motivated by a desire for deep involvement in product definition.</li> <li>You write, test, document and deploy clean code in an asynchronous architecture that ensures the integrity of our operations and unique user experience</li> <li>You have built platform applications with Python/Ruby/Java.</li> <li>You maintain a willingness to learn, teach and step outside of your comfort zone.</li> <li>You design and update RESTful APIs and their documentations.</li> <li>You collaborate with our exceptional design & engineering teams for the best UX</li> </ul> <strong>The Stack:</strong>  <ul> <li>Backend: Python, Django/DRF, Celery</li> <li>Infrastructure: EC2, MySQL, RabbitMQ, Redis, Consul</li> <li>Devops Tools: Ansible, Terraform, Jenkins</li> <li>Frontend: ES6, React, Redux</li> </ul> <strong>The Team:</strong>  <ul> <li>Join a group of agile, bright, hard-working, and thoughtful individuals</li> <li>Gain insight from executive leadership (with advice on getting a job with a startup)</li> <li>Work with cutting edge technology</li> <li>Help us drink ~three gallons of coffee each day (collectively)</li> </ul> If you want to join a startup that makes a concrete impact on the physical world every day then please apply. <br/><br/> MakeSpace is an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

Job_Description: Our Calgary location is currently looking for a <strong><u>full-time Software Developer</u></strong> to be part of a team that is responsible for delivering timely, high quality releases that delight our customers in the upstream oil & gas sector. You’d be designing, coding and testing enhancements to our Harmony desktop application in C++ and/or C#. <br/><br/> <strong>About You:</strong> <ul> <li><strong>You’re highly collaborative</strong> - you have an affinity for solving complex problems through dialogue with team members</li><li><strong>You’re a problem solver</strong> – you enjoy solving complex problems, and are comfortable exploring them even if the problem and solution are not yet well-defined</li><li><strong>You’re practical</strong> – you assess the circumstances and make the best decision based on the facts</li><li><strong>You’re always improving something</strong> – whether it’s learning a new programming language, or finding better ways to do things with your team, continuous improvement is important to you</li> </ul> <strong>Some of the things you’d be doing as a developer on our team:</strong> <ul> <li>Be an active and collaborative team member as part of an agile development team of 5-9 people</li><li>Design, code and test enhancements for a Windows-based desktop application written in C++ and/or C#, with SQL Server as its backend database</li><li>Work with customer stakeholders to ensure we’re adding value for our users</li><li>Work closely with other developers, for example by pair programming and participating in code reviews</li><li>Troubleshoot and fix bugs</li><li>Contribute to testing of user stories, features and releases</li><li>Assist our customer facing support team in solving client issues, when necessary</li><li>Contribute insights and suggestions as part of our continuous improvement</li><li>Generally pitch in wherever needed to help get a high quality release out on time</li> </ul> <strong>Qualifications that would make you a good fit for this role:</strong> <ul> <li>Minimum B.Sc. in software engineering, computer engineering, computer science, or equivalent experience.</li></ul>  <ul> <li>Experience writing code in C++ and/or C#</li></ul>  <ul> <li>Experience with SQL Server databases</li><li>Familiarity with object oriented software design</li><li>Experience with unit testing</li><li>Familiarity with, or interest in, agile principles and values</li> </ul> <strong>About Us</strong> <br/><br/> We are IHS Markit. We harness deep sources of information, analytics and expertise to forge solutions for the industries and markets that drive global economies. Our company partners with clients in business, finance and government to provide the unrivaled insights and perspectives that lead to well-informed, confident decisions. We call this The New Intelligence. IHS Markit serves more than 50,000 key customers in more than 140 countries, including 80 percent of the Fortune Global 500. We help decision makers apply higher-level thinking to daily tasks and strategic issues across a host of industries and disciplines including energy, finance, automotive, engineering, technology, maritime and trade, aerospace and defense, chemical, and economics and country risk. <br/><br/> Headquartered in London, IHS Markit (Nasdaq: INFO) is committed to sustainable, profitable growth. <br/><br/> It is the policy of IHS Markit to provide equal employment opportunity (EEO) to all persons regardless of age, color, national origin, citizenship status, physical or mental disability, race, religion, creed, gender, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, genetic information, marital status, status with regard to public assistance, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local law. In addition, IHS Markit will provide reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities. We maintain a drug-free workplace. For candidates in the US, we are a participant in E-Verify (see link below). <br/><br/> EEO is the Law <br/> EEO is the Law Supplement <br/> Right to Work <br/> Pay Transparency Policy <br/> E-Verify<br/><br/>Current ColleaguesIf you are currently a colleague with IHS Markit please apply internally via Workday.
Title: Sr. Software Developer

Job_Description: <div><div>Our innovation team focuses on building new products and technical prototypes from proof of concept through to MVP, sales demos and integrations to our partner ecosystem. We’re a small but growing team with a focus on being agile and fast paced. We use a variety of tools and platforms across the entire stack from backend through to mobile applications and across multiple cloud platforms such as AWS and GCP.</div><br/> <div><strong>Who you are:</strong> </div><div>The ideal candidate is a self-starter with full stack development experience on a variety of platforms. Working with product management and the innovation development team, you will be responsible for planning, architecting and implementing products, features and integrations.</div><br/>  <div><strong>We believe:</strong> </div><div>When you join Tulip, you’ll be part of a fast-growing group of people who come from different backgrounds, countries, and experience. We believe in investing in our people, building positive relationships with our customers, and treating our work like craft. We prioritize diversity, inclusion and building a community, and we stay humble and hungry.</div></div><div><div>What you'll do:  <ul>   <ul> <li>Build proof of concept products and technology implementations from ideation to design to implementation</li><li>Work on all aspects of the product, including design, client and server development</li><li>Build and maintain the demo product(s) used by sales & customer successIdentify opportunities for automation and build new tools to simplify the process of creating a demo tailored to specific verticals</li><li>Build and maintain product integrations into our partner ecosystems</li><li>Continuously improve the product to further highlight the value of the Tulip platform</li><li>Stay up to date with the sales strategy and identify solutions to address upcoming challenges</li></ul> </ul>  </div> <br/> <div><div>What you'll need:</strong>  <ul>   <ul> <li>Degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or relevant work experience</li><li>3+ years of software development experience</li><li>Experience with common web technologies, such as: PHP, mySQL, nginx, redis, Golang, React, Angular, etc.</li><li>Experience with mobile application development on Apple or Android platforms</li><li>A deep familiarity building or integrating with RESTful API’s</li><li>Able to relate complex technical concepts to impact on business processes</li><li>Proven ability in communicating with multiple stakeholders, both internal and external</li></ul> </ul>  </div> </div><div><div>Bonus skills!  <ul>   <ul> <li>Experience with retail software such as eCommerce Platforms (ECP), Order Management Systems (OMS), Warehouse Management Systems (WMS), ERP’s, etc.</li><li>Experience working on cloud platforms such as AWS, GCP or Azure</li><li>History of contributing to open source projects</li></ul> </ul>  </div> <br/> <div><div>We Offer:</strong>  <ul>   <ul> <li>An environment passionate about growth and learning</li><li>Flexible hours for our early risers and night owls</li><li>Medical and Dental Insurance</li><li>Paid parental leavePaid sick days</li><li>15 days of paid vacation</li><li>Corporate gym rate</li><li>Weekly team lunches with halal and vegetarian options</li><li>Healthy (and less healthy) snacks and gourmet espresso</li><li>Breathtaking Toronto office on the waterfront and close to Union station</li><li>Creative community space in our Communitech home in Kitchener</li></ul> </ul>  </div> </div><div><div><strong>What we do:</strong></div><div>Tulip Retail is the first mobile platform built exclusively for store associates. Leading retailers like Saks Fifth Avenue, Coach, and Chanel believe in enabling the next generation of store associates with mobile technology using Tulip. We’re a team of experts who have worked with and for retailers over the past 20 years and are driven to build a company whose mission is to enable one of the world’s largest job markets. By placing Tulip-enabled iPads into the hands of associates, our goal is to provide them with instant and reliable access to product information, while also being able to transact, communicate, and collaborate in an omnichannel world.</div><br/> <div>We encourage applications from candidates of colour, women, queer candidates, candidates with family caregiving responsibilities, immigrant candidates, transgender candidates, and candidates with disabilities.</div><br/> <div>Feel like you can’t tick all the boxes above? If you have some of the skills and experience that we’re looking for and are willing to use your talent to learn the rest, we encourage you to apply.</div> </div></div></div>

Job_Description: Full-Time Position - Toronto <br/><br/> Hiring a full-time Senior Developer in Toronto, ON! Our client is looking to build a financial reporting and business analytics platform. Job_Description: Web DeveloperToronto, Canada<br/>   <div> About Us<br/><br/>We’re a leading financial technology company in the institutional debt capital markets - the largest capital market globally and the lifeline of finance world - that is laser focused on transforming how global investment banks, institutional investors, corporations and governments can better execute transactions, price discover and engage with each other. Overbond is building a first-of-its-kind cloud-based platform that makes new bond issuance digital, transparent, and secure. Our team consists of individuals with deep expertise, from both a technical and industry perspective, that are truly motivated by the fact that we are making a significant impact on how global capital markets operate. We value sharp minds, integrity, high performance, collaboration, and purpose. Our mindset is to innovate and challenge convention. At Overbond, we believe that change is the only constant and that problems are opportunities in disguise.</div><br/>  <div> The Opportunity<br/><br/>This exciting new role is available as part of the Overbond team expansion. The position is a unique opportunity to build creative solutions for complex problems using cutting edge technology. As a key member of our team, you will be collaborating with designers, sales, marketing and engineers to develop a standard design and user experience for the website. We are looking for professionals who are passionate about innovative technology, have advanced knowledge and experience with writing standards-compliant front-end code for websites, are well versed in SEO and website optimization, and strive for excellence in developing responsive design website across multiple devices.</div><br/>  <div> What You'll Do   <ul>   <li>Plan, design, write, modify, integrate and test website-related code</li> <li>Develop responsive design website across multiple devices and browsers</li> <li>Code websites, landing pages, emails and marketing campaigns</li><li>Manage web environments from development phase to launch</li><li>Actively identify, design and implement timely and robust solutions to business-related issues</li><li>Accurately translate visual appearance from design marketing and teams to HTML/CSS/JavaScript</li><li>Optimize and performance-tune applications for usability, file size and traffic requirements etc.</li><li>Effectively integrate frontend code with the backend by working closely with the engineering team</li><li>Comfortable to operate independently or as a team member</li><li>Willingness to learn new technologies and expand knowledge base</li> </ul>   </div><br/>   <div> What You'll Need   <ul>   <li>Minimum 2 years of experience with writing web application solutions</li><li>Degree or Diploma in Computer Science, Web Development or related disciplines</li><li>Strong knowledge of object oriented development practices</li><li>Extensive experience with modern HTML, CSS and JavaScript (libraries including JQuery)</li><li>Superb ability to write standards-compliant code from scratch</li><li>Familiarity with JavaScript-related and CSS-related browser compatibility issues</li><li>Knowledge in Ruby on Rails is a plus</li><li>Experience building and debugging complex systems in a team environment</li><li>Proficiency with modern browser technologies</li><li>Team-oriented, pragmatic, self-starting</li><li>Superior communication skills and a positive attitude</li><li>Enjoy working in a fast-paced environment and the challenge of unfamiliar tasks</li><li>An entrepreneurial mindset, likes working in an agile environment, driven to ship frequently</li> </ul>   </div><br/>   <div> What We Offer   <ul>   <li>The challenge and opportunity of joining a well funded & rapidly growing startup</li><li>Opportunity to work on a real product with very demanding paying enterprise clients</li><li>Lots of opportunity for learning and self-development</li><li>Variety of snacks (fruits, yoghurt, cookies, nutrition bars, nuts, coffee, tea, etc.)</li><li>Regular fun company socials are included (holiday party, Friday lunch & learn, social night etc.)</li><li>Ability to contribute in all stages of product development</li><li>Your full choice of development hardware</li> </ul>   </div><br/>  <div>Successful candidate(s) will have a truly exciting opportunity to be part of the industry leading financial technology company changing the way how global investment banks, institutional investors, corporations and governments access the capital markets. The candidate will work with top notch industry professionals and will be given ample amount of opportunities to learn and contribute.</div><br/>  <div> Apply</div> <br/>

Title: Software Developer

Job_Description: <strong>About NestReady</strong> <br/><br/> NestReady is looking for ambitious, highly motivated, driven professionals with strong technical skills to join our team! We are a real estate technology company with over 6 years of experience in building innovative tools to empower the next generation to enter the real estate market. Our environment is fast-paced, challenging, and ultimately very rewarding for the right person. <br/><br/> <strong>Our product</strong> <br/><br/> NestReady is a real estate platform that brings all parts of the home-buying experience together. It is a digital platform that removes the stress from the homebuying process creating transparency and accessibility every step of the way. NestReady transforms the customer experience through data processing and user pattern identification. We define a systematic journey from beginning to end that allows us to provide the best in class home buying guidance. <br/><br/> Our platform is built to be integrated within financial institutions platforms to help our partners provide a full home buying experience - from discovery to financing. <br/><br/> <strong>Who you’ll work with</strong> <br/><br/> Reporting directly to the VP of Product & Development, you will provide the technological vision and leadership in the development, implementation and support of our product. You will oversee the quality of the architecture, codebase and infrastructure of the product, delivering designs to agreed specifications within timelines and budget constraints. <br/><br/> You thrive in a startup environment, with a strong desire to help build for the future and enjoy leading a team of engineers. You are an entrepreneurial, results-oriented, customer-focused leader who will manage technical discussions with business prospects, understand and assess their requirements, prepare and present NestReady offerings, and provide recommendations for optimal solutions. <br/><br/> As the leader of this team, you will also be responsible for hiring team of exceptional engineers as we grow our business.<br/><br/>Outside of Canada?<br/><br/>We are open to assisting with visa sponsorship for applicants with a desire to move to Montreal, Quebec. <br/><br/> <strong>What you’ll be working on</strong>  <ul>  <li>Develop and advocate the technological vision and roadmap with the development team</li>    <li>Influence technical direction by choosing best tools and approaches & ensure delivery of high-quality end product</li>    <li>Define a strategy to manage development processes to ensure that the engineering team delivers with the highest levels of quality, efficiency and predictability</li>    <li>Work closely with the product and sales teams to define product specifications, new features and client requirements</li>    <li>Build, manage, mentor and lead a team of Backend and Front End developers</li>   </ul>    <ul>  <li>Writing back-end code in Ruby and improving our current code</li>    <li>Design and implement robust features that perform and scale for millions of users</li>    <li>Architecture and performance optimization of complex customizable software apps</li>    <li>Constantly seek and advocate for adopting new bold new technologies for our product</li>    <li>Support planning and documentation of technical architecture</li>    </ul> <strong>What you have</strong>  <ul>  <li>Minimum 5 years professional experience with Ruby/Rails framework or other full-stack frameworks</li>   </ul>    <ul>  <li>Minimum 3 years of demonstrated experience leadership experience</li>    <li>Able to work independently with little to no supervision</li>    <li>Strong ability to communicate and align with the executive team and corporate roadmap</li>    <li>Strong ability to present, synthesize and influence change</li>    <li>Self-driven</li>    <li>Strong organizational skills with great attention to detail</li>    <li>Creative problem solving</li>    </ul> <strong>It would be great if you had</strong>  <ul>  <li>Strong knowledge of Javascript, React, NodeJS</li>    <li>Knowledge of MongoDB,PostgreSQL, Graphs, and Geoprocessing</li>    <li>Experience with startup environment</li>    <li>Appreciation for agile development and efficient code</li>    <li>Have experience creating technical documentation</li>    <li>Previously contributed to open source projects</li>    </ul> <strong>What We Offer</strong>  <ul>  <li>Sponsorship for Canadian work visa</li>    <li>Flexible work schedule</li>    <li>Casual dress code</li>    <li>Open office space in Old Port</li>    <li>Free coffee, snacks, and drinks</li>    <li>Health Benefits covered up to 80%</li>    <li>Fun parties and team building activities</li>    <li>Opportunities for advancement</li>    </ul> <strong>Un peu d’info sur NestReady</strong> <br/><br/> NestReady est à la recherche de professionnels ambitieux, motivés et motivés, possédant de solides compétences techniques pour se joindre à notre équipe! Nous sommes une société de technologie immobilière avec plus de 6 ans d'expérience dans la construction d'outils innovants pour permettre à la prochaine génération d'entrer dans le marché de l'immobilier. Notre environnement est rapide, stimulant, et finalement très enrichissant pour la bonne personne. <br/><br/> Notre produit <br/><br/> NestReady est une plate-forme immobilière qui réunit toutes les parties de l'expérience d'achat d'une maison. C'est une plate-forme numérique qui élimine le stress du processus d'achat d'une maison en créant transparence et accessibilité à chaque étape du processus. NestReady transforme l'expérience client grâce au traitement des données et à l'identification des modèles utilisateur. Nous définissons un parcours systématique du début à la fin qui nous permet de fournir les meilleurs conseils en matière d'achat d'une maison. <br/><br/> Notre plateforme est conçue pour être intégrée aux plates-formes des institutions financières afin d'aider nos partenaires à offrir une expérience complète d'achat d'une maison, de la découverte au financement. <br/><br/> <strong>Vos futurs collègues de travail</strong> <br/><br/> Relevant directement du vice-président des produits et du développement, vous fournirez la vision technologique et le leadership dans le développement, la mise en œuvre et le soutien de notre produit. Vous superviserez la qualité de l'architecture, de la base de code et de l'infrastructure du produit, fournissant des conceptions conformes aux spécifications convenues dans les délais et les contraintes budgétaires. <br/><br/> Vous prospérez dans un environnement de démarrage, avec un fort désir d'aider à construire pour l'avenir et profiter de diriger une équipe d'ingénieurs. Vous êtes un leader entrepreneurial, axé sur les résultats et axé sur le client qui gère les discussions techniques avec les clients potentiels, comprend et évalue leurs besoins, prépare et présente les offres NestReady et fournit des recommandations pour des solutions optimales. <br/><br/> En tant que chef de cette équipe, vous serez également responsable de l'embauche d'une équipe d'ingénieurs exceptionnels à mesure que nous développons notre entreprise. <br/><br/> <strong>Vous êtes actuellement situé à l’étranger?</strong> <br/><br/> Nous sommes ouverts à l'aide pour le parrainage de visas pour les candidats désireux de déménager à Montréal, Québec. <br/><br/> <strong>Vos tâches</strong>  <ul>  <li>Développer et défendre la vision technologique et la feuille de route avec l'équipe de tête</strong>  <ul>  <li>Bonne connaissance de Javascript, React, NodeJS</li>    <li>Connaissance de MongoDB, PostgreSQL, Graphes et Géotraitement</li>    <li>Expérience avec l'environnement de démarrage</li>    <li>Appréciation pour le développement agile et le code efficace</li>    <li>Avoir de l'expérience en création de documentation technique</li>    <li>Auparavant contribué à des projets open source</li>    </ul> <strong>Ce que nous offrons</strong>  <ul>  <li>Parrainage pour un visa de travail canadien</li>    <li>Horaire de travail flexible</li>    <li>Tenue
