amusantes et des activités de team building</li>    <li>Des opportunités d'avancement</li>    </ul>
Title: Lead Back-end Developer/Développeur Principal Back-end

Job_Description: <strong>Job Summary:</strong> <br/><br/> We are looking for an enthusiastic and experienced front-end developer to join our development team. If you are looking for opportunities to develop your technical skills and grow your career, we currently have an exciting opening for you. <br/><br/> <strong>Major Responsibilities/Activities:</strong> <ul> <li>You will be a key member of the team responsible for developing new modernized web front-ends and reusable components for our key products.</li> <li>You will be responsible for the full development process of these front-end components, including design, implementation, peer review, bug fixing, automated unit tests and technical documentation.</li> <li>You will work closely with our UX team to create end products that deliver great usability and follow best design practices.</li> <li>You will use your knowledge to influence the way we address day-to-day technical challenges.</li> <li>While this role has a focus on front-end development, Genesys development teams use a wide range of technologies and we value any other technical knowledge that you can offer.</li> </ul> <strong>Minimum Requirements:</strong> <ul> <li>Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, or related disciplines.</li><li>5 years of experience in designing and development large scale web applications.</li><li>Strong working knowledge of the following:</li><li>DOM, HTML5, CSS3 and JavaScript (ES5 ).</li><li>Modern JavaScript frameworks/libraries, such as Backbone, Angular, React, Redux, Flux, Ember, jQuery, Bootstrap.</li><li>Backend integration using HTTP REST-based API, with strong understanding of synchronous/asynchronous request handling.</li><li>Knowledge around communication frameworks (webSockets, socketio, …)</li><li>Responsive web design techniques.</li><li>JavaScript test automation frameworks such as Jasmine, Karma, PhantomJS, Protractor.</li><li>Experience with Source control such as GIT and Mercurial.</li><li>Strong communication skills, both verbal and written.</li><li>Strong team player who enjoys collaborating with others.</li>  </ul> <strong>Desirable Skills:</strong> <ul> <li>Knowledge in full-stack development.</li><li>Knowledge in mobile web application development.</li><li>Experience with building distributed application in the cloud.</li><li>Knowledge in continuous integration/continuous delivery.</li><li>Technologies/tools:</li><li>Typescript.</li><li>NodeJS and npm.</li><li>build/test tools such as Gulp, Grunt.</li><li>Amazon AWS</li><li>Docker</li>  </ul> About Us: <br/><br/> Genesys® powers more than 25 billion of the world’s best customer experiences each year. We put the customer at the center of everything we do and passionately believe that great customer engagement drives great business outcomes. More than 10,000 companies in more than 100 countries trust the industry’s #1 customer experience platform to orchestrate omnichannel customer journeys that eliminate silos and build lasting relationships. With a strong track record of innovation and a never-ending desire to be first, Genesys is the only company recognized by top industry analysts as a leader in both cloud and on-premise customer engagement solutions. Connect with Genesys via www.genesys.com, Twitter, Facebook, YouTube, LinkedIn, and the Genesys blog. <br/><br/> <strong>Genesys is an equal opportunity employer committed to diversity in the workplace. We evaluate qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, disability, veteran status, and other protected characteristics.</strong> #LI-BJ1
Title: Software Developer, Front End

Job_Description: <strong>Company Profile</strong><br/><br/>Miovision’s mission is to provide the foundation for tomorrow’s smart cities by transforming the way traffic networks are managed today. Backed by the world’s most advanced traffic AI, Miovision’s innovations in traffic signal planning and operations have made it possible for cities to improve the transportation experience for drivers, cyclists and pedestrians since 2005. With offices in Kitchener, Canada and Cologne, Germany, Miovision serves over 17,000 municipalities worldwide. For more information, visit www.miovision.com<br/><br/><strong>Position Summary</strong><br/><br/>Do you know someone who hates the commute to work? Do you want to be part of the solution? Miovision is looking for an exceptional software developer who wants to solve meaningful problems that affect not only your friends, your family, but you! Whether you love spending time tinkering with algorithms in the backend, or laying out and styling spectacular front ends, we’ve got problems that you can apply yourself to. Bring yourself here and help be part of the solution! <br/><br/> Here are some of the products that you could work on.<br/><br/><strong>DataLink</strong><br/><br/>DataLink is software for project and data management built for traffic data collection, that helps a user coordinate traffic data requests, organize, store and visualize data, and share files and collaborate with colleagues. In 2017, we processed over 150,000 hours of video and delivered it right to our customers to analyze. Learn more at https://miovision.com/datalink<br/><br/><strong>TrafficLink</strong><br/><br/>TrafficLink is a software platform used to help traffic engineers create more responsive, efficient traffic networks. It allows you to monitor and manage your traffic signals, monitor traffic with real-time video, provide automated traffic signal performance measures, and so much more! Learn more at https://miovision.com/trafficlink<br/><br/><strong>TrafficLink Hardware</strong><br/><br/>TrafficLink Hardware is the hardware side of the TrafficLink product that generates a combination of video and telemetry data into the cloud. It tells us exactly what’s happening at an intersection. There are a number of products that fall under the umbrella. Learn more at https://miovision.com/trafficlink/hardware<br/><br/><strong>Things we’d like you to do:</strong>   <ul> <li>Develop application features from initial design/prototype phase to production</li> <li>Ensure quality via dev testing (local/automated)</li> <li>Participate in the code review process</li> <li>Participate to technical road map discussions and estimation exercises</li> <li>Evaluate design trade-offs, and long-term impact of immediate decisions</li> <li>Evaluate performance and scalability of live systems</li> </ul>  <strong>A few things we’d like you to have:</strong>   <ul> <li>Passion for products that directly affect our customers</li> <li>The ability to wear multiple hats and see things from different perspectives</li> <li>Curiosity to dive into technical details of how things work</li> <li>A positive attitude to build relationships with everyone within the organization</li> <li>Make data driven decisions</li> </ul> We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.
Title: Software Developer (New Grad)

Job_Description: Full Stack Java Developer #68920 <br/><br/> Request ID: 68920-1 <br/> Start Date: ASAP, 6 month contract to start, likely contract renewal <br/> Work Location: downtown Toronto, Near TTC and GO <br/> 3 positions open - Senior and Int. <br/><br/> Join a huge multi year project that will revamp/modernize all client touchpoints and data systems with this leading financial services company. <br/> Investor and Treasury Services (I&TS) has developed a multi-year business transformation strategy, Advanced Client Engagement (ACE), that focuses on aligning our clients’ requirements with system enhancements designed to improve their overall experience, enhance operational efficiency and reduce risk – and we’re just getting started! <br/> You will be part of a highly skilled agile team and work in a collaborative environment where you will have continuous learning opportunities and challenging work – we just can’t afford to be boring! <br/> We are using continuous integration, cloud based solution and leading edge architecture to quickly deliver a next-generation portal for our clients. Our technical team is very important to us, and we make our best to build an environment where you can enjoy the work and shine. So review the description below and tell us why you’re the winning candidate? Don’t go unnoticed! <br/><br/> Key to this role is solid Java full stack developer, focus on backend development using Spring (spring boot), some front end with Javascript technologies, TTD/Junit/unit test, CI (maven/jenkin etc.) and great team/collaboration experience ( agile, scrum, kanban, lean). <br/><br/> What will you do?   <ul> <li>Design, develop and test a large-scale, custom distributed software system using latest Java and JavaScript technologies.</li> <li>Employ agile development practices including test and deployment automation as well as Continuous Integration/Continuous Delivery using Jenkins to improve overall execution speed and product quality.</li> <li>Function as in-house consultant/expert for resolution of complex technical issues. Research emerging trends/best practices and determine implications of proposed solutions on meeting business unit strategy</li> <li>Key contributor in the creation of technical strategy for ACE projects within bank IT with the architecture group. Identify technical and business opportunities to take advantage of cross project knowledge, best practices and reusability to expedite projects</li> <li>Be a technology advocate and share expertise with other team members.</li> <li>Be a key partner to the business and the rest of the team throughout the delivery cycle.</li> <li>Think through challenging and interesting problems and solve them with your team.</li> <li>Coach and help develop the team and bank One technology community.</li> </ul>  What do you need to succeed? <br/> <strong>Must Have:</strong>   <ul> <li>Extensive hands-on development and delivery experience using Java and Spring Framework</li> <li>Hands-on experience with a client side rendering framework such as Angular, Ember, Vue.js…</li> <li>Great Object Oriented coding practices, including strong design patterns knowledge, refactoring, clean code…</li> <li>Real passion for software engineering and best practices</li> <li>Passion for technology, team leadership and a willingness to mentor and work with developers at all levels of experience</li> <li>Some cloud project experience</li> <li>Continuous Integration (CI/CD), Devops experience</li> </ul>  <strong>Nice to Have:</strong>   <ul> <li>Experience in Agile , Lean and/or Continuous Delivery approach such as Continuous Integration/CI, TDD/unit testing, infrastructure as code</li> <li>Experience in designing application running in cloud platforms such as PCF, Bluemix, AWS..</li> </ul>  What's in it for you? <br/> Work in an environment promoting continuous learning through learning session, study group, external event, online learning.   <ul> <li>Become part of a team that thinks progressively and works collaboratively. We care about seeing each other reach full potential.</li> <li>Working in a unique atmosphere dedicated to Innovation.</li> <li>Ability to make a difference and lasting impact from a local-to-global scale</li> <li>Work on Next Gen Technology to lead the way in Innovation</li> <li>Work in a dynamic, collaborative, transparent, non-hierarchal and ego-free culture where your talent is valued over your role title.</li> </ul>
Title: Full Stack Java Developer

Job_Description: This is a full-time, renewable 1-year contract position<br/><br/>What youll do:<br/><br/>You are an experienced, hands-on developer who has shipped medium to large-scale applications. You will be a forward thinker who can balance day-to-day pragmatism with an eye for future growth of our platform. <br/>  As a software developer with TELUS Digital, you will be responsible for designing, building and running the software applications which enable innovative, data-driven, customer centric digital experiences for TELUS customers. <br/><br/> You will be working as part of a friendly, cross-discipline agile team who helps each other solve problems across all functions. As a custodian of customer trust, you will employ best practice in development, security, accessibility and design to achieve the highest quality of service for our customers. <br/><br/> We use a range of technologies to get the job done: JavaScript and Babel (<em>ES2018</em>) coupled with Webpack, React, Redux and other libraries to provide a modern, easy to use Javascript toolchain. A central Design System is used for styling and hosts shared components, while our RESTful APIs are built with Node.js powering our custom services. Quality is a primary concern and we test our applications at multiple levels with automation testers and Product Owners embedded within teams.<br/><br/>What youll be responsible for:  <ul> <li>Design, develop, test, deploy, maintain and improve software applications</li><li>Identify problem areas in code and suggest solutions on how to tackle</li><li>Assist in evaluating technology choices and rapidly test solutions</li><li>Develop scalable systems with performance and security in mind</li><li>Develop solutions that are maintainable, scalable and performant</li><li>Help identify and solve application issues experienced by customers</li><li>Ensure a cohesive experience across different browsers and devices</li><li>Adhere to accessibility best practices <em>(We believe in an accessible web for everyone)</em></li><li>Collaborate closely with team members in an agile environment <em>(we like Scrum, Kanban)</em></li><li>Assist in mentoring junior developers on your team</li> </ul>  <strong>What youll need to be successful:</strong> <br/>  Minimum qualifications  <ul> <li>Proven experience with front-end development <em>(ES2018 JavaScript, React, CSS)</em></li><li>Proven experience in backend and API development <em>(we use Node.js, PostgreSQL, Redis)</em></li><li>Strong Experience with React and Redux</li><li>Strong Experience with client-side testing <em>(we use Jest)</em></li><li>Experience designing and documenting APIs <em>(we use Node.js, Express, OpenAPI Spec)</em></li><li>Experience with FRP <em>(functional, reactive programming)</em></li> </ul>  Preferred qualifications  <ul> <li>Experience in building scalable production services and monitoring performance <em>(we use Kibana, NewRelic)</em></li><li>Experience with clustering technologies <em>(we use Kubernetes)</em></li><li>Familiarity with the Docker ecosystem</li> </ul> <strong>About TELUS Digital</strong> <br/><br/> Were a customer-driven and product-minded team within TELUS, responsible for our companys digital evolution. We simplify the path to production so teams can focus on what matters most. <br/><br/> TELUS Digitals mission is to make life easier for millions of customers and for our team. We build smart, customer-centric and data-driven experiences for telus.com, business.telus.com and the My Account app. <br/><br/> Our team includes a passionate group of strategists, UX and visual designers, full stack developers, content managers, scrum masters, testers, product owners, people experience specialists, and other digital experts. <br/><br/> <strong>Were looking for team members who:</strong> <ul> <li>Share our passion for all things digital</li></ul>  <ul> <li>Thrive in an agile, lean and fast-paced environment</li><li>Clearly see things from the perspective of our customers</li><li>Are curious, experiment and never stop learning</li><li>Embrace diversity and new ideas</li> </ul> <strong>What you can expect from us:</strong> <ul> <li>An environment where youre encouraged to share and act on your ideas</li> </ul>  <ul> <li>Flexible work hours in a central downtown location</li> <li>A welcoming, relaxed office with a casual dress code</li> <li>A culture committed to giving; every year we donate time and resources in our communities</li><li>Team lunches with a generous supply of healthy snacks</li><li>A fun, dynamic team that works and plays every day; great ideas can come as easily during an impromptu hallway soccer match or social team outing</li> </ul> We aspire to build the best products. Were always a work in progress and looking for people to join us and help digitize the telco. Learn about our team at telus.com/digital. <br/><br/> <strong>Accessibility</strong> <br/><br/> At TELUS, we are committed to diversity and equitable access to employment opportunities based on ability. <br/><br/> <strong>Bonus points</strong> <br/><br/> Check out labs.telus.com/blog to see how we solve challenging problems for millions of customers with innovative tools.
Title: Intermediate Full-stack Developer

Job_Description: Job Description<div>one45 is a leader in cloud-based solutions for medical education management in North America. We’re on a mission to change medical education for the better by making educators more proactive and effective at training the next generation of doctors and health-care professionals. <br/><br/> <strong>Work somewhere incredible</strong> <br/><br/> As a one45 full-stack developer you will be a member of an extremely passionate development team. We’re looking for enthusiastic and motivated software developers looking for new challenges in big data; including creating ingenious data integrations, rock solid ETL pipelines, and data visualizations that sing. <br/><br/> You’ll be responsible for developing core features from front-end UI to backend DB on a new and ambitious SaaS product looking to change the education landscape in massive ways. <br/><br/> <strong>Your responsibilities</strong> <br/><br/> Create high-quality code <ul>  <li>Work with Product Management, Customer Service and Development in cross-functional, Agile teams to design and develop new product features.</li> <li>Execute the full lifecycle of software development from initial design through development and testing to deployment.</li> <li>Write well designed, testable code that meets our coding standards.</li> <li>Contribute to test plans for manual and automated testing; develop automated tests.</li>  </ul> Embark on a bold new adventure <ul>  <li>Create and improve upon a brand new ambitious product currently in-development.</li> <li>Develop and implement policies to strengthen and improve the quality of evolving code.</li> <li>Guide and build database designs, implementation, refactoring and optimization efforts.</li> <li>Segment portions of functionality into modularized services for long term reliability.</li>  </ul> Train the padawans <ul>  <li>Review & test other developers code and provide feedback.</li> <li>Focus on self-improvement and productivity gains for yourself and others.</li> <li>Coach and mentor junior developers to solve things faster and achieve higher velocity.</li>  </ul> <strong>Your qualifications</strong> <br/><br/> Required <ul>  <li>Bachelor’s degree or equivalent in Computer Science or Software Engineering.</li> <li>3+ years professional experience using PHP frameworks such as Laravel or Symfony.</li> <li>Comfortable working on the front-end and with responsive design.</li> <li>3+ years experience with object oriented programming, PHP, MySQL, HTML5, CSS3, JavaScript / jQuery.</li> <li>Familiarity with front end build tools such as Grunt, Webpack, Gulp, Sass, etc.</li> <li>Experience using package management systems (i.e. composer, npm).</li> <li>Thorough understanding of relational database design and implementation.</li> <li>Professional experience working within a LAMP stack development environment.</li> <li>Strong understanding of UI/UX best practices.</li> <li>Comfortable utilizing a version control system, such as Git or Bitbucket.</li>  </ul> Bonus experience <ul>  <li>Design and implementation of Data visualizations with large data sets.</li> <li>Hands-on experience of writing, debugging, and optimizing ETL processes.</li> <li>Continuous integration knowledge involving Jenkins or equivalent integration tools.</li> <li>Familiarity with AWS technologies and Big Data.</li> <li>Mobile design using Angular and Ionic framework.</li> <li>Experience with REST API development and security.</li> <li>Site performance improvement and optimization knowledge.</li>  </ul> <strong>The perks</strong> <br/><br/> At one45, we thrive on shared values and a constant desire to delight our customers beyond their wildest expectations. Working at one45, you’ll meet some of the brightest and most enthusiastic people the tech scene has to offer. <br/><br/> Benefits <ul>  <li>Top notch employer paid extended healthcare, MSP coverage, dental, and life insurance.</li> <li>Personal days and flexible hours.</li> <li>Above industry average paid vacation each year.</li> <li>Weekly personal 1:1s with a focus on developing your career in the direction you want to go.</li> <li>Fully stocked kitchen with limitless snacks, sodas, fruit, etc.</li> <li>Legendary summer and winter staff parties.</li> <li>Monthly team events (team lunches, hikes, yearly Vancouver Sun Run Team, etc).</li> <li>In-office beer/wine + games (darts, board games, etc) for those quiet Friday afternoons.</li>  </ul> <strong>Apply Now</strong> <br/><br/> Sound like a fit? If so, we want to hear from you. Send us your resume to jobs@one45.com. When applying, please make the subject line “Full-Stack Developer (CPR) - Your Name”. Shortlisted candidates will be contacted for next steps. No phone calls or agencies please.</div>Company Description<div>one45 has been a leader in cloud-based solutions for medical education management in North America since 2002. We’re on a mission to change medical education for the better by making educators more proactive and effective at training the next generation of doctors and health-care professionals.</div>
Title: Intermediate/Senior Full-Stack Developer

Job_Description: <div>  <div> <p><strong>Software Developer - Back End<br></strong><strong>(JavaScript, JS Frameworks, Ruby, MySQL) </strong></p> <p><strong>Développeur Logiciel - Back-End<br></strong><strong><strong>(JavaScript, JS Frameworks, Ruby, MySQL) </strong></strong></p> <p></p> </div> </div><div> <p><strong></strong></p> <p></p> <p></p> <p></p> <p></p> <p></p> <p><strong>Software Developer - Back End (Senior)</strong></p> <p><strong>(JavaScript, JS Frameworks, Ruby, MySQL) </strong></p> <p><strong></strong> </p> <p><strong>Dakis Inc. | Montreal (Qc), Canada </strong></p> <p>Product: Next Generation WebAPP eCommerce & Photo Solutions</p> <p></p> <p></p> <p><strong></strong> </p> <p><strong>Job description & responsibilities </strong></p> <p>At Dakis, web development is king! We are looking for a talented software developer who doesn’t fear JavaScript and new web technologies, and who is very enthusiastic at the idea of bringing eCommerce to the next level. You will play an active role in shaping Dakis’ next generation WebApp eCommerce and photo solutions: </p> <p> </p>  <div> <ul> <li> <div>Your role will be to help develop this product and connect the backend to Dakis’ core eCommerce and Photo products</div> </li><li> <div>You will be highly involved in all phases of the software’s development and will be responsible for planning features, designing its components, programming and more </div> </li><li> <div>You will design the software and architecture, and translate “user stories” and requirements to build Dakis' next generation of solutions</div> </li><li> <div>Design and develop using mainly JavaScript and Ruby</div></li></ul> </div> <p> </p> <p>This is one of the most interesting project available and a dream job. Ready for a real challenge and want to jump into an exciting life changing project? Let’s get in touch! </p> <p></p> <p> </p> <p><strong>Main qualifications and desired skills</strong></p> <p> </p>  <div> <ul> <li> <div>Experienced with JavaScript, JS Frameworks and Ruby </div> </li><li> <div>Experienced with MySQL </div> </li><li> <div>Experienced building and scaling consumer oriented web applications </div> </li><li> <div>Have previously built web applications from A to Z </div> </li><li> <div>Attention to details and strong commitment to quality</div> </li><li> <div>Experienced with modern software development principles and processes, frameworks, and version control systems </div></li></ul> </div> <p> </p> <p><strong>Complementary skill set</strong></p> <p><strong></strong> </p><strong></strong>  <div> <ul> <li> <div>Good understanding of responsive front-end framework, cross-browser user interfaces / browser limitations, modern web technologies, web security and SEO</div> </li><li> <div>Scaling high traffic web applications </div> </li><li> <div>Modern web technologies and languages </div> </li><li> <div> <p>Rails, HTML and CSS is an asset</p></div> </li><li> <div>Nginx and Apache web servers </div> </li><li> <div>Debian Linux and/or Unix operating systems </div> </li><li> <div>Facebook, Social Medias and Web Services APIs </div> </li><li> <div>Mobile Apps </div></li></ul> </div> <p> </p> <p><strong>About Dakis </strong></p> <p>Dakis is a private Software Development Company. We assist retailers and manufacturers across the globe with easy to use and well adapted Managed Websites, WebStores, Product Information and Photo Solutions.</p> <p></p> <p> </p> <p><strong>Apply </strong></p> <p>We value talented and motivated individuals that truly love what they do. Interested to shape the future? Send us your CV, links or code sample and salary expectations at cv@dakis.com. Let's get in touch!</p> <p> </p> <p> </p> <p><strong>Développeur Logiciel - Back End (Senior)</strong></p> <p><strong>(JavaScript, JS Frameworks, Ruby, MySQL) </strong></p> <p><strong></strong> </p> <p><strong>Dakis Inc. | Montreal (Qc), Canada </strong></p> <p>Produit: Prochaine génération WebApp eCommerce et solutions photos</p> <p></p> <p> </p> <p><strong>Description & responsabilités </strong></p> <p>Chez Dakis, le web c’est du sérieux! Nous recherchons un développeur logiciel talentueux qui n’a pas peur du javascript et des nouvelles technologies web, et qui est enthousiaste à l’idée d’amener le commerce électronique à un autre niveau. Vous jouerez un rôle de premier plan dans le développement de la prochaine génération de nos solutions WebApp eCommerce et solutions photos: </p> <p> </p>  <div> <ul> <li> <div>Votre rôle sera de développer ce produit et de faire la connexion côté backend avec les autres produits de Dakis incluant nos solutions eCommerce et photos </div> </li><li> <div>Vous serez impliqué dans toutes les phases de développement du logiciel et serez responsable de la planification des caractéristiques, la conception de ses composantes, la programmation et plus encore </div> </li><li> <div>Vous contribuerez à la définition et la planification du projet puis traduirez les « user stories » et les exigences du projet pour développer les prochaines générations de solutions de Dakis</div> </li><li> <div>Vous ferez le design et vous développerez en utilisant principalement JavaScript et Ruby</div></li></ul> </div> <p> </p> <p>Ce projet est l’un des plus intéressants et offre une carrière rêvée. Êtes-vous prêt à relever un important défi et désirez-vous vous lancer dans un projet qui va changer votre vie? Contactez-nous! </p> <p> </p> <p><strong>Principales qualifications</strong></p> <p><strong> </strong></p>  <div> <ul> <li> <div>Maîtrise de JavaScript, JS Frameworks et Ruby </div> </li><li> <div>Maîtrise de MySQL </div> </li><li> <div>Expérience pour bâtir et faire évoluer des applications web orientées clients </div> </li><li> <div>Avoir bâti des applications web de A à Z </div> </li><li> <div>Attention aux détails et fierté de livrer un produit de qualité </div> </li><li> <div>Expérimenté avec les principes et processus modernes de développement logiciel, frameworks et version control systems </div></li></ul> </div> <p> </p> <p><strong>Expertise complémentaire </strong></p> <p><strong></strong> </p>  <div> <ul> <li> <div>Bonne compréhension des responsive front-end framework, limitations des fureteurs, technologies web modernes, sécurité web et SEO</div> </li><li> <div>Faire évoluer des applications web à haut trafique </div> </li><li> <div>Technologies et langages web modernes </div> </li><li> <div> <p>Rails, HTML et CSS est un atout</p></div> </li><li> <div>Nginx et Apache web servers </div> </li><li> <div>Debian Linux et/ou Systèmes d’Opération Unix </div> </li><li> <div>API Facebook, médias sociaux et services web </div> </li><li> <div>App Mobile </div></li></ul> </div> <p> </p> <p></p> <p> </p> <p><strong>À Propos de Dakis </strong></p> <p>Dakis est une société privée du domaine du développement logiciel. Nous contribuons au succès des détaillants et des manufacturiers du monde entier en leur fournissant des solutions de Sites Web Gérés, WebStore, Information Produit et des Solutions Photos qui sont simples d’utilisation et bien adaptées.</p> <p></p> <p> </p> <p><strong>Appliquez </strong></p> <p>Nous apprécions les individus talentueux et motivés qui aiment vraiment ce qu'ils font. Intéressé à façonner l'avenir? Envoyez-nous votre CV, des liens ou des exemples de code et vos attentes salariales à cv@dakis.com . Contactez-nous!</p> <p></p> <p> </p> </div>
Title: Software Developer - Back End (JS, JS Frameworks, Ruby, MySQL)

Job_Description: <strong>Description:</strong> <br/> Sr API Developper</strong>  <br/><br/> Youre an experienced, senior backend developer whos passionate about creating meaningful experiences through well-engineered products. You are a mentor and guiding voice for developers, who can balance day-to-day workload, with an eye for future improvements of your team. <br/><br/> As a developer within client Digital, you will be working on leading edge microservice APIs, supporting client employees and growing our digital footprint - what you help build will be the underlying systems that help our team achieve better customer experiences. Title: Sr API Developer

Job_Description: Company Profile <br/><br/> Morgan Stanley is a global financial services firm and a market leader in investment banking, securities, investment management and wealth management services. With offices in more than 43 countries, the people of Morgan Stanley are dedicated to providing our clients the finest thinking, products and services to help them achieve even the most challenging goals. <br/><br/> As a market leader, the talent and passion of our people is critical to our success. We embrace integrity, excellence, team work and giving back. <br/><br/> Technology <br/><br/> The Technology division partners with our business units and leading technology companies to redefine how we do business in ever more global and dynamic financial markets. <br/><br/> Our sizeable investment in technology results in leading-edge tools, software, and systems. Our insights, applications, and infrastructure give a competitive edge to clients’ businesses—and to our own. <br/><br/> Quality Assurance and Production management (QAPM) provides Quality Assurance, Event Management, Production Management, and End User services to clients within the Firm. QAPM partners with the development teams in other technology divisions to ensure seamless technology delivery to our clients. <br/><br/> QAPM’s goal is to deliver a first-class technology platform by focusing on production stability and delivering excellent end user services. The division supports the evolution of technology platforms and tools, manage and maintain our production plant, and ensure the implementation and adherence to proper operational controls to manage risk. <br/><br/> Position Description <br/><br/> The QA Tools backend automation team is looking for an intermediate DevOps automation developer. The candidate is responsible to build, enhance and maintain the automation solutions for various backend systems, while having a high focus on reuse and efficiency. A successful candidate should have a broad knowledge of IT technologies and have a desire and capability to work on several issues simultaneously. The candidate should be comfortable solving problems independently and integrating backend automation solutions with the toolkit. The candidate will work closely with QA function and development teams to improve the overall quality of the applications in an Agile development environment. Strong interpersonal and communication skills are a must. <br/><br/> Skills Required <br/><br/> • 5 years of experiences   <ul> <li>Strong knowledge of Linux, command line tools and shell scripting</li> <li>Good Object-Oriented development skills (Java/Scala/Python)</li> <li>Good understanding of RDBMS, SQL</li> <li>Good backend messaging knowledge (Soap/Rest/MQ, XML/JSON)</li> <li>Strong problem solving skills</li> <li>A desire to lean and integrate new technologies</li> <li>Good written and oral communication skills <br/><br/> Skills Desired <br/><br/> • Experience in Quality Assurance and test automation</li> <li>Experience with Git/Stash/JIRA/Jenkins</li> <li>Experience with Selenium, Javascript, AngulaJS <br/><br/> Knowledge of French and English are required. <br/><br/> Morgan Stanley is an equal opportunities employer. We work to provide a supportive and inclusive environment where all individuals can maximize their full potential.<br/><br/></li> </ul>
Title: Intermediate DevOps Automation Developer

Job_Description: Company Description<div> <strong>At INgrooves Music Group, we are committed to powering creativity in today’s dynamic music marketplace by providing the best end-to-end digital asset management platform tools and services to content creators and owners. </strong> <br/><br/> <strong>Our focus is on promoting quality independent music labels through our network of media store partnerships that include Spotify, iTunes, Pandora, Amazon, Google Music, YouTube, and Napster.</strong> <br/><br/> <strong>Our team is solutions-oriented, predisposed to delivering fun and results!</strong></div>  <br/>Job Description<div>The successful candidate considers themselves a full-stack engineer with a preference for the backend details. Builds and fosters strong relationships and effective partnerships with cross-functional teams. <br/>  <br/> <strong>What this means:</strong>  You care about your teammates and clients. <br/><br/> <u>Executing for Results</u> <br/><br/> The successful candidate will demonstrate the ability to generate and translate strategic plans into actions with timely execution and accountability. <br/>  <br/> <strong>What this means:</strong> You have a strong work ethic. <br/><br/> <u>Leadership/Collaboration</u> <br/><br/> Establishes and maintains positive working relationships, operates with integrity, influences and supports others, and remains open to ideas. <br/>  <br/> <strong>What this means:</strong> Your teammates care about you. <br/><br/> <u>Problem Solving</u> <br/><br/> The successful candidate will be tenacious and self-motivated and have a demonstrable record of resolving issues and providing effective solutions. Demonstrates an eagerness and ability to learn quickly and leverages a flexible mindset in response to shifting dynamics, adversity and/or change. <br/>  <br/> <strong>What this means:</strong> You're efficient and intelligent. <br/><br/> <u><strong>Why work with us?</strong></u> <br/><br/> We are passionate about developing dynamic solutions in a relaxed and engaged environment. Our people matter! And we have a fun, relaxed working environment (with great views, among other perks)!</div>  <br/>Job LocationI'm interested

Job_Description: This is a full-time, renewable 1-year contract position<br/><br/>What youll do:<br/><br/>You are an experienced, hands-on developer who has shipped medium to large-scale applications. You will be a forward thinker who can balance day-to-day pragmatism with an eye for future growth of our platform. <br/><br/> As a software developer with TELUS Digital, you will be responsible for designing, building and running the software applications which enable innovative, data-driven, customer centric digital experiences for TELUS customers. <br/><br/> You will be working as part of a friendly, cross-discipline agile team who helps each other solve problems across all functions. As a custodian of customer trust, you will employ best practice in development, security, accessibility and design to achieve the highest quality of service for our customers. <br/><br/> We use a range of technologies to get the job done: JavaScript and Babel (<em>ES2018</em>) coupled with Webpack, React, Redux and other libraries to provide a modern, easy to use Javascript toolchain. A central Design System is used for styling and hosts shared components, while our RESTful APIs are built with Node.js powering our custom services. Quality is a primary concern and we test our applications at multiple levels with automation testers and Product Owners embedded within teams.<br/><br/>What youll be responsible for:  <ul> <li>Design, develop, test, deploy, maintain and improve software applications</li><li>Identify problem areas in code and suggest solutions on how to tackle</li><li>Assist in evaluating technology choices and rapidly test solutions</li><li>Develop scalable systems with performance and security in mind</li><li>Develop solutions that are maintainable, scalable and performant</li><li>Help identify and solve application issues experienced by customers</li><li>Ensure a cohesive experience across different browsers and devices</li><li>Adhere to accessibility best practices <em>(We believe in an accessible web for everyone)</em></li><li>Collaborate closely with team members in an agile environment <em>(we like Scrum, Kanban)</em></li><li>Assist in mentoring junior developers on your team</li> </ul>  <strong>What youll need to be successful:</strong> <br/>  Minimum qualifications  <ul> <li>Proven experience with front-end development <em>(ES2018 JavaScript, React, CSS)</em></li><li>Proven experience in backend and API development <em>(we use Node.js, PostgreSQL, Redis)</em></li><li>Strong Experience with React and Redux</li></ul>  <ul> <li>Strong Experience with client-side testing <em>(we use Jest)</em></li><li>Experience designing and documenting APIs <em>(we use Node.js, Express, OpenAPI Spec)</em></li><li>Experience with FRP <em>(functional, reactive programming)</em></li> </ul>  Preferred qualifications  <ul> <li>Experience in building scalable production services and monitoring performance <em>(we use Kibana, NewRelic)</em></li><li>Experience with clustering technologies <em>(we use Kubernetes)</em></li><li>Familiarity with the Docker ecosystem</li> </ul>  <strong>About TELUS Digital</strong><br/><br/>Were a customer-driven and product-minded team within TELUS, responsible for our companys digital evolution. We simplify the path to production so teams can focus on what matters most. <br/><br/> TELUS Digitals mission is to make life easier for millions of customers and for our team. We build smart, customer-centric and data-driven experiences for telus.com, business.telus.com and the My Account app. <br/><br/> Our team includes a passionate group of strategists, UX and visual designers, full stack developers, content managers, scrum masters, testers, product owners, people experience specialists, and other digital experts. <br/><br/> <strong>Were looking for team members who:</strong> <ul> <li>Share our passion for all things digital</li></ul>  <ul> <li>Thrive in an agile, lean and fast-paced environment</li><li>Clearly see things from the perspective of our customers</li><li>Are curious, experiment and never stop learning</li><li>Embrace diversity and new ideas</li> </ul> <strong>What you can expect from us:</strong> <ul> <li>An environment where youre encouraged to share and act on your ideas</li> </ul>  <ul> <li>Flexible work hours in a central downtown location</li> <li>A welcoming, relaxed office with a casual dress code</li> <li>A culture committed to giving; every year we donate time and resources in our communities</li><li>Team lunches with a generous supply of healthy snacks</li><li>A fun, dynamic team that works and plays every day; great ideas can come as easily during an impromptu hallway soccer match or social team outing</li> </ul> We aspire to build the best products. Were always a work in progress and looking for people to join us and help digitize the telco. Learn about our team at telus.com/digital. <br/><br/> <strong>Accessibility</strong> <br/><br/> At TELUS, we are committed to diversity and equitable access to employment opportunities based on ability. <br/><br/> <strong>Bonus points</strong> <br/><br/> Check out labs.telus.com/blog to see how we solve challenging problems for millions of customers with innovative tools.

A close and customized support. <br/> Projects, events and workshops dedicated throughout the year, a source of exchanges, career opportunities and also training (Agility, Lean Management...) <br/> An attractive and evolving salary package. <br/> Missions with a strong added value within prestigious clients. <br/> An Access to our large knowledge database and to our training center. <br/> A support of our experts ... that will help you to become an expert on you own and to continue to grow with us.

planning, analyzing and designing solutions accordingly.</li> <li>Designing, creating and executing tests to determine validity of data and reliability of codes.</li> <li>Analyzing, isolating, debugging and solving problems by providing corrective action.</li> <li>Maintaining applications by detecting and correcting failures, and by implementing enhancements and modifications.</li> <li>Building security features into relevant application designs.</li> <li>Providing technical support for users of applications supported by IIT.</li> <li>Offering technical assistance on matters related to multimedia and other web based projects and application functionality.</li> <li>Providing orientation and training and serving as a resource to staff members regarding new and existing features for application software and portals.</li> <li>Assisting the Help Desk in providing advanced technical support and trouble-shooting.</li> <li>Creating help guides and documentation for new and existing applications and keeping up to date with new development tools, languages, environments, and architecture.</li> </ul>  <strong>Qualifications and Experience</strong>   <ul> <li>Minimum of 5 years of experience developing for and maintaining enterprise Drupal multisite <br/> Installations, designing and building Web-based applications, including backend databases.</li> <li>Strong Web programming skills, including PHP 5-7, AJAX technologies (XML/JSON, HTML 5, CSS & XHTML, browser DOMs).</li> <li>Thorough understanding of Web-based technologies in a primarily LAMP environment with fluency in other common environments (Java, Python, etc.) and technologies.</li> <li>Demonstrated working knowledge of Web application design and programming. Strong time management and organizational skills. Excellent verbal and written communication skills.</li> </ul>  </div> <br/>
Title: Drupal/PHP Developer

Job_Description: <div><strong>Web UI/Java Software Developer</strong></div><br/>  <div><strong>STRATACACHE</strong> is the industry leader in digital signage. We provide powerful end-to-end digital media deployments for the largest global businesses and brands across Quick Serve Restaurants, Retail, Consumer Package Goods, Retail Finance, Stadiums, Lottery, Gaming and Corporate Communications.</div><br/>  <div>We develop Digital Signage systems (the TVs flourishing in stores and restaurants), Digital Menu Board systems (above cash registers in restaurants), Digital Experiences in stores (through SmartPhones, Tablets and TouchScreens) including Digital Play (games) and Video Walls. To support those systems, and to more broadly manage Digital Contents, Stratacache relies on a strong core management system, in charge of Content Management, Content Distribution, Device Management, Monitoring and Reporting, as well as specialized tools for Menu Board management.</div><br/>  <div><strong>We are rapidly growing and so is our R&D team.</strong> </div><br/>  <div><strong>Job Description</strong> </div><br/>  <div>The main task is to design, develop, test and support the specialized core Web applications, using cutting edge Web technologies (Angular / Bootstrap 4). While the emphasis of the position is on the Web Interface and UI design, the task also requires backend ownership, based on SQL, Hibernate, SpringBoot, and more advanced tools, such as reporting engines and audio/video tools.</div><br/>  <div>To accomplish the tasks, you will have a great autonomy, but you can count on the expertise of the current team who are well versed in the involved technologies.</div><br/>  <div>Compensation and benefits are competitive. Work environment is stimulating and enjoyable, at downtown Montreal on McGill College in the Bell Media tower. Remote working is also possible (twice a week) after six months.</div><br/>  <div><strong>Responsibilities</strong></div>   <ul>  	<li>Design (collaboratively) and develop user interfaces</li> <li>Work in an Agile / Scrum team</li> <li>Help maintain code quality, organization, and automatization</li> <li>Ensure the best possible performance, quality, and responsiveness of the applications</li> </ul>  <div><strong>Skills</strong> </div>   <ul>  	<li>Proficient in Java, with a good knowledge of its ecosystems</li> <li>Proficient in Javascript, Angular, Bootstrap, CSS3, HTML5</li> <li>Strong experience in UI Design</li> <li>Familiarity with GWT, MVP is a plus (for legacy UI)</li> <li>Implementing automated testing platforms and unit tests (Protractor, Karma, JUnit)</li> <li>Understanding of code versioning tools, such as Git</li> <li>Familiarity with continuous integration (TeamCity)</li>  </ul>
Title: Web UI/Java Software Developer

of positively impacting a team, and caring about your fellow human</li> </ul> Benefits & Perks  <ul> <li>Explore ongoing opportunities for professional development: training, conferences, certifications, and in-house peer mentorship</li> <li>Experiment with new techniques, wear multiple hats, and learn about new disciplines. Our environment is not your average, hierarchical development shop: we emphasize accountability for outcomes, but autonomy in activities</li> <li>Pursue independent projects, explore new ideas, and challenge yourself to become a thought leader in your field with 5 days of dedicated Awesome time (self-directed professional development) annually and quarterly training budgets</li> <li>Enjoy a flexible schedule of full-time hours, health/dental benefits and private US coverage</li> <li>Work from a modern, ergonomic space complete with standing/sitting desks and an open-concept social atmosphere</li> <li>Additional perks based on employee feedback and interest, including in-house mindfulness training, yoga, group get-togethers and more!</li> </ul> <strong>About Myplanet</strong> <br/><br/> Were a software studio with an integrated team of designers and developers. We make smarter interfaces for the worlds most influential companies by implementing leading software platforms from Acquia, IBM, and Salesforce to empower your employees and engage your customers. Headquartered in Toronto, with studio presence in Vancouver, Ukraine, and Chicago, we're a team of 90 designers, product managers & engineers hell-bent on making the workplace better. <br/><br/> <strong>A Commitment to an Inclusive Workplace</strong> <br/><br/> We are committed to fostering an inclusive and accessible environment as we work to build a workforce that reflects the diversity of the community in which we live, including those with disabilities. We are dedicated to providing accommodations in all parts of the hiring process in accordance with the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act and the Ontario Human Rights Code. If you require any accommodation, we will work with you to meet your needs.
Title: Full Stack Software Developer

Job_Description: <em>English version to follow</em> <br/><br/> <strong>Venez changer le monde de la messagerie avec nous!</strong> <br/><br/> Smooch (www.smooch.io) donne le coup d’envoi à la prochaine vague d’innovation en matière de messagerie et transforme la façon dont les entreprises et les consommateurs communiquent. Notre nouvelle technologie de messagerie s’affaire à révolutionner et à humaniser les interactions entre les gens, les entreprises et la technologie. <br/><br/> <strong>Contribuez au plus grand tournant en matière de communication depuis des décennies.</strong> <br/><br/> Nous sommes à la recherche de développeur(e)s de logiciel mobile expérimenté(e)s voulant se joindre à notre équipe de Montréal pour développer principalement nos kits de développement (SDK) mobiles fournissant des interfaces usager (UI) conversationnelles et des interfaces de programmation (API) natives sur iOS et Android. Ces trousses mobiles sont soutenues par des services web sur HTTP ou websocket (Node.js, Express, ES6+, MongoDB, Redis, etc.). Vous contribuerez ainsi au développement d'une plateforme utilisée par des milliers de développeurs et des millions d’utilisateurs à travers le monde. <br/><br/> <strong>En tant que membre de l’équipe d'ingénierie, vous serez responsable de :</strong>  <ul> <li>Développer les fonctionnalités de nos SDK mobiles, incluant les interfaces usager conversationnelles et les API natives.</li></ul>   <ul> <li>Livrer des fonctionnalités de bout en bout en collaboration avec l'équipe et avec un haut niveau d'autonomie.</li></ul>   <ul> <li>Écrire du code bien structuré et testé qui tient compte de la performance, la fiabilité, la compatibilité et la flexibilité de nos produits.</li> <li>Travailler avec les technologies les plus récentes et avancées dans une équipe d'ingénierie qui est toujours ouverte aux nouvelles idées.</li> </ul> <strong>À propos de vous :</strong>  <ul> <li>Vous êtes un(e) développeur(e) mobile talentueux(se) avec au moins 2 ans d'expérience professionnelle.</li> <li>Vous êtes à l'aise en Objective-C et très familier(ère) avec l'écosystème iOS.</li> <li>Vous avez un niveau d'intérêt similaire pour Android.</li> <li>Vous avez travaillé sur des solutions mobiles ou des composants utilisés par d'autres développeurs.</li> <li>Vous connaissez les principes REST et vous êtes prêt(e) à contribuer à l'implémentation d'API sur Node.js.</li> <li>Vous voulez collaborer avec une équipe dynamique qui vous inspirera et vous aidera chaque fois que vous serez bloqué(e).</li> </ul> <strong>À propos de Smooch: :</strong> <br/><br/> Smooch est une <em>startup</em> de San Francisco/Montréal, soutenue par une équipe chevronnée d'entrepreneurs en technologie, d’ingénieurs logiciels, de conseillers et d'investisseurs. <br/><br/> Ce qui nous distingue vraiment, c’est d’abord et avant tout notre culture sympathique et notre raison d’être. Nous accordons une grande importance à la transparence, au sens de l'initiative et de la responsabilité, comme à la capacité de prendre des décisions et de les assumer. Nous aimons travailler fort tout en ayant du plaisir, et être solidaires dans le succès comme devant l’épreuve. <br/><br/> <strong>Ce que vous aimerez chez nous :</strong>  <ul> <li>Vous aurez la liberté de proposer des idées, le soutien nécessaire pour les concrétiser</li> <li>Vous aurez la chance de prendre des projets à bras-le-corps et d’être dans le feu de l’action. Nous avons appris à célébrer nos victoires et à apprendre de nos échecs, et nous voulons vous aider à donner le meilleur de vous-même.</li>   <li>Notre politique de vacances généreuse ainsi que nos horaires (et nos lieux) de travail flexibles auront de quoi rendre vos amis jaloux.</li> <li>Nous vous encourageons et vous soutenons dans le développement continu de vos compétences, afin de vous permettre d’approfondir votre connaissance de l’industrie et de pousser votre expertise en matière de messagerie encore plus loin.</li> <li>Dans notre équipe, on a du <em>fun</em>. Nous sommes une gang de passionnés qui aiment leur travail, mais qui savent aussi s’amuser – jeux de sociétés, jeux vidéo, jeux de cartes, soirées cinéma, sport : ici, on ne s’ennuie jamais!</li> <li>Smooch organise et/ou commandite régulièrement des hackathons à l’intérieur comme à l’extérieur de nos bureaux.</li> <li>Situé à Montréal, en plein cœur du Mile-End – un repère de<em> startups</em> –, notre bureau offre une vue imprenable sur le quartier. Autres points bonis : nous sommes à deux pas du centre culturel du Mile-End et du meilleur café en ville.</li> </ul> -- <br/><br/> Vous pensez avoir ce qu’il faut pour relever le défi? Nous invitons tous les gens brillants et ambitieux à se joindre à notre équipe en pleine croissance. Promis : ce sera l'une des expériences les plus plaisantes, mémorables, gratifiantes et importantes de votre carrière. <br/><br/> <em>Veuillez noter que tous les candidats retenus devront se soumettre à une vérification de leurs antécédents.</em> <br/><br/> ------------- <br/><br/> <strong>Come change the world of messaging with us!</strong> <br/><br/> Smooch (www.smooch.io) is enabling the next wave of messaging and changing the way business and consumers communicate. Our new messaging technology is revolutionizing and humanizing how people interact with businesses and technology. <br/><br/> <strong>Be part of the biggest change in the way people communicate in decades.</strong> <br/><br/> We are seeking experienced Mobile Software Developers who are excited to join our team in Montreal. You’ll work on our mobile SDKs, which provide conversational UIs and native APIs (iOS, Android), and are backed by RESTful and websocket-based APIs (Node.js, Express, ES6+, MongoDB, Redis, etc). You’ll be involved in building a platform that is currently used by thousands of developers and millions of their end users around the world. <br/><br/> As part of the Software Development Team, you will:  <ul> <li>Expand the capabilities of our mobile native SDKs which provide conversational UIs to end users, expose native APIs to developers, and interact with our backend.</li>   <li>Work with a high level of autonomy, owning features from start to finish, while being supported by an experienced team.</li> <li>Write well structured, unit tested code while taking into account the performance, reliability and scalability of our products.</li> <li>Work with the latest and greatest technologies within an engineering culture that is always open to new ideas.</li> <li>Use your own expertise to mentor us, your teammates.</li> </ul> About You:  <ul> <li>You are a proficient mobile developer with at least 2 years of professional experience under your belt.</li>   <li>You are well-versed in Objective-C and very familiar with iOS frameworks and ecosystem.</li>   <li>You have a similar level of interest on Android.</li> <li>You have worked on mobile frameworks or open sourced components used by other developers.</li> <li>You are familiar with RESTful APIs and open to contributing to their implementation (Node.js).</li> <li>You want to collaborate with a dynamic team that will give you help and inspiration whenever you get stuck.</li> </ul> <strong>About Smooch:</strong> <br/><br/> Smooch is a venture-backed San Francisco/Montreal-based startup, led by a team of seasoned and successful technology entrepreneurs, software engineers, advisors and investors. <br/><br/> Our friendly culture, full transparency, and purpose is ultimately what really sets us apart. We value taking initiative and owning the accountability that comes with it. We thrive on working hard and playing well, sharing our wins and owning our failures. <br/><br/> You’ll love:  <ul> <li>The freedom to put ideas on the table, the support to see them through and the recognition for seeing your projects come to fruition.</li> <li>The opportunity to take ownership and have an impact. We know how to celebrate successes and learn from our failures. We want to help you do your best work with us.</li> <li>Our generous flexible vacation policy as well as flexible work hours (and location!).</li> <li>We invest in and support you in your continuing skills development, helping you to develop your industry knowledge and increase your expertise in the messaging space.</li> <li>A fun team environment. We are passionate about our work, and also know how to have fun – board & card games, movie nights, video games, and more!</li> <li>Our offices in the heart of the Mile-End start-up neighborhood with a million dollar view for everyone to enjoy. We are steps away from the cultural centre of Montreal’s Mile End as well as the best coffee in the city.</li> </ul> -- <br/><br/> Think you're up to the challenge? We're inviting bright, ambitious & progressive people to join our growing team - we guarantee it will be one of your most enjoyable, memorable, rewarding, and important gigs of your career. <br/><br/> <em>Please note that successful applicants will be required to undergo a background check.</em>
Title: Mobile Software Developer / Développeur(e) de logiciel mobile

Job_Description: <div><div><div> Description</div> <div>MindGeek, a company specializing in the development and marketing of highly trafficked web properties, and a leader in its activity sector is searching for a <strong> Senior PHP Software Developer</strong>. <br/><br/> If you are passionate about programming, eager to learn new things, and love to push the boundaries of what is possible, then MindGeek is the place for you. You will be working as part of a team within a dynamic, fast-paced, fun, challenging and creative environment in order to achieve team-oriented goals. <br/><br/> We are looking for senior level candidates with at least 5 years of PHP experience to join our team: <br/><br/> <strong>Responsibilities:</strong>  <ul> <li>Develop new features for existing projects.</li>  <li>Maintenance and support for existing features.</li>  <li>Write unit and functional tests.</li>  <li>Peer code review.</li>  <li>Create development threads; create innovative software/way of solving company problems.</li>  <li>Evaluate systems performance and take action(create new systems, change current systems), review and repair old code,</li>  <li>Making presentation for new features/ define specification for new development.</li>  <li>Participate in development of long range planning for new projects and facilities.</li>  <li>Assist junior members of the team when needed</li>  <li>Participate in the full software development life cycle (design, implementation, integration, and interaction with quality assurance) In the case of a new project</li> </ul> <strong>Required technical skills:</strong>  <ul> <li>SOLID principles, with understanding of interfaces and dependency injection.</li>  <li>GIT, composer.</li>  <li>Experience with API development.</li>  <li>Experience with unit and functional tests.</li>  <li>Knowledge of Redis or other caching methods.</li>  <li>Experience with Linux Servers, and knowledge of Apache or Nginx web servers.</li>  <li>Laravel 5.*, Symphony 4.*, or other similar web frameworks.</li>  <li>PHP7 with knowledge of return types, type hinting, traits, etc</li>  <li>Good English language skills (written and spoken), strong communication skills.</li>  <li>Excellent programming skills used in backend development. The technologies will vary depending on the project.</li> </ul> <strong>ASSETS - Great to have experience with:</strong>  <ul> <li>MySQL, ElasticSearch.</li>  <li>Micro service architecture.</li>  <li>Scalable, highly available systems. Experience in dealing with large-scale websites that receive millions of visits per day.</li>  <li>HTML, Javascript, CSS.</li>  <li>Test Driven Development.</li>  <li>Event Driven Programming.</li>  <li>Domain Driven Design.</li> </ul> <strong>Desirable personal skills:</strong>  <ul> <li>Good attention to details.</li>  <li>Good communication skills.</li>  <li>Enthusiasms for learning and using new technologies.</li>  <li>Ability to complete duties on time whilst maintaining a high quality service.</li>  <li>Sense of humor, positive approach and work well within a team.</li> </ul> MindGeek offers its employees a competitive compensation plan including annual bonus plans and benefits package. <br/><br/> We thank all applicants for their interest, however only candidates under consideration will be contacted. No telephone calls please. Title: Senior PHP Developer

Job_Description: <p>Are you passionate about emerging technologies and Virtual Reality? Do you want to be part of an expanding project to help like-minded individuals share this content? Secret Location is looking for a Full Stack Developer to join one of our projects, Vusr, a white-label solution for the distribution of VR video and immersive content (check it out here: https://www.vusr.co/). Vusr is a one-of-a-kind, made-in-house product with an innovative and collaborate team who has an avid interest in pushing the leading edge on new VR technology.</p>  <p>The platform includes a web-based CMS dashboard and customizable apps for iOS, Android, Gear VR, Daydream, Oculus Rift, HTC Vive, PSVR, Apple TV and web platforms, with more to be added in future. This role would focus on the CMS for the product, including implementation of new features in the dashboard, and providing back-end support for the Vusr applications.</p>  <p> </p>  <p><strong>Responsibilities</strong></p>  <p>Working from the existing code base, implement new features, revisions and improvements to the Vusr CMS, web applications and server backend that powers these. This may include:</p>  <p><strong>CMS dashboard (front-end):</strong></p>  <ul>  <li>Build pages or components for new features</li>  <li>Implement revisions from UX audits</li>  <li>Implement styling updates from visual QA passes</li>  </ul>  <p><strong>Vusr back-end:</strong></p>  <ul>  <li>Update data model and provide server side support for new features and user-facing elements</li>  <li>Create database schemas that represent and support new and existing features</li>  <li>Work with the app development team to ensure the integration of CMS and front-end apps evolves as changes are made</li>  <li>Ensure security and data protection</li>  <li>Implement automated testing platforms and unit tests</li>  </ul>  <p><strong>Overall:</strong></p>  <ul>  <li>Writing reusable, testable, and efficient code that enables low-latency, highly available, and scalable applications</li>  <li>Assist with scoping and breaking out tasks for new features</li>  <li>Work to weekly sprint plan in Jira</li>  <li>Make revisions based on client requests or user testing</li>  <li>Evaluate, profile, and implement bug fixes</li>  </ul>  <p> </p>  <p><strong>Requirements</strong></p>  <p><strong>Main Languages needed</strong></p>  <ul>  <li>Javascript (ES5 & ES6)</li>  <li>Stylus, or other CSS preprocessor</li>  <li>Jade, EJS, or other markup templating languages</li>  </ul>  <p><strong>Main Frameworks needed</strong></p>  <ul>  <li>Node.js and related support libraries (eg. Express)</li>  <li>AngularJS 1.x - 4.x</li>  </ul>  <p><strong>Main Tools used / needed</strong></p>  <ul>  <li>AWS<br>  - DynamoDB<br>  - S3<br>  - Cloudfront<br>  - Elastic Transcoder</li>  <li>NPM</li>  <li>Gulp</li>  <li>Github</li>  <li>Jenkins</li>  <li>Atlassian: Jira/Confluence</li>  <li>Agile development</li>  </ul>  <p> </p>  <p><strong>Nice to have experience</strong></p>  <ul>  <li>Customizing CMS frameworks</li>  <li>Video player or streaming apps, particularly 360 / 3D video</li>  <li>Adaptive Video Streaming in HTML5 - libdash and/or HLS</li>  <li>Virtual reality projects and platforms, eg. iOS & Android for Google Cardboard, Google Daydream, Samsung Gear VR, Oculus Rift, HTC Vive, PlayStation VR</li>  <li>Gulp for build automation</li>  <li>Jenkins for Continuous Integration</li>  <li>WebGL and Canvas</li>  <li>Google Analytics or Crashlytics</li>  <li>Sketch</li>  </ul>  <p><strong><strong>What youll be a part of:</strong></strong></p>  <p><strong>· </strong> Taking care: competitive health and dental coverage (for full-time employees)</p>  <p>· Investing in your future: employee stock option purchase plan, and local defined contribution pension plans</p>  <p>· Break time: free snacks, winter holiday office closures, reduced hours in summer</p>  <p>· Party time: office bar carts, after work drinks, holiday and summer parties, and sometimes just because</p>  <p>· Be inspired: regular film screenings, concerts, and opportunity to get involved in industry events</p>  <p>· The office: modern facilities, in house screening rooms, more snacks, and swag</p>  <p>· Build a better world: transcend entertainment to our corporate social responsibility activities. Plan a social event. Promote healthy lifestyles. Go green. Give back.</p>  <p>· Grow: develop your career and shape your future</p>  <p><strong>We thank everyone for their interest but only those candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.</strong></p>  <p><strong><em><em><strong>We are committed to providing accommodations for persons with disabilities. If you require accommodation, we will work with you to meet your needs.</strong></em></em></strong></p>  <p></p>
Title: Full Stack Developer

Job_Description: Position Title: Junior Software Developer <br/><br/> Reports to: Director, Application Development <br/><br/> Department: IT <br/><br/> Location: Toronto, ON <br/><br/> Position Summary <br/><br/> The Software Developer will translate software requirements into workable programming code and build scalable web applications that solve a variety of problems for our clients. <br/><br/> Major Responsibilities  <ul> <li> Use a variety of programming languages and development tools to build, test, implement, and support the development of web software applications.</li>   <li> Collaborate and interact with interdisciplinary teams (interactive designers and software developers) to identify and resolve issues, review and complete projects.</li>   <li> Participate in an agile software development framework. Proactively find and address areas of concern and identify potential roadblocks.</li>   <li> Assist in estimating resource needs and timelines to complete short and long term projects as well as daily operational tasks. Assist in clarifying stakeholder requirements; communicate questions and address concerns. Provide relevant and detailed updates and feedback in a timely manner</li>  </ul> Education and Experience  <ul> <li> Minimum 1 year of experience in a professional software development role or a co-op term</li>   <li> Post-secondary education in Computer Science, Application Development, or Information Technology (nice to have but not required)</li>   <li> Any related certification is an asset</li>  </ul> Skills  <ul> <li> Solution Design Ability to define and describe an architecture of a system and understand the cause and effect of their coding</li>   <li> Collaborative communication skills (written and oral) - Ability to convert and explain technical concepts to a non-technical audience</li>   <li> Development from specifications - Ability to find requirements and break them down into actionable execution plans for the team and proactively identify problems</li>   <li> Frontend Development some experience and applicable knowledge with HTML 5, CSS3 and/or Java Script, Bitmaker course completion</li> </ul> Backend Development Some experience and applicable knowledge in backend development in any language (Ruby, PHP, .NET, etc.), relational databases, writing and optimizing queries (Postgres, MySQL, etc.) <br/><br/> <em>ITRG is an equal opportunity employer committed to diversity and inclusion. We are pleased to consider all qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability, or any other legally protected factors. To that end, upon request, ITRG will ensure, to the extent possible, that accommodation be made available to applicants throughout the recruitment and hiring process.</em>
Title: Junior Software Developer

Job_Description: <strong>Job Description</strong> <br/><br/> An established startup in the gaming industry is urgently looking for a Lead Unity Engineer to lead their Game Client engineering team at their downtown Toronto office. Their current game client sits on a high performance, large scale game service and utilizes a virtual world/3D navigation user interface. You will be responsible for managing the current team (5), own the integratino process between frontend and backend, and design and implement game features. <br/><br/> The ideal candidate will have strong leadership experience managing a team of developers, hands on experience developing game features using Unity and must have experience shipping mobile games. <br/><br/> <strong>Skills/Requirements</strong> <ul> <li>1-3 years leading a software development team</li><li>3-5 years of experience in unity mobile app development</li><li>3-5 years of experience using C#/.NET</li><li>Knowledge and understanding of OOP principles and design patterns</li><li>MUST have shipped at least 1 mobile game title</li> </ul> <strong>Benefits</strong> <ul> <li>Competitive base salary + bonus</li><li>3 weeks of vacation</li><li>Stock option plan</li><li>Full benefits package</li></ul>  <ul> <li>RELOCATION ASSISTANCE</li> </ul> <strong>Salary: 150,000</strong>
Title: Lead Unity Developer for VC Funded Gaming Company

Job_Description: <div>Senior Full Stack Developer - Java & JavaScript</div><div>Ref: DP8075596213</div><div>Overview</div><div>This company is a mature product shop offering nuanced, complex work. You will not be in a silo as you will get to work on many parts of the product on different projects. They are proud of the environment they have created – a quiet, calm office in a team that seldom does more than 40 hours per week. The matrix organizational structure offers variety as you work on various project teams of 3-5 people.</div><div><br></div><div>Initially, you will focus on redeveloping all of the UIs (using JavaScript, Angular and TypeScript). In future projects you will work on the full stack for new feature development, enhancements and maintenance. As a senior, you will provide technical leadership to the team and if you have an interest in moving into people leadership, there are opportunities for that.</div><div><br></div><div>You are a seasoned software engineer with a genuine interest in technology. You like to understand how things work and you will look into how tools work out of curiosity. You can’t imagine developing without unit testing even though you partner with the QA team to ensure a quality product. Ideally, you are an experienced full stack developer but if you are a Front End Developer open to becoming a full stack expert, you will have the opportunity to learn the backend in this role.</div><div><br></div><div>What you need to have:</div><div>•Expertise in JavaScript and frameworks like Angular</div><div>•A track record of completed enterprise software development projects</div><div>•An innate curiosity about how things work outside of your role focus</div><div>•Experience with some of the following: Java, REST, Spring, Hibernate</div><div><br></div><div>Please note: Candidates need to be authorized to work in Canada and available for interviews in Vancouver. If you are in the process of relocating to Vancouver, please include further information on that when you apply.</div><div><br></div><div>For information about TEEMA Solutions Group and to consider other career opportunities, please visit our website at www.teemagroup.com</div><div><br></div>
Title: Senior Full Stack Developer - Java & JavaScript

Job_Description: Job Title: QA Automation Test Developer <br/><br/> Company Profile Brokerage is a global financial services firm and a market leader in investment banking, securities, investment management and wealth management services. With offices in more than 43 countries, the people of Brokerage are dedicated to providing our clients the finest thinking, products and services to help them achieve even the most challenging goals. As a market leader, the talent and passion of our people is critical to our success. We embrace integrity, excellence, team work and giving back. <br/><br/> QA Tools Automation Group <br/><br/> The QA Tools automation group is looking for a developer to build, enhance and maintain tools and test harnesses for various middleware and non-GUI backend systems while having a high focus on reuse and efficiency. A successful candidate should have a broad knowledge of IT technologies and have a desire and capability to work on several issues simultaneously. <br/> The role will also require you to work closely with the tools team and our internal clients, thus a successful candidate will also take part in all stages of software delivery, from requirements gathering to testing. The candidate should be comfortable solving problems independently and integrating backend automation solutions with the toolkit. The candidate will work closely with development teams to address known gaps in the SDLC process and recommend a comprehensive delivery program that lowers the time to market and delivery risk and improves the overall quality in an Agile development environment. Strong interpersonal and communication skills are a must. <br/><br/> <strong>Responsibilities</strong> <br/> Automation requirements gathering/analysis Backend tools & harness development <br/> Troubleshooting/support Documentation <br/><br/> Technical Skills Required   <ul> <li>Excellent problem solving skills</li> <li>Back-end messaging knowledge (Soap/XML/JSON/MQ)</li> <li>Good Object-Oriented development skills (Java/Scala)</li> <li>Good understanding of DB technology such as RDBMS, SQL, MongoDBStrong</li> <li>Linux/Unix skills & shell scripting</li> <li>A desire to learn and integrate new technologies</li> <li>Experience with source control and continuous integration tooling such as Git/Stash/JIRA/Jenkins</li> <li>Good time management abilities; the candidate should be able to deal with several customer issues simultaneously</li> <li>Good written and oral communication skills (English)</li> </ul>  <strong>Skills Desired:</strong>   <ul> <li>Has 2 to 5 years of experience in QA</li> <li>Has experience with Client Quality Center, know how to use release/requirement/test plan/test lab and defect module</li> <li>Understand different testing cycle, unit, system, regression and performance</li> <li>Independent problem solving skills</li> <li>Automation skills and other testing tools: QTP, TestComplete, Selenium is plus</li> </ul>
Title: QA Automation Test Developer

Job_Description: Full Stack Developers<br/>   <div>Location Ottawa, ON</div> <div>Start Date June 4, 2018</div> <div>Security Clearance Reliability Status</div> <div>Duration 2+ years</div> <div>Date Posted May 15, 2018</div> <div>Job ID 10585</div>  <br/>  <div>Maplesoft Group is currently seeking (2) Full Stack Developers to join one of our clients located in Gatineau for a project role. <br/><br/> The project requires that the resources use the Agile approach for creation and modification of application software that defines development sprint and specifies the activities, products, verification procedures and completion criteria for each sprint of both new and existing application software. <br/><br/> Tasks include but are not limited to the following: <br/><br/> - Implement WEB Experience Toolkit (WET) guidelines into existing public facing web application;   <ul> <li>Write Java code based applications using Spring framework;</li> <li>Develop Java based applications that interact with an Oracle or PostGres backend;</li> <li>Troubleshoot applications;</li> <li>Document issues and solutions when arise;</li> <li>Develop and execute unit and Integration testing;</li> <li>Write and maintain user interfaces and reports;</li> <li>Develop, test and implement web services that will be reused by other systems;</li> <li>Build and deploy applications;</li> <li>Review application and program design to ensure adherence to the corporate standards and to recommend performance improvements;</li> <li>Participate in all the Agile SDLC activities such as scrum meetings, planning sessions to discuss the business and the systems requirements;</li> <li>Update user documentation such as Sprint backlog and other artifacts as determined by the Project Authority;</li> <li>Implement Data Access layers;</li> <li>Write and tune SQL and PL/SQL code;</li> <li>Translate business requirements into functional specifications and detailed design;</li> <li>Test the functionality code;</li> <li>Arrange and document code review sessions;</li> <li>Assist, mentor and support other programmer / analysts through Object Oriented (OO) analysis, design and construction; and</li> <li>Provide technical expertise on a one on one or within a group meeting or as determined by the Project Authority.</li> </ul>  Technologies involved include, but are not limited to the following: <br/><br/> - Oracle database ver 11.1 and above;   <ul> <li>PostGres;</li> <li>Java JEE 1.8;</li> <li>GIT, Maven;</li> <li>Rabit MQ, Weblogic 12.1.3, JSP, XML, XSL, YML, JSON, ltext, Sprint data REST web services, JNDI, Log4J/logback, springboot, spring MVC and hibernate/JPA;</li> <li>Microsoft PowerPoint, Visio, Word, Excel, Internet Explorer, Windows 7 and 10; and</li> <li>Thymeleaf framework. <br/><br/> The ideal candidates will have experience in the following: <br/><br/> - Minimum of one (1) year experience developing web services applications in Service- Oriented Architecture (SOA) environment.</li> <li>Minimum of one (1) year experience working with Structured Query Language (SQL).</li> <li>Minimum of one (1) year experience developing Java applications using Hibernate.</li> <li>Minimum of one (1) year experience developing of secure web application using Spring security.</li> <li>Minimum of one (1) year experience working with the Web applications using JQuery.</li> <li>Minimum of one (1) year experience building Java applications using MAVEN.</li> <li>Minimum of one (1) year experience developing Web applications using HTML 5.0.</li> <li>Minimum of one (1) year experience applying the Government of Canada (GoC) Web Experience Toolkit (WET) to develop Web application. <br/><br/> Maplesoft Group prides itself on its distinct corporate culture and recognizes that success is a direct reflection of our most valuable asset - our people. Therefore, attitude and ambition are key personality traits we seek out, along with skill and aptitude, in potential employees. <br/><br/> We thank you for your interest in Maplesoft Group and wish to advise that only candidates under consideration will be contacted.</div></li>  <br/> </ul>  <strong><div> Contact Recruiter:</strong> <br/> kelly.graham@maplesoftgroup.com</div>  <br/>
