Title: Java Developer

Job_Description: Core Experience is focused on making TripAdvisor a habit for our travelers. Helping the people who come to TripAdvisor find and become part of a community of travelers with similar interests. The team focuses on growing membership as well as bringing travelers a personalized travel journey. Here are some examples of what you could work on:  <ul> <li>Building and maintaining scalable platforms that TripAdvisor uses for content search, recommendations, and streaming data across applications.</li> <li>Sifting through millions of Points of Interest and hundreds of millions of reviews to find the most relevant information to surface.</li> </ul> <strong>What you will do</strong>  <ul> <li>Write codeit's a developer role, after all.</li> <li>Work with you team, as well as other groups like product management, design, plus others, to bring your projects to fruition.</li> <li>Touch whatever level of code required in order to complete your project.</li> <li>Be creative and pragmatic when solving the problem you are working on.</li> <li>Be a mentor for others on the team.</li> <li>Move quick. We have a weekly release so build it and ship it!</li> </ul> <strong>What you will bring to the team</strong>  <ul> <li>A want to learn</li> <li>An open mind</li> <li>The desire to move quick</li> <li>5+ years of experience as a Software Developer.</li> <li>The understanding that done is often a better option for us than perfection.</li> </ul> Our tech stack is primarily Java based. You will be provided with both a Mac laptop and a Linux dev server for your daily work environment. Our storage engine is PostgreSQL, our backends are all moving to micro-services, and our web front ends are currently Dust though we're in the process of moving to React and web components. With the number of consumers who use TripAdvisor on a daily basis, you can imagine that our big data is exactly that, and so your job will have you working with Hadoop (Hive, Spark, M/R) and RedShift. We make liberal use of ML here, so you will have the chance to support, or take part in, significant optimization projects. <br/><br/> TripAdvisor, the world's largest travel site**, enables travelers to unleash the full potential of every trip. With over 570 million reviews and opinions covering the world's largest selection of travel listings worldwide -- covering 7.3 million accommodations, airlines, attractions, and restaurants -- TripAdvisor provides travelers with the wisdom of the crowds to help them decide where to stay, how to fly, what to do and where to eat. TripAdvisor also compares prices from more than 200 hotel booking sites so travelers can find the lowest price on the hotel that's right for them. TripAdvisor-branded sites are available in 49 markets, and are home to the world's largest travel community of 455 million average monthly unique visitors*, all looking to get the most out of every trip. TripAdvisor: Know better. Book better. Go better. <br/><br/> *LI-MS1
Title: Software Developer - Core Experience

Job_Description: Morgan Stanley is a global financial services firm and a market leader in investment banking, securities, investment management and wealth management services. With offices in more than 43 countries, the people of Morgan Stanley are dedicated to providing our clients the finest thinking, products and services to help them achieve even the most challenging goals. <br/><br/> As a market leader, the talent and passion of our people is critical to our success. We embrace integrity, excellence, team work and giving back. <br/><br/> The Technology division partners with our business units and leading technology companies to redefine how we do business in ever more global and dynamic financial markets. <br/><br/> Our sizeable investment in technology results in leading-edge tools, software, and systems. Our insights, applications, and infrastructure give a competitive edge to clients’ businesses—and to our own. <br/><br/> Institutional Securities Technology (IST) develops and oversees the overall technology strategy and bespoke technology solutions to drive and enable the Institutional businesses and enterprise-wide functions. Our clients include Fixed Income, Equities, Commodities, Investment Banking, Research and Global Capital Markets as well as Operations, HR and Corporate Services. <br/><br/> Position Description <br/><br/> We are currently looking for committed developers into a smaller team that is working on the backend part of a new pricing component that is in the early phase of a multi-year delivery. Our goal is to enable business expansion and to meet regulatory demands. This component if part of our new Risk Calculation Environment which is built on a Scala based platform (codenamed Rice and Optimus) that is able to run heavy calculations in a distributed, highly parallel environment. <br/><br/> Primary Responsibilities <br/><br/> • Gathering and clarifying requirements; collaborating with managers and lead engineers of the IRD team, broader technology partners in the Technology Division and business unit partners in order to understand technical and business requirements that will drive solutions.   <ul> <li>Delivering new features/components from design to integration to the wider system and enhancement and necessary re-factor of existing one</li> <li>Perform testing of the new features, supporting production deployment and post production activities</li> <li>Building strong relationships with business unit partners and the global IRD and Rice team <br/><br/> Skills Required <br/><br/> • At least 3 years of relevant experience</li> <li>Strong knowledge of Object Oriented Programming principles</li> <li>Strong analytical and problem solving skills</li> <li>Interest in functional programming, desire to specialize in Scala</li> <li>Desire to learn and use different technologies to overcome complex problems in financial modelling</li> <li>Good communication skills in English <br/><br/> Skills Desired <br/><br/> • Solid knowledge of Java (1.5 )</li> <li>Experience in C development</li> <li>Knowledge of Scala (2.10 )</li> <li>Hands-on experience in functional programming</li> <li>Interest in learning about various financial products <br/><br/> Knowledge of French and English are required. <br/><br/> Morgan Stanley is an equal opportunities employer. We work to provide a supportive and inclusive environment where all individuals can maximize their full potential.<br/><br/></li> </ul>
Title: Java/scala application developer

Job_Description: Are you looking for unlimited opportunities to develop and <br/> succeed? With work that challenges and makes a difference and a flexible <br/> and supportive environment, we can help our customers achieve their dreams and <br/> aspirations. <br/><br/> <strong>Delivery Practices and Quality Assurance</strong> is an organization <br/> that leads the design and execution of technology services shared <br/> divisionally. Quality Assurance Services (QAS) provides testing services <br/> to Canadian Division Technology (CDT) systems and applications. <br/><br/> QAS is looking for someone who is self-directed, motivated, <br/> critical thinking and collaborative. As an <strong>Intermediate Test Automation <br/> Developer</strong> you contribute to accelerating product delivery through automation of <br/> repeatable test scripts during product development. On a daily basis, you will work <br/> very closely with developers, testers and DevOps staff to integrate tests into <br/> Continuous Integration pipelines. As a team member you contribute to the <br/> success of your team to improve QA approach by using modern automation and <br/> DevOps tools.<br/>  <div><strong>As an Intermediate Test Automation Developer, you will:</strong></div>  <ul> <li>Collaborate with Developers, Testers, peer Test Developers <br/> and Continuous Integration Leads to build the automated tests and configure <br/> them to execute in a deployment platform using tools such as Selenium with Java <br/> and Maven packages, HP UFT, various web service test tools, Jira, Jenkins, <br/> Gitlab, Docker, HP ALM, Robot, DevTest and TestNG</li><li>Create and maintain a reusable set of automated tests: Unit, <br/> Integrated, Performance, and functional tests with QA and business experts</li><li>Identification and creation of <br/> reusable test data, particularly for automated testing</li><li>Manage test requests, estimating time needed and working <br/> with other team members to set priorities following risk based testing approach</li><li>Assist team in maintenance and enhancements of Software <br/> Architecture and Infrastructure</li><li>Participate in test strategy, test estimation and planning <br/> discussions</li><li>Communicate test results and highlight any potential quality <br/> risks</li><li>Train and guide other QA team members on tools and test <br/> automation</li><li>Responsible for finding, isolating, documenting, tracking, <br/> and regressing defects through the QA process utilizing a bug tracking tool <br/> effectively</li><li>Provide ideas on efficient code functions (preferably <br/> reusable) in UFT and Selenium</li><li>Troubleshoot common UFT, Robot, DevTest and Selenium script <br/> execution issues</li><li>Build and maintain relationships within the business unit <br/> and QA Services, including Global Resources</li><li>Collaborate with geographically and culturally diverse <br/> cross-functional teams</li><li>Depending on current assignment, up to 50" manual testing <br/> may be required</li> </ul> <strong>You will bring and continuously build upon the following <br/> knowledge & skills:</strong> <ul> <li>3 years of experience in testing software and maintaining <br/> test automation</li><li>Experience within a Financial and/or Insurance Company <br/> and/or Financial systems is an asset</li><li>Knowledge of UFT, Robot and Selenium</li><li>Knowledge of Mobile <br/> testing will be an asset</li><li>Knowledge of web service testing tools such as SoapUI and <br/> Postman</li><li>Knowledge of API and web service testing tools such as <br/> SoapUI, DevTest and Postman</li><li>Knowledge of QA tools, methodology and process</li><li>Knowledge and Experience with DevOps, Agile, Scrum, Kanban, <br/> Continuous Integration and Continuous Deployment is an asset</li><li>Have hands-on experience with cloud based technologies</li><li>Have hands-on experience building and/or testing backend <br/> systems</li><li>CSTE, CSQA certifications is an asset</li><li>Experience of source control systems and configuration <br/> management is an asset</li><li>Experience building automated test <br/> scripts in parallel of development efforts in an Agile environment is an asset</li><li>Ability to work both independently and on a wide variety of <br/> teams</li><li>Self-motivated, organized, detail-oriented, proactive, and <br/> collaborative</li><li>Ability to influence and negotiate with others to meet <br/> project deadlines without compromising quality</li><li>Strong communication and interpersonal skills</li><li>Ability to identify productivity and efficiency improvements</li><li>Proven ability to quickly and easily adapt to change</li><li>Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or equivalent work <br/> experience</li> </ul> <strong>Last year Manulife / John Hancock spent $1.4 billion <br/> on technology. You may be working with:</strong> <ul> <li>Test Automation Tools:  <br/> Selenium, ROBOT, Micro Focus UFT, DevTest, SoapUI, Postman</li><li>Programming Language:  <br/> Java, Java script, VB script, Python, C#</li><li>Test Management Tools:  <br/> Micro Focus ALM, Jira</li><li>DevOps Toolkit : Jenkins, Docker, Git, GitLab</li><li>Office 365: One <br/> Drive, Skype for Business, Sharepoint, Yammer, Confluence</li> </ul> Want to learn more? Apply today; we are eager to speak <br/> with you!<br/>  <div><strong>About Manulife</strong></div><br/>  <div>Manulife Financial Corporation is a leading international <br/> financial services group that helps people make their decisions easier and <br/> lives better. We operate primarily as John Hancock in the United States and <br/> Manulife elsewhere. We provide financial advice, insurance, as well as wealth <br/> and asset management solutions for individuals, groups and institutions. At the <br/> end of 2017, we had about 35,000 employees, 73,000 agents, and thousands of <br/> distribution partners, serving more than 26 million customers. As of March 31, <br/> 2018, we had over $1.1 trillion (US$850 billion) in assets under management and <br/> administration, and in the previous 12 months we made $26.9 billion in payments <br/> to our customers. Our principal operations are in Asia, Canada and the United <br/> States where we have served customers for more than 100 years. With our global <br/> headquarters in Toronto, Canada, we trade as 'MFC' on the Toronto, New York, <br/> and the Philippine stock exchanges and under '945' in Hong Kong.</div>
Title: Intermediate Test Automation Developer

Job_Description: <div><div>Our success engineering team is responsible for addressing reported defects, preventing future defects through preventative maintenance, and delivering enhanced functionality through change requests. As a Senior Software Developer in Success Engineering you’ll be responsible for overseeing and contributing to the continued success of our strategic customer’s Tulip implementation.</div> <br/> <div><strong>Who you are:</strong> </div><div>The ideal candidate for this position will be a reliable and adept programmer who is eager to break down large technical problems and solve them directly and through active mentorship of other team members.</div><br/> <div><strong>We believe:</strong> </div><div>When you join Tulip, you’ll be part of a fast-growing group of people who come from different backgrounds, countries, and experience. We believe in investing in our people, building positive relationships with our customers, and treating our work like craft. We prioritize diversity, inclusion and building a community, and we stay humble and hungry.</div><br/> <div><div>What you'll do:</strong>  <ul>   <ul> <li>Diagnose and resolve complex issues throughout the entire portfolio of products utilized by our strategic customers including but not limited to data transformations, third party service integrations, and front and backend technologies</li><li>Scope and Deliver enhanced functionality through change requests</li><li>Drive how we manage and maintain implemented solutions within a highly collaborative department</li><li>Aid in the development of junior software developers’ career growth through mentorship</li><li>Champion product and architectural improvements for future releases</li></ul> </ul>  </div> <br/> <div><div>What you have:</strong>  <ul>   <ul> <li>Degree in Computer Science or Computer Engineering, or equivalent experience</li><li>5+ Experience with common web technologies, such as: PHP, MySQL, Nginx, Redis, Python</li><li>5+ Experience delivering SaaS solutions</li><li>Experience building and shipping iOS applications is a plus</li></ul> </ul>  </div> <br/> <div><div>We Offer:</strong>  <ul>   <ul> <li>An environment passionate about growth and learning</li><li>Flexible hours for our early risers and night owls</li><li>Medical and Dental Insurance</li> <li>Paid parental leavePaid sick days</li><li>15 days of paid vacation</li><li>Corporate gym rate</li><li>Weekly team lunches with halal and vegetarian options</li><li>Healthy (and less healthy) snacks and gourmet espresso</li><li>Breathtaking Toronto office on the waterfront and close to Union station</li><li>Creative community space in our Communitech home in Kitchener</li></ul> </ul>  </div> </div><div><div><strong>What we do:</strong></div><div>Tulip Retail is the first mobile platform built exclusively for store associates. Leading retailers like Saks Fifth Avenue, Coach, and Chanel believe in enabling the next generation of store associates with mobile technology using Tulip. We’re a team of experts who have worked with and for retailers over the past 20 years and are driven to build a company whose mission is to enable one of the world’s largest job markets. By placing Tulip-enabled iPads into the hands of associates, our goal is to provide them with instant and reliable access to product information, while also being able to transact, communicate, and collaborate in an omnichannel world.</div><br/> <div>We encourage applications from candidates of colour, women, queer candidates, candidates with family caregiving responsibilities, immigrant candidates, transgender candidates, and candidates with disabilities.</div><br/> <div>Feel like you can’t tick all the boxes above? If you have some of the skills and experience that we’re looking for and are willing to use your talent to learn the rest, we encourage you to apply.</div> </div></div></div></div>
Title: Senior Software Developer - Customer Success

Job_Description: To meet the growing needs of our clients based in Canada we are looking for a "Backend Java Developer". <br/><br/> Who are we looking for ? <br/><br/> You are responsible for Java EE application development from concept and design to testing. You perform hands-on coding. <br/> You update, repair, modify and expand existing Java and/or SOA-based application. <br/> You perform coding to written technical specifications, investigate, analyze and document reported defects. <br/> You are able to code software according to published standards and design guidelines. <br/> You have advanced knowledge in Java programming language, object-relational mapping framework (Open JPA, Hibernate, etc.), web service technologies (XML, XSD, etc.), database architecture and design, SQL programming (DB2, Oracle, SQL Server). <br/> You are curious and proactive with a strong collaborative mind. You are able to communicate with both a technical and non-technical audiences. <br/> You have a strong Object Oriented Java design and development work experience within bank, insurance, telco, retail... or corporate (internship included) environments. <br/> You have at least a Bachelor's or Master's Degree in IT or 5 years' equivalent experience. <br/> You are fluent in French + English. <br/> You work well under pressure with the ability to priorities urgent tasks. <br/><br/> Why should you join us ? <br/><br/> Strong corporate values and culture: Discussions, Attention, Dynamism and Expertise. <br/> A polyvalent and passionate team only dedicated to this expertise. <br/> Our result? A close and customized support. <br/> Projects, events and workshops dedicated throughout the year, a source of exchanges, career opportunities and also training (Agility, Lean Management...) <br/> An attractive and evolving salary package. <br/> Missions with a strong added value within prestigious clients. <br/> An access to our large knowledge database and to our training center. <br/> A support of our experts ... that will help you to become an expert on you own and to continue to grow with us.

Job_Description: <div><div><div>...</strong></div> </li>  </ul>   </div> </div> <br/><strong>Date:</strong>  <br/>  May 2, 2018 <br/><br/> <strong>Location:</strong> <br/>  Brampton, ON, CA, L6T 0C1<br/> <div>At Rogers we’re for supporting you on a journey to a rewarding career. Whether you’re a developer, an analyst, or a customer care consultant, Rogers is the place where ideas become reality. We embrace change, and find ways to do better. And we deliver on that commitment by fostering an environment of passion and innovation for all people. <br/><br/> <strong>Who we are</strong> <br/><br/> We are Rogers, a dynamic Canadian media and telecommunications company. Innovation is our legacy and building a brilliant digital future is our mission. As a leading Canadian company we are passionate about winning and committed to pursuing the best. This translates into everything we do, including the selection of a candidate. This role will be primarily based in Brampton but may expand to the downtown office. <br/><br/> Web Service Experts at Rogers are passionate about coding. You can tell just by looking at their output. They do most of their programming in Java using the Play/Akka framework but are always ready and willing to diversify their portfolio. <br/><br/> <strong>What we want you to do</strong> <br/><br/> We are looking for a Web Service Expert who will be a critical member of a new, forward-thinking, Digital IT team. Think server-side development, with a keen eye on software craftsmanship and scalable architecture. You will develop robust web services to support a diverse range of common functions including (but definitely not limited to): User signup and registration services, web site administration, entitlement checking, making payments, resetting cable boxes and allocating data between wireless accounts. <br/><br/> <strong>The nuts and bolts</strong>  <ul>  	<li>Write reliable and robust code – bonus points if you know how to use TDD – that uses both non-relational and relational databases</li> <li>Make bullet-proof code and implement proper logging, monitoring and manageability</li> <li>Create lightning-fast web services</li> <li>Solve DevOps problems with our infrastructure team</li> <li>Build systems that manage our deployment pipeline, using tools like Bamboo and Ansible</li> </ul> <strong>Who you are</strong>  <ul>  	<li>You are a university graduate with a degree in computer science, computer engineering or a related field</li> <li>You and programming go way back, we’re talking more than five years of experience using core Java</li> <li>Experience with REST API’s</li> <li>You truly love to code and can’t wait to show us what you’ve worked on</li> <li>You have more than five years of experience writing code that uses SQL and relational databases<br/><br/>Following are the key skills and years of experience for the ideal candidate for Java Backend dev: <br/><br/> 1. Java (5+) <br/><br/> 2. Advance Java concepts (3+) <br/><br/> 3. Design pattern and best practices (3+) <br/><br/> 4. SOA (Rest Exp) 3+ <br/><br/> 5. Microservice (1+) <br/><br/> 6. Spring Framework (3+) <br/><br/> 7. NoSQL (2+) <br/><br/> Nice to have <br/><br/> 1. Java 8 <br/><br/> 2. Akka <br/><br/> 3. Any reactive framework <br/><br/> 4. Cassandra <br/><br/> 5. Kafka <br/><br/> 6. Scala</li>  </ul>  <div><strong>Schedule:</strong> Full Time</div><br/>  <div><strong>Shift:</strong> Day</div><br/>  <div><strong>Length of Contract:</strong> Not Applicable (Regular Position)</div><br/>  <div><strong>Work Location:</strong> 8200 Dixie Road (101), Brampton, ON</div><br/>  <div><strong>Travel Requirements:</strong> Up to 10%</div><br/>  <div><strong>Posting Category/Function:</strong> Technology & Information Technology</div><br/>  <div><strong>Requisition ID:</strong> 121240</div><br/>  <div><strong>WHY ROGERS?</strong></div><br/>  <div>As a proud Canadian company, we're dedicated to making things easier for our customers. We’ve been embracing and leading change for over 50-years, and we’ll continue to seek out new opportunities to bring our customers simple solutions for today and tomorrow.</div><br/>  <div><strong>We recognize that success is determined by the strength and diversity of our people. We work together because we want to win together, and these five shared values guide and define our work:</strong></div> <ul>  	<li>Simplify and innovate</li> <li>Take ownership of the what and the how</li> <li>Equip people to succeed</li> <li>Execute with discipline and pride</li> <li>Talk straight, build trust, and over deliver</li> </ul>  <div>Why Rogers? Because your tomorrow inspires our today.</div><br/>  <div>What makes us different makes us stronger. Rogers has a strong commitment to diversity and inclusion. Everyone who applies for a job will be considered.</div><br/>  <div>We recognize the business value in creating a workplace where each team member has the tools to reach their full potential. At Rogers, we value the insights and innovation that diverse teams bring to work. We work with our candidates with disabilities throughout the recruitment process to ensure that they have what they need to be at their best. Please reach out to our recruiters and hiring managers to begin a conversation about how we can ensure that you deliver your best work. You can also reach out to our team at RogersRecruiting@rci.rogers.com to begin a conversation about your individual accessibility needs throughout the hiring process.</div><br/>  <div>Posting Notes: Information Technology & Engineering || Canada (CA) || ON || Brampton || SF:LI-KM1 ||</div></div>  <br/>
Title: Digital Java Developer

Job_Description: <strong>About TELoIP</strong> <br/><br/> TELoIP is on a mission to simplify cloud access with Software Defined Networking (SDN) solutions. One of the most significant shifts in the industry is occurring right now. Its anticipated that worldwide SD-WAN revenues will exceed $6 billion in 2020. We go up against the big names and come out on the winning side. For over 15 years weve been a competitive choice providing leading-edge products and outstanding client service to an impressive list of clients. From LEGO to the LCBO; from Five Guys to Abercrombie & Fitch. Our VINO SD-WAN-as-a-service is a solution proven to increase speed, reliability and performance of existing hardware, connectivity and cloud services. <br/><br/> Our teams make us great by creating, supporting and selling our products. Products that are disrupting the SDN market. By joining us now, you could be a part of the disruption, the creativity and the momentum. In a world where technology changes every minute; new and never-been-done-before continues to be a rarity. This is your chance to capture that opportunity. <br/><br/> <strong>We need a Full Stack Developer to join the team.</strong> This is a newly created role for someone who has a passion for using cutting-edge tools to build new features and web portal functions for our product set. Its a chance to build out our offerings, collaborate with the team and contribute to the roadmap. Whether you are 1 of 100 at a big network company or 1 of 3 at a small startup, this is your opportunity to stand out as the second Full Stack Developer on our R&D team. <br/><br/> <strong>Whats in it for you?</strong> <br/><br/> <em>The chance to make an impact.</em> We are building new solutions, expanding our reach and growing our teams. You want to be associated with a product or a market that delivers high standards on quality and make a tangible contribution as we further promote our reputation as an enterprise grade provider of the network services. <br/><br/> <em>Access to knowledge.</em> At TELoIP we are putting a new emphasis on information sharing. From documentation to training, its all coming together to create a new culture of synchronicity. You want to be active and part of a team that is an active player of the market, lucrative, growing industry. <br/><br/> <em>Freedom to make decisions</em>. You will design and develop new features using tools from an open source library with the freedom to research and try new things. <br/><br/> <em>Immediate career growth</em>. This is a chance to grow your career and gain exposure as you join us during this period of transformation. <br/><br/> <strong>So, how do we know thats you? You have:</strong>  <ul> <li><em>The education.</em> You have a degree or diploma in Computer Science, Computer Engineering or a related field.</li> <li><em>The experience</em>. You have 3+years as a Front and Backend Developer building REST services with ServiceStack, WebAPI, NancyFx or similar framework using C#. You have familiarity with Bootstrap/Jquery/Knockout frameworks and building Single Page Applications using HTML5/JS. You have experience with BigQuery data store service or other big data stores.</li> <li><em>The technical knowledge.</em> You understand MVC (Model/View/Controller) Design patterns; web standards and web technologies including front-end design and working knowledge of back-end development.You have a strong understanding of object-oriented programming. You are comfortable working with Git.</li> </ul> <strong>More about us</strong> <br/><br/> At TELoIP, we are growing, innovating and putting it all out there. That includes the not-so-good as well as the awesome. A couple of things you should know about us, that we are actively working on: <br/><br/> <em>We are refocused.</em> We are aggressively pursuing a position at the top of the industry. With the right people joining, new leadership at the helm and products that solve networking and cloud computing problems for big businesses, the future is positive. <br/><br/> <em>We have a solid reputation.</em> We have an impressive and growing client list. We know that in order to continue to grow and succeed we need to bring on board intelligent, team players. <br/><br/> <em>We are rebuilding our culture</em>. We want your input on what we need to do to become an employer-of-choice. Things that will help get us there? A candidate-first recruitment and onboarding experience; open-door managers; excellent benefits and career building opportunities. <br/><br/> <em>Were like a startup, but better.</em> We have wiped down the white boards and rearranged the desks. We are set up to do whatever it takes, to make decisions that allow us to move quickly, be agile, listen to our customers - and our teams. <br/><br/> <strong>Like what youve learned about us and the role?</strong> Express your interest here or follow us on Twitter or LinkedIn to learn more about us. <br/><br/> TELoIP welcomes and encourages applications from people with disabilities. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process.
Title: Full Stack Developer

Job_Description: Are you looking for unlimited opportunities to develop and succeed? With work that challenges and makes a difference and a flexible and supportive environment, we can help our customers achieve their dreams and aspirations. <br/><br/> <strong>Delivery Practices and Quality Assurance</strong> is an organization that leads the design and execution of technology services shared divisionally. Quality Assurance Services (QAS) provides testing services to Canadian Division Technology (CDT) systems and applications. <br/><br/> QAS is looking for someone who is self-directed, motivated, critical thinking and collaborative. As a<strong> Senior Test Automation Developer</strong> you contribute to accelerating product delivery through automation of repeatable test scripts during product development. On a daily basis, you will work very closely with developers, testers and DevOps staff to integrate tests into Continuous Integration pipelines. As a team member you contribute to the success of your team to improve QA approach by using modern automation and DevOps tools. <br/><br/> <strong>As a Senior Test Automation Developer, you will:</strong> <ul> <li>Collaborate with Developers, Testers, peer Test Developers and Continuous Integration Leads to build the automated tests and configure them to execute in a deployment platform using tools such as Selenium with Java and Maven packages, HP UFT, various web service test tools, Jira, Jenkins, Gitlab, Docker, HP ALM, Robot, DevTest and TestNG</li><li>Create and maintain a reusable set of automated tests: Unit, Integrated, Performance, and functional tests with QA and business experts</li><li>Identification and creation of reusable test data, particularly for automated testing</li><li>Manage test requests, estimating time needed and working with other team members to set priorities following risk based testing approach</li><li>Assist team in maintenance and enhancements of Software Architecture and Infrastructure</li><li>Participate in test strategy, test estimation and planning discussions</li><li>Communicate test results and highlight any potential quality risks</li><li>Train and guide other QA team members on tools and test automation</li><li>Responsible for finding, isolating, documenting, tracking, and regressing defects through the QA process utilizing a bug tracking tool effectively</li><li>Provide ideas on efficient code functions (preferably reusable) in UFT and Selenium</li><li>Troubleshoot common UFT, Robot, DevTest and Selenium script execution issues</li><li>Build and maintain relationships within the business unit and QA Services, including Global Resources</li><li>Collaborate with geographically and culturally diverse cross-functional teams</li><li>Depending on current assignment, some manual testing may be required</li>  </ul> <strong>You will bring and continuously build upon the following knowledge & skills:</strong> <ul> <li>6 years of experience in testing software and maintaining test automation</li><li>Experience within a Financial and/or Insurance Company and/or Financial systems is an asset</li><li>Knowledge of UFT, Robot and Selenium</li><li>Knowledge of Mobile testing will be an asset</li><li>Knowledge of web service testing tools such as SoapUI and Postman</li><li>Knowledge of API and web service testing tools such as SoapUI, DevTest and Postman</li><li>Knowledge of QA tools, methodology and process</li><li>Knowledge and Experience with DevOps, Agile, Scrum, Kanban, Continuous Integration and Continuous Deployment is an asset.</li><li>Have hands-on experience with cloud based technologies</li><li>Have hands-on experience building and/or testing backend systems</li><li>CSTE, CSQA certifications is an asset</li><li>Experience of source control systems and configuration management is an asset</li><li>Experience building automated test scripts in parallel of development efforts in an Agile environment is an asset.</li><li>Ability to work both independently and on a wide variety of teams</li><li>Self-motivated, organized, detail-oriented, proactive, and collaborative</li><li>Ability to influence and negotiate with others to meet project deadlines without compromising quality</li><li>Strong communication and interpersonal skills</li><li>Ability to identify productivity and efficiency improvements</li><li>Proven ability to quickly and easily adapt to change</li><li>Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or equivalent work experience</li> </ul> <strong>Last year Manulife / John Hancock spent $1.4 billion on technology. You may be working with:</strong> <ul> <li>Test Automation Tools: Selenium, ROBOT, Micro Focus UFT, DevTest, SoapUI, Postman</li><li>Programming Language: Java, Java script, VB script, Python, C#</li><li>Test Management Tools: Micro Focus ALM, Jira</li><li>DevOps Toolkit : Jenkins, Docker, Git, GitLab</li><li>Office 365: One Drive, Skype for Business, Sharepoint, Yammer, Confluence</li> </ul>  Want to learn more? Apply today; we are eager to speak with you! <br/><br/> <strong>About Manulife</strong><br/>  <div>Manulife Financial Corporation is a leading international financial services group that helps people make their decisions easier and lives better. We operate primarily as John Hancock in the United States and Manulife elsewhere. We provide financial advice, insurance, as well as wealth and asset management solutions for individuals, groups and institutions. At the end of 2017, we had about 35,000 employees, 73,000 agents, and thousands of distribution partners, serving more than 26 million customers. As of March 31, 2018, we had over $1.1 trillion (US$850 billion) in assets under management and administration, and in the previous 12 months we made $26.9 billion in payments to our customers. Our principal operations are in Asia, Canada and the United States where we have served customers for more than 100 years. With our global headquarters in Toronto, Canada, we trade as 'MFC' on the Toronto, New York, and the Philippine stock exchanges and under '945' in Hong Kong.</div>  <br/>
Title: Senior Test Automation Developer

Job_Description: <DIV><STRONG>ROSS VIDEO THRIVES IN LIVE PRODUCTION, AND WE NEED YOUR HELP</STRONG></DIV><DIV>We have a great group of people working together to create and deliver cutting edge products that look amazing and are easy to use. We go all out so that our customers can have the best possible experience and achieve quality results. With a product focus, continual learning, results driven processes, and creative thinking, we constantly strive to improve our solutions and to deliver results. If you've ever watched live television, news, sports, or entertainment, you've seen our products in use. All of the major Hollywood award shows, most professional sports teams, and many of the largest broadcasters in the world use Ross Video technology. Get behind the scenes and learn about what it takes to make live events possible.</DIV> <DIV>If that resonates, and you’re someone with integrity, intelligence, and a strong drive to deliver great products, we’d love to hear from you.</DIV><DIV><STRONG>WHAT'S IN THE JOB?</STRONG></DIV><DIV>Be part of a cross-functional team that is designing, developing and building distributed, scalable and highly available applications, tools and services that tie together live video production technology across multiple locations. We are building software that will revolutionize the industry by leveraging a move to video over IP, distributed architecture and cloud-based infrastructure.</DIV> <br/> <DIV><strong>Responsibilities:</strong></DIV><ul><LI>Participate in the full software development lifecycle – requirements gathering, scoping, design, implementation, documentation, testing and maintenance</LI> <LI>Write code across the full stack – UI, back end services and database</LI> <LI>Provide design reviews and code reviews for fellow team members promoting high-quality work, sound software methodologies and attention to detail</LI> </ul>  <strong>Basic qualifications:</strong>  <ul> <LI>Backend development experience with a thorough understanding of object oriented software design, data structures, algorithms and databases</LI><LI>Excellent software development skills in an object-oriented language – Java, Scala, Python, Ruby or C++</LI><LI>Experience with JSON, RESTful APIs and HTTP protocols</LI><LI>Knowledge of HTML, CSS, JavaScript along with ability to use browser debug tools</LI><LI>Ability to function in both Windows and Linux environments</LI> </ul>  <strong>Preferred qualifications:</strong>  <ul> <LI>Experience with any of the following Java frameworks and technologies:</LI>  <ul> <LI>Hibernate ORM, Equinox OSGi, Spring, Struts II, Spring Boot, Dropwizard, Jersey, Play</LI> </ul>  <LI>Front end development with any of the following libraries and frameworks:</LI>  <ul> <LI>jQuery, React, Vue.js, Bootstrap, AngularJS</LI> </ul>  <LI>Experience with microservices and distributed, horizontally scalable services</LI>   <ul> <LI>Containers – Docker, Rkt</LI><LI>Container orchestration – Docker Swarm, Apache Mesos, Kubernetes</LI><LI>Configuration management – Puppet, Chef, Ansible, SaltStack</LI><LI>Platform as code –Terraform, Juju Charms</LI><LI>Cloud platforms – AWS, GCP, Azure</LI> </ul>  <LI>Experience with DevOps tools including Elastic Stack, Prometheus, Grafana</LI> </ul>  <DIV><STRONG>WE'RE GROWING FAST</STRONG></DIV><DIV>That means we are always looking for better ways to adapt our work environment and processes to meet the high demands of our customers. Our roles morph, we volunteer for extra tasks, we all care a lot about helping good things happen. If you don't like change, you’re in the wrong place. But if you do, then you can be part of an incredible journey.</DIV><DIV><STRONG>WHY WORK FOR ROSS VIDEO?</STRONG></DIV><DIV>Because we can help you flourish. You will get to develop and deliver cutting edge technological solutions for the entertainment industry. You will be part of the Ross Video team working together to make that happen, and we find that a pretty energizing environment to be a part of.</DIV><DIV>We value our people and listen to their feedback. We also offer great perks, flexible hours, free coffee and soft drinks (and a commercial espresso machine for when you need that extra jolt), team building events, BBQ's, and other fun activities. You'll also get to work on real-world projects that have a meaningful impact to our customers and are in use all over the world, every day.</DIV><DIV><STRONG>LOCATION</STRONG></DIV><DIV>Ottawa, Canada. It's the Nation’s Capital with the longest skating rink (the Rideau Canal) in the winter, waterways in the summer, and hills for skiing and hiking 30 minutes from the office. Ottawa posts vibrant urban neighbourhoods, as well as numerous recreational possibilities.</DIV><DIV><STRONG>IN A NUTSHELL</STRONG></DIV><DIV>Do you have integrity, intelligence, and a drive to get results? Then Ross is the place for you, and we'd like to hear from you.</DIV><DIV>Even if we are not presently listing a suitable position, you should still get in touch. We love hearing from game changers with a growth mindset.</DIV><DIV><STRONG>FURTHER DETAILS</STRONG></DIV><DIV>Make sure you understand what Ross Video is about, and then click on "Apply Now" below. Be sure to include a bit about you and your interests.</DIV>
Title: Software Developer - Enterprise

Job_Description: The platform development team at PayByPhone is looking for a new Senior Software Developer. <br/><br/> You have improved practices and brought new ideas and techniques to the development table, you've led the design and development of key business deliverables, you have mentored your team members to help hone their coding skills, and you are now looking for a new technology market leader to call home. <br/><br/> In this role, you will design and develop major components of the backend APIs that power our consumer apps. We nurture teamwork among our domain experts and prosper in an agile development environment with multiple production deployments per day. You take pride and ownership of the quality work you and your team create, you are inquisitive and enjoy solving challenging technical problems <br/><br/> <strong>You will:</strong>  <ul> <li>Leave your fingerprints on the design of products, architect our infrastructure, and improve technical documentation</li> <li>You are a go-to technical expert for other people in the organization, articulating technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders</li> <li>Write code and mentor teammates as they test-drive code for new features and bugfixes</li> <li>Work with your team to design and develop automated test suites, refine acceptance criteria, and establish test plans</li> <li>Participate in code reviews to share expertise with the team, ensure code quality, and verify PCI compliance</li> <li>Use and improve our automated CI/CD pipeline</li>   <li>Provision and maintain cloud infrastructure for your teams products</li> <li>Monitor the success of your teams products through application and system metrics</li> <li>Have full ownership of the systems you and your team develop. This includes monitoring, investigating issues, and supporting the service during outages</li> <li>Track time according to company policy</li> </ul> <strong>You have:</strong>  <ul> <li>5+ years experience designing, developing, and maintaining scalable production software that stands up to real-world users and production conditions</li> <li>An excellent understanding of software engineering techniques</li> <li>Expert-level ability to code in languages such as C#, Java, Node.JS, Go, Python, or Ruby</li> <li>Worked in an agile development environment using processes like Kanban or Scrum</li> <li>Experience mentoring junior and intermediate developers</li> <li>Experience with TDD/BDD practices</li> </ul> <strong>It would be nice if you had:</strong>  <ul> <li>Experience with cloud platforms like AWS/Azure</li> <li>Experience with service-oriented or microservices architecture</li> </ul> <strong>Working For PayByPhone</strong> <br/><br/> PayByPhone values collaboration, innovation, learning, and fun.  <ul> <li>We encourage each other to try out new ideas and adopt the ones that work.</li> <li>We are culturally diverse.</li> <li>We deeply value supporting a flexible work/life balance.</li> <li>We invest in professional growth. We attend conferences such as AWS re:Invent, ng-conf, .NET Fringe, HashiConf, and more!</li> <li>We have company-sponsored social events and are well-represented in local events, such as the Sun Run and Bike to Work weeks.</li> </ul>  <strong>About PayByPhone</strong><br/><br/>PayByPhone is one of the fastest-growing mobile payment companies in the world. We process over 70 million parking, transit, and bike-share transactions a year in cities across North America, Europe and Australia. PayByPhone helps millions of consumers easily and securely pay for parking and transportation without the hassles of waiting in line, carrying change, or risking costly fines. <br/><br/> Cities such as San Francisco, Seattle, Miami, Vancouver, London, and Paris have entrusted PayByPhone with driving their parking operations forward, through unrivaled uptime and reliability, 24/7/365 customer support, seamless integrations, and deep data insights. With our recent acquisition by Volkswagen Financial Services, part of the largest auto manufacturing group in the world, PayByPhone has access to unmatched marketing resources, funding, and drivers. <br/><br/> By helping transportation agencies and parking operators tap into the latest advancements in secure mobile payment, data analysis, and location technologies, PayByPhone reduces costs while increasing revenue. To learn more, visit www.paybyphone.com or download our app for iOS or Android.
Title: Senior Software Developer

Job_Description: <div><div>In the role of Developer you’ll help create and build beautiful software that matters using modern JavaScript and software development best practices (Agile, TDD, Continuous Delivery). As a developer for Rangle.io, you’ll be joining a diverse community of people who are passionate about modern JavaScript and its ability to change the world. You’ll get to work on a wide range of projects, using the latest JS frameworks building for the web & mobile, working with a tight knit team of talented individuals.</div><br/> <div>YOUR IMPACT</div>  <li>Opportunity to work with one of the most exciting modern JavaScript software companies in the world.</li> <li>Play a big part in the success of Rangle.io. We’re helping shape the Tech scene in Toronto and modern web and mobile development across the world.</li>  <br/> <div>YOUR GROWTH</div>  <li>We have built a strong community that supports and encourages learning and continuous improvement. We’re highly active in the tech community: in Toronto and globally. We run several of the most popular tech meetups in Toronto.</li> <li>We have a variety of programs that help everyone improve, include several initiated by our own staff (ex. Rangle U, Lunch & Learns, Hack Nights). We encourage everyone to attend a conference every year (and we pay for it). Everyone gets a coach/mentor to help you grow in your career. And we also contribute to open source.</li> <li>You’ll be a part of a small impactful team - because we use agile/scrum, you’ll be personally involved in decisions on how we’ll build out our products for our clients.</li>  </div><div><div>HOW WE WORK  <ul>   <ul> <li>You’ll join a tightly-knit team consisting of JS Developers, Designers, Business Quality Analysts and Scrum Masters, who collaborate to build web and mobile apps (Ionic/Cordova, React Native) for our clients. Most projects are new and won’t require you to deal with a lot of legacy code.</li><li>We work with modern JavaScript across a range of frameworks and technologies, on the client as well as on the server: Angular, Angular 2, React, NodeJS, TypeScript, ES6, Babel, Flux. (You don’t need to be proficient with all of those things to start).</li><li>Our approach to making software stresses teamwork and close interaction with our clients. We rely on a well thought-out process based on Scrum, continuous delivery, and test-driven development. This process allows us to build software in a way that sets you up for success, allowing you to exercise your creativity and building software that matters without all the red tape, hierarchy and politics.</li><li>We avoid sharply defined roles: everyone gets to partake in all aspects of their project and to try their hand at new things. Our developers do not just develop: they also help our clients think through product features, contribute to design, and test.</li><li>We work for many clients in an exciting range of industries: social media, e-commerce, manufacturing, transportation, alternative energy, wellness. Any company that we feel helps make the world a better place.</li></ul> </ul>  </div> </div><div><div>WHAT YOU BRING TO THE TEAM  <ul>   <ul> <li>Solid understanding of JavaScript. (Alternatively: really solid backend experience + some JavaScript + ability to learn JavaScript really fast.)</li><li>Bonus points if you have previous experience building apps in Angular, React or Node.</li><li>Great interpersonal skills - we are a close knit team and work together to solve problems.</li><li>Ideally 1+ years experience in web application development, bonus points if you have experience working directly with clients or a product owner.</li><li>A desire to follow a software development process that helps you sleep better at night</li><li>Bonus points if you have server side experience.</li><li>Bonus points if you have an eye for design. (BTW, all our designers can code.)</li><li>Great problem solver and ability to reinvent oneself - We are always looking at ways we can do things better, sometimes there is no path to follow.</li><li>Proactive and self starter - we hire folks that have a deep desire to do better and be better, you won’t be micromanaged in this role. (We want to hear your voice.)</li><li>Passionate about learning - You’ll help identify new technologies and approaches to problems. (Web development and especially JS is always evolving.)</li></ul> </ul>  </div> </div><div><div><strong>ABOUT US</strong></div><div>Based out of Toronto, Canada, Rangle.io is changing how software is built, designed, developed and delivered. The web is undergoing a massive transformation in how web and mobile applications are being built, and Rangle is the expert in this next generation of the web.</div><br/> <div>We are dedicated to helping startups and enterprises move to the modern web. We specialize in using modern JavaScript frameworks (such as Angular 2, React, and Node) and a User-Experience driven development process to build applications that deliver a compelling user experience for significantly less development effort compared to legacy server-side web development techniques.</div><br/> <div>Our agile development process, and continuous delivery of working software to build beautiful modern web and mobile applications ensures our clients are never more than a moment away from jumping on the next business opportunity or responding to the next market event.</div><br/> <div>Rangle is an equal opportunity employer. If you are contacted for an interview and require accommodation during the interviewing process, please let us know.</div></div>
Title: Modern JavaScript Developer (Angular, React, Node)

Job_Description: Senior Software Developer- e-Commerce<br/><br/>Job Description<br/><br/>The senior software developer has the responsibility of designing, developing and maintaining Corel’s e-Commerce stack of technologies. They range from Windows and Mac desktop products and HTML5, Javascript frameworks to Java and Python web applications with Oracle and SQL server database backend.<br/><br/>Requirements  <ul>  <li>8+ years of software development experience in a fast paced industry</li> <li>Experience in full stack software design and development, build vs buy evaluation, technology evaluations and rapid prototyping.</li> <li>Server based software technologies like Java/J2EE, Python, Django, Node.js, etc.</li> <li>RESTful web services</li> <li>Writing database queries in MS SQL Server, Oracle or MySQL</li> <li>HTML5, CSS, Javascript frameworks like JQuery</li> <li>SEO best practices</li> <li>Strong working knowledge of Amazon Web Services</li> <li>Experience in Agile development methodology</li>  </ul>  Desired  <ul>  <li>Tag management, reporting and analytics products like Google Tag Manager, Google Analytics, Kissmetrics, Tableau</li> <li>Responsive design best practices</li> <li>Experience in data warehousing concepts and products</li> <li>Payment gateway integration, PCI compliance requirements</li> <li>e-Commerce CMS platform integration or customization</li> <li>Windows or Mac desktop application development experience</li> <li>Business Analysis, requirements gathering and documentation</li>  </ul>  Soft skills required  <ul>  <li>Good oral communication and presentation skills</li> <li>Strong problem-solving ability</li> <li>Ability to manage multiple activities against aggressive deadlines</li> <li>Self-starter with can-do attitude and a strong sense of ownership <br/><br/> At Corel, we strive to give people the broadest choices in software and the freedom to express themselves in exciting, creative and persuasive ways. <br/><br/> It is the policy and practice of the Company to offer equal employment opportunities to all qualified applicants and employees without regard to race, color, age, religion, national origin, Job_Description: We are looking to add a SalesForce & CPQ Platform Developer (Technical Analyst) focused on day to day oversight of ClearSlide & Corel’s Salesforce.com ecosystem. This is a highly strategic role that will have direct (measurable!) impact on the focus areas (ClearSlide’s Quote to Cash and Corel’s B2B sales ecosystem). Ultimately it Is your job to ensure there is clean data flowing through the various systems that will enable effective sales and never would a system or backend limitation come in the way of sales success. <br/><br/> This is a highly technical role that will interface with our business sponsors on daily basis. You will become a resident technical expert on our CRM (Salesforce), marketing automation (Marketo), CPQ (Tyso) & Billing Subscription (Zuora), as well as our customer success (Gainsight) platforms and a few other bells and whistles within Salesforce that come with some years of customization. This role will work closely with the rest of the Sales & Business Operations team to ensure consistency across processes and systems that are being followed by the entire business. <br/><br/> <strong><u>You Will</u></strong><strong></strong> <ul> <li>Drive and implement a Salesforce development lifecycle including but not limited to standard practices, QA and code reviews. Perform development, testing, implementation and documentation as it relates to Salesforce.com software and the Force.com platform.</li> <li>Design and implement enhancements including creation of custom objects, pages, Apex classes, triggers, processes, flows, workflows, reports, etc.</li> <li>Design, develop and maintain Visualforce, AppExchange, Force.com pages and integration with on-premise or third party solutions using web services, APIs, etc.</li> <li>Perform system administration including administering user accounts, security roles, profiles, workflows, etc.</li> <li>Enforcement and assistance of all Governance (including but not limited to Security and Compliance)</li> <li>Drive and implement a Salesforce development lifecycle including but not limited to standard practices, QA and code reviews.</li> <li>Develop and complete unit test scripts, to develop user acceptance test scripts, to develop resulting deployment packages and any applicable training materials</li> <li>Develop and maintain all system documentation.</li> <li>Communicate ideas clearly, both orally and in writing, to executive staff, business sponsors, business analysts and technical resources in concise language that is the parlance of each group.</li> <li>Develop custom applications using Salesforce.com and integrating Salesforce.com with other systems like NetSuite, Docusign etc</li> <li>As a Developer for our Salesforce platform you will work on a variety of projects related to our growing business. In addition to Apex and Visualforce, you will also work extensively with SQL, HTML/CSS, and JavaScript.</li> </ul> <strong><u>You Have</u></strong><ul> <li>A Bachelors degree with 7+ years of experience or, an equivalent combination of education and experience sufficient to successfully perform the essential functions of the job.</li> <li>7+ years of CRM experience</li> <li>3+ years of Salesforce platform experience</li> <li>Extensive experience with Salesforce Sales, Enterprise, Lightning & Service Cloud offerings</li> <li>Extensive development experience using Apex, Visualforce, etc.</li> <li>Proven ability to design and optimize business processes and integrate business processes across multiple systems</li> <li>Competent to work at the highest technical level of all phases of the Application Development Life Cycle</li> <li>Experience leading a development team through the project life cycle, be it internally or external consultants.</li> <li>Attends training and/or industry seminars as appropriate, to stay abreast of current technologies, trends and directions</li> <li>Strong organizational skills, quick responsiveness, and act with a sense of urgency</li> <li>Excellent data analytics skills and attention to detail.</li> <li>Experience with any of the following tools a nice to have: Zendesk, data.com, Jira, Tyso</li> <li>DocuSign, GainSight, Zuora and NetSuite are <strong><u>MUST</u></strong> have skills</li> <li>Bonus Points: Salesforce.com Certified Platform Developer II</li> </ul> It is the policy and practice of the Company to offer equal employment opportunities to all qualified applicants and employees without regard to race, color, age, religion, national origin, sex, political affiliation, sexual orientation, marital status, disability, veteran status, genetics, or any other protected characteristic. <br/><br/> Corel offers a competitive compensation and benefits package<br/><br/>
Title: Salesforce.com AND SaaS Applications Platform Developer

Job_Description: BLANKSLATE Partners is working with A&K Robotics as they grow their team.<br/><br/>A&K Robotics is adding a full-time, permanent Full Stack Developer to our team in Vancouver. <br/><br/> A Vancouver based start-up, A&K is developing artificial intelligence for indoor autonomous vehicle systems. Founded on a shared belief that robotic technologies has the potential to drastically improve our world and quality of life, we see the future with unique eyes, pushing the boundaries of robotics and seeking real-life applications of new technologies. <br/><br/> A&K has demonstrated stable growth over the past 3 years, is venture backed with ambitious growth plans for 2018. We are building a strong, diverse team with a passion for Robotics as we prepare to take on the dangerous and the dull on a global scale. <br/><br/> The Full Stack Developer will be responsible for building our dashboard and Robot HUD - built in React.js - that will allow users to view and interact with our autonomous fleet of robots. <br/><br/> We have a highly skilled team of entrepreneurial, collaborative developers who think about possibilities and not about problems. <br/><br/> <strong>Next Steps</strong> <br/><br/> Candidates who meet our criteria will be invited to participate in our interview process which will include: <ul>  <li>Send in your profile</li>  <li>Brief phone screen</li> <li>Technical Challenge in Javascript</li>  <li>In-person interview with CTO and developers where you will discuss the assignment</li>  </ul> <strong>Requirements</strong> <br/><br/> You are: <ul>  <li>A JavaScript guru, who has successfully built web applications from scratch as the sole developer</li>  <li>Proficient in React.js and familiar with the trimmings (Redux, Flux, etc) or able to convince us that Angular is the only way.</li> <li>Capable of designing or informing the design of RESTful APIs, not just consuming them</li> <li>In love with serverless backends and have given API Gateway and AWS Lambda (or Azure/GCP equivalents) a spin</li> <li>Up to speed on authentication/authorization mechanisms that play nice with all of the above</li> </ul> Bonus Points if you are: <ul>  <li>Familiar with media streaming, specifically integrating MPEG DASH or WebRTC into applications</li> <li>At peace with binary serialization. ie Protocol Buffers, Flat Buffers, Thrift</li> <li>Comfortable with the different shapes and sizes of databases, especially the AWS favourites</li> </ul>
Title: Full Stack Developer (Javascript + AWS Serverless) - A&K Robotics

Job_Description: <strong>Job Description</strong> <br/> IBM Global Business Services: Join a Leader. Consult with us. <br/><br/> IBM Global Business Services helps top-tier clients solve their most complex business and technical issues. As an Application Developer Salesforce, the candidate will deliver innovative business consulting, business process design, systems integration, and application design and management to leading sector organizations in 17 industries worldwide. With access to resources that only a global leader can provide, the candidate will learn valuable skills, gain access to a vast and diverse network of talented professionals, and enjoy unparalleled career, training, and educational opportunities. <br/><br/> Visit http://www.ibm.com/ca/ for more information. <br/><br/> Our team is looking for enthusiastic Application Developers with skills in developing applications. Can you collaborate and push the envelope to design, develop and implement leading applications for our clients? We want your skills and experience. Bring us your work portfolio and lets talk! <br/><br/> Professional Skills  <ul> <li>Analytical and has proven problem determination skills</li><li>Detail oriented, creative, resourceful and able to work independently as well as part of a larger team</li><li>Experience developing complex rich mobile user interfaces, component and widgets</li><li>Keen eye for details and quality at both the code level and the overall application design</li><li>Proven communicator and enjoy collaborating</li><li>Takes initiative, exhibits creative thinking, has the drive to turn ideas into reality, and have a passion for user experience</li> </ul>  Required Technical and Professional Expertise   <ul> <li>Admin 201 certification or higher including Force.com Developer (DEV401) or Advanced Developer (DEV501)</li> <li>2 to 5 years of IT experience</li> <li>Knowledge of Visualforce, Force.com and Apex.</li> <li>Knowledge of software development life cycle (SDLC) and testing</li> <li>Some knowledge or experience in backend integration of Salesforce using technologies such as Salesforce REST and SOAP API, Jitterbit, CastIron, Mulesoft, or others.</li> <li>Experience working in AGILE projects</li> </ul>  Preferred Tech and Prof Experience   <ul> <li>5 + years of IT experience</li> </ul>  EO Statement <br/> IBM is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status. IBM is also committed to compliance with all fair employment practices regarding citizenship and immigration status. <br/><br/>
Title: Application Developer - Salesforce

Job_Description: <strong>Global Financial Client in Montreal, QC <br/> 12+ Months Contract <br/> Web Application Developer with Angular 2+ (2/3/4/5)</strong> <br/><br/> <strong>Technology Team Profile</strong> <br/> Technology works as a strategic partner with Brokerage business units and the world's leading technology companies to redefine how we do business in ever more global, complex, and dynamic financial markets. Brokerage's sizeable investment in technology results in quantitative trading systems, cutting-edge modelling and simulation software, comprehensive risk and security systems, and robust client-relationship capabilities, plus the worldwide infrastructure that forms the backbone of these systems and tools. Our insights, our applications and infrastructure give a competitive edge to clients' businesses—and to our own. <br/><br/> Enterprise Infrastructure (EI) is responsible for delivering essential technology infrastructure solutions to Brokerage's businesses. EI manages the production, operations, and engineering of our data centers, voice and data networking solutions, mainframe servers and databases, distributed computing, wireless technologies, and associated end user capabilities. <br/><br/> <strong>Position Description:</strong> <br/> Enterprise Reporting Framework (ERF) is a critical reporting system which provides both highly concurrent adhoc / ondemand reporting and batch reporting capability as well as reporting workflow monitoring tools. It generates 20k custom reports for 16900 Wealth Management FAs very day, and it generates 2 million quarterly reports in 4 days. <br/><br/> The candidate will part of Montreal based development team and will be involved in development and maintenance of various distributed frontend/backend systems including middleware components, web, and infrastructure components.   <ul> <li>Design & implement distributed applications, enhance and support existing systems.</li> <li>Utilize strong object oriented design (OOD), algorithms & programming skills to implement distributed systems of multi-tier architecture.</li> <li>Work closely with internal, external clients and users to deliver solutions.</li> <li>Will have the opportunity to participate in system integration efforts and requirements gathering for projects involving multiple teams and systems.</li> </ul>  In addition to this, candidate will also work on various integration/special projects that involves working with different business units like Wealth Management, and Investment Management etc. The team also works on technical R&D and cutting-edge solutions to improve performance & scale and for integrating new products and technologies in our system. <br/><br/> <strong>Skills Required:</strong>   <ul> <li>Strong programming skills in HTML, Angular 2+, JavaScript with 4+ years of experience.</li> <li>Experience developing distributed, performance-critical, highly available, or large-scale systems</li> <li>Experience building Web applications in Multithreading, Web Services for a Unix/Linux platform</li> <li>Experience working with Source Code Management solutions like (ex. Perforce, Git, CVS)</li> <li>Experience testing software (e.g. Unit testing, performance testing/tuning)</li> <li>Good troubleshooting and problem solving skills</li> <li>Good verbal and written communication skills</li> <li>A Team Player</li> </ul>  <strong>Skills Desired:</strong>   <ul> <li>Experience working with the Spring framework</li> <li>Experience in either Eclipse IDE or IntelliJ</li> </ul>
Title: Web Application Developer

Job_Description: <strong>WE ARE A TRANSFORMATIONAL PARTNER</strong><br/><br/>We marry design and engineering language in ways that produce impactful and memorable experience journeys. We partner all the way to continuously improve our clients’ digital maturity. Our Studio network brings the optimal combination of skill, scale, and cost for each stage of the product development lifecycle. And to do this we need great transformational people that want to impact the projects and organizations that they work with. <br/><br/> We are looking for an exceptional <strong>Senior Java Developer</strong> to work with our cross-functional team, and join our world-class community of talented experts. Core to this need are expertise in:  <ul>  	<li>7-10 years of Java experience; BackEnd development</li> <li>Experience with messaging frameworks, Business Process Modeling and Relational/Non-Relational Databases (e.g. Kafka, Signavio, Drools, MongoDB)</li> <li>Experience integrating with RESTful web services</li> <li>Comfort with Agile Operating Models</li>  </ul> <strong>Ideally you will also have:</strong>  <ul>  	<li>Undergraduate Degree in Computer Science, Physics or Mathematics (Graduate Degree always is a plus)</li> <li>Experience in Web Development and Frameworks</li> <li>Experience integrating with vendor applications</li> <li>Experience in finance and financial application development</li> <li>Comfort operating in a matrix environment</li> </ul> We are a thriving Community of top technology talent that is globally connected. We Engage, Make, Run and Evolve the technology that makes many brands that you know and love. So let’s take this journey together. No matter where you are on your digital career roadmap, we can help you grow and have fun doing it. <br/><br/> <strong>At this time, Softvision LLC will not sponsor a new applicant for employment authorization for this position.</strong> <strong>Relocation assistance is available. Softvision LLC is an Equal Opportunity Employer. No 3rd Party Agency Candidates please.</strong>
Title: Senior Java Developer -

Job_Description: <strong>Job Description</strong> <br/> <div><div>Want to help save the world? Help us stop the modern hacker. <br/><br/> Sophisticated attacks are breaking through conventional safeguards every single day. Organized criminals, hacktivists, governments and adversaries are compelled by financial gain, politics and notoriety to attack valuable government and corporate assets. Their attack operations are well-funded and business-like <br/> attackers patiently evaluating targets based on potential effort and reward. Their methods are extremely targeted <br/> they use social media and other entry points to track down people with access, take advantage of trust and exploit them as vulnerabilities. Meanwhile, negligent employees inadvertently put the business at risk via human error and even worse, the rapid adoption of new technologies such as mobile and cloud only serve to increase the number of attack vectors. Security investments of the past simply fail to protect against these new classes of attacks.</div> <br/> <div>Join us as we build the next generation of security software built around cognitive systems that leverage data mining, machine learning and natural language processing to defend against the most advanced cybersecurity threats facing the world today. Our developers work within small, close-knit squads and are tasked with highly-defined missions. In the spirit of Agile development, we operate on short sprints and each squad is given a high degree of freedom and responsibility to execute on their commitments. As a member of our team, you will have responsibilities covering the end-to-end delivery of features for your squad ranging from Research, Design, Prototype, Development, QA, Deployment to Support. Additionally, as a member of the Development team, you will be also working with the Product Management team and the CTO who both help shape and prioritize our portfolio strategy and directions. <br/><br/> The ideal candidate will have a strong passion for developing software as demonstrated by their active participation in hackathons, contribution to open source projects, experimenting with new technologies and development of their own hobby applications. The candidate must also have a relentless desire for continuous improvement through the learning of new things, championing of new ideas, exploring new perspectives and embrace the idea of going beyond their comfort zone even at the risk of failure or embarrassment. <br/><br/> If you have a keen interest in the latest web technologies and a strong interest in building usable software with intuitive interfaces then this could be the opportunity for you!</div></div> <br/> <strong>This role will involve working with technology that is covered by embargo Export Regulations. If you are a Foreign National from any of the following embargoed countries (Cuba, Iran, North Korea, Sudan, and Syria) on a work permit, you are not eligible for employment in this position.</strong> <br/><br/> Required Technical and Professional Expertise  <ul> <li>English (Fluent in verbal and written)</li><li>Proven experience programming in JavaScript and Java.</li><li>Proven experience with web application development and understanding of cloud architecture.</li><li>Proven experience applying object oriented design and methodologies.</li><li>Strong communication skills and able to convey ideas and opinions to others.</li> </ul>  Preferred Tech and Prof Experience  <ul> <li>Experience in enterprise-related development (multi-threading, scalability, performance)</li><li>Experience using Node.js or TypeScript for backend web development</li><li>Knowledge of front-end development frameworks for web development (e.g. AngularJS)</li><li>Familiarity with automating deployment, scaling and management of containerized applications</li><li>Familiarity with NoSQL database platforms</li><li>Familiarity with continuous delivery and continuous integration</li><li>Familiarity with internet protocols and architectures</li> </ul>  EO Statement <br/> IBM is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status. IBM is also committed to compliance with all fair employment practices regarding citizenship and immigration status. <br/><br/>
Title: Software Developer - IBM Security

Their office is located in the heart of Gastown.<br><br><br>We want you to take the lead of the backend development at a smaller, but very fast-moving ecommerce development shop.<br><br>Specifically you will be responsible to:<br><br>--Play a major role in application development<br>--Own the code base, continually refactor it, and make it better<br>--Implement a road map of new features<br>--The typical developer stuff: liaise with customer support, bring ideas to meetings, educate other team members on best practices and continually look for ways to improve the product.<br>--Develop RESTful APIs for internal and external use<br>--Develop scalable backend services<br>
Title: Developer - Ruby on Rails

Job_Description: <div> <div>Were ecobee, a proudly Canadian hardware company transforming the way energy is used in the home. As first-to-market pioneers in the connected home space, we introduced the worlds first smart Wi-Fi compatible thermostat. Our beautifully designed devices help reduce energy waste and carbon emissions. So, they arent just smart for our usersbut for our planet too. <br/><br/> To keep that creativity and innovation going, we offer a flexible and multidisciplinary environment where designers, hardware engineers, and software professionals collaborate. <br/><br/> Our hive, headquartered in Toronto is growing quickly and we are specifically looking for a Web Test Developer for our fantastic QA team. <br/><br/> Who you are:  <ul> <li>You not only find problems but you provide creative solutions for solving them as well</li> <li>Enjoy interacting with multiple departments including (but not limited to) development, UX and PM</li> <li>You thrive when the challenges are outstanding and the time is tight</li> <li>Have a natural sense of curiosity; always find yourself tinkering with your gadgets</li> <li>You are always learning something new and bring that knowledge</li> </ul> What youd do:  <ul> <li>Own all aspects of the quality for your role</li> <li>Write Test Plans, Test Cases, and Test Summary Reports</li> <li>Create test cases for Functionality, Usability, Compatibility, Performance, and Security</li> <li>Design and execution of test cases for the ecobee product line</li> <li>Automate test cases using different tools, including Selenium</li> <li>Improving our test infrastructure by incorporating new technologies</li> </ul> Our Requirements:  <ul> <li>University degree or college diploma in computer science</li> <li>3+ years of experience on Web, API, backend, performance/load/stress, and security testing</li> <li>Experience with Selenium or similar frameworks</li> <li>Experience with Continuous Integration and Continuous Delivery and/or Deployment</li> <li>Proven tinker experience creating software/tools/robots on your own</li> <li>Proficient in any of the following languages: Python, Ruby, JavaScript, Java</li> <li>2+ years writing code from scratch</li> <li>3+ years writing test cases based on minimum requirements</li> <li>Knowledge of web services / REST API, networking, distributed systems, database administration, Apache Kafka, Docker, Apache Tomcat, Jenkins, CircleCI</li> <li>Linux, OSX, Docker, and Apache Kafka experience an asset</li> <li>Excellent verbal and written communication skills</li> </ul> Are you the one we need? If so, we would love to hear from you. <br/><br/> ecobee is committed to workplace diversity and will provide accommodation to applicants with disabilities throughout the hiring process.</div> </div> <br/>
Title: Web Test Developer

The solutions are composed of in-car devices, smartphone apps and backend systems. ease-of-use, ease-of-support, robustness, scalability and security, key ingredients to the recommended design solutions</li><li>Develop and code web and UI solutions</li><li>Collaborate with other teams (Mobile, Interface, Embedded, Test, IT Team and Marketing) and outsourced partners when required</li><li>Work in an Agile-Sprint environment</li><li>Participate in the Continuous Improvement design</li><li>Excellent communication verbal/written skills (English and French)</li></ul><p></p>            <p> </p>  <p><b><u>Assets:</u></b></p>  <p></p><ul><li>Experience in integration of 24X7 high-availability vehicle telematics or IoT services</li><li>Experience with Java based technologies</li><ul><li>Micro service architectures including Spring Boot, Spring REST & Spring CloudWatch</li><li>Experience with docker application deployment and container management</li><li>Knowledge of those tools: Target Process or Jira, Confluence, SVN/Git, Jenkins</li><li>Asset
