Job_Description: Skip is growing at a rapid pace and with that, we will need to expand our elite team of software developers and engineers to advance the innovation and improvements of our existing technology. Were looking for talented and experienced React developers that can pave future of our industry leading tools and redefine what it means to stay ahead of game. <br/><br/> People need to eat so Skip never sleeps, and that means the show runs around the clock. Were looking for people who want the chance of contributing to build a world-class tech company right here in the Canadian Prairies. <br/><br/> The skills youll need: <ul> <li>Experience developing, releasing, and maintaining Android apps</li><li>Solid understanding of Java, XML, and Gradle</li><li>Experience with Java 8, RxJava, and Retrofit</li><li>Familiarity with React Native or willingness to learn</li><li>Deep familiarity with debugging, performance measurement, and test-driven development</li><li>Solid understanding of REST principles and exposure to backend APIs</li> </ul> People were looking for: <ul> <li>Have a great attitude and are proven self-starters</li><li>Keep hustling and are able to work through rejection</li><li>Thrive in a rapidly changing environment</li><li>Understand that a startup is not a 9-5 job, it's a lifestyle!</li> </ul> What its like to work at Skip: <ul> <li>Fast paced entrepreneurial environment</li><li>Casual dress attire, we focus on results, not wearing suits</li><li>Exposure to leading-edge technology</li><li>Advancement opportunities for high contributors</li><li>Merit-based compensation & benefits</li> </ul>
Title: Android Developer

Job_Description: Our Calgary location is currently looking for a <strong><u>full-time Senior Software Developer</u></strong> to be part of a team that is responsible for delivering timely, high quality releases that delight our customers in the upstream oil & gas sector. You’d be designing, coding and testing enhancements to our Harmony desktop application in C++ and/or C#. <br/><br/> <strong>About You:</strong>  <ul> <li><strong>You’re highly collaborative</strong> - you have an affinity for finding solutions through discussions with team members</li><li><strong>You’re a problem solver</strong> – you enjoy solving complex problems, and are comfortable exploring them even if the problem and solution are not yet well-defined</li><li><strong>You’re always improving something</strong> – whether it’s learning a new programming language, or finding better ways to do things in your team or organizationally, continuous improvement is important to you</li><li><strong>You’re practical</strong> – you assess the circumstances and make the best decision based on the facts</li> </ul>  <strong>Some of the things you’d be doing as a developer on our team:</strong>  <ul> <li>Be an active and collaborative team member as part of an agile development team of 5-9 people</li><li>Design, code and test enhancements for a Windows-based desktop application written in C++ and/or C#, with SQL Server as its backend database</li><li>Work closely with customer stakeholders to ensure we’re adding value for our users</li><li>Work closely with other developers, for example by pair programming and participating in code reviews</li><li>Troubleshoot and fix Title: Senior Software Developer

Job_Description: Company Description<div><strong>About the company:</strong> <br/><br/> Thinking Capital is the leader in the Canadian Alternative Lending space, using technology to be at the forefront of the FinTech industry. Since 2006, they have helped more than 10,000 small-to-medium sized Canadian businesses reach their full potential. By combining their people and technology, We are transforming the way business owners get the capital they need to grow. For more information, visit www.thinkingcapital.ca</div>Job Description<div><strong>Your role:</strong> <br/><br/> Reporting to the team lead, this role will work on the “client side” of our web applications. You will be part of an agile team that is working with state of the art technologies in a leading tech company. The ideal candidate is a creative thinker with a strong background in user experience definition and user interface design. <br/><br/> <strong>Your tasks:</strong> <ul> <li>Creation of site layout/user interface from provided design concepts by using standard HTML/CSS practices;</li><li>Supporting existing web applications with focus on continuous improvement;</li><li>Implement design and content modifications to website templates as well as numerous interactive electronic forms in HTML and PDF;</li><li>Identify and troubleshoot online application errors; implement fixes and resolve issues;</li><li>Create and update electronic forms;</li><li>Create email templates, landing pages and other communication pieces, based on designs;</li><li>Take ownership of daily project needs and communications;</li><li>Placement and layout of web site pages based on content that has been provided;</li><li>Test and propose innovative technologies and solutions that can better support the business.</li></ul></div> <br/> Qualifications<div><strong>Apply if you have the following skillset:</strong> <ul> <li>University Degree or equivalent experience in computer science, programming or related field;</li><li>5+ years proven experience in development of web technologies;</li><li>Javascript, HTML, CSS;</li><li>Well versed in dynamic languages: PHP JSP & .NET;</li><li>Working knowledge of JSON & XML;</li><li>Working knowledge of Angular;</li><li>Experience working in an Agile environment;</li><li>JIRA knowledge;</li><li>Knowledge and Experience with salesforce.com is an asset;</li><li>Bilingual (spoken and written) in French and English;</li><li>Experience with object oriented programming languages an asset.</li></ul></div> <br/> Additional Information<div><strong>Why work for Thinking Capital:</strong> <ul> <li><strong>Our Mission:</strong>  <br/> To own the rails on which small businesses access credit in Canada.</li> <li><strong>Great Team:</strong> Surround yourself with high-performing, energetic and passionate group of people dedicated to the Thinking Capital Mission;</li><li><strong>FinTech Revolution:</strong>  <br/> Be part of a team that is revolutionizing the financial system and redefining how Canadian small businesses access capital;</li><li><strong>Our Stack:</strong> <br/> Our backend is a sophisticated service oriented architecture developed mostly in Java with a Spring framework. On the frontend side, our application is developed on an AngularJS framework. We use Git in coordination with the best DevOps practices for Continuous Integration and Deployment to our AWS cloud infrastructure.</li><li><strong>Fast-Paced Environment:</strong>  <br/> Take on complex projects in a start-up like collaborative environment;</li><li><strong>Amazing Culture:</strong>  <br/> Amazing work spaces, advanced technology tools, subsidized lunches, Foosball table, super fun work events (Amazing Race, Murder mystery wine and cheeses, Wacky Olympics, Casino nights and legendary holiday parties and more). Take a look at our career page for more information!</li><li><strong>Thinking Capital Academy:</strong>  <br/> Get the opportunity to grow and advance in the company through continuous professional training;</li><li><strong>Diverse Team:</strong>  <br/> Join an “at-will” equal opportunity team that prides itself on it's diversity and harmony;</li> </ul> </div> <br/> I'm interested
Title: Front End Developer

Job_Description: <div><strong>Sr. Automation Developer</strong></div><div></div> <br/> <div><strong>COMPANY OVERVIEW:</strong></div><div>As one of the fastest growing IoT (Internet of Things) companies in North America, Fleet Complete has won numerous awards since its inception in 2000 thanks to its relentless commitment to <strong>Innovation</strong>, <strong>Quality</strong>, <strong>Customer Focus</strong>, <strong>Productivity, People</strong> and <strong>Community</strong>.</div><div>We are proud to be named one of <strong>Greater Toronto’s Top Employers for 2018</strong> and one of <strong>Canada’s Best Employers for Recent Graduates.</strong>  We were also recently recognized as one of <strong>Canada’s Top Small and Medium Employers for 2018</strong>. See more: <br/> http://content.eluta.ca/top-employer-fleet-complete</div> <br/> <div><strong>MAIN BUSINESS OBJECTIVES:</strong></div><div>The Product Development group requires a Sr. Automation Developer with the ability to implement test automation to increase the quality of our products by working side by side with the teams in charge of the design and development of our core products ranging from Client/Server, Web and Mobile (Android, iOS and Windows Mobile) solutions.</div> <div>You will work under the supervision of the Team Lead and/or Dev Manager and will be accountable for improving quality via test executions and the development and maintenance of test automation for key products of Fleet Complete.</div><div></div><div><strong>Sr. Automation Developer</strong></div><div></div> <br/> <div><strong>ESSENTIAL DUTIES & RESPONSIBILITIES:</strong></div><ul><li>Work with Product Owners (and BAs), Architects, Developers and DevOps to understand and successfully execute a Product Roadmap that meets or exceeds the quality standards required</li> <li>Participate in all phases of the iterative development cycle, including grooming, planning, daily standups, demos and retrospectives</li> <li>Develop, maintain and execute manual and automated test cases using new and existing tools (i.e. Visual Studio, Xamarin, Selenium, etc.) at various levels including database validation, business rules validation, UI validation and integration, service validation and mobile device testing</li> <li>Adhere and contribute to the enforcement and improvement of Development and QA standards, ensuring transparency of your own work and advocating and enforcing adoption by your peers via discussion and peer review processes</li> <li>Continually expand manual and automated tests by clearly documenting test cases and ncreasing automated code coverage by creating tools and automation scripts that assist in functional testing and creation of test data</li> <li>Design and develop test automation to provide quality assurance using a variety of unit, integration, coded UI and UI automated tests to validate Product requirements and measure product performance and scalability</li><li>Remain up-to-date in emerging trends and techniques in software development and automation, advocating for their adoption where and when appropriate</li><li>Participate in a peer review process, ensuring adherence to standards and proper implementation</li><li>Contribute to an atmosphere of cross-functional teamwork within the organizations Agile product lifecycle</li><li>Appreciate and acknowledge individual and team contributions</li> </ul>  <strong><div>QUALIFICATIONS:</div> <br/> </strong> <br/> <div><strong>All applicants must possess the following:</strong></div><ul><li>5+ years QA experience with deep understanding of overall QA processes and testing approaches including but not limited to requirements review, test planning, test case creation and execution, defect management, issue troubleshooting, tracking, reporting and verification</li><li>3+ years of professional development experience with an emphasis on quality and automation in an Agile environment</li><li>A University degree or College diploma in Computer Science / Computer Programming or equivalent</li><li>Proven experience developing with a Test Automation Framework using a variety of unit, integration, coded UI and UI automated tests</li><li>Demonstrated ability to automate testing for Desktop, Web and Mobile (Android, iOS) applications using a variety of tools / methods</li><li>Working knowledge of C#</li><li>Good understanding of Client/Server and multi-tier application architecture and development</li><li>Confident in your ability to develop tests and verification scripts for Relational Databases (Microsoft SQL Server)</li><li>Knowledge of Git, for Source Control, Work Item Tracking, Builds and Tests</li><li>Experience communicating with RESTful Services using WCF REST / WebAPI & Entity Framework</li><li>Results oriented and problem solving mentality</li><li>Strong communication skills for delivering QA updates to various teams and management, delivering QA updates</li><li>Proven track record of being a go to person who owns every task from beginning to end</li> </ul>  <div><strong>Ideal candidates also demonstrate the following:</strong></div><ul><li>Experience as project QA Prime responsible for reviewing requirements, creating test plans, executing both manual and automated test scripts and providing status reports</li> <li>Extensive experience in functional, system, performance, integration, regression, backend testing for web, software applications & mobile applications, and mobile hardware devices</li><li>Knowledge of software development tools such as Gitlab, Jira, Confluence and test case management tools</li> </ul>  <div><strong>Typical Hours of Operations: Mon- Fri (9 am to 5 pm) Occasional Overtime</strong></div><br/> <div>Fleet Complete will provide support in its recruitment processes to applicants with disabilities, including accommodation that takes into account an applicant's accessibility needs. If you require accommodation during the interview or recruitment process, please contact the Recruitment Team at 866-649-7949.</div><div>Fleet Complete is an equal opportunity employer committed to diversity and inclusion. We are pleased to consider all qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability, protected veteran’s status or any other legally-protected factors.</div><br/>
Title: Senior Automation Developer

Job_Description: Do you live, breathe and dream in code? Would you like to develop expertise in large-scale cloud storage and highly-distributed systems? Are you interested in becoming part of a team that is building new capabilities to grow a successful backup and disaster recovery solution in a rapidly-expanding market? If yes, then Carbonite is the place for you!<br/> <div> <div>We have an immediate opening for a Senior Software Quality Engineer / Automation Developer with strong technical and communication skills, with passion for building high-quality test automation frameworks and work side by side with core developers and QA manual testers.</div><br/>  <div><strong>Specific Objectives & Responsibilities:</strong></div><div></div> <br/> <strong><div><em>First three months:</em></div> <br/> </strong> <br/> <div>   <ul> <li>Gain basic understanding of EVault product suite with focus on the backend infrastructure and services (the Vault)</li> <li>Learn the team’s automation environment, tools, and processes</li> <li>Learn how to use existing test automation, review the scheduled runs and participate in root cause analysis for failures</li> <li>Implement simple fixes for failed tests to increase the coverage.</li> <li>Design/code review the work of peer engineers.</li> </ul>  </div><br/>  <div><em>Three to nine months:</em>  <ul> <li>Design and develop several suites of automated tests.</li> <li>Contribute to ongoing test automation improvement efforts.</li> <li>Contribute to conception of a next generation automation solution.</li> <li>Use your own initiative to increase velocity and quality.</li> </ul> <em>Beyond nine months:</em>  <ul> <li>Improve our test automation</li> <li>Contribute to a company-wide automation solution focused on modularity, commonality, robustness, reporting, and efficiency</li> </ul>  <div><strong>Key Challenges to Overcome:</strong></div><div>   <ul> <li>You will be working in a fast-paced, agile environment where things change quickly.</li> <li>Are you ready to understand current automation and produce automation?</li> <li>Are you up for working on a very complex product, where you’ll have to dig deep to find the right solutions for different automation needs?</li> <li>Can you keep the big picture in mind and identify components impacting with the change?</li> <li>Are you prepared to bring fresh ideas and energy to help make our company and our product even better? Are you ready to grow and help your colleagues to grow with you?</li> </ul>  </div> </div> </div><br/>  <div>Qualifications</div> <br/><strong>What will make you successful at Carbonite:</strong>  <ul> <li>A track record of good judgment and decision-making in positions with significant responsibility</li> <li>Highly autonomous and able to independently identify high value projects and drive them to completion</li> <li>Demonstrated leadership capability in cross-functional team environments</li> <li>High degree of comfort with complex technical environments</li> <li>Having and being able to articulate/defend an informed opinion on important topics</li> </ul> <strong>Skills & Experience:</strong>  <ul> <li>Minimum 5+ years of test automation experience</li> <li>Good software development skills with knowledge of object-oriented design and programming</li> <li>C#, Java (or similar languages like C++, etc. …) experience</li> <li>Experience in RESTful/API automation.</li> <li>A passionate desire to excel as an automation engineer</li> <li>Good experience with Windows platforms and knowledge of relational databases (such as MS SQL)</li> <li>Abundant initiative and ability to rapidly learn from mistakes</li> <li>Exceedingly strong team/collaborative work ethic</li> <li>Strong communication skills</li> <li>Active, demonstrable curiosity about the newest technologies and practices</li> </ul>

A PHP Developer writes beautiful, fast PHP to a high standard, in a timely and scalable way that improves the code-base of our products in meaningful ways. You will be a part of a full-stack creative team that is responsible for all aspects of the ongoing software development from the initial specification, through to developing, testing and launching of our proprietary web properties and those of our clients.<br/><br/>Responsibilities  <ul>  <li>Write “clean”, well-designed code</li> </ul>  <div>  <ul> <li>Contribute in all phases of the development lifecycle( server, domain names, wordpress development)</li></ul>  <ul> <li>Basic implementation of on-page SEO elements</li></ul>  <ul> <li>Produce detailed specifications</li></ul>  <ul> <li>Troubleshoot, test and maintain the core product software and databases to ensure strong optimization and functionality</li></ul>  <ul> <li>Contribute in all phases of the development lifecycle</li></ul>  <ul> <li>Follow industry best practices</li></ul>  <ul> <li>Develop and deploy new features to facilitate related procedures and tools if necessary</li></ul></div> <br/><strong>Requirements</strong> <ul>  <li>Proven software development experience in PHP</li> <li>Understanding of open source projects like *WordPress, WooCommerce Joomla, Shopify, Magento ect...</li> <li>Demonstrable knowledge of web technologies including HTML, CSS, Javascript, AJAX etc</li> <li>Ability to optimized page speed on websites from rendering issues indicated from GTMetrix, Google pagespeed insights, Google WebMaster Tools (Search Console),</li>  <li>Understand website security measures and their implementations</li> <li>Good knowledge of relational databases, version control tools and of developing web services</li> <li>Experience in common third-party APIs (Google, AdWords, Analytics, Facebook, Ebay etc)</li> <li>Passion for best design and coding practices and a desire to develop new bold ideas</li> <li>BS/MS degree in Computer Science, Engineering or a related subject</li> </ul>
Title: PHP Developer

Job_Description: <div><strong>Canada, Amérique du Nord</strong> <br/> <strong>Software</strong> <br/><br/> Now a certified B Corporation, OPTEL is a leading provider of traceability systems, and its mission is to use its innovative technologies to create a better world through responsible capitalism. The company’s renowned solutions ensure the quality of consumer health products and contribute to the eradication of counterfeit pharmaceuticals and medical devices throughout the world. OPTEL also adapts its technologies according to the requirements of various other sectors: from health industries to intelligent manufacturing, all sectors can benefit from global traceability. OPTEL’s expertise will allow diverse industries to measure, inspect, control, and track a variety of elements as a means to improve product quality and offer a more responsible use of resources. <br/><br/> OPTEL is currently looking for a Full-Stack Web Developer. The incumbent will participate in the development of a new line of innovative products. The main mandate is to conceptualize and implement Web applications. He or she collaborates with the various internal departments and contributes to the growth of the company by proposing innovative ways of doing things. <br/><br/> <strong>KEY RESPONSIBILITIES</strong>   <ul> <li>Design and develop modern and modular web applications</li> <li>Develop new services, features, user interfaces, and APIs</li> <li>Maintain and create integrations with various external / 3rd party APIs</li> <li>Build unit tests and work with continuous integration environment</li> <li>Continuously and independently streamline interface for growth</li> <li>Ensure adequate built-in security of programmed modules</li> <li>Ensure the quality of his or her own code and documentation</li> <li>Regular communication with team on project progress, issues, and risk</li> <li>Be on the lookout for emerging trends, technologies and opportunities</li> <li>Develop reusable tools to increase productivity as applicable <br/><br/> <strong>PROFESSIONAL QUALIFICATIONS</strong></li> <li>Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or Computer Engineering / Software or college diploma in Programming / Computer Science with related experience</li> <li>3 to 5 years of relevant experience <br/><br/> <strong>KEY COMPETENCIES</strong> <br/><br/> • Great experience with Web applications and related programming languages such as Ruby, Python, Java, HTML, CSS, JavaScript and API’s</li> <li>Being able to build and consume Web Services (REST, SOAP, etc.)</li> <li>Strong interest in new Web technologies</li> <li>Knowledge of the Agile methodology</li> <li>Experience in the design, development, and implementation of scalable and performant backend micro-services</li> <li>Good experience with security concepts and how to apply them to a web application</li> <li>Intermediate English (spoken and written) <br/><br/> Working at OPTEL is benefiting from a dynamic work environment, based on collaboration with open spaces and focus on challenges. It is also a flexible schedule, activities organized by the social club each month and many stimulating projects. All of this in a friendly atmosphere with free coffee, of course! <br/><br/> <strong>Join a team focused on the future, live the Optel experience!</strong></div></li> </ul>
Title: Full-Stack Web Developer

Job_Description: <div><br></div><div><b>About Paytm Labs:</b></div><div> Paytm Labs is located in the heart of Toronto, nestled between the busy Finance and vibrant entertainment District. Transmitting billions of bytes of electronic and secure data at dizzying speed is our forte, it allows us to make commerce more accessible and convenient. We proudly support Paytm India and we are the birth place of the Paytm Canada app. </div><div> </div><div>In 2017, we launched the Paytm Canada App, a consumer-facing mobile application allowing consumers to pay their bills using multiple payment options with no fees, earn points, and make peer-to-peer payments. </div><div> </div><div>Paytm India is the largest leading Payment gateway that offers comprehensive payment services for approximately 250 million customers and 7 million merchants. We offer mobile payment solutions to allow consumers to make seamless mobile payments from Credit Cards, Bank Accounts, and Digital Credit among others. We pioneered and are the leader of QR code based mobile payments in India. With the launch of Paytm Payments Bank, we aim to bring banking and financial services to half-a-billion un-served and under-served people in India and around the globe.</div><div> </div><div>Paytm Labs is proudly certified as a Great Place to Work! We are small, diverse, and tight-knit team that is committed to working for the end consumer. We leverage our expertise in technology to build lasting, secure, and efficient solutions. Our creative and incredibly talented engineers work to provide customized and confidential experiences for consumer of Paytm India and Paytm Canada. We encourage our employees to take charge of their innovative ideas and execute them with passion and vigor. </div><div><br></div><div><br></div><div><b>Job Description:</b></div><div>We are looking for an talented full-stack capable frontend developer to join Paytm Labs! Work closely with the design and backend team to build and develop web applications for our forward thinking products.</div><div><br></div><div><b>Responsibilities:</b></div><div>• Work on all things front-end including web and mobile. </div><div>• Building applications that are responsive, performant, and accessible Produce high quality HTML/CSS pages from mock ups.</div><div>• Collaborating with other disciplines across engineering, UX, and Product to help develop front end solutions.</div><div>• Using our Micro service stack to integrate front end into the development lifecycle.</div><div> </div><div> </div><div><b>Qualifications:</b></div><div>• Degree in Computer Science, similar field, or equivalent experience.</div><div>• 4 + years of experience of software development.</div><div>• Experience using Angular or React or Vue.js.</div><div>• Interest and ability to learn new technology stacks as needed.</div><div>• Experience with server-side web app code, e.g. REST APIs using Java, Ruby and/or Node.js.</div><div>• Doesnt shy away from testing and code review.</div><div>• React Native or Weex experience is a plus.</div><div> </div><div><b>What We Offer:</b></div><div>• We are proud to announce that we have been certified as a Great Place to Work!</div><div>• A collaborative, open work environment that fosters ownership, creativity, and urgency.</div><div>• Enrollment in the Group Health Benefits plan right from the day you start working, no waiting period.</div><div>• We believe in hard work, fun, innovation, and team building. Every other month, we plan an activity to celebrate that. So far, we've gone biking, axe-throwing, bowling, indoor rocking climbing, and go-karting (to name a few).</div><div>• Chocolates & Snacks: Our "Chief Chocolate Officer" is in charge of stocking high-quality chocolates for all.</div><div>• Ping Pong: A chance to be Paytm Labs table tennis champion!</div><div> </div><div>*Selected candidates will be given a technical challenge*</div><div> </div><div>We thank all applicants, however, only those selected for an interview will be contacted.</div><div> </div><div><br></div><div>Paytm Labs is committed to meeting the accessibility needs of all individuals in accordance with the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act (AODA) and the Ontario Human Rights Code (OHRC). Should you require accommodations during the recruitment and selection process, please let us know. Paytm Labs is an equal opportunity employer.</div>
Title: Front-End Developer - Toronto, Canada

Job_Description: Company Description<br/><br/>Become part of our growing community of bright, motivated people who are dedicated and inspired by what they do best. Principled, honest, and supremely attentive are qualities that set us apart and guide our decisions, every day. Our creative approach to technology continuously breaks new ground so that our customers can do more.Over the last 17 years, Intelerad has grown into a leader of the medical imaging software industry. We take pride in being a world-class healthcare solutions company with more than 300 employees and over 1000 customer sites. Today, our distributed solutions play a vital role in the delivery of healthcare across 11 time zones, 3 continents, and counting. <br/><br/> We are Intelerad. Join us if you care to make a difference in healthcare.<br/><br/>Job Description<br/><br/>Do you want to join a great team working on designing and building a suite of web and desktop apps that will drive the future of patient care? You could be part of creating the next-generation of medical apps that aspire to help emergency doctors, medical specialists, radiologists and patients through providing a real-time user experience that will contribute to increased medical provider satisfaction and better patient outcomes. <br/><br/> Come work with us and you will have chosen to work with a smart and motivated team in a fast-paced environment that is both challenging and rewarding with opportunities to learn new technologies and grow your skills. The technologies and applications you will be researching and developing will be used by medical professionals all over the world to treat patients and deliver first class care. So, are you interested in truly making a difference? <br/><br/> <strong>Responsibilities</strong> <ul>  <li>Design, prototype, develop, test, document, deploy and maintain desktop and/or web-based applications with backend components</li> <li>Refine the software to continuously improve its performance</li> <li>Develop a deep understanding of our clients needs</li> <li>Tackle issues that may arise across the full software stack</li>  </ul> Qualifications<br/><br/><strong>Key qualifications</strong> <br/><br/> Bachelors degree in Computer Science, Engineering, related discipline or equivalent skills and practical industry experience <br/><br/> Solid understanding of web services development using Java (HTTP, REST APIs, Tomcat) <br/><br/> Solid experience using Java in complex application development (8+ years) <br/><br/> Good experience with core javascript and front-end web development technologies (Angular, TypeScript, HTML5, AJAX, CSS) <br/><br/> Good experience with relational database design, SQL and design patterns <br/><br/> Experience designing and building complex data workflows for customers <br/><br/> Knowledgeable about building secure, scalable & resilient web applications <br/><br/> Knowledge of multithreaded or event-driven programming <br/><br/> Experience writing unit tests and e2e tests <br/><br/> Ability to adapt to working with a wide array of technologies and languages <br/><br/> <strong>Preferred qualifications</strong> <br/><br/> Knowledge of DICOM, HL7 and medical imaging would be an asset <br/><br/> Experience with Unix, shell scripts, command line <br/><br/> Experience with PostgreSQL <br/><br/> Familiarity with radiology workflows <br/><br/> Experience with Angular, NativeScript, iOS, Android <br/><br/> Knowledge of front-end build tools and package management (Node, NPM, Gulp, Grunt) <br/><br/> Experience with AWS and/or other cloud infrastructure <br/><br/> Detailed knowledge and understanding of cross browser, cross platform compatibility issues and workarounds<br/><br/>Additional Information  <ul> <li>Competitive salaries</li><li>Paid time off = 30 days</li><li>Corporate bonus program</li><li>Employee recognition program</li><li>Employee referral program</li><li>Flexible hours</li><li>Comprehensive insurance plan</li><li>Training & skill upgrading</li><li>Social events</li><li>Dynamic culture</li> </ul>
Title: SOFTWARE DEVELOPER

Job_Description: <strong>It’s your experience that counts</strong><br/><br/>Rise is Canada’s complete HR-Payroll-Benefits solution that gives businesses everything they need to build loyal and productive teams — all in one place. <br/><br/> When you step through our doors, you’ll discover a workplace that brings people together to innovate and succeed. We’re a forward thinking group of individuals that believes in building strong relationships, challenging one another, and fostering an open environment of dialogue and creativity. <br/><br/> Headquartered in Vancouver, we serve hundreds of businesses and thousands of employees across Canada and have big plans to grow. We care deeply about our employee experiences and support each individual with our own HR + Benefits solution that we all trust. <br/><br/> At Rise, it goes without saying that we have a lot of fun, and we’d really love you to join us. We aim to provide you with the most positive, challenging, and transformative experience of your career.<br/><br/><strong>This could be you</strong><br/><br/>Managing people is core to every business. That’s why Rise is on a mission to dominate the people-management software market with powerful software that is a cut above the rest. Rise provides an experience that is unique in our market by focusing on modern, intuitive software and an outstanding client experience. <br/><br/> We are seeking a full stack software developer with at least three years of experience to work on the RESTful API services that power our front-end applications. The developer should be strongly familiar with Angular and Rails or a similar framework. <br/><br/> As an engineering organization, we always choose to get things done right over getting them done fast. We strongly believe that research and experimentation is fundamental to producing high-quality software and are not afraid to challenge conventional wisdom. We are looking for people who share these values and are strongly consistent with their own.<br/><br/><strong>Here’s what you’ll be doing</strong><br/><br/><strong>#1) <strong>Build a Winning Platform</strong></strong> <br/><br/> You’ll work directly with the Senior Backend Software Developer and the development team to execute on the product plan for the Rise platform. Using your extensive knowledge of software architecture, you’ll build product enhancements to the platform, improve the architecture, and develop, debug and design software applications and databases. <br/><br/> <strong>#2) <strong>Collaborate with the Development Team</strong></strong> <br/><br/> You’ll collaborate with the development team in the design, development, test, deployment and operation of the Rise platform. As a full stack software developer, you’ll deliver fast and predictable results, adjusting in an agile fashion to provide what our customers need. <br/><br/> <strong>#3) <strong>Ensure Operational Excellence</strong></strong> <br/><br/> You have a proven track record of operational success with a high attention to detail. You’ll ensure sanity of architecture, operational excellence, and quality while delivering results on time.<br/><br/><strong>Your qualifications</strong>  <ul> <li>Minimum 3 years of experience building software</li><li>Deep full-stack knowledge of client, server, tools, and internet technologies</li><li>Intermediate to advanced level experience with JS/HTML/CSS and RoR/PHP</li><li>Strong working knowledge of frontend frameworks and libraries (Angular, Bootstrap, Foundation, WebPack, Grunt)</li><li>Experience in agile methodologies with scrum</li><li>Bachelors in Computer Science or Engineering or equivalent experience</li><li>Exceptional verbal and written communication skills</li><li>Exceptional attention to detail and organizational skills</li><li>Deeply collaborative and enjoy working in a cross-departmental fashion</li><li>Driven and entrepreneurial, yet open and approachable</li><li>Willing to roll up sleeves and do whatever needs to be done to make this a great place to work</li><li>Technical knowledge and mobile app development expertise is a bonus</li> </ul>
Title: Full Stack Software Developer

Job_Description: <strong>Test Automation Developer (Python)</strong> <strong>-</strong><strong> 10-month contract role located in Montreal</strong> <br/><br/> We are recruiting for a Consulting <strong>Test Automation Developer (Python)</strong> for our client on a contract term of 10-months. There is a strong possibility of extension, so it is long-term engagement opportunity! <br/><br/> You will help the existing team by building automation solutions. <br/><br/> <strong>Qualifications</strong>   <ul> <li>5+ years experience in Python scripting</li> <li>Knowledge of UNIX/Linux environments</li> <li>Experience with source control and continuous integration systems</li> <li>Understanding of backend services and messaging protocols</li> <li>Experience with QA processes and test automation is desired</li> <li>Detailed oriented and be able to work in a fast-paced environment</li> <li>Excellent written and oral communication</li> </ul>  Please apply with a latest copy of resume in MS Word format. Having valid work authorization to work in Quebec, Canada is mandatory. <br/><br/>
Title: Test Automation Developer

Job_Description: CBC Digital Products is the countrys biggest digital startup, taking on the challenges of innovating how media is made, sent and received. We are also part of Canadas oldest and truest broadcasting company. We are trying new things. We are growing. As an entity of our own. As a voice for our country. As a team. <br/><br/> If you want to enter the world of digital media and be part of the change this is your chance. CBC Digital Products is looking an Audio-Video Developer to join our AV Platform team and drive the integration of our Digital Audio/Video Systems that deliver on-demand and live audio and video content to millions of Canadians. It is a highly collaborative, high exposure role with a chance to attend A/V integration conferences in Canada and the US. <br/><br/> If you're passionate about Canada and you love technology, learning and bringing out the best in others, youll love working at CBC. <br/><br/> <strong>Who you are and where are you now?</strong> <br/><br/> You are a Backend Developer working with large enterprise systems and developing applications to support distribution of live and on-demand audio and video content. You are looking for an opportunity to spearhead both new development and the integration of critical delivery systems for streamlining live Audio/Video workflows; middleware custom tools using various APIs; and more. <br/><br/> <strong>Whats in it for you?</strong>  <ul> <li><u>C</u>utting edge tech. You will provide technical expertise for online digital Audio/Video systems building, implementing and integrating multiple complex systems to ensure the successful delivery of A/V content.</li> <li><u>B</u>elonging. You will collaborate with our passionate and dedicated internal groups. You will work closely with Engineering, Media Presentation (Broadcasting), IT, Content Producers, Revenue, etc. to achieve integration. You want to make an impact bringing forward new tools and ideas that will meet the demand of a national audience and support the internal stakeholders need to digitally deliver as much content as we can efficiently.</li> <li><u>C</u>areer growth. You will deepen your skills as you innovate solutions to the unique challenges we face as we strive to deliver content to millions of Canadians across the country. You will gain hands-on experience with cutting edge technology and be given the opportunity to further develop through internal and external learning opportunities.</li> </ul> <strong>Why join us?</strong> <br/><br/> CBC/Radio-Canada reflects the Canadian identity and promotes democracy. We strive to represent the voices of the country and support social and economic innovation. Our values - collaboration, learning and continuous improvement- embody who we are as a people-focused, digital-forward employer. We offer a rare-in-tech work-life balance with flexible schedules, an excellent benefit package and a pension plan noted as one of the best in the country, we want to ensure you are happy in and out of the office. <br/><br/> Collaboration. We follow lean startup principles and use an Agile approach. Our dedicated people managers work closely with every individual to ensure we are leveraging their strengths, championing their ideas and supporting their pursuit of new skills and career progression. <br/><br/> Learning. From simply buying a book or recommending a course to one-on-ones, our leadership team is focused on creating an atmosphere where people feel fulfilled.Our team members are given opportunities to learn and work cross-functionally across multiple projects. <br/><br/> Continuous improvement. What can you innovate in 8 hours a week? Our Digital department at CBC recognizes just how smart, creative and inventive our team members are. From prototyping new UI/UX to setting up dev environments to experiment on and learning new programming languages to creating improved search functions for our media. Wherever your interests lie, your 20% time is yours to allocate in a productive and professionally gratifying way. <br/><br/> <strong>What you bring:</strong>  <ul> <li>Post-secondary degree in Computer Science/Engineering or equivalent.</li> <li>The direct experience. You have three years experience in software development (Java, Python, PHP). You have a proven track record of working with complex enterprise systems.</li> <li>The desire to learn. You have a keen interest in AI, Machine Learning, Product Intelligence. You can quickly pick up new tools and technologies including Video CMS such as the Platform or Brightcove; Google Advertising Platform (DFP) or Freewheel.</li> <li>The flexibility. You are available to participate in a rotating on-call shift one out of every four or five weeks, for which you will earn additional compensation.</li> <li>The interest in growing your A/V technical knowledge. You have a passion for the technologies and workflows relating to online A/V presentation:   <ul> <li>Akamai or other CDN media delivery.</li> <li>Video Streaming Delivery Protocols (RTMP, HTTP, HTTPS, TCP, UDP).</li> <li>Video Formats and Codecs (HLS, HDS, MP4, MPEG-DASH, CMAF, AV1, etc.).</li> <li>Video Encoders (FFMPEG, Digital Rapids, Vantage, Elemental).</li> </ul>  </li> <li>The extras. Nice to have experience including operating in Windows, Apple and Unix environments and a working knowledge of Apache, Tomcat, Docker/Containers, Cloud services.</li> </ul> <strong>To apply:</strong> <br/><br/> Think this job is meant for you but worried you dont have it all? At CBC we know that not everyone takes the same path when it comes to building their skills. You can read about the various backgrounds the talented people that make up our team bring to us here. <br/><br/> Hands-on experience, intelligence, innovation, a passion for learning and a team-focused approach can combine to form the best set of qualifications. If you feel you meet all or most of the qualifications we are seeking; and you are excited by the possibility of growing our company, take a chance and express your interest. <br/><br/> In becoming the leader in expressing Canadian culture and enriching democratic life, we need to be as diverse in every way as the country we serve, both within our workforce and on air. As an employer, we value equal opportunity and nurture an inclusive workplace where our individual differences are not only recognized and valued, but also extend to and pervade all the services we provide as Canada's public broadcaster.
Title: Audio Video Developer

Job_Description: We are looking for a back-end developer who will ensure we are building the best possible platform for our users. We operate properties such as: makeagif.com, perfectvalidation.com, performancemarketers.com as well as service clients on a selective basis. <br/><br/> You will have a meaningful say in what and how we build all aspects of the platform: from efficiently scaling an API to implementing a new feature used by thousands of users. <br/><br/> We value communication, enthusiasm, and an eagerness to learn. <br/><br/> <strong>RESPONSIBILITIES</strong>  <ul> <li>Write production-quality code, run tests, and iterate rapidly</li> <li>Own the implementation of highly-visible user-facing features</li> <li>Define specs with product managers, designers and other developers</li> <li>Design architecture and conduct code review sessions</li> <li>Develop innovative backend services that can scale using best technologies</li> <li>Be responsible for overall site performance and stability</li> <li>Develop custom tools and write scripts to automate processes as necessary</li> <li>Work with a team of highly web developers</li> <li>Collaborate closely with the rest of the team throughout the development process</li> <li>Assist support team members in identifying and resolving issues with the platform</li> </ul> <strong>REQUIREMENTS</strong>  <ul> <li>Experience building web-based applications</li> <li>3+ years Experience in web technologies (JavaScript, HTML, CSS, PHP)</li> <li>MVC PHP framework experience (Our legacy systems use Zend Framework, our new projects are built on Laravel/Lumen, Symfony)</li>   <li>Good knowledge of MySQL, Redis, PostgreSQL and MV* style frameworks</li> <li>PHP Testing experience (PHPUnit, Behat, PHPSpec)</li> <li>An appreciation for instituting TDD practices</li>  </ul> <strong>WHAT WE'RE LOOKING FOR</strong>  <ul> <li>Working in linux environment using the following technologies: NoSQL, MySQL, PostgreSQL, OO PHP, HTML 5, JS, JQuery and various of open source frameworks</li> <li>Solid scripting knowledge with shell ( bash, python or php ) required</li> <li>Passion for new technology</li> <li>Contributed to open-source software - advantage</li> <li>Motivation to learn new skills, programming languages and technologies</li> <li>Willingness and ability to work hard, learn and teach in this fast-paced environment</li> </ul> <strong>COMPENSATION & BENEFITS</strong>  <ul> <li>Competitive salary, Insurance (Medical, Dental and Vision)</li> <li>Parking, Office Snacks and Dual Monitor Setup</li> <li>Paid company outings and Flex hours</li> <li>Travel abroad vacation bonus</li> <li>Flexible on level of English of applicants, no French required but an asset</li> </ul>
Title: PHP Web Developer

Job_Description: Company Profile <br/><br/> Morgan Stanley is a global financial services firm and a market leader in investment banking, securities, investment management and wealth management services. With offices in more than 43 countries, the people of Morgan Stanley are dedicated to providing our clients the finest thinking, products and services to help them achieve even the most challenging goals. <br/><br/> As a market leader, the talent and passion of our people is critical to our success. We embrace integrity, excellence, team work and giving back. <br/><br/> Technology <br/><br/> The Technology division partners with our business units and leading technology companies to redefine how we do business in ever more global and dynamic financial markets. <br/><br/> Our sizeable investment in technology results in leading-edge tools, software, and systems. Our insights, applications, and infrastructure give a competitive edge to clients’ businesses—and to our own. <br/><br/> Institutional Securities Technology (IST) develops and oversees the overall technology strategy and bespoke technology solutions to drive and enable the Institutional businesses and enterprise-wide functions. Our clients include Fixed Income, Equities, Commodities, Investment Banking, Research and Global Capital Markets as well as Operations, HR and Corporate Services. <br/><br/> Position Description: <br/><br/> Morgan Stanley is looking for a strong experienced developer in Montreal who will be able to help improve its real time risk analysis systems used by derivatives traders. Our systems are meant to consistently provide large amounts of important data, at high scale, while markets are moving quickly. <br/><br/> You would be part of a development team for a system that is responsible for all of the distributed components and the associated user interfaces for said risk delivery. There are several languages and development frameworks involved (Java, C , C#, Javascript, etc) so we're interested in talking to any who have broad technical interests or who would like to explore various technical paths. We prefer to see people with some interest in finance or analytic concepts regardless of industry experience. <br/><br/> We encourage developers to contribute to the whole system rather than just individual components, so over time you'll have more freedom to develop in areas you are interested in. This also means individual developers have more ownership of project work across several components and programming languages. <br/><br/> Skill required: <br/><br/> - At least 5 years of relevant experience   <ul> <li>Strong Computer Science fundamentals</li> <li>Expert with at least one object oriented language (e.g. Java, C# or C )</li> <li>Proficient with a scripting language (e.g. Python)</li> <li>Organized and comfortable taking on projects with ambiguous requirements</li> <li>Experienced with web server architectures or front end web development</li> <li>Comfortable working in a linux environment <br/><br/> Nice to have: <br/><br/> - An ideal candidate has at least some experience working on both backend or frontend systems, even if expertise is more in one area than the other</li> <li>Interest and knowledge of capital markets and finance concepts</li> <li>Mastery of C is not required or expected but would be very valuable</li> <li>Expertise in Angular or other Javascript frameworks <br/><br/> Knowledge of French and English are required. <br/><br/> Morgan Stanley is an equal opportunities employer. We work to provide a supportive and inclusive environment where all individuals can maximize their full potential.<br/><br/></li> </ul>
Title: Senior software developer (various languages welcome!)

Job_Description: We are looking for a strong Principal Software Developer, who will have an opportunity to lead, develop and design highly scalable and performant architectures across multiple teams and set the technical direction for the entire walmart.ca FE teams. You will be responsible for driving and building prototypes for complex and large initiatives while providing guidance and insight into deep technical and performance issues. As a Principal Software Developer, you will also lead the transition of our platform to micro-app architecture and help us in evaluating best technical choices for this transition and evangelize those technical choices to other teams. You will also work closely with Product Owners, UI/UX, and other senior engineering team members to define the future architecture and system design to support new business needs.  <ul> <li>BA/BS/MA/MS degree in Computer Science or closely related field or equivalent practical experience.</li><li>12+ years of software development experience working in NodeJS, Scala, Java, Ruby on Rails or Python.</li><li>Strong knowledge of JavaScript, JavaScript Frameworks (React, Ember or Angular), CSS3, HTML5, asynchronous request handling, and AJAX in highly scalable and available applications.</li><li>Strong understanding of all the different components (Frontend, Backend, Storage, Caching layer etc) of the web application and their interactions.</li><li>Expert in building responsive UIs which are optimized for mobile devices.</li><li>Experience with persistence and caching technologies (eg. MySql, Postgres, Memcache, Redis)</li><li>Experience working with micro-services architecture and distributed systems.</li><li>Solid understanding of building RESTful APIs.</li><li>Ability to clearly and effectively communicate at all levels from development to executive levels.</li><li>A history of open-source contribution is an asset.</li> </ul>
Title: Principal Software Developer

Job_Description: <div><strong>What it’s like working at CBC/Radio-Canada</strong></div> <div><div>At CBC/Radio-Canada, we create content that informs, entertains and connects Canadians on multiple platforms. Our successes and accomplishments are driven by embodying and upholding values, which include creativity, integrity, inclusiveness and relevance.</div> <br/> <div>Do you think you have the ability and drive to keep up with this exciting, ever-changing industry? Whether it be in front of the camera, on air, online or behind the scenes, you would be joining a team that thrives on making connections and telling stories that are important to Canadians.</div></div> <div></div> <div><strong>Your team:</strong></div> <br/> <div><div>CBC Digital Products is the country’s biggest digital startup, taking on the challenges of innovating how media is made, sent and received. We are also part of Canada’s oldest and truest broadcasting company. We are trying new things. We are growing. As an entity of our own. As a voice for our country. As a team.</div><br/> <div>Digital is a part of our present and all of our future. CBC’s strategy is focused on becoming a digital-first organization that provides a digital platform for storytellers. Our mission is to engage our audience with stories they care about.</div> <br/> <div><strong>The opportunity:</strong></div><br/> <div>If you want to enter the world of digital media and be part of the change and growth of one of Canada’s long-established and respected broadcasters, this is your chance. CBC Digital Products is looking a Senior Systems Integration Developer to join our AV Platform team and drive the integration of our Digital Audio/Video Systems that deliver on-demand and live audio and video content to millions of Canadians. It is a highly collaborative, high exposure role with a chance to attend highly specific A/V integration conferences in Canada and the US.</div><br/> <div>CBC’s Audio/Video Content Management System comprises of a suite of tools used to manage the vast library of on-demand and live streaming content. Our new Integration Developer will implement and enhance the systems, workflows and presentation of A/V streaming on all platforms. As part of a core team supporting the bigger organization, this is an opportunity to work with live broadcasting machinery and content and interact with all of the teams in the department and teams across the organization.</div><br/> <div>If you're passionate about Canada and you love technology, learning and bringing out the best in others, you’ll love working at CBC.</div> <br/> <div><strong>Who you are and where are you now?</strong></div><br/> <div>You are a Backend Developer with a focus on integrating systems and implementing workflows for large amounts of audio or video streaming content. You are looking for new challenges and an opportunity to spearhead both new development and the modernization of connecting the workflows and systems.You want to join an organization that is shifting towards digital-on-demand for the web. You want to make an impact bringing forward new tools and ideas that will meet the demand of a national audience and support the internal stakeholders’ need to digitally deliver as much content as we can efficiently.</div> <br/> <div><strong>What’s in it for you?</strong></div><br/> <div><strong><u>C</u></strong>utting edge tech. CBC has more than 25 digital sites, all of which are mandated to reach Canadians online everywhere and every way, with a high emphasis on mobile devices. To achieve that goal, with no down-time, takes a robust infrastructure, powerful technologies, reliable solutions and rewarding work. Java, JEE, PHP and Python are just part of our rich technology landscape.</div> <br/> <div><strong><u>B</u></strong>elonging. CBC/Radio-Canada is a Canadian institution. By joining our dynamic Digital Products team, you will be exposed to the best of all worlds. Corporate. Public. Startup. You will be part of a team that embraces diversity and at its core, truly cares about the country and the world.</div> <br/> <div><strong><u>C</u></strong>areer growth. CBC is fully invested in our people. Whatever it is you want to pursue whether it’s a new programming language or a technical solution, whether it’s expanding your Agile knowledge or building an audience-facing platform. We will provide you with the time, resources and championing that you need to keep your career here rewarding.</div> <br/> <div><strong>How you will contribute to the team, you will:</strong></div><br/> <div>  <ul> <li>Provide technical expertise for online digital Audio/Video systems. You will integrate multiple complex systems to ensure the successful delivery of A/V content.</li><li>Collaborate with internal groups. You will work closely with Engineering, Media Presentation, IT, Content Producers, Revenue, etc. to achieve integration.</li><li>Build and implement key deliverables. You will develop delivery systems for streamlining live Audio/Video workflows; middleware custom tools using various APIs; and more.</li><li>Manage the production systems. You will oversee the complete development and support lifecycle of specific systems. You will provide quality product support to end-users.</li></ul></div> </div> <br/> <div><div><strong>What you bring:</strong></div><br/> <div>  <ul> <li>Post-secondary degree in Computer Science/Engineering or equivalent.</li><li>The direct experience. You have three years experience in software development (Java, Python, PHP), with a focus on integrating systems. You have a proven track record of administering an Audio Video delivery system. You have experience operating in Windows, Apple and Unix environments and have a working knowledge of Apache, Tomcat, Docker/Containers, Cloud services.</li><li>The hands-on A/V technical knowledge. You have a passion for the technologies and workflows relating to online A/V presentation, with hands-on experience using:  <ul> <li>Akamai or other CDN media delivery.</li><li>Video Streaming Delivery Protocols (RTMP, HTTP, HTTPS, TCP, UDP).</li><li>Video Formats and Codecs (HLS, HDS, MP4, MPEG-DASH, CMAF, AV1, etc.).</li><li>Video Encoders (FFMPEG, Digital Rapids, Vantage, Elemental).</li></ul></li> <li>The desire to learn. You have a keen interest in AI, Machine Learning, Product Intelligence. You can quickly pick up new tools and technologies including Video CMS such as the Platform or Brightcove; Google Advertising Platform (DFP) or Freewheel.</li><li>The communication skills. You know how to listen and relay empathy and understanding for diverse perspectives.</li><li>The Agile approach. You believe in the Agile methodology deeply, but you are flexible and open to the real-world twists and turns.</li><li>The flexibility. You are available to participate in a rotating on-call shift one out of every four or five weeks, for which you will earn additional compensation.</li></ul></div><br/>  <div><strong>Why join us?</strong> </div><br/> <div>CBC/Radio-Canada reflects the Canadian identity and promotes democracy. We are rooted in the communities we serve and committed to sharing stories as Canadians live them, each and every day. We strive to speak in the voices of the country and support social and economic innovation. We live these external values. They are the foundation of our employee culture. A diverse culture of collaboration, learning and continuous improvement.</div> <br/> <div>Collaboration. We follow lean startup principles and use an Agile approach. Our dedicated people managers work closely with every individual to ensure we are leveraging their strengths, championing their ideas and supporting their pursuit of new skills and career progression. Our team members are given opportunities to collaborate cross-functionally across multiple projects.</div> <br/> <div>Learning. From simply buying a book or recommending a course to one-on-ones, our leadership team is focused on creating an atmosphere where people feel fulfilled.</div><br/> <div>Continuous improvement. What can you innovate in 8 hours a week? Our Digital department at CBC recognizes just how smart, creative and inventive our team members are. Everyone is given the opportunity to choose personal projects on which to spend 20" of their time. From prototyping new UI/UX for our content to setting up dev environments to experiment on. From reviewing Apple Developer videos and learning new programming languages to creating improved search functions for our media. From updating old code to building unit testing tools. Your 20" time is yours to allocate in a productive and professionally gratifying way.</div> <br/> <div><strong>To apply:</strong></div><br/> <div>Think this job is meant for you but worried you don’t have it all? At CBC we know that not everyone takes the same path when it comes to building their skills. Hands-on experience, intelligence, innovation, a passion for learning and a team-focused approach can combine to form the best set of qualifications. If you feel you meet all or most of the qualifications we are seeking; and you are excited by the possibility of growing our company, take a chance and express your interest here.</div><br/> <div>Please click on the link to apply: http://bit.ly/2Cir71z</div></div> <div><div>Candidates may be subject to skills and knowledge testing.</div><br/> <div>CBC/Radio-Canada is committed to being a leader in reflecting our country’s diversity. That’s because we can only create and tell the stories that connect Canadians, by having a workforce that mirrors the ever-changing makeup of our country. That’s why we, as an employer, value equal opportunity and nurture an inclusive workplace where our individual differences are not only recognized and valued, but also extend to and pervade all the services we provide as Canada’s public broadcaster. For more information, visit the Talent and Diversity section of our website. If you have accommodation needs at this stage of the recruitment process, please inform us as soon as possible by sending an e-mail to recruitment@cbc.ca.</div><br/> <div>If this sounds interesting, please apply online! We thank all applicants for their interest, but only candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.</div></div>
Title: Audio/Video Systems Integration Developer, Digital Operations (English Services)

Job_Description: <strong>Description:</strong> <br/> You are an experienced, hands-on lead developer, who has led small to large teams in shipping large-scale applications. You are a mentor and guiding voice for developers, who can balance day-to-day workload, with an eye for future improvements of your team and their work. <br/><br/> As a software developer with client Digital, you will be responsible for designing, building and running the software applications which enable innovative, data-driven, customer centric digital experiences for client customers. <br/><br/> You will be working as part of a friendly, cross-discipline agile team who helps each other solve problems across all functions. As a custodian of customer trust, you will employ best practice in development, security, accessibility and design to achieve the highest quality of service for our customers. <br/><br/> We use a range of technologies to get the job done: JavaScript and Babel (ES2015-2016) coupled with Webpack, React, Redux and other libraries to provide a modern, easy to use Javascript toolchain. A central Design System is used for styling and hosts shared components, while our RESTful APIs are built with Node.js powering our custom services. Quality is a primary concern and we test our applications at multiple levels with QA and Product Owners embedded within teams. <br/><br/> <strong>Details:</strong>  <br/> Lead team members in an agile environment (we like Scrum, Kanban) <br/> Evaluate technology choices and rapidly test solutions <br/> Setting the technical vision for your team, and working with Architects to define the roadmap for the applications that your team supports <br/> Work closely with the team to solve architectural challenges <br/> Work with product owners to support translating business deliverables into technical outcomes <br/> Design scalable systems with performance and security in mind <br/> Identify and solve frontend web development issues experienced by customers <br/> Ensure a cohesive experience across different browsers and devices <br/> Advocate the use of unit testing and test driven development to drive design and development <br/> Challenge, mentor and guide the team to implement best practices <br/> Implement & Advocate accessibility best practices (We believe in an accessible web for everyone) <br/> Diagnose and evolve container-based build pipelines for your team <br/> Adapt and influence the team to create the best outcome for not only the project but also for customers <br/><br/> <strong>Minimum qualifications</strong>  <br/> Prior experience in mentoring developers and team leadership <br/> 3+ years of experience with frontend development (ES2015-2016 JavaScript, CSS) <br/> 3+ years of experience in backend development (we use Node.js, PostgreSQL, Redis) <br/> Expert level knowledge of client-side testing best practices and tooling (we use Jest, Mocha) <br/> Expert level knowledge of React and Redux <br/> Experience at excelling in a team based environment <br/> Experience mentoring juniors, overseeing code quality and evangelizing best practices <br/> Experience in translating technical concepts and requirements for non-technical stakeholders <br/> Experience designing and documenting APIs (we use Node.js, Express, OpenAPI Spec) <br/> Experience with FRP (functional, reactive programming) <br/> Experience monitoring production web services (we use Kibana) <br/> Experience with clustering technologies (we use Kubernetes) <br/> Experience designing and load-testing highly available systems <br/> Experience with the Docker ecosystem <br/> Experience with securing web applications to common security threats <br/><br/> <strong>Preferred qualifications</strong>  <br/> Familiar with accessibility (WCAG 2) best practices <br/> Experience with Web/HTTP security controls (CORS, CSP, TLS, etc ...) <br/> Experience designing, building, and maintaining High Availability systems <br/> Experience in creating and socializing technology roadmaps <br/><br/> Vous travaillez dans une équipe interdisciplinaire sympathique qui applique la méthode Agile et qui mise sur la collaboration pour résoudre les problèmes en tout genre. Pour conserver la confiance des clients et leur offrir des services de la plus haute qualité, vous appliquez les meilleures pratiques en matière de développement, de sécurité, daccessibilité et de conception. <br/><br/> Voici les technologies votre disposition : langage JavaScript et compilateur Babel (ES2015-2016) jumelés Webpack, React, Redux et dautres bibliothèques pour fournir une chaîne de compilation JavaScript simple et moderne. Nous utilisons un système de conception central pour nommer et héberger les composants partagés, alors que nos API RESTful sont conçues sur la plateforme Node.js, sur laquelle reposent nos services personnalisés. Comme nous accordons beaucoup dimportance la qualité, nous testons les applications plusieurs niveaux et nos équipes comprennent des responsables de lassurance de la qualité et des responsables de produit. <br/><br/> Attributions <br/> Diriger des membres de léquipe dans un environnement Agile; nous préférons les méthodes Schwaber-Sutherland (Scrum) ou Kanban <br/> Évaluer les choix technologiques et tester rapidement les solutions <br/> Donner une vision technique léquipe et travailler avec les architectes pour établir la feuille de route des applications quelle prend en charge <br/> En collaboration avec léquipe, résoudre les problèmes darchitecture <br/> En collaboration avec les responsables de produit, transformer les livrables en résultats techniques <br/> Concevoir des systèmes évolutifs en tenant compte de la performance et de la sécurité <br/> Cerner et résoudre les problèmes de développement web frontal qui touchent les clients <br/> Garantir une expérience uniforme entre les divers navigateurs et appareils <br/> Promouvoir lutilisation de tests unitaires et le développement guidé par les tests lors de la conception et du développement <br/> Encourager léquipe appliquer les meilleures pratiques et lui montrer comment faire <br/> Appliquer et promouvoir les meilleures pratiques en matière daccessibilité (nous croyons que le web devrait être accessible tous) <br/> Examiner et développer les pipelines fondés sur des conteneurs pour votre équipe <br/> Gérer léquipe de façon ce quelle produise dexcellents résultats selon les objectifs du Title: Web Developer 3 / Développeur web 3

Job_Description: RideCo builds technology for next generation transit. Fleet operators and public transit agencies around the world use RideCo’s cloud based ‘dynamic shuttle’ software platform to provide on-demand shared rides in dynamically routed buses, vans and cars. Our solution works in real-time at large scale across a mixed fleet of vehicles from buses to sedans in both high- and low-density urban environments. Our customers include public transit organizations and one of the largest ridesharing companies in the world. At RideCo, you can be part of this rapidly changing industry. <br/><br/> You will join a our growing QA engineering team responsible for the overall quality of RideCo’s technology, from development all the way to production. The ideal candidate will have a strong understanding of testing within a distributed software system as well as an end-to-end understanding of common QA tools and techniques. You will need strong systems experience, excellent interpersonal communication, and experience accepting and giving meaningful feedback on technical designs and implementations.<br/><br/>Responsibilities   <ul> <li>Work closely with Engineers to develop test automation strategies and frameworks.</li> <li>Build, maintain, and enhance tools that streamline and automate all forms of testing.</li> <li>Build and run automated functional, integration, stress, and performance tests.</li> <li>Run large scale simulations based on custom or real-world data to find or reproduce issues, bottlenecks, and regressions.</li> <li>Analyze and report the results of testing efforts in a clear and timely manner.</li> <li>Manual testing of mobile, web, and backend applications, as necessary.</li> </ul>  <strong>Requirements</strong>   <ul> <li>Degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or a related discipline.</li> <li>Experienced software developer or QA engineer (3+ years).</li> <li>Experience with testing mobile, web, and client/server applications.</li> <li>Strong proficiency in automation and automated testing, including functional, integration, stress, performance, and other tests.</li> <li>Strong scripting and experience building diverse, robust tooling (Python, Perl, Shell).</li> <li>Strong analytical, troubleshooting and problem-solving skills.</li> <li>Strong written and verbal communication skills.</li> <li>Outstanding attention to detail.</li> </ul>  Preferred   <ul> <li>Experience with Python programming language.</li> <li>Experience with Python web application development and testing (Django, Flask).</li> <li>Experience with hybrid mobile applications (Ionic).</li> <li>Experience with Docker and container based build infrastructures.</li> <li>Experience with the cloud (AWS, EC2, RDS).</li> <li>Experience with databases (PostgreSQL, Redis).</li> <li>Familiarity with Agile build and development processes.</li> <li>Excitement for learning new domains and new skills.</li> </ul>  About RideCo<br/><br/>RideCo is a tech startup. Fleet operators and public transit agencies in North America and Asia use RideCo’s cloud based software platform to provide on-demand shared rides in dynamically routed buses, vans and cars. <br/><br/> Have you experienced getting frustrated with public buses and switched to driving a car? What about dynamically splitting the cost of a taxi ride with others going the same way? Have you seen buses drive around in residential areas with very few passengers on-board and wondered how inefficient that seems to be? You’re likely aware of the first & last mile access challenges faced by transit hubs. We are solving these problems by re-imagining shared mobility. Imagine a world where vehicles have dynamic routes responsive to real-time trip demand. This ‘dynamic shuttle’ (or van /sedan) would pick you up, on-demand, at or near your doorstep and take you to your destination or transit hub. Along the way it may pick-up other passengers going in your direction. Your experience will be seamless: less waiting, less walking, fewer transfers, shorter travel time, and timely pickups and drop-offs. RideCo’s ‘dynamic shuttle’ platform enables this seamless experience and low-cost shared rides for vehicle fleet operators and their passengers. By seamlessly moving more people in fewer vehicles we are catalyzing a generational shift in how people get around cities and towns. This means commuters spend less time in transit and more time doing what they enjoy. <br/><br/> While there are many companies attempting to commercialize dynamic transportation solutions, RideCo is the only company that offers a solution that works in real-time at large scale across a mixed fleet of vehicles from buses to sedans in both high-density and low-density urban environments. This unique solution is based on patent-pending logistics technology developed over years of research by our engineering team. <br/><br/> RideCo’s early adopter customers include regional transit agencies as well as multi-national private fleet operators in North America and Asia. We are investing to scale up and capture the growing demand for on-demand shared rides solutions. <br/><br/> <strong>Compensation</strong> <br/><br/> Negotiable base salary + shares/stock options <br/><br/> <strong>Contact</strong> <br/><br/> Send your resume (or link to your LinkedIn profile) and cover letter to: <br/><br/> <strong>resume@rideco.com</strong> <br/><br/> <strong>Email Subject: “Quality Assurance (QA) Developer</strong>

Job_Description: Design, develop, troubleshoot and debug software programs for databases, applications, tools, networks etc. <br/><br/> As a member of the software engineering division, you will take an active role in the definition and evolution of standard practices and procedures. You will be responsible for defining and developing software for tasks associated with the developing, designing and debugging of software applications or operating systems. <br/><br/> Work is non-routine and very complex, involving the application of advanced technical/business skills in area of specialization. Leading contributor individually and as a team member, providing direction and mentoring to others. BS or MS degree or equivalent experience relevant to functional area. 7 years of software engineering or related experience. <br/><br/> <strong>Oracle is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability and protected veterans status or any other characteristic protected by law.</strong><br/><br/>Are you interested in building large-scale distributed infrastructure for the cloud? Oracle’s Cloud Infrastructure team is building new Infrastructure-as-a-Service technologies that operate at high scale in a broadly distributed multi-tenant cloud environment. Our customers run their businesses on our cloud, and our mission is to provide them with best in class compute, storage, networking, database, security, and an ever expanding set of foundational cloud-based services. <br/><br/> https://cloud.oracle.com/en_US/home <br/><br/> We’re looking for hands-on engineers with expertise and passion in solving difficult problems in distributed systems, virtualized infrastructure, and highly available services in the globally-available Oracle Compute Cloud Service. We are responsible for customer lifecycle and billing data management, backend database management and maintenance, and infrastructure commissioning, operational, and compliance tooling. <br/><br/> Candidates should have: <br/><br/> 7 years of development experience, with at least 3 years in a senior development position <br/><br/> Proven experience as a “Generalist” (Linux shell scripting and admin, python, perl, ruby, etc) <br/><br/> Experience in designing greenfield systems and defining requirements <br/><br/> Experience in formal software processes (design, peer reviews, testing) <br/><br/> Demonstrable experience in all of the following: analysis/requirements/specification, architecture/design, testing, debugging, documentation, support/maintenance <br/><br/> Background in applying and developing data structures and algorithms <br/><br/> Motivated to work independently and able to be a member of a distributed team <br/><br/> Ideally, a candidate would have: <br/><br/> A strong understanding virtualization and cloud computing <br/><br/> A familiarity with micro-service and multi-tier architectures <br/><br/> Development experience in Java (JavaSE 7 ) <br/><br/> Experience working in an Oracle RDBMS environment. <br/><br/> Experience in a continuous-release devops or agile shop

Oculus Rift, HTC Vive</li><li>Experience with Google Analytics</li> </ul> <strong>What youll be a part of:</strong> <br/><br/> · Taking care: competitive health and dental coverage (for full-time employees) <br/><br/> · Investing in your future: employee stock option purchase plan, and local defined contribution pension plans <br/><br/> · Break time: free snacks, winter holiday office closures, reduced hours in summer <br/><br/> · Party time: office bar carts, after work drinks, holiday and summer parties, and sometimes just because <br/><br/> · Be inspired: regular film screenings, concerts, and opportunity to get involved in industry events <br/><br/> · The office: modern facilities, in house screening rooms, more snacks, and swag <br/><br/> · Build a better world: transcend entertainment to our corporate social responsibility activities.
