Title: Back-end developer

Job_Description: About Covera<br/><br/>Covera is an InsurTech Startup that automates the annual process of re-shopping for home and auto insurance. We are taking on the challenge of re-inventing an unloved product by leveraging technology, new ways of thinking and alternative go-to-market strategies. We are looking for people who have an entrepreneurial mindset, are self-directed and who have a thirst for continuous personal development. <br/><br/> What you can expect from Covera: <ul> <li>A progressive & technology driven environment where team members are expected to contribute to the continuous improvement of company tools, policies, processes and resources;</li> <li>Continuous and high quality personal development opportunities using a structure built on best practices;</li> <li>Encouragement and resources to contribute to the business and incentives to share in its success.</li> </ul> What you should not expect from Covera: <ul> <li>An environment to coast by, work under the radar, and keep your head down - we will expect you to have a voice in the organization;</li> <li>An environment where there is strict division of labour - we are a Startup, everyone is required to get their hands dirty when needed.</li> </ul>  Senior Full Stack Web Developer<br/><br/>To achieve our goals, we are looking to add an additional talented senior full stack web developer who can critically analyze complex business problems and deconstruct them into elegant programmatic solutions. <br/><br/> You will be working in an agile and collaborative environment with the other members of the development and brokerage teams to implement solutions. <br/><br/> You will work across the entire stack to: <ul> <li>Be an expert in the capabilities of the Covera platform and become an expert in insurance brokering.</li> <li>Develop consumer and broker facing components of the platform, responsive PWAs written in React.</li> <li>Develop our backend platform, written in .Net Core.</li> <li>Develop learning aspects of the platform, using machine learning tools to build the next generation insurance platform.</li> </ul>  What We Need:<br/><br/>We need our new team member to have: <ul>  <li>Superior JavaScript development skills.</li>   <li>Superior C# development skills.</li> <li>Excellent communication, collaboration and critical thinking skills.</li> <li>At least 5 years of experience in a collaborative agile development environment delivering mobile first, web based software solutions.</li> <li>A Computer Science degree or equivalent.</li> <li>Demonstrable knowledge of React, Redux, Redux-Saga and Styled Components.</li> <li>Demonstrable knowledge of C#, .Net Core, Web API, EF Core.</li> <li>Demonstrable knowledge of JavaScript and .Net Core build and deploy processes.</li> <li>Experience configuring cloud environments and test automation technologies a significant plus.</li> </ul>  What we offer  <ul> <li>The opportunity to play an essential role in a funded, early-stage Startup set to compete in a massive and lucrative industry.</li> <li>Fantastic loft offices in the heart of Montreals St. Henri neighborhood.</li> <li>Competitive salaries.</li><li>Equity and stock options to own a stake within Covera.</li><li>A real and honest commitment towards challenging and developing our people.</li> </ul>
Title: Senior Full Stack Developer (React + C#)

Job_Description: Highmark Interactive (HMI) is pushing the boundaries between technology and medicine. We’re working on developing technology to help improve the efficiency and functionality of injured and non-injured brains alike. <br/><br/> In support of this goal we are seeking a new member of our team who is passionate about thinking out of the box and helping create next-generation mobile device based concussion diagnosis and therapeutics support tools. The backend and processing of the data is the backbone of our product and as the first dedicated backend engineer you will be making some incredibly important decisions for the company. You’ll get to work with other developers to expand our application’s capabilities, build new APIs and analysis systems as well as working with our medical and business teams to implement and improve our diagnosis and therapeutic accuracy. <br/><br/> HMI is dedicated to the goal of building a culturally diverse company culture and a multi-cultural workplace and strongly encourages applications from women and minorities. <br/><br/> <strong>You Will:</strong>  <ul>  <li>Design, build, document and maintain HMI’s backend servers and databases.</li>    <li>Work with other developers on the implementation of APIs, services and systems to access and utilize our data</li>    <li>Maintain and administrate HMI’s data storage backend solutions.</li>    <li>Work with the medical and business development teams to improve our product’s accuracy and value.</li>    </ul> <strong>You may be fit for this role if:</strong>  <ul>  <li>You are an out-of-the-box thinker – with an ability to learn, experiment, and engage in new technologies – and would be motivated in the field of gaming and its implications on medical diagnosis and therapeutics.</li>    <li>You are motivated by accountability and leadership and are excited about the opportunity to take responsibility for core development in a small team environment.</li>    <li>You have a very strong understanding of CS fundamentals (eg: object oriented design, data structures, algorithm design, and complexity analysis).</li>    <li>You love thinking about systems and writing high quality code.</li>    <li>You have knowledge of software engineering practices for the full software development life cycle including coding standards, code reviews, source control management, build processes, testing, and operations.</li>    <li>You are knowledgeable about various data management methodologies and are intimately familiar with NoSQL database design techniques.</li>    <li>You have previous experience building systems that use Java, Spring and Docker.</li>    </ul> <strong>Bonus:</strong>  <ul>  <li>Experience in Data Science and Data Analytics.</li>    <li>Knowledge around data protection especially data encryption and data storage standards.</li>    <li>Any experience with expert system strategies, machine learning.</li>    <li>Experience with distributed software development techniques.</li>    <li>2-4 years experience in building backend server components</li>    <li>NoSQL Graph databases, specifically Neo4j.</li>    </ul> <strong>You will work on:</strong>  <ul>  <li>Building and leading a top tier team of backend developers.</li>    <li>Developing and improving on our backend services for our customer and user facing applications.</li>    <li>Building new APIs for communication between our user-facing app and our backend.</li>    <li>Create and administer our data storage solutions and our backend data stack.</li>    <li>Work with our medical, business and marketing teams to analyze data and improve our diagnosis and treatment plans.</li>    <li>Create and maintain both the test and service environments for our applications.</li>    </ul> <strong>You’ll receive:</strong>  <ul>  <li>Competitive salary</li>    <li>Comprehensive benefits package (health, dental, and vision)</li>    <li>Generous time off policies:</li>    <li>3 Weeks vacation</li>    <li>5 Sick days</li>    <li>5 Mental health days</li>    </ul>
Title: Senior Back End Developer

Job_Description: <div>The App DevOps team enables our consumers to experience Canadian tire through new and emerging digital channels. Retail is changing in Canada and Canadian Tire is on the leading edge of this transformation. To us, culture comes first and is based on support and teamwork.</div> <br/> <div>In Winnipeg, we are investing in creative people to build world-leading software to enhance the Canadian Tire retail experience and continue to support and augment them in an evolving industry. We expect our Winnipeg lab to refocus the lens retail is experienced through by revitalizing current applications and cultivate new digital experiences.</div> <br/> <div><strong>Responsibilities:</strong></div><br/> <div>To be a part of the team, you must have experience in building applications with high performance connecting to several backend Web Services exchanging data with complex systems. Strong knowledge of modern best practices for professional software development including secure coding standards, code reviews, source control management, build processes, testing, and operations. Experience developing native mobile applications connecting to Secured Web Services and familiarity with security standards for API’s, SSL, and Tokens is highly preferred. Design patterns while creating the functionality outlined in the requirement document and convert functional requirements into user interface designs and prototypes, and developed application(s). Work closely with the UI/UX design team to ensure feasibility of implementation of designs</div><div>  <ul> <li>Utilize different languages & web platforms to create scalable web and mobile applications based on business requirements.</li><li>Interface with internal project owners, creative team members and developers to ensure that the applications, experiences and websites display and function as expected.</li><li>Able to code and develop features that leverage in-app purchases, eCommerce, engaging experiences and social media integration.</li><li>Convert Mobile App, Digital Display and Website design specifications (wireframes and mock-ups) into working software.</li><li>Provide recommendations and solutions that meet business needs while ensuring an intuitive and best-in-class end user experience.</li><li>Play an active role and take ownership of optimization and performance activities for our interactive digital experiences.</li> <li>Collaborate within the App DevOps team and key stakeholders to incorporate the business requirements based on research informed solutions for both psychological and physical elements that will enhance the customer journey and overall experience</li><li>Participate at all phases of the software development life cycle and work with the team via Agile programming practices (such as Scrum or Kanban) to drive team delivery.</li> <li>Leverage your past experience with version control software, such as Git or Perforce to communicate and enforce sound code control practices within the development team.</li> <li>Effectively develops and encourages clean, well structured, easily maintainable code bases.</li><li>Executes a regular cadence of Code Reviews and shares feedback throughout the team.</li> <li>Consult on browser capability and rendering to ensure that proposals and development will work on specified platforms.</li><li>Experience working with remote data via REST and JSON.</li></ul></div><br/>  <div><strong>Qualifications:</strong></div><div>  <ul> <li>Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science, Engineering preferred or equivalent Software Development industry experience.</li> <li>5 years of Web or App development experience.</li><li>Holds a passion for client-side development and a strong background in building highly dynamic web apps leveraging a Javascript stack with HTML5, REST, CSS3, jQuery, and working knowledge of Cordova.</li> <li>Has practical knowledge and experience with Git, Gulp, and Node.JS.</li><li>Functional and practical understanding of JavaScript MVC frameworks leveraging Ionic and Angular.</li> <li>Experience with CSS frameworks and pre-processor’s similar to Bootstrap, Sass or Less.</li> <li>Development experience on server side JavaScript.</li> <li>Experienced with software architecture and design patterns.</li><li>Adapted to leveraging a Scrum/Agile development methodology and is passionate about optimizing process to keep agility high.</li> <li>A meticulous eye for detail; finding and correcting the little issues that turn substandard experiences into best-in-class.</li><li>Possesses some native programming experience for Android using Android Studio, Android SDK, and related languages (Java).</li><li>Knowledge of Android M and N features and differences from prior versions</li><li>Experience with testing frameworks, continuous integration and build tools (i.e. jUnit, DBUnit, Jenkins/Hudson)</li><li>Proficient in writing automated Unit tests (Jasmine / Karma).</li><li>Advanced knowledge of JavaScript Single Page Applications and related tools.</li><li>Experience working with Unity 3D game engine is an asset, with a practical understanding of C#, Boo or Python.</li> <li>Experienced using and automating tests, documentation, builds and deployment.</li><li>Large scale application development an asset.</li></ul></div><br/>  <div><strong>What would success look like:</strong></div><br/> <div>As the successful candidate for the App Developer role on the Canadian Tire App DevOps team you would challenge the norm, push for excellence in everything and always seek discomfort. Everything you do and everything you are responsible for you will be on display for all of our consumers. Life in Canada depends on you and your expertise to make our digital experiences engaging and rewarding.</div> <br/> <div>From the agile path you will be involved from the initial concept through to product delivery and be part of the decisions, direction and all facets that will impact the experiences we bring to Canadians. As a successful Developer you will never stop learning by keeping on top of changes with coding standards such as HTML5, CSS3, and responsive design functions.</div> <br/> <div>In a pinch you fall back on guiding principles whether that be following Stack Overflow blogs, learning how to work directly with the UX designers, UI Developers and team members or spending time creating and refining a well-designed process methodology.If you enjoy looking outside of Web Development and into other areas such as 3D or possess a familiarity with Unity, we would love to hear from you.</div>   <br/>Canadian Tire is an equal opportunity employer. We are committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace for all. We recognize that our future success depends on the perspectives and contributions of all our employees -- their diverse backgrounds, abilities and experiences make our business stronger. If you are contacted for a job opportunity, please advise us of any accommodations needed to ensure fair and equitable access throughout the recruitment and selection process. All accommodation information provided will be treated as confidential and used only for the purpose of providing an accessible candidate experience.
Title: Sr. Developer - Canadian Tire Corporation - Winnipeg, MB

Job_Description: Cineplex is one of Canada's leading entertainment companies and operates numerous businesses including theatrical exhibition, food service, amusement gaming (Player One Amusement Group), alternative programming (Cineplex Events), traditional and digital media (Cineplex Media and Cineplex Digital Media), out of home leisure and entertainment (The Rec Room), eSports (World Gaming), and home entertainment content (CineplexStore.com). Cineplex is also a joint venture partner in SCENE - Canada's largest entertainment loyalty program. <br/><br/> We are proudly a Canadian company with approximately 13,000 employees in Canada and the US, and we offer competitive compensation, incentive and benefits programs. To learn more about Cineplex please visit our website at www.cineplex.com. <br/><br/> <STRONG>Cineplex Digital Media (CDM)</STRONG> is a fully integrated, in-store digital merchandising provider with well over a decade of research, development and design experience. We provide strategically designed installations and customized creative to enable brands to effectively communicate with audiences in ways they never imagined. Using proprietary, state-of-the-art technology, and patented software, we have developed some of the world's largest and most complex digital merchandising networks. <br/><br/> The Cineplex Digital Media division of Cineplex Entertainment Limited Partnership currently has an opening for the position of <STRONG> Senior Software Developer</STRONG> , reporting to the Sr. Manager, Software Development, Cineplex Digital Media. <STRONG> This position will be based out of our Cineplex Digital Media office located at 369 York Street in London, Ontario.</STRONG>  <br/><br/> As a Senior Software Developer you will be implementing innovative designs that make our solutions and services the market leader in In-Store Digital Merchandising. As a key member of a highly collaborative agile development team, the Senior Software Developer will work with a cross-functional team in all layers of the system including UI, backend services, device, automated test, and automated deployment. The Software Developer is expected to possess high initiative and has the ability to take leadership and work in a collaborative team environment and has excellent expertise and experience in software development lifecycle and quality engineering. <br/><br/> The Senior Software Developer will work closely with multiple teams, including: Business Development, UX Design, Operations, in developing new consumer-facing Web applications, improving/maintaining existing ones and addressing users' needs, experience and usability requirements. <br/><br/> <strong>Position Responsibilities:</strong>  <ul> <LI>Active participation in Agile development process including iteration planning, estimation, retrospective, standup and cross training</LI> <LI>Take leadership in design, implementation and code reviews; mentor junior members of the team</LI> <LI>Design and implement high quality Web applications using HTML, CSS, JavaScript, PHP, Ajax and REST/JSON API's</LI> <LI>Design and implement web services using JAVA, PHP, REST, SOAP</LI> <LI>Design and implement automated test cases for UI and system integration</LI> <LI>Participate in maintain, upgrade, optimization of existing solutions</LI> <LI>Involve in updating automated deployment script</LI>  </ul>  <strong>Education and Experience:</strong>  <ul> <LI>A BS or MS degree in Computer Science, Mathematics or other related technical disciplines</LI> <LI>Above 5 years of experience in a mature engineering organization building packaged software products</LI> <LI>Experience of architecting, designing and implementing enterprise-scale applications with OO approach</LI> <LI>Experience in side-side Web technologies including: Java, Servlet, JAX-WS, JAX-RS, PHP</LI> <LI>Experience with HTML4/5, CSS, JavaScript, XML, JSON, AJAX</LI> <LI>Experience with relational databases and SQL</LI> <LI>Experience in the digital signage, promotion, and advertisement or related industries would be a significant asset</LI> <LI>Strong communication skills and ability to work across team/product-unit boundaries</LI> <LI>Proven ability in problem solving, decision making and leadership</LI> </ul>  Interested applicants please apply today. <br/><br/> <STRONG>While we appreciate all interest, only those candidates selected for an interview will be contacted. As part of Cineplex Entertainment's standard recruitment process, suitable candidate(s) will be required to undergo pre-employment screening as a condition of employment or promotion.</STRONG>  <br/><br/> <STRONG>No Agency Calls Please</STRONG> <br/>
Title: Sr. Software Developer - Cineplex Digital Media (DV62)

Job_Description: We are working with a large client for a Back-end Java Developer for a 12 month contract opportunity. <br/><br/> In this role you'll work as part of team of developers working on projects associated the Telecommunications solutions. <br/><br/> In this role you will: <br/><br/> - Work with your team to create innovative solutions focusing on utilizing Java and Back-end technologies <br/><br/> - Develop and build your solutions <br/><br/> - Be involved in the deployment and release of your products <br/><br/> - Contribute to post production support and change requests as required <br/><br/> Requirements and Experience for this role:  <ul>  	<li>Strong experience as a Developer with Solutions creation experience (5 years)</li> <li>Previous experience with Java development focusing on Core Backend Java</li> <li>Previous experience with SQL and other Database technologies</li> <li>Experience with any Telecommunications experience like OSS or BSS is a strong assett</li> <li>Web Services experience is nice to have</li> <li>Ability to create innovative solutions and contribute to ideation sessions</li> <li>Agile foundational knowledge</li> <li>Cloud experience is an advantage</li> </ul> If you are interested in this role please apply today! <br/><br/> Please note only candidates with eligible Canadian working rights will be considered for this role.
Title: Back-end Java Developer - Contract

Job_Description: <strong>Job Description:</strong> <br/><br/> Our client is a rapidly growing application development firm in Quebec City, and offer a great work environment in an excellent location in Quebec City. Working with them, you'll have a chance to build tools that make an impact, while developing extremely valuable skills. <br/><br/> A successful candidate must display a high degree of tenacity, ingenuity, independence, and flexibility to work in various fields of expertise. You must also have strong software engineering skills, including an appreciation for all aspects of the software development process. <br/><br/> You should apply to this job offer if:   <ul> <li>You want to work on projects where you are implementing creative solutions to real problems that require deep understanding of the problem space.</li> <li>You constantly challenge yourself and others to come up with better solutions.</li> <li>You enjoy working side by side with partners, colleagues and teams on tough problems.</li> <li>You never shy away from a challenge.</li> <li>You enjoy learning new technology and always ask "why" we do something the way we do it.</li> <li>You seek for better team processes and foster change when required, leaving every team and process better than you found it.</li> <li>You enjoy leading teams & managing projects when required.</li> </ul>  Position Requirements (they want smart people. Not "specific" experience. They're happy to teach you what you don't know, as long as you want to learn): <br/><br/> <strong>Experience:</strong>   <ul> <li>Full-stack experience with and a passion for building web apps from start to finish, backend (Rails, Python, or Java) to frontend (JavaScript, HTML, CSS)</li> <li>Strong experience with object-oriented design and coding skills</li> <li>Experience in design and implementation of modern web application</li> <li>Experience dealing well with ambiguous/undefined problems; ability to think abstractly</li> </ul>  <strong>Asset Experience:</strong>   <ul> <li>Highly proficient in design and implementation of modern web applications</li> <li>Ability to effectively articulate technical challenges and solutions</li> <li>Experience in integrating open source technologies in a production environment</li> <li>Experience with RESTful service development, HTML5, CSS3, Responsive Design, and CSS Frameworks.</li> <li>Experience on continuous delivery and in build and deployment processes.</li> <li>Knowledge of content management systems (CMS) - no preferences.</li> <li>Experience with JavaScript frameworks such as AngularJS, React/Redux.</li> <li>Fluent in HTML, CSS, and JavaScript.</li> </ul>
Title: Full Stack Developer

Job_Description: Skip is growing at a rapid pace and with that, we will need to expand our elite team of software developers and engineers to advance the innovation and improvements of our existing technology. We’re looking for talented and experienced React developers that can create the future of our industry leading tools and redefine what it means to stay ahead of game. <br/><br/> People need to eat so Skip never sleeps, and that means the show runs around the clock. We’re looking for people who want the chance of contributing to build a world-class tech company right here in the Canadian Prairies. <br/><br/> The skills you’ll need: <ul> <li>Experience developing, releasing, and maintaining React.js or React Native apps</li><li>Solid understanding of ES6, JSX, and Node</li><li>Deep familiarity with debugging, performance measurement, and test-driven development</li><li>Experience building large scale responsive web applications</li><li>Solid understanding of REST principles and exposure to backend APIs</li><li>Mastery of HTML5 and CSS3</li> </ul> People we’re looking for: <ul> <li>Have a great attitude and are proven self-starters</li><li>Keep hustling and are able to work through rejection</li><li>Thrive in a rapidly changing environment</li><li>Understand that a fast growth company is not a 9-5 job, it's a lifestyle!</li> </ul> What it’s like to work at Skip: <ul> <li>Fast paced entrepreneurial environment</li><li>Exposure to leading-edge technology</li><li>Advancement opportunities for high contributors</li><li>Merit-based compensation & benefits</li> </ul>
Title: Senior React Developer

Job_Description: We believe that no enterprise should have to choose between data security, regulatory compliance, and ROI. <br/><br/> That’s why we’ve made it our mission to help organizations take full advantage of multi-cloud cost-efficiency, resilience, agility, and scale — with full assurance their data is protected, compliant and with IT controls that extend across the cloud. <br/><br/> We’ve reinvented software-defined object storage by combining the cost and resource efficiency of the object storage approach with exceptionally strong, blockchain-hardened data protection and the capacity to manage data on a petabyte scale. <br/><br/> We're growing rapidly, and we’re looking for a Blockchain Developer to join our team. <br/><br/> <strong>What does the job entail?</strong> <br/><br/> Blockchain is evolving quickly. <br/><br/> We’re building a brand-new team with an initial emphasis on research and rapid prototyping, though fully expect to launch production software in the very near future. This is an opportunity to join us as an early core team member and help define our product. <br/><br/> <strong>What does the successful candidate “look like”?</strong> <br/><br/> We’re a fast-paced start-up, so we need versatile self-starters who are motivated by new technologies and will jump right in. We’re not overly hung up on what languages you’re most comfortable with, but we are focused on hiring those with a learning mindset and are comfortable working in a rapidly evolving environment. <br/><br/> We don’t expect to find someone that is a perfect match to the details below, but here are the typical bullet points that we’re hoping you bring to the table:  <ul> <li>5+ years of software development experience (Java/C/C++).</li>  <li>Experience developing and deploying backend applications.</li>  <li>Experience creating web services and RESTful APIs.</li>  <li>Understanding of cryptographic algorithms, application security architecture, security standards, and secure development best practices.</li>  <li>Distributed database experience.</li>  <li>Success working with customers, sales, and customer-focused teams to understand unique requirements.</li>   <li>A passion for agile development.</li>  <li>A great sense of humour :).</li> </ul> In a perfect world, you’d also have:  <ul> <li>Technical knowledge of public/private blockchains.</li>   <li>Experience developing distributed ledgers and smart contracts, and APIs for applications to interface with the blockchain.</li>  <li>Cryptography / computer security background, with expertise in any of FIPS 140-2, PKI, network security, IoT security, cloud security, web services security.</li>  <li>A strong understanding of DevOps, Jenkins, continuous build/test/deploy systems.</li> </ul> <strong>What’s in it for me?</strong> <br/><br/> We’re a small team with the heart of a start-up. We treat each and every person that joins us as a VIP, and everyone has the opportunity to make a significant impact on the success of our business. Although we don’t have a go-kart track and beach volleyball pit on our premises, we’re big on providing autonomy, mastery, and purpose, and ensuring that our employees have a strong life-work balance. <br/><br/> We create awesome technology with awesome technology, our leadership has been around the block a few times and knows what leading a rapid growth tech company is like, and we treat our people like our biggest asset and differentiator; because they are. <br/><br/> <strong>What can I expect when I submit my application?</strong> <br/><br/> Our recruitment partner – <strong>Pivot and Edge</strong> – will review your application and either schedule a conversation with you or let you know that we’re passing on your candidacy within 5 business days. <br/><br/> <strong>What does the interview process involve?</strong> <br/><br/> The first step is a conversation with Pivot and Edge. They’ll focus on the human side of things and answer any questions you may have. From there, we’ll provide an opportunity for those that exhibit a high potential to be successful in our environment to demonstrate their technical capabilities and then talk shop with some of our engineers and leaders. Assuming you’re one of our finalists, we’ll be sure to give you a tour of the office and introduce you to some of your future teammates. <br/><br/> We’re not just interviewing you. <br/><br/> We want to make sure that we’re the right fit for each other, so please feel encouraged to interview us at every step. <br/><br/> <strong>What is the target start date for this role?</strong> <br/><br/> We’re motivated to hire for this role now, though worst case scenario we’d like to have our new teammate onboard by the end of April. <br/><br/> <strong>What if I have more questions before I apply?</strong> <br/><br/> No worries at all! If you have additional questions prior to submitting your application, please feel free to reach out to <strong>John Fleischauer</strong> at Pivot and Edge. He accepts all connection requests on LinkedIn and does his best to reply to all messages within 24 hours. <br/><br/> <strong>About Us:</strong> <br/><br/> <strong>Leonovus</strong> is a cloud solution software provider that offers the leading software-defined object storage solution (SDOSS) and governance, risk management and compliance (GRC) solution for the modern enterprise. Designed with the IT manager in mind, Leonovus’ patented algorithms virtualize, transform and disperse data across a network of on-premises, hybrid or multi-cloud storage nodes – allowing for the most secure yet internally accessible form of object-based data storage that provides GRC across the entire solution. The advanced architecture minimizes latency, optimizes availability, reduces remote backup costs and meets data sovereignty requirements. With its software and hardware agnostic design, Leonovus provides petabyte scalability and allows the enterprise to utilize its existing idle storage resources, extend the usable lifespan of depreciated resources and improve the enterprise’s overall ROI. <br/><br/> Leonovus is an equal opportunity employer. Should you require accommodation in any aspect of our selection process, please contact <strong>Vanessa Martone</strong> of Pivot and Edge at vanessa.martone@pivotandedge.com / 613-599-4339 x 224.
Title: Blockchain Developer

Job_Description: We are searching for a Full Stack Developer to join our team. <br/><br/> As a tech company, Bellesa is faced every day with unforeseen coding challenges. If you are passionate about programming, eager to contribute to a dynamic business and feel excited by the notion of overcoming problems and challenges, then please read on. <br/><br/> <strong>Responsibilities</strong>: <br/><br/> As a member of Bellesas tech team, you will have a mandate to contribute to all aspects of the web development cycle, and must be willing to expand your knowledge base and put in hours solving tech problems that might fall outside your areas of expertise. Your key daily tasks include:  <ul> <li>Develop, implement and maintain backend applications running on PHP and MYSQL.</li> <li>Work with the core front end technologies, including ReactJS, HTML5, Javascript, jQuery, CSS, etc.</li> <li>Be prepared to respond to an array of technical requests from company management.</li> <li>Respond directly to Bellesa CTO.</li> <li>Analyze technical processes in order to generate solutions.</li> <li>Regularly audit the website in search of areas for improvement, not limited to: design, SEO, performance, or expanding functionality.</li> </ul> <strong>Requirements</strong>:  <ul> <li>Bachelors degree in Computer Science/Engineering or equivalent with prior experience at a small company where you had a high level of responsibility.</li> <li>Excellent knowledge of web technologies in ReactJS, PHP, MYSQL HTML5, Javascript, jQuery, CSS.</li> <li>Strong knowledge of database technologies to scale for high volume web sites.</li> <li>Strong knowledge of dealing with large systems including logging and reporting.</li> <li>Excellent analysis, problem-solving and communication skills.</li> <li>Ability to deal with constantly changing technical priorities.</li> <li>Strong command of the English language.</li> </ul> <strong>Benefits of working for Bellesa</strong>:  <ul> <li>Gain a ton of experience working with a small team in a growing company.</li> <li>Dynamic, fast-paced work environment.</li> <li>Subvert many of the outdated trends of traditional pornography.</li> <li>Office directly across from the beautiful Lachine canal, right around corner from Atwater market.</li> </ul> We are looking for people whose passion translate into results; people who are not only unafraid to break the mold, but are excited by the very prospect of it. We are looking for individuals who always have the wheels turning- if that means our phones ringing at 3 AM because you had a stroke of genius that just couldnt wait until the morning, then even better. <br/><br/> We are looking to integrate talented, bold trailblazers at the ground-floor of our company. Were a dynamic group here at Bellesa and were looking to work with people who have the passion, the skills and the vision necessary to become an immediate contributor. If this sounds like you, then you are exactly who we are looking for <br/><br/> We invite anyone who feels like lightning struck while reading this to apply to this job listing.
Title: Full Stack Developer

Job_Description: <strong>Job Requisition ID</strong>: 9761 <br/><br/> Software Engineering at HMH is focused on building fantastic software to meet the challenges facing teachers and learners. Enabling and supporting a wide range of next generation learning experiences. We design, and build custom applications and services used by millions. We are creating teams full of innovative, eager software professionals to build the products that will transform our industry. <br/><br/> We are staffing new, small, self-contained teams of engineers with people who love solving problems, building high quality products and services. We are looking for people with a wide range of skills, who can contribute broadly bringing the right tool to the right job. We use a wide range of technologies, and are building up a next generation services platform that can make our learning tools and content available to all our products, and someday to the world. If you want to make a difference in the lives of students and teachers, and understand what it takes to deliver high quality software, we would love to talk to you about this opportunity. <br/><br/> <strong>The Opportunity - Staff Developer</strong> <br/><br/> Staff Software Engineers will own and be technology leaders of the highest impact projects. These engineers have a background of exceptional technical competence in taking ownership of a high impact project and leading the design and development of this product across the full technology stack from inception to production. They set the bar for a team for technical excellence, acting as engineering role models and mentoring Software and Senior Software Engineers. They will be subject matter experts in certain verticals, but will have expertise for the full technology stack with the knowhow to apply the right technology to the job. The Staff Engineer will improve technology practices and methodologies within the group and communication across the organization. Often apply outward thought leadership, representing HMH in industry groups and open-source communities. Staff Engineers are good communicators and great team players and with an added ability to communicate and pitch ideas, concepts and Architectures to senior stakeholders. <br/><br/> <strong>Responsibilities:</strong> <ul> <li>Contribute code to complex projects.</li><li>Engineering leader and influencer for the development team of 5-10 engineers.</li><li>Program-level solution design/technology and product evaluations.</li><li>Applying subject matter expertise on improving technology practices, standards and methodologies within the group</li><li>Communication across the organization.</li> </ul> <strong>Skills & Experience Required:</strong> <ul> <li>Minimum 10 years of experience.</li><li>Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or related field.</li><li>Exceptional technical competence that includes a portfolio of thought leadership and individual technical.</li><li>Proven track record as a leader in initiating, architecting and building distributed and scalable solutions across the complete stack, including front end, backend, web services and database layers.</li><li>Expertise in a wide range of technologies is preferred with the know-how to choose and apply the right technology for the job.</li> </ul> Développer des logiciels extraordinaires pour supporter les défis que rencontrent chaque jour professeurs et élèves, c'est la mission des équipes d'ingénierie logicielle à HMH. Nous travaillons pour créer une vaste palette d'expériences d'apprentissage nouvelle génération. Nous conçevons et développons à grande échelle des applications et des services utilisés par des millions d'utilisateurs. Nos équipes de développement créatrices sont en pleine croissance pour transformer notre industrie en profondeur. <br/><br/> Nous nous organisons en petites équipes de professionnels qui aiment résoudre les problèmes et développer des produits et des services de haute qualité. Nous recherchons des collaborateurs multi-talent, qui peuvent contribuer largement et trouver les bons outils pour chaque situation. Nous utilisons des technologies variées pour développer nos services, nos outils d'apprentissage et nos contenus. Vous voulez faire une différence dans la vie de millions d'enseignants et d'élèves ? Vous savez comment livrer du logiciel de haute qualité ? Nous aimerions vraiment avoir une conversation avec vous ! <br/><br/> <strong>L'opportunité: Développeur Logiciel en Chef</strong> <br/><br/> Possédant une longue expérience de prise en charge de solutions technologiques complexes, de la conception à la livraison et à l'exploitation, le Développeur Logiciel en Chef est un modèle d'excellence technique et un mentor pour les équipes. Il possède une expertise poussée dans certains domaines, mais aussi une connaissance large de l'ensemble des technologies, qui lui permet d'appliquer les bons outils aux bons problèmes. Il contribue significativement à l'amélioration des pratiques et des méthodes. Il représente HMH dans les groupes de travail de l'industrie et dans les communautés open-source. Bon communicateur, il est capable de proposer des idées, des concepts et des architectures techniques à tous les niveaux de l'entreprise. <br/><br/> <strong>Rôle et Responsabilités</strong> <ul> <li>Contribuer du code à des projets complexes.</li><li>Leader technologique et influenceur pour des équipes de 5 à 10 personnes.</li><li>Conception technologique de larges produits, évaluation de produits.</li><li>Amélioration continue des pratiques, standards et méthodes de développement.</li><li>Communication dans l'organisation.</li> </ul> <strong>Connaissances et Experience</strong> <ul> <li>10+ années d'expérience</li><li>Baccalauréat en informatique ou comparable.</li><li>Compétence technique exceptionnelle.</li><li>Expérience démontrée à initier, conçevoir, développer et faire évoluer des solution distribuées et scalables comprenant front-end, back-end, services et bases de données.</li><li>Expertise dans une variété de technologies et capacité d'utiliser les technolgies appropriées à chaque problème.​​​​​​​</li> </ul> <strong>ABOUT US:</strong> <br/> Houghton Mifflin Harcourt (NASDAQ:HMHC) is a global learning company dedicated to changing people’s lives by fostering passionate, curious learners. As a leading provider of pre-K–12 education content, services, and cutting-edge technology solutions across a variety of media, HMH enables learning in a changing landscape. HMH is uniquely positioned to create engaging and effective educational content and experiences from early childhood to beyond the classroom. HMH serves more than 50 million students in over 150 countries worldwide, while its award-winning children's books, novels, non-fiction, and reference titles are enjoyed by readers throughout the world. Follow HMH on Twitter, Facebook and YouTube. For more information, visit http://careers.hmhco.com <br/><br/> <strong>PLEASE NOTE:</strong> <br/> Houghton Mifflin Harcourt is an equal employment opportunity employer and participates in E-Verify. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment and will not be discriminated against on the basis of gender, race/ethnicity, gender identity, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, disability, or other protected group status. <br/><br/> *LI-MD1
Title: Staff Software Developer/Développeur Logiciel en Chef

Job_Description: Java Configuration Analyst <br/><br/> The Select Group is in search of a Java Configuration Analyst to join a growing company located in Downtown Toronto. The Java Configuration Analyst will be responsible for configuring and maintaining a proprietary application. This analyst will interact primarily with an internal project team, business analysts, project managers, and developers to understand the needs of the client. Their daily responsibilities will be focused configuration, and the top technologies they will be working with will be XML, Java, and SQL. This client is looking for passionate and energetic analysts to join their team and if that is you, please send your resume ASAP to thivya@selectgroup.com. <br/><br/> <strong>Java Configuration Analyst Responsibilities:</strong> <br/><br/> Working with a project team to configure a web-based proprietary application based on the needs of the client <br/> Demonstrating analytical problem solving skills and attention to detail <br/> Using XML, Java, and SQL daily to configure <br/> Interacting with GIT hub, Jira, Oracle & SQL databases, and AWS <br/><br/> <strong>Java Configuration Analyst Requirements:</strong> <br/><br/> 5 years experience as a software analyst or configuration specialist <br/> A strong understanding of XML, and ability to configure products in XML <br/> Basic development experience with Java programming language and spring framework <br/> Familiarity with Oracle and SQL databases <br/> Basic front end development experience with Javascript, HTML, and CSS <br/><br/> If you are ready to take on the next step in your career, and this seems like a great opportunity for you, please send your resume and contact information to Thivya at thivya@selectgroup.com <br/><br/> The Select Group provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, genetic information, marital status, amnesty or status as a covered veteran in accordance with applicable federal, state, and local laws. The Select Group expressly prohibits any form of unlawful employee harassment based on race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, national origin, age, genetic information, disability or veteran status. <br/><br/> Software develop engineer application config xml java backend consultant <br/><br/> Software develop engineer application config xml java backend consultant
Title: JAVA DEVELOPER /CONFIGURATOR

Job_Description: <strong>Job Description</strong> <br/><br/> An established startup in the healthcare industry is looking for a Senior Full Stack Developer to work directly with their Lead Developer and engineering team at their Toronto office. This company is a web and mobile SaaS-based app providing a digital therapy platform that helps people overcome mental health concerns and reducing the barriers associated with preventative mental health measures. <br/><br/> You will be responsible for developing new applications through lifecycle, provide strong team leadership advancing the vision of their product, and suggest methods and new technologies to increase effectiveness moving forward. The ideal candidate will have a strong development background in Java, Spring, JavaScript, and Angular, and a strong desire/willingness to work in a startup environment. <br/><br/> <strong>Skills/Requirements</strong> <ul> <li>BS degree in Computer Science or equivalent</li><li>3+ years of working experience in a full stack capacity</li> <li>Strong backend experience using Java/Spring</li><li>Strong frontend experience using JavaScript/Angular</li><li>Expert understanding of Microservices architecture, and RESTful web services</li><li>Willingness to work in startup environment</li> </ul> <strong>Benefits</strong> <ul> <li>Competitive base salary + bonus</li><li>3 weeks of vacation</li><li>Stock option plan</li><li>Full benefits package</li> </ul> <br/><br/> <strong>Salary: 130,000</strong>
Title: Senior Full Stack Java Developer for VC Funded Healthcare Startup

Job_Description: <strong>Job Description</strong> <br/>  <br/> Have you been the mastermind behind a stellar UI? Are you passionate about turning design concepts into killer workable applications? Are you a CSS ninja with a passion for the latest trends in technology? If so, you could be a great candidate for our Front End Developer role. <br/><br/> Our client understands that design isn’t just about how things look; it’s about how they work. Hundreds of thousands of end-users use our platform, and while we engineer incredibly elegant software under the hood, the reality is that most customers and their users judge our technology by what they see and experience. <br/><br/> On behalf of one of our clients in Victoria, Brainhunter Systems is looking for some talented Front End Developers to fulfill permanent openings. In this position, you’ll be involved in both internal development projects and external client projects, from concept to completion. We’re looking for someone bright and talented with strong technical skills. The ideal candidate will be dependable and reliable with a focus on execution. Although this role isn’t specifically design-oriented, we would love to see candidates with experience building user interfaces where the interaction between users and software is as intuitive as possible. We want to know that you understand server-side code and have experience making both the client and server-side of web applications work smoothly together. <br/><br/> This position offers the opportunity to build new skills and gain experience in a young, dynamic, and growing company with an evolving design team. Depending on the overall skill set, we’re interested in candidates at all experience levels. We’re looking for the right fit for the role and the team. <br/><br/> <strong>Responsibilities:</strong>   <ul> <li>Production, modification and maintenance of web application’s user interfaces</li> <li>Cross-browser compatibility testing</li> <li>Work with backend developers to build and implement user interfaces</li> <li>Involvement in the design and implementation for the full user experience of our suite of Geocortex products and services</li> </ul>  <strong>Qualifications:</strong>   <ul> <li>Experience with HTML5, CSS and JavaScript</li> <li>Experience with responsive development and cross-browser testing</li> <li>Knowledge of web and mobile UI design standards and patterns</li> <li>Knowledge of UX best practices</li> <li>Excellent communication and interpersonal skills</li>   <li>Ability to multi-task, prioritize and meet deadlines</li>   <li>Ability to create UI mockups and storyboards would be an asset</li> </ul>  <strong>How to Apply:</strong> <br/><br/> <strong>Online:</strong> <br/><br/> Apply online now at www.Brainhunter.com <br/><br/> <strong>Email:</strong> <br/><br/> If you would prefer to email a copy of your resume for later review, we would be pleased to consider your resume for future upcoming opportunities. You can email your resume to Resumes@Brainhunter.com <br/><br/> <strong>Company Overview:</strong> <br/><br/> BRAINHUNTER provides staffing and recruitment for full time, part time, contract and consulting services. BRAINHUNTER also provides payroll management services and a comprehensive suite of HRIS IT, ATS, and CRM software. BRAINHUNTER is a Microsoft Certified Partner, HP Alliance One Partner, Telus Business Solutions Partner, Oracle Partner, and ranked among the top Global Recruitment Industry providers. BRAINHUNTER leverages ISO 9001:2000 certified processes, industry best practices, and unique loyalty programs for the individuals that we represent. We are dedicated to our clients, consultants, and our community. Apply now or contact one of our experienced recruiters to help you find the right job for your personal skills and experience. <br/><br/> Let your Talent Flow <br/><br/> www.Brainhunter.com
Title: Front End Developer

Job_Description: <div><div><div><div><div>Senior Big Data Developer <br/><br/> About Rakuten Kobo Inc. <br/><br/> Created by booklovers for booklovers in 2009, Toronto-based Rakuten Kobo Inc. is one of the world’s leading and most innovative eReading services, offering a world-class catalogue of over 5 million eBooks to millions of customers in 190 countries. Kobo delivers the best digital reading experience through creative innovation, award-winning eReaders, and top-ranking mobile apps. Kobo is a part of the Rakuten group of companies. Kobo offers the opportunity to work in a cutting edge, lightning-fast startup environment where you’ll have a decisive hand in building the next big thing in eReading using the latest technology available. <br/><br/> <strong>The Role:</strong> <br/> Our Big Data team delivers unique and personalized experiences directly to millions of readers around the world. <br/><br/> We are seeking a Senior Big Data Developer to join our team. The ideal candidate has strong software design and programming experience, expertise in machine learning and Big Data technologies, and strong communication and management skills. <br/><br/> You will be part of a diverse, flexible, and collaborative environment where you will be able to apply and develop your skills and knowledge working with unique data and exciting applications. <br/><br/> Software Engineering <ul> <li>Design and develop backend services to store and process data in new ways.</li><li>Build, optimize, and deploy production-quality code for our search, recommendations and content analysis research projects.</li><li>Build on frameworks such as Spark, Hadoop, Storm, Flume and Hive to implement innovative solutions and technologies.</li><li>Integrate with 3rd party and other in-house teams’ APIs.</li><li>Own, architect and design new services.</li><li>Provide leadership on many levels both inside and outside the team</li> </ul> Qualifications: <ul> <li>Undergraduate degree or equivalent in Computer Science, Computer or Electrical Engineering, or related field.</li><li>5 years or more experience with multiple mainstream programming languages such as Python, Java, C++, C#, Go, etc.</li><li>Expertise in designing, implementing, testing and deploying software solutions.</li><li>Comfort operating on the command line in Linux.</li><li>Experience working with distributed Big Data tools such as Spark, Hadoop, Storm, Hive and Flume is an asset, but is not required.</li><li>Machine Learning, Statistics, or related knowledge is an asset.</li> </ul> Candidates will be required to complete a coding test as part of the interview process. <br/><br/> Rakuten Kobo Inc. is an equal opportunity employer. Accessibility accommodations for candidates with disabilities participating in the selection process are available on request. Any information received related to accommodation needs of applicants will be addressed confidentially. <br/><br/> Rakuten Kobo Inc. would like to thank all applicants for their interest in this role however only qualified candidates will be shortlisted.</div> </div>  </div>  </div> </div> <br/>
Title: Senior Big Data Developer

Job_Description: <strong><u>About Us</u></strong> <br/><br/> Do you want to be a part of something disruptive and change an entire industry? Do you want to be a part of a best-in-class culture? Do you want to be in the first wave of individuals to help shape the growth of a company? If you are excited about anything you just read, we'd love for you to be a part of the Upchain team! <br/><br/> At Upchain, we are looking to turn the PLM (Product Lifecycle Management) industry on it's head. By 2021, many project the SaaS PLM industry to be worth over $40 Billion USD, and we are driven to make our mark! We have the product, we have the vision, and we have the plannow we need a great team to execute! <br/><br/> <strong><u>Job Description</u></strong> <br/><br/> To do this we need the help of experienced full stack developers who are dedicated, versatile, methodical and able to do this without a lot of direction. You'll work with other talented team members to build our enterprise and cloud service that allows our customers to build their products at a global scale. <br/><br/> We are a well funded startup with a fun work culture that thrives on working with other smart and motivated people. <br/><br/> <strong><u>Full Stack Developer Duties & Responsibilities:</u></strong>  <ul>  	<li>Architect new features and get feedback from the team while documenting this so that others can understand</li>  <li>Plan and break down large features into itemized tasks working with the management team to schedule them</li>  <li>Develop features along the full stack (backend, database schema, front end, deployment) in an iterative fashion with our scrum based process.</li>  <li>Write unit and integration tests for new and old features</li>  <li>Design and develop load tests for the system</li>  <li>Identify problems in the product and ways it can be improved</li>  <li>Help other team members through mentoring, code reviews, and design reviews</li>  <li>Work with DevOps and other staff to get changes into production in a way that can be easily managed</li>  <li>Debug application issues in all environments including production</li> </ul> <strong><u>Full Stack Developer Qualification & Skills:</u></strong>  <ul>  	<li>UNIX command line experience</li>  <li>SQL</li>  <li>All aspects of web applications including REST APIs, database models, user front ends</li>  <li>Unit testing and a commitment to quality</li>  <li>Initiative to work autonomously</li>  <li>Proper development workflow including code reviews, automated builds, bug tracking</li>  <li>Experience debugging full stack systems including performance issues</li>  <li>Designing features and helping to plan the tasks to build it</li> </ul> Ideally you would also have experience with:  <ul>  	<li>Go, NodeJS, Java OR the desire to learn these quickly</li>  <li>GWT, AngularJS OR the desire to learn these quickly</li>  <li>Server management experience (DevOps or IT Admin)</li>  <li>Other database experience is an asset: Redis, ElasticSearch, etc.</li>  <li>Cloud stack experience (AWS, GCP, Azure)</li>  <li>Writing documentation for APIs</li>  <li>Database query optimization and profiling</li>  <li>Setting up all aspects of a development environment including build server, code style, listing, etc.</li> </ul>
Title: Full Stack Developer

Job_Description: Interested in being a part of a team that is leading the evolution of retail in Canada? <br/><br/> Embracing and driving change is critical to our success. The complexity and rate at which the retail industry is transforming has increased exponentially in recent years and we are committed to being a leader in the industry. As such we are relentlessly focused on innovating at every level of our business, investing in new technologies and products, and doubling down on the best talent to drive the company forward. It is an especially exciting time to join the Canadian Tire Family of Companies. <br/><br/> Our IT team plays a critical role in our evolution, specifically as we transition to an omni-retailer where digital complements the physical. Our commitment to being a world-class digital organization is evident in how we are using cutting-edge technologies to bring our digital strategy to life in-store, online and on your mobile devices, ultimately improving customer experiences, driving traffic, and boosting loyalty. <br/><br/> The App DevOps team enables our consumers to experience Canadian tire through new and emerging digital channels. Retail is changing in Canada and Canadian Tire is on the leading edge of this transformation. To us, culture comes first and is based on support and teamwork. <br/><br/> In Winnipeg, we are investing in creative people to build world-leading software to enhance the Canadian Tire retail experience and continue to support and augment them in an evolving industry. We expect our Winnipeg lab to refocus the lens retail is experienced through by revitalizing current applications and cultivate new digital experiences. <br/><br/> <strong>What you’ll do</strong> <ul> <li>To be a part of the team, you must have experience in building applications with high performance connecting to several backend Web Services exchanging data with complex systems.</li> <li>Strong knowledge of modern best practices for professional software development including secure coding standards, code reviews, source control management, build processes, testing, and operations.</li><li>Experience developing native mobile applications connecting to Secured Web Services and familiarity with security standards for API’s, SSL, and Tokens is highly preferred.</li><li>Design patterns while creating the functionality outlined in the requirement document and convert functional requirements into user interface designs and prototypes, and developed application(s). Work closely with the UI/UX design team to ensure feasibility of implementation of designs.</li><li>Utilize different languages & web platforms to create scalable web and mobile applications based on business requirements.</li><li>Interface with internal project owners, creative team members and developers to ensure that the applications, experiences and websites display and function as expected.</li><li>Able to code and develop features that leverage in-app purchases, eCommerce, engaging experiences and social media integration.</li><li>Convert Mobile App, Digital Display and Website design specifications (wireframes and mock-ups) into working software.</li><li>Provide recommendations and solutions that meet business needs while ensuring an intuitive and best-in-class end user experience.</li><li>Play an active role and take ownership of optimization and performance activities for our interactive digital experiences.</li><li>Collaborate within the App DevOps team and key stakeholders to incorporate the business requirements based on research informed solutions for both psychological and physical elements that will enhance the customer journey and overall experience</li><li>Participate at all phases of the software development life cycle and work with the team via Agile programming practices (such as Scrum or Kanban) to drive team delivery.</li><li>Leverage your past experience with version control software, such as Git or Perforce to communicate and enforce sound code control practices within the development team.</li><li>Effectively develops and encourages clean, well structured, easily maintainable code bases.</li><li>Executes a regular cadence of Code Reviews and shares feedback throughout the team.</li><li>Consult on browser capability and rendering to ensure that proposals and development will work on specified platforms.</li> </ul> <strong>What you’ve done</strong> <ul> <li>Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science, Engineering preferred or equivalent Software Development industry experience.</li><li>5 years of Web or App development experience.</li><li>Holds a passion for client-side development and a strong background in building highly dynamic web apps leveraging a Javascript stack with HTML5, REST, CSS3, jQuery, and working knowledge of Cordova.</li> <li>Has practical knowledge and experience with Git, Gulp, and Node.JS.</li><li>Functional and practical understanding of JavaScript MVC frameworks leveraging Ionic and Angular.</li><li>Experience with CSS frameworks and pre-processor’s similar to Bootstrap, Sass or Less.</li><li>Development experience on server side JavaScript.</li><li>Experienced with software architecture and design patterns.</li><li>Adapted to leveraging a Scrum/Agile development methodology and is passionate about optimizing process to keep agility high.</li><li>Experience with testing frameworks, continuous integration and build tools (i.e. jUnit, DBUnit, Jenkins/Hudson)</li><li>Proficient in writing automated Unit tests (Jasmine / Karma).</li><li>Advanced knowledge of JavaScript Single Page Applications and related tools.</li><li>Experienced using and automating tests, documentation, builds and deployment.</li><li>Large scale application development an asset.</li><li>Experience developing reusable APIs, consuming web services (REST) and processing data (XML/JSON)</li><li>Experience with both iOS Objective-C and Swift 2.0 required, Swift 3.0 or Android Studio, Android SDK, and related languages (Java) a big plus!</li> </ul> <strong>Why us</strong> <br/><br/> Canadian Tire is one of Canada’s most iconic and diversified companies. Our culture and values uphold our pledge to sustainable practices, and commitment to our local communities through Jumpstart cannot be beat. <br/><br/> To learn more about this team and the Canadian Tire Family of Companies follow us on LinkedIn.<br/><br/>Canadian Tire is an equal opportunity employer. We are committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace for all. We recognize that our future success depends on the perspectives and contributions of all our employees -- their diverse backgrounds, abilities and experiences make our business stronger. If you are contacted for a job opportunity, please advise us of any accommodations needed to ensure fair and equitable access throughout the recruitment and selection process. All accommodation information provided will be treated as confidential and used only for the purpose of providing an accessible candidate experience.
Title: Senior DevOps App Developer - Canadian Tire - Winnipeg, MB

Job_Description: About SuiteSpot<br/><br/>At SuiteSpot we are on a mission to transform the way real-estate is managed and operated at scale. We're well-funded startup in Toronto, building a product that is well underway. SuiteSpot combines tens of years of industry experience with the latest SaaS technologies to deliver products and insights that streamline our customers' operations and help them stay ahead the curve. <br/><br/> Our core values are Passion, Integrity and Execution. They guide all of our decisions, every day.<br/><br/>Who you are   <ul>   <li>Youre a junior/intermediate Full-Stack Developer</li> <li>An out of the box thinker and innovator along the way</li> <li>You have excellent attention to detail and you like to move fast</li> <li>You have an entrepreneurial mindset, are ready up roll up your sleeves, and wear multiple hats</li> <li>Love what you do and take pride in the impact that you make to the company!</li> <li>You enjoy working with others in a highly collaborative environment</li> <li>You live and breathe product, and are always learning new ways of building the right product, for the right audience</li> <li>You're equally happy learning something new or teaching others something you've learned</li> <li>You're looking for a company that will appreciate you for your excellence</li> </ul>  <br/> What you'll be doing<br/><br/>Dream features and live code. Be part of our technical team and make your contribution during all stages of the development effort: feature design, coding, QA and delivery. We are passionate about the value our products deliver for our customers and proud of our engineering craft. We like to keep our code base well architected, clean, testable and scalable.<br/><br/>What you should have   <ul>   <li>Experience in a startup environment</li> <li>Strong software design, development and testing skills acquired through a compelling academic background or practical work experience.</li> <li>Fluency in Javascript/Typescript is required. Our stack is based entirely on Typescript with Angular 2+ on the frontend and NodeJS on the backend. We use MongoDB as the main data store. We deploy to the cloud using Docker.</li> <li>Experience with HTML5 and CSS3 is required.</li> <li>Experience with automated testing frameworks (Protractor/Selenium/WebDriver) and continuous integration systems (Circle CI, Travis, etc.) is a plus.</li> <li>Experience with mobile development frameworks Apache Cordova, Ionic 2+, is a plus.</li> </ul>  <br/> What's in it for you   <ul>   <li>Join an early stage startup that aims at nothing short of changing the world.</li> <li>Work with some of the best and brightest in the industry</li> <li>Friendly environment with flexible hours</li> <li>Competitive compensation package</li> <li>Learning culture (we insist)</li> <li>Build products that delight customers with a team that shares your passion for technology in a fast and agile, no red-tape environment.</li> <li>Grow with us and be an early part of the success story with a comprehensive stock option plan, competitive pay and benefits.</li> </ul>
Title: Full Stack Developer

Job_Description: Description:   About Us\:  The AIR MILES® Rewards Program has earned the trust and support of more than two-thirds of Canadian households. For over two decades, we have helped our Partners use Canada’s most widely accepted loyalty currency, AIR MILES® reward miles, to influence customer behavior, drive profitability, and build long-term relationships.  Check us out – LoyaltyOne on Stack Overflow | LinkedIn | Glassdoor | Facebook |Twitter  Engineering Team Culture\:  We are polyglots\: We believe in using the best tech stack for the job. We’ve written scripts in Python and built APIs in Scala, Java, Akka, and Node.js. We deploy everything to the Cloud.  We pair program\: You pick your machine\: Windows or Mac. Our floors are open space with no cubicles or private offices, regularly pair programming and mobbing when working. Teams have hack days at least once a month when they take a break to work on anything they want, and most of the time their creations end up in our production environment. Communication is key to our approach, and we don't want to hinder it with walls, real or metaphorical.  We are Agile\: Development methodologies mean different things to different people. For us? We have a story card wall and release a few times a week. We keep the team in sync with daily stand-ups and have a retrospective once a month to discuss things that are going well and opportunities for improvements. We surround teams with everything they need, Scrum Masters to coach us on the process, Product Owners to make sense of the work, Pod Leaders to help with our careers and Competency Leads to facilitate technical design and provide mentorship in advanced technical skills.  Types of projects we work on\:   As part of the AM Next team, you will be building the next generation Air Miles Reward Program platform. This new Cloud-based platform will focus on quality and security while providing massive data scalability and real-time data ingestion, processing, and consumption. We are finding new ways of working that allow us to continuously improve delivery of value with high levels of cadence and quality.   Qualification:  What we look for in you\:  Ability and desire to work in our collaborative environment\: open team room, pair programming and fluid interactions with all products and operations teams  Focusing on building solutions utilizing an agile approach; leveraging close relationships with Product Managers, communicating and digesting real-time feedback, and working smart to build story cards on daily basis  You have experience building large scale distributed systems, based on reactive principles, that are flexible, loosely-coupled and scalable  You believe that Cloud is the future and you have experience managing some of them - AWS, Azure, Google Cloud Platform or IBM Cloud  We know there are endless tools and technologies, and we don’t expect you to come in as an expert on everything, but you are looking forward to experimenting and learning.  Air Miles Perks\:  Hack Days\: one day a month you work on projects that interest you to improve your craft   Training\: from hackathons to conferences, to instructor lead, building your competency is our priority About LoyaltyOne  LoyaltyOne is part of the successful Alliance Data family of companies that provide the full range of data-driven loyalty, marketing and credit solutions in more than 80 locations across the globe.  Working with more than 100 leading brands in the retail, financial services, grocery, petroleum retail, travel and hospitality industries to profitably change customer behavior. Through a team of businesses, including one of the leading coalition loyalty programs in the world, the AIR MILES® Reward Program, LoyaltyOne designs, delivers and manages a suite of services focused on consumer data, customer-centric retail strategies, direct-to-consumer marketing, loyalty consulting and more.   LoyaltyOne has broadened its horizons geographically by growing Precima in the European market. With the recent acquisition of BrandLoyalty in the Netherlands, LoyaltyOne has gained the expertise of a global leader in short-term loyalty campaigns, along with a client network that extends throughout Europe and Asia.     About ADS   Alliance Data® (NYSE\: ADS) is a leading global provider of data-driven marketing and loyalty solutions serving large, consumer-based industries. The Company creates and deploys customized solutions, enhancing the critical customer marketing experience; the result is measurably changing consumer behavior while driving business growth and profitability for some of today's most recognizable brands. Alliance Data helps its clients create and increase customer loyalty through solutions that engage millions of customers each day across multiple touch points using traditional, digital, mobile and emerging technologies. An S&P 500 and Fortune 500 company headquartered in Plano, Texas, Alliance Data consists of three businesses that together employ more than 16,000 associates at approximately 100 locations worldwide. www.alliancedata.com    Alliance Data is an Employment Opportunity employer. Accordingly, we will make reasonable accommodations to respond to the needs of people with disabilities in accordance with legislation.  Alliance Data participates in E-Verify.
Title: Backend Developer

Job_Description: Looking to work for an awesome team? You've come to the right place! Our developers are a tight-knit group, and we are pushing for substantial product development as we continue looking to grow the team in the next year. We value passion for quality, maintainable, and scalable code, and for building awesome products. A side benefit of developing for the restaurant industry is that once we’re done working hard, we have some great clients who can always provide amazing venues for unwinding with our close knit team. TouchBistro is looking for several Backend Developers at the Intermediate or Senior level here in our Toronto office. Our POS system is evolving and our customers are demanding more product capabilities. As a member of our agile Technology team, you will have the chance to work on our current or next-Gen product's web features. Our current stack is ReactJS and NodeJS but if you have worked with other frameworks that is also sufficient. To apply for this position, you must possess a minimum 1+ years of production experience using NodeJS and SQL databases. The development team is poised for growth and along with that comes with many opportunities to learn different skills as well as have a growth path internally.   YOUR DAY-to-DAY Using JavaScript, design & implement features to help our restaurant customers succeed Create a new API using NodeJS and SQL databases on the backend Keep Up-to-Date with best practices and tooling from the JavaScript community Fearlessly Collaborate with your team to solve problems and learn from failures   ALL ABOUT YOU Knowledge of modern JavaScript, HTML5, CSS3 1+ Years of Experience with NodeJS 3+ Years of experience using a backend language (we use Node, but Java, Ruby on Rails, Python, etc. is also acceptable) Some exposure to SQL or NoSQL databases Test Driven Development Experience working on teams in an agile-scrum environment 4 year College Diploma or University Degree  WHY CHOOSE US? TouchBistro is an award-winning iPad Point of Sale system, built for restaurant people by restaurant people. We’re a team of thinkers, builders, doers, and innovators. While many of us have experience working at restaurants, some of us just have a true passion for the industry. We’re venture backed by some of the best tech VCs in the world and are partnered with top innovators in the mobile, food, and payment industries. We’re global and growing! TouchBistro is used in more than 100 countries worldwide and has offices in NYC, Austin, Chicago, London and headquarters in Toronto. We’re a fast-moving, ever-evolving company on a mission to change the way restaurateurs do business and help them succeed through our products and services, but we need talented, passionate people to help! So, what do you say? Are you ready to become part of something awesome?  TouchBistro believes in fostering an inclusive workplace where all individuals have an opportunity to succeed. Requests for accommodation due to a disability can be made at any stage of the recruitment process.
Title: Backend Developer

Job_Description: Our Mission: Modern Money Movement.Instant Financial is disrupting the standard notion of ‘payday’ by giving workers daily control over their earned income. We allow people to live better lives by fixing the misalignment between when people get paid and when they need their money. Employers who pay with Instant enjoy greater access to the best employees as well as high employee retention and engagement. All of this translates into a better, more profitable business. We have started the payroll revolution and need talented passionate people to join the Modern Money Movement.We are dreamers who have a proven track record of making big things happen. We do this by inspiring ourselves and those we work with to do what others cannot do. We know that we must move together as a team, celebrate our successes, and above all learn quickly from the mistakes we know will be made due to the fast pace of our execution. We carry ourselves with urgency, honesty and integrity in everything we do. Together, we truly believe we can empower working lives.About the Team: We're a small but high-performing team of engineers, building SaaS and mobile technologies for a rapidly growing organization, led by a founding team with a proven track record.We embrace Agile and DevOps practices and tools to ensure the delivery of high quality software with a high release velocity. We have a well defined product and technology roadmap in support of a very healthy sales pipeline. We have a highly efficient flat structure and ambitious growth plans.Our stack is JavaScript-based (including with Node/Express microservices). Most importantly, we work in a collaborative environment of continuous learning - we expect you to challenge us as much as we challenge you!About You: You're an intermediate to senior full stack developer with JavaScript skills. You're passionate about building web and mobile applications and you’ve had experience delivering production-grade software.You thrive in fast-paced environments where you have lots of independence and ownership. You keep up-to-date with new technologies and trends, and you're eager to learn. You live and work with honesty and integrity, you carry your work with a healthy sense of urgency, you truly believe in teamwork, and you're not afraid to be held - or hold others - accountable for what must be done.What You'll Bring: Several years experience developing production-quality software at high scaleDegree in Computer Science, or equivalent experienceAbility to learn new technologies and paradigms rapidlyStrong JavaScript skillsFamiliarity with non-relational databases such as MongoDBProficiency in a Linux environmentDeep knowledge of web technologiesExcellent spoken and written EnglishBonus Assets: Test automationWorking in an Agile+DevOps development environmentWriting Node-based microservicesWriting microservices in a framework such as ExpressAny JavaScript framework such as Angular, React, or similarJOIN US!Are you so excited about taking on this challenge, and about what we stand for, that by now you can barely sit still? Then go ahead and send us your application, we would love to hear from you.We want authentic, passionate, hard-working people who will embrace this challenge, make it their personal goal to give it all they got, and leave a legacy while knowing that, by doing so, they are truly improving the lives of everyone that touches our solutions.Referral Reward: Know someone qualified for this role? You can receive a CAD $3,000 referral reward (paid 90 days after hire) by referring them to us.Job Type: Full-time
