Job_Description: Who we are: SPORTLOGiQ is the leading provider of advanced analytics data for professional sports teams and broadcast media. As a Senior Back End Developer, you will work with the product development team to develop our next generation advanced analytics platform, providing our users with powerful analysis tools using SPORTLOGiQ’s unique data set. This is a once-in-a-lifetime opportunity to help shape the future of sports analysis, coaching and media storytelling.What you'll do: Collaborating with the product development team to iteratively define, design and implement the backend of SPORTLOGiQ’s hockey analysis system, from data collection to data reporting and the web UI.Owning the back end software design and architecture.Define and implement the REST API used by data analysis and collection tools as well as the customer facing Web UIs.Optimizing API and database for maximum speed and scalabilityManage testing and ensure robustness of the backend infrastructure codeManaging the deployment toolchain * Working effectively with the product development and design team to ensure back end features meet front end requirements properly.What you need: Minimum 5+ years’ experience as a Back-End Developer, Database Developer or similar related role.Significant experience of building secure, scalable RESTful APIs (PHP, Python).Significant experience working with databases and datawarehousing systems (PostgreSQL)Experience using cloud based platforms such as AWS / HerokuExperience in C++ programming a plus.Experience with FFMPEG/h264 a plus.Proficient understanding of code versioning tools, such as GitBachelor’s degree in Computer Science, or Computer Engineering.Passion for hockey a nice plus!What we offer: Extremely competitive salary/bonus programCentralized and accessible location in trendy Mile-EndCompetitive benefits packageFlexible work scheduleJob Type: Full-timeEducation:Bachelor's

Job_Description: Sinitic is a Canadian startup that helps businesses automate multilingual customer support with our conversational AI technology.  We're recruiting a backend engineer with at least 3 years of python experience, to join our team of experienced developers. We're looking for someone who strives to write good quality code, loves learning about new topics and likes sharing their knowledge : -)  The backbone of Sinitic consists of several python micro-services communicating mostly through a message queue server. Our clients include call-centers with 24/7 operations, therefore testing and high-availability are critical to us.  Your responsibilities will also include improving our engineerings standard and processes, doing code reviews, improving our test coverage as well as making sure all the critical paths are monitored in our production environment, to ensure a high level of quality.  Job benefits:  Competitive compensation 30 vacation days Sick and compassionate leave Flex hours Sponsored inter-office transfer and Visa assistance Gym membership & team activities Macbook Pro + screen Multicultural work environment  Ideally, you can offer these skill sets:  Able to organise its own schedule based on management's priorities 3+ years of experience writing python 3 code for backend services, at ease with asyncio Familiar with message queue servers and event sourcing Able to write SQL queries using outer joins and group by Good understanding of how to write scalable code in a highly available environment. Excellent verbal and written communication in at least 2 languages

Job_Description: Talented Software Engineers are critical to OANDA’s business success: as a software company - our products are only as good as the people who create them. With that in mind, OANDA looks for highly intelligent, innovative, and dedicated technology professionals. Duties & Responsibilities: Working within a Linux / Solaris environment, you will research, design, test, implement, and maintain online and backend trading and data services infrastructure applications. Work closely with OANDA’s business and technical leadership to understand business requirements, and will collaborate with development team members to design and write applications systems and programs. Participate in project management and will contribute to the architecture and design process of the backend trading systems. Finally, you will test and debug applications to ensure proper performance, and will be responsible for developing/modifying program documentation.   Qualifications: At least 5 years of post-graduate working experience in a software engineering role. A University degree in computer science, computer engineering, or a related field. A graduate degree would be an asset. Solid application development experience using C++ Relevant experience in the development of Internet-ready applications programs using Internet communications protocols (TCP/IP). Experience with UNIX / Linux / Solaris operating systems. Technical insight to achieve the best possible results in a timely manner Proven ability to innovate in ways that contribute to the success of the business. A strong team orientation combined with the drive and ability to contribute at the individual level. Exceptional communications skills – both oral and written. Developer experience with scripting languages such as Python would be an asset.  OANDA Global Corporation is a diverse and global team with offices around the world. We value the unique skills and experiences each individual brings to OANDA. We are committed to creating and sustaining a collegial work environment in which all individuals are treated with dignity and respect and one which reflects the diversity of the community in which we operate. We provide an inclusive and accessible environment for everyone. Candidates selected for an interview will be contacted directly. If you require accommodation during the recruitment and selection process, please let us know. We will work with you to provide as seamless a recruitment experience as possible.

Job_Description: BACKEND DEVELOPER  LOCATION: TORONTO Let’s Talk About You  You want to Own Your Career. You’re serious about rising as far and as fast as your work and achievements can take you. And you’re ready to write the next chapter of your career story: a challenging and rewarding role as a Capco Back-End Developer.  A Word About Us  Capco – Forming the Future of Finance  Capco is a distinctly and positively different place to work. Much more than consultants, we are active participants in the global financial services industry. Our passionate business and technology professionals enjoy a unique environment where they are actively encouraged to apply intellect, innovation, experience and teamwork. We are dedicated to fully supporting our world class clients as they respond to challenges and opportunities in: Banking, Capital Markets, Finance Risk & Compliance, Insurance and Wealth and Investment Management. Experience Capco for yourself at capco.com.  Let’s Get Down To Business  Capco is looking for talented, innovative and creative people to join our Innovation Labs development team to work on a number of projects and applications within the Digital practise.  We are looking for Developers, particularly with Java experience, who can Work on multiple projects for different clients to design, develop and support back end services, integrating with a variety of external services and products exposing restful apis for a variety of consumer applications.  Fitting that description, you will also need to be supremely personally motivated to work in a team where clients become colleagues too.  Responsibilities Mentor and train junior developersProduces high quality complex deliverables with minimal input from stakeholdersManage full software lifecycle for medium complexity projects from requirements, to design, to implementation, to testingDevelop and maintain back end solutions using cutting edge technologies and productsWork with Scrum Masters and product owners to priorities and deliver solutions using an Agile environmentBuild reusable code and libraries for future use and follow emerging technologies  Show Us What You’ve Got  It will be very useful if you have some or all of the following skills and experience: Background working with object oriented programming languagesStrong organizational and communication skillsExperience building, testing and troubleshooting microservices and RESTful APIsExceptional knowledge of Database technologies – RDBMS or NoSQLExperience working in an Agile environmentExperience working with code versioning toolsExperience working with cloud technologiesExperience working with build, packaging and continuous integration tools and frameworks  Professional experience is important. But it’s paramount you share our belief in disruptive innovation that puts clients ahead in a tough market. From Day One, your key skill will be to perceive new and better ways of doing things to give your clients an unfair advantage.  Now Take The Next Step  If you’re looking forward to progressing your career with us, then we’re looking forward to receiving your application.

Responsibilities: Develop responsive web services.Design, implement, and test Debug problematic code Work alongside mobile designers and implement design with attention to detail Document source code Problem solving and debugging  Desires Skills: 2-3 years experience with PHP, Python, RoR or Java Experience in working within a team environmentExperience with REST/SOAP web services Experience with codeigniter, cakephp or zend is plusExperience with GAE is plus Experience working in a Mac or Unix environment Experience with parsing / writing XML, JSON Comfortable with OO programming Familiar with source code control systems  Please Note: This is an in-House only opportunity. We exclusively work with companies that are looking to make a difference in the mobile space and make it an integral part of their customers' lives. We specialize in ideating, designing and engineering apps and sites for smartphones, tablets, and devices everywhere for commerce, loyalty, payment, wallets, location-based and transactional branded experiences. Plastic Mobile is headquartered out of Toronto and New York City powered by the best creative minds, mobile strategists and software engineers designing and building world-class mobile experiences. Job_Description: We’re ecobee. Born and raised in Canada, we're making living more comfortable with simply designed smart home devices that aren’t just smart for our users—but for our planet too. We invented the world’s first smart Wi-Fi enabled thermostat and continue to innovate the next generation in technology that is connecting the home.  Our hive, headquartered in Toronto, is growing quickly and we are specifically looking for Developers for our fantastic Server Chapter, of varying levels of experience.  We have customers who rely on our products across North America, and as a result, have a pretty nifty and quite technologically advanced Server environment that manages a massive amount of devices and data.  The team mindset is entrepreneurial and futuristic. We thrive on solving complex problems with elegant solutions.  Some of the cool stuff you’ll be working on: As a Software Developer you’ll use leading edge technologies to innovate highly concurrent, primarily Java-based server applications that directly impact ecobee’s success. We encourage the freedom to investigate and evaluate new technologies to solve complex problems. As a result, your input will have a significant impact on our company and objectives.  You will work on product squads of diverse composition (other Server Developers, Front End developers, QA, Site Reliability Engineers, Product Stakeholders, Creative/Design), and be an Ambassador for the "back end"; applying your craft to contribute to the squad's success.  Who you are: You like to continuously challenge yourself by finding new and better ways to solve complex problems.  You don’t mind learning new technologies if it means getting you there sooner.  The bigger the challenge, the better. You want to fearlessly dive into issues of concurrency, management of massive data sets, security, redundancy, fail over, and everything else you imagine a successful IoT company would need to consider.  You have at least one year of experience coding in Java, are interested in furthering your core Java knowledge, and eager to compliment it with other server-side technologies like Kafka, databases of varying nature, all sorts of Google Cloud and Amazon Web Services trinkets, Voice Assistant integrations (Alexa, Google), and more.  As we also use GO and Kotlin, you're not shy of mixing it up because you understand the importance of "the right tool for the right job".  You understand the craft of software development, and its elements: automated testing (Unit, Integration, End-to-End tests), continuous integration and deployment, and everything Clean Code.  The fundamentals of software engineering are very important to you: complexity (timing) of algorithms, the right data structure for the problem at hand.  You know databases, SQL and otherwise.  You are familiar with how to get your code "live", from getting it reviewed, merged into a production GIT branch, and orchestrated on the cloud or in a datacenter.  You are comfortable scripting in Linux for automation.  You keep your ear to the ground in the community to keep up with movements in the industry via blogs, tutorials, books, videos.  What we are offering:  Truly meaningful work that effects our planet A unique field in hardware/software interaction – easy to share the product with friends and family! Ability to work on IoT products using new emerging technologies Small collaborative teams where you can impact both product and culture Parental Top-Up Program (75% top up or 5 bonus days off) for all full-time employees taking Parental Leave Flexible schedules and work from home days Learning opportunities supported by an education fund for every employee Community support through our ecobee acts program Frequent Town Halls for company transparency Get in early at a growing (private) company with stock options Build new things + find new solutions – were growing to make room for new products! Are you the one we need? If so, we would love to hear from you! ecobee is committed to workplace diversity and will provide accommodation to applicants with disabilities throughout the hiring process.  Are you the one we need? If so, we would love to hear from you!  ecobee is committed to workplace diversity and will provide accommodation to applicants with disabilities throughout the hiring process.

Job_Description: Backend Developer, Digital Products (English Services) - TOR06201  Job Family Media Production Primary Location Toronto Position Language Requirement English Only Language Skill Levels (Reading / Writing / Speaking) - - - Status of Employment Permanent Work schedule(s) Full-time  Description  What it’s like working at CBC/Radio-Canada  At CBC/Radio-Canada, we create content that informs, entertains and connects Canadians on multiple platforms. Our successes and accomplishments are driven by embodying and upholding values, which include creativity, integrity, inclusiveness and relevance.  Do you think you have the ability and drive to keep up with this exciting, ever-changing industry? Whether it be in front of the camera, on air, online or behind the scenes, you would be joining a team that thrives on making connections and telling stories that are important to Canadians.  Your team: CBC Digital Products is the country’s biggest digital startup, taking on the challenges of innovating how media is made, sent and received. We are also part of Canada’s oldest and truest broadcasting company. We are trying new things. We are growing. As an entity of our own. As a voice for our country. As a team.  Digital is a part of our present and all of our future. CBC’s strategy is focused on becoming a digital-first organization that provides a digital platform for storytellers. Our mission is to engage our audience with stories they care about.  The opportunity:  If you want to enter the world of digital media and be part of the change and growth of one of Canada’s long-established and respected broadcasters, this is your chance. CBC Digital Products is looking a Senior Systems Integration Developer to join our AV Platform team and drive the integration of our Digital Audio/Video Systems that deliver on-demand and live audio and video content to millions of Canadians. It is a highly collaborative, high exposure role with a chance to attend highly specific A/V integration conferences in Canada and the US.  CBC’s Audio/Video Content Management System comprises of a suite of tools used to manage the vast library of on-demand and live streaming content. Our new Integration Developer will implement and enhance the systems, workflows and presentation of A/V streaming on all platforms. As part of a core team supporting the bigger organization, this is an opportunity to work with live broadcasting machinery and content and interact with all of the teams in the department and teams across the organization.  If you're passionate about Canada and you love technology, learning and bringing out the best in others, you’ll love working at CBC.  Who you are and where are you now?  You are a Backend Developer with a focus on integrating systems and implementing workflows for large amounts of audio or video streaming content. You are looking for new challenges and an opportunity to spearhead both new development and the modernization of connecting the workflows and systems.You want to join an organization that is shifting towards digital-on-demand for the web. You want to make an impact bringing forward new tools and ideas that will meet the demand of a national audience and support the internal stakeholders’ need to digitally deliver as much content as we can efficiently.  What’s in it for you?  Cutting edge tech. CBC has more than 25 digital sites, all of which are mandated to reach Canadians online everywhere and every way, with a high emphasis on mobile devices. To achieve that goal, with no down-time, takes a robust infrastructure, powerful technologies, reliable solutions and rewarding work. Java, JEE, PHP and Python are just part of our rich technology landscape.  Belonging. CBC/Radio-Canada is a Canadian institution. By joining our dynamic Digital Products team, you will be exposed to the best of all worlds. Corporate. Public. Startup. You will be part of a team that embraces diversity and at its core, truly cares about the country and the world.  Career growth. CBC is fully invested in our people. Whatever it is you want to pursue whether it’s a new programming language or a technical solution, whether it’s expanding your Agile knowledge or building an audience-facing platform. We will provide you with the time, resources and championing that you need to keep your career here rewarding.  How you will contribute to the team, you will:  Provide technical expertise for online digital Audio/Video systems. You will integrate multiple complex systems to ensure the successful delivery of A/V content. Collaborate with internal groups. You will work closely with Engineering, Media Presentation, IT, Content Producers, Revenue, etc. to achieve integration. Build and implement key deliverables. You will develop delivery systems for streamlining live Audio/Video workflows; middleware custom tools using various APIs; and more. Manage the production systems. You will oversee the complete development and support lifecycle of specific systems. You will provide quality product support to end-users. Qualifications  What you bring:  Post-secondary degree in Computer Science/Engineering or equivalent. The direct experience. You have three years experience in software development (Java, Python, PHP), with a focus on integrating systems. You have a proven track record of administering an Audio Video delivery system. You have experience operating in Windows, Apple and Unix environments and have a working knowledge of Apache, Tomcat, Docker/Containers, Cloud services. The hands-on A/V technical knowledge. You have a passion for the technologies and workflows relating to online A/V presentation, with hands-on experience using: Akamai or other CDN media delivery. Video Streaming Delivery Protocols (RTMP, HTTP, HTTPS, TCP, UDP). Video Formats and Codecs (HLS, HDS, MP4, MPEG-DASH, CMAF, AV1, etc.). Video Encoders (FFMPEG, Digital Rapids, Vantage, Elemental). The desire to learn. You have a keen interest in AI, Machine Learning, Product Intelligence. You can quickly pick up new tools and technologies including Video CMS such as the Platform or Brightcove; Google Advertising Platform (DFP) or Freewheel. The communication skills. You know how to listen and relay empathy and understanding for diverse perspectives. The Agile approach. You believe in the Agile methodology deeply, but you are flexible and open to the real-world twists and turns. The flexibility. You are available to participate in a rotating on-call shift one out of every four or five weeks, for which you will earn additional compensation.  Why join us?  CBC/Radio-Canada reflects the Canadian identity and promotes democracy. We are rooted in the communities we serve and committed to sharing stories as Canadians live them, each and every day. We strive to speak in the voices of the country and support social and economic innovation. We live these external values. They are the foundation of our employee culture. A diverse culture of collaboration, learning and continuous improvement.  Collaboration. We follow lean startup principles and use an Agile approach. Our dedicated people managers work closely with every individual to ensure we are leveraging their strengths, championing their ideas and supporting their pursuit of new skills and career progression. Our team members are given opportunities to collaborate cross-functionally across multiple projects.  Learning. From simply buying a book or recommending a course to one-on-ones, our leadership team is focused on creating an atmosphere where people feel fulfilled.  Continuous improvement. What can you innovate in 8 hours a week? Our Digital department at CBC recognizes just how smart, creative and inventive our team members are. Everyone is given the opportunity to choose personal projects on which to spend 20% of their time. From prototyping new UI/UX for our content to setting up dev environments to experiment on. From reviewing Apple Developer videos and learning new programming languages to creating improved search functions for our media. From updating old code to building unit testing tools. Your 20% time is yours to allocate in a productive and professionally gratifying way.  To apply:  Think this job is meant for you but worried you don’t have it all? At CBC we know that not everyone takes the same path when it comes to building their skills. Hands-on experience, intelligence, innovation, a passion for learning and a team-focused approach can combine to form the best set of qualifications. If you feel you meet all or most of the qualifications we are seeking; and you are excited by the possibility of growing our company, take a chance and express your interest here.  Please click on the link to apply: http://bit.ly/2Cir71z  Candidates may be subject to skills and knowledge testing.  CBC/Radio-Canada is committed to being a leader in reflecting our country’s diversity. That’s because we can only create and tell the stories that connect Canadians, by having a workforce that mirrors the ever-changing makeup of our country. That’s why we, as an employer, value equal opportunity and nurture an inclusive workplace where our individual differences are not only recognized and valued, but also extend to and pervade all the services we provide as Canada’s public broadcaster. For more information, visit the Talent and Diversity section of our website. If you have accommodation needs at this stage of the recruitment process, please inform us as soon as possible by sending an e-mail to recruitment@cbc.ca.  If this sounds interesting, please apply online! We thank all applicants for their interest, but only candidates selected for an interview will be contacted. This position is for a brilliant end-to-end thinker who is passionate about building large-scale and critical platforms and can take full ownership of the entire creation process.Company teams are spread around the globe but still work closely together in a fast-paced agile environment. With very short release cycles and individual ownership they expect great things from their team and reward them with stimulating new projects, cutting-edge technologies and the chance to be a part of a team that is changing cloud technologies from the inside out.Do you want to join in creating the most innovative and robust cloud platform that already serves many enterprises worldwide?DescriptionYou will be responsible for designing and building services to run within our product offering, Symphony You will join a small team of dedicated, experienced developers working to build a world-class product. About Leap Tools  We are the makers of Roomvo, a proprietary AR visualization platform that is changing the way people buy online and in stores. Global billion-dollar companies trust us to supercharge their retail operations every day, at scale. Supported by our strong financial results and 100% quarterly growth rate, we are expanding our team with talented individuals who are eager to grab career-building responsibilities. Title: Backend Software Developer

Job_Description: Description  About Us: The AIR MILES® Rewards Program has earned the trust and support of more than two-thirds of Canadian households. For over two decades, we have helped our Partners use Canada’s most widely accepted loyalty currency, AIR MILES® reward miles, to influence customer behavior, drive profitability, and build long-term relationships. Check us out – LoyaltyOne on Stack Overflow | LinkedIn | Glassdoor | Facebook |Twitter Engineering Team Culture: We are polyglots: We believe in using the best tech stack for the job. We’ve written scripts in Python and built APIs in Scala, Java, Akka, and Node.js. We deploy everything to the Cloud. We pair program: You pick your machine: Windows or Mac. Our floors are open space with no cubicles or private offices, regularly pair programming and mobbing when working. Teams have hack days at least once a month when they take a break to work on anything they want, and most of the time their creations end up in our production environment. Communication is key to our approach, and we don't want to hinder it with walls, real or metaphorical. We are Agile: Development methodologies mean different things to different people. For us? We have a story card wall and release a few times a week. We keep the team in sync with daily stand-ups and have a retrospective once a month to discuss things that are going well and opportunities for improvements. We surround teams with everything they need, Scrum Masters to coach us on the process, Product Owners to make sense of the work, Pod Leaders to help with our careers and Competency Leads to facilitate technical design and provide mentorship in advanced technical skills. Types of projects we work on:  As part of the AM Next team, you will be building the next generation Air Miles Reward Program platform. This new Cloud-based platform will focus on quality and security while providing massive data scalability and real-time data ingestion, processing, and consumption. We are finding new ways of working that allow us to continuously improve delivery of value with high levels of cadence and quality. Qualifications  What we look for in you: Ability and desire to work in our collaborative environment: open team room, pair programming and fluid interactions with all products and operations teams Focusing on building solutions utilizing an agile approach; leveraging close relationships with Product Managers, communicating and digesting real-time feedback, and working smart to build story cards on daily basis You have experience building large scale distributed systems, based on reactive principles, that are flexible, loosely-coupled and scalable You believe that Cloud is the future and you have experience managing some of them - AWS, Azure, Google Cloud Platform or IBM Cloud We know there are endless tools and technologies, and we don’t expect you to come in as an expert on everything, but you are looking forward to experimenting and learning. Air Miles Perks: Hack Days: one day a month you work on projects that interest you to improve your craft  Training: from hackathons to conferences, to instructor lead, building your competency is our priority About LoyaltyOne  LoyaltyOne is a global leader in the design and implementation of coalition loyalty programs, customer analytics, and loyalty services for Fortune 1000 clients around the world. LoyaltyOne has over 20 years history leveraging data-driven insights to develop and operate some of the world's most effective loyalty programs and customer-centric solutions. These include the AIR MILES Reward Program, North America's premier coalition loyalty program, Precima, the global retail strategy and analytics arm, LoyaltyOne Consulting, European-based BrandLoyalty, and Latin America's leading coalition program, dotz. LoyaltyOne is an Alliance Data company. www.loyalty.com   About ADS  Alliance Data® (NYSE: ADS) is a leading global provider of data-driven marketing and loyalty solutions serving large, consumer-based industries. The Company creates and deploys customized solutions, enhancing the critical customer marketing experience; the result is measurably changing consumer behavior while driving business growth and profitability for some of today's most recognizable brands. Alliance Data helps its clients create and increase customer loyalty through solutions that engage millions of customers each day across multiple touch points using traditional, digital, mobile and emerging technologies. An S&P 500 and Fortune 500 company headquartered in Plano, Texas, Alliance Data consists of three businesses that together employ more than 16,000 associates at approximately 100 locations worldwide. www.alliancedata.com  Alliance Data is an Employment Opportunity employer. Accordingly, we will make reasonable accommodations to respond to the needs of people with disabilities in accordance with legislation. Alliance Data participates in E-Verify.

Job_Description: Looking to work for an awesome team? You've come to the right place! Our developers are a tight-knit group, and we are pushing for substantial product development as we continue looking to grow the team in the next year. We value passion for quality, maintainable, and scalable code, and for building awesome products. A side benefit of developing for the restaurant industry is that once we’re done working hard, we have some great clients who can always provide amazing venues for unwinding with our close knit team. TouchBistro is looking for several Backend Developers at the Intermediate or Senior level here in our Toronto office. Our POS system is evolving and our customers are demanding more product capabilities. As a member of our agile Technology team, you will have the chance to work on our current or next-Gen product's web features. Our current stack is ReactJS and NodeJS but if you have worked with other frameworks that is also sufficient. To apply for this position, you must possess a minimum 1+ years of production experience using NodeJS and SQL databases. The development team is poised for growth and along with that comes with many opportunities to learn different skills as well as have a growth path internally.   YOUR DAY-to-DAY Using JavaScript, design & implement features to help our restaurant customers succeed Create a new API using NodeJS and SQL databases on the backend Keep Up-to-Date with best practices and tooling from the JavaScript community Fearlessly Collaborate with your team to solve problems and learn from failures   ALL ABOUT YOU Knowledge of modern JavaScript, HTML5, CSS3 1+ Years of Experience with NodeJS 3+ Years of experience using a backend language (we use Node, but Java, Ruby on Rails, Python, etc. is also acceptable) Some exposure to SQL or NoSQL databases Test Driven Development Experience working on teams in an agile-scrum environment 4 year College Diploma or University Degree  WHY CHOOSE US? TouchBistro is an award-winning iPad Point of Sale system, built for restaurant people by restaurant people. We’re a team of thinkers, builders, doers, and innovators. While many of us have experience working at restaurants, some of us just have a true passion for the industry. We’re venture backed by some of the best tech VCs in the world and are partnered with top innovators in the mobile, food, and payment industries. We’re global and growing! TouchBistro is used in more than 100 countries worldwide and has offices in NYC, Austin, Chicago, London and headquarters in Toronto. We’re a fast-moving, ever-evolving company on a mission to change the way restaurateurs do business and help them succeed through our products and services, but we need talented, passionate people to help! So, what do you say? Are you ready to become part of something awesome?  TouchBistro believes in fostering an inclusive workplace where all individuals have an opportunity to succeed. Requests for accommodation due to a disability can be made at any stage of the recruitment process.
Title: Backend Developer

Job_Description: Reporting to the Director, Technology Services, the Website Designer/Developer (WDD) provides support for all Law website related design, development and administration activities and coordinates IT website-related projects with the Director.  Website key duties include: design, development, maintenance, performance and administration of all Faculty of Law related websites; administering all integrations with internal/external systems; collaboration with content editors & external communications & marketing teams.  Project coordinator key duties include: tracking and reporting on the status of project milestones; participating in and record keeping of client engagement and analysis meetings (minute-taking, keeping notes and other meeting material such as records of design solutions and decisions); scheduling and logistical preparation for meetings; working with clients and members of the Faculty community to gather information, business needs, and functional specifications for projects; and contributing to the development of project plans, system specifications reports and contracts.  Qualifications: (MINIMUM) Education: Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, Information Technology, or acceptable equivalent combination of education and experience is required. Courses in project management and Human-Computer Interaction would be an asset.  Experience: Minimum of 4 years’ comprehensive experience with designing, structuring, developing, and implementing interactive web sites and mobile data-driven applications. Minimum of 3+ years of experience developing for and maintaining enterprise Drupal multi-site installations, designing and building Web-based applications, including backend databases. Extensive knowledge and experience with Web technologies, languages, and tools: PHP and MySQL mandatory, HTML, HTML5, CSS, XML, XSL, Browser DOMs, AJAX, JavaScript and jQuery, and Codeception, PHPUnit, SimpleTest, Test:Unit, JUnit, or similar. Comprehensive understanding & working knowledge of Drupal 7/8 CMS and Drush. Experience creating custom Drupal modules. Experience working with caching technologies such as Varnish, ESI, Entity Cache. Knowledge of RESTful frameworks. Knowledge of Git version control. Experience designing, building and consuming web services and APIs. Experience integrating applications with third-party solutions including authentication, single sign on, access and identity Management (e.g. LDAP, SAML, Active Directory). Thorough understanding of application development methodologies including Agile Expertise with object and component methodology and technology. Experience with database development, physical and logical database design, and data conversion (e.g. PostgreSQL, SQL, MySQL). Experience in gathering and analyzing technical requirements. Knowledge of coding standards and practices, including web accessibility standards. Experience developing web sites for multiple platforms and screen dimensions. Experience and understanding of user experience issues, Internet design principles, W3C standards, accessibility standards, and Windows, UNIX and Apple OS/X interface standards. Significant experience with LAMP stack. Experience with other web development frameworks would be an asset. Knowledge of enterprise systems typical of those found at U of T (e.g., UTORAuth, ROSI, Blackboard, SAP) is preferred. Experience with analytic and advertising platforms (e.g. Google Analytics, AdWords, LinkedIn Campaign Manager, Facebook Business Manager, Hotjar etc.). Experience developing and maintaining system, project, and process documentation. Experience coordinating IT/Web based projects (including but not limited to gathering information, business needs and functional specifications; planning components of projects and workflows)  Other: Excellent communication (both oral and written) and interpersonal skills; demonstrated superior organizational, analytical, and problem-solving skills; highly self-motivated and self-directed; strong service orientation; attention to detail and a commitment to achieving the highest-possible quality and accuracy; demonstrated ability to work independently, showing initiative and good judgment; demonstrated ability to prioritize tasks and responsibilities and to work well under pressure; ability to work with confidential information; ability to draft written materials for review and distribution; Adept at explaining technical concepts to a wide variety of non-technical users both orally and in writing; Ability to learn quickly from technical reference manuals and on-line help facilities; Strong team player with a sense of urgency when required; Ability to maintain technical knowledge of emerging web-related technologies and trend; Must be able to work with a large number of people from diverse backgrounds. Experience working in a team-oriented, collaborative environment, with exposure to mentoring or coaching staff. Knowledge with the operations of a university/college on a faculty administrative level is an asset.  Travel: None  Notes: Job description available upon request.  Employee Group: United Steelworkers (USW)  Appointment Type: Budget - Continuing  Schedule: Full-time  Pay Scale Group and Hiring Rate: USW Pay Band 12 - $66,051 with an annual step progression to a maximum of $84,468. Pay scale and job class assignment is subject to determination pursuant to the Job Evaluation/Pay Equity Maintenance Protocol. Job_Description: Job Purpose  Are you a Developer looking to working at forefront of technology and innovative products supporting millions of players?  As you will be developing and maintaining systems to enable people to have fun, we strongly believe you in turn should have fun doing this. We have a recreation room with Foosball/Table Tennis/Pool table and Yoga classes.  Focusing more on the job itself, as one of our highly skilled Developers, you will analyse user requirements and produce corresponding development tasks, ensuring their completion by putting together a robust end to end process. You will maintain our existing systems, develop new system applications and improve functionality to ensure high quality in any software releases.  You will be working on innovative project of Real Time CRM and dashboards for our business customers, etc.  The Backend Developer job is based in our Toronto service office forming part of our Software Development Services team. As part of this team, you will provide contract research and development services to our gaming companies. And trust us, there are plenty of pioneering projects across the Group.  Skills and Qualifications: As our ideal candidate, it is essential that you have solid experience with the following technologies: C/C++, TCP/IP, Multi-Threading, Windows Kernel. You will also have an in-depth knowledge of RDBMS and SQL.  You will be building applications supporting millions of people and therefore, have previously worked on designing these for large volume usage by end users.  Bachelor's Degree in one of: Engineering, Computer Science, or Mathematics  Well versed in software engineering principles, frameworks and technologies  Highly skilled in C/C++  Exceptional understanding of OOP  Expert knowledge of Windows OS internals (WIN32 API and Multi-threading)  Expert knowledge of computer networking and distributed applications  Experience with systems that operate 24/7/365  Excellent coding skills, ability to produce clean, robust, and accurate code that meets the specs  Experience in designing of efficient algorithms  Expert knowledge of STL library  Ability to work under pressure and meet deadlines  Familiar with Git and best practices in Source Control Management  Solid communication skills, solid writing skills and solid people skills  Achiever - you say what you do and then do what you say  What We Offer  If you are looking for an exciting yet challenging career within a growing, people focused software development environment, then Stars Technologies is for you. Hiring the top people in the industry, Stars Technologies prides itself in its talented and dedicated employees. With virtually non-existent turnover, competitive compensation, and benefits and multiple perks. The environment allows its employees to enjoy coming to work every day. The results speak for themselves: a growing company with a positive culture, winning Canada's Best Workplaces Award for 4 consecutive years.  We operate in a highly regulated environment and all successful candidates are therefore subject to a background screening programme. You will be made aware during the recruitment process of the specific checks that are carried out in relation to the role you have applied for and how this process is delivered by our third party provider. No checks are undertaken at selection stage, only if a conditional offer is made to you.
Title: Backend Developer - C++

Job_Description: Localised is a new company reimagining the cross-border ecommerce experience, and how brands and shoppers transact across borders, languages, currencies and cultures. Our Global Ecommerce as a Service platform builds highly localised ecommerce sites in distant markets on behalf of coveted U.S. and U.K. brands and retailers, helping them look, feel and behave “local” from the perspective of today’s empowered global shopper.  We are based in NYC with teams in Toronto, London, Warsaw, Bucharest and Hong Kong.  We live, obsess over, and celebrate the following core values:  Brave . We are bold and ambitious. We are not afraid to test new ideas. We are resourceful. We solve hard problems in clever ways.  Empathetic . We don’t pretend to know what all customers want. We listen intently. We are objective. We put ourselves in our customers’ shoes.  Accountable . We got this. We do what we need to do. We don’t let each other down. We make commitments and keep them.  Focused . We have very high standards. We don’t cut corners. We are specialists, not generalists. We choose depth over breadth.  We’re looking for a Backend Developer to join our Labs Development team as our primary interface into Operations. In this role, you will have one foot in our product development team and one foot in our production support team. You will work closely with operations and development engineers throughout the entire service lifecycle, from design through the development process to production support. This role will require learning how our platform works end to end so that you can take control of operational work and coordinate the team participation required to resolve.  As a Backend Developer – Operations Interface, you will  Act as primary escalation point for operations once they have exhausted known remedies for production support incidences  Perform triage and identify root causes, as well as, solution and remedy options for production support incidences  Be the voice of operations through the product development process  Advocate for best practices in development practices, application logging and support consistency  Work closely with Product Managers on prioritization, solution preferences and any blocking decision making  Manage prioritization, feature/task backlog, and trade-offs  Drive continuous testing and measurement to improve the performance of the platform we manage  Bring latest thinking, trends and market developments to inform development operations strategy  This might be a perfect fit for you if  You have 5 years of experience in software development  You have experience in ecommerce, parcel logistics, content management domains  You have proven success in delivering beautiful and thoughtful consumer-facing products  You favor iterative, rapid development to get products to market early and often  You pay close attention to detail, evidenced by you noticing this spelling mistke  You can communicate effectively and clearly across any channel or medium  You enjoy working in a fast-paced and hard-working environment where the impact you make is immediate, obvious, significant and rewarding  You think hard problems are the most fun problems  You have experience using, and enjoy using, the following technologies and tools: Jira, New Relic, Splunk, Bitbucket, Docker, AWS  You have experience working with different DBMS (e.g. Postgres, MySql), comfortable with writing SQL queries and perform simple DBA tasks (e.g. backup and restore)  You have an BA/BS degree in Business, Engineering, Computer Science or Mathematics
Title: Backend Developer - Operations Interface

Types of projects we work on\:   As part of the AM Next team, you will be building the next generation Air Miles Reward Program platform. This new Cloud-based platform will focus on quality and security while providing massive data scalability and real-time data ingestion, processing, and consumption. We are finding new ways of working that allow us to continuously improve delivery of value with high levels of cadence and quality.   Qualification:  What we look for in you\:  Ability and desire to work in our collaborative environment\: open team room, pair programming and fluid interactions with all products and operations teams  Focusing on building solutions utilizing an agile approach; leveraging close relationships with Product Managers, communicating and digesting real-time feedback, and working smart to build story cards on daily basis  You have experience building large scale distributed systems, based on reactive principles, that are flexible, loosely-coupled and scalable  You believe that Cloud is the future and you have experience managing some of them - AWS, Azure, Google Cloud Platform or IBM Cloud  We know there are endless tools and technologies, and we don’t expect you to come in as an expert on everything, but you are looking forward to experimenting and learning.  Air Miles Perks\:  Hack Days\: one day a month you work on projects that interest you to improve your craft   Training\: from hackathons to conferences, to instructor lead, building your competency is our priority About LoyaltyOne  LoyaltyOne is part of the successful Alliance Data family of companies that provide the full range of data-driven loyalty, marketing and credit solutions in more than 80 locations across the globe.  Working with more than 100 leading brands in the retail, financial services, grocery, petroleum retail, travel and hospitality industries to profitably change customer behavior. Through a team of businesses, including one of the leading coalition loyalty programs in the world, the AIR MILES® Reward Program, LoyaltyOne designs, delivers and manages a suite of services focused on consumer data, customer-centric retail strategies, direct-to-consumer marketing, loyalty consulting and more.   LoyaltyOne has broadened its horizons geographically by growing Precima in the European market. With the recent acquisition of BrandLoyalty in the Netherlands, LoyaltyOne has gained the expertise of a global leader in short-term loyalty campaigns, along with a client network that extends throughout Europe and Asia.     About ADS   Alliance Data® (NYSE\: ADS) is a leading global provider of data-driven marketing and loyalty solutions serving large, consumer-based industries. The Company creates and deploys customized solutions, enhancing the critical customer marketing experience; the result is measurably changing consumer behavior while driving business growth and profitability for some of today's most recognizable brands. Alliance Data helps its clients create and increase customer loyalty through solutions that engage millions of customers each day across multiple touch points using traditional, digital, mobile and emerging technologies. An S&P 500 and Fortune 500 company headquartered in Plano, Texas, Alliance Data consists of three businesses that together employ more than 16,000 associates at approximately 100 locations worldwide. www.alliancedata.com    Alliance Data is an Employment Opportunity employer. Accordingly, we will make reasonable accommodations to respond to the needs of people with disabilities in accordance with legislation.  Alliance Data participates in E-Verify.

We do this by inspiring ourselves and those we work with to do what others cannot do. You keep up-to-date with new technologies and trends, and you're eager to learn. Then go ahead and send us your application, we would love to hear from you.We want authentic, passionate, hard-working people who will embrace this challenge, make it their personal goal to give it all they got, and leave a legacy while knowing that, by doing so, they are truly improving the lives of everyone that touches our solutions.Referral Reward: Know someone qualified for this role? You can receive a CAD $3,000 referral reward (paid 90 days after hire) by referring them to us.Job Type: Full-time

Job_Description: Reporting to the Director, Technology Services, the Website Designer/Developer (WDD) provides support for all Law website related design, development and administration activities and coordinates IT website-related projects with the Director.  Website key duties include: design, development, maintenance, performance and administration of all Faculty of Law related websites; administering all integrations with internal/external systems; collaboration with content editors & external communications & marketing teams.  Project coordinator key duties include: tracking and reporting on the status of project milestones; participating in and record keeping of client engagement and analysis meetings (minute-taking, keeping notes and other meeting material such as records of design solutions and decisions); scheduling and logistical preparation for meetings; working with clients and members of the Faculty community to gather information, business needs, and functional specifications for projects; and contributing to the development of project plans, system specifications reports and contracts.  Qualifications: (MINIMUM) Education: Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, Information Technology, or acceptable equivalent combination of education and experience is required. Courses in project management and Human-Computer Interaction would be an asset.  Experience: Minimum of 4 years’ comprehensive experience with designing, structuring, developing, and implementing interactive web sites and mobile data-driven applications. Minimum of 3+ years of experience developing for and maintaining enterprise Drupal multi-site installations, designing and building Web-based applications, including backend databases. Extensive knowledge and experience with Web technologies, languages, and tools: PHP and MySQL mandatory, HTML, HTML5, CSS, XML, XSL, Browser DOMs, AJAX, JavaScript and jQuery, and Codeception, PHPUnit, SimpleTest, Test:Unit, JUnit, or similar. Comprehensive understanding & working knowledge of Drupal 7/8 CMS and Drush. Experience creating custom Drupal modules. Experience working with caching technologies such as Varnish, ESI, Entity Cache. Knowledge of RESTful frameworks. Knowledge of Git version control. Experience designing, building and consuming web services and APIs. Experience integrating applications with third-party solutions including authentication, single sign on, access and identity Management (e.g. LDAP, SAML, Active Directory). Thorough understanding of application development methodologies including Agile Expertise with object and component methodology and technology. Experience with database development, physical and logical database design, and data conversion (e.g. PostgreSQL, SQL, MySQL). Experience in gathering and analyzing technical requirements. Knowledge of coding standards and practices, including web accessibility standards. Experience developing web sites for multiple platforms and screen dimensions. Experience and understanding of user experience issues, Internet design principles, W3C standards, accessibility standards, and Windows, UNIX and Apple OS/X interface standards. Significant experience with LAMP stack. Experience with other web development frameworks would be an asset. Knowledge of enterprise systems typical of those found at U of T (e.g., UTORAuth, ROSI, Blackboard, SAP) is preferred. Experience with analytic and advertising platforms (e.g. Google Analytics, AdWords, LinkedIn Campaign Manager, Facebook Business Manager, Hotjar etc.). Experience developing and maintaining system, project, and process documentation. Experience coordinating IT/Web based projects (including but not limited to gathering information, business needs and functional specifications; planning components of projects and workflows)  Other: Excellent communication (both oral and written) and interpersonal skills; demonstrated superior organizational, analytical, and problem-solving skills; highly self-motivated and self-directed; strong service orientation; attention to detail and a commitment to achieving the highest-possible quality and accuracy; demonstrated ability to work independently, showing initiative and good judgment; demonstrated ability to prioritize tasks and responsibilities and to work well under pressure; ability to work with confidential information; ability to draft written materials for review and distribution; Adept at explaining technical concepts to a wide variety of non-technical users both orally and in writing; Ability to learn quickly from technical reference manuals and on-line help facilities; Strong team player with a sense of urgency when required; Ability to maintain technical knowledge of emerging web-related technologies and trend; Must be able to work with a large number of people from diverse backgrounds. Experience working in a team-oriented, collaborative environment, with exposure to mentoring or coaching staff. Knowledge with the operations of a university/college on a faculty administrative level is an asset.  Travel: None  Notes: Job description available upon request.  Employee Group: United Steelworkers (USW)  Appointment Type: Budget - Continuing  Schedule: Full-time  Pay Scale Group and Hiring Rate: USW Pay Band 12 - $66,051 with an annual step progression to a maximum of $84,468. Pay scale and job class assignment is subject to determination pursuant to the Job Evaluation/Pay Equity Maintenance Protocol.  Job Field: Information Technology  Job Posting: Apr 29, 2018  Job Closing: Jun 10, 2018, 10:59:00 PM

Job_Description: About NestReady  NestReady is looking for ambitious, highly motivated, driven professionals with strong technical skills to join our team! We are a real estate technology company with over 6 years of experience in building innovative tools to empower the next generation to enter the real estate market. Our environment is fast-paced, demanding, and ultimately very rewarding for the right person.  Our product  NestReady is a real estate platform that brings all parts of the home-buying experience together. It is a digital platform that removes the stress from the homebuying process creating transparency and accessibility every step of the way. NestReady transforms the customer experience through data processing and user pattern identification. We define a systematic journey from beginning to end that allows us to provide the best in class home buying guidance.  Our platform is built to be integrated within financial institutions platforms to help our partners provide a full home buying experience - from discovery to financing.  Who you’ll work with  You’ll be surrounded by other driven professionals who thrive in rapid growth and change. We work hard, dream big and celebrate our wins. Every team member has the power to influence our success, and we settle for nothing less but industry disruption. If you have what it takes to work at a fast growing startup that will change the industry forever, apply to this position.  Outside of Canada?  We are open to sponsor applicants with a desire to move to Montreal, Canada!  The salary range for this position is between $60,000-$90,000 CAD per year.  What you’ll be working on  Develop a platform that helps homebuyers find the home of their dreams using Ruby, Python or Node.JS  Design and develop versioned JSON Endpoints to streamline user and search information  Design and implement robust features that perform and scale for millions of users  Architecture and performance optimization of complex customizable software apps  Constantly seek and advocate for adopting new bold technologies for our product  Support planning and documentation of technical architecture  Collaborate with Front End, Product and other teams to ensure we ship world-class bullet-proof features  What you have  3+ years experience of development using one of the following languages: Ruby, Python, NodeJS, GO  Professional experience with Rails framework or other full-stack frameworks  Knowledge of MongoDB, Graphs, and Geoprocessing  Able to work independently with little to no supervision  Coaching and leadership acumen  It would be great if you had  Strong knowledge of Javascript  Experience with startup environment  Map/Reduce, Aggregations and other complex MongoDB queries  Appreciation for agile development and efficient code  Have experience leading teams  Have experience creating technical documentation  Previously contributed to open source projects  What We Offer  Sponsorship for Canadian work visa  Flexible work schedule  Casual dress code  Open office space in Old Port  Free coffee, snacks, and drinks  Fun parties and team building activities  Opportunities for advancement  *******************************************************************  Un peu d’info sur NestReady  NestReady est à la recherche de professionnels ambitieux, acharnés, et hautement motivés, possédant des compétences techniques avancées, qui désirent se joindre à notre équipe! Nous sommes une entreprise de technologie immobilière, qui a établi une réputation sur plus de 6 ans dans la création d’outils innovateurs qui ont le potentiel de redonner à la génération qui suit la capacité de mettre un pied dans le marché immobilier. Notre environnement de travail est rapide, exigeant, mais aussi très fructueux pour le candidat adéquat.  Notre produit  NestReady est une plateforme immobilière qui intègre avec fluidité toutes les étapes de l’expérience d’achat d’un domicile. C’est une plateforme numérique qui élimine le stress du processus d’achat immobilier, et qui offre transparence et accessibilité à chaque étape. NestReady révolutionne l’expérience client grâce au traitement de données et l’identification du comportement de l’utilisateur. Nous identifions un cheminement systématique du début à la fin de ce processus, qui nous permet d’offrir une expérience hors classe dans l’achat de demeures haute gamme.  Notre plateforme a été conçue pour fonctionner de paire avec les plateformes des institutions financières, afin de permettre à nos partenaires d’offrir une expérience d’achat immobilier intégrée – de la découverte de la propriété à son financement.  Vos futurs collègues de travail  Vous serez entouré de cadres qui s’épanouissent dans un environnement rapide et sans cesse changeant. Nous travaillons dur, rêvons gros, et arosons nos succès. Chaque membre de l’équipe à l’opportunité de contribuer à notre prestige, et nous visons tous foncièrement un chambardement de l’industrie dans son ensemble – rien de moins! Si vous vous pensez à la hauteur, et que vous voyez votre place dans l’environnement effervescent d’une startup en plein essor, qui laissera sa marque sur l’industrie telle que nous la connaissons, sautez sur l’occasion et faites nous parvenir votre candidature sans plus tarder.  Vous êtes actuellement situé à l’étranger?  Nous sommes en mesure de parrainer les candidats qui désireraient immigrer au Canada et déménager à Montréal!  L'échelle salariale pour ce poste se situe entre 60 000 $ et 90 000 $ CAN par année.  Vos tâches  Développer une plateforme numérique qui permette aux acheteurs immobiliers de trouver la demeure de leurs rêves en utilisant Ruby, Python ou Node.JS.  Concevoir et développer des versions adaptées de points d'arrivés JSON, afin de rationaliser les données de l‘utilisateur et les données de recherche.  Concevoir et mettre en place des fonctionnalités solides qui opèrent efficacement et permettent une expansion à grande échelle et une utilisation par des millions d’utilisateurs.  Améliorer l'architecture et optimiser les performances de systèmes logiciels personnalisables très complexes.  Explorer quotidiennement, et promouvoir activement, de nouvelles technologies innovatrices pour servir nos produits.  Soutenir la planification et la documentation de l'architecture technique.  Collaborer avec les équipes Front-End, Produit et autres afin de garantir que nous livrons des produits infaillibles, à la fine pointe du développement.  Ce que nous recherchons  3 ans et plus d'expérience en développement à l'aide de l'une des langues suivantes: Ruby, Python, NodeJS, GO.  Expérience professionnelle avec le framework Rails ou d'autres frameworks complets.  Connaissance approfondie de MongoDB, Graphiques et Geoprocessing.  Capacité de travailler de manière autonome, avec peu de/ sans supervision.  Un talent intuitif pour le coaching ou le mentorat.  Les atouts qui vous placeront en tête  Connaissance solides de Javascript  Une certaine aise dans le milieu des startups  Habiletés à l’égard de Map/ Reduce, Aggregation et autres requêtes complexes MongoDB.  Une bonne compréhension du développement agile et du code efficace.  Une solide expertise en gestion d’équipe  Une expertise prouvée dans la conception de documents techniques  Des contributions antérieures à des projets “open source”  Ce que nous offrons  Un parrainage dans le cadre de la demande de visa de travail au Canada  Un horaire flexible  Code vestimentaire décontracté  Un bureau en concept espace ouvert dans le Vieux port  Café gratuit, collations et boissons  Des partys de bureau qui sont le fun et des activités de consolidation d’équipe  Des opportunités de promotion
Title: Backend Developer / Développeur Back-End

Job_Description: Talented Software Engineers are critical to OANDA’s business success: as a software company - our products are only as good as the people who create them. With that in mind, OANDA looks for highly intelligent, innovative, and dedicated technology professionals. Duties & Responsibilities: Working within a Linux / Solaris environment, you will research, design, test, implement, and maintain online and backend trading and data services infrastructure applications. Work closely with OANDA’s business and technical leadership to understand business requirements, and will collaborate with development team members to design and write applications systems and programs. Participate in project management and will contribute to the architecture and design process of the backend trading systems. Finally, you will test and debug applications to ensure proper performance, and will be responsible for developing/modifying program documentation.   Qualifications: At least 5 years of post-graduate working experience in a software engineering role. A University degree in computer science, computer engineering, or a related field. A graduate degree would be an asset. Solid application development experience using C++ Relevant experience in the development of Internet-ready applications programs using Internet communications protocols (TCP/IP). Experience with UNIX / Linux / Solaris operating systems. Technical insight to achieve the best possible results in a timely manner Proven ability to innovate in ways that contribute to the success of the business. A strong team orientation combined with the drive and ability to contribute at the individual level. Exceptional communications skills – both oral and written. Developer experience with scripting languages such as Python would be an asset.  OANDA Global Corporation is a diverse and global team with offices around the world. We value the unique skills and experiences each individual brings to OANDA. We are committed to creating and sustaining a collegial work environment in which all individuals are treated with dignity and respect and one which reflects the diversity of the community in which we operate. We provide an inclusive and accessible environment for everyone. Candidates selected for an interview will be contacted directly. If you require accommodation during the recruitment and selection process, please let us know. We will work with you to provide as seamless a recruitment experience as possible.
