Job_Description: The AIR MILES® Rewards Program has earned the trust and support of more than two-thirds of Canadian households. For over two decades, we have helped our Partners use Canada’s most widely accepted loyalty currency, AIR MILES® reward miles, to influence customer behavior, drive profitability, and build long-term relationships. Check us out – LoyaltyOne on Stack Overflow | LinkedIn | Glassdoor | Facebook |Twitter Engineering Team Culture: We are polyglots: We believe in using the best tech stack for the job. We’ve written scripts in Python and built APIs in Scala, Java, Akka, and Node.js. We deploy everything to the Cloud. We pair program: You pick your machine: Windows or Mac. Our floors are open space with no cubicles or private offices, regularly pair programming and mobbing when working. Teams have hack days at least once a month when they take a break to work on anything they want, and most of the time their creations end up in our production environment. Communication is key to our approach, and we don't want to hinder it with walls, real or metaphorical. We are Agile: Development methodologies mean different things to different people. For us? We have a story card wall and release a few times a week. We keep the team in sync with daily stand-ups and have a retrospective once a month to discuss things that are going well and opportunities for improvements. We surround teams with everything they need, Scrum Masters to coach us on the process, Product Owners to make sense of the work, Pod Leaders to help with our careers and Competency Leads to facilitate technical design and provide mentorship in advanced technical skills. Types of projects we work on:  As part of the AM Next team, you will be building the next generation Air Miles Reward Program platform. This new Cloud-based platform will focus on quality and security while providing massive data scalability and real-time data ingestion, processing, and consumption. We are finding new ways of working that allow us to continuously improve delivery of value with high levels of cadence and quality. What we look for in you: Ability and desire to work in our collaborative environment: open team room, pair programming and fluid interactions with all products and operations teams Focusing on building solutions utilizing an agile approach; leveraging close relationships with Product Managers, communicating and digesting real-time feedback, and working smart to build story cards on daily basis You have experience building large scale distributed systems, based on reactive principles, that are flexible, loosely-coupled and scalable You believe that Cloud is the future and you have experience managing some of them - AWS, Azure, Google Cloud Platform or IBM Cloud We know there are endless tools and technologies, and we don’t expect you to come in as an expert on everything, but you are looking forward to experimenting and learning. Air Miles Perks: Hack Days: one day a month you work on projects that interest you to improve your craft  Training: from hackathons to conferences, to instructor lead, building your competency is our priority About LoyaltyOne LoyaltyOne is part of the successful Alliance Data family of companies that provide the full range of data-driven loyalty, marketing and credit solutions in more than 80 locations across the globe.  Working with more than 100 leading brands in the retail, financial services, grocery, petroleum retail, travel and hospitality industries to profitably change customer behavior. Through a team of businesses, including one of the leading coalition loyalty programs in the world, the AIR MILES® Reward Program, LoyaltyOne designs, delivers and manages a suite of services focused on consumer data, customer-centric retail strategies, direct-to-consumer marketing, loyalty consulting and more.  LoyaltyOne has broadened its horizons geographically by growing Precima in the European market. With the recent acquisition of BrandLoyalty in the Netherlands, LoyaltyOne has gained the expertise of a global leader in short-term loyalty campaigns, along with a client network that extends throughout Europe and Asia. About ADS  Alliance Data® (NYSE: ADS) is a leading global provider of data-driven marketing and loyalty solutions serving large, consumer-based industries. The Company creates and deploys customized solutions, enhancing the critical customer marketing experience; the result is measurably changing consumer behavior while driving business growth and profitability for some of today's most recognizable brands. Alliance Data helps its clients create and increase customer loyalty through solutions that engage millions of customers each day across multiple touch points using traditional, digital, mobile and emerging technologies. An S&P 500 and Fortune 500 company headquartered in Plano, Texas, Alliance Data consists of three businesses that together employ more than 16,000 associates at approximately 100 locations worldwide. www.alliancedata.com  Alliance Data is an Employment Opportunity employer. Accordingly, we will make reasonable accommodations to respond to the needs of people with disabilities in accordance with legislation. Alliance Data participates in E-Verify.
Title: Backend Developer

Job_Description: Position Title: Junior Software Developer  Reports to: Director, Application Development  Department: IT  Location: Toronto, ON  Position Summary  The Software Developer will translate software requirements into workable programming code and build scalable web applications that solve a variety of problems for our clients.  Major Responsibilities   Use a variety of programming languages and development tools to build, test, implement, and support the development of web software applications.  Collaborate and interact with interdisciplinary teams (interactive designers and software developers) to identify and resolve issues, review and complete projects.  Participate in an agile software development framework. Proactively find and address areas of concern and identify potential roadblocks.  Assist in estimating resource needs and timelines to complete short and long term projects as well as daily operational tasks. Assist in clarifying stakeholder requirements; communicate questions and address concerns. Provide relevant and detailed updates and feedback in a timely manner Education and Experience   Minimum 1 year of experience in a professional software development role or a co-op term  Post-secondary education in Computer Science, Application Development, or Information Technology (nice to have but not required)  Any related certification is an asset Skills   Solution Design – Ability to define and describe an architecture of a system and understand the cause and effect of their coding  Collaborative communication skills (written and oral) - Ability to convert and explain technical concepts to a non-technical audience  Development from specifications - Ability to find requirements and break them down into actionable execution plans for the team and proactively identify problems  Frontend Development – some experience and applicable knowledge with HTML 5, CSS3 and/or Java Script, Bitmaker course completion Backend Development – Some experience and applicable knowledge in backend development in any language (Ruby, PHP, .NET, etc.), relational databases, writing and optimizing queries (Postgres, MySQL, etc.)  ITRG is an equal opportunity employer committed to diversity and inclusion. We are pleased to consider all qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability, or any other legally protected factors. To that end, upon request, ITRG will ensure, to the extent possible, that accommodation be made available to applicants throughout the recruitment and hiring process.
Title: Junior Software Developer

Job_Description: Mobile Developer Location: Toronto, Canada Guestlogix is Making Air Travel a Great Experience Again! Chances are you’ve been an airline passenger at some point in your life. You’ve likely had a similar on-board experience on every flight, and rarely found it to be modern and personalized. Guestlogix is changing how consumers feel about travel and how airlines provide a personalized and high-impact onboard retail experience for their passengers, while increasing revenues and profitability and boosting passenger loyalty like no other industry provider can. Check us out at www.guestlogix.com. We're looking for talented, innovative leaders who want to join our crew to make it happen. Our crew gets the job done by owning problems and collaborating on solutions, with a customer first sense of urgency, and passion and dedication to make air travel a great experience again.   Your Mission We’re looking for a passionate Mobile Developer who can work in a tightly knit Agile team environment. You’ll be joining a multi-disciplinary team, working closely with other software engineers and product managers who share your drive for excellence and desire to build great products. You are an experienced Mobile Developer with an entrepreneurial spirit. Your work related, or personal project experience, means you know how to build a product from scratch. What we’re working on right now is so exciting that we sincerely believe no passenger will travel by plane the same way again - and we want you to be a part of it! At Guestlogix, you won’t be limited to a specific part of the product, you’ll have the opportunity to be fully involved in all aspects of product decisions. If you want to grow your career, make recommendations and expand your exposure to developing a product end-to-end, this is the role for you.   As a crew member, your role is to: Build something brand new. You will get to see the things you have built be deployed and be part of the team that actively improved the travelling experience of thousands of people. Be involved in the SDLC. Your experience as a Mobile Developer will enable you to contribute to everything from requirements to proposed designs, coding to writing unit tests. Be a problem solver. When faced with a problem, you can easily identify the steps needed to resolve it in an effective manner. Be a key contributor to the team. You will design and build new features in collaboration with the Architect and Product team. You will work closely across teams to identify and maximize opportunities to produce scalable, reusable enterprise grade applications and features. Be passionate. We want you to love what you do, that’s our biggest ask. Building cool applications and making ideas come to fruition is what gets you out of bed in the morning - and you’re looking for a team of equally passionate people to do this with. The right crew member will have: A degree or diploma in Computer Science, Engineering or equivalent experience is required. The experience. You have been working in mobile development for 3+ years in a professional capacity or on personal projects. We understand not everyone hones their development skills at work. If you’ve created awesome things in your spare time, we’d love to see them! The technical expertise. Experience with native development and cross-platform “write once — run anywhere” frameworks. Working knowledge of Xamarin, Objective-C and/or Swift is a plus. A collaborative approach. You understand that everyone needs to do whatever it takes to meet deadlines and deliver promises. But you bring with you a need for perfection and to uphold a reputation. Working with our crew at Guestlogix: Join us on our journey to make air travel a great experience again. Our crew enjoys a comfortable, open and casual environment, collaborating with an exceptional team of Agile based technology innovators. You have the flexibility and autonomy to innovate within small teams to build the ‘first to market’, mobile-first platform, using modern tools and methods. As if that is not enough, we provide you with a competitive salary and benefits, and provide you with the flexibility to manage work and life, along with virtually unlimited developmental opportunities to grow your skills and learn together on our journey. At Guestlogix, you won’t be limited to a specific part of the product; you’ll have the opportunity to be fully involved in all aspects of product decisions. You will have a chance to: Make recommendations and see them implemented as part of our new product development. Be involved in the end-to-end product development expanding your marketable skills in Front End, Backend or Mobile. Learn from senior team members through one-on-one mentorship and career coaching. Grow with us - as we scale, you will be in a prime position to scale with us. Joining Guestlogix now is the chance to share in the excitement of building an amazing global technology business that has a huge impact on the industry. Guestlogix welcomes and encourages applications from people with disabilities. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process.
Title: Mobile Developer

Job_Description: Job Purpose  Are you a Developer looking to working at forefront of technology and innovative products supporting millions of players?  As you will be developing and maintaining systems to enable people to have fun, we strongly believe you in turn should have fun doing this. We have a recreation room with Foosball/Table Tennis/Pool table and Yoga classes.  Focusing more on the job itself, as one of our highly skilled Developers, you will analyse user requirements and produce corresponding development tasks, ensuring their completion by putting together a robust end to end process. You will maintain our existing systems, develop new system applications and improve functionality to ensure high quality in any software releases.  You will be working on innovative project of Real Time CRM and dashboards for our business customers, etc.  The Backend Developer job is based in our Toronto service office forming part of our Software Development Services team. As part of this team, you will provide contract research and development services to our gaming companies. And trust us, there are plenty of pioneering projects across the Group.  Skills and Qualifications: As our ideal candidate, it is essential that you have solid experience with the following technologies: C/C++, TCP/IP, Multi-Threading, Windows Kernel. You will also have an in-depth knowledge of RDBMS and SQL.  You will be building applications supporting millions of people and therefore, have previously worked on designing these for large volume usage by end users.  Bachelor's Degree in one of: Engineering, Computer Science, or Mathematics  Well versed in software engineering principles, frameworks and technologies  Highly skilled in C/C++  Exceptional understanding of OOP  Expert knowledge of Windows OS internals (WIN32 API and Multi-threading)  Expert knowledge of computer networking and distributed applications  Experience with systems that operate 24/7/365  Excellent coding skills, ability to produce clean, robust, and accurate code that meets the specs  Experience in designing of efficient algorithms  Expert knowledge of STL library  Ability to work under pressure and meet deadlines  Familiar with Git and best practices in Source Control Management  Solid communication skills, solid writing skills and solid people skills  Achiever - you say what you do and then do what you say  What We Offer  If you are looking for an exciting yet challenging career within a growing, people focused software development environment, then Stars Technologies is for you. Hiring the top people in the industry, Stars Technologies prides itself in its talented and dedicated employees. With virtually non-existent turnover, competitive compensation, and benefits and multiple perks. The environment allows its employees to enjoy coming to work every day. The results speak for themselves: a growing company with a positive culture, winning Canada's Best Workplaces Award for 4 consecutive years.  We operate in a highly regulated environment and all successful candidates are therefore subject to a background screening programme. You will be made aware during the recruitment process of the specific checks that are carried out in relation to the role you have applied for and how this process is delivered by our third party provider. No checks are undertaken at selection stage, only if a conditional offer is made to you.
Title: Backend Developer - C++

You'll be required to assist in architect, code, debug problematic code, as well as execute general troubleshooting and problem solving. You'll work alongside our talented project managers, engineers and designers to create award-winning properties. We exclusively work with companies that are looking to make a difference in the mobile space and make it an integral part of their customers' lives. We specialize in ideating, designing and engineering apps and sites for smartphones, tablets, and devices everywhere for commerce, loyalty, payment, wallets, location-based and transactional branded experiences. Plastic Mobile is headquartered out of Toronto and New York City powered by the best creative minds, mobile strategists and software engineers designing and building world-class mobile experiences. Find us on the Web: http://www.plasticmobile.com

Job_Description: Our Mission: Modern Money Movement.Instant Financial is disrupting the standard notion of ‘payday’ by giving workers daily control over their earned income. We allow people to live better lives by fixing the misalignment between when people get paid and when they need their money. Employers who pay with Instant enjoy greater access to the best employees as well as high employee retention and engagement. All of this translates into a better, more profitable business. We have started the payroll revolution and need talented passionate people to join the Modern Money Movement.We are dreamers who have a proven track record of making big things happen. We do this by inspiring ourselves and those we work with to do what others cannot do. We know that we must move together as a team, celebrate our successes, and above all learn quickly from the mistakes we know will be made due to the fast pace of our execution. We carry ourselves with urgency, honesty and integrity in everything we do. Together, we truly believe we can empower working lives.About the Team: We're a small but high-performing team of engineers, building SaaS and mobile technologies for a rapidly growing organization, led by a founding team with a proven track record.We embrace Agile and DevOps practices and tools to ensure the delivery of high quality software with a high release velocity. We have a highly efficient flat structure and ambitious growth plans.Our stack is JavaScript-based (including with Node/Express microservices). Most importantly, we work in a collaborative environment of continuous learning - we expect you to challenge us as much as we challenge you!About You: You're an intermediate to senior full stack developer with JavaScript skills. You're passionate about building web and mobile applications and you’ve had experience delivering production-grade software.You thrive in fast-paced environments where you have lots of independence and ownership. You keep up-to-date with new technologies and trends, and you're eager to learn. You live and work with honesty and integrity, you carry your work with a healthy sense of urgency, you truly believe in teamwork, and you're not afraid to be held - or hold others - accountable for what must be done.What You'll Bring: Several years experience developing production-quality software at high scaleDegree in Computer Science, or equivalent experienceAbility to learn new technologies and paradigms rapidlyStrong JavaScript skillsFamiliarity with non-relational databases such as MongoDBProficiency in a Linux environmentDeep knowledge of web technologiesExcellent spoken and written EnglishBonus Assets: Test automationWorking in an Agile+DevOps development environmentWriting Node-based microservicesWriting microservices in a framework such as ExpressAny JavaScript framework such as Angular, React, or similarJOIN US!Are you so excited about taking on this challenge, and about what we stand for, that by now you can barely sit still? Then go ahead and send us your application, we would love to hear from you.We want authentic, passionate, hard-working people who will embrace this challenge, make it their personal goal to give it all they got, and leave a legacy while knowing that, by doing so, they are truly improving the lives of everyone that touches our solutions.Referral Reward: Know someone qualified for this role? You can receive a CAD $3,000 referral reward (paid 90 days after hire) by referring them to us.Job Type: Full-time

Title: Web Developer

Job_Description: Looking to work for an awesome team? You've come to the right place! Our developers are a tight-knit group, and we are pushing for substantial product development as we continue looking to grow the team in the next year. We value passion for quality, maintainable, and scalable code, and for building awesome products. A side benefit of developing for the restaurant industry is that once we’re done working hard, we have some great clients who can always provide amazing venues for unwinding with our close knit team. TouchBistro is looking for several Backend Developers at the Intermediate or Senior level here in our Toronto office. Our POS system is evolving and our customers are demanding more product capabilities. As a member of our agile Technology team, you will have the chance to work on our current or next-Gen product's web features. Our current stack is ReactJS and NodeJS but if you have worked with other frameworks that is also sufficient. To apply for this position, you must possess a minimum 1+ years of production experience using NodeJS and SQL databases. The development team is poised for growth and along with that comes with many opportunities to learn different skills as well as have a growth path internally.   YOUR DAY-to-DAY Using JavaScript, design & implement features to help our restaurant customers succeed Create a new API using NodeJS and SQL databases on the backend Keep Up-to-Date with best practices and tooling from the JavaScript community Fearlessly Collaborate with your team to solve problems and learn from failures   ALL ABOUT YOU Knowledge of modern JavaScript, HTML5, CSS3 1+ Years of Experience with NodeJS 3+ Years of experience using a backend language (we use Node, but Java, Ruby on Rails, Python, etc. is also acceptable) Some exposure to SQL or NoSQL databases Test Driven Development Experience working on teams in an agile-scrum environment 4 year College Diploma or University Degree  WHY CHOOSE US? TouchBistro is an award-winning iPad Point of Sale system, built for restaurant people by restaurant people. We’re a team of thinkers, builders, doers, and innovators. While many of us have experience working at restaurants, some of us just have a true passion for the industry. We’re venture backed by some of the best tech VCs in the world and are partnered with top innovators in the mobile, food, and payment industries. We’re global and growing! TouchBistro is used in more than 100 countries worldwide and has offices in NYC, Austin, Chicago, London and headquarters in Toronto. We’re a fast-moving, ever-evolving company on a mission to change the way restaurateurs do business and help them succeed through our products and services, but we need talented, passionate people to help! So, what do you say? Are you ready to become part of something awesome?  TouchBistro believes in fostering an inclusive workplace where all individuals have an opportunity to succeed. Requests for accommodation due to a disability can be made at any stage of the recruitment process.
Title: Backend Developer

Job_Description: Description:   About Us\:  The AIR MILES® Rewards Program has earned the trust and support of more than two-thirds of Canadian households. For over two decades, we have helped our Partners use Canada’s most widely accepted loyalty currency, AIR MILES® reward miles, to influence customer behavior, drive profitability, and build long-term relationships.  Check us out – LoyaltyOne on Stack Overflow | LinkedIn | Glassdoor | Facebook |Twitter  Engineering Team Culture\:  We are polyglots\: We believe in using the best tech stack for the job. We’ve written scripts in Python and built APIs in Scala, Java, Akka, and Node.js. We deploy everything to the Cloud.  We pair program\: You pick your machine\: Windows or Mac. Our floors are open space with no cubicles or private offices, regularly pair programming and mobbing when working. Teams have hack days at least once a month when they take a break to work on anything they want, and most of the time their creations end up in our production environment. Communication is key to our approach, and we don't want to hinder it with walls, real or metaphorical.  We are Agile\: Development methodologies mean different things to different people. For us? We have a story card wall and release a few times a week. We keep the team in sync with daily stand-ups and have a retrospective once a month to discuss things that are going well and opportunities for improvements. We surround teams with everything they need, Scrum Masters to coach us on the process, Product Owners to make sense of the work, Pod Leaders to help with our careers and Competency Leads to facilitate technical design and provide mentorship in advanced technical skills.  Types of projects we work on\:   As part of the AM Next team, you will be building the next generation Air Miles Reward Program platform. This new Cloud-based platform will focus on quality and security while providing massive data scalability and real-time data ingestion, processing, and consumption. We are finding new ways of working that allow us to continuously improve delivery of value with high levels of cadence and quality.   Qualification:  What we look for in you\:  Ability and desire to work in our collaborative environment\: open team room, pair programming and fluid interactions with all products and operations teams  Focusing on building solutions utilizing an agile approach; leveraging close relationships with Product Managers, communicating and digesting real-time feedback, and working smart to build story cards on daily basis  You have experience building large scale distributed systems, based on reactive principles, that are flexible, loosely-coupled and scalable  You believe that Cloud is the future and you have experience managing some of them - AWS, Azure, Google Cloud Platform or IBM Cloud  We know there are endless tools and technologies, and we don’t expect you to come in as an expert on everything, but you are looking forward to experimenting and learning.  Air Miles Perks\:  Hack Days\: one day a month you work on projects that interest you to improve your craft   Training\: from hackathons to conferences, to instructor lead, building your competency is our priority About LoyaltyOne  LoyaltyOne is part of the successful Alliance Data family of companies that provide the full range of data-driven loyalty, marketing and credit solutions in more than 80 locations across the globe.  Working with more than 100 leading brands in the retail, financial services, grocery, petroleum retail, travel and hospitality industries to profitably change customer behavior. Through a team of businesses, including one of the leading coalition loyalty programs in the world, the AIR MILES® Reward Program, LoyaltyOne designs, delivers and manages a suite of services focused on consumer data, customer-centric retail strategies, direct-to-consumer marketing, loyalty consulting and more.   LoyaltyOne has broadened its horizons geographically by growing Precima in the European market. With the recent acquisition of BrandLoyalty in the Netherlands, LoyaltyOne has gained the expertise of a global leader in short-term loyalty campaigns, along with a client network that extends throughout Europe and Asia.     About ADS   Alliance Data® (NYSE\: ADS) is a leading global provider of data-driven marketing and loyalty solutions serving large, consumer-based industries. The Company creates and deploys customized solutions, enhancing the critical customer marketing experience; the result is measurably changing consumer behavior while driving business growth and profitability for some of today's most recognizable brands. Alliance Data helps its clients create and increase customer loyalty through solutions that engage millions of customers each day across multiple touch points using traditional, digital, mobile and emerging technologies. An S&P 500 and Fortune 500 company headquartered in Plano, Texas, Alliance Data consists of three businesses that together employ more than 16,000 associates at approximately 100 locations worldwide. www.alliancedata.com    Alliance Data is an Employment Opportunity employer. Accordingly, we will make reasonable accommodations to respond to the needs of people with disabilities in accordance with legislation.  Alliance Data participates in E-Verify.

Job_Description: Company Overview At Proofpoint, we have a passion for protecting people, data, and brands from today’s advanced threats and compliance risks. We hire the best people in the business to: Build and enhance our proven security platform Blend innovation and speed in a constantly evolving cloud architecture Analyze new threats and offer deep insight through data-driven intel Collaborate with customers to help solve their toughest security challenges We are singularly devoted to helping our customers protect what matters most. That’s why we’re a leader in next- generation cybersecurity—and why more than half of the Fortune 100 trust us as a security partner.  The Role We are looking for a Software Developer in Test Automation to work in our downtown Toronto office. Proofpoint Enterprise Archiving is a cloud-based solution that features a distributed grid search and storage infrastructure. This service-based architecture allows us to scale to meet the needs of companies that are amongst the largest businesses in the world. As a Software Developer for Test Automation, you will play a pivotal role on one of our Scrum teams by identifying design issues, promoting and improving testability, creating and automating test cases, and identifying and reporting defects. This is a highly technical role that requires solid OO development skills (we have a custom automation test harness integrated into our backend infrastructure). Basically, we need developers who are passionate about quality and automation. In this role, you will help form and drive our overall test automation strategy, and you will be working alongside sharp, like-minded engineers as well. Your day-to-day Contribute to the delivery of high quality, testable software, from requirements analysis to acceptance testing Design, develop and deliver automated functional and integration test cases Work with the Scrum team to deliver well-tested software in each sprint Demonstrate technical leadership and act as a mentor for other test team members Act as a tireless promoter for testability and automation What you bring to the team 3-5 years of test automation experience; demonstrated ability to contribute to test automation frameworks and test suites (our interviews have whiteboard coding tests, this is a must-have requirement) Test case authoring, prioritization, and organization Experience with source control management with Git, Mercurial, SVN or equivalent Testing UI expertise with frameworks such as Selenium Webdriver Experience testing RESTful services with SoapUI or equivalent Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, or equivalent What make you different from others Excellent programming skills Experience with Software as a Service (SaaS) based products is a strong plus Why Proofpoint  As a customer focused and driven-to-win organization with leading edge products, there are many exciting reasons to join the Proofpoint team. We believe in hiring the best the brightest and cultivating a culture of collaboration and appreciation. As we continue to grow and expand globally, we understand that hiring the right people and treating them well is key to our success! We are a multi-national company with locations in 10 countries, with each location contributing to Proofpoint’s amazing culture! #LI-JR1

Job_Description: Upsight is the world’s largest enterprise-grade user lifecycle management platform. Our mission is to transform the world’s data into valuable action. Upsight customers leverage our consolidated solution stack to learn about their users, make informed decisions and take immediate action to positively impact KPIs, increase LTV and add value to their businesses. We handle more than 500 billion data points and deliver over 1.4 billion targeted web and mobile communications every month. Born of the 2014 merger that married Playhaven’s marketing automation solution with Kontagent’s omnichannel analytics, Upsight was built from the ground up to handle the challenges inherent in managing the world’s largest software portfolios. The 2016 acquisition of Fuse Powered and their best-in-class ad optimization technology secured our place as the industry’s only one stop shop for enterprise technologists. Upsight’s battle-tested infrastructure has scaled to facilitate some of the largest digital product launches in history, and our commitment to perfecting the industry’s only full-service solution has afforded us the privilege of working with companies like Electronic Arts, Warner Brothers, Activision and more. Above all, Upsight values relationships. Our refusal to adopt a “one-size-fits-all” approach has empowered us and our customers to build resilient partnerships that drive growth. It’s a philosophy we aim to carry with us into the future as we look forward to leading our industry in the discovery and development of practical technologies for the digital enterprise market. About the role Upsight is looking for a Software Developer that will work on the development of our mediation stack, helping to build, optimize and streamline our industry-leading mediated ad serving solution. What you’ll do Contribute to the development of our backend mediation stack, helping to add features and improve system performance Build tools that will enable our team to work more efficiently and optimize our mediation capabilities Help improve our automated testing and deployment strategies Advocate and enforce adoption of architecture standards such as technical design patterns, reusable code examples, and design best practices Provide solutions to current (tactical) problems with permanent (strategic) answers. Help develop and document technical design specifications Work in an Agile development environment About you Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or related field Proficient understanding of relational database technologies (preferably MySQL) with advanced SQL knowledge and query optimization experience Enjoy coding in PHP and Perl Experience in developing JavaScript and CSS Knowledge of PHP frameworks 3 years of software engineering or related experience designing and building PHP applications Possess a solid understanding of high-scalability and large-scale infrastructures What You’ll Get An opportunity to make immediate impact $2,500 flexible benefit program to be used towards a combination of vacation, fitness, mobile devices, and education Snacks on snacks on snacks Catered lunches 3x per week Upsight welcomes and encourages applications from people with disabilities. Job_Description: Looking to work for an awesome team? You've come to the right place! Our developers are a tight-knit group, and we are pushing for substantial product development as we continue looking to grow the team in the next year. We value passion for quality, maintainable, and scalable code, and for building awesome products. A side benefit of developing for the restaurant industry is that once we’re done working hard, we have some great clients who can always provide amazing venues for unwinding with our close knit team. TouchBistro is looking for several Backend Developers at the Intermediate or Senior level here in our Toronto office. Our POS system is evolving and our customers are demanding more product capabilities. As a member of our agile Technology team, you will have the chance to work on our current or next-Gen product's web features. Our current stack is ReactJS and NodeJS but if you have worked with other frameworks that is also sufficient. To apply for this position, you must possess a minimum 1+ years of production experience using NodeJS and SQL databases. The development team is poised for growth and along with that comes with many opportunities to learn different skills as well as have a growth path internally.   YOUR DAY-to-DAY Using JavaScript, design & implement features to help our restaurant customers succeed Create a new API using NodeJS and SQL databases on the backend Keep Up-to-Date with best practices and tooling from the JavaScript community Fearlessly Collaborate with your team to solve problems and learn from failures   ALL ABOUT YOU Knowledge of modern JavaScript, HTML5, CSS3 1+ Years of Experience with NodeJS 3+ Years of experience using a backend language (we use Node, but Java, Ruby on Rails, Python, etc. is also acceptable) Some exposure to SQL or NoSQL databases Test Driven Development Experience working on teams in an agile-scrum environment 4 year College Diploma or University Degree  WHY CHOOSE US? TouchBistro is an award-winning iPad Point of Sale system, built for restaurant people by restaurant people. We’re a team of thinkers, builders, doers, and innovators. While many of us have experience working at restaurants, some of us just have a true passion for the industry. We’re venture backed by some of the best tech VCs in the world and are partnered with top innovators in the mobile, food, and payment industries. We’re global and growing! TouchBistro is used in more than 100 countries worldwide and has offices in NYC, Austin, Chicago, London and headquarters in Toronto. We’re a fast-moving, ever-evolving company on a mission to change the way restaurateurs do business and help them succeed through our products and services, but we need talented, passionate people to help! So, what do you say? Are you ready to become part of something awesome?  TouchBistro believes in fostering an inclusive workplace where all individuals have an opportunity to succeed. The project requires that the resources use the Agile approach for creation and modification of application software that defines development sprint and specifies the activities, products, verification procedures and completion criteria for each sprint of both new and existing application software.  Tasks include but are not limited to the following:  Implement WEB Experience Toolkit (WET) guidelines into existing public facing web application; Write Java code based applications using Spring framework; Develop Java based applications that interact with an Oracle or PostGres backend; Troubleshoot applications; Document issues and solutions when arise; Develop and execute unit and Integration testing; Write and maintain user interfaces and reports; Develop, test and implement web services that will be reused by other systems; Build and deploy applications; Review application and program design to ensure adherence to the corporate standards and to recommend performance improvements; Participate in all the Agile SDLC activities such as scrum meetings, planning sessions to discuss the business and the systems requirements; Update user documentation such as Sprint backlog and other artifacts as determined by the Project Authority; Implement Data Access layers; Write and tune SQL and PL/SQL code; Translate business requirements into functional specifications and detailed design; Test the functionality code; Arrange and document code review sessions; Assist, mentor and support other programmer / analysts through Object Oriented (OO) analysis, design and construction; and Provide technical expertise on a one on one or within a group meeting or as determined by the Project Authority. The ideal candidates will have experience in the following:  Minimum of one (1) year experience developing web services applications in Service- Oriented Architecture (SOA) environment. Minimum of one (1) year experience working with Structured Query Language (SQL). Minimum of one (1) year experience developing Java applications using Hibernate. Minimum of one (1) year experience developing of secure web application using Spring security. Minimum of one (1) year experience working with the Web applications using JQuery. Minimum of one (1) year experience building Java applications using MAVEN. Minimum of one (1) year experience developing Web applications using HTML 5.0. Minimum of one (1) year experience applying the Government of Canada (GoC) Web Experience Toolkit (WET) to develop Web application.  Maplesoft Group prides itself on its distinct corporate culture and recognizes that success is a direct reflection of our most valuable asset - our people. Therefore, attitude and ambition are key personality traits we seek out, along with skill and aptitude, in potential employees.  We thank you for your interest in Maplesoft Group and wish to advise that only candidates under consideration will be contacted.

Job_Description: MetricAid is a small, high-functioning team that operates in the healthcare field. We provide a service to hospitals that improves the quality of life for patients and physicians and we are growing.  We are looking to hire a talented backend developer to help expand our API and reporting services. We want somebody who loves to write server code: from security to database queries and everything in between. If you like to write efficient code that delivers results fast then this is the job for you.  You will require : A desire to build quality code that you can take pride in  The drive to learn new things and challenge yourself  Ability to follow direction independently  Experience with relational databases (PostgreSQL)  Experience working on HTTP servers  You should have : Experience writing in GO or a C-based language  Ability to write code that is easy to read and understand  A desire to work as part of a social and involved team  The capacity to learn new skills regularly  A love of board games  Your job will involve : Writing backend server code including  Database queries  HTTP route handlers  Support packages  Contributing to planning/implementation of features  Designing data structures and relationships  Working in a Scrum environment  If this sounds like you (or almost sounds like you) submit an application. We’d love to hear from you.  Some of the things being employed in this role provides...  Benefits 15 paid days vacation per year (5 day work week) (pro-rated from hire date) 20 paid days vacation starting year 4 10 recognized statutory holidays 8 additional paid "holidays" that we combine with statutory holidays to make a longer "break" We are invested and involved in our community through volunteering

Company: HomeX Labs - a division of Home Experience LLC
Job_Description: We're looking for a front-end developer and JavaScript Jedi with elite skills, someone who is passionate about building stellar user experiences and great products through elegant code. Working closely with an interaction designer and product manager, you will be helping to develop the ‘client-side’ as we build new customer-facing and technician-facing web applications and mobile apps. You will have a key role in translating our company and customer needs into functional and appealing interactive applications. We expect you to be a tech-savvy professional who is curious about new digital technologies and aspires to combine usability with visual design. Ultimately, you should be able to create a functional, attractive and inventive digital face to make innovative user experiences come to life. You will be empowered to invent and innovate, and given clear ownership of engineering problems and solutions in a technology-led environment.  Having the chance to be involved in the early stages of a company dedicated to re-inventing an experience with universal reach is rare. The opportunity to do it with intensity but without the burndown charts or limited runway of a conventional start-up is what makes joining our team unique. Our solid foundation, ambitious vision and experienced leadership team give us the means to quickly but uncompromisingly create experiences that will transform an entire industry. As a front-end developer you will: Develop a great product experience, while leveraging the latest web technologies Work closely with other team members to develop industry leading solutions for the home services market Develop state-of-the art user experiences using your experience with Javascript, HTML and CSS Leverage best UI/UX practices to build an industry leading, cutting edge and award-winning product Be an integral part of an elite, energetic team of Architects, Product Managers, Developers, Business Analysts where collaboration across all groups is integral to success Requirements Minimum 2-3 years relevant full-time hands-on experience in developing robust interfaces and user experiences, and optimizing performance in web applications. Extensive experience with modern Javascript Libraries - preferably React Elite HTML/CSS skills Agile/Scrum experience In-depth understanding of the entire web development process (design, development and deployment) Knowledge of SEO principles, usability best practices and layout aesthetics Strong collaboration skills, whether working with backend developers, interaction designers, product managers, or architects Passionate about and engaged in the user experience and business outcomes BSc degree in Computer Science or related field Benefits Greenfield development - collaborate with other talented people to build something great from the ground up Fun and positive working environment Experienced, people-first leaders with a clear plan and a track record of success Competitive compensation and performance-based incentives Full health care benefits Transportation allowance Complimentary snacks and beverages Beautiful offices in the heart of Toronto's entertainment district Unlimited vacation

Job_Description: One of our client located in the old port of Montreal is looking for a Junior Java developer for a contract ending on December 31th, 2018.  If you are a Java Developer seeking new exciting challenges, where you can make an impact, look no further. Our client is seeking Developers with a passion for solving complicated problems with the latest technologies.  In this role, you will look forward to research and use the most suitable technologies to solve our client’s current business and technical problems. If you were to join their team today, you would be part of an Agile/Kanban team, working closely with your fellow engineers and product owners to build Java and Kotlin-based applications using Spring-Boot 2 , deploying them in the Amazon Cloud (AWS) using Docker containers . You'd have to use deep learning models trained in house by data scientists. You’d be responsible to test your code, see it through production, monitor it, and keep on improving it.  Required Skills:  1 to 3 years of experience as a software developer Good knowledge of Java A strong interest in learning new technologies An excellent team spirit Interest in working on backend services Interest in devops culture/practices

Job_Description: Shape the future of commerce. Lucova Inc. is an emerging technology company with clients across North America. We bring technology, data and people together to enhance and personalize the human experience of commerce. Our tools allow brands to personalize each unique experience and interact with their customers like never before. We turn each and every transaction into a meaningful customer interaction. What you'll do: Join our core tech team and participate in solution design and development of Lucova platform Prepare appropriate documentation and specifications as needed to communicate solution to senior members Adhere to appropriate quality standards including following all quality processes and payment card industry (PCI) standards Troubleshoot and diagnose technical problems, build test solutions, and oversee test scripts to validate all new software developments and enhancements Employ sound time-management practices in order to meet external deadlines Participate with team members on client engagements/presentations Other ad hoc duties as assigned  What you'll need: Education: Bachelor (4yr) degree with a technical major in engineering or computer science (or equivalent) Software programmer with 1-3 yrs experience in developing backend software solutions (Ruby, Python, Java, Javascript, SQL, MongoDB) Track record of developing well designed backend solutions Strong attention to details, security and delivery on specifications Demonstrate initiative, multitasking and strong time management skills Additional experience working in the financial or mobile development industry would be an asset  What you can expect: Hands-on opportunity to help shape the future of the company A chance to disrupt the in-store status quo through the development of innovative solutions Exposure to startup culture  Send your resume and apply directly by contacting us at careers@lucova.com
Title: Full-Stack Developer

Job_Description: --------------- Company Profile ---------------  Miovision’s mission is to provide the foundation for tomorrow’s smart cities by transforming the way traffic networks are managed today. Backed by the world’s most advanced traffic AI, Miovision’s innovations in traffic signal planning and operations have made it possible for cities to improve the transportation experience for drivers, cyclists and pedestrians since 2005. With offices in Kitchener, Canada and Cologne, Germany, Miovision serves over 17,000 municipalities worldwide. For more information, visit www.miovision.com  ---------------- Position Summary ----------------  Do you know someone who hates the commute to work? Do you want to be part of the solution? Miovision is looking for an exceptional software developer who wants to solve meaningful problems that affect not only your friends, your family, but you! Whether you love spending time tinkering with algorithms in the backend, or laying out and styling spectacular front ends, we’ve got problems that you can apply yourself to. Bring yourself here and help be part of the solution!  Here are some of the products that you could work on.  ******** DataLink ********  DataLink is software for project and data management built for traffic data collection, that helps a user coordinate traffic data requests, organize, store and visualize data, and share files and collaborate with colleagues. In 2017, we processed over 150,000 hours of video and delivered it right to our customers to analyze. Learn more at https://miovision.com/datalink  *********** TrafficLink ***********  TrafficLink is a software platform used to help traffic engineers create more responsive, efficient traffic networks. It allows you to monitor and manage your traffic signals, monitor traffic with real-time video, provide automated traffic signal performance measures, and so much more! Learn more at https://miovision.com/trafficlink  ******************** TrafficLink Hardware ********************  TrafficLink Hardware is the hardware side of the TrafficLink product that generates a combination of video and telemetry data into the cloud. It tells us exactly what’s happening at an intersection. There are a number of products that fall under the umbrella. Learn more at https://miovision.com/trafficlink/hardware  ---------------------------------  Things we’d like you to do: ---------------------------------   Develop application features from initial design/prototype phase to production Ensure quality via dev testing (local/automated) Participate in the code review process Participate to technical road map discussions and estimation exercises Evaluate design trade-offs, and long-term impact of immediate decisions Evaluate performance and scalability of live systems  -----------------------------------------  A few things we’d like you to have: -----------------------------------------   Passion for products that directly affect our customers The ability to wear multiple hats and see things from different perspectives Curiosity to dive into technical details of how things work A positive attitude to build relationships with everyone within the organization Make data driven decisions  We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

Job_Description: Looking to work for an awesome team? You've come to the right place! Our developers are a tight-knit group, and we are pushing for substantial product development as we continue looking to grow the team in the next year. We value passion for quality, maintainable, and scalable code, and for building awesome products. A side benefit of developing for the restaurant industry is that once we’re done working hard, we have some great clients who can always provide amazing venues for unwinding with our close knit team. TouchBistro is looking for several Backend Developers at the Intermediate or Senior level here in our Toronto office. Our POS system is evolving and our customers are demanding more product capabilities. As a member of our agile Technology team, you will have the chance to work on our current or next-Gen product's web features. Our current stack is ReactJS and NodeJS but if you have worked with other frameworks that is also sufficient. To apply for this position, you must possess a minimum 1+ years of production experience using NodeJS and SQL databases. The development team is poised for growth and along with that comes with many opportunities to learn different skills as well as have a growth path internally.   YOUR DAY-to-DAY Using JavaScript, design & implement features to help our restaurant customers succeed Create a new API using NodeJS and SQL databases on the backend Keep Up-to-Date with best practices and tooling from the JavaScript community Fearlessly Collaborate with your team to solve problems and learn from failures   ALL ABOUT YOU Knowledge of modern JavaScript, HTML5, CSS3 1+ Years of Experience with NodeJS 3+ Years of experience using a backend language (we use Node, but Java, Ruby on Rails, Python, etc. is also acceptable) Some exposure to SQL or NoSQL databases Test Driven Development Experience working on teams in an agile-scrum environment 4 year College Diploma or University Degree  WHY CHOOSE US? TouchBistro is an award-winning iPad Point of Sale system, built for restaurant people by restaurant people. We’re a team of thinkers, builders, doers, and innovators. While many of us have experience working at restaurants, some of us just have a true passion for the industry. We’re venture backed by some of the best tech VCs in the world and are partnered with top innovators in the mobile, food, and payment industries. We’re global and growing! TouchBistro is used in more than 100 countries worldwide and has offices in NYC, Austin, Chicago, London and headquarters in Toronto. We’re a fast-moving, ever-evolving company on a mission to change the way restaurateurs do business and help them succeed through our products and services, but we need talented, passionate people to help! So, what do you say? Are you ready to become part of something awesome?  TouchBistro believes in fostering an inclusive workplace where all individuals have an opportunity to succeed. Requests for accommodation due to a disability can be made at any stage of the recruitment process.

Job_Description: Who we are: SPORTLOGiQ is the leading provider of advanced analytics data for professional sports teams and broadcast media. As a Senior Back End Developer, you will work with the product development team to develop our next generation advanced analytics platform, providing our users with powerful analysis tools using SPORTLOGiQ’s unique data set. This is a once-in-a-lifetime opportunity to help shape the future of sports analysis, coaching and media storytelling.What you'll do: Collaborating with the product development team to iteratively define, design and implement the backend of SPORTLOGiQ’s hockey analysis system, from data collection to data reporting and the web UI.Owning the back end software design and architecture.Define and implement the REST API used by data analysis and collection tools as well as the customer facing Web UIs.Optimizing API and database for maximum speed and scalabilityManage testing and ensure robustness of the backend infrastructure codeManaging the deployment toolchain * Working effectively with the product development and design team to ensure back end features meet front end requirements properly.What you need: Minimum 5+ years’ experience as a Back-End Developer, Database Developer or similar related role.Significant experience of building secure, scalable RESTful APIs (PHP, Python).Significant experience working with databases and datawarehousing systems (PostgreSQL)Experience using cloud based platforms such as AWS / HerokuExperience in C++ programming a plus.Experience with FFMPEG/h264 a plus.Proficient understanding of code versioning tools, such as GitBachelor’s degree in Computer Science, or Computer Engineering.Passion for hockey a nice plus!What we offer: Extremely competitive salary/bonus programCentralized and accessible location in trendy Mile-EndCompetitive benefits packageFlexible work scheduleJob Type: Full-timeEducation:Bachelor's

Job_Description: About Soundstream MultimediaSoundStream Multimedia is a one stop shop for all multimedia related production! Job_Description: Our rapidly growing team is looking for a full-time Software Developer to work in our Toronto office. Our ideal candidate has two years experience in a software production environment (Ruby/RoR) and is excited by the challenges found in an emerging sector.  About Us  Ample Organics is Canada’s most trusted technology provider for Licensed Producers. A complete ecosystem for cannabis businesses, our platform was designed for government regulations and makes compliance easy by tracking individual plants and reporting every detail of the growth, production, and sales processes. We are seeking courageous and intelligent people to join our team of trailblazers.  Responsibilities  Work in Agile teams to design, build, and maintain the front end of our core SaaS product Work with product and design teams to refine requirements, while also participating in the maintenance of a Vue.js component library used across applications Develop and maintain reliable, scalable, well-tested code Participate in the resolution of support issues and feature requests Collaborate and share knowledge with other team members Write unit and automation tests  Tools and tech the team is using: Our tech stack is being modernized with:Scalable, elegant, well-tested applications built with: Vue, Vuex, Axios, Webpack, our own Vue component library, Karma and Nightwatch.js on the front end Ruby on Rails, GoLang, PostgreSQL, and AWS on the backend A collaborative code review process on Github, including our documented Git Flow Our front-end, full-stack, back-end, and devops team members work closely together to build our products holistically in an Agile (Scrum) methodology This includes working with our Agile Coach, Technical Writers, and other teams to write kick-ass documentation Motorized sit/stand desks macOS or Ubuntu development environment, it’s up to you! Ample’s Offer  We are offering competitive compensation that includes: benefits, professional development, and the potential to earn options in a quickly developing company. If daily challenges and helping to define a global industry sound exciting, this is the career you’ve been looking for.  If your experience is really close to what is outlined above, please consider applying. Experience is key, however enthusiasm, determination, and grit go a long way. We are looking for a true product champion, which comes in many forms. We encourage everyone interested to apply. Ample Organics is an Equal Opportunity Employer.  Who you’ll be working with  Evan McEwen, VP Technology Ronen Kalo, Director of Technology Martin Laws, Lead, Front End Development Ravi Desai, Sr. Software Engineer

Job_Description: About Us  Do you want to be a part of something disruptive and change an entire industry? Do you want to be a part of a best-in-class culture? Do you want to be in the first wave of individuals to help shape the growth of a company? If you are excited about anything you just read, we’d love for you to be a part of the Upchain team!  At Upchain, we are looking to turn the PLM (Product Lifecycle Management) industry on it’s head. By 2021, many project the SaaS PLM industry to be worth over $40 Billion USD, and we are driven to make our mark! We have the product, we have the vision, and we have the plan…now we need a great team to execute!  Job Description  To do this we need the help of experienced full stack developers who are dedicated, versatile, methodical and able to do this without a lot of direction. You’ll work with other talented team members to build our enterprise and cloud service that allows our customers to build their products at a global scale.  We are a well funded startup with a fun work culture that thrives on working with other smart and motivated people.  Full Stack Developer Duties & Responsibilities:  Architect new features and get feedback from the team while documenting this so that others can understand Plan and break down large features into itemized tasks working with the management team to schedule them Develop features along the full stack (backend, database schema, front end, deployment) in an iterative fashion with our scrum based process. Write unit and integration tests for new and old features Design and develop load tests for the system Identify problems in the product and ways it can be improved Help other team members through mentoring, code reviews, and design reviews Work with DevOps and other staff to get changes into production in a way that can be easily managed Debug application issues in all environments including production  Full Stack Developer Qualification & Skills:  UNIX command line experience SQL All aspects of web applications including REST APIs, database models, user front ends Unit testing and a commitment to quality Initiative to work autonomously Proper development workflow including code reviews, automated builds, bug tracking Experience debugging full stack systems including performance issues Designing features and helping to plan the tasks to build it  Ideally you would also have experience with:  Go, NodeJS, Java OR the desire to learn these quickly GWT, AngularJS OR the desire to learn these quickly Server management experience (DevOps or IT Admin) Other database experience is an asset: Redis, ElasticSearch, etc. Cloud stack experience (AWS, GCP, Azure) Writing documentation for APIs Database query optimization and profiling Setting up all aspects of a development environment including build server, code style, listing, etc.

Job_Description: About SuiteSpot  At SuiteSpot we are on a mission to transform the way real-estate is managed and operated at scale. We're well-funded startup in Toronto, building a product that is well underway. SuiteSpot combines tens of years of industry experience with the latest SaaS technologies to deliver products and insights that streamline our customers' operations and help them stay ahead the curve.  Our core values are Passion, Integrity and Execution. They guide all of our decisions, every day. Who you are  You’re a junior/intermediate Full-Stack Developer  An out of the box thinker and innovator along the way  You have excellent attention to detail and you like to move fast  You have an entrepreneurial mindset, are ready up roll up your sleeves, and wear multiple hats  Love what you do and take pride in the impact that you make to the company!  You enjoy working with others in a highly collaborative environment  You live and breathe product, and are always learning new ways of building the right product, for the right audience  You're equally happy learning something new or teaching others something you've learned  You're looking for a company that will appreciate you for your excellence  What you'll be doing  Dream features and live code. Be part of our technical team and make your contribution during all stages of the development effort: feature design, coding, QA and delivery. We are passionate about the value our products deliver for our customers and proud of our engineering craft. We like to keep our code base well architected, clean, testable and scalable. What you should have  Experience in a startup environment  Strong software design, development and testing skills acquired through a compelling academic background or practical work experience.  Fluency in Javascript/Typescript is required. Our stack is based entirely on Typescript with Angular 2+ on the frontend and NodeJS on the backend. We use MongoDB as the main data store. We deploy to the cloud using Docker.  Experience with HTML5 and CSS3 is required.  Experience with automated testing frameworks (Protractor/Selenium/WebDriver) and continuous integration systems (Circle CI, Travis, etc.) is a plus.  Experience with mobile development frameworks Apache Cordova, Ionic 2+, is a plus.  What's in it for you  Join an early stage startup that aims at nothing short of changing the world.  Work with some of the best and brightest in the industry  Friendly environment with flexible hours  Competitive compensation package  Learning culture (we insist)  Build products that delight customers with a team that shares your passion for technology in a fast and agile, no red-tape environment.  Grow with us and be an early part of the success story with a comprehensive stock option plan, competitive pay and benefits.

Priority Setting.  Strong Organizational and Time Management skills.  Quality Management. Strong knowledge of Microsoft Azure cloud solutions and technologies, C#, Microsoft ASP.NET platform, Web API, Microsoft SQL Server, Visual Studio, Internet technologies, HTML, XML, JSON as well as security techniques and web server familiarity.

Job_Description: About Paytm Labs:  Paytm Labs is located in the heart of Toronto, nestled between the busy Finance and vibrant entertainment District. Transmitting billions of bytes of electronic and secure data at dizzying speed is our forte, it allows us to make commerce more accessible and convenient. We proudly support Paytm India and we are the birth place of the Paytm Canada app.  In 2017, we launched the Paytm Canada App, a consumer-facing mobile application allowing consumers to pay their bills using multiple payment options with no fees, earn points, and make peer-to-peer payments.  Paytm India is the largest leading Payment gateway that offers comprehensive payment services for approximately 250 million customers and 7 million merchants. We offer mobile payment solutions to allow consumers to make seamless mobile payments from Credit Cards, Bank Accounts, and Digital Credit among others. We pioneered and are the leader of QR code based mobile payments in India. With the launch of Paytm Payments Bank, we aim to bring banking and financial services to half-a-billion un-served and under-served people in India and around the globe.  Paytm Labs is proudly certified as a Great Place to Work! We are small, diverse, and tight-knit team that is committed to working for the end consumer. We leverage our expertise in technology to build lasting, secure, and efficient solutions. Our creative and incredibly talented engineers work to provide customized and confidential experiences for consumer of Paytm India and Paytm Canada. We encourage our employees to take charge of their innovative ideas and execute them with passion and vigor. Work closely with the design and backend team to build and develop web applications for our forward thinking products.  Responsibilities:Work on all things front-end including web and mobile. Building applications that are responsive, performant, and accessible Produce high quality HTML/CSS pages from mock ups.Collaborating with other disciplines across engineering, UX, and Product to help develop front end solutions.Using our Micro service stack to integrate front end into the development lifecycle.  Qualifications:Degree in Computer Science, similar field, or equivalent experience.4 + years of experience of software development.Experience using Angular or React or Vue.js.Interest and ability to learn new technology stacks as needed.Experience with server-side web app code, e.g. REST APIs using Java, Ruby and/or Node.js.Doesn’t shy away from testing and code review.React Native or Weex experience is a plus.  What We Offer:We are proud to announce that we have been certified as a Great Place to Work!A collaborative, open work environment that fosters ownership, creativity, and urgency.Enrollment in the Group Health Benefits plan right from the day you start working, no waiting period.We believe in hard work, fun, innovation, and team building. Every other month, we plan an activity to celebrate that. So far, we've gone biking, axe-throwing, bowling, indoor rocking climbing, and go-karting (to name a few).Chocolates & Snacks: Our "Chief Chocolate Officer" is in charge of stocking high-quality chocolates for all.Ping Pong: A chance to be Paytm Labs table tennis champion!  *Selected candidates will be given a technical challenge*  We thank all applicants, however, only those selected for an interview will be contacted.   Paytm Labs is committed to meeting the accessibility needs of all individuals in accordance with the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act (AODA) and the Ontario Human Rights Code (OHRC). Initially, the role will be focused on manual testing various client and internal product releases; however, your extensive automation testing experience will enable the company to integrate an automated testing tool into the mainstream of our testing process. Your ability to design and develop testing strategies, plans and test cases is well recognized by your managers and peers.RESPONSIBILITIESDeliver amazing products to customersEnsure features achieve the desired level of functional flow and quality, including reliability, security and performance.Facilitate Acceptance Test Driven Development (ATDD) by working with developers and testers to ensure quality unit tests are created based on test dataUnderstand application acceptance and provide support in automation of testingWorking to minimize manual testing by identifying high-ROI test cases and automating themWorking within an agile environment/team to implement development of the product as per Test Pyramid ConceptIdentifying layers of Test Pyramid and the appropriate implementation of these tests within those layersUse and maintain test automation frameworkProvide leadership and guidance to the quality of the projectActively participate in establishing project and sprint plans, estimating work and monitoring progress against milestones.Develop test plans/cases within an agile framework from user stories or requirement specifications; define methodologies, pass/fail criteria, risk assessment and assumptions.Work with management to define and/or improve processes, templates, and standards related to software testingContribute to product quality by developing tools that identify issues as well as improve testabilityCreative solving of technical problems – to ensure the ability to translate technical requirements to test plansResponsible for system analysis, and decomposition of business and functional/ system requirements to develop test scenarios & test conditions (front and/ or back-end systems and applications)Helping to ensure functionality delivered in each sprint is tested as features are deliveredManage defects in compliance with the established defects management process and use tools such as JiraEnsures automated tests are integrated into the Continuous Delivery PipelineCo-ordinate code deployments, maintenance upgrades and project testing across numerous environments on various technology platforms.Build relationships and work collaboratively to identify solutions and resolve variances from product/application specificationsTest Mobile Devices (iOS, Android, Windows Phone)BEHAVIOURALYou win as a team and lose as a team; you never leave a teammate behindYou build positive team spirit through empowerment, trust and respectYou advocate for our customers by guiding your team to deliver smart solutionsYou do the right thing, even if it’s difficult to doYou celebrate all victories, big or smallThrive in an agile, lean and fast-paced environmentAre curious, experiment and never stop learningEmbrace diversity and new ideasQUALIFICATIONSSKILLSStrong analytical and problem-solving skillsStrong organizational and planning skillsStrong interpersonal and communication skillsStrong knowledge in performing testing activities using all the appropriate techniques, such as black box, white box, integration, functional, regression, performance, usability, installation, security, and more.Ability to lead and work as part of a team with good work ethicsExcellent written, interpersonal and verbal communication skills*EXPERIENCEMinimum 4 years IT related experience with specific focus in QAQA Automation ExperienceExperience working on a SaaS enterprise web-based and mobile applicationExperience with UI and backend testingExperience designing and executing SQL statements for database manipulation and querying.Experience using Visual Studio, Selenium, unit test (nUnit or MS Test), SoapUIProficiency in documenting and recording bugs and errors discovered during system, software testing, training documentation and recommending solutions for corrective actions.Intermediate programming skills in C# and JavaScriptKnowledge and understanding of Unit Tests and their implementationCOMPANY INFORMATIONSCI offers our employees a competitive salary, comprehensive employee benefits, and an environment that fosters teamwork & entrepreneurial spirit. Our organization will, on request, provide accommodations for applicants with disabilities to support their participation in all aspects of our Recruitment Process. SCI is an equal opportunity employer. We thank all applicants for their interest, however, only those selected for an interview will be contacted.Job Type: Full-timeExperience:QA: 1 year
