Job_Description: We’re on a mission to build the relationship-focused bank of the future and we’re looking for the passionate collaborators, innovators, advisors, and leaders who can get us there. Our distinct culture is built on a shared commitment to do what’s right for our clients, our people, and our communities, and we strive for excellence in everything we do. Because life at CIBC is not only what you do, but how you do it.  To learn more about CIBC, please visit CIBC.com  What You’ll Be Doing  You’ll contribute to CIBC’s Digital transformation by successfully delivering complex, enterprise-scale projects involving multiple back-end systems. As a Senior MEAN Stack Developer within Capital Markets Technology, you will build, implement and maintain easy, flexible, and personalized solutions that enhance the client experience. As you lead the planning and strategy for the technical design, development, and integration of these applications, you’ll help build the future of banking.  How You’ll Succeed Design & Develop: Perform and coordinate complex application programming activities: Design application's technical infrastructure: specific databases, programming languages, utilities, and testing approaches. Lead the design and development of cost-effective and innovative solutions to meet business objectives while also maintaining existing applications. Perform complex HTML5, JavaScript, AngularJS, Angular2, 4, 5, CSS3 programming activities Technology Roadmap: Develop 1-3 year technology roadmaps to align with overall vision & strategy. Spearhead multiple complex projects involving backend systems, new technology and innovation and enhancing existing applications Strong Leadership: Act as the development team lead and interface with the project team including leading code-review sessions to ensure overall code quality aligns with business and project requirements. Support and mentor intermediate and senior developers through knowledge sharing, collaboration and effective problem solving.  Who You Are  You can demonstrate experience in: 5+ years of hands-on development experience with Java, MEAN Stack, microservices, HTML5, JavaScript, CSS3, Angular JS, Angular 2, 4, 5; NodeJS, and CSS3 while working within an Agile test-driven environment. You have the proven ability to effectively interact with stakeholders, end users, business analysts, and technical resources to gather requirements and prepare design specifications while managing multiple priorities and projects. Experience with UX/UI, Adobe Photoshop & Illustrator, SiteCatalyst, BitBucket, JIRA, GIT, Junit, REACT, Maven, Jenkins considered an asset. It would be an advantage if you have experience with visual design, site navigation, and webpage. Your influence makes an impact. You know that relationships and networks are essential to success. You inspire outcomes by making yourself heard. You're driven by collective success. You know that collaboration can transform a good idea into a great one. You understand the power of a team that enjoys working together to create a shared vision. You are passionate about client service - You want the work you do each day to result in a positive client experience. \ Values matter to you. You bring your real self to work and you live our values - trust, teamwork, and accountability. What CIBC Offers At CIBC, our people are our greatest asset. You’ll become part of a diverse community that acknowledges everyone’s unique talents, and empowers teams to do what’s right for the client, and to do it well. As part of our team, you will:  Thrive: Benefit from an open and approachable culture that provides the flexibility and support you need to integrate your life at work and at home Connect: Work in a place where the right technology and infrastructure fosters innovation, collaboration and creativity Develop: Grow your skills and career through our best-in-class onboarding experience, ongoing learning opportunities, and individual development planning. Prosper: Share in our collective success with a competitive salary, incentive pay, banking benefits, health benefits program, and employee share purchase plan What You Need to Know  CIBC is committed to creating an inclusive environment where all team members and clients feel like they belong. We seek applicants with a wide range of abilities and we provide an accessible candidate experience. If you need accommodation during the application or interview process, please contact Mailbox.careers-carrieres@cibc.com You need to be legally eligible to work in Canada at the location(s) specified above and, where applicable, must have a valid work or study permit
Title: Senior Full Stack Developer

Job_Description: Développeur Junior de logiciels Backend Vous désirez travailler sur des solutions automobiles et IoT (Internet des objets) ? Joignez-vous à nous pour faire partie de l'aventure en tant que Développeur Junior Backend ! Nous développons des services-nuages pour le frontend web et mobile, en plus de générer des interactions hardware du backend à une flotte de voitures connectés au Cloud. Dans un environnement en mode Agile, axé sur les tests et le développement, l’équipe logiciel est forte sur l’évolution continuelle. Relevant au Directeur de l’ingénierie – Développement logiciel, vous serez responsable de concevoir, développer et faire évoluer les services-nuages complets utilisés pour surveiller et contrôler les comportements des véhicules. Le système complet est composé d’équipements spécialisés dans les automobiles, d’applications mobiles et web et de systèmes backend. Votre expérience coté-serveur comme développeur vous aidera à guider l'architecture globale du système, en plus d’être un membre actif dans le développement du back-end et pour interagir avec l’équipe front-end. Vos principales responsabilités seront : Gestion de Projets et de Processus Collaborer avec les autres membres de l’équipe, les clients, les autres équipes travail (Mobile, Interface, Embedded, Test, TI, et Marketing) et des partenaires externes lorsque requis Participer à la gestion de projet en aidant les autres à comprendre les différentes possibilités coté-serveur, en assistant au niveau de l’architecture du système back-end, et en définissant les tâches selon l’historique des utilisateurs et le suivi du progrès. Participer à la consolidation, le suivi, la priorisation, la planification des exigences du produit et à la correction des bugs. Maintenir la philosophie de l’amélioration continuelle Travailler dans un environnement Agile Communiquer les problèmes techniques et les détails du projet à ses pairs et à l’équipe de la direction Technique – Développement des solutions logicielles Cartographier les exigences détaillées en solutions logicielles Guider la feuille de route de l'architecture du système, les spécifications et la décision technique clé Assurer la facilité d'utilisation, la facilité de support, la robustesse, l'évolution et la sécurité des fonctionnalités : des éléments clés pour les solutions de conception recommandées Participer activement au développement et au codage de la solution logicielle, notamment au niveau du serveur backend Promouvoir les meilleures pratiques logicielles (ex : développement des tests, intégration continuelle et déploiement continuel de la culture Qualifications : Baccalauréat en génie informatique ou l'équivalent Trois (3) ans d'expérience dans le développement de logiciels côté serveur Expérience dans le développement d'architecture client-serveur Expérience avec les technologies basées sur Java Expérience avec les microarchitectures, y compris Spring Boot, Spring REST et JPA Expérience en développement d'applications Web avec Angular 2+ Expérience en conception de systèmes utilisant des services web (REST, SOAP, XML / JSON) Expérience en SOA Excellentes aptitudes en communication orale et écrite (anglais et français) Atouts : Intégration des services télématiques 24X7 haute disponibilité (backend et présentation) Expérience de la plate-forme de messagerie télématique de véhicules (traitement des messages GPS, traitement des alertes, configuration de l'appareil OTA) Expérience avec au moins un des éléments suivants: Intégration de réseaux MVNO ou télécoms Traitement de messages à volume élevé - Kafka, JMS, ActiveMQ, Camel Stockage de messages basé sur NoSQL - NoSQL, MongoDB, DynamoDB, Cassandr Expérience en traitement des messages, recherche et analyse - Elasticsearch, Hadoop Ecosystem Expérience avec les Technologies Amazon Web Services incluant EC2, ECS, RDS, DynamoDB, CloudWatch Expérience en déploiement de l'application Docker et gestion du contenu Connaissance de ces outils: Target Process ou Jira, Confluence, SVN / Git, Jenkins Expérience avec les technologies Microsoft (ASP.NET, IIS, C #, Visual Studio, MSSQL, etc.) Expérience avec Linux Compétences : Proactif Axé sur les résultats Organisé, méthodique Capacité à travailler sous pression Solides compétences analytiques, approche systémique Capacité à garder le focus et prioriser Capacité à troubleshooting, tester les approches / méthodologies Aimer travailler au sein d'une équipe dynamique Capacité de proposer / présenter des solutions et d'atteindre un consensus en cas de besoin Attentif aux détails Capacité à interagir avec des partenaires de développement et directement avec les contacts techniques du client pour les spécifications, les tests, les défis d'intégration Junior Backend Software Developer Do you want to work on state of the art vehicle and IoT solutions? Join us and be part of the adventure as a server-side (backend) development team! We are developing cloud services for both web and mobile front ends, as well as generating hardware interactions from the backend to a fleet of cloud-connected cars. We are aficionados of Agile, test-driven development and CI with an eye to CD. The software group is big on continuous improvement. Reporting to the Director of Engineering Software Development, you will design, develop and evolve end-to-end cloud services used to monitor and control some motorized vehicle behaviors. The end-to-end system is composed of in-car devices, smartphone & web apps, and backend systems. Your server-side developer background will help you guide the overall system architecture as well as actively develop the backend, and interact with the frontend team. Your main responsibilities will be: Project and Process Management Collaborate with other team members, with Product Owners, work closely with other functional groups (Mobile, Interface, Embedded, Test, IT Team and Marketing) and outsourced partners when required Participate in project management by helping others understand the possibilities of server-side, assisting with backend system architecture, and defining your tasks as driven by user stories, and progress tracking. Participate in the consolidation, the follow-up, the prioritization and the scheduling of product requirements and bug fixing implementation. Live the Continuous Improvement philosophy. Work in an Agile-Scrum environment Communicate technical issues and project details to peers and management team Technical - Development of software solutions Map detailed business requirements into software solutions Guide the system architecture roadmap, the specifications and the key technical decision Ensure that feature ease-of-use, ease-of-support, robustness, scalability and security are always key ingredients in the recommended design solutions Actively participate in development and coding, namely at the server-side level (backend) Promote the software best practice, i.e. test-driven development, continuous integration, and continuous deployment culture Qualifications: Bachelor’s degree in computer science or equivalent 3 years + of professional experience in server-side software development Experience in Client-server architecture development Experience with Java based technologies Micro service architectures including Spring Boot, Spring REST & JPA Experience in design of systems using web services (REST, SOAP, XML/JSON) Experience with service oriented architecture (SOA) Excellent communication verbal/written skills (English and French) Pluses: Integration of 24/7 high-availability telematics service (backend and presentation) Vehicle telematics messaging platform experience (GPS message processing, alert processing, OTA device configuration) At least one of the following : MVNO or telecom carrier network integration high volume message processing - Kafka, JMS, ActiveMQ, Camel NoSQL based message storage - NoSQL, MongoDB, DynamoDB, Cassandra message processing, search and analytics - Elasticsearch, Hadoop Ecosystem Experience with Amazon Web Services technologies including EC2, ECS, RDS, DynamoDB, CloudWatch Experience with Docker application deployment and container management Experience with Linux Knowledge of Target Process or Jira, Confluence, SVN/Git, Jenkins Experience with Microsoft technologies (ASP.NET, IIS, C#, Visual Studio, MSSQL, etc.) Strengths and skills: Proactive Result-oriented Organized, methodical Works well under pressure Strong analytical skills, system approach; Ability to focus on established priorities; Ability to troubleshoot, test-driven approaches/methodologies; Enjoy working as part of a dynamic team Ability to suggest/present solution approaches and reach consensus when needed; Attention to detail Able to interface with 3rd party development partners and directly with the customer technical contacts for specifications, testing, integration challenges
Title: Développeur Jr Backend Developer

Job_Description: À propos d’Ipnos  Ipnos est un studio créatif de développement d’applications mobiles où la technologie rencontre le bien-être. Créatrice de Relax Melodies, qui compte des millions d’utilisateurs fidèles, notre entreprise innove dans des produits dédiés au sommeil, à la relaxation et à la méditation.  Avec plus de 400 000 téléchargements par mois, nos apps touchent des millions d’utilisateurs de façon positive. Ce succès est attribué à une équipe agile, passionnée et ultra-talentueuse. Dans un monde digital, Ipnos répand le bien-être, un usager à la fois. Vous connaissez sans doute quelqu’un qui utilise une de nos applications!  Nous sommes l'une des rares entreprises québécoises vivant du succès mondial d'une application mobile. Nous faisons ainsi concurrence à nos compétiteurs de la Silicon Valley.  Pourquoi avons-nous besoin de vous?  Ipnos est à la recherche d’un développeur mobile iOS et Android solide et talentueux pour ajouter à son équipe. Nous sommes une entreprise en croissance où chaque projet est important et où le rôle de chacun est primordial. Nous travaillons dans un environnement agile avec les meilleures pratiques de développement et les dernières technologies. Nous cherchons des gens qui veulent faire la différence, car nos employés sont le moteur de notre entreprise. Responsabilités Développer de nouvelles applications mobilesMaintenir et à améliorer des applications existantesTravailler sur avec des systèmes d’analytics avancésInterfacer le backend et le front endCréer des modules et des librairies réutilisables à travers les différents projets.Participer à l’amélioration continue des outils et du processus de  développement. Automatiser le maximum de tâches   Vous êtes : Une personne autonome possédant un bon leadership et sens de l’initiativeRigoureuse, organisée et structuréeExcellent à effectuer un travail multitâche au sein d’un environnement  dynamique, tout en respectant les échéanciers Reconnu pour tes habiletés interpersonnelles et ta capacité à communiquer  clairement et efficacement de l’information  Vous avez : Expérience en programmation d’au moins 2 ans avec un langage orienté objetBaccalauréat en génie logiciel, informatique ou doté d'une expérience similaireExcellente aptitude et compétence en UI / UXAvoir le souci du détail et de produire du code de qualitéExpérience en création d’applications sous iOS ou Android un atoutAutonome, autodidacte et passionné  Pourquoi se joindre à notre équipe?  Ipnos met le bien-être au cœur de ses activités. Quelques raisons pour se joindre à nous: Travailler sur un produit unique qui aide des millions de personnes à travers le monde.Équipe jeune, créative et passionnéeEnvironnement agile mettant en place les meilleures pratiquesLieu de travail à ambiance zenAire de détente pour méditation et yoga sur placeEnvironnement et équipement AppleDéjeuners gratuitsGym sur placeHoraires flexiblesÀ proximité des transports en communAssurances collectives  Envoyez votre C.V. à jobs@ipnos.com
Title: Mobile Developer

Job_Description: Requisition ID: 28956 Join the Global Community of Scotiabankers to help customers become better off. What your role will be... Senior Full Stack Software Developer  Purpose of Job As an API engineer, you will be working as part of a smaller, but efficient team to deliver services for use in both internal and external applications. The successful candidate considers themselves a full-stack engineer with a preference for the backend details. They can modify UI components, write a RESTful API, and implement a data backend, write high-performance software, and micro-service architecture.  Key Job Accountabilities  5+ years programming full-stack applications Experience storing, querying, searching, streaming, and manipulating big data sets Experience with micro-service architecture and cloud infrastructure Experience writing and integrating RESTful APIs Knowledge and experience with JavaScript is mandatory Good knowledge of at least one of the following programming languages: Java, Python Good knowledge of at least one API frameworks, languages, tools, specification, frameworks, development & client tools: Express.js, JSON, Swagger, Java, Python, Docker, Kubernetes Experience using Vue.js, Node.js, and/or GoLang a plus A positive attitude and a reliable, self-motivated, team player with excellent communication skills A track record in employing and ensuring industry best practices for software development Knowledge of software development lifecycle, CI, and Agile development practices A history of adopting and evangelizing new technologies and motivated to do new and interesting things Comfortable working as part of a distributed team  Education and Other Requirements  Bachelor (equivalent or higher) degree in Computer Science, Engineering or related discipline 2-3 years of banking/financial industry experience. Experience working in an Agile environment  Location(s): Canada : Ontario : Toronto As Canada’s International Bank, we are a leader when it comes to inclusion. We are a diverse and global team, speaking more than 100 languages with backgrounds from more than 120 countries. We value the unique skills and experiences each individual brings to the bank, and are committed to creating and maintaining an inclusive and accessible environment for everyone. Candidates selected for an interview will be contacted directly. If you require accommodation during the recruitment and selection process, please let us know. We will work with you to provide as seamless a recruitment experience as possible.
Title: Senior Full Stack Software Developer - Toronto, ON

Job_Description: The AI platform services team at 24/7 Inc. is a group dedicated to building AI services such as chat bots, knowledge base search and numerous platform components that power our Predictive OmniChannel customer service solutions that support voice, social, mobile and web front ends. We work closely with the Platform services group that develops applications on top of our platform, Data Science group that develops advanced deep learning technologies, speech to text algorithms, prediction models, the UX team that design cutting-edge user interfaces and other cross functional teams to generate, collect, analyze, visualize data in the form of reports. We are looking for a Full stack engineer with strong design and development skills building both frontends and backends, with exposure to building cloud scale web services. You will be working closely with data scientists, peer developers and UX teams to develop new services that involve Machine Learning and NLP. You will be incorporating Machine Learning and NL technologies in a scalable architecture for our Fortune 100 customers. You will be a contributing to architecture, design and software engineering through all stages of product development. The ideal candidate should have the following qualifications: BS in Computer Science (or equivalent work experience) 8+ years of strong design and development skills and ability to produce maintainable code in the cloud Experienced in developing frontends using web technologies such as HTML 5, Javascript, CSS, React.js & UI frameworks Experience in programming with Node.js & a demonstrated ability to pickup new programming languages a big plus 2+ years of experience in building scalable RESTful web services Demonstrated ability for attention to detail and passion for high quality software Demonstrated ability to work with cross functional stake holders such as UX designers, Product owners to gather requirements and turn that into working code You love being part of a strong team and can actively provide and receive feedback in code reviews, design reviews and other technical discussions Online portfolio (public github or similar) is a plus Good understanding of agile practices and experience working in scrum teams Strong verbal and written communication skills  ABOUT [24]7: [24]7 is redefining the way companies interact with consumers. Using artificial intelligence and machine learning to understand consumer intent, [24]7’s technology helps companies create a personalized, predictive and effortless customer experience across all channels. The world’s largest and most recognizable brands are using intent-driven engagement from [24]7 to assist several hundred million visitors annually, through more than 1.5 billion conversations, most of which are automated. The result is an order of magnitude improvement in digital adoption, customer satisfaction, and revenue growth.
Title: Sr. Software Engineer - Full Stack, AI Platform Services

Job_Description: Pathcore is a Toronto-based software company specializing in whole slide digital pathology image management and workflow. The company develops leading enterprise grade software for managing big pathology data which supports cancer informatics and healthcare IT. We are located in downtown Toronto, steps away from Queen’s Park metro station and the MaRS discovery district. About the Position Pathcore is currently recruiting an energetic, detailed-oriented and motivated Software Developer for creating leading web applications for healthcare. The successful candidate will assist with development of Pathcore Web, a cloud-enabled environment for accessing wholeslide pathology images designed for viewing, annotating and analyzing wholeslide pathology images. The candidate will be responsible for ensuring development targets are met in a timely fashion while working with other developers to produce high quality, well-tested and user-friendly software. We expect responsibilities will be dynamic and expand as we strive to meet our clients’ needs. Responsibilities and Expectations Must be detail-oriented with the ability to learn new technologies and libraries through self-study Work closely with system designers to develop architecture and create implementation plans Review, test and enhance existing features Performance tuning, testing, and documentation Handling inbound support and responding to bug reports Required Skills and Experience Comprehensive knowledge of frontend web development technologies, including JavaScript, CSS, HTML Experience developing web application backends using Flask, Django, Rails, Express, or an equivalent framework Experience with relational databases such as Postgres or MySQL Past experience with using software development tools and methods (source control, unit testing, bug tracking, continuous integration, etc.) Must have excellent English communication skills; both verbal and written Desirable Skills Experience with Python Past experience using or developing software for medical imaging Medical image analysis (i.e. algorithm development) background and/or training Experience deploying software on cloud platforms (e.g. GCP, AWS, Microsoft Azure)
Title: Full Stack Web Developer (Medical Imaging)

Job_Description: Voices.com offers talented and motivated Web Developers the opportunity to work in a dynamic and growing company. As the ideal Web Developer, you will work from an open concept environment and be set-up with a suite of Web development tools. Through internal advancement opportunities and a competitive salary you'll have the chance to create a career that you can be proud of. Don't miss your chance to join our winning team! Essential Job Functions & Responsibilities  Design and implement our web backend platform, fast  Evaluate and spec out new product development opportunities  Rapidly iterate on software projects  Research and advise on new technologies and improvements  Desire to work in a fast paced environment  Strong collaborative skills and ability to fulfill multiple roles  Attention to detail and quality  Skills Required  Experience in development of video/multimedia sites, community sites, or other web applications  Knowledge of social media, social networking and modern web apps  Familiar with Javascript, CSS, DHTML, XML, AJAX  In-depth knowledge of PHP, MySQL, and Apache  Expertise in Linux  Excellent presentation skills, relational skills, communication (telephone and email), dependable, reliable, ambitious, driven  Educational Requirements  3+ years experience in database-driven web site development  BS or MS in Computer Science or equivalent work experience  Equal Employment Opportunities  Voices.com values diversity. We're proud to be an equal opportunity employer and consider qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, ancestry, age, genetic information, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital or family status, veteran status, medical condition or disability. Accommodation  Voices.com is committed to providing accommodation for applicants with disabilities; please let us know if you require an accommodation during the recruitment process.
Title: Web Developer

Job_Description: Looking to work for an awesome team? You've come to the right place! Our developers are a tight-knit group, and we are pushing for substantial product development as we continue looking to grow the team in the next year. We value passion for quality, maintainable, and scalable code, and for building awesome products. A side benefit of developing for the restaurant industry is that once we’re done working hard, we have some great clients who can always provide amazing venues for unwinding with our close knit team. TouchBistro is looking for several Backend Developers at the Intermediate or Senior level here in our Toronto office. Our POS system is evolving and our customers are demanding more product capabilities. As a member of our agile Technology team, you will have the chance to work on our current or next-Gen product's web features. Our current stack is ReactJS and NodeJS but if you have worked with other frameworks that is also sufficient. To apply for this position, you must possess a minimum 1+ years of production experience using NodeJS and SQL databases. The development team is poised for growth and along with that comes with many opportunities to learn different skills as well as have a growth path internally.   YOUR DAY-to-DAY Using JavaScript, design & implement features to help our restaurant customers succeed Create a new API using NodeJS and SQL databases on the backend Keep Up-to-Date with best practices and tooling from the JavaScript community Fearlessly Collaborate with your team to solve problems and learn from failures   ALL ABOUT YOU Knowledge of modern JavaScript, HTML5, CSS3 1+ Years of Experience with NodeJS 3+ Years of experience using a backend language (we use Node, but Java, Ruby on Rails, Python, etc. is also acceptable) Some exposure to SQL or NoSQL databases Test Driven Development Experience working on teams in an agile-scrum environment 4 year College Diploma or University Degree  WHY CHOOSE US? TouchBistro is an award-winning iPad Point of Sale system, built for restaurant people by restaurant people. We’re a team of thinkers, builders, doers, and innovators. While many of us have experience working at restaurants, some of us just have a true passion for the industry. We’re venture backed by some of the best tech VCs in the world and are partnered with top innovators in the mobile, food, and payment industries. We’re global and growing! TouchBistro is used in more than 100 countries worldwide and has offices in NYC, Austin, Chicago, London and headquarters in Toronto. We’re a fast-moving, ever-evolving company on a mission to change the way restaurateurs do business and help them succeed through our products and services, but we need talented, passionate people to help! So, what do you say? Are you ready to become part of something awesome?  TouchBistro believes in fostering an inclusive workplace where all individuals have an opportunity to succeed. Requests for accommodation due to a disability can be made at any stage of the recruitment process.

Job_Description: Our Mission: Modern Money Movement.Instant Financial is disrupting the standard notion of ‘payday’ by giving workers daily control over their earned income. We allow people to live better lives by fixing the misalignment between when people get paid and when they need their money. Employers who pay with Instant enjoy greater access to the best employees as well as high employee retention and engagement. All of this translates into a better, more profitable business. We have started the payroll revolution and need talented passionate people to join the Modern Money Movement.We are dreamers who have a proven track record of making big things happen. We do this by inspiring ourselves and those we work with to do what others cannot do. We know that we must move together as a team, celebrate our successes, and above all learn quickly from the mistakes we know will be made due to the fast pace of our execution. We carry ourselves with urgency, honesty and integrity in everything we do. Together, we truly believe we can empower working lives.About the Team: We're a small but high-performing team of engineers, building SaaS and mobile technologies for a rapidly growing organization, led by a founding team with a proven track record.We embrace Agile and DevOps practices and tools to ensure the delivery of high quality software with a high release velocity. We have a well defined product and technology roadmap in support of a very healthy sales pipeline. We have a highly efficient flat structure and ambitious growth plans.Our stack is JavaScript-based (including with Node/Express microservices). Most importantly, we work in a collaborative environment of continuous learning - we expect you to challenge us as much as we challenge you!About You: You're an intermediate to senior full stack developer with JavaScript skills. You're passionate about building web and mobile applications and you’ve had experience delivering production-grade software.You thrive in fast-paced environments where you have lots of independence and ownership. Job_Description: We’re on a mission to build the relationship-focused bank of the future and we’re looking for the passionate collaborators, innovators, advisors, and leaders who can get us there. Our distinct culture is built on a shared commitment to do what’s right for our clients, our people, and our communities, and we strive for excellence in everything we do. Because life at CIBC is not only what you do, but how you do it.  To learn more about CIBC, please visit CIBC.com  What You’ll Be Doing  You’ll be at the heart of CIBC’s digital transformation, successfully delivering complex, enterprise-scale mobile projects involving multiple back-end systems. As an Application Consultant, you will build, implement and maintain easy, flexible, and personalized solutions that enhance the client experience across both iOS and Android. You’ll lead the planning and strategy for the technical design, development and integration of these applications.  How You’ll Succeed Design and Development: Perform and coordinate complex application programming activities. Design the application's technical infrastructure using specific databases, programming languages, utilities, and testing approaches. Lead the design and development of cost-effective and innovative solutions. Strategic Planning: Develop multi-year technology roadmaps that align with the bank’s vision, strategy, and business objectives. Lead multiple complex projects involving backend systems, new technology, and the enhancement of existing applications. Leadership Skills: Act as the mobile development team lead and run code-review sessions with the wider team to ensure the project is on track to meet objectives. Support and mentor intermediate and senior developers by sharing knowledge, collaborating and problem solving.  Who You Are You embrace and champion change. You'll continuously evolve your thinking and the way you work in order to deliver your best. Your influence makes an impact. You know that relationships and networks are essential to success. You inspire outcomes by making yourself heard. You’re digitally savvy. You seek out innovative solutions and embrace evolving technologies. You can easily adapt to new tools and trends. You're driven by collective success. You know that collaboration can transform a good idea into a great one. You understand the power of an inclusive team that enjoys working together to create a shared vision. You can demonstrate experience in: C#, Solace, SQL Server and Rest API. It would also be an asset if you had prior experience with Objective C, Xcode, Android SDK, Swift, Web Services, XML, Subversion, and GIT. It’s also preferable if you are fluent in Object Oriented Design, JSON and RESTFul web services, and if you have written Unit Test and UI Automation Tests. Values matter to you. You bring your real self to work and you live our values - trust, teamwork, and accountability. What CIBC Offers  At CIBC, our people are our greatest asset. You’ll become part of a diverse community that acknowledges everyone’s unique talents, and empowers teams to do what’s right for the client, and to do it well. As part of our team, you will: Thrive: Benefit from an open and approachable culture that provides the flexibility and support you need to integrate your life at work and at home Connect: Work in a place where the right technology and infrastructure fosters innovation, collaboration and creativity Develop: Grow your skills and career through our best-in-class onboarding experience, ongoing learning opportunities, and individual development planning Prosper: Share in our collective success with a competitive salary, incentive pay, banking benefits, health benefits program, and employee share purchase plan What You Need to Know CIBC is committed to creating an inclusive environment where all team members and clients feel like they belong. We seek applicants with a wide range of abilities and we provide an accessible candidate experience. If you need accommodation during the application or interview process, please contact Mailbox.careers-carrieres@cibc.com You need to be legally eligible to work in Canada at the location(s) specified above and, where applicable, must have a valid work or study permit NOTE - There will be a 2 hour CODE TEST included in the selection process

Job_Description: Fuze is a global, cloud-based unified communications platform that empowers productivity and delivers insights across the enterprise by enabling simplified business voice communications, flexible video conferencing, and always-on collaboration. Fuze (formerly ThinkingPhones) allows the modern, mobile workforce to seamlessly communicate anytime, anywhere, across any device.  At Fuze we are passionate about building software that enables teams to work together more effectively. We want to harness the power of video and high quality audio to build a communications and collaboration product that is intuitive, easy to use, reliable, elegant and above all visually stunning.  Within this role, you will be expected to become fully familiar with our complex platform and to handle testing requests from the Endpoint Provisioning & Core Backend Switching teams.  The successful applicant will have a solid track record and enjoy digging deep and finding technical issues.  This role is a combination of manual and some automated testing. The candidate will start mostly with manual testing as they assess and then build up the automation platform.  If you are a detailed oriented person, who enjoys troubleshooting and finding bugs and you enjoy trying to resolve these issues the this is the role for you!  What You'll Do:  Create, maintain and execute test cases Assess and implement automation test cases as needed and enhance the existing ones Work in a continuous integration environment Coordinate and actively participate in ensuring proper execution of test cases Work with product and development teams to establish prioritized feature list Provide test estimates and ensure testing is tracking according to the desired timeline Participate in dialog with developers in discussing current and proposed architecture, defects, enhancements and other issues Participate in reviews and discussions of specifications such as user stories and designs and provides feedback concerning completeness, accuracy, and testability  What You'll Need:  3+ years of experience in hosted Software Testing Knowledge of common scripting languages (ex: Python, shell) Familiar using and automating REST services Comfortable using the Linux command line Working knowledge of Git/Github, Jenkins and JIRA Solid understanding of common QA and SW development processes and methodologies – especially in an Agile environment Strong problem solving and investigative skills Experienced in writing, executing, and maintaining test plans Familiar with Asterisk, OpenSIPS/Kamailio, Freeswitch or other IP PBX systems is a definite asset Automation experience with SIP hardware devices like Polycom, ATAs or Yealink In depth knowledge of data networking technologies like SIP, TCP/IP, DNS, DHCP, VLAN, subnets, routing, switches and firewalls Comfortable with using Wireshark to perform packet captures and analyze data flows General understanding of database structures and SQL General understanding of Voice and Video protocols like SIP, RTP and H.264 Functional understanding of network security protocols like TLS, SRTP, SSH Must be eligible to work in our Ottawa office

Job_Description: WHY WORK AT ROSS VIDEO?  We have a great group of people working together to create and deliver cutting edge products that look amazing and are easy to use. We go all out so that our customers can have the best possible experience and achieve quality results. With a product focus, continual learning, results driven processes, and creative thinking, we constantly strive to improve our solutions and to deliver results.  If you've ever watched live television, news, sports, or entertainment, you've seen our products in use. All of the major Hollywood award shows, most professional sports teams, and many of the largest broadcasters in the world use Ross Video technology. Get behind the scenes and learn about what it takes to make live events possible.  If that resonates, and you’re someone with integrity, commitment, and a strong drive to deliver great products, we’d love to hear from you.  Be part of the team that connects different technologies together into brilliant, easy-to-use, customer-focused solutions. Our team leverages Ross Video’s Emmy-Award-winning DashBoard user interface technology to create customized applications that allows one or more operators to do everything from playing video clips on a 58-foot tall wrap-around score board, to blasting water cannons 75-feet to the sky, to sending a robotic camera zooming across the stage of a concert. Then Ross is the place for you, and we'd like to hear from you.

Job_Description: Who we are Creating a planet fueled by reliable, clean energy isn’t what keeps us up at night; it’s what gets us out of bed. At Opus One Solutions, our software platform GridOS® helps us pursue solutions that will change how countries access, optimize and distribute electrical energy. From microgrids that keep things running in the event of an outage to how electric utilities can optimize their operations and allow homeowner feed energy into a power grid fueling the electrical sharing economy. At Opus One Solutions, we believe some of the best talent in the tech industry share our passion for delivering technology that matters and that will make a difference, in our lifetime and beyond. We want to work with people who love the complexities of software; who believe in its power to transform the world to a better place. Good people know that great ideas are everywhere and what matters most is practical execution. Turning vision into reality is the hard part. But, when it’s creating technical solutions that support access to renewable energy, it’s an engineering feat worth contributing to. Our tech stack Our tech stack is deep because we interact with real things in the real world where the outcome matters. Our systems collect, analyze and interact with other systems in real-time. Our Automation team uses: Python to build the backend of GridOS. Selenium to test our web application. Docker for containerization and deployment. Gitlab for repository management. Jenkins to schedule and build automation. The opportunity Opus One Solutions is looking for a Software Development Engineer in Test (SDET) to take on a new role on our team. Our new SDET will be part of a broad and multidisciplinary team that will include Developers, DevOps Engineers and energy experts. Someone who is excited to join us as we develop and test complicated power systems software, sometimes with hardware in the loop. An SDET who wants to help us answer the question “How do you build, test & deploy software that will create a cleaner and smarter grid?”. Who are you? You are passionate about software automation and you want to build and deploy automation frameworks. You act as a champion for the judicious use of process to help ensure that the end result is robust. You have open source project experience testing automated frameworks. You are seeking an opportunity to work for a company with a purpose you can get behind. Either way, you want the best of both worlds: to stay in a hands-on technical role while having a say in the technologies used to test and automate solutions that matter. What’s in it for you? Challenges. The electrical power grid is a lifeline to millions of people. Quite literally, this is a system that cannot go down when it comes to hospitals, traffic controls and more. Your challenge is to build an automaton process and automation tools to ensure our software is robust enough to help utilities keep the lights on. Personal and professional satisfaction. You want a chance to be part of a new build. You want to do meaningful work contributing to solutions that matter. What will our new SDET work on? Building. Oversee and develop both the automated and manual testing efforts to ensure that our next generation cleantech software works. Test plans. Evaluate test criteria, create and execute tests to determine if new releases of software are acceptable for delivery. Design and implementation. Design a variety of tools, services and procedures to more effectively write and test new code. Evaluation. Assess the impact of new features on overall product scalability and performance. Benchmark, analyze, report on and make recommendations. Here’s what you bring: The experience. You are a recent grad with demonstrable skills gained through relevant co-op experience or you have 1-2 years working on complex projects in your current role. You have strengths coding in one or more languages, supporting deployment and testing automated frameworks. The passion. You are equally passionate about cleantech as you are about quality and continuous improvement. You have a deep appreciation for Agile methodology. The Software Deployment expertise. You know how to get a software release out the door. The vision. You can focus on the big picture and the details. Robust, reliable and scalable is your motto. The communication. You have exceptional written and oral communication skills. The energy. You thrive in a high volume, fast paced environment without losing sight of the details. The innovation. You possess excellent analytical skills and you can provide creative, quick - and reliable - solutions to complex problems. Why join Opus One Solutions Opus One is growing! After spending the last four years under the radar focused on research and pilot projects we’re ready to shine as one of Canada’s top 10 game-changers named by CIX Cleantech! We are deploying exciting microgrid projects in North America and have partnerships with leading energy players such as Tesla and Advanced Microgrid Solutions. Collectively, we are fanatical about the work we do. Our leadership has assembled carefully selected teams with some of the best strategic visionaries - and executors - in technology and the clean energy space. From the newest team member to the company founders, we are all driven by one common goal: to accelerate the integration of clean and sustainable energy in North America and the world. As a team and a company, we are committed to working with like-minded people, with opinions and thoughts of their own that will contribute to our innovation and evolution. We equally want to work with people who like to get outside and spend time together on team outings, special events, to grab lunch or take part in off-site brainstorming retreats. There’s a lot of humility at Opus One Solutions. No one person is going to know it all – it’s too complicated. We must work and innovate together to get the job done. If Opus One Solutions aligns to what you care about, you have most of the qualifications we are looking and all of the passion we need, we’d love to start a conversation and learn more about you. Opus One Solutions welcomes and encourages applications from people with disabilities. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process.
Title: Software Development Engineer in Test

Job_Description: Sryas is a technology consulting company specializing in advanced business intelligence, data integration, application development, application support and Business Process Outsourcing services, headquartered in Grand Island, NY, US. The ideas and passion of our team members and the ambitions of our customers drive our corporate philosophy and purpose.  As an end-to-end IT solutions provider, we set up smart teams who love challenges and think outside the box, to help our clients succeed. We continue to push the limits of our software solutions to ensure dynamic data integration, insight and decision optimization techniques for our customers.  We look for fun, intelligent, team players who believe in our values: customer focus, transparency, diligence, optimism, and ability to join our team.  Summary:  Currently looking for a Security Clearance Level 2 .Net Developer to drive projects for our Client. You will be responsible to ensure Project Management is adhered to and liaise with the Client, Local and Offshore teams and PM’s. This requires both front and backend development, with the focus on front end.  Responsibilities: Responsible for working on the Architecture, Design and Development of the large-scale enterprise projects/products Define, track and document high level and low level technical design that incorporates best practices Interact with Clients, gather requirements, and translate into technical specification. Also work with the development team to impart the requirements and guide them during the development process Responsible for delivering the client projects on time with expected code quality and meting the business requirements Plan, track and execute projects – Project Management skills are essential. Knowledge in Microsoft Project is a must Design and implement Solutions to satisfy nonfunctional requirements such as scalability, usability, maintainability and supportability Evaluate 3rd party solutions and prepare recommendation and cost benefit analysis for their use Interface with other teams to clarify and communicate the technical design details and architectural components Maintaining knowledge of cutting-edge Microsoft technologies and provide input for training and training materials Participate in presales demos and presentations whenever required Be a part in achieving the company’s technical vision and contributing to all aspects of the company’s technology development Qualifications: 6 to 8 years’ experience in all aspects and phases of the SDLC for the design, implementation and operation of enterprise-wide software solutions At least 5-6 years of experience working with Microsoft .Net technologies (versions 2.0/3.5/4.0/4.5) At least 3 -4 years’ experience in a development lead role Microsoft Certifications: Microsoft Certified Technology Specialist (MCTS) / Microsoft Certified IT Professional (MCITP) Web application development using MVC and ASP .NET with code behind as C#/VB.Net Web and windows services development REST (JSON) and SOAP based service implementation ADO.Net, ADOMD.Net Extensive knowledge on JQuery, AJAX, JavaScript Strong working experience with XML, XSD, XSLT and Xpath Strong development experience in MS SQL Server 2000/2005/2008, Oracle/MySQL Experience with Microsoft Enterprise Library and Microsoft Application Blocks. Ability to work flexible hours and a willingness to work on call if required Experience with Windows Communication Foundation (WCF), Workflow Foundation (WF) Knowledge in Packaging, Deployment, Release and Version management Experience with Team Foundation Server/ Visual Studio Team System 2013 Experience in OOAD with UML modeling Knowledge of Design Patterns (like Component, MVC, SOA) Experience in using Rational Rose suite, ERWin, MS Visio, and Visual Studio Knowledge Application Life Cycle (ALM) management Open source development experience Good organizational abilities, oral/written communications and interpersonal skills Significant Assets Experience with .NET: 6 years Syras offers the dynamics and excitement of working in a start-up environment, a leading Center of Excellence with top of the line technology and innovation.  Sryas is an equal opportunity employer and values diversity in its workforce. We thank all applicants in advance for their interest in this position, however, only those selected for an interview will be contacted.
Title: Sr. .Net Developer

Job_Description: In the role of Sr. Developer you’ll help create and build beautiful software that matters using modern JavaScript and software development best practices (Agile, TDD, Continuous Delivery). As a developer for Rangle.io, you’ll be joining a diverse community of people who are passionate about modern JavaScript and its ability to change the world. You’ll get to work on a wide range of projects, using the latest JS frameworks building for the web & mobile, working with a tight knit team of talented individuals.  YOUR IMPACT Opportunity to work with one of the most exciting modern JavaScript software companies in the world.Play a big part in the success of Rangle.io. We’re helping shape the Tech scene in Toronto and modern web and mobile development across the world.  YOUR GROWTHWe have built a strong community that supports and encourages learning and continuous improvement. We’re highly active in the tech community: in Toronto and globally. We run several of the most popular tech meetups in Toronto.We have a variety of programs that help everyone improve, include several initiated by our own staff (ex. Rangle U, Lunch & Learns, Hack Nights). We encourage everyone to attend a conference every year (and we pay for it). Everyone gets a coach/mentor to help you grow in your career. And we also contribute to open source. - You’ll be a part of a small impactful team - because we use agile/scrum, you’ll be personally involved in decisions on how we’ll build out our products for our clients. HOW WE WORK You’ll join a tightly-knit team consisting of JS Developers, Designers, Business Quality Analysts and Scrum Masters, who collaborate to build web and mobile apps (Ionic/Cordova, React Native) for our clients. Most projects are new and won’t require you to deal with a lot of legacy code. We work with modern JavaScript across a range of frameworks and technologies, on the client as well as on the server: Angular, Angular 2, React, NodeJS, TypeScript, ES6, Babel, Flux. (You don’t need to be proficient with all of those things to start). Our approach to making software stresses teamwork and close interaction with our clients. We rely on a well thought-out process based on Scrum, continuous delivery, and test-driven development. This process allows us to build software in a way that sets you up for success, allowing you to exercise your creativity and building software that matters without all the red tape, hierarchy and politics. We avoid sharply defined roles: everyone gets to partake in all aspects of their project and to try their hand at new things. Our developers do not just develop: they also help our clients think through product features, contribute to design, and test. We work for many clients in an exciting range of industries: social media, e-commerce, manufacturing, transportation, alternative energy, wellness. Any company that we feel helps make the world a better place. WHAT YOU BRING TO THE TEAM Solid understanding of JavaScript. (Alternatively: really solid backend experience + some JavaScript + ability to learn JavaScript really fast.) 5+ years experience in web application development, bonus points if you have experience working directly with clients or a product owner. Bonus points if you have previous experience building apps in Angular, React or Node. Great interpersonal skills - we are a close knit team and work together to solve problems. A desire to follow a software development process that helps you sleep better at night Bonus points if you have server side experience. Bonus points if you have an eye for design. (BTW, all our designers can code.) Great problem solver and ability to reinvent oneself - We are always looking at ways we can do things better, sometimes there is no path to follow. Proactive and self starter - we hire folks that have a deep desire to do better and be better, you won’t be micromanaged in this role. (We want to hear your voice.) Passionate about learning - You’ll help identify new technologies and approaches to problems. (Web development and especially JS is always evolving.) ABOUT US  Based out of Toronto, Canada, Rangle.io is changing how software is built, designed, developed and delivered. The web is undergoing a massive transformation in how web and mobile applications are being built, and Rangle is the expert in this next generation of the web.  We are dedicated to helping startups and enterprises move to the modern web. We specialize in using modern JavaScript frameworks (such as Angular 2, React, and Node) and a User-Experience driven development process to build applications that deliver a compelling user experience for significantly less development effort compared to legacy server-side web development techniques.  Our agile development process, and continuous delivery of working software to build beautiful modern web and mobile applications ensures our clients are never more than a moment away from jumping on the next business opportunity or responding to the next market event.  Rangle is an equal opportunity employer. If you are contacted for an interview and require accommodation during the interviewing process, please let us know.
Title: Sr. Modern JavaScript Developer (Angular, React, Node)

Job_Description: Flexitive Design Cloud is the world’s leading AI driven visual communications platform. Flexitive is used by global brands, agencies and publishers to improve the quality of their visual communications and streamline workflow production.  As a Senior Developer/Team Lead, you will be directly responsible for managing the output, code quality and happiness for a team of 5-10 developers. You will be coordinating releases, and ensuring that the team is on track to deliver their sprint objectives.  Impact: Providing technical guidance and leadership for your team Writing code in Javascript, possibly Python, that will improve our code base in meaningful ways Sharing your knowledge and experience with the team members and providing mentorship through code reviews and lunch and learns Acting as the bridge between your team and the product team, to provide estimates and develop realistic deadlines Championing code quality, unit tests, and agile best-practices  What You Need to Succeed: Solid understanding of the Agile processes and servant leadership. A proven ability to lead and scale a software team. 5+ years of relevant work experience in a backend or full stack developer role. Solid ability in designing scalable web application features and systems. Desire to work in a fast-paced, startup environment A bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, or related field. Experience with Node.js, Angular.js, React or similar javascript frameworks. Why Flexitive?  You want to be part of a fast growing, passionate team. We offer all employees competitive compensation (including salary, bonus and stock options in the company) and invest in your personal growth and success.  Employee stock option plan Medical and dental benefits Bi-monthly hackdays, work on passion projects or make something cool in our VR Room Our Toronto office is located right downtown next to College subway! Flexible hours and relaxed dress code Monthly game nights and quarterly team building events Jax, our golden retriever loves hugs Unlimited snacks!  We are looking for the best in the business - tell us why you are the one.
Title: Senior Developer/Team Lead

This is a unique opportunity to join a VC-funded startup with a team of creative and passionate individuals destined to change the face of digital marketing. This role is core to our company's product. Your focus will be development of all client-side logic and user interfaces. This is your chance to work on cutting-edge technology in the chatbot space.  The team works in quick iterations, using the techniques and algorithms best suited for solving our challenging problems.  Responsibilities   Implementation of front-end logic and interfaces in React Implementation of the backend logic in Python and Go Integration of user-facing elements with server side logic (GraphQL) Building reusable code and libraries for future use Optimization of the application for maximum speed and scalability  Skills And Qualifications   Understanding of front-end technologies and platforms, such as JavaScript, HTML5, and CSS3 Integration of multiple data sources and databases into one system Experience in JavaScript frameworks such as React, or Angular Data migration, transformation, and scripting Creating database schemas that represent and support business processes Implementing automated testing platforms and unit tests Proficient knowledge of a back-end programming languages such as Python, or Go (golang) Proficient understanding of code versioning tools, such as Git

We’re looking for talented and experienced React developers that can pave future of our industry-leading tools and redefine what it means to stay ahead of game. People need to eat so Skip never sleeps, and that means the show runs around the clock. We’re looking for people who want the chance of contributing to build a world-class tech company right here in the Canadian Prairies. The skills you’ll need: Experience developing, releasing, and maintaining iOS or Android apps Solid understanding of ReactiveX, using Swift and/or Java 8 Familiarity with React Native or eager to learn Deep familiarity with debugging, performance measurement, and test-driven development Solid understanding of REST principles and exposure to backend People we’re looking for: Have a great attitude and are proven self-starters Keep hustling and are able to work through rejection Thrive in a rapidly changing environment Understand that a startup is not a 9-5 job, it's a lifestyle! What it’s like to work at Skip: Fast paced entrepreneurial environment Casual dress attire, we focus on results, not wearing suits Exposure to leading-edge technology Advancement opportunities for high contributors Merit-based compensation & benefits

Job_Description: Our clients (Start-up)are looking for a Backend, iot & cloud Developer (Lead) with a proven track record building scalable Cloud & SaaS applications. You will play a role in defining and building innovative WiFi sensing application. You will lead the definition of our system architecture and participate in the development of our new platform.  Key Functions  Architect and develop our cloud-based services to provide reliability and scalability for applications to both individual consumers and our business partners.  Provide technical leadership and vision for the team  Design and implement great features and high quality code  Work closely with the research and product management teams  Participate and help lead our agile software process (scrum, sprint planning, code reviews, continuous integration) Requirements  Bachelor or Master degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering or similar  Minimum of 3 years of experience designing, developing and maintaining back end services for a SaaS product solution.  Experience designing and building highly scalable services and RESTful APIs that support multiple clients.  Familiarity with Amazon AWS and its supporting services (EC2, S3, DynamoDB, SNS, Cognito, etc.).  Advanced-level experience with several cloud technologies and platforms such as: RabbitMQ, MongoDB, Hadoop, redis, Spark, Kafka, etc.  Developer level Linux platform experience,  Solid grasp of software development fundamentals (system architecture, algorithms, data structures, OO design, problem solving) and software product life cycle  Knowledge and experience with Java, Python C/C++ and Go  Must have a good understanding of software testing concepts  Minimum of 6 year of experience in software development Assets  AWS Certification  Familiarity with agile development and tools such as JIRA  Any experience in the field of Machine Learning  Working experience with Docker  Experience with IoT services and/or AWS IoT
Title: C++ Linux Back-end, iot, Cloud Developer

Job_Description: Description:   About Us\:  The AIR MILES® Rewards Program has earned the trust and support of more than two-thirds of Canadian households. For over two decades, we have helped our Partners use Canada’s most widely accepted loyalty currency, AIR MILES® reward miles, to influence customer behavior, drive profitability, and build long-term relationships.  Check us out – LoyaltyOne on Stack Overflow | LinkedIn | Glassdoor | Facebook |Twitter  Engineering Team Culture\:  We are polyglots\: We believe in using the best tech stack for the job. We’ve written scripts in Python and built APIs in Scala, Java, Akka, and Node.js. We deploy everything to the Cloud.  We pair program\: You pick your machine\: Windows or Mac. Our floors are open space with no cubicles or private offices, regularly pair programming and mobbing when working. Teams have hack days at least once a month when they take a break to work on anything they want, and most of the time their creations end up in our production environment. Communication is key to our approach, and we don't want to hinder it with walls, real or metaphorical.  We are Agile\: Development methodologies mean different things to different people. For us? We have a story card wall and release a few times a week. We keep the team in sync with daily stand-ups and have a retrospective once a month to discuss things that are going well and opportunities for improvements. We surround teams with everything they need, Scrum Masters to coach us on the process, Product Owners to make sense of the work, Pod Leaders to help with our careers and Competency Leads to facilitate technical design and provide mentorship in advanced technical skills.  Types of projects we work on\:   As part of the AM Next team, you will be building the next generation Air Miles Reward Program platform. This new Cloud-based platform will focus on quality and security while providing massive data scalability and real-time data ingestion, processing, and consumption. We are finding new ways of working that allow us to continuously improve delivery of value with high levels of cadence and quality.   Qualification:  What we look for in you\:  Ability and desire to work in our collaborative environment\: open team room, pair programming and fluid interactions with all products and operations teams  Focusing on building solutions utilizing an agile approach; leveraging close relationships with Product Managers, communicating and digesting real-time feedback, and working smart to build story cards on daily basis  You have experience building large scale distributed systems, based on reactive principles, that are flexible, loosely-coupled and scalable  You believe that Cloud is the future and you have experience managing some of them - AWS, Azure, Google Cloud Platform or IBM Cloud  We know there are endless tools and technologies, and we don’t expect you to come in as an expert on everything, but you are looking forward to experimenting and learning.  Air Miles Perks\:  Hack Days\: one day a month you work on projects that interest you to improve your craft   Training\: from hackathons to conferences, to instructor lead, building your competency is our priority About LoyaltyOne  LoyaltyOne is part of the successful Alliance Data family of companies that provide the full range of data-driven loyalty, marketing and credit solutions in more than 80 locations across the globe.  Working with more than 100 leading brands in the retail, financial services, grocery, petroleum retail, travel and hospitality industries to profitably change customer behavior. Through a team of businesses, including one of the leading coalition loyalty programs in the world, the AIR MILES® Reward Program, LoyaltyOne designs, delivers and manages a suite of services focused on consumer data, customer-centric retail strategies, direct-to-consumer marketing, loyalty consulting and more.   LoyaltyOne has broadened its horizons geographically by growing Precima in the European market. With the recent acquisition of BrandLoyalty in the Netherlands, LoyaltyOne has gained the expertise of a global leader in short-term loyalty campaigns, along with a client network that extends throughout Europe and Asia.     About ADS   Alliance Data® (NYSE\: ADS) is a leading global provider of data-driven marketing and loyalty solutions serving large, consumer-based industries. The Company creates and deploys customized solutions, enhancing the critical customer marketing experience; the result is measurably changing consumer behavior while driving business growth and profitability for some of today's most recognizable brands. Alliance Data helps its clients create and increase customer loyalty through solutions that engage millions of customers each day across multiple touch points using traditional, digital, mobile and emerging technologies. An S&P 500 and Fortune 500 company headquartered in Plano, Texas, Alliance Data consists of three businesses that together employ more than 16,000 associates at approximately 100 locations worldwide. www.alliancedata.com    Alliance Data is an Employment Opportunity employer. Accordingly, we will make reasonable accommodations to respond to the needs of people with disabilities in accordance with legislation.  Alliance Data participates in E-Verify.
Title: Backend Developer

Job_Description: Looking to work for an awesome team? You've come to the right place! Our developers are a tight-knit group, and we are pushing for substantial product development as we continue looking to grow the team in the next year. We value passion for quality, maintainable, and scalable code, and for building awesome products. A side benefit of developing for the restaurant industry is that once we’re done working hard, we have some great clients who can always provide amazing venues for unwinding with our close knit team. TouchBistro is looking for several Backend Developers at the Intermediate or Senior level here in our Toronto office. Our POS system is evolving and our customers are demanding more product capabilities. As a member of our agile Technology team, you will have the chance to work on our current or next-Gen product's web features. Our current stack is ReactJS and NodeJS but if you have worked with other frameworks that is also sufficient. To apply for this position, you must possess a minimum 1+ years of production experience using NodeJS and SQL databases. The development team is poised for growth and along with that comes with many opportunities to learn different skills as well as have a growth path internally.   YOUR DAY-to-DAY Using JavaScript, design & implement features to help our restaurant customers succeed Create a new API using NodeJS and SQL databases on the backend Keep Up-to-Date with best practices and tooling from the JavaScript community Fearlessly Collaborate with your team to solve problems and learn from failures   ALL ABOUT YOU Knowledge of modern JavaScript, HTML5, CSS3 1+ Years of Experience with NodeJS 3+ Years of experience using a backend language (we use Node, but Java, Ruby on Rails, Python, etc. is also acceptable) Some exposure to SQL or NoSQL databases Test Driven Development Experience working on teams in an agile-scrum environment 4 year College Diploma or University Degree  WHY CHOOSE US? TouchBistro is an award-winning iPad Point of Sale system, built for restaurant people by restaurant people. We’re a team of thinkers, builders, doers, and innovators. While many of us have experience working at restaurants, some of us just have a true passion for the industry. We’re venture backed by some of the best tech VCs in the world and are partnered with top innovators in the mobile, food, and payment industries. We’re global and growing! TouchBistro is used in more than 100 countries worldwide and has offices in NYC, Austin, Chicago, London and headquarters in Toronto. We’re a fast-moving, ever-evolving company on a mission to change the way restaurateurs do business and help them succeed through our products and services, but we need talented, passionate people to help! So, what do you say? Are you ready to become part of something awesome?  TouchBistro believes in fostering an inclusive workplace where all individuals have an opportunity to succeed. Requests for accommodation due to a disability can be made at any stage of the recruitment process.
Title: Backend Developer

Job_Description: Our Mission: Modern Money Movement.Instant Financial is disrupting the standard notion of ‘payday’ by giving workers daily control over their earned income. We allow people to live better lives by fixing the misalignment between when people get paid and when they need their money. Employers who pay with Instant enjoy greater access to the best employees as well as high employee retention and engagement. All of this translates into a better, more profitable business. We have started the payroll revolution and need talented passionate people to join the Modern Money Movement.We are dreamers who have a proven track record of making big things happen. We do this by inspiring ourselves and those we work with to do what others cannot do. We know that we must move together as a team, celebrate our successes, and above all learn quickly from the mistakes we know will be made due to the fast pace of our execution. We carry ourselves with urgency, honesty and integrity in everything we do. Together, we truly believe we can empower working lives.About the Team: We're a small but high-performing team of engineers, building SaaS and mobile technologies for a rapidly growing organization, led by a founding team with a proven track record.We embrace Agile and DevOps practices and tools to ensure the delivery of high quality software with a high release velocity. We have a well defined product and technology roadmap in support of a very healthy sales pipeline. We have a highly efficient flat structure and ambitious growth plans.Our stack is JavaScript-based (including with Node/Express microservices). Most importantly, we work in a collaborative environment of continuous learning - we expect you to challenge us as much as we challenge you!About You: You're an intermediate to senior full stack developer with JavaScript skills. You're passionate about building web and mobile applications and you’ve had experience delivering production-grade software.You thrive in fast-paced environments where you have lots of independence and ownership. You keep up-to-date with new technologies and trends, and you're eager to learn. You live and work with honesty and integrity, you carry your work with a healthy sense of urgency, you truly believe in teamwork, and you're not afraid to be held - or hold others - accountable for what must be done.What You'll Bring: Several years experience developing production-quality software at high scaleDegree in Computer Science, or equivalent experienceAbility to learn new technologies and paradigms rapidlyStrong JavaScript skillsFamiliarity with non-relational databases such as MongoDBProficiency in a Linux environmentDeep knowledge of web technologiesExcellent spoken and written EnglishBonus Assets: Test automationWorking in an Agile+DevOps development environmentWriting Node-based microservicesWriting microservices in a framework such as ExpressAny JavaScript framework such as Angular, React, or similarJOIN US!Are you so excited about taking on this challenge, and about what we stand for, that by now you can barely sit still? Then go ahead and send us your application, we would love to hear from you.We want authentic, passionate, hard-working people who will embrace this challenge, make it their personal goal to give it all they got, and leave a legacy while knowing that, by doing so, they are truly improving the lives of everyone that touches our solutions.Referral Reward: Know someone qualified for this role? You can receive a CAD $3,000 referral reward (paid 90 days after hire) by referring them to us.Job Type: Full-time
