Job_Description: Vena Solutions is seeking Java Developers to help us expand our sophisticated SaaS cloud technology. This role is a match for you if you are an innovative software engineer with an aptitude for big data and server-side development who loves to be continually challenged to create scalable and performant code. As a Java Developer, you will be responsible for the backbone for the Vena platform, building REST web services with a very modern Java 8 backend stack. Our developer-focused team culture encourages our engineers to be self-motivated and self-disciplined. We value leadership and people with passion who will take ownership to make their mark on our product within this growing business space. Check out the team blog for more details at engineering.vena.io. What you will do Design and develop flexible, efficient, object-oriented server code in Java Resolve problems that affect how businesses make sense of their data Refactor, simplify, and optimize code so we can develop new features more efficiently Work within an Agile, cross-functional team on features, design and implementation Contribute to building our environment that embraces continuous integration through the use of automated testing Think outside the box, adapting the latest software technologies while developing innovative functionality to improve software performance and usability What we use We are continuously revisiting the following stack to improve our product’s performance and usability: A versatile JavaScript front-end built with Backbone.js, jQuery and Bootstrap. Java SE/EE A custom-built OLAP processing engine that makes use of Jetty, Google Guice, and Dropwizard Modern data stores like MongoDB, Redis, Redshift Fully automated AWS cloud infrastructure A C# .NET Excel add-in built using VSTO, Excel Interop/VBA, and LINQ And much more Does this sound like you? You have three or more (3+) years of programming experience in Java development Equivalent experience and/or Post-secondary education in Computer Science, Software Engineering You have a strong knowledge of Computer Science fundamentals including software design, algorithms, etc. Working knowledge of building Java REST web services, AspectJ, Java 8 Lambdas, Hibernate, MongoDB is a bonus, but not required You are self-motivated and self-directed You believe in keeping stack current with the latest tools, libraries, frameworks, and trends in cloud technologies You have excellent analytical skills, coupled with a strong sense of ownership and drive You have experience working in an Agile development environment  Apply today... We can't wait to hear from you! About Us At Vena, our mission is to help smart companies better manage their data, spreadsheets, and files. Our cloud infrastructure leverages the flexibility and ease of use of widely-used spreadsheets while adding beautiful web-based workflows and a powerful cloud storage to make mission-critical business processes simple. Viewed by many as one of the most innovative Canadian start-ups, we’re part of a growing industry looking to revolutionize the enterprise so that people can stop fighting software and get back to doing their best work. Candidates must be legally entitled to work in Canada. Local candidates only. No agencies please. Should you require accommodation for any disability throughout any stage of the recruitment and selection process, please describe your requirements when making an application and we will be sure your accommodation needs are met.
Title: Java Developer

Job_Description: Sryas is a technology consulting company specializing in advanced business intelligence, data integration, application development, application support and Business Process Outsourcing services, headquartered in Grand Island, NY, US. The ideas and passion of our team members and the ambitions of our customers drive our corporate philosophy and purpose.  As an end-to-end IT solutions provider, we set up smart teams who love challenges and think outside the box, to help our clients succeed. We continue to push the limits of our software solutions to ensure dynamic data integration, insight and decision optimization techniques for our customers.  We look for fun, intelligent, team players who believe in our values: customer focus, transparency, diligence, optimism, and ability to join our team.  Summary:  Currently looking for a .Net Developer to drive projects for our Client. You will be responsible to ensure Project Management is adhered to and liaise with the Client, Local and Offshore teams and PMs. This requires both front and backend development, with the focus on front end.  Responsibilities: Responsible for working on the Architecture, Design and Development of the large-scale enterprise projects/products Define, track and document high level and low level technical design that incorporates best practices. Interact with Clients, gather requirements, and translate into technical specification. Also work with the development team to impart the requirements and guide them during the development process Responsible for delivering the client projects on time with expected code quality and meting the business requirements Plan, track and execute projects – Project Management skills are essential. Knowledge in Microsoft Project is a must Design and implement Solutions to satisfy nonfunctional requirements such as scalability, usability, maintainability and supportability Evaluate 3rd party solutions and prepare recommendation and cost benefit analysis for their use Interface with other teams in order to clarify and communicate the technical design details and architectural components Maintaining knowledge of cutting-edge Microsoft technologies and provide input for training and training materials Participate in presales demos and presentations whenever required Be a part in achieving the company’s technical vision and contributing to all aspects of the company’s technology development Qualifications: 6 to 8 years’ experience in all aspects and phases of the SDLC for the design, implementation and operation of enterprise-wide software solutions At least 5-6 years of experience working with Microsoft .Net technologies (versions 2.0/3.5/4.0/4.5) At least 3 -4 years’ experience in a development lead role Microsoft Certifications: Microsoft Certified Technology Specialist (MCTS) / Microsoft Certified IT Professional (MCITP) Web application development using MVC and ASP .NET with code behind as C#/ VB.Net Web and windows services development REST (JSON) and SOAP based service implementation ADO.Net, ADOMD.Net Extensive knowledge on JQuery, AJAX, JavaScript Strong working experience with XML, XSD, XSLT and Xpath Strong development experience in MS SQL Server 2000/2005/2008, Oracle/MySQL Experience with Microsoft Enterprise Library and Microsoft Application Blocks. Ability to work flexible hours and a willingness to work on call if required Experience with Windows Communication Foundation (WCF), Workflow Foundation (WF) Knowledge in Packaging, Deployment, Release and Version management Experience with Team Foundation Server/ Visual Studio Team System 2013 Experience in OOAD with UML modeling Knowledge of Design Patterns (like Component, MVC, SOA) Experience in using Rational Rose suite, ERWin, MS Visio, and Visual Studio Knowledge Application Life Cycle (ALM) management Open source development experience Good organizational abilities, oral/written communications and interpersonal skills Significant Assets Experience with .NET: 6 years Syras offers the dynamics and excitement of working in a start-up environment, a leading Center of Excellence with top of the line technology and innovation.  Sryas is an equal opportunity employer and values diversity in its workforce. We thank all applicants in advance for their interest in this position, however, only those selected for an interview will be contacted.
Title: .Net Developer

Job_Description: Founded in 1996, SKURA has grown into a well-recognized and respected international company with satisfied customers in 78 countries around the world. Customers include, but are not limited to: GlaxoSmithKline, Allergan, Novo Nordisk, Biogen Idec, Honeywell, Abbott, Urgo Laboratories, Daiichi-Sankyo, Ping, Mazda, and many more. These customers have all benefited from SKURA’s unique value proposition by deploying our market leading sales enablement solution. To achieve this, Skura has developed a SaaS platform called SFX that manages sales content from marketing to sales to the end customer. In managing the content SFX also provides real time tracking and analytics across all channels. The Role We are looking for a creative, personable and talented Developer to join our team. You are a self driven software developer who takes pride in their work. You are comfortable working with both back-end and front-end technologies. You collaborate well with designers and other developers to support integration and spur creative ideas and interface effectively with QA teams and your business minded colleagues. Ideal Candidate Qualifications: Graduated with a degree/diploma in computer engineering/services/technology/programming/etc Knowing or working with Angular 2 is a serious plus Mobile development experience with iOS and/or Android is a sizable asset. At least three of the following are second nature to you: HTML, Javascript, CSS, C# or Java.  Experience with any of these technologies would aid your application: Maven and Git Enterprise Integration Patterns Architecting and planning app builds Mobile web interface design and user experience Linux and basic shell scripting Cloud computing: Amazon, Rackspace, etc Web servers: Apache, Nginx, etc Backend languages: PHP, NodeJS Database: MySQL, PostgreSQL, XML/JSON in general
Title: Full Stack Developer

Our company culture emphasizes results and our top priority is to offer excellent customer service. Our work environment is friendly and professional, and we're looking for talented people to join us and support our continued growth. We are located near Métro de l'Église in Montreal. Easily accessible by metro, car, bicycle or bixi.We wish to welcome a motivated web developer for our web and product development team that will report to our lead developer and be able to : Participate to the architectural decision and tasks priorisation with the team Program at different level(backend and front-end) based on individual talents and the company/user requirements Provide concrete and measurable results Be able to estimate and communicate project progression. Be responsible for the development environment and ensure that web infrastructure remains stable. Ensure the quality and and usability of deliverables. Understand our clients and develop innovative changes to improve the product for the end user. Rethink each user experience to simplify and enhance the user interface.We have an entrepreneurial culture based on innovation and results. Job_Description: QuirkLogic, Inc. is a creative company that believes in thinking differently. We look to identify everyday problems that need new technological advances. We create new innovative solutions that address these market gaps. For us that means creating technologies that don’t currently exist and that’s pretty cool!  We are looking for a Mobile Developer to join our first-class team. You will be engaged in extending our QuirkLogic ideation ecosystem by developing Android and iOS apps. The key to being successful in this position will be your innovation, passion for new and interesting work, and your ability to meet deadlines.  Responsibilities:  Build new apps using Swift and Kotlin that plug into our QuirkLogic ecosystem Deliver a great user experience that supports expanding our user base Work closely with backend developers and UX designers Troubleshoot and debug apps, write unit tests Participate in standups and code reviews Write clean code in a testable, reliable and sustainable way Qualifications:  Demonstrable experience with Kotlin, Swift, Java or Javascript. Kotlin or Swift experience is preferred Experience with agile development practices Knowledge of unit and system level testing, and how to make your code tested and testable Understanding of object-oriented analysis and design Strong problem solving and innovation skills At least 2 years (and preferably 4 years) of software development experience Passion for interesting development work Dedication to high quality, on time code production Nice to have skills:  Android Kotlin iOS Swift NoSQL Database (Couchbase) Node.js RESTful APIs
Title: Mobile Application Developer , Calgary, Alberta

Job_Description: At Versett, a developer is a broad sweeping term for a technical consultant, strategist, and finally, implementor of solutions for the products we create. A Front-end Developer's role focuses on the UI and UX of web products and applications and integrating them with backend systems and APIs. You should be equipped with an ever-shifting tool belt based on latest best practices, up-to-date standards, and most importantly a strong understanding of the problem at hand and what best solves it.  Worried about frameworks, build systems, transpilers and other beasts? Don't be. While we do have preferences that we adjust and align on as a team, in our opinion tools are easier to teach and learn than concepts (but we encourage teaching and learning those, too).  Requirements Your core competencies as a front-end developer rely on a strong understanding of CSS, HTML, and Javascript (web and Node). You have a foundational understanding of modern patterns and methodologies, a solid grasp of latest specifications, and an awareness of accessibility and performance pitfalls. You are flexible and strive to better yourself and the company. You have a collaborative mindset, and most importantly, you have empathy for your users, clients, and co-workers.  'Front-end' is a broad term and doesn't have to be all-encompassing, if you feel like you fit some of the following you should get in touch: You have worked with a designer or solo to build out a styleguide/style system/UI kit. You have rolled your own BEM, OOCSS, SMACSS-esque css architecture, for better or worse. You have built a SPA or two using one or more JS frameworks and it went really well. You have built a SPA or two using one or more JS frameworks and it went really badly. You've built out a website or web-app that met WCAG AA compliance. You are used to letting a build system do the heavy lifting. You have had conversations around state management, immutability, and unidirectional flow.   Is Versett the right place for you? We are a small and growing development team that is constantly looking to improve process and quality with every project we do. If you are looking to make an impact and have continued input into how a company operates, this is probably the place for you.  Our goal is to give our developers the opportunity to explore and learn new technologies and constantly expand their toolbelts and professional capabilities, whether that is through different client projects or our internal Alpha projects.  Here are examples of tools and technologies we currently work with:  React, Redux Flow Jest, Jasmine WebPack, Babel npm SCSS NodeJS  Travis Heroku AWS  We currently have openings for Front-end Developer in Toronto, Calgary, and New York.  About Versett Versett is a product design and engineering studio in Calgary, Toronto, and New York. Founded in 2011, we specialize in websites and mobile products.  Why work at Versett Our team is tight-knit and built on the philosophy of "Small, but Mighty". Versett was founded on a shared vision of a place where we can create meaningful work collaboratively, while continuing to grow and learn as individuals.  Perks? We’ve got perks:  Team events and retreats Competitive salary and benefits The hardware/software setup you need "Take the time you need" vacation policy Flexible hours Casual environment Diverse team Friday team lunches
Title: Developer - Front-end

Job_Description: At Interaxon , we develop engaging experiences using brain sensing technology. We are a passionate team of researchers, technical experts and scientists building the world’s leading science-based brain platform to empower personal transformation through human-centered innovation. Our flagship product is the Muse headband, a brain sensing headband that is designed to make meditation easier and provides real-time audio and visual feedback on your meditative state through the Muse companion app. More information is available at www.choosemuse.com .  As a Senior Cloud Developer at Interaxon, you’ll help us build APIs used by cross-platform mobile apps, revenue-generating web apps, and big data infrastructure that enables our neuroscientists to comb through our enormous brain data set. You are someone with a keen eye for detail, who thrives in a fast paced environment, and have extensive experience of architecting and building scalable distributed backend systems.  What you‘ll be doing: Architect and build scalable distributed backend systems.  Look out for and evaluate promising technologies/services most suitable for the task.  Test your code, ensuring high coverage and shipping features that you are proud of.  Collaborate with Product Managers and Designers to ensure the specifications make sense.  Review code from others in a collaborative way. No stone goes unturned.  Participate in Sprint rituals, especially story point estimation.  Share your opinion and experience in technical design sessions.  Bring your ideas to continuously improve our processes and practices.  Coach junior developers, raising the bar for everyone on the team.  Develop your craft as you learn something new and grow while on our team.  Your skills and experience: 5+ years of experience working with cloud platforms, preferably Google Cloud, building large distributed systems  5+ years of experience with Python, Node, Go, PHP, or Ruby, working in a team environment.  Built applications using both SQL and NoSQL databases, has solid understanding of different design principles and trade-offs.  DevOps mindset, experience with operating code in production.  Expert in Git.  Experience with CI/CD tools.  Computer Science degree or similar degree.  What we offer: Our collaborative and inclusive culture is an extension of our vision to empower personal transformation to improve lives and change the world. We have a flexible working environment, great benefits package, meditation space, onsite gym with subsidized membership, a kitchen full of snacks, a variety of food nearby on King Street / Queen Street, onsite bicycle parking and easy access to the TTC. Join a team passionate about making a difference!
Title: Senior Cloud Developer

Job_Description: Note: This is an on-location position only.  Senior Backend Developer (PHP / Symfony) Cheeky Monkey Media is an established web services company with a track record of delivering great looking and diverse web projects.  We are seeking backend developers to add to our team. We specialize in PHP and MySQL based Drupal development, but no previous Drupal experience is required. A successful candidate will have backend web development experience and be comfortable with PHP/MySQL. If you have programming competency, Cheeky Monkey Media will provide mentorship in Drupal.  What’s it like to work with monkeys? Flexibility: Office hours are flexible as long as long as we meet the needs of the team and the projects we’re working on. Extended Learning: Our team is all about attending events that help broaden our developer horizons. Fun: We aim to please, but we also have a great time doing it. Team Building: In-house developers get to partake in some pretty kick-butt team meetings. There may or may not be beverages consumed. Support: We will never let you fall on your monkey-butt. Ping the team slack channel for help on anything, monkeys will answer. Our workflow is designed to help our developers improve and we take opportunities to mentor each other. Competitive Pay: Not just bananas! We value your talent and for that, you shall be rewarded.  Backend Developer duties would include: Drupal site planning and building.Custom module/plugin development.Development workflow with GIT.Performing code review of other team members code.Automated testing.Maintenance and debugging.Offering technical solutions based on client requirements.Providing patches to contributed Drupal modules.Giving direction as project tech lead.Participating in a demonstration of completed work.Mentoring junior developers.  Education and Experience required: Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science or a related field.Minimum of 4 years programming experience.Experience with REST API development and integration.BONUS - Proficiency in Drupal site engineering, module development & theming.BONUS - Frontend experience with HTML/JS/SCSS.  TO APPLY Would you like to apply? If so, please send your resume to [email protected]
Title: Senior Backend Developer

Job_Description: Embrace and Lead  You have spent countless hours over the years learning the academic and practical skills to be great at what you do. Working professionally and as a hobbyist you have gathered experience in your field so you know what to do and what not to do. You embrace the perpetual cycle of learning and mastering new technologies. At ZetaTango we encourage everyone to trust themselves, stop holding back and use your acquired knowledge.  Everyone in the team is an integral contributor to our products, working with our customers to collaborate and design the best solutions. Our open work culture provides the opportunity for you to contribute to all aspects of our business: customer engagement, product ownership, software, QA, devops and 24/7 cloud service deployment.  As a key member of our development team you will lead through collaboration to design, develop and deploy our integrated cloud services that help small businesses succeed:  Drive the full product lifecycle as a product owner and developer  Design complete solutions  Develop secure code for APIs, frontend, backend, web, mobile, partner integration  Learn and adapt technologies to real problems  Leverage big data, predictive analytics and machine learning when and where its needed  What You Bring: Ruby on Rails or other web application frameworks  ELT and processing large data sets  Experience with the Apache big data ecosystem  Experience with API driven solutions  Proficiency with Linux  Working autonomously and being highly resourceful  Experience with agile, test driven design methodology  BSC or MSC in computer science or engineering  Other Valued Skills & Knowledge: Statistics, analytics and machine learning  Node.js, JavaScript and front-end development frameworks  Heroku, AWS, Kubernetes, Docker  Security & Cryptography  Accounting, payment, billing or other finance solutions  What You Can Expect From Us  At ZetaTango we hire for fit. Fit with our values of openness, agility and respect. Fit with the knowledge and skills needed to excel both individually and as part of a larger team so that we can continue to serve our customers. Fit with an insatiable need to improve, learn and discover. What you’ll get in return is the opportunity to work with others who are top in the industry and who possess an incredible amount of knowledge and enthusiasm for building a world class company.  If you are looking for a challenging career and the opportunity to be part of a successful and high growth company, ZetaTango is the ideal place for you.  ​ We want our candidates and our employees to be set up for success. During every part of the recruiting process you will have the opportunity to get in touch with our People & Culture team with any questions, concerns or requests for accommodations.
Title: Software Developer

Job_Description: About Mazu  Mazu is a youth engagement company helping professional sports teams across the major leagues as well as other large brands communicate with their younger audience. Through the use of our B2B and B2C products Mazu’s mission is to reconnect brands and families. We take a value based approach in delivering innovative and engaging content and solutions.  The staff at Mazu enjoy a fun, open and energetic atmosphere. Most of our team is located in Kelowna, BC with a sprinkling of remote workers throughout North America. Our clients are some of the most interesting brands and are eager to try new innovative solutions.  You will work on the full stack, front end to backend to create dynamically driven mobile applications. You will work with the latest mobile technologies like Ionic, Cordova, IOS, Android and Progressive Web Applications. Responsibilities will include (but are not limited to): requirements, systems analysis, code creation, unit testing, feature planning and technical documentation. Code must be designed per responsive mobile design techniques to run across a wide range of devices.  Requirements  2+ years hands-on experience building highly scalable, secure, robust mobile applications.  Extensive experience with JavaScript.  Familiar with mobile cross platform development tools like Cordova / Ionic  Wide experience in the handling and writing of APIs and JSON data structures  Proven experience in backend systems design  Must be able to take initiative, work independently and be innovative  Demonstrated ability to meet project timelines and collaborate in a small team.  Desired Skills  Worked mobile applications  Experience working with database design and administration.  Experience working with Linux environments.  Basic knowledge of Progressive Web Apps  Experience working with HTML, CSS, XML, JQuery and MVC Frameworks  Familiar with Agile Methodologies (SCRUM)  Solid understanding of the full mobile development life cycle  Experience in testing and debugging  Experience working with tools like Git, JIRA and Confluence.  What You Will Be Doing  Design and develop world-class applications based on requirements generated by the, business stakeholders as well as technology department staff  Integrate newly developed ap p s with existing software.  Location: Kelowna, British Columbia (must be willing to relocate and must be eligible to work in Canada)  Department: Development  Employment Type: Full Time  Minimum Experience: Mid-level
Title: Software Developer

Job_Description: Our Mission: Modern Money Movement.Instant Financial is disrupting the standard notion of ‘payday’ by giving workers daily control over their earned income. We allow people to live better lives by fixing the misalignment between when people get paid and when they need their money. Employers who pay with Instant enjoy greater access to the best employees as well as high employee retention and engagement. All of this translates into a better, more profitable business. We have started the payroll revolution and need talented passionate people to join the Modern Money Movement.We are dreamers who have a proven track record of making big things happen. We do this by inspiring ourselves and those we work with to do what others cannot do. We know that we must move together as a team, celebrate our successes, and above all learn quickly from the mistakes we know will be made due to the fast pace of our execution. We carry ourselves with urgency, honesty and integrity in everything we do. Together, we truly believe we can empower working lives.About the Team: We're a small but high-performing team of engineers, building SaaS and mobile technologies for a rapidly growing organization, led by a founding team with a proven track record.We embrace Agile and DevOps practices and tools to ensure the delivery of high quality software with a high release velocity. We have a well defined product and technology roadmap in support of a very healthy sales pipeline. We have a highly efficient flat structure and ambitious growth plans.Our stack is JavaScript-based (including with Node/Express microservices). Most importantly, we work in a collaborative environment of continuous learning - we expect you to challenge us as much as we challenge you!About You: You're an intermediate to senior full stack developer with JavaScript skills. You're passionate about building web and mobile applications and you’ve had experience delivering production-grade software.You thrive in fast-paced environments where you have lots of independence and ownership. You keep up-to-date with new technologies and trends, and you're eager to learn. You live and work with honesty and integrity, you carry your work with a healthy sense of urgency, you truly believe in teamwork, and you're not afraid to be held - or hold others - accountable for what must be done.What You'll Bring: Several years experience developing production-quality software at high scaleDegree in Computer Science, or equivalent experienceAbility to learn new technologies and paradigms rapidlyStrong JavaScript skillsFamiliarity with non-relational databases such as MongoDBProficiency in a Linux environmentDeep knowledge of web technologiesExcellent spoken and written EnglishBonus Assets: Test automationWorking in an Agile+DevOps development environmentWriting Node-based microservicesWriting microservices in a framework such as ExpressAny JavaScript framework such as Angular, React, or similarJOIN US!Are you so excited about taking on this challenge, and about what we stand for, that by now you can barely sit still? Then go ahead and send us your application, we would love to hear from you.We want authentic, passionate, hard-working people who will embrace this challenge, make it their personal goal to give it all they got, and leave a legacy while knowing that, by doing so, they are truly improving the lives of everyone that touches our solutions.Referral Reward: Know someone qualified for this role? You can receive a CAD $3,000 referral reward (paid 90 days after hire) by referring them to us.Job Type: Full-time
Title: Backend Developer

Job_Description: Who we are: SPORTLOGiQ is the leading provider of advanced analytics data for professional sports teams and broadcast media. As a Senior Back End Developer, you will work with the product development team to develop our next generation advanced analytics platform, providing our users with powerful analysis tools using SPORTLOGiQ’s unique data set. This is a once-in-a-lifetime opportunity to help shape the future of sports analysis, coaching and media storytelling.What you'll do: Collaborating with the product development team to iteratively define, design and implement the backend of SPORTLOGiQ’s hockey analysis system, from data collection to data reporting and the web UI.Owning the back end software design and architecture.Define and implement the REST API used by data analysis and collection tools as well as the customer facing Web UIs.Optimizing API and database for maximum speed and scalabilityManage testing and ensure robustness of the backend infrastructure codeManaging the deployment toolchain * Working effectively with the product development and design team to ensure back end features meet front end requirements properly.What you need: Minimum 5+ years’ experience as a Back-End Developer, Database Developer or similar related role.Significant experience of building secure, scalable RESTful APIs (PHP, Python).Significant experience working with databases and datawarehousing systems (PostgreSQL)Experience using cloud based platforms such as AWS / HerokuExperience in C++ programming a plus.Experience with FFMPEG/h264 a plus.Proficient understanding of code versioning tools, such as GitBachelor’s degree in Computer Science, or Computer Engineering.Passion for hockey a nice plus!What we offer: Extremely competitive salary/bonus programCentralized and accessible location in trendy Mile-EndCompetitive benefits packageFlexible work scheduleJob Type: Full-timeEducation:Bachelor's
Title: Senior Back end Developer
