We are founded by a world class team with decades of experience in international payments. Our mission is to change the legacy financial payment system through innovation. We are backed by some of the top investors in the Silicon Valley, San Francisco, and Asia.Responsibilities:Be part of an Agile team. Work closely with a team of FE, BE, QE and Product Managers on a daily basis.Voice your opinion, collaboratively come up with a decision as a team. Be held accountable as a team.Work with Architects to design & code new features for our expanding business.Document your technical design and approach.Write integration tests. (BE, QE) Write unit tests (FE).Perform code reviews inter- & intra-Agile teams.Evolve & expand a modern SOA distributed platform that is processing several $100M USD annually.Skills: Java (will consider Kotlin, Scala & Go engineers).Designing & scaling REST APIs in a distributed SOA system.Building consumer facing apps (web or mobile) that scale.MySQL/PostgreSQL/Oracle.AWS or other Cloud platforms.Bonus: experience in SpringBoot, Redis & Cassandra.Job Type: Full-timeExperience:Software Developer: 1 yearJava: 1 yearLocation:Ottawa, ON
Title: Backend Developer

Job_Description: Vena Solutions is seeking Java Developers to help us expand our sophisticated SaaS cloud technology. This role is a match for you if you are an innovative software engineer with an aptitude for big data and server-side development who loves to be continually challenged to create scalable and performant code. As a Java Developer, you will be responsible for the backbone for the Vena platform, building REST web services with a very modern Java 8 backend stack. Our developer-focused team culture encourages our engineers to be self-motivated and self-disciplined. We value leadership and people with passion who will take ownership to make their mark on our product within this growing business space. Check out the team blog for more details at engineering.vena.io. What you will do Design and develop flexible, efficient, object-oriented server code in Java Resolve problems that affect how businesses make sense of their data Refactor, simplify, and optimize code so we can develop new features more efficiently Work within an Agile, cross-functional team on features, design and implementation Contribute to building our environment that embraces continuous integration through the use of automated testing Think outside the box, adapting the latest software technologies while developing innovative functionality to improve software performance and usability What we use We are continuously revisiting the following stack to improve our product’s performance and usability: A versatile JavaScript front-end built with Backbone.js, jQuery and Bootstrap. Java SE/EE A custom-built OLAP processing engine that makes use of Jetty, Google Guice, and Dropwizard Modern data stores like MongoDB, Redis, Redshift Fully automated AWS cloud infrastructure A C# .NET Excel add-in built using VSTO, Excel Interop/VBA, and LINQ And much more Does this sound like you? You have three or more (3+) years of programming experience in Java development Equivalent experience and/or Post-secondary education in Computer Science, Software Engineering You have a strong knowledge of Computer Science fundamentals including software design, algorithms, etc. Working knowledge of building Java REST web services, AspectJ, Java 8 Lambdas, Hibernate, MongoDB is a bonus, but not required You are self-motivated and self-directed You believe in keeping stack current with the latest tools, libraries, frameworks, and trends in cloud technologies You have excellent analytical skills, coupled with a strong sense of ownership and drive You have experience working in an Agile development environment  Apply today... We can't wait to hear from you! About Us At Vena, our mission is to help smart companies better manage their data, spreadsheets, and files. Our cloud infrastructure leverages the flexibility and ease of use of widely-used spreadsheets while adding beautiful web-based workflows and a powerful cloud storage to make mission-critical business processes simple. Viewed by many as one of the most innovative Canadian start-ups, we’re part of a growing industry looking to revolutionize the enterprise so that people can stop fighting software and get back to doing their best work. Candidates must be legally entitled to work in Canada. Local candidates only. No agencies please. Should you require accommodation for any disability throughout any stage of the recruitment and selection process, please describe your requirements when making an application and we will be sure your accommodation needs are met.
Title: Java Developer

Job_Description: The App DevOps team enables our consumers to experience Canadian tire through new and emerging digital channels. Retail is changing in Canada and Canadian Tire is on the leading edge of this transformation. To us, culture comes first and is based on support and teamwork.  In Winnipeg, we are investing in creative people to build world-leading software to enhance the Canadian Tire retail experience and continue to support and augment them in an evolving industry. We expect our Winnipeg lab to refocus the lens retail is experienced through by revitalizing current applications and cultivate new digital experiences.  Responsibilities: To be a part of the team, you must have experience in building applications with high performance connecting to several backend Web Services exchanging data with complex systems. Strong knowledge of modern best practices for professional software development including secure coding standards, code reviews, source control management, build processes, testing, and operations. Experience developing native mobile applications connecting to Secured Web Services and familiarity with security standards for API’s, SSL, and Tokens is highly preferred. Design patterns while creating the functionality outlined in the requirement document and convert functional requirements into user interface designs and prototypes, and developed application(s). Work closely with the UI/UX design team to ensure feasibility of implementation of designs  Utilize different languages & web platforms to create scalable web and mobile applications based on business requirements.  Interface with internal project owners, creative team members and developers to ensure that the applications, experiences and websites display and function as expected.  Able to code and develop features that leverage in-app purchases, eCommerce, engaging experiences and social media integration.  Convert Mobile App, Digital Display and Website design specifications (wireframes and mock-ups) into working software.  Provide recommendations and solutions that meet business needs while ensuring an intuitive and best-in-class end user experience.  Play an active role and take ownership of optimization and performance activities for our interactive digital experiences.  Collaborate within the App DevOps team and key stakeholders to incorporate the business requirements based on research informed solutions for both psychological and physical elements that will enhance the customer journey and overall experience  Participate at all phases of the software development life cycle and work with the team via Agile programming practices (such as Scrum or Kanban) to drive team delivery.  Leverage your past experience with version control software, such as Git or Perforce to communicate and enforce sound code control practices within the development team.  Effectively develops and encourages clean, well structured, easily maintainable code bases.  Executes a regular cadence of Code Reviews and shares feedback throughout the team.  Consult on browser capability and rendering to ensure that proposals and development will work on specified platforms.  Experience working with remote data via REST and JSON.  Qualifications: Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science, Engineering preferred or equivalent Software Development industry experience.  5 years of Web or App development experience.  Holds a passion for client-side development and a strong background in building highly dynamic web apps leveraging a Javascript stack with HTML5, REST, CSS3, jQuery, and working knowledge of Cordova.  Has practical knowledge and experience with Git, Gulp, and Node.JS.  Functional and practical understanding of JavaScript MVC frameworks leveraging Ionic and Angular.  Experience with CSS frameworks and pre-processor’s similar to Bootstrap, Sass or Less.  Development experience on server side JavaScript.  Experienced with software architecture and design patterns.  Adapted to leveraging a Scrum/Agile development methodology and is passionate about optimizing process to keep agility high.  A meticulous eye for detail; finding and correcting the little issues that turn substandard experiences into best-in-class.  Possesses some native programming experience for Android using Android Studio, Android SDK, and related languages (Java).  Knowledge of Android M and N features and differences from prior versions  Experience with testing frameworks, continuous integration and build tools (i.e. jUnit, DBUnit, Jenkins/Hudson)  Proficient in writing automated Unit tests (Jasmine / Karma).  Advanced knowledge of JavaScript Single Page Applications and related tools.  Experience working with Unity 3D game engine is an asset, with a practical understanding of C#, Boo or Python.  Experienced using and automating tests, documentation, builds and deployment.  Large scale application development an asset.  What would success look like: As the successful candidate for the App Developer role on the Canadian Tire App DevOps team you would challenge the norm, push for excellence in everything and always seek discomfort. Everything you do and everything you are responsible for you will be on display for all of our consumers. Life in Canada depends on you and your expertise to make our digital experiences engaging and rewarding.  From the agile path you will be involved from the initial concept through to product delivery and be part of the decisions, direction and all facets that will impact the experiences we bring to Canadians. As a successful Developer you will never stop learning by keeping on top of changes with coding standards such as HTML5, CSS3, and responsive design functions.  In a pinch you fall back on guiding principles whether that be following Stack Overflow blogs, learning how to work directly with the UX designers, UI Developers and team members or spending time creating and refining a well-designed process methodology.If you enjoy looking outside of Web Development and into other areas such as 3D or possess a familiarity with Unity, we would love to hear from you.  Canadian Tire is an equal opportunity employer. We are committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace for all. We recognize that our future success depends on the perspectives and contributions of all our employees -- their diverse backgrounds, abilities and experiences make our business stronger. If you are contacted for a job opportunity, please advise us of any accommodations needed to ensure fair and equitable access throughout the recruitment and selection process. All accommodation information provided will be treated as confidential and used only for the purpose of providing an accessible candidate experience.  Information Technology  Manitoba-Winnipeg  Permanent  Full-time  Job Posting  :  May 1, 2018, 1:41:49 PM
Title: Sr. Developer

Job_Description: Company Profile  Morgan Stanley is a global financial services firm and a market leader in investment banking, securities, investment management and wealth management services. With offices in more than 43 countries, the people of Morgan Stanley are dedicated to providing our clients the finest thinking, products and services to help them achieve even the most challenging goals. As a market leader, the talent and passion of our people is critical to our success. We embrace integrity, excellence, team work and giving back.  Technology  The Technology division partners with our business units and leading technology companies to redefine how we do business in ever more global and dynamic financial markets. Our sizeable investment in technology results in leading-edge tools, software, and systems. Our insights, applications, and infrastructure give a competitive edge to clients’ businesses—and to our own.  Enterprise Technology & Risk (ETR) is comprised of five primary areas  Core Infrastructure (CI) manages the infrastructure technology solutions to support the Firm’s daily operations, enable our businesses to expand to new markets, offer new client products, and comply with evolving regulations.•End User Technology (EUT) delivers core communication, collaboration and productivity tools across the Firm, including desktop and mobile devices, remote computing solutions, and multimedia services. •Quality Assurance & Production Management (QAPM) provides production management, quality assurance, and end user services for Institutional Securities and Support Services. QAPM also manages the Enterprise Command Center, Enterprise Systems Management, and Technology Disaster Recovery services.•Technology & Information Risk (TIR) delivers first-line defenses to manage risks to Firm technology. TIR oversees programs that protect and enable the business, ensure secure delivery of services to our clients, address the risks presented by an evolving threat landscape, and meet regulatory expectations. •Technology Business Development (TechBD) manages the Firm’s strategic relationships with external technology companies.  Position Description: We are looking for a hands-on Database Tester The Candidate needs to be able to work with geographically dispersed Dev & QA team in a very dynamic, rapidly evolving and high pressure, high visibility project setting. The candidate is expected to contribute in a hands-on fashion on the project as well as take ownership of various QA deliverables. The following will be the candidates key focus areas. - Passionate around automating end to end testing including frontend/backend applications.- Being comfortable with frequent, incremental code testing and deployment- Ability to use a wide variety of open source and in house technologies and tools- Take a hands-on approach to implementing QA processes right from requirements analysis, test design, automation and analysis. - Own the quality and timeliness of delivery- Collaborate with Developers, Business and multiple global stakeholders to drive QA agenda & standards by engaging with them throughout the SDLC- Communicate key issues and progress updates in a regular, accurate, timely fashion.  Required:  8+ years of hands on experience working on QA automation team- Bachelor Degree in Computer Science or related field.- Experience working with source control / defect tracking and continuous integration systems- Experience around automating end to end testing including frontend/backend applications.- Proficient in traditional RDBMS schema and SQL- Good in Linux/Unix- Detail oriented and should be able to work in a fast paced environment- Able to demonstrate process improvements across both QA and development teams - Strong analytical ability and problem solving skills- Excellent interpersonal skills and professional approach- Good knowledge about testing concepts- Solid Test design skills, test case automation and analysis.- Hands on experience in of Shell scripting\Perl\Python . - Experience working with ALM  Desired:  PubSub/VCS/Autosys/Sybase/AFS/TCP-IP - Agile software development experience, preferably Scrum - Continuous Integration tools like Jenkins- Hands on experience in ETL testing- Exposure to BDD (JBehave / Cucumber/ Fitness / Concordion) (nice to have? YES)-Financial background  Knowledge of French and English are required.  Morgan Stanley is an equal opportunities employer. We work to provide a supportive and inclusive environment where all individuals can maximize their full potential.
Title: Database Tester 3110972

Job_Description: We are a successful independent Real Estate brokerage company with over 100 realtors. We are looking for a detail oriented web designer who has a great eye for design and loves to work in a growing environment. In this role, you will be working directly with our full-stack developer and graphic designer to implement a cross platform, user friendly interface to our web application.Qualifications2 years of professional web design experience or equivalent web design educationCertificate in web design is a bonus. BCIT graduates preferredAbility to implement a provided design from a PNG layout is a mustAbility to integrate layout with backend codeFamiliarity with JavaScript, CSS, Bootstrap, JQueryExperience within a Start-Up/entrepreneurial environment is a bonusWillingness to constantly learn and collaborate with other team membersIf you meet our requirements, please apply with your resume including examples of past relevant work experience.This is a 30 hours/week, 3 month position.Job Types: Full-time, Temporary, ContractSalary: $16.00 to $18.00 /hour
Title: Web Designer - 3 Month Contract

Job_Description: Quality Assurance AnalystPower Factors is looking for a new Quality Assurance Analyst to join our team. As a QA Analyst, you will be working with our excellent software development team to ensure we deliver the highest quality cloud-based asset management platform free of bugs or other defects.This position will be located in Power Factors’ offices in Montreal, Canada. This position will report to the Director of Technical Solutions.Essential Functions: Identify and create test requirements from specificationsOrganize, execute, and maintain manual test plans, regression suites and test casesPerform exploratory testing and functional testing of our software applicationPerform backend database testing in Microsoft SQL environment (stored procedures, jobs, triggers)Ensure communication of test results and statuses, escalating issues and risks as appropriateFind and isolate errors to allow the development teams to efficiently resolve defectsCommunicate results clearly and preciselyEvaluate and provide feedback on the usability of the applicationWork autonomously with little supervisionCompetencies and RequirementsBachelor's degree in Computer Science or appropriate technical degree or equivalent work experience3+ years of relevant QA testing experienceBilingual (English & French), written and spokenExperience with SQL queries and a good understanding of relational databasesFull understanding of the Software Development Life Cycle (SDLC)Excellent analytical, problem-solving and communication skillsAbility to focus on deadlines and deliverablesAbility to prioritize and manage multiple tasks concurrently and ensure follow up to completionMust be self-motivated and possess the ability to work efficiently and effectivelyUnderstanding of the Agile Scrum environment/methodologyExperience with electric utilities, solar, and wind power is an assetFamiliarity with automated testing tools is an assetPreferred Skills and Experience: O&M; ExperienceFamiliarity with cloud-based technologies (Azure, AWS, Rackspace, etc.)French or Spanish as a second languageFamiliarity with OSISoft’s PI system, SQL, and SalesforceAbout Power FactorPower Factors, a MaxGen Energy Services company, provides a SaaS platform for comprehensive Operations & Maintenance (O&M;) and Enterprise Asset Management (EAM) services. Our clients are industry-leading clean energy developers, financiers, operators, and asset owners. We collect data from utility, commercial, and residential-scale solar PV, wind, and energy storage sites and empower decision making and optimization through the effective curation and analysis of that data. We automate the processes to schedule and track site maintenance, increasing operational efficiency and reducing O&M; costs to accelerate the adoption of clean energy.About YouYou’re passionate about changing the energy landscape and doing things right the first time. You learn fast, have a positive attitude, and get along with a wide range of people. Power Factors is a vibrant and growing community and you have something to contribute to the team.Job Type: Full-timeLanguage:FrenchSpanish
Title: Quality Assurance Analyst

Job_Description: ACL Impact  ACL exists to help makes the world a safer and more ethical place. By enabling Governance, Risk, and Compliance (GRC) professionals that use our software to be recognized for the value they bring to their organizations, we aim to be game-changers: to provide organizations with the software tools, support, and knowledge to dive deep into their data, identify anomalies, and manage GRC across the entire organization. From helping a national agency track down missing children to helping banks find suspicious patterns in their data and state agencies stamp out fraudulent activities, ACL has been at the heart of many investigations that have helped save people and millions…talk about impact!  The ACL R&D Team  The R&D team extends beyond the walls of ACL and stands on the shoulders of giants. We use the innovation of technology partners like Amazon, select OEMs, and the Open Source Community to ensure we’re meeting our challenges with the most current and effective technologies. We give back by contributing time, code and support to our engineers and across the community.  To understand more about software development at ACL, read Landing your Software Engineering Dream Job. To look through the window into R&D, check out our blog or read these articles: Inside ACL R&D Part I — Brigades, and R&D Baymax Team Spirit.  As a DevOps shop, we own what we build. We do not pass it off to others. We maintain it. We continually work to reduce the time required to build and safely deploy software. Security, integrity and performance are not an afterthought. They are built into our development process. We design for growing use. We use tools to continually scan our code base and stay current on patches and upgrades. If a serious vulnerability is discovered we pause everything else and immediately resolve it.  We have a product development group of 70+ and counting (the company has over 300 employees and counting). We work in small “brigades” comprised of 5 or so Software Engineers, 2 QA Engineers, a Manager, a UX Designer, UX Developer and a Product Manager. It’s our version of a scrum team.  The Challenge Ahead  We’re searching for a Backend Software Engineer who has good backend experience to build robust and scalable backend APIs and modules that integrates with our visually stunning front-end interfaces.  You will help our team to build seamless integrations across our modules and services while also partnering closely with our product and UX teams to create and maintain new user features in our GRC platform.  What Will You Get Out of This?  An amazing dynamic startup environment within a financially stable company (did we mention we just celebrated our 30th anniversary?)Some of the best benefits in the industry (asking for more information can be a great first question for us in the interview process)Working with an awesome team of professional software engineers with plenty of room to learn and grow.  Skills for Success at ACL  You have a Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, or equivalent experience.You have experience delivering large-scale, high availability, secure web applications. Bonus if you’ve built them with Ruby on Rails in an agile environment.You have experience building and consuming RESTful APIs, working with relational databases and SQL (ideally PostgresSQL).You care deeply about code quality, are a TDD ninja, and detest having bugs slip through to production.You are passionate about learning and continuous improvement.You have creative ideas, a collaborative attitude and strong work ethic.  Bonus You have an interest in learning or have experience with backend technologies such as Ruby on Rails, relational databases and AWS services.You are actively involved in local meetups and contribute to open source project we can look at on Github.
Title: Software Engineer (Backend)

Job_Description: Zymeworks is a clinical-stage biopharmaceutical company dedicated to the discovery, development and commercialization of next-generation bispecific and multifunctional biotherapeutics. Zymeworks’ suite of complementary therapeutic platforms and its fully-integrated drug development engine provide the flexibility and compatibility to precisely engineer and develop highly-differentiated product candidates.  We are looking for a web application developer with expertise in data visualization, user interface design, and browser based tools to join our software team. This is an ideal opportunity for an individual who enjoys working with diverse teams of scientists and software developers to contribute towards our research platform. This position will report to the Group Lead of the Software Development Team and will be based in Vancouver, Canada.  We expect you to have…  Proven experience with interactive web application development  A good grasp of web standards and browser technology  A working knowledge of HTTP, REST and the nuances of API design  Experience with our software stack or equivalent technologies  Proficiency in English, spoken and written  It would be great if you had…  Two years or more industry experience in web development  Proven ability to assume ownership of a medium-to-large scale web application including design, implementation and maintenance  A track record of mentorship and knowledge sharing  Expertise or interest in backend web technologies such as Python or Go  D uties  Create browser-based visualizations, user interfaces for web applications and data analysis tools tailored to our scientists' R&D; needs  Collaborate with scientists and developers to condense complex requirements, design prototypes and deploy production grade software for internal users.  Participate in peer code reviews, regression testing and systematic deployments.  Experiment with new technologies and ideas to enhance the maintainability, simplicity and robustness of our platform.  Our Platform  Our software platform includes the following technologies: Elm and JavaScript, including D3, AngularJS for webapp frontends and visualizations  Python for scientific applications and modelling software  Go for server development  Elixir for server development  PostgreSQL  Wh y Work for Us?  Zymeworks’ employees are passionate, engaged and extremely motivated to succeed. We are excited by cutting-edge science and technology, the endless possibilities this union holds and the sheer opportunity to be a part of something big. To learn more about Zymeworks Inc. and our current openings, please visit our website at www.zymeworks.com.  We offer challenging career opportunities, competitive benefits and an environment that recognizes and rewards performance.
Title: Web Application Developer - 1474

Job_Description: At Versett, a developer is a broad sweeping term for a technical consultant, strategist, and finally, implementor of solutions for the products we create. A Front-end Developer's role focuses on the UI and UX of web products and applications and integrating them with backend systems and APIs. You should be equipped with an ever-shifting tool belt based on latest best practices, up-to-date standards, and most importantly a strong understanding of the problem at hand and what best solves it.  Worried about frameworks, build systems, transpilers and other beasts? Don't be. While we do have preferences that we adjust and align on as a team, in our opinion tools are easier to teach and learn than concepts (but we encourage teaching and learning those, too).  Requirements Your core competencies as a front-end developer rely on a strong understanding of CSS, HTML, and Javascript (web and Node). You have a foundational understanding of modern patterns and methodologies, a solid grasp of latest specifications, and an awareness of accessibility and performance pitfalls. You are flexible and strive to better yourself and the company. You have a collaborative mindset, and most importantly, you have empathy for your users, clients, and co-workers.  'Front-end' is a broad term and doesn't have to be all-encompassing, if you feel like you fit some of the following you should get in touch: You have worked with a designer or solo to build out a styleguide/style system/UI kit. You have rolled your own BEM, OOCSS, SMACSS-esque css architecture, for better or worse. You have built a SPA or two using one or more JS frameworks and it went really well. You have built a SPA or two using one or more JS frameworks and it went really badly. You've built out a website or web-app that met WCAG AA compliance. You are used to letting a build system do the heavy lifting. You have had conversations around state management, immutability, and unidirectional flow.   Is Versett the right place for you? We are a small and growing development team that is constantly looking to improve process and quality with every project we do. If you are looking to make an impact and have continued input into how a company operates, this is probably the place for you.  Our goal is to give our developers the opportunity to explore and learn new technologies and constantly expand their toolbelts and professional capabilities, whether that is through different client projects or our internal Alpha projects.  Here are examples of tools and technologies we currently work with:  React, Redux Flow Jest, Jasmine WebPack, Babel npm SCSS NodeJS  Travis Heroku AWS  We currently have openings for Front-end Developer in Toronto, Calgary, and New York.  About Versett Versett is a product design and engineering studio in Calgary, Toronto, and New York. Founded in 2011, we specialize in websites and mobile products.  Why work at Versett Our team is tight-knit and built on the philosophy of "Small, but Mighty". Versett was founded on a shared vision of a place where we can create meaningful work collaboratively, while continuing to grow and learn as individuals.  Perks? We’ve got perks:  Team events and retreats Competitive salary and benefits The hardware/software setup you need "Take the time you need" vacation policy Flexible hours Casual environment Diverse team Friday team lunches
Title: Developer - Front-end

Job_Description: At Interaxon , we develop engaging experiences using brain sensing technology. We are a passionate team of researchers, technical experts and scientists building the world’s leading science-based brain platform to empower personal transformation through human-centered innovation. Our flagship product is the Muse headband, a brain sensing headband that is designed to make meditation easier and provides real-time audio and visual feedback on your meditative state through the Muse companion app. More information is available at www.choosemuse.com .  As a Senior Cloud Developer at Interaxon, you’ll help us build APIs used by cross-platform mobile apps, revenue-generating web apps, and big data infrastructure that enables our neuroscientists to comb through our enormous brain data set. You are someone with a keen eye for detail, who thrives in a fast paced environment, and have extensive experience of architecting and building scalable distributed backend systems.  What you‘ll be doing: Architect and build scalable distributed backend systems.  Look out for and evaluate promising technologies/services most suitable for the task.  Test your code, ensuring high coverage and shipping features that you are proud of.  Collaborate with Product Managers and Designers to ensure the specifications make sense.  Review code from others in a collaborative way. No stone goes unturned.  Participate in Sprint rituals, especially story point estimation.  Share your opinion and experience in technical design sessions.  Bring your ideas to continuously improve our processes and practices.  Coach junior developers, raising the bar for everyone on the team.  Develop your craft as you learn something new and grow while on our team.  Your skills and experience: 5+ years of experience working with cloud platforms, preferably Google Cloud, building large distributed systems  5+ years of experience with Python, Node, Go, PHP, or Ruby, working in a team environment.  Built applications using both SQL and NoSQL databases, has solid understanding of different design principles and trade-offs.  DevOps mindset, experience with operating code in production.  Expert in Git.  Experience with CI/CD tools.  Computer Science degree or similar degree.  What we offer: Our collaborative and inclusive culture is an extension of our vision to empower personal transformation to improve lives and change the world. We have a flexible working environment, great benefits package, meditation space, onsite gym with subsidized membership, a kitchen full of snacks, a variety of food nearby on King Street / Queen Street, onsite bicycle parking and easy access to the TTC. Join a team passionate about making a difference!
Title: Senior Cloud Developer

Job_Description: BlackBerry is looking for server-side Software Developers to join our IoT team where we are developing technology to help connect devices to deliver "Internet-of-Things" experiences, including our innovative BlackBerry Radar product and our novel, newly-unveiled, security-focused BlackBerry Jarvis offering . Our services enable customer efficiency improvements that were unheard of previously and rest on a foundation of rock-solid security. We are looking for enthusiastic developers who love new technologies and thrive in the polyglot software development model that Service-Oriented Architectures and Micro-service Architectures make possible. These platform roles demand broad generalized ability - on any given day, you might be fixing a bug in one of our Scala or Ruby services, authoring a new feature in a node.js or go service, or working with DevOps to set up a new CI pipeline for a service, among many, many other possibilities.  Developers with a solid understanding of modern DevOps and a commitment to the development of high-quality software through the use of unit testing and TDD are preferred as we must take care in the development process to ensure we make zero downtime, incremental upgrades possible while maintaining high levels of quality throughout. Our group is committed to innovation and as a member of our platform team, you will participate in ideation sessions to generate new patentable inventions, benefit financially from these via our patent incentive program, and are likely to see at least some of those good ideas end up in our products themselves. Equally, as our service offerings grow and mature, we are accumulating vast quantities of data - we will be turning our attention to mining that data in interesting and novel ways through the use of Machine Learning and Analytics, so candidates with some background in these areas will similarly be preferred.  Responsibilities:  Developing server side functionality in a wide variety of languages Developing user interfaces for both management of services and applications Being a DOM ninja!  Integrating and using leading open source tools such as React, Node.js, Docker Designing and developing full-stack solutions focused on solving use cases all the way from embedded device, web UI, to backend and database Writing unit tests to continually improve quality as well as our ability to introduce features at a rapid pace Working directly with customers to enable their use cases with our platform Planning work using Scrum methodologies  Skills and Qualifications: Experience developing web-based user interfaces and server-side business logic including database modelling Working knowledge of the AWS service ecosystem Experience in designing REST APIs in particular and excellent design skills in general Examples of frameworks we use include: React, Angular, Express, Mocha, JUnit, Rails  Examples of languages we use include: Javascript (both client-side and server-side using Node.js), HTML, CSS, Ruby, Java, Go and Scala Examples of databases we use include: NoSql data stores like Cassandra, ElasticSearch, as well as RDBMS systems like MariaDB and Postgresql Examples of tools we use include: Jira, Git, Jenkins, Docker Proficiency in UNIX/Linux Excellent communication and interpersonal skills High degree of motivation, and ability to work both independently and in a team environment #LI-TT1   Job Family Group Name: Product Development    Scheduled Weekly Hours: 40
Title: Senior Software Developer, IoT

Job_Description: Our Calgary location is currently looking for a full-time Software Developer to be part of a team that is responsible for delivering timely, high quality releases that delight our customers in the upstream oil & gas sector. You’d be designing, coding and testing enhancements to our Harmony desktop application in C++ and/or C#.  About You:  You’re highly collaborative - you have an affinity for solving complex problems through dialogue with team members You’re a problem solver – you enjoy solving complex problems, and are comfortable exploring them even if the problem and solution are not yet well-defined You’re practical – you assess the circumstances and make the best decision based on the facts You’re always improving something – whether it’s learning a new programming language, or finding better ways to do things with your team, continuous improvement is important to you Some of the things you’d be doing as a developer on our team:  Be an active and collaborative team member as part of an agile development team of 5-9 people Design, code and test enhancements for a Windows-based desktop application written in C++ and/or C#, with SQL Server as its backend database Work with customer stakeholders to ensure we’re adding value for our users Work closely with other developers, for example by pair programming and participating in code reviews Troubleshoot and fix bugs Contribute to testing of user stories, features and releases Assist our customer facing support team in solving client issues, when necessary Contribute insights and suggestions as part of our continuous improvement Generally pitch in wherever needed to help get a high quality release out on time Qualifications that would make you a good fit for this role:  Minimum B.Sc. in software engineering, computer engineering, computer science, or equivalent experience. Experience writing code in C++ and/or C# Experience with SQL Server databases Familiarity with object oriented software design Experience with unit testing Familiarity with, or interest in, agile principles and values  About Us  We are IHS Markit. We harness deep sources of information, analytics and expertise to forge solutions for the industries and markets that drive global economies. Our company partners with clients in business, finance and government to provide the unrivaled insights and perspectives that lead to well-informed, confident decisions. We call this The New Intelligence. IHS Markit serves more than 50,000 key customers in more than 140 countries, including 80 percent of the Fortune Global 500. We help decision makers apply higher-level thinking to daily tasks and strategic issues across a host of industries and disciplines including energy, finance, automotive, engineering, technology, maritime and trade, aerospace and defense, chemical, and economics and country risk. Headquartered in London, IHS Markit (Nasdaq: INFO) is committed to sustainable, profitable growth.  It is the policy of IHS Markit to provide equal employment opportunity (EEO) to all persons regardless of age, color, national origin, citizenship status, physical or mental disability, race, religion, creed, gender, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, genetic information, marital status, status with regard to public assistance, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local law. In addition, IHS Markit will provide reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities. We maintain a drug-free workplace. For candidates in the US, we are a participant in E-Verify (see link below).  EEO is the Law EEO is the Law Supplement Right to Work Pay Transparency Policy E-Verify   Current Colleagues If you are currently a colleague with IHS Markit please apply internally via Workday.
Title: Explore the possibilities

Job_Description: About NestReady  NestReady is looking for ambitious, highly motivated, driven professionals with strong technical skills to join our team! We are a real estate technology company with over 6 years of experience in building innovative tools to empower the next generation to enter the real estate market. Our environment is fast-paced, challenging, and ultimately very rewarding for the right person.  Our product  NestReady is a real estate platform that brings all parts of the home-buying experience together. It is a digital platform that removes the stress from the homebuying process creating transparency and accessibility every step of the way. NestReady transforms the customer experience through data processing and user pattern identification. We define a systematic journey from beginning to end that allows us to provide the best in class home buying guidance.  Our platform is built to be integrated within financial institutions platforms to help our partners provide a full home buying experience - from discovery to financing.  Who you’ll work with  Reporting directly to the VP of Product & Development, you will provide the technological vision and leadership in the development, implementation and support of our product. You will oversee the quality of the architecture, codebase and infrastructure of the product, delivering designs to agreed specifications within timelines and budget constraints.  You thrive in a startup environment, with a strong desire to help build for the future and enjoy leading a team of engineers. You are an entrepreneurial, results-oriented, customer-focused leader who will manage technical discussions with business prospects, understand and assess their requirements, prepare and present NestReady offerings, and provide recommendations for optimal solutions.  As the leader of this team, you will also be responsible for hiring team of exceptional engineers as we grow our business. Outside of Canada?  We are open to assisting with visa sponsorship for applicants with a desire to move to Montreal, Quebec.  What you’ll be working on  Develop and advocate the technological vision and roadmap with the development team  Influence technical direction by choosing best tools and approaches & ensure delivery of high-quality end product  Define a strategy to manage development processes to ensure that the engineering team delivers with the highest levels of quality, efficiency and predictability  Work closely with the product and sales teams to define product specifications, new features and client requirements  Build, manage, mentor and lead a team of Backend and Front End developers  Writing back-end code in Ruby and improving our current code  Design and implement robust features that perform and scale for millions of users  Architecture and performance optimization of complex customizable software apps  Constantly seek and advocate for adopting new bold new technologies for our product  Support planning and documentation of technical architecture  What you have  Minimum 5 years professional experience with Ruby/Rails framework or other full-stack frameworks  Minimum 3 years of demonstrated experience leadership experience  Able to work independently with little to no supervision  Strong ability to communicate and align with the executive team and corporate roadmap  Strong ability to present, synthesize and influence change  Self-driven  Strong organizational skills with great attention to detail  Creative problem solving  It would be great if you had  Strong knowledge of Javascript, React, NodeJS  Knowledge of MongoDB,PostgreSQL, Graphs, and Geoprocessing  Experience with startup environment  Appreciation for agile development and efficient code  Have experience creating technical documentation  Previously contributed to open source projects  What We Offer  Sponsorship for Canadian work visa  Flexible work schedule  Casual dress code  Open office space in Old Port  Free coffee, snacks, and drinks  Health Benefits covered up to 80%  Fun parties and team building activities  Opportunities for advancement  Un peu d’info sur NestReady  NestReady est à la recherche de professionnels ambitieux, motivés et motivés, possédant de solides compétences techniques pour se joindre à notre équipe! Nous sommes une société de technologie immobilière avec plus de 6 ans d'expérience dans la construction d'outils innovants pour permettre à la prochaine génération d'entrer dans le marché de l'immobilier. Notre environnement est rapide, stimulant, et finalement très enrichissant pour la bonne personne.  Notre produit  NestReady est une plate-forme immobilière qui réunit toutes les parties de l'expérience d'achat d'une maison. C'est une plate-forme numérique qui élimine le stress du processus d'achat d'une maison en créant transparence et accessibilité à chaque étape du processus. NestReady transforme l'expérience client grâce au traitement des données et à l'identification des modèles utilisateur. Nous définissons un parcours systématique du début à la fin qui nous permet de fournir les meilleurs conseils en matière d'achat d'une maison.  Notre plateforme est conçue pour être intégrée aux plates-formes des institutions financières afin d'aider nos partenaires à offrir une expérience complète d'achat d'une maison, de la découverte au financement.  Vos futurs collègues de travail  Relevant directement du vice-président des produits et du développement, vous fournirez la vision technologique et le leadership dans le développement, la mise en œuvre et le soutien de notre produit. Vous superviserez la qualité de l'architecture, de la base de code et de l'infrastructure du produit, fournissant des conceptions conformes aux spécifications convenues dans les délais et les contraintes budgétaires.  Vous prospérez dans un environnement de démarrage, avec un fort désir d'aider à construire pour l'avenir et profiter de diriger une équipe d'ingénieurs. Vous êtes un leader entrepreneurial, axé sur les résultats et axé sur le client qui gère les discussions techniques avec les clients potentiels, comprend et évalue leurs besoins, prépare et présente les offres NestReady et fournit des recommandations pour des solutions optimales.  En tant que chef de cette équipe, vous serez également responsable de l'embauche d'une équipe d'ingénieurs exceptionnels à mesure que nous développons notre entreprise.  Vous êtes actuellement situé à l’étranger?  Nous sommes ouverts à l'aide pour le parrainage de visas pour les candidats désireux de déménager à Montréal, Québec.  Vos tâches  Développer et défendre la vision technologique et la feuille de route avec l'équipe de développement  Influencer la direction technique en choisissant les meilleurs outils et approches et assurer la livraison de produits finis de haute qualité  Définir une stratégie pour gérer les processus de développement afin de s'assurer que l'équipe d'ingénierie offre les plus hauts niveaux de qualité, d'efficacité et de prévisibilité  Travailler en étroite collaboration avec le produit et les équipes de vente pour définir les spécifications du produit, les nouvelles fonctionnalités et les exigences du client  Construire, gérer, encadrer et diriger une équipe de développeurs Backend et Front End  Rédaction de code back-end dans Ruby et amélioration de notre code actuel  Concevoir et mettre en œuvre des fonctionnalités robustes performantes et évolutives pour des millions d'utilisateurs  Architecture et optimisation des performances des applications logicielles personnalisables complexes  Toujours chercher et préconiser l'adoption de nouvelles technologies audacieuses pour notre produit  Planification de la prise en charge et documentation de l'architecture technique  Ce que nous recherchons  Expérience professionnelle de 5 ans minimum avec le framework Ruby / Rails ou d'autres frameworks full-stack  Minimum de 3 ans d'expérience démontrée en leadership  Capable de travailler de façon autonome avec peu ou pas de supervision  Forte capacité à communiquer et à s'aligner sur l'équipe de direction et la feuille de route de l'entreprise  Forte capacité à présenter, synthétiser et influencer le changement  Personnalité autonome  Solides compétences organisationnelles avec une grande attention aux détails  Résolution de problèmes créative  Les atouts qui vous placeront en tête  Bonne connaissance de Javascript, React, NodeJS  Connaissance de MongoDB, PostgreSQL, Graphes et Géotraitement  Expérience avec l'environnement de démarrage  Appréciation pour le développement agile et le code efficace  Avoir de l'expérience en création de documentation technique  Auparavant contribué à des projets open source  Ce que nous offrons  Parrainage pour un visa de travail canadien  Horaire de travail flexible  Tenue vestimentaire  Espace de bureau ouvert dans le Vieux-Port  Café gratuit, collations et boissons  Prestations de santé couvertes jusqu'à 80%  Des soirées amusantes et des activités de team building  Des opportunités d'avancement
Title: Lead Back-end Developer/Développeur Principal Back-end

Job_Description: WebFull Stack DeveloperDescription de tâchesTEC recherche actuellement un architecte Web. Le poste se rapporte au Coordonnateur du développement web et implique une connaissance approfondie des CMS, Kentico étant celui qui est utilisé chez TEC ainsi que du développement de site web complexe, à haut trafic et a une forte facilité à faire de l'inginérie inverse.Responsabilités majeures· Développer des nouvelles sections de notre site web qui s'intègre a plusieurs sous-système de type legacy, et ce en respectant les échéancier et les requis des clients internes et en respectant les· Supporter, maintenir et évoluer les site web des différentes divisions de TEC· Mettre en place des unit test et de la documentation complète pour l’ensemble des nouveaux développement web effectué· Développez en utilisant Microsoft stack (MsSQL, C#, Asp.Net) à la fois le back-end et le front-end du système (ASP.Net WebForm, MVC, JavaScript, jQuery, HTML4/5, CSS, LESS/SASS, Gulp.js)· Tenir des revues techniques pour s'assurer que les pratiques et l'utilisation appropriée des normes sont respectées dans l'architecture et la conception de toutes les solutions.· Communiquer et assurer une compréhension commune du besoin par toutes les parties prenantes de l’équipeQualifications· BSc / MSc en informatique, en génie logiciel ou en systèmes d'information de gestion.· 10+ années expérience éprouvée dans le développement web· Bonne connaissance des technologies NoSQL (Elastic Search preferred)· Connaissance approfondie des CMS, Kentico étant un atout majeur· Historique prouvé de livraison de site web à haut trafic· Excellente aptitude à l'écriture et à la communication orale· Bonne relation interpersonnelle avec les acteurs commerciaux et les équipes techniques.· Connaissance approfondie des méthodologies de livraison, y compris les méthodologies agiles· Bilingue anglais / françaisCe que nous offrons à nos employés: ✅ Chez TEC, nous avons un programme de REER-COOP très avantageux. Vous pouvez réellement faire un impact sur votre placement ici!✅ TEC paye l’assurance groupe à ses employés✅ Collations gratuites – nous avons couramment des pommes, bagels et beignes✅ 5@7 mensuel✅ Thé et café offert gratuitement✅ Gymnase sur les lieux✅ Heures flexibles✅ Management accessible et abordable – nos portes sont toujours ouvertes-----------------------------Task descriptionTEC is currently looking for a Web Architect. It takes people who have the passion and desire to disrupt the status quo, push boundaries, deliver innovation, and change the world. If you have this type of passion, we invite you to take a look at the opportunities available to come join our team.    Are you passionate about creating quality software used at multiple AMD sites around the world? Do you want to help improve experiences of cutting-edge AMD CPU, APU and graphics products? The developer will be responsible for developing and driving technical direction for a cutting-edge web application. Outstanding design and organizational skills as well as ability to read and understand code in multiple languages are critical. Reasonable accommodations are available for applicants with disabilities during the recruitment process, unless undue hardship to AMD would result. Any applicant who requires accommodation should contact AskHR@amd.com AMD does not accept unsolicited resumes from headhunters, recruitment agencies or fee based recruitment services.

Experience working with AWS & Dev Ops (deployment, server integration, etc) Developing/deploying in a Linux environment Experience in SAP integration will be an asset Knowledge of testing methodologies & software development life cycle (SDLC) Understanding of the full web stack – from server to browser Knowledge of IE9+, Safari, Firefox, iOS & Android browser specific compatibility issues Excellent analytical skills (planning & problem solving) Experience in estimating for large scale applications Strong Knowledge and proven experience in setting, securing and managing public cloud infrastructure Demonstrated knowledge of cloud provisioning and administration, cloud bursting, and business continuity strategies, as well as performance measurement and monitoring in the cloud. Experience in AWS IAM policy preparation for cloud Security Proficiency in cloud automation using AWS CLI  DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES  REQUIREMENTS:  Strong JavaScript Frameworks (AngularJS, Angular 5) Strong Web Development (WordPress, HTML5, CSS3, jQuery, Git) Experience building single-page applications consuming REST APIs Technical leadership skills Communication skills (includes interaction with stakeholders and demonstration of UI/UX features) Experience with cloud, AWS – preferred Experience with performance tuning and monitoring Working experience with Magento and WooCommerce. Knowledge of Demandware is a plus. Experience with SEO and website performance optimization Strong documentation discipline ASSETS  Bachelor’s or advanced degree, preferably in Computer Science or Engineering disciplines. 6+ years web application development (single-page JavaScript apps); 4+ years of experience building web-applications leveraging AngularJS development. Experience with development methodologies such as Agile or Scrum Experience with Continuous Integration/Delivery/Deployment environment Experience with native mobile development for iOS / Android  WORKING CONDITIONS/PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS:  The standard working week is 40 hours, Full Time Permanent. On-the-job training is provided. This area carries a moderate to high decision-making ability. This individual has a moderate to high level of responsibility.  To Apply: Interested candidates should submit their resume online to: [email protected] with subject as: Senior Lead Web Developer in Woodbridge, Canada.

You love to learn and improve and have a passion for technology and writing code.  You want to join us in using technology to build the next generation of products that enable organizations to power human connections at scale. Working on high-volume, highly available, scalable and extensible websites/applications Web foundations - HTML, CSS and Javascript You have a fundamental understanding of Object Oriented concepts and MVC frameworks Working with REST APIs Writing tests to ensure quality in your code Optimizing and applying best practices Learning and evolving your technical capabilities Working in a fast paced and continuously evolving environment  Bonus Points…   Knowledge of Unix based systems Experience with Go and/or Python Experience with infrastructure orchestration and/or infrastructure as code (Ansible, Terraform, Docker, Kubernetes, etc.) Experience with React, ES6, Angular Experience in an agile environment and methodologies You have open source contributions or personal projects you’ve shipped successfully  Hootsuite is an inclusive employer. Title: Web Developer

Job_Description: Description:   About Us\:  The AIR MILES® Rewards Program has earned the trust and support of more than two-thirds of Canadian households. For over two decades, we have helped our Partners use Canada’s most widely accepted loyalty currency, AIR MILES® reward miles, to influence customer behavior, drive profitability, and build long-term relationships.  Check us out – LoyaltyOne on Stack Overflow | LinkedIn | Glassdoor | Facebook |Twitter  Engineering Team Culture\:  We are polyglots\: We believe in using the best tech stack for the job. We’ve written scripts in Python and built APIs in Scala, Java, Akka, and Node.js. We deploy everything to the Cloud.  We pair program\: You pick your machine\: Windows or Mac. Our floors are open space with no cubicles or private offices, regularly pair programming and mobbing when working. Teams have hack days at least once a month when they take a break to work on anything they want, and most of the time their creations end up in our production environment. Communication is key to our approach, and we don't want to hinder it with walls, real or metaphorical.  We are Agile\: Development methodologies mean different things to different people. For us? We have a story card wall and release a few times a week. We keep the team in sync with daily stand-ups and have a retrospective once a month to discuss things that are going well and opportunities for improvements. We surround teams with everything they need, Scrum Masters to coach us on the process, Product Owners to make sense of the work, Pod Leaders to help with our careers and Competency Leads to facilitate technical design and provide mentorship in advanced technical skills.  Types of projects we work on\:   As part of the AM Next team, you will be building the next generation Air Miles Reward Program platform. This new Cloud-based platform will focus on quality and security while providing massive data scalability and real-time data ingestion, processing, and consumption. We are finding new ways of working that allow us to continuously improve delivery of value with high levels of cadence and quality.   Qualification:  What we look for in you\:  Ability and desire to work in our collaborative environment\: open team room, pair programming and fluid interactions with all products and operations teams  Focusing on building solutions utilizing an agile approach; leveraging close relationships with Product Managers, communicating and digesting real-time feedback, and working smart to build story cards on daily basis  You have experience building large scale distributed systems, based on reactive principles, that are flexible, loosely-coupled and scalable  You believe that Cloud is the future and you have experience managing some of them - AWS, Azure, Google Cloud Platform or IBM Cloud  We know there are endless tools and technologies, and we don’t expect you to come in as an expert on everything, but you are looking forward to experimenting and learning.  Air Miles Perks\:  Hack Days\: one day a month you work on projects that interest you to improve your craft   Training\: from hackathons to conferences, to instructor lead, building your competency is our priority About LoyaltyOne  LoyaltyOne is part of the successful Alliance Data family of companies that provide the full range of data-driven loyalty, marketing and credit solutions in more than 80 locations across the globe.  Working with more than 100 leading brands in the retail, financial services, grocery, petroleum retail, travel and hospitality industries to profitably change customer behavior. Through a team of businesses, including one of the leading coalition loyalty programs in the world, the AIR MILES® Reward Program, LoyaltyOne designs, delivers and manages a suite of services focused on consumer data, customer-centric retail strategies, direct-to-consumer marketing, loyalty consulting and more.   LoyaltyOne has broadened its horizons geographically by growing Precima in the European market. With the recent acquisition of BrandLoyalty in the Netherlands, LoyaltyOne has gained the expertise of a global leader in short-term loyalty campaigns, along with a client network that extends throughout Europe and Asia.     About ADS   Alliance Data® (NYSE\: ADS) is a leading global provider of data-driven marketing and loyalty solutions serving large, consumer-based industries. The Company creates and deploys customized solutions, enhancing the critical customer marketing experience; the result is measurably changing consumer behavior while driving business growth and profitability for some of today's most recognizable brands. Alliance Data helps its clients create and increase customer loyalty through solutions that engage millions of customers each day across multiple touch points using traditional, digital, mobile and emerging technologies. An S&P 500 and Fortune 500 company headquartered in Plano, Texas, Alliance Data consists of three businesses that together employ more than 16,000 associates at approximately 100 locations worldwide. www.alliancedata.com    Alliance Data is an Employment Opportunity employer. Accordingly, we will make reasonable accommodations to respond to the needs of people with disabilities in accordance with legislation.  Alliance Data participates in E-Verify.
Title: Backend Developer

Job_Description: Looking to work for an awesome team? You've come to the right place! Our developers are a tight-knit group, and we are pushing for substantial product development as we continue looking to grow the team in the next year. We value passion for quality, maintainable, and scalable code, and for building awesome products. A side benefit of developing for the restaurant industry is that once we’re done working hard, we have some great clients who can always provide amazing venues for unwinding with our close knit team. TouchBistro is looking for several Backend Developers at the Intermediate or Senior level here in our Toronto office. Our POS system is evolving and our customers are demanding more product capabilities. As a member of our agile Technology team, you will have the chance to work on our current or next-Gen product's web features. Our current stack is ReactJS and NodeJS but if you have worked with other frameworks that is also sufficient. To apply for this position, you must possess a minimum 1+ years of production experience using NodeJS and SQL databases. The development team is poised for growth and along with that comes with many opportunities to learn different skills as well as have a growth path internally.   YOUR DAY-to-DAY Using JavaScript, design & implement features to help our restaurant customers succeed Create a new API using NodeJS and SQL databases on the backend Keep Up-to-Date with best practices and tooling from the JavaScript community Fearlessly Collaborate with your team to solve problems and learn from failures   ALL ABOUT YOU Knowledge of modern JavaScript, HTML5, CSS3 1+ Years of Experience with NodeJS 3+ Years of experience using a backend language (we use Node, but Java, Ruby on Rails, Python, etc. is also acceptable) Some exposure to SQL or NoSQL databases Test Driven Development Experience working on teams in an agile-scrum environment 4 year College Diploma or University Degree  WHY CHOOSE US? TouchBistro is an award-winning iPad Point of Sale system, built for restaurant people by restaurant people. We’re a team of thinkers, builders, doers, and innovators. While many of us have experience working at restaurants, some of us just have a true passion for the industry. We’re venture backed by some of the best tech VCs in the world and are partnered with top innovators in the mobile, food, and payment industries. We’re global and growing! TouchBistro is used in more than 100 countries worldwide and has offices in NYC, Austin, Chicago, London and headquarters in Toronto. We’re a fast-moving, ever-evolving company on a mission to change the way restaurateurs do business and help them succeed through our products and services, but we need talented, passionate people to help! So, what do you say? Are you ready to become part of something awesome?  TouchBistro believes in fostering an inclusive workplace where all individuals have an opportunity to succeed. Requests for accommodation due to a disability can be made at any stage of the recruitment process.
Title: Backend Developer

Job_Description: Our Mission: Modern Money Movement.Instant Financial is disrupting the standard notion of ‘payday’ by giving workers daily control over their earned income. We allow people to live better lives by fixing the misalignment between when people get paid and when they need their money. Employers who pay with Instant enjoy greater access to the best employees as well as high employee retention and engagement. All of this translates into a better, more profitable business. We have started the payroll revolution and need talented passionate people to join the Modern Money Movement.We are dreamers who have a proven track record of making big things happen. We do this by inspiring ourselves and those we work with to do what others cannot do. We know that we must move together as a team, celebrate our successes, and above all learn quickly from the mistakes we know will be made due to the fast pace of our execution. We carry ourselves with urgency, honesty and integrity in everything we do. Together, we truly believe we can empower working lives.About the Team: We're a small but high-performing team of engineers, building SaaS and mobile technologies for a rapidly growing organization, led by a founding team with a proven track record.We embrace Agile and DevOps practices and tools to ensure the delivery of high quality software with a high release velocity. We have a well defined product and technology roadmap in support of a very healthy sales pipeline. We have a highly efficient flat structure and ambitious growth plans.Our stack is JavaScript-based (including with Node/Express microservices). Most importantly, we work in a collaborative environment of continuous learning - we expect you to challenge us as much as we challenge you!About You: You're an intermediate to senior full stack developer with JavaScript skills. You're passionate about building web and mobile applications and you’ve had experience delivering production-grade software.You thrive in fast-paced environments where you have lots of independence and ownership. You keep up-to-date with new technologies and trends, and you're eager to learn. Job_Description: Our Calgary location is currently looking for a full-time Software Developer to be part of a team that is responsible for delivering timely, high quality releases that delight our customers in the upstream oil & gas sector. About You: You’re highly collaborative - you have an affinity for finding solutions through discussions with team members You’re a problem solver – you enjoy solving complex problems, and are comfortable exploring them even if the problem and solution are not yet well-defined You’re always improving something – whether it’s learning a new programming language, or finding better ways to do you’d be doing as a developer on our team: Be an active and collaborative team member as part of an agile development team of 5-9 people Design, code and test enhancements for a Windows-based desktop application written in C++ and/or C#, with SQL Server as its backend database Work closely with customer stakeholders to ensure we’re adding value for our users Work closely with other developers, for client issues, when necessary Contribute insights and suggestions as part of our continuous improvement Generally pitch in wherever needed to help get a high quality release out on time Qualifications object-oriented programming language, ideally C++ and/or C# Experience with WPF and XAML Experience with SQL Server databases Experience in web development (particularly Angular and/or React,
