Job_Description: ABOUT YOU: First and foremost, you’re passionate about great work. Be it a powerful Perl one-liner, beautiful succinct HTML, or an Object-Oriented masterpiece, crafting rewarding and optimized user experiences shines through in everything you do. You thrive in a brand-driven environment and you’re able to articulate ideas and communicate effectively with both technical and non-technical staff.A motivated self-starter and detail oriented code guru, you live and breathe the web and the tech that delivers it. You’ve got some awesome HTML/CSS/JS skills to showcase alongside impressive server-side development and sys-admin chops.Your interfaces are pixel perfect and your code is clean, efficient, and selfdocumenting. You see opportunity in challenge and you’re excited to join a rapidly growing team that has an affinity for nature and a thirst for outdoor adventure.THE OPPORTUNITY: This is an opportunity to join an amazing digital marketing brand that executes quickly and drives performance.You’ll thrive while experimenting with the latest tech as a key member of a development team that delivers solutions you can be proud of. Working collaboratively with digital marketing and creative teams, you’ll be implementing solutions in our proprietary course delivery platform and a variety of properties including websites, social and email - at a brand that rewards innovation, progression and growth hacking success.Responsibilities and DutiesA DAY IN THE LIFE: Diving deep into the codebase and coding novel solutions for the LMS, CMS, analytics, and marketing campaignsGrowth hacking UI/UX, and backend improvements based on user input and analyticsOptimizing applications, assets, and technology for speed and scalabilityBuilding reusable components, libraries, and scriptsQualifications and SkillsQUALIFICATIONS: 5+ years Front-End development in a corporate or agency setting. Experience with HTML5, Bootstrap, CSS3, AJAX and JSON5+ years Back-End development with a deep understanding of Object-Oriented principles and PHP development3+ years of Linux system administration. Experience deploying and administering Ubuntu Linux on AWS a definite asset3+ years of database administration including deployment, security, and query optimizationExperience with client-side scripting and JavaScript frameworks such as JQueryFamiliar with image authoring tools such as Adobe PhotoshopExperience with database normalization, star schema, and fact and dimension tables a plusSKILLS: Object Oriented Development in PHPLinux System AdministrationCommand Line Script-FuFront-End DevelopmentDatabase Administration, Optimization, and DesignAdaptable, Amiable, and Probably a Bit EccentricJob Type: Full-timeExperience:Back-End Development: 5 yearsLinux System Administration: 3 yearsDatabased Administration: 3 yearsFront-End Development: 5 years
Title: Full-Stack Developer

Job_Description: A little about us...  Bray Leino Software is a specialist boutique software development company who have been developing market leading software products for over 10 years. Bray Leino Software are developing a suite of highly effective web and mobile applications for the Healthcare Industry, supporting every part of the NHS continuing healthcare initiative and are currently looking for a talented and experienced Developer to join the team based in Nantwich!  What will I be doing?  This unique opportunity will involve working as part of a small, close-knit team in a modern, vibrant office. The successful candidate must be able to produce good quality code and the work produced will be clear, maintainable and testable. Furthermore, experience in the following technologies is a must:  Microsoft SQL Server Node.js Ember.js HTML CSS JavaScript (incl. OOJS) They should also have operations experience including deploying to, patching and managing Windows and Linux servers. Finally, they should have experience working under an agile methodology and have extensive Git capability.  The candidate must be able to communicate their ideas, progress, opportunities, risks and setbacks to their team and project stakeholders. They must be able to document their work including non-coding activities such as deployment and configuration. They should be able work effectively with colleagues seeing through architecture, design and QA work.  The candidate should be committed to their part in QA and will be happy to unit test their code, review the code of others and to have their code reviewed. They should be committed to best practice throughout, including on performance and security and will be happy reviewing the quality of all aspects of development work, not just code. Experience with TDD would be preferable.  Main Responsibilities:  Developing well-designed, structured, documented, secure and robust code (including debugging) within a project schedule and according to procedures determined. Create HTML/CSS/JavaScript Front End based on HTML based Application Mockup / PSD files. Front End is built using Ember 2.0 and accessing Nodejs Backend server Potential for future mobile/tablet development using Web technologies & Cordova. Additional Back End coding support as and where required. What will I need?  At least five years of experience in Web Application development. Experienced in JavaScript, JQuery, Ember, handlebars REST, Oauth2, Bootstrap, CSS3, HTML5, JSON, XML. Practice good JavaScript design patterns including MVVM, MVC. Good knowledge of the best practices in development, including coding standards, unit testing, Agile development. Knowledge of VB / MS Access would be advantageous but not essential. Key personal attributes;  Excellent analytical abilities and creative thinking. Ability to accept responsibility for arranging own tasks and priorities. Excellent attention to detail. Good communication skills and ability to confidently present own work to the team.  Bray Leino team perks 25 days holiday rising after 2 years to 29 days (plus Bank holidays) Health Cash Plan Claim back the costs of dental, optical, physio treatments and more Xmas break Office closed between Christmas and New Year The basics Company pension scheme Childcare vouchers Cycle to work scheme Refer a friend scheme Rewarding loyalty Enhanced employer pension contribution after one year's service Outstanding training and progression The extras Health plan Employee discount platform Health and wellbeing programme  About the Nantwich office Modern offices and a talented, close-knit team Development-focussed environment; creativity and innovation are encouraged We work hard to produce ingenious solutions, and we have a good time doing it How we hire We keep things simple, so our recruitment process should be quick and pain-free If we like your application, expect a call very soon You may need to visit us a couple of times to ensure you meet everyone you need to For some roles, we’ll likely ask you to show us your portfolio We like it when people want to work with us, so even if your initial application is unsuccessful, we’ll be in touch if a better suited role comes up Click here to apply Facebook twitter Linked In  Reasons to join  Life at Bray Leino
Title: Software Developer

Job_Description: Our Calgary location is currently looking for a full-time Software Developer to be part of a team that is responsible for delivering timely, high quality releases that delight our customers in the upstream oil & gas sector. You’d be designing, coding and testing enhancements to our Harmony desktop application which is mostly written in C++ but uses some C# and is looking into expanding into web technologies.  About You: You’re highly collaborative - you have an affinity for finding solutions through discussions with team members You’re a problem solver – you enjoy solving complex problems, and are comfortable exploring them even if the problem and solution are not yet well-defined You’re always improving something – whether it’s learning a new programming language, or finding better ways to do things in your team or organizationally, continuous improvement is important to you You’re practical – you assess the circumstances and make the best decision based on the facts Some of the things you’d be doing as a developer on our team: Be an active and collaborative team member as part of an agile development team of 5-9 people Design, code and test enhancements for a Windows-based desktop application written in C++ and/or C#, with SQL Server as its backend database Work closely with customer stakeholders to ensure we’re adding value for our users Work closely with other developers, for example by pair programming and participating in code reviews Troubleshoot and fix bugs Contribute to testing of user stories, features and releases Assist our customer facing support team in solving client issues, when necessary Contribute insights and suggestions as part of our continuous improvement Generally pitch in wherever needed to help get a high quality release out on time Qualifications that would make you a good fit for this role: Minimum B.Sc. in software engineering, computer engineering, computer science, or equivalent experience Experience writing code in a high-level object-oriented programming language, ideally C++ and/or C# Experience with WPF and XAML Experience with SQL Server databases Experience in web development (particularly Angular and/or React, Javascript, CSS) Familiarity with object oriented software design Experience with unit testing Familiarity with, or interest in, agile principles, values and practices   We are proud to be an EEO/AA employer M/F/Disability/Veterans. Please refer to the EEO is the Law Poster & Supplement, Right to Work and Pay Transparency Policy. IHS Markit is a participant in E-Verify (see links below). We maintain a drug-free workplace and perform pre-employment drug testing. EEO is the Law EEO is the Law Supplement Right to Work Pay Transparency Policy E-Verify   Current Colleagues If you are currently a colleague with IHS Markit please apply internally via Workday.
Title: Software Developer

Job_Description: Retsly About the role Zillow Group's Vancouver office is looking for an intermediate-senior level Backend Developer to join our talented team of engineers. We build tools and products that shape the real estate industry. This includes the chance to:  Build software solutions involving data at a massive scale Design RESTful APIs to service dozens of 3rd party applications Grow your career in a fun, fast-paced environment About the team We are a small inventive tech startup located in Yaletown, Vancouver, BC. In 2014, our rapid success quickly caught the attention of the largest real-estate marketplace of the United States, Zillow Group. Since the acquisition, we now have the resources, benefits, work-life balance, and support of a Fortune organization, but the ability to still build innovative technology, learn new things, and have a massive impact. Join us for the unique opportunity to be part of a small start-up culture while still having the stability and perks of "big corporate". Who you are 3+ years building backend software systems at scale Advanced knowledge in Javascript or other scripting languages Experience with both SQL and NoSQL databases Strong foundations in shell scripting Familiarity with Docker or other container technologies Experience provisioning Linux based AWS infrastructure Experience configuring CI/CD pipelines for containerized services Get to know us Zillow Group houses a portfolio of the largest and most vibrant real estate and home-related brands on the web and mobile. Our mission is to build the largest, most trusted and vibrant home-related marketplace in the world. Zillow Group is owned, fueled and grown by innovators who help people make better, smarter decisions around all things home. We encourage one another at every level, and our efforts are supported by employee-driven, world-class benefits that enable us to enjoy our lives outside the office while building fulfilling careers that impact millions of individuals every day.  Zillow Group is an equal opportunity employer committed to fostering an inclusive, innovative environment with the best employees. Therefore, we provide employment opportunities without regard to age, race, color, ancestry, national origin, religion, disability, sex, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, or any other protected status in accordance with applicable law. If there are preparations we can make to help ensure you have a comfortable and positive interview experience, please let us know.
Title: Software Developer

Job_Description: Job Description   Do you want to join a great team working on designing and building a suite of web and desktop apps that will drive the future of patient care? You could be part of creating the next-generation of medical apps that aspire to help emergency doctors, medical specialists, radiologists and patients through providing a real-time user experience that will contribute to increased medical provider satisfaction and better patient outcomes. Come work with us and you will have chosen to work with a smart and motivated team in a fast-paced environment that is both challenging and rewarding with opportunities to learn new technologies and grow your skills. The technologies and applications you will be researching and developing will be used by medical professionals all over the world to treat patients and deliver first class care. So, are you interested in truly making a difference? Responsibilities Design, prototype, develop, test, document, deploy and maintain desktop and/or web-based applications with backend components Refine the software to continuously improve its performance Develop a deep understanding of our client’s needs Tackle issues that may arise across the full software stack Qualifications  Key qualificationsBachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, related discipline or equivalent skills and practical industry experienceSolid understanding of web services development using Java (HTTP, REST APIs, Tomcat)Solid experience using Java in complex application development (8+ years)Good experience with core javascript and front-end web development technologies (Angular, TypeScript, HTML5, AJAX, CSS)Good experience with relational database design, SQL and design patternsExperience designing and building complex data workflows for customersKnowledgeable about building secure, scalable & resilient web applicationsKnowledge of multithreaded or event-driven programmingExperience writing unit tests and e2e testsAbility to adapt to working with a wide array of technologies and languages  Preferred qualificationsKnowledge of DICOM, HL7 and medical imaging would be an assetExperience with Unix, shell scripts, command lineExperience with PostgreSQLFamiliarity with radiology workflowsExperience with Angular, NativeScript, iOS, AndroidKnowledge of front-end build tools and package management (Node, NPM, Gulp, Grunt)Experience with AWS and/or other cloud infrastructureDetailed knowledge and understanding of cross browser, cross platform compatibility issues and workarounds Additional Information   Competitive salaries Paid time off = 30 days Corporate bonus program Employee recognition program Employee referral program Flexible hours Comprehensive insurance plan Training & skill upgrading Social events Dynamic culture
Title: SOFTWARE DEVELOPER

Job_Description: Job Description  Software Developer - Digital & Connected Healthcare Does this sound familiar? You are Passionate about Healthcare and the impact it can have on people lives. You are familiar with HIPAA regulations and have worked on projects where you had to design software for HIPAA compliance. You care about security. You might even have experience with data protection and enterprise application level security. You have dealt with cloud security and have done risk analysis and risk profiling for software applications. You have worked on medical device application requiring FDA approval where you had to double down on the quality assurance process. You understand the challenges of interoperability first-hand and looked for strategies to help you navigate this realm. You understand and might have even had first hand experience with healthcare protocols like HL7, FHIR, DICOM. You have a consultancy mindset. You are able to balance technical requirements, agile practices and business requirements like a pro. You are an expert advisor looking always for the success of your customers. You have done system design and have software architecture experience. You are adaptive to different technology stacks. You are comfortable doing research on new technologies (front and backend) and providing the guidance your clients need. You have played a significant role in a major integration project. If you relate to the above statements, join us! We are looking for a new colleague to take on the challenge of transforming the world of healthcare and making a difference in the lives of generations of people. Qualifications  Experience working in a regulated environment.  Experience with secure software development processes. Experience with designing and developing for cloud using any of the following cloud providers: AWS, Azure, Google Cloud. Operations/DevOps knowledge. Knowledge of HIPAA regulations and requirements. Deep SQL knowledge in one of the following technologies: MSSQL, MySQL, PostgresSQL. Expert level experience with at least one backend tech stack (.NET, Java, Python, NodeJS). NICE TO HAVE: Experience with the HITRUST certification process. Experience with Medical devices and FDA submissions. Experience developing software under design control, ISO 13485, IEC 62304, ISO 14971. Experience with Hospital workflows, health data integration, HL7, FHIR, CDA, CCD and integration engines (Mirth, Raphsody, Cloverleaf). Experience with EMR/EHR, PACS, RIS, DICOM, CQM and Meaningful Use Experience with standard code systems (SNOMED, ICD, etc.) Experience with pharma, insurance, hospitals Experience with Intersystems Cache, Epic, Cerner, Allscripts Additional Information  WHY MACADAMIAN?  Well we could write you a nice sales pitch but how about you check us out in action over these medias and judge for yourself how awesome we are.... http://www.macadamian.com/careers/ http://www.youtube.com/user/Macadamianglobal http://www.linkedin.com/company/macadamian-technologies https://www.facebook.com/MacadamianTech https://twitter.com/macadamianlabs
Title: Software Developer

Job_Description: Who You Are…  You're an experienced Software Developer, with more than 5 years of web application development experience, who has experience designing system architectures, including microservices and service-oriented architectures. You're comfortable collaborating in small teams to design, build and ship high-quality software and experienced in iterating in an agile fashion. You have knowledge of issues related to building Cloud infrastructures and have prior hands-on experience in developing and deploying Microservices solutions on Cloud infrastructure.  You’re comfortable working closely with designers and outside stakeholders to build both awesome UI/UX components and systems, as well as backend services and APIs that can process millions of request per day. You have experience liaising and collaborating with other departments in determining requirements and specifications.  You love to coach, lead and nurture the development of more junior developers while sharing your knowledge within the team along with the broader technical community, all the while shaping our software development culture by improving our processes and codebases.  You want to join us in using exciting new technologies to build the next generation of one of the most visible, and prominently placed components of the Hootsuite product. You are super smart and have a Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science or Engineering, or have equivalent work experience.  Read about some of the things we're doing here: http://code.hootsuite.com  You’re Great At…   Building high-volume, highly available, and distributed server applications, hence you have a portfolio of web apps you’ve played a key role in shipping Building microservices in Go and have experience with container and orchestration technologies such as Docker, Mesos, Kubernetes Experience with event-based and message-driven distributed system Working with Big Data, utilizing SQL and noSQL databases, data warehouse technologies, and familiarity with data lakes and data marts. Working with REST APIs (bonus if you’ve worked with Twitter or Facebook APIs) Creating automated test suites and ensuring quality in your code Optimizing and applying best practices  Bonus Points…   Interest in startups and passion for social media Drive to succeed in a fast pace and continuously evolving environment You have open source contributions or personal projects you’ve shipped successfully  Hootsuite is an inclusive employer. Every effort will be made to provide accommodations requested by candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process.  #LI-TG1
Title: Senior Software Developer

Job_Description: We’re here to ensure the advertising industry and the people in it are healthy and engaging positively and effectively with those around them. We’re here, ultimately, to improve the lives of people working in the media industry. And we take our responsibility seriously.  ABOUT THE PRODUCT AND ENGINEERING TEAM  At Centro, we’ve always been about making people’s lives better—from our employees to our clients. Today, we’re building a unified platform to execute every digital media advertising transaction, thus providing a new level of automation and intelligence in ad tech. This is an enormous task that will disrupt an industry and improve the lives of those who work within it.   To do this, we’re aggressively growing our team of engineers, product developers and designers. We are imaginative, passionate, determined and relentless in our efforts. Of course, we are fascinated by the complexity of engineering problems at this scale—it’s what brings bright minds together. But what keeps us coming back (and why we love coming to work everyday) is the chance to improve how work gets done: freeing up people’s time so that they can dream bigger and make life better.   Come build something amazing with us.  CORE RESPONSIBILITIES Responsible for design and execution of a complex automated testing platform of a real-time, high-throughput (>2M QPS) ecosystem Deliver optimized code and deal with interesting scalability challenges Be the voice of quality in highly collaborative agile product teams. Make sure that each deployment to production is of highest quality  QUALIFICATIONS Strong understanding of computer science fundamentals OO development, multithreading, SQL & NoSQL, micro-services architecture, and TDD Degree in Computer Science or equivalent experience Solid coding skills and experience in one or more Object Oriented programming languages: Java , C#, Scala Experience with one or more dynamic languages like Ruby, Python, or Javascript Experience with build/project management tools Experience with creating testing backend automation solutions in a big data ecosystem is a big plus Understanding of Agile SDLC OUR TEAM’S TECH STACK Development language: Java Additional coding/scripting languages: Scala, Python, Javascript, Ruby Databases: MariaDB, Redis, AeroSpike, PostgreSQL Frameworks: Jersey, Guava, Selenium Webdriver Infrastructure: Dockers, AWS, VM Big Data: HDFS, Hive, Impala, Kafka, Cassandra Services: Tomcat, Grizzly Additional technologies such as: Zookeeper, Maven, Artifactory, Git, IntelliJ, Mockito  Centro is an Equal Opportunity Employer and does not discriminate against any employee or applicant on the basis of race, gender, age, disability or any other basis protected under the law. Job_Description: Do you want to work on state of the art vehicle and IoT solutions? Join our client and be part of the adventure as a server-side (backend) development team! They are developing cloud services for both web and mobile front ends, as well as generating hardware interactions from the backend to a fleet of cloud-connected cars. They are aficionados of Agile, test-driven development and CI with an eye to CD. The software group is big on continuous improvement. Reporting to the Director of Engineering Software Development, you will design, develop and evolve end-to-end cloud services used to monitor and control some motorized vehicle behaviors. The end-to-end system is composed of in-car devices, smartphone & web apps, and backend systems. Your server-side developer background will help you guide the overall system architecture as well as actively develop the backend and interact with the frontend team. Qualifications:  Bachelor’s degree in computer science or equivalent 10 years + of professional experience in server-side software development Experience in Client-server architecture development Experience with Java based technologies Micro service architectures including Spring Boot, Spring REST & JPA Experience in design of systems using web services (REST, SOAP, XML/JSON) Experience with service-oriented architecture (SOA) Excellent communication verbal/written skills (English and French)  Pluses:  Integration of 24/7 high-availability telematics service (backend and presentation) Vehicle telematics messaging platform experience (GPS message processing, alert processing, OTA device configuration) At least one of the following: MVNO or telecom carrier network integration High volume message processing - Kafka, JMS, ActiveMQ, Camel NoSQL based message storage - NoSQL, MongoDB, DynamoDB, Cassandra o message processing, search and analytics - Elasticsearch, Hadoop Ecosystem Experience with Amazon Web Services technologies including EC2, ECS, RDS, DynamoDB, CloudWatch Experience with Docker application deployment and container management Experience with Linux Knowledge of Target Process or Jira, Confluence, SVN/Git, Jenkins Experience with Microsoft technologies (ASP.NET, IIS, C#, Visual Studio, MSSQL, etc.) Strengths and skills:  Proactive Result-oriented Organized, methodical Works well under pressure Strong analytical skills, system approach; Ability to focus on established priorities; Ability to troubleshoot, test-driven approaches/methodologies; Enjoy working as part of a dynamic team Ability to suggest/present solution approaches and reach consensus when needed; Attention to detail Able to interface with 3rd party development partners and directly with the customer technical contacts for specifications, testing, integration challenges - 10 years + of professional experience in server-side software development - Experience in Client-server architecture development - Experience with Java based technologies - Micro service architectures including Spring Boot, Spring REST & JPA - Experience in design of systems using web services (REST, SOAP, XML/JSON) - Experience with service-oriented architecture (SOA) - Excellent communication verbal/written skills (English and French)
Title: Sr. Backend Developer

Job_Description: Looking to work for an awesome team? You've come to the right place! Our developers are a tight-knit group, and we are pushing for substantial product development as we continue looking to grow the team in the next year. We value passion for quality, maintainable, and scalable code, and for building awesome products. A side benefit of developing for the restaurant industry is that once we’re done working hard, we have some great clients who can always provide amazing venues for unwinding with our close knit team.  TouchBistro is looking for a Senior Full Stack Developer here in our Toronto HQ office. Our POS system is evolving and our customers are demanding more product capabilities. As a member of our agile Technology team, you will have the chance to work on our current or next-Gen product's web features. Our current stack is ReactJS and NodeJS but if you have worked with other JavaScript frameworks that is also sufficient. The development team is poised for growth and along with that comes with many opportunities to learn different skills as well as have a growth path internally.  YOUR DAY-to-DAY  Using JavaScript, design & implement features to help our restaurant customers succeed Create Features using modern JavaScript frameworks like ReactJS on the frontend or NodeJS on the backend Keep Up-to-Date with best practices and tooling from the JavaScript community Fearlessly Collaborate with your team to solve problems and learn from failures  ALL ABOUT YOU  Knowledge of modern JavaScript, HTML5, CSS3 Experience building production web applications using modern JavaScript frameworks like Angular, Node or React Exposure to a backend language (we use Node, but Java, Ruby on Rails, Python, etc. is also acceptable) Some exposure to SQL or NoSQL databases Test Driven Development Experience working on teams in an agile-scrum environment  WHY CHOOSE US?  TouchBistro is an award-winning iPad Point of Sale system, built for restaurant people by restaurant people. We’re a team of thinkers, builders, doers, and innovators. While many of us have experience working at restaurants, some of us just have a true passion for the industry.  We’re venture backed by some of the best tech VCs in the world and are partnered with top innovators in the mobile, food, and payment industries.  We’re global and growing! TouchBistro is used in more than 100 countries worldwide and has offices in NYC, Austin, Chicago, London and headquarters in Toronto. We’re a fast-moving, ever-evolving company on a mission to change the way restaurateurs do business and help them succeed through our products and services, but we need talented, passionate people to help!  So, what do you say? Are you ready to become part of something awesome?  TouchBistro believes in fostering an inclusive workplace where all individuals have an opportunity to succeed. Requests for accommodation due to a disability can be made at any stage of the recruitment process.
Title: Senior Full Stack Developer

Our exceptional team consist of experts in every functional area of business and they are the key to our position as leaders in content delivery. We strive to innovate on a daily basis to ensure we continue to grow and create new revenue opportunities and cutting edge technology. If you are passionate about taking your career to the next level, then join the MindGeek team and be a part of something big. Excellent analysis, problem-solving and communication skills Ability to work independently as well as in a team Ability to deal with constantly changing technical priorities Strong command of the English language. Spoken French. What we offer: Competitive compensation Stay sharp by taking part at one of our Hackathons, Engineering retreats, Lunch & Learns or Leadership Seminars. Free breakfast daily as well as monthly lunches Flex time and summer hour schedule A 500$ fitness allowance Epic parties throughout the year including summer BBQ, Halloween costume party, Holiday bash and 5 a 7s Opportunity to give back to the community through our Pay it Forward Program, Ronald Macdonald House visits and supporting the MindGeek Scholarship Fund for Dans la Rue A chance to work with a first-class team ! We thank all applicants for their interest, however only candidates under consideration will be contacted. No telephone calls please. No agency calls or emails.

Job_Description: Our purpose and our reach, your opportunity. Top Hat is revolutionizing the world of higher education. We are the leading teaching platform that professors use to create an active learning environment. Using Top Hat, professors can transform students' smartphones and laptops into tools of engagement, leading to increased attendance, higher grades, and a more effective lecture experience. More recently, Top Hat launched its own interactive textbook authoring platform and marketplace—you can read about the financing round we just raised to drive this initiative over at Bloomberg. We aim to be the premier way for professors to interact with students both in and out of the classroom.  Top Hat is used and adored by over 750 universities and over 2 million students worldwide. As we set our sights on increasing adoption of our products to all 4000+ post-secondary institutions in North America, we need to grow our cross-functional Growth team. We need a Full Stack Developer who can surpass our business targets by developing features and experimenting with different techniques.  Where are you right now? You are part of a growth team or are building a user pipeline on your own right now. You love what you do but you are seeking more professional and personal satisfaction. You want to join a fast growing company with purpose where you can see the difference your work is making.  You may not have expertise in our particular programming languages or technologies. That’s OK. What’s important to Top Hat is solid computer science fundamentals, passion, the ability to learn quickly, and your drive for professional growth. As a key member of our growing development team you will: Experiment. Create growth initiatives based on our extensive usage data. Experiment with new features and avenues for growing our user base. Provide solutions to exciting new challenges. Collaborate. Work with a dynamic, cross-functional group of people including marketing, product management, UX and an exec level leader on both definition and execution against the growth roadmap (Our backend is a REST API built with Django. Our frontend framework is React. Everything runs in a high-availability setup on AWS, with MySQL.) Engage. Build and retain our user base through multiple campaigns and outreach methods. Some of the reasons we attract great people: The impact you will make extends beyond just the success of the company but the prosperity of the education environment. We work in a collaborative team-oriented atmosphere. We have a very good business and strong revenue growth. You will be exposed to all-aspects of a business past start-up mode and scaling quickly. We’re just the right size. Top Hat isn’t a megacorp nor are we a small ‘cowboy’ shop. We are just the right size for individuals that want stability but don’t want to be a number. We offer mentorship and meaningful work. Leadership opportunities. Whether it’s leading people, products or projects, our growth translates into new positions for those that are motivated. What you will bring to Top Hat: The technical skills. You have comfort with most of the following: Web development technologies and tools Automated unit and integration testing A/B Testing Data analytics Integrating in-house systems with marketing automation systems About Top Hat: Top Hat’s interactive, cloud-based teaching platform enables professors to engage students inside and outside the classroom with compelling content, tools and activities. Millions of students at 700 leading North American colleges and universities use the Top Hat teaching platform. Headquartered in Toronto, Top Hat has been operating profitably since its 2009 launch. We have a vibrant culture of brilliant people who are innovators, thinkers, and creative geniuses. We believe in defying the status quo and we want smart people like you to join us.  The life of a Top Hatter also comes with other sweet perks too:Outstanding company culture, with a team that is super smart and motivated to be a part of a company that is changing the face of education.We offer breakfast and catered lunch every day!Conveniently located at Bloor and Avenue, near 3 TTC stations.We are one of the top education technology companies in North America (named Fastest 50 Growing Companies by Deloitte Consulting!)Our dress code is casual.  Top Hat welcomes and encourages applications from people with disabilities. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process.
Title: Growth Developer

Job_Description: Our client is the leader in mobile consumer products that enhance the personal safety of millions of users. Our services are used by millions of monthly paying subscribers worldwide. Our engineers work closely with major device manufacturers, platform providers and network operators worldwide to provide cutting-edge solutions leveraging remote mobile device locator and management tools. Our company is redefining the market with a refreshing take on location services and the way in which mobile devices are managed.About this RoleWe are looking for a Backend Engineer to build the next generation of our products. Your primary focus will be the development of server-side logic, API definition, leveraging our Big Data and Machine Learning infrastructure to generate, serve new insights and drive engagement with our customers, optimization of the existing systems, and ensuring high performance and responsiveness that power our flagship mobile apps and various backend services. This position will work closely with product, design, devOps and the mobile engineering team located in Ottawa.Join us as we scale our products to add millions of new users while simultaneously meeting some of the strictest SLAs with our partners. You will help evolve our architecture by building on great technologies like Cloudinary, NewRelic, MapBox, AWS, Docker, Kubernetes, Spinnaker, Branchio, TeamCity, Fabric, Loggly, DataDog, Grafana, Kafka, Riak and more.What We're Looking For: 3-5 years of proven industry experience working on the backend services or infrastructure for a large-scale, highly distributed mobile and web applications.Strong Java and Python with OOP (Object-Oriented Programming, RESTful APIs, Swagger, JSON) experience and proficient with version control such as GitHub, SVN, P4.Proficient in working with Linux, Shell scripting, Database, data transformation and Cloud-based technologies such as AWS, OpenStack, or Google Cloud.Solid understanding of fundamental design principles behind a scalable application.Passionate about the architecture, automated testing framework including unit tests, quality, and performance of the applications your team builds.Comprehensive understanding of the full stack and have owned the development, build, testing and release process.Continuous incorporation of new and creative technical solutions to improve your products.Will require training in the U.S.Solid communication skills.Tech We UseBackend:  Java with Spring and Hibernate, or Python with Flask and SQLAlchemy.Database:  MySQL, AWS DynamoDB, RDS, Redshift, and ElastiCache.Data:  Percona, Redis, RabbitMQ, Kafka and Riak to flow and persist our dataInfrastructure:  Kubernetes, Spinnaker, Terraform, Ansible, Docker, and CloudWatch /Nagios to keep our production systems running on-premise and in AWS.Metrics:  Elasticsearch-Logstash-Kibana, Graphite, InfluxDB, Grafana, and Amplitude to help understand our usersContinuous Integration:  We use Jenkins, TeamCity to build our software and Crucible extensively for code review.Job Type: ContractExperience:software development: 3 yearsLocation:Ottawa, ONLicence:valid passport

This is a once-in-a-lifetime opportunity to help shape the future of sport analysis, coaching and media storytelling.What you'll do: - Collaborating with the product design team to iteratively define, design and implement the SPORTLOGiQ's next generation hockey analysis web application.- Owning the front end software design and architecture.-Building reusable code and libraries- Working effectively with the software development team to ensure front end requirements are properly met by the application backend.What you'll need: - Minimum 5+ years' experience as a Front end Developer, Web Developer or similar Web UI related role.- Significant experience of web markup, including HTML5, CSS3 and animation primitives.- Significant experience of client-side scripting and JavaScript frameworks, including jQuery.- Significant experience building cross-browser applications, deep knowledge of compatibility issues and ways to work around them.- Good understanding of asynchronous request handling, partial page updates, and AJAX, as well as AngularJS, D3.js and HTML5 media playback APIs.- Proficient understanding of code versioning tools, such as Git.- Understanding of server-side CSS pre-processing platforms, such as LESS or SASS.- Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, or Computer Engineering.- Passion for sports a plus!What we offer: Extremely competitive salary/bonus programCentralized and accessible location in trendy Mile-EndCompetitive benefits packageFlexible work scheduleJob Type: Full-timeEducation:Bachelor's

Job_Description: Description:   About Us\:  The AIR MILES® Rewards Program has earned the trust and support of more than two-thirds of Canadian households. For over two decades, we have helped our Partners use Canada’s most widely accepted loyalty currency, AIR MILES® reward miles, to influence customer behavior, drive profitability, and build long-term relationships.  Check us out – LoyaltyOne on Stack Overflow | LinkedIn | Glassdoor | Facebook |Twitter  Engineering Team Culture\:  We are polyglots\: We believe in using the best tech stack for the job. We’ve written scripts in Python and built APIs in Scala, Java, Akka, and Node.js. We deploy everything to the Cloud.  We pair program\: You pick your machine\: Windows or Mac. Our floors are open space with no cubicles or private offices, regularly pair programming and mobbing when working. Teams have hack days at least once a month when they take a break to work on anything they want, and most of the time their creations end up in our production environment. Communication is key to our approach, and we don't want to hinder it with walls, real or metaphorical.  We are Agile\: Development methodologies mean different things to different people. For us? We have a story card wall and release a few times a week. We keep the team in sync with daily stand-ups and have a retrospective once a month to discuss things that are going well and opportunities for improvements. We surround teams with everything they need, Scrum Masters to coach us on the process, Product Owners to make sense of the work, Pod Leaders to help with our careers and Competency Leads to facilitate technical design and provide mentorship in advanced technical skills.  Types of projects we work on\:   As part of the AM Next team, you will be building the next generation Air Miles Reward Program platform. This new Cloud-based platform will focus on quality and security while providing massive data scalability and real-time data ingestion, processing, and consumption. We are finding new ways of working that allow us to continuously improve delivery of value with high levels of cadence and quality.   Qualification:  What we look for in you\:  Ability and desire to work in our collaborative environment\: open team room, pair programming and fluid interactions with all products and operations teams  Focusing on building solutions utilizing an agile approach; leveraging close relationships with Product Managers, communicating and digesting real-time feedback, and working smart to build story cards on daily basis  You have experience building large scale distributed systems, based on reactive principles, that are flexible, loosely-coupled and scalable  You believe that Cloud is the future and you have experience managing some of them - AWS, Azure, Google Cloud Platform or IBM Cloud  We know there are endless tools and technologies, and we don’t expect you to come in as an expert on everything, but you are looking forward to experimenting and learning.  Air Miles Perks\:  Hack Days\: one day a month you work on projects that interest you to improve your craft   Training\: from hackathons to conferences, to instructor lead, building your competency is our priority About LoyaltyOne  LoyaltyOne is part of the successful Alliance Data family of companies that provide the full range of data-driven loyalty, marketing and credit solutions in more than 80 locations across the globe.  Working with more than 100 leading brands in the retail, financial services, grocery, petroleum retail, travel and hospitality industries to profitably change customer behavior. Through a team of businesses, including one of the leading coalition loyalty programs in the world, the AIR MILES® Reward Program, LoyaltyOne designs, delivers and manages a suite of services focused on consumer data, customer-centric retail strategies, direct-to-consumer marketing, loyalty consulting and more.   LoyaltyOne has broadened its horizons geographically by growing Precima in the European market. With the recent acquisition of BrandLoyalty in the Netherlands, LoyaltyOne has gained the expertise of a global leader in short-term loyalty campaigns, along with a client network that extends throughout Europe and Asia.     About ADS   Alliance Data® (NYSE\: ADS) is a leading global provider of data-driven marketing and loyalty solutions serving large, consumer-based industries. The Company creates and deploys customized solutions, enhancing the critical customer marketing experience; the result is measurably changing consumer behavior while driving business growth and profitability for some of today's most recognizable brands. Alliance Data helps its clients create and increase customer loyalty through solutions that engage millions of customers each day across multiple touch points using traditional, digital, mobile and emerging technologies. An S&P 500 and Fortune 500 company headquartered in Plano, Texas, Alliance Data consists of three businesses that together employ more than 16,000 associates at approximately 100 locations worldwide. www.alliancedata.com    Alliance Data is an Employment Opportunity employer. Accordingly, we will make reasonable accommodations to respond to the needs of people with disabilities in accordance with legislation.  Alliance Data participates in E-Verify.

You will help evolve our architecture by building on great technologies like Cloudinary, NewRelic, MapBox, AWS, Docker, Kubernetes, Spinnaker, Branchio, TeamCity, Fabric, Loggly, DataDog, Grafana, Kafka, Riak and more.What We're Looking For: 3-5 years of proven industry experience working on the backend services or infrastructure for a large-scale, highly distributed mobile and web applications.Strong Java and Python with OOP (Object-Oriented Programming, RESTful APIs, Swagger, JSON) experience and proficient with version control such as GitHub, SVN, P4.Proficient in working with Linux, Shell scripting, Database, data transformation and Cloud-based technologies such as AWS, OpenStack, or Google Cloud.Solid understanding of fundamental design principles behind a scalable application.Passionate about the architecture, automated testing framework including unit tests, quality, and performance of the applications your team builds.Comprehensive understanding of the full stack and have owned the development, build, testing and release process.Continuous incorporation of new and creative technical solutions to improve your products.Will require training in the U.S.Solid communication skills.Tech We UseBackend:  Java with Spring and Hibernate, or Python with Flask and SQLAlchemy.Database:  MySQL, AWS DynamoDB, RDS, Redshift, and ElastiCache.Data:  Percona, Redis, RabbitMQ, Kafka and Riak to flow and persist our dataInfrastructure:  Kubernetes, Spinnaker, Terraform, Ansible, Docker, and CloudWatch /Nagios to keep our production systems running on-premise and in AWS.Metrics:  Elasticsearch-Logstash-Kibana, Graphite, InfluxDB, Grafana, and Amplitude to help understand our usersContinuous Integration:  We use Jenkins, TeamCity to build our software and Crucible extensively for code review.Job Type: ContractExperience:software development: 3 yearsLocation:Ottawa, ONLicence:valid passport

Job_Description: Are you passionate about emerging technologies and Virtual Reality? Do you want to be part of an expanding project to help like-minded individuals share this content? Secret Location is looking for a Full Stack Developer to join one of our projects, Vusr, a white-label solution for the distribution of VR video and immersive content (check it out here: https://www.vusr.co/). Vusr is a one-of-a-kind, made-in-house product with an innovative and collaborate team who has an avid interest in pushing the leading edge on new VR technology.  The platform includes a web-based CMS dashboard and customizable apps for iOS, Android, Gear VR, Daydream, Oculus Rift, HTC Vive, PSVR, Apple TV and web platforms, with more to be added in future. This role would focus on the CMS for the product, including implementation of new features in the dashboard, and providing back-end support for the Vusr applications.  Responsibilities  Working from the existing code base, implement new features, revisions and improvements to the Vusr CMS, web applications and server backend that powers these. This may include:  CMS dashboard (front-end): Build pages or components for new features  Implement revisions from UX audits  Implement styling updates from visual QA passes  Vusr back-end: Update data model and provide server side support for new features and user-facing elements  Create database schemas that represent and support new and existing features  Work with the app development team to ensure the integration of CMS and front-end apps evolves as changes are made  Ensure security and data protection  Implement automated testing platforms and unit tests  Overall: Writing reusable, testable, and efficient code that enables low-latency, highly available, and scalable applications  Assist with scoping and breaking out tasks for new features  Work to weekly sprint plan in Jira  Make revisions based on client requests or user testing  Evaluate, profile, and implement bug fixes  Requirements  Main Languages needed  Javascript (ES5 & ES6)  Stylus, or other CSS preprocessor  Jade, EJS, or other markup templating languages  Main Frameworks needed  Node.js and related support libraries (eg. Express)  AngularJS 1.x - 4.x  Main Tools used / needed  AWS   DynamoDB S3 Cloudfront Elastic Transcoder  NPM  Gulp  Github  Jenkins  Atlassian: Jira/Confluence  Agile development  Nice to have experience  Customizing CMS frameworks  Video player or streaming apps, particularly 360 / 3D video  Adaptive Video Streaming in HTML5 - libdash and/or HLS  Virtual reality projects and platforms, eg. iOS & Android for Google Cardboard, Google Daydream, Samsung Gear VR, Oculus Rift, HTC Vive, PlayStation VR  Gulp for build automation  Jenkins for Continuous Integration  WebGL and Canvas  Google Analytics or Crashlytics  Sketch  What you’ll be a part of:  Taking care: competitive health and dental coverage (for full-time employees) Investing in your future: employee stock option purchase plan, and local defined contribution pension plans Break time: free snacks, winter holiday office closures, reduced hours in summer Party time: office bar carts, after work drinks, holiday and summer parties, and sometimes just because Be inspired: regular film screenings, concerts, and opportunity to get involved in industry events The office: modern facilities, in house screening rooms, more snacks, and swag Build a better world: transcend entertainment to our corporate social responsibility activities. Title: Senior Software Developer (Backend)

Job_Description: The ACL Impact ACL exists to help make the world a safer and more ethical place. Our software has been used by a national agency to help track down missing children, by banks to find suspicious patterns in their data, and by a state agency to identify money laundering fronts for a drug cartel. ACL has been at the heart of investigations that have helped save millions of dollars of fraud, waste and even saved lives… talk about making an impact!  The ACL R&D Team  The R&D team extends beyond the walls of ACL and stands on the shoulders of giants. We use the innovation of technology partners like Amazon, select OEMs, and the Open Source Community to ensure we’re meeting our challenges with the most current and effective technologies. We give back by contributing time, code and support to our engineers and across the community.  To understand more about software development at ACL, read Landing your Software Engineering Dream Job. To look through the window into R&D, check out our blog or read these articles: Inside ACL R&D Part I — Brigades, and R&D Baymax Team Spirit.  As a DevOps shop, we own what we build. We do not pass it off to others. We maintain it. We continually work to reduce the time required to build and safely deploy software. Security, integrity and performance are not an afterthought. They are built into our development process. We design for growing use. We use tools to continually scan our code base and stay current on patches and upgrades. If a serious vulnerability is discovered we pause everything else and immediately resolve it.  We have a product development group of 70+ and counting (the company has over 300 employees and counting). We work in small “brigades” comprised of 5 or so Software Engineers, 2 QA Engineers, a Manager, a UX Designer, UX Developer and a Product Manager. It’s our version of a scrum team.  The Challenge Ahead We're searching for a Software Engineer who has full stack web development experience to expand our existing suite of cloud based applications. We're looking for someone with proven knowledge in building high performing data driven applications from the database design, layering backend application concerns, designing APIs, and connecting them with the latest UI frameworks.  What Will You Get Out of This?  An amazing dynamic startup environment within a financially stable company (did we mention we just celebrated our 30th anniversary?)Some of the best benefits in the industry (asking for more information can be a great first question for us in the interview process).Working with an awesome team of professional software engineers with plenty of room to learn and grow.  What You Will Bring to ACL You are a solid full stack developer who has extensive experience delivering high availability, secure, fault tolerant largescale solutions using either Ruby on Rails or NodeJS. You have solid experience modelling database relationships, know what's needed to grow a codebase without growing technical debt, have designed APIs for performance and ease of use, and understand how it all fits with the latest UI frameworks like React or Angular You eat code for breakfast and lunch, and munch on software architecture blogs and books for dinner. When you wake up in the morning you usually have a solution to a complex problem in your head and you can't wait to get to the office to code it and share it with your teammates. You love to mentor others and get great joy from seeing others grow and learn.  Skills For Success at ACL  You have a Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, or equivalent experience.You have at least 2 years of professional experience delivering large-scale, high availability, secure web applications in an agile environment.You have up-to-date knowledge on the state of modern Javascript tools and frameworks.You have experience building and consuming RESTful APIs, working with relational databases and SQL.You care deeply about code quality, are a TDD ninja, and detest having bugs slip through to production.You are passionate about learning and continuous improvement.You have creative ideas, a collaborative attitude and strong work ethic.  Bonus You are actively involved in local meetups and open source project contributions we can look at on Github.
Title: Software Engineer (Full Stack)

Job_Description: About Us: Stellar is redefining the world of private aviation, a $30B+ industry in dire need of new, cutting-edge technology, full of fleet operators striving for a better way to run their businesses and highly-discerning customers looking for a better travel experience. Our people are what will make this exciting transformation possible by developing innovative technology and facilitating its use. Stellar alone has the unique potential to dominate the industry and, in the process, more than double its current size.  Responsibilities: Our Java engineers utilize innovative algorithms to create products that drive our business and reinvent an industry. We are looking for a top Senior Core Java Developer to play a leading role in our development team. Our platform will be used by private jet operators, across the world, to manage their entire business operation so it needs to be performant and fault tolerant.  Who We're Looking For:  You are passionate about technology You make your team better You are highly motivated, with excellent communication skills You have rigorous attention to detail and ask tough questions You bring practical thinking to the fast-paced start-up environment You have fun at work and think jets are awesome  Your Background:  BS in Computer Science or equivalent 4+ years of core Java experience 1+ years writing robust applications using Spring Framework (Boot, Cloud, Security, MVC, Streams, etc) or equivalent JEE framework Strong understanding of object oriented programming and domain driven design Agile development experience using Scrum/Kanban  Nice to Haves:  Experience with full stack development Knowledge of and experience with Microservice architecture and tools Hands on experience with distributed multi-tenant cloud native applications, their design and challenges. Experience with Netflix OSS stack (Eureka, Zuul, Ribbon, Feign) Experience with messaging driven services using AMQP/RabbitMQ/Kafka  Perks:  Flexible vacation policy Competitive salary & equity based on experience Comprehensive health, dental, and vision coverage Paid Parental Leave Life and AD&D; insurance EAP Snacks, Drinks and Lunches* Company Social Events Get in on the ground floor of a highly-collaborative, rapidly growing start-up disrupting the aviation industry  Note: Currently we offer in-office lunches 3 times a week. All perks are subject to change in company discretion.

Title: PHP Developer

Job_Description: We’re on a mission to build the relationship-focused bank of the future and we’re looking for the passionate collaborators, innovators, advisors, and leaders who can get us there. Our distinct culture is built on a shared commitment to do what’s right for our clients, our people, and our communities, and we strive for excellence in everything we do. Because life at CIBC is not only what you do, but how you do it.  To learn more about CIBC, please visit CIBC.com  What You’ll Be Doing  You’ll be at the heart of CIBC’s digital transformation, successfully delivering complex, enterprise-scale mobile projects involving multiple back-end systems. As a Solution Designer - Microservices within CIBC's Personal and Small Business Technology department, you will build, implement and maintain easy, flexible, and personalized solutions that enhance the client experience across both iOS and Android. You’ll lead the planning and strategy for the technical design, development and integration of these applications.  How You’ll Succeed Design and Development: Perform and coordinate complex application programming activities. Design the application's technical infrastructure using specific databases, programming languages, utilities, and testing approaches. Lead the design and development of cost-effective and innovative solutions. Strategic Planning: Develop multi-year technology roadmaps that align with the bank’s vision, strategy, and business objectives. Lead multiple complex projects involving backend systems, new technology, and the enhancement of existing applications. Leadership Skills: Act as the mobile development team lead and run code-review sessions with the wider team to ensure the project is on track to meet objectives. Support and mentor intermediate and senior developers by sharing knowledge, collaborating and problem solving.  Who You Are You can demonstrate experience in: Microservices application architecture, as well as FullStack application development (Web, Angular, React, NodeJS, MongoDB). You are familiar with development, deployment and integration of applications in Cloud environments (MS Azure, AWS, Docker, Kubernetes). It is an advantage if you have an understanding of Machine Learning principles You embrace and champion change. You'll continuously evolve your thinking and the way you work in order to deliver your best. Your influence makes an impact. You know that relationships and networks are essential to success. You inspire outcomes by making yourself heard. You’re digitally savvy. You seek out innovative solutions and embrace evolving technologies. You can easily adapt to new tools and trends. Job_Description: It’s your experience that countsRise is Canada’s complete HR-Payroll-Benefits solution that gives businesses everything they need to build loyal and productive teams — all in one place.When you step through our doors, you’ll discover a workplace that brings people together to innovate and succeed. That’s why Rise is on a mission to dominate the people-management software market with powerful software that is a cut above the rest. Rise provides an experience that is unique in our market by focusing on modern, intuitive software and an outstanding client experience.We are seeking a full stack software developer with at least three years of experience to work on the RESTful API services that power our front-end applications. The developer should be strongly familiar with Angular and Rails or a similar framework.As an engineering organization, we always choose to get things done right over getting them done fast. We strongly believe that research and experimentation is fundamental to producing high-quality software and are not afraid to challenge conventional wisdom. We are looking for people who share these values and are strongly consistent with their own.Here’s what you’ll be doing#1) Build a Winning PlatformYou’ll work directly with the Senior Backend Software Developer and the development team to execute on the product plan for the Rise platform. Using your extensive knowledge of software architecture, you’ll build product enhancements to the platform, improve the architecture, and develop, debug and design software applications and databases.#2) Collaborate with the Development TeamYou’ll collaborate with the development team in the design, development, test, deployment and operation of the Rise platform. As a full stack software developer, you’ll deliver fast and predictable results, adjusting in an agile fashion to provide what our customers need.#3) Ensure Operational ExcellenceYou have a proven track record of operational success with a high attention to detail. You’ll ensure sanity of architecture, operational excellence, and quality while delivering results on time.Your qualificationsMinimum 3 years of experience building softwareDeep full-stack knowledge of client, server, tools, and internet technologiesIntermediate to advanced level experience with JS/HTML/CSS and RoR/PHPStrong working knowledge of frontend frameworks and libraries (Angular, Bootstrap, Foundation, WebPack, Grunt)Experience in agile methodologies with scrumBachelors in Computer Science or Engineering or equivalent experienceExceptional verbal and written communication skillsExceptional attention to detail and organizational skillsDeeply collaborative and enjoy working in a cross-departmental fashionDriven and entrepreneurial, yet open and approachableWilling to roll up sleeves and do whatever needs to be done to make this a great place to workTechnical knowledge and mobile app development expertise is a bonusJob Type: Full-timeExperience:building software: 3 yearsEducation:Bachelor's

Job_Description: Netcoins is actively hiring to expand and build a world-class software engineering team right here in Vancouver.We're looking for ambitious senior software engineers, software developers, software engineering team leads / architects.Founded in 2014, Netcoins is a market leader in the Bitcoin space with its flagship Virtual Bitcoin ATM software for selling Bitcoin in retail stores, and also via peer-to-peer networks. We make buying Bitcoin easier than ever, and our system is relied on by merchants across Canada (and internationally) to sell bitcoin to their customers. Netcoins also operates a Bitcoin brokerage to service investor clients and institutions.Bitcoin has seen a breakout year in 2017-18 and it's just getting started. Netcoins is undergoing hyper-growth and we need creative entrpreneurial-minded engineers that are keen on building and scaling a products that are already “in the wild” with a large customer base. There is work both on scaling and hardening existing products and also lots of R&D; work on building new projects.You will have direct input and influence in the creative process and direction of product development and work directly with the management team. We're looking for engineers confident in their ability to take on responsiblity and launch great software products. You'll be vital to propelling the company forward while being part of a cohesive and passionate engineering team that loves to solve challenges.Plus your friends will be able to visit stores that use your software!You are an engineer that enjoys brainstormining and debating new features, functionality and ways to improve usability, security, sales and performance. As a senior engineer, ideally you have worked on projects that exposed you to:- Leading a software development project- Software design and architecture with security best-practices- Front and backend development on SaaS software products- Working with cloud servers (AWS), and design architecture / backups / system monitoring etc- Comfortable with version control systems- Working on R&D; software dev projects and on mission critical / live software- Working with a team of engineers / developersCompetitive compensation, stock options, flexible work environment and benefits are all part of the package. Join us today for a very rare opportunity to be part of Bitcoin's future!Job Type: Full-timeLocation:Vancouver, BCLanguage:English
