Title: Web Developer

Job_Description: Opening: Lead Full-Stack Software Engineer (Product Team - WebDev)  Who we are  DeepLearni.ng is a technology company transforming the way enterprises work with AI around the world. Based in Toronto, we work with enterprise leaders to collaboratively build and deploy customized AI systems that solve real business problems. DeepLearni.ng’s creation of enterprise AI systems is powered by our end-to-end platform Frontiers, designed to optimize team collaboration on enterprise AI systems.  We are also an active player in the AI community, and have partnerships with industry leaders including NVIDIA, the Vector Institute and Amazon Web Services. In 2017, we were named AI Company of the Year by the DFI Institute and received Series A funding.  A few examples of our work: Reinforcement learning for the credit risk areas of retail banking Image classification for insurance adjudication and claims processing Self-optimizing environmental controls for vertical farming Machine vision for robot warehouse navigation  What is the opportunity?  DeepLearni.ng is looking for a Lead Full-Stack Software Engineer for our Product Engineering Team who is passionate about code craftsmanship, continuous improvement and agile development. Experience crafting web applications using Python, specifically Flask, JavaScript, HTML, CSS and extremely strong unit testing are a must.  Working with a diverse range of technologies and clients across industry verticals, you will have the opportunity to become a leading expert in delivering transformative machine learning solutions to industry designed for real-world results. As part of a vibrant and growing team, you will be at the frontier of the AI revolution.  What will you do?  Contribute to the product’s vision and goals, as well as technical strategy Lead the team in building a best-in-class machine learning platform and related tools Oversee an exceptional group of engineers with a strong team-oriented culture Provide technical leadership to drive the design and deployment of extremely large Machine Learning as a Service web applications and suite of products Develop functional product prototypes in support of marketing, sales, and UX research and discovery efforts Debug, troubleshoot and fix issues across multiple browsers Actively take part in evangelism activities: e.g. giving tech talks, running webinars, leading internal hack-a-thons and coordinating lunch & learns / DoJos Mentor the professional development of each direct report through personal and performance management and coaching  What do you need to succeed?  Must have: 7+ years of proven experience as a Full-Stack Software Engineer/Developer delivering low latency websites or single page applications 2+ years of progressive leadership experience directing high visibility initiatives Expertise in web development and related technologies, using frameworks such as ReactJS or AngularJS Experience developing backend services in Python Flask or Ruby Demonstrable experience with agile/SCRUM or similar methodologies for continuous development of product and technology An Engineering, Computer Science, Physics, Math, or similar degree Penchant for great algorithm design and strong CS fundamentals Strong passion for QA, usability and accessibility Maniacal about TDD fundamentals, including experience with Gherkin language syntax Ability to work on a diverse team or with a diverse range of people, and in a rapidly changing multi-disciplinary work environment  Nice to have: Experience delivering solutions at scale based on a variety of cloud and on-premises services (in the datacenter, AWS, Google, Azure, Digital Ocean, etc.) Knowledge of deployment and continuous integration platforms such as Docker, Puppet, Chef, Ansible, Kubernetes, Mesos, Jenkins, TeamCity or Gitlab CI Experience with high-growth technology companies, and in organizations that know how to compete and win Entrepreneurial and collaborative, able to operate effectively at a high level but also hands-on, execution-oriented, and capable of getting things done quickly Able to translate a long-term vision into a near-term, executable plan, including prioritizing and triaging effectively, deciding which projects to deliver first Demonstrable machine learning experience and knowledge Ensure community reach, having lead meetups, webinars, hacks, etc. Contributions to open-source or personal projects  What’s in it for you?  Work with purpose: contribute to deploying machine learning models that drive real business impact across industry verticals Opportunity to work with leading machine learning experts on cutting-edge problems Opportunities to develop relationships with a variety of industry decision-makers, subject-matter experts, software developers, and machine learning specialists  Split time between your work duties and pursuing personal machine learning passion projects with mentoring from our machine learning experts Participate in feats of strength and lively company events that build your career toolkit while also enjoying a work-life balance  Enjoy a comfortable company work environment located in downtown Toronto that encourages self-expression, creativity, honesty, and learning Amazing quality of life benefits: healthy snacks, gym memberships, travel accommodations, great health benefits, and more! Stock options possible after you have proven your impact on the job As needed: sponsorship for work visas  How to apply  We look forward to receiving your application! Please apply directly online by sending your resume and cover letter addressed to the Hiring Manager. Please note that we will be in touch with applicants that make it to the next phase of the interview process directly.  By submitting your CV and application to this role, you authorize DeepLearni.ng to store your information in our internal recruitment database and to reach out to you as necessary for the purpose of further evaluating your qualifications for this or other career opportunities at the company.  We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.
Title: Lead Full-Stack Software Engineer

Job_Description: Requisition ID: 25859 The Digital Factory is an innovation hub with a clear and well-supported mandate to transform the way banking technology is delivered, by re-imaging the customer experience, to deliver new digital value propositions. We have the support and experience of one of the world’s largest banks behind us and a talented, and growing, team of industry leaders driving us forward. Do you want to help us reinvent how people bank? At the Scotiabank Digital Factory, we are passionate about transforming the customer experience. We're looking to fill our team with influencers, makers, creators and leaders who are flexible, curious, adventurous, versatile and responsive; and who are ready to roll up their sleeves in a collaborative and productive environment to get things done. As the Backend Java Developer, you'll be working on a Scrum team that is modernizing all of our services, building microservices on the cloud.  Are you the right person for this role? You're not afraid to challenge the status quo You have a deep pride in quality craftsmanship, with user-centered design, that delights customers You're able to pivot and adapt to change You spend your free time tinkering with new technologies or building apps on the side You want to find a solution to real-life problems that will flip the multi-billion dollar financial industry on its head High aptitude for diving in, taking ownership and picking up new things Eager to mentor, teach and share your ideas in a team environment Open and transparent communication, including the ability to distill technical details into human terms  Do you have the skills that will enable you to succeed in this role? Experience programming in Java Experience building scalable, enterprise-level technology stacks and web applications Experience with any database, SQL and/or NoSQL Experience with software architecture design and security design Experience in leading a group of 3-5 software developers for software implementation  What's in it for you? We have an inclusive and collaborative working environment that encourages creativity, curiosity, and celebrates success! We provide you with the tools and technology needed to create beautiful customer experiences Dress codes don't apply here, being comfortable does You'll get to work with and learn from diverse industry leaders, who have hailed from top technology companies around the world This isn't your typical "corporate" job. We work hard and we have fun! We offer a competitive total rewards package that includes a base salary, a performance bonus, company matching programs (on pension & profit sharing), 4 weeks of vacation, personal & sick days, paternity/maternity leave top-ups and much more. Location(s): Canada : Ontario : Toronto As Canada’s international bank, we are a leader when it comes to inclusion. Scotiabankers hail from over 120 countries, speak more than 100 languages and serve over 23 million customers globally. As a highly diverse company, we know that an inclusive environment for employees and customers helps everyone achieve their best. We value the unique skills and experiences each individual brings to the bank, and are committed to creating and maintaining an inclusive and accessible environment for everyone. Candidates selected for an interview will be contacted directly. If you require accommodation during the recruitment and selection process, please let us know. We will work with you to provide a positive recruitment experience.
Title: Senior Java Developer, Digital Factory

Job_Description: SigFig is tearing down the barriers to investing. We've raised $60 million to support our growth as the #1 Online Investment Advisor for large Financial Institutions. To meet the rapidly growing demand and interest in our investment solution, we have recently set-up a development center in Calgary. Come join a fast growing San Francisco based-company and help build SigFig Calgary’s team. Help us define the next generation of investing!  As a Software Engineer at SigFig, you will work with a team of brilliant developers to build solutions that analyze billions in investor assets, running complex algorithms and recommendations software to help people make better investment decisions. You’ll help us Platformize (yes that’s a word) our code, build high-impact features, and make it more easily configurable and customizable for a diverse set of needs. It’s not easy, but it’s an incredible opportunity for people who like technical, people and business challenges.  WHAT YOU'LL BE DOING:  Design, develop, test, deploy and maintain services around SigFig’s Wealth Management Platform. Integrate SigFigs Wealth Management systems into a diverse set of third-party enterprise systems. Interact with engineering members across the organization to ensure consistency in engineering practices and foster active exchange of ideas. We have development centers in San Francisco, Tucson, Singapore and India and the ability to work with distributed teams is a key skill. Perform peer code reviews. Review performance, security and flexibility of the code. Participating in SigFig’s agile ceremonies (e.g. daily standup, release and sprint planning, demos, scrum of scrums).  WE'RE LOOKING FOR SOMEONE WITH:  You possess a BTech/BE in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related technical field or equivalent practical experience. Strong Computer Science fundamentals - you understand data structures, algorithms and software design practices. Good experience with JVM languages (Scala, Java) and relational databases (ability to design, query, transform and optimize). Great Communication Skills — You have excellent communication skills and are able to clearly articulate your thoughts during verbal and written communications. The work we do here is very collaborative (and globally distributed), so team players and an experience with fast moving projects is a big plus as well. Self starters with the interest and ability to learn other coding languages as needed. Knowledge of modern web technologies including Javascript, AngularJS is a plus. Familiarity working with SSO solutions (SAML, OAuth, OpenID), CRM vendors, email systems, e-signature providers, or financial data (FIX, OFX), web infrastructure (firewalls, VPNs, proxies) and hosting is a plus. Domain Experience is a plus — You understand the financial services domain and have executed projects involving implementation and integration of software solutions with other systems in financial institutions. You understand the need for strong security, audits and performance criteria that are associated with the banking and financial services industry. Passion for finance and investing is a plus.  ABOUT SIGFIG  SigFig is dedicated to making high-quality investment advice more accessible and affordable to investors of all wealth levels. Using a combination of design, data science, and technology, SigFig helps empower investors with the information and guidance they need to achieve their personal financial goals. Through partnerships with some of the world’s largest and most innovative financial institutions, SigFig seeks to help investors and advisors better manage their investments. Its enterprise technology accelerates time to market for its partners, while doing so in a secure, scalable, and compliant way. Its product, design, and growth labs fuel innovation, accelerate adoption, and create delight for clients.  Founded in 2007, SigFig is backed by leading financial institutions including Eaton Vance, Comerica Bank, New York Life, Santander InnoVentures, and UBS, as well as top-tier venture capital firms, including Bain Capital Ventures, DCM Ventures, Nyca Partners, and Union Square Ventures. The company is headquartered in San Francisco, California. Learn more at www.sigfig.com ( http://cts.businesswire.com/ct/CT?id=smartlink&url;=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.sigfig.com%2F&esheet;=51348899&newsitemid;=20160524006200&lan;=en-US&anchor;=www.sigfig.com&index;=1&md5;=6cabf72b3dd0c045eae1fe42afbc7f4d ).
Title: Backend Software Engineer

Job_Description: The Quality Assurance Developer is responsible for partnering with the software development team in a continuous delivery environment to ensure releases on our core platform and all client facing applications flawlessly meet business and technical requirements. The ideal candidate is a software developer at heart with a passion for quality and a hunger to continuously learn. Working on the Quality Assurance team as part of the software development lifecycle, the Quality Assurance Developer will search for, investigate, reproduce, document, and track issues through resolution. Never satisfied with the status quo, the Quality Assurance Developer is driven to constantly improve test coverage in an automated pipeline for REST APIs, message based architectures and user interfaces. Responsible to create, update and execute new and existing test plans and programmatically design new automated test assets, ensuring Exchange Solutions is consistently producing quality software. The ideal candidate will have a passion for QA, have a DevOps mindset and driven to automate integration, performance and security testing in to a continuous integration delivery pipeline.  Primary Responsibilities  Automate full regression tests and performance load tests in to a continuous delivery build pipeline.  Work closely with software developers, IT operations, technical solutions architects and product managers to review product requirements and system design from a testing perspective.  Establish and build test plans, test requirement matrices, test design/specifications and test cases as required.  Test software builds, detect all deficiencies, document and track them in Jira through resolution.  Share your expertise and collaborate with the Quality Assurance team members in the execution of all testing assignments.   Operate as a self-starter and possess the technical aptitude in troubleshooting both software and environment issues.  Be a catalyst for continuous improvement aiding in implementing new test strategies and process improvements.  Capability Requirements – education, skills & experience  Degree in Computer Engineering/Science or equivalent knowledge/capability from other disciplines and/or equivalent professional experience.  1- 2 years of experience in a QA automation role.  Experience with one or more automated test frameworks (i.e. Selenium, Robot, Cucumber, etc.)  Expertise in performance and load testing of front and backend systems using JMeter.  1 – 2 years of progressively responsible experience working in team based software development shop with a solid foundation in at least one or more of the following languages: Java, C, C++, Python, PHP, Ruby, or JavaScript.  Experience with or a demonstrable ability to quickly learn containers, orchestration frameworks and infrastructure automation tooling, i.e., Docker, Kubernetes, and Ansible is a great asset.  Comfortable in agile development environments and team structures using scrum.  Experience using source code management systems, i.e., Git.  Well versed in REST and message base microservice architectures, and HTTP protocol.  Proficient in UNIX/Linux environments and shell scripting.  Proficient in basic SQL operations such as joins and views.  Experience with Atlassian suite of products, i.e., Jira, Confluence, Stash, and Bamboo a great asset.  Ability to play well with others, motivate other team members, and thrive in a fast paced and challenging work environment.  Able to set goals, make and keep commitments to achieve scheduled deadlines.  Excellent verbal and written communication skills are a must.  How to apply To apply for this role, please send an email to careers@exchangesolutions.com listing the title above in the subject line. Please include:  Cover letter  Resume (in Word or PDF format please) We thank all applicants for their interest, however, only those selected for an interview will be contacted.
Title: Role Overview

This Global entity is tasked to oversee worldwide projects and enable regional professional services team with tools and knowledge to execute projects with our Vynamic software suite.As an Software Engineer Senior - Professional Servicesyou will experience very close customer involvement, while continuously improving our software suite, its quality, and the projects’ deliverables. You may be asked to lead smaller projects on your own and/or technically lead smaller projects with the regional development teams. Our culture encourages not only knowledge building and best practice sharing, but also gives the opportunity to provide feedback for continuous improvement.SCOPE OF RESPONSIBILITYThe Software Engineer Senior - Professional Serviceswill participate in reviewing existing solutions and providing recommendations for extensions, customizations and new solutions for our product suite and estimates for our product and client solutions.This position is primarily responsible for software integration, including deployment of new software bundles and updates, into the customer’s environment, installing them to customer ATMs remotely without interrupting ATM service by using silent scripts and installs. You will work in partnership with the customer while collaborating with service, software development, sales and support personnel in various business units throughout Diebold Nixdorf, representing the Software and Technology side of Diebold’s Professional Services.ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONSWork closely with other team members to understand product requirements and translate them into software solutionsWork within set deadlines and deliver high quality, well unit tested code using prescribed specificationsReview, analyze, and modify existing systems including encoding, testing, debugging, and TLS-Windows Firewall configuration-Web-services (SOAP and REST)-Database migrations and server failover testsUnix command-line experience is an assetExperience with Atlassian tools (Confluence, Title: Software Engineer-Professional Services

Job_Description: Interested in being a part of a team that is leading the evolution of retail in Canada?  Embracing and driving change is critical to our success. The complexity and rate at which the retail industry is transforming has increased exponentially in recent years and we are committed to being a leader in the industry. As such we are relentlessly focused on innovating at every level of our business, investing in new technologies and products, and doubling down on the best talent to drive the company forward. It is an especially exciting time to join the Canadian Tire Family of Companies.  Our IT team plays a critical role in our evolution, specifically as we transition to an omni-retailer where digital complements the physical. Our commitment to being a world-class digital organization is evident in how we are using cutting-edge technologies to bring our digital strategy to life in-store, online and on your mobile devices, ultimately improving customer experiences, driving traffic, and boosting loyalty.  The App DevOps team enables our consumers to experience Canadian tire through new and emerging digital channels. Retail is changing in Canada and Canadian Tire is on the leading edge of this transformation. To us, culture comes first and is based on support and teamwork.  In Winnipeg, we are investing in creative people to build world-leading software to enhance the Canadian Tire retail experience and continue to support and augment them in an evolving industry. We expect our Winnipeg lab to refocus the lens retail is experienced through by revitalizing current applications and cultivate new digital experiences.  What you’ll do  To be a part of the team, you must have experience in building applications with high performance connecting to several backend Web Services exchanging data with complex systems.  Strong knowledge of modern best practices for professional software development including secure coding standards, code reviews, source control management, build processes, testing, and operations.  Experience developing native mobile applications connecting to Secured Web Services and familiarity with security standards for API’s, SSL, and Tokens is highly preferred.  Design patterns while creating the functionality outlined in the requirement document and convert functional requirements into user interface designs and prototypes, and developed application(s). Work closely with the UI/UX design team to ensure feasibility of implementation of designs.  Utilize different languages & web platforms to create scalable web and mobile applications based on business requirements.  Interface with internal project owners, creative team members and developers to ensure that the applications, experiences and websites display and function as expected.  Able to code and develop features that leverage in-app purchases, eCommerce, engaging experiences and social media integration.  Convert Mobile App, Digital Display and Website design specifications (wireframes and mock-ups) into working software.  Provide recommendations and solutions that meet business needs while ensuring an intuitive and best-in-class end user experience.  Play an active role and take ownership of optimization and performance activities for our interactive digital experiences.  Collaborate within the App DevOps team and key stakeholders to incorporate the business requirements based on research informed solutions for both psychological and physical elements that will enhance the customer journey and overall experience  Participate at all phases of the software development life cycle and work with the team via Agile programming practices (such as Scrum or Kanban) to drive team delivery.  Leverage your past experience with version control software, such as Git or Perforce to communicate and enforce sound code control practices within the development team.  Effectively develops and encourages clean, well structured, easily maintainable code bases.  Executes a regular cadence of Code Reviews and shares feedback throughout the team.  Consult on browser capability and rendering to ensure that proposals and development will work on specified platforms.  What you’ve done  Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science, Engineering preferred or equivalent Software Development industry experience.  5 years of Web or App development experience.  Holds a passion for client-side development and a strong background in building highly dynamic web apps leveraging a Javascript stack with HTML5, REST, CSS3, jQuery, and working knowledge of Cordova.  Has practical knowledge and experience with Git, Gulp, and Node.JS.  Functional and practical understanding of JavaScript MVC frameworks leveraging Ionic and Angular.  Experience with CSS frameworks and pre-processor’s similar to Bootstrap, Sass or Less.  Development experience on server side JavaScript.  Experienced with software architecture and design patterns.  Adapted to leveraging a Scrum/Agile development methodology and is passionate about optimizing process to keep agility high.  Experience with testing frameworks, continuous integration and build tools (i.e. jUnit, DBUnit, Jenkins/Hudson)  Proficient in writing automated Unit tests (Jasmine / Karma).  Advanced knowledge of JavaScript Single Page Applications and related tools.  Experienced using and automating tests, documentation, builds and deployment.  Large scale application development an asset.  Experience developing reusable APIs, consuming web services (REST) and processing data (XML/JSON)  Experience with both iOS Objective-C and Swift 2.0 required, Swift 3.0 or Android Studio, Android SDK, and related languages (Java) a big plus!  Why us  Canadian Tire is one of Canada’s most iconic and diversified companies. Our culture and values uphold our pledge to sustainable practices, and commitment to our local communities through Jumpstart cannot be beat.  To learn more about this team and the Canadian Tire Family of Companies follow us on LinkedIn.  Canadian Tire is an equal opportunity employer. We are committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace for all. We recognize that our future success depends on the perspectives and contributions of all our employees -- their diverse backgrounds, abilities and experiences make our business stronger. If you are contacted for a job opportunity, please advise us of any accommodations needed to ensure fair and equitable access throughout the recruitment and selection process. All accommodation information provided will be treated as confidential and used only for the purpose of providing an accessible candidate experience.  Information Technology  Manitoba-Winnipeg  Permanent  Full-time  Job Posting  :  Mar 5, 2018, 9:32:51 AM
Title: Senior DevOps App Developer

Job_Description: Overview Fortinet team has a great career opportunity for a Linux/C Developer within its FortiClient team, which is responsible for several of Fortinet's client software development.  The new developer will be primarily working on the FortiClient software. Based on the current project load and requirement changes, the new developer will help more on the backend engineering of the product. The basic requirement is to have few years of C/C++ programming knowledge. Network and Windows programming experience is a plus, but not mandatory. We are looking for a more intermediate to a senior level candidate.  Must have Skills:  5+ hands-on experience in C/C++ development Experience developing in Linux environment and a solid understanding of TCP/IP Experience with scripting languages (Python, Perl, Shell etc) Experience and/or knowledge of Networking technologies, Software Define Networking/routers/switches is a plus. Strong problem solving and analytical skills Clear written and verbal communication  Desired skills:  Experience with kernel mode development Experience with operating system interfaces for threads, process control, and virtual memory Experience writing and debugging multithreaded programs  Educational qualifications:  BS or MS degree in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering or related field  #GD #LI-HD1
Title: Senior Linux Developer 3 (CARD2387)

Job_Description: About Covera  Covera is an InsurTech Startup that automates the annual process of re-shopping for home and auto insurance. We are taking on the challenge of re-inventing an unloved product by leveraging technology, new ways of thinking and alternative go-to-market strategies. We are looking for people who have an entrepreneurial mindset, are self-directed and who have a thirst for continuous personal development.  What you can expect from Covera: A progressive & technology driven environment where team members are expected to contribute to the continuous improvement of company tools, policies, processes and resources;  Continuous and high quality personal development opportunities using a structure built on best practices;  Encouragement and resources to contribute to the business and incentives to share in its success.  What you should not expect from Covera: An environment to coast by, work under the radar, and keep your head down - we will expect you to have a voice in the organization;  An environment where there is strict division of labour - we are a Startup, everyone is required to get their hands dirty when needed.  Senior Full Stack Web Developer  To achieve our goals, we are looking to add an additional talented senior full stack web developer who can critically analyze complex business problems and deconstruct them into elegant programmatic solutions.  You will be working in an agile and collaborative environment with the other members of the development and brokerage teams to implement solutions.  You will work across the entire stack to: Be an expert in the capabilities of the Covera platform and become an expert in insurance brokering.  Develop consumer and broker facing components of the platform, responsive PWAs written in React.  Develop our backend platform, written in .Net Core.  Develop learning aspects of the platform, using machine learning tools to build the next generation insurance platform.  What We Need: We need our new team member to have: Superior JavaScript development skills.  Superior C# development skills.  Excellent communication, collaboration and critical thinking skills.  At least 5 years of experience in a collaborative agile development environment delivering mobile first, web based software solutions.  A Computer Science degree or equivalent.  Demonstrable knowledge of React, Redux, Redux-Saga and Styled Components.  Demonstrable knowledge of C#, .Net Core, Web API, EF Core.  Demonstrable knowledge of JavaScript and .Net Core build and deploy processes.  Experience configuring cloud environments and test automation technologies a significant plus.  What we offer  The opportunity to play an essential role in a funded, early-stage Startup set to compete in a massive and lucrative industry.  Fantastic loft offices in the heart of Montreal’s St. Henri neighborhood.  Competitive salaries. Equity and stock options to own a stake within Covera. A real and honest commitment towards challenging and developing our people.
Title: Senior Full Stack Developer (React + C#)

Job_Description: Molecular You Corporation is a digital health company that utilizes molecular level profiles of individuals to provide personalized healthcare solutions in a usable and actionable format. Molecular You’s science-driven solutions are built into its Health Intelligence Platform; from data to insight from insight to action. This platform has been developed to enable the delivery of truly personalized healthcare.We are currently seeking an experienced developer to join our team, specifically for supporting the development work of our web-based Health Intelligence platform.Our team is small, but our customer demands are growing fast; you'll have the ability to make a big impact, working on all parts of the stack.What You’ll Work OnYou'll get a chance to design, build, and improve on each part of our tech stack. Our tech stack is composed of several parts that are all interconnected:(1) A secure data backend that stores sensitive information.(2) An application that provides doctors and patients with a way to explore the molecular information through different views and visualizations. The application is Ruby on Rails, MySQL and React with a beautiful design.(3) The Rails app also drives our internal dashboard that is used to manage our logistics and laboratory information. It is critical for handling the logistics of sample collection and delivery, and helps us ensure we deliver a quality product on time to our users. The internal application is also where we manage all of the key information that is critical for the data analysis pipeline.These duties will be performed with direct support and supervision of the Senior Developer and in a cross-collaborative product team of scientists, designers, data analysts and data visualizers.Work closely with the team and creative partners to create and execute projects.Creative thinking, effective problem solving and attention to detail. The ability to explain work, articulate your process and explain reasoning behind your decisions.Ability to thrive under pressure and manage multiple demands in a deadline-driven environmentHighly self-motivated and proactive with acute attention to detailAbility to maintain a positive attitude and responds well to critiqueBe open to learning new skills and contributing ideas within the teamA happy, enthusiastic and hardworking approachAn interest in learning and tackling new disruptive fields and technologies and to solve hard problems.Required Technical QualificationsRuby on RailsReact.jsBonus if you have experience withD3.jsRedisSalt (server configuration)HIPPA ComplianceRelational & non-relational databasesWorking at Molecular YouWe are situated in the beautiful city of Vancouver. We are building something challenging and unique, with the potential to change medicine for the better. Expect to learn a lot and solve interesting problems every day. You will be working with a team of brilliant designers, scientists and developers and will be compensated well.Job Type: Full-timeExperience:Ruby on Rails: 4 yearsReactJS: 2 years
Title: Full Stack Developer - Ruby On Rails, React.js

Job_Description: Electric Edge Systems Group Inc.FACTS™ - Fishing Activity & Catch Tracking SystemIntermediate to Senior Systems DeveloperMonday to Friday 8:00-4:00 pm (possibility of an earlier start/end time)A Bit About How Us and How We Are Changing Fisheries ITWe started back I 2001 with Fisheries and Oceans Canada (aka DFO) and the National Recreational Licensing System. That was back when we did contract systems work for just about any client and did that kind of work with the DFO up until about 2014. In 2009 we realized that we had been working in fisheries in BC that the rest of the world dreamed they could operate because of how they are monitored. We saw that having all of that monitoring data being submitted via paper forms and then data entered was quite frankly crazy in the 21st century.That’s when we started building what we hope will be considered the best fisheries IT product on the planet to drag the entire industry out of the dark ages of IT and towards a better way. FACTS™ (Fishing Activity & Catch Tracking System) was launched in 2010 and we haven’t looked back. It’s tough being a maverick, but we saw the vision and strove to prove it was the way of the future. We didn’t do it by going public, making fantastical claims, or saying we “could” do it – we just built it and proved it works. We like to think our clients would back us up on that statement…oh wait they have!Fast forward to 2014 when fisheries in the US started to talk about systems using the approach we do (one might wonder where they got the idea). We were ready for them having proven ourselves by doing – now we are considered experts. So much so, that in 2015 we were asked by The Office of Science and Technology (part of NOAA in the US) to visit all six federal fisheries regions and document how they collect fishing data and how that data is handled and where it ends up. Once assessed we were to provide ways for each region to modernize their data collection and management systems.Now we jump to today where we handle the fisheries of two US states, provide various modules of FACTS™ to several industry groups, and are involved in several projects based on grants won by folks we work with. The phones are ringing, we are done with any sort of stealth mode and we are looking for an outstanding new team member to join our team. Will that be you?See www.fisheryfacts.com for more information about our outstanding product (new site close to launching).Our Clients Who Love Us and We Love BECAUSE they are AwesomeClients can make or break your day and ours are simply awesome – smart folks trying to do their best to protect fish resources and/or harvest responsibly. They are always great to work with, which is rather handy as we either are their IT team or a great addition to their existing IT team.FACTS™ is a SaaS offering and for the fee, we simply do what is needed. This means we work very closely with our clients every day and are enhancing the system all the time. We don’t wait for long upgrade cycles – if something isn’t as good as it could be, or something changes in a fishery that requires the system to be adjusted – we do it. This makes for a fresh system with little room for “making due” for end users. They see the results of their feedback far faster than a system that follows the normal SDLC. That makes for happy users, happy clients, and excellent referrals to new clients.What You’ll Do Besides Building The Best Fisheries IT System EverThe Intermediate to Senior Systems Developer reports to and works closely with the CEO, Lead Senior Systems Developer, and the Customer and Systems Support Specialist.The primary responsibility of the role will be to learn the database structure and the system as a whole. The successful candidate will be provided ample training and support from our team. Initially work will be a support role which will include daily issue resolution and non-mission critical system changes and enhancements. You will learn our system through helping with the testing of issues that need resolution. That will be coupled with access to the Lead Senior Systems Developer and the CEO to help explain the system, how it functions, and what the most important aspects and rules are within it.As you advance in your training your work will also include larger and more critical issues/changes, and self-serve support tools for the company and clients. A big part of being a systems developer at Electric Edge Systems Group is staying current with the rules in each fishery/module combinations that the client(s) you work with are using.You will provide prompt and courteous internal support for our FACTS™ Customer and Systems Support Specialist via e-mail, in person, by phone, and a systems issue ticketing application (Jira from Atlassian).This position requires the applicant to work diligently, independently with the ability to recognize when they need more information when making a judgment call. Accuracy, with the ability to listen attentively and attention to detail are all key aspects of this position.Hats to be WornWe are a small, but growing company. That means we all wear multiple hats, but we also get to define our future – how fun is that!Ideas – we always like new ideas. We know we don’t know it all and so should you. Teamwork and listening to each other is key to making FACTS™ great!Learning and implementing the business rules of each fishery we serveDatabase creation and administrationWeb Server administrationCoding of product changes and enhancementsHandling system support issuesManaging issues in Jira from initial report through resolutionCoding and maintaining support utilities for use internally or for clients to self-serve withTesting interfaces and the resulting data changes for your own work and othersWearing multiple hats where technology is concerned in the companyHave some fun – it’s not all 1s and 0s or “one fish two fish” if you willThings That Make You the Right FitActive listening to understand client and system needsExcellent client service skillsCritical thinking, brainstorming and problem solvingProfessional telephone skillsExcellent communication - written and verbalAbility to work independently while contributing as a positive team memberAbility to understand how parts of a system are related in order to assess if a workaround exists when issues are found.Multi-task with strong attention to detailGood retention of information5+ years’ experience in Systems DevelopmentAble to handle constant change – we constantly iterateLiving in or near Victoria, BC – remote development may be considered. But most likely only if you live on Vancouver Island. Working at our office is preferred. If outside of the southern coastal area of BC, we won’t respond to your application.Experience MattersMS SQL Server Database Administration – 5+ years (or comparable experience with other relational databases)Adobe ColdFusion – 5+ years (or comparable experience with other preferable multiple other languages for web development)JQuery – 3+ years (or comparable experience with JavaScript/Angular/Node JS, etc)Cross-trained in all aspects of systems development including server administration, backend and UI coding, and database design and administrationWhat You GetCompetitive salaryPaid lunch and coffee breakFlexible benefit plan to fit the individual needs of each employeeRandom acts of bonusPerformance recognitionRelaxed office setting with lots of natural lightHelp save our oceans, lakes, and rivers through better data!Job Type: Full-timeExperience:service client's needs: 5 yearsJQuery or comparable JavaScript/Angular/Node JS, etc: 3 yearsAdobe ColdFusion or comparable: 5 yearsSystems Development: 5 yearsMS SQL Server Database Administration or comparable: 5 yearsLocation:Victoria, BCLanguage:English
Title: Intermediate to Senior Systems Developer

Job_Description: The Role: We are looking for talented and energetic individuals to join our team. As a backend cloud engineer you will work closely with our R&D;, Android and iOS developers throughout the product development cycle. We currently operate on a LAMP stack with MySQL and PHP cores.  You will be responsible for: Developing the foundation of our platform, backend software and cloud architecture  Optimizing and scaling our system and databases to maintain performance as our suite of products and users grow  Configuring and maintaining our cloud networking and storage infrastructure  Working side by side with front-end developers to deliver new releases and updates for existing applications  Troubleshooting system issues and build monitoring, logging and alert systems  Documenting the end-to-end release process  Playing a critical role in defining our future technology stack  You will be responsible for building and maintaining our infrastructure and web applications. Each member of our team plays a critical role in the company and yours will be no different – we expect fresh ideas and a drive to keep innovating.  Requirements: Proficient in a LAMP/WAMP stack environment (Linux/Windows, Apache, MySQL, PHP). Proficiency in Python application development a plus  Experience in Backend MVC web application development  Experience with Linux server administration and Amazon AWS or other cloud platforms  Experience in MySQL and relational databases  Experience with Apache, RESTful APIs and networking protocols like SSL  Excellent technical writing skills to document code and product specifications  Work with a cross-functional team  Qualifications  Master’s or Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or a related field, or equivalent experience.  You must be self-managed, independent and committed to working in a fast-paced environment.  3-5 years of experience.

Job_Description: Join a passionate and diverse team of developers in creating the next generation of clustered media content management systems, with the opportunity to work alongside some of the biggest content distribution providers and broadcasters in the world.  In the role of a front-end developer, you will help to create the products’ user interface, working with the latest web technologies such as Angular and Typescript, and best practices including Agile, Continuous Integration and TDD. You will be part of a tight knit scrum team, working closely with your team members and mentor, but also others from the QA, design and projects departments. HOW WE WORK We work with a modern JavaScript stack, consisting of Angular 4 / 5, Typescript, SaSS, Node.js and Redux. We are strong believers in TDD and QA, and use Protractor and Jasmine to test our codebase. You won’t need to be knowledgeable in all these areas to start, there is plenty of opportunity to learn within the team. We work as part of small scrum teams, consisting of 4 or 5 developers and a QA engineer. We work closely together though design, implementation, test and QA to deliver a solid product. There is opportunity for everyone to get involved in all aspects of the design and implementation, allowing you to exercise and explore a more creative side with design, or get into the low-level implementation details.  WHAT YOU WILL BRING TO OUR TEAM A good understanding of JavaScript or Typescript (or a backend server side experience, e.g. Java, Python or Node.js, and the ability to learn really fast) Great communication skills, you will be part of a small scrum team, meeting with other departments and developers A passion for software development and great problem-solving skills Extra points for experience with Angular or Angular JS or similar front-end framework (React, Vue.js) Extra points for any application testing experience, using Protractor, Jasmine or similar Extra points for having server side experience with Java   Location: Burlington, ON
Title: Modern Javascript Developer (Angular, Typescript, NODE)

Job_Description: What you’ll do: You’re an experienced, senior backend developer who’s passionate about creating meaningful experiences through well-engineered products. You are a mentor and guiding voice for developers, who can balance day-to-day workload, with an eye for future improvements of your team.  As a developer within TELUS Digital, you will be working on leading edge microservice APIs, supporting TELUS employees and growing our digital footprint - what you help build will be the underlying systems that help our team achieve better customer experiences. The services you will build will need to be both performant and resilient.  What you’ll be responsible for: You will be working as part of a friendly, agile team who helps each other solve problems across all functions. As a coal-shoveler in the engine room, you will employ best practices in development, security, accessibility and design to achieve the highest quality of service for our customers. You’re also interested in constantly learning and growing - both building your own skill set and helping develop the people around you.  What you’ll need to be successful: A passion for emerging technologies, you’ve kept up to date on top trends and love to bring new ideas to your team Experience in architecture of microservices Expertise in writing RESTful APIs Experience with incident management Experience using Nodejs Familiarity with creating and implementing unit and integration tests Comfort working with SOAP APIs Familiarity with security and authentication standards such as OAuth & JWT Experience working in an Agile or Scrum environment  This is a full-time, renewable 1-year contract position.  About TELUS Digital We’re a customer-driven and product-minded team within TELUS, responsible for our company’s digital evolution. We simplify the path to production so teams can focus on what matters most.  TELUS Digital’s mission is to make life easier for millions of customers – and for our team. We build smart, customer-centric and data-driven experiences for telus.com, business.telus.com and the My Account app.  Our team includes a passionate group of strategists, UX and visual designers, full stack developers, content managers, scrum masters, testers, product owners, people experience specialists, and other digital experts.  We’re looking for team members who : Share our passion for all things digital Thrive in an agile, lean and fast-paced environment Clearly see things from the perspective of our customers Are curious, experiment and never stop learning Embrace diversity and new ideas  What you can expect from us: An environment where you’re encouraged to share and act on your ideas Flexible work hours in a central downtown location A welcoming, relaxed office with a casual dress code A culture committed to giving; every year we donate time and resources in our communities Team lunches with a generous supply of healthy snacks A fun, dynamic team that works and plays every day; great ideas can come as easily during an impromptu hallway soccer match or social team outing  We aspire to build the best products. We’re always a work in progress and looking for people to join us and help digitize the telco. Learn about our team at telus.com/digital.  Accessibility  At TELUS, we are committed to diversity and equitable access to employment opportunities based on ability.  Bonus points  Check out labs.telus.com/blog to see how we solve challenging problems for millions of customers with innovative tools.
Title: Senior API Web Developer

Job_Description: Cineplex is one of Canada's leading entertainment companies and operates numerous businesses including theatrical exhibition, food service, amusement gaming (Player One Amusement Group), alternative programming (Cineplex Events), traditional and digital media (Cineplex Media and Cineplex Digital Media), out of home leisure and entertainment (The Rec Room), eSports (World Gaming), and home entertainment content (CineplexStore.com). Cineplex is also a joint venture partner in SCENE - Canada's largest entertainment loyalty program.  We are proudly a Canadian company with approximately 13,000 employees in Canada and the US, and we offer competitive compensation, incentive and benefits programs. To learn more about Cineplex please visit our website at www.cineplex.com.  Cineplex Digital Media (CDM) is a fully integrated, in-store digital merchandising provider with well over a decade of research, development and design experience. We provide strategically designed installations and customized creative to enable brands to effectively communicate with audiences in ways they never imagined. Using proprietary, state-of-the-art technology, and patented software, we have developed some of the world's largest and most complex digital merchandising networks.  The Cineplex Digital Media division of Cineplex Entertainment Limited Partnership currently has an opening for the position of Senior Software Developer , reporting to the Sr. Manager, Software Development, Cineplex Digital Media. This position will be based out of our Cineplex Digital Media office located at 369 York Street in London, Ontario.  As a Senior Software Developer you will be implementing innovative designs that make our solutions and services the market leader in In-Store Digital Merchandising. As a key member of a highly collaborative agile development team, the Senior Software Developer will work with a cross-functional team in all layers of the system including UI, backend services, device, automated test, and automated deployment. The Software Developer is expected to possess high initiative and has the ability to take leadership and work in a collaborative team environment and has excellent expertise and experience in software development lifecycle and quality engineering.  The Senior Software Developer will work closely with multiple teams, including: Business Development, UX Design, Operations, in developing new consumer-facing Web applications, improving/maintaining existing ones and addressing users' needs, experience and usability requirements.  Position Responsibilities: Active participation in Agile development process including iteration planning, estimation, retrospective, standup and cross training Take leadership in design, implementation and code reviews; mentor junior members of the team Design and implement high quality Web applications using HTML, CSS, JavaScript, PHP, Ajax and REST/JSON API's Design and implement web services using JAVA, PHP, REST, SOAP Design and implement automated test cases for UI and system integration Participate in maintain, upgrade, optimization of existing solutions Involve in updating automated deployment script Education and Experience: A BS or MS degree in Computer Science, Mathematics or other related technical disciplines Above 5 years of experience in a mature engineering organization building packaged software products Experience of architecting, designing and implementing enterprise-scale applications with OO approach Experience in side-side Web technologies including: Java, Servlet, JAX-WS, JAX-RS, PHP Experience with HTML4/5, CSS, JavaScript, XML, JSON, AJAX Experience with relational databases and SQL Experience in the digital signage, promotion, and advertisement or related industries would be a significant asset Strong communication skills and ability to work across team/product-unit boundaries Proven ability in problem solving, decision making and leadership Interested applicants please apply today.  While we appreciate all interest, only those candidates selected for an interview will be contacted. As part of Cineplex Entertainment's standard recruitment process, suitable candidate(s) will be required to undergo pre-employment screening as a condition of employment or promotion.  No Agency Calls Please
Title: Sr. Software Developer - Cineplex Digital Media (DV62)

Job_Description: Description:   About Us\:  The AIR MILES® Rewards Program has earned the trust and support of more than two-thirds of Canadian households. For over two decades, we have helped our Partners use Canada’s most widely accepted loyalty currency, AIR MILES® reward miles, to influence customer behavior, drive profitability, and build long-term relationships.  Check us out – LoyaltyOne on Stack Overflow | LinkedIn | Glassdoor | Facebook |Twitter  Engineering Team Culture\:  We are polyglots\: We believe in using the best tech stack for the job. We’ve written scripts in Python and built APIs in Scala, Java, Akka, and Node.js. We deploy everything to the Cloud.  We pair program\: You pick your machine\: Windows or Mac. Our floors are open space with no cubicles or private offices, regularly pair programming and mobbing when working. Teams have hack days at least once a month when they take a break to work on anything they want, and most of the time their creations end up in our production environment. Communication is key to our approach, and we don't want to hinder it with walls, real or metaphorical.  We are Agile\: Development methodologies mean different things to different people. For us? We have a story card wall and release a few times a week. We keep the team in sync with daily stand-ups and have a retrospective once a month to discuss things that are going well and opportunities for improvements. We surround teams with everything they need, Scrum Masters to coach us on the process, Product Owners to make sense of the work, Pod Leaders to help with our careers and Competency Leads to facilitate technical design and provide mentorship in advanced technical skills.  Types of projects we work on\:   As part of the AM Next team, you will be building the next generation Air Miles Reward Program platform. This new Cloud-based platform will focus on quality and security while providing massive data scalability and real-time data ingestion, processing, and consumption. We are finding new ways of working that allow us to continuously improve delivery of value with high levels of cadence and quality.   Qualification:  What we look for in you\:  Ability and desire to work in our collaborative environment\: open team room, pair programming and fluid interactions with all products and operations teams  Focusing on building solutions utilizing an agile approach; leveraging close relationships with Product Managers, communicating and digesting real-time feedback, and working smart to build story cards on daily basis  You have experience building large scale distributed systems, based on reactive principles, that are flexible, loosely-coupled and scalable  You believe that Cloud is the future and you have experience managing some of them - AWS, Azure, Google Cloud Platform or IBM Cloud  We know there are endless tools and technologies, and we don’t expect you to come in as an expert on everything, but you are looking forward to experimenting and learning.  Air Miles Perks\:  Hack Days\: one day a month you work on projects that interest you to improve your craft   Training\: from hackathons to conferences, to instructor lead, building your competency is our priority About LoyaltyOne  LoyaltyOne is part of the successful Alliance Data family of companies that provide the full range of data-driven loyalty, marketing and credit solutions in more than 80 locations across the globe.  Working with more than 100 leading brands in the retail, financial services, grocery, petroleum retail, travel and hospitality industries to profitably change customer behavior. Through a team of businesses, including one of the leading coalition loyalty programs in the world, the AIR MILES® Reward Program, LoyaltyOne designs, delivers and manages a suite of services focused on consumer data, customer-centric retail strategies, direct-to-consumer marketing, loyalty consulting and more.   LoyaltyOne has broadened its horizons geographically by growing Precima in the European market. With the recent acquisition of BrandLoyalty in the Netherlands, LoyaltyOne has gained the expertise of a global leader in short-term loyalty campaigns, along with a client network that extends throughout Europe and Asia.     About ADS   Alliance Data® (NYSE\: ADS) is a leading global provider of data-driven marketing and loyalty solutions serving large, consumer-based industries. The Company creates and deploys customized solutions, enhancing the critical customer marketing experience; the result is measurably changing consumer behavior while driving business growth and profitability for some of today's most recognizable brands. Alliance Data helps its clients create and increase customer loyalty through solutions that engage millions of customers each day across multiple touch points using traditional, digital, mobile and emerging technologies. An S&P 500 and Fortune 500 company headquartered in Plano, Texas, Alliance Data consists of three businesses that together employ more than 16,000 associates at approximately 100 locations worldwide. www.alliancedata.com    Alliance Data is an Employment Opportunity employer. Accordingly, we will make reasonable accommodations to respond to the needs of people with disabilities in accordance with legislation.  Alliance Data participates in E-Verify.
Title: Backend Developer

Job_Description: Looking to work for an awesome team? You've come to the right place! Our developers are a tight-knit group, and we are pushing for substantial product development as we continue looking to grow the team in the next year. We value passion for quality, maintainable, and scalable code, and for building awesome products. A side benefit of developing for the restaurant industry is that once we’re done working hard, we have some great clients who can always provide amazing venues for unwinding with our close knit team. TouchBistro is looking for several Backend Developers at the Intermediate or Senior level here in our Toronto office. Our POS system is evolving and our customers are demanding more product capabilities. As a member of our agile Technology team, you will have the chance to work on our current or next-Gen product's web features. Our current stack is ReactJS and NodeJS but if you have worked with other frameworks that is also sufficient. To apply for this position, you must possess a minimum 1+ years of production experience using NodeJS and SQL databases. The development team is poised for growth and along with that comes with many opportunities to learn different skills as well as have a growth path internally.   YOUR DAY-to-DAY Using JavaScript, design & implement features to help our restaurant customers succeed Create a new API using NodeJS and SQL databases on the backend Keep Up-to-Date with best practices and tooling from the JavaScript community Fearlessly Collaborate with your team to solve problems and learn from failures   ALL ABOUT YOU Knowledge of modern JavaScript, HTML5, CSS3 1+ Years of Experience with NodeJS 3+ Years of experience using a backend language (we use Node, but Java, Ruby on Rails, Python, etc. is also acceptable) Some exposure to SQL or NoSQL databases Test Driven Development Experience working on teams in an agile-scrum environment 4 year College Diploma or University Degree  WHY CHOOSE US? TouchBistro is an award-winning iPad Point of Sale system, built for restaurant people by restaurant people. We’re a team of thinkers, builders, doers, and innovators. While many of us have experience working at restaurants, some of us just have a true passion for the industry. We’re venture backed by some of the best tech VCs in the world and are partnered with top innovators in the mobile, food, and payment industries. We’re global and growing! TouchBistro is used in more than 100 countries worldwide and has offices in NYC, Austin, Chicago, London and headquarters in Toronto. We’re a fast-moving, ever-evolving company on a mission to change the way restaurateurs do business and help them succeed through our products and services, but we need talented, passionate people to help! So, what do you say? Are you ready to become part of something awesome?  TouchBistro believes in fostering an inclusive workplace where all individuals have an opportunity to succeed. Requests for accommodation due to a disability can be made at any stage of the recruitment process.
Title: Backend Developer

We allow people to live better lives by fixing the misalignment between when people get paid and when they need their money. Employers who pay with Instant enjoy greater access to the best employees as well as high employee retention and engagement. All of this translates into a better, more profitable business. We have started the payroll revolution and need talented passionate people to join the Modern Money Movement.We are dreamers who have a proven track record of making big things happen. We do this by inspiring ourselves and those we work with to do what others cannot do. We know that we must move together as a team, celebrate our successes, and above all learn quickly from the mistakes we know will be made due to the fast pace of our execution. We carry ourselves with urgency, honesty and integrity in everything we do. Together, we truly believe we can empower working lives.About the Team: We're a small but high-performing team of engineers, building SaaS and mobile technologies for a rapidly growing organization, led by a founding team with a proven track record.We embrace Agile and DevOps practices and tools to ensure the delivery of high quality software with a high release velocity. We have a well defined product and technology roadmap in support of a very healthy sales pipeline. We have a highly efficient flat structure and ambitious growth plans.Our stack is JavaScript-based (including with Node/Express microservices). Most importantly, we work in a collaborative environment of continuous learning - we expect you to challenge us as much as we challenge you!About You: You're an intermediate to senior full stack developer with JavaScript skills. You're passionate about building web and mobile applications and you’ve had experience delivering production-grade software.You thrive in fast-paced environments where you have lots of independence and ownership. You keep up-to-date with new technologies and trends, and you're eager to learn. You live and work with honesty and integrity, you carry your work with a healthy sense of urgency, you truly believe in teamwork, and you're not afraid to be held - or hold others - accountable for what must be done.What You'll Bring: Several years experience developing production-quality software at high scaleDegree in Computer Science, or equivalent experienceAbility to learn new technologies and paradigms rapidlyStrong JavaScript skillsFamiliarity with non-relational databases such as MongoDBProficiency in a Linux environmentDeep knowledge of web technologiesExcellent spoken and written EnglishBonus Assets: Test automationWorking in an Agile+DevOps development environmentWriting Node-based microservicesWriting microservices in a framework such as ExpressAny JavaScript framework such as Angular, React, or similarJOIN US!Are you so excited about taking on this challenge, and about what we stand for, that by now you can barely sit still? Then go ahead and send us your application, we would love to hear from you.We want authentic, passionate, hard-working people who will embrace this challenge, make it their personal goal to give it all they got, and leave a legacy while knowing that, by doing so, they are truly improving the lives of everyone that touches our solutions.Referral Reward: Know someone qualified for this role? You can receive a CAD $3,000 referral reward (paid 90 days after hire) by referring them to us.Job Type: Full-time

Job_Description: Company Profile  Morgan Stanley is a global financial services firm and a market leader in investment banking, securities, investment management and wealth management services. With offices in more than 43 countries, the people of Morgan Stanley are dedicated to providing our clients the finest thinking, products and services to help them achieve even the most challenging goals. As a market leader, the talent and passion of our people is critical to our success. We embrace integrity, excellence, team work and giving back.  Technology  The Technology division partners with our business units and leading technology companies to redefine how we do business in ever more global and dynamic financial markets. Our sizeable investment in technology results in leading-edge tools, software, and systems. Our insights, applications, and infrastructure give a competitive edge to clients’ businesses—and to our own.  Enterprise Technology & Risk (ETR) is comprised of five primary areas  Core Infrastructure (CI) manages the infrastructure technology solutions to support the Firm’s daily operations, enable our businesses to expand to new markets, offer new client products, and comply with evolving regulations.•End User Technology (EUT) delivers core communication, collaboration and productivity tools across the Firm, including desktop and mobile devices, remote computing solutions, and multimedia services. •Quality Assurance & Production Management (QAPM) provides production management, quality assurance, and end user services for Institutional Securities and Support Services. QAPM also manages the Enterprise Command Center, Enterprise Systems Management, and Technology Disaster Recovery services.•Technology & Information Risk (TIR) delivers first-line defenses to manage risks to Firm technology. TIR oversees programs that protect and enable the business, ensure secure delivery of services to our clients, address the risks presented by an evolving threat landscape, and meet regulatory expectations. •Technology Business Development (TechBD) manages the Firm’s strategic relationships with external technology companies.  Position Description: We are looking for a hands-on Database Tester The Candidate needs to be able to work with geographically dispersed Dev & QA team in a very dynamic, rapidly evolving and high pressure, high visibility project setting. The candidate is expected to contribute in a hands-on fashion on the project as well as take ownership of various QA deliverables. The following will be the candidates key focus areas. - Passionate around automating end to end testing including frontend/backend applications.- Being comfortable with frequent, incremental code testing and deployment- Ability to use a wide variety of open source and in house technologies and tools- Take a hands-on approach to implementing QA processes right from requirements analysis, test design, automation and analysis. - Own the quality and timeliness of delivery- Collaborate with Developers, Business and multiple global stakeholders to drive QA agenda & standards by engaging with them throughout the SDLC- Communicate key issues and progress updates in a regular, accurate, timely fashion.  Required:  8+ years of hands on experience working on QA automation team- Bachelor Degree in Computer Science or related field.- Experience working with source control / defect tracking and continuous integration systems- Experience around automating end to end testing including frontend/backend applications.- Proficient in traditional RDBMS schema and SQL- Good in Linux/Unix- Detail oriented and should be able to work in a fast paced environment- Able to demonstrate process improvements across both QA and development teams - Strong analytical ability and problem solving skills- Excellent interpersonal skills and professional approach- Good knowledge about testing concepts- Solid Test design skills, test case automation and analysis.- Hands on experience in of Shell scripting\Perl\Python . - Experience working with ALM  Desired:  PubSub/VCS/Autosys/Sybase/AFS/TCP-IP - Agile software development experience, preferably Scrum - Continuous Integration tools like Jenkins- Hands on experience in ETL testing- Exposure to BDD (JBehave / Cucumber/ Fitness / Concordion) (nice to have? YES)-Financial background  Knowledge of French and English are required.  Morgan Stanley is an equal opportunities employer. We work to provide a supportive and inclusive environment where all individuals can maximize their full potential.

Think speech recognition but for music: a musician plays their instrument and near-instantaneously receives sheet music indicating the notes that were performed. Frettable brings advanced artificial intelligence out of the lab and onto mobile devices to empower musicians with quality transcriptions and song writing tools anytime, anywhere.Do you want your work to have immediate impact? Ability to appreciate a really good guitar riffRESPONSIBILITIESPlan sprints for updates to the Frettable iOS and Android appsCarry out sprints and deliver production-ready applicationQuality assurance on multiple real (provided) and simulator devicesCommunicate directly with project’s technology leadJob Type: Full-timeLocation:Edmonton, ABLanguage:English
