Job_Description: Our Mission: Modern Money Movement.Instant Financial is disrupting the standard notion of ‘payday’ by giving workers daily control over their earned income. We allow people to live better lives by fixing the misalignment between when people get paid and when they need their money. Employers who pay with Instant enjoy greater access to the best employees as well as high employee retention and engagement. All of this translates into a better, more profitable business. We have started the payroll revolution and need talented passionate people to join the Modern Money Movement.We are dreamers who have a proven track record of making big things happen. We do this by inspiring ourselves and those we work with to do what others cannot do. We know that we must move together as a team, celebrate our successes, and above all learn quickly from the mistakes we know will be made due to the fast pace of our execution. We carry ourselves with urgency, honesty and integrity in everything we do. Together, we truly believe we can empower working lives.About the Team: We're a small but high-performing team of engineers, building SaaS and mobile technologies for a rapidly growing organization, led by a founding team with a proven track record.We embrace Agile and DevOps practices and tools to ensure the delivery of high quality software with a high release velocity. We have a well defined product and technology roadmap in support of a very healthy sales pipeline. We have a highly efficient flat structure and ambitious growth plans.Our stack is JavaScript-based (including with Node/Express microservices). Most importantly, we work in a collaborative environment of continuous learning - we expect you to challenge us as much as we challenge you!About You: You're an intermediate to senior full stack developer with JavaScript skills. You're passionate about building web and mobile applications and you’ve had experience delivering production-grade software.You thrive in fast-paced environments where you have lots of independence and ownership. You keep up-to-date with new technologies and trends, and you're eager to learn. You live and work with honesty and integrity, you carry your work with a healthy sense of urgency, you truly believe in teamwork, and you're not afraid to be held - or hold others - accountable for what must be done.What You'll Bring: Several years experience developing production-quality software at high scaleDegree in Computer Science, or equivalent experienceAbility to learn new technologies and paradigms rapidlyStrong JavaScript skillsFamiliarity with non-relational databases such as MongoDBProficiency in a Linux environmentDeep knowledge of web technologiesExcellent spoken and written EnglishBonus Assets: Test automationWorking in an Agile+DevOps development environmentWriting Node-based microservicesWriting microservices in a framework such as ExpressAny JavaScript framework such as Angular, React, or similarJOIN US!Are you so excited about taking on this challenge, and about what we stand for, that by now you can barely sit still? Then go ahead and send us your application, we would love to hear from you.We want authentic, passionate, hard-working people who will embrace this challenge, make it their personal goal to give it all they got, and leave a legacy while knowing that, by doing so, they are truly improving the lives of everyone that touches our solutions.Referral Reward: Know someone qualified for this role? You can receive a CAD $3,000 referral reward (paid 90 days after hire) by referring them to us.Job Type: Full-time
Title: Backend Developer

Job_Description: Who we are: SPORTLOGiQ is the leading provider of advanced analytics data for professional sports teams and broadcast media. As a Senior Back End Developer, you will work with the product development team to develop our next generation advanced analytics platform, providing our users with powerful analysis tools using SPORTLOGiQ’s unique data set. This is a once-in-a-lifetime opportunity to help shape the future of sports analysis, coaching and media storytelling.What you'll do: Collaborating with the product development team to iteratively define, design and implement the backend of SPORTLOGiQ’s hockey analysis system, from data collection to data reporting and the web UI.Owning the back end software design and architecture.Define and implement the REST API used by data analysis and collection tools as well as the customer facing Web UIs.Optimizing API and database for maximum speed and scalabilityManage testing and ensure robustness of the backend infrastructure codeManaging the deployment toolchain * Working effectively with the product development and design team to ensure back end features meet front end requirements properly.What you need: Minimum 5+ years’ experience as a Back-End Developer, Database Developer or similar related role.Significant experience of building secure, scalable RESTful APIs (PHP, Python).Significant experience working with databases and datawarehousing systems (PostgreSQL)Experience using cloud based platforms such as AWS / HerokuExperience in C++ programming a plus.Experience with FFMPEG/h264 a plus.Proficient understanding of code versioning tools, such as GitBachelor’s degree in Computer Science, or Computer Engineering.Passion for hockey a nice plus!What we offer: Extremely competitive salary/bonus programCentralized and accessible location in trendy Mile-EndCompetitive benefits packageFlexible work scheduleJob Type: Full-timeEducation:Bachelor's
Title: Senior Back end Developer

Job_Description: About you: We are looking for a technology creator to help build our server management and data analyses. Our goal is to create amazing products and the backend represents an important part of this ecosystem as it provides services to our mobile apps and helps us analyze our usage data. Your duties would include : Deploy and administer our application and data servers Creating infrastructure to process millions of GPS data points from all over the world Leading our backend development efforts Specifying, creating and maintaining functionalities on our backend Gathering feedback, planning and reviewing all work done on our backend As a successful candidate, you might have : Experience deploying AWS and/or Google Cloud environments Experience with multiple DBMS with extremely large data sets A team player spirit and experience managing others 5+ years experience creating and maintaining backend APIs Experience using Node.js or any other backend language A desire to create quality products Amazing communication skills A thirst to learn new things
Title: Backend developer/DevOps (NodeJS)

Job_Description: mnubo is a creative, fun and fast-growing big data and analytics company focused in the revolutionary space of the Internet of Things (IoT). mnubo’s IoT cloud SaaS platform transforms the way object manufacturers, enterprises and consumers interact with, and benefit from, connected smart objects. mnubo is building tremendous momentum in the IoT market and has received multiple awards and acquired a growing number of customers and partners. This is a great opportunity to join the booming market of the Internet of Things “IoT” and be part of a fast growing company that is on the leading edge of the industry.  We are located in the entrepreneurial and technology hub of Montreal in an open, loft-style office space; our highly talented team tackles difficult problems with innovative solutions and a great team-building attitude.  mnubo is looking for a talented Front End Developer to join the Data Visualization Team. The team constantly pushes the edge to deliver state to the art dashboards and analytics tools in a fast, agile environment deploying in production multiple times per day by trusting automated testing. Job Role and Responsibilities  Write web applications in TypeScript, HTML, CSS that are heavily dependent on AngularJS and Angular  Accountable for delivering assigned development tasks and take ownership in order to deliver on time  Translate provided designs and style guides into functional user interfaces, ensuring cross browser compatibility and performance  Scope and estimate the development and testing effort for user stories  Perform automated testing (Unit, Integration and End to End) within an iterative agile environment  Share knowledge with the team by participating in Code Reviews and Pair Programming.  Participate in all agile ceremonies (standups, planning, backlog refinement, reviews, retrospectives)  Perform installation, maintenance and debugging of operational infrastructure  Traits and Skills  Truly passionate about Front End development  A team player who is able to collaborate across teams (FrontEnd, BackEnd, DevOps)  Result oriented and positive attitude  Good analytical capabilities to debug existing code and write tests  Understand the user stories and their acceptance criteria  Great attention to detail  Basic Qualifications  Bachelor’s degree in CS, related software engineering discipline or equivalent experience  2+ years of professional experience in Front End development with a modern framework (React, Angular, Vue, …).  Both French and English speaker.  Our Stack  Front End Framework: TypeScript, Webpack, AngularJS with ongoing migration to Angular  Backend: Scala with Play Framework v2 (some scripts in Node.JS) - Akka HTTP for internal services  CSS Layout: bootstrap v3  Testing: Karma, Protractor (looking into Pupeteer)  Data visualization: Highcharts, D3.js  Infrascture: Docker, Kubernetes, Ansible  Source Control: Git  Bug Tracking: JIRA
Title: Data Visualization/Front End Developer

Job_Description: Interested in being a part of a team that is leading the evolution of retail in Canada?  Embracing and driving change is critical to our success. The complexity and rate at which the retail industry is transforming has increased exponentially in recent years and we are committed to being a leader in the industry. As such we are relentlessly focused on innovating at every level of our business, investing in new technologies and products, and doubling down on the best talent to drive the company forward. It is an especially exciting time to join the Canadian Tire Family of Companies.  Our Technology team plays a critical role in our evolution, specifically as we transition to an omni-retailer where digital complements the physical. Our commitment to being a world-class digital organization is evident in how we are using cutting-edge technologies to bring our digital strategy to life in-store, online and on your mobile devices, ultimately improving customer experiences, driving traffic, and boosting loyalty.  The Technology Retail Delivery and Support team is responsible for providing project management, business analysis, QA testing and development services in support of the delivery of projects and ongoing maintenance of Canadian Tire's in-store and corporate applications. As an experienced Quality Assurance Analyst you will be involved in all aspects and phases of the application development life cycle and will work directly with business analysts and developers to ensure the on-time delivery of high-quality software solutions for our associate stores.  What you’ll do  As a Business Analyst you will help define and deliver solutions that meet business objectives, and will serve as a facilitator between the business and IT in understanding the business's needs.  In partnership with Project Managers, Business Stakeholders, and IT interfacing groups you will lead the eliciting, analyzing, validating and managing of requirements, business processes, and high-level solution design  s  .  This position will be part of an IT team that supports the Dealer Community and supports both the frontend and backend systems that are key to daily operations of each Canadian Tire Retail Store.  Specific duties include: Work with the client/product owners and Project Manager on defining the project’s scope.  Facilitate requirements gathering sessions with multiple stakeholders  Form a partnership with the business and IT teams to understand their business in order to enable the capture of clear, concise and correct requirements  Bridge the gap between both business and IT teams, ensuring common understanding and alignment of both functional and non-functional requirements  Build stakeholder trust by understanding business concepts, issues, opportunities and language  Convey requirements and design concepts with models such as gap analysis, and prototypes  In Agile projects: you will be responsible for creating, refining and maintaining user stories and associated deliverables such as process flows and test cases to meet development and stakeholder needs  Facilitate and/or actively participate in problem-solving discussions and general communications between the business and IT and within IT itself  Provide project management support  Contribute to a collaborative team environment by information sharing and team cooperation  Who you are  We are looking for high performing individuals who are: Agile and innovative individuals, who are able to manage in an environment of change and ambiguity to help us take bold and strategic moves in this rapidly evolving retail environment  Creative thinkers who take initiative and are capable of building, launching and managing projects/programs that drive results for our customers  Problem solvers with the ability to analyze and prioritize to meet business objectives  Collaborative team players with superior influencing skills, who build relationships easily across various stakeholder groups to move initiatives forward  If you’re curious, ready to take on new challenges and open to doing things differently to help us evolve rapidly, then Canadian Tire is definitely the place to be.  What you’ve done  University degree or equivalent  Minimum of  2  years of experience  as a  Business Analyst in an agile project-based environment  Understanding and experience within a Retail Environment and Product life cycle.  Fluent in technology and strong knowledge of project and software development methodologies/techniques  Strong presentation, facilitation, interviewing and workshop skills  Strong interpersonal, communication (both written and verbal) and conflict-management skills  Ability to deliver under tight deadlines  Ability to navigate ambiguity, overcome confusion and simplify complex situations  Experience creating agile ‘user stories’  Knowledge and interest in industry best practices regarding requirements definition and management  Proficiency with Microsoft Office (Word, Excel, PowerPoint), Project and Visio  Experience in Agile Scrum Delivery  IIBA Certification is an asset  SQL experience is beneficial  Why us  Canadian Tire is one of Canada’s most iconic and diversified companies. Our culture and values uphold our pledge to sustainable practices, and commitment to our local communities through Jumpstart cannot be beat.  To learn more about this team and the Canadian Tire Family of Companies follow us on LinkedIn.  AODA/D&I; statement  Canadian Tire is an equal opportunity employer. We are committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace for all. We recognize that our future success depends on the perspectives and contributions of all our employees -- their diverse backgrounds, abilities and experiences make our business stronger. If you are contacted for a job opportunity, please advise us of any accommodations needed to ensure fair and equitable access throughout the recruitment and selection process. All accommodation information provided will be treated as confidential and used only for the purpose of providing an accessible candidate experience.  Information Technology  Ontario-Toronto  Permanent  Full-time  Job Posting  :  May 10, 2018, 2:11:11 PM
Title: Business Analyst

Job_Description: We have a new exciting PERMANENT opportunity for a Full-Stack Developer with our public health client located at Yonge & Sheppard. The IT team is quite small, thus there will be a lot of room for growth in this position. The client is union-based, and will be offering 3 weeks' vacation, competitive benefits, pension, flexible hours and opportunities to work remote.  The successful candidate will be part of the IT team responsible for building web applications to accommodate the client's changing requirements. Responsibilities will include the development of all server-side logic, APIs, good knowledge of WordPress and Apostrophe CMS and the ability to implement front-end technologies. This position is responsible for developing and maintaining the integration between website, eLearning system and internally hosted applications, such as Microsoft Dynamics CRM.  Roles and Responsibilities  Design, implement and test web application code  Implementation of a robust set of services and APIs to power the web application  Building reusable code and libraries for future use  Optimization of the application for maximum speed and scalability  Implementation of security and data protection  Extract and analyze existing traffic, logs and usage metrics to proactively scan for issues or improvements for monitoring purposes and to assess and optimize for speed and scalability  Develop documentation, flowcharts, diagrams, code comments and training manuals  Explain the technical trade-offs of different approaches, including estimating how long each will take to build  Project estimating using work back schedules and time management with the ability to prioritize based on deadlines  Data migration, transformation, and scripting  Setup and administration of website backups  Create and modify reports  Train Shop Managers for data entry and financial report gathering  Excellent diagnostic and problem solving ability  Manage the hosting environment, including database administration, web server administration and scaling of applications to support load changes  Qualifications and Experience  A degree in computer science or related discipline or equivalent education and experience  Minimum 10 years of solid experience in Front end development including JavaScript, HTML5 and CSS3  Experience in Node.js backend development  Minimum 7 years of experience in database design and development such as MYSQL, MSSQL, MongoDB and PostgreSQL  Minimum 2 years of experience in PHP  Working knowledge of creating full stack web application using ReactJS, Relay and GraphQL  Ability to use and integrate with APIs on any platform  Solid understanding of UI and UX design  Ability to build responsive/adaptive solutions  Ability to work with creative team to implement or improve website features  Advanced comfort level with technical change management, its affects, results and consequences on current code base  Excellent debugging and troubleshooting skills  Good understanding of accessibility considerations and web standards  Experience using software versioning and revision control system SVN + or GIT  Other tools include: Gitlab, AWS console, Docker, API design and development, and RESTful services
Title: Full-Stack Developer

Job_Description: Autodata Solutions is looking for a Senior Front-End Web Developer in our London, ON office! We are looking for a Front-End Web Developer who is motivated to combine the art of design with the art of programming. This is an opportunity for a Senior Leader manage both sides and define not only how the application looks, but how it works. You will translate the UI/UX design wireframes to actual code that will produce visual elements of the application while integrating SEO principals into your design. Through collaboration with our backend developers, you will integrate REST service endpoints to the UI through AJAX calls and design the expected output from the services. MUST have solid previous experience with ReactJS to join this project. Responsibilities: Develop new user-facing features while buiding reusable code and libraries for future use Ensure the technical feasibility of UI/UX designs Optimize application for maximum speed and scalability Integrate user interfaces with backend REST services Execute effectively in a high-volume, fast-changing work environment while managing multiple time-critical issues Act as technical advisor to business owners, project management, UX Designers Troubleshoot issues with code, integrations, and other related website properties  Qualifications: 2+ years of hands-on experience designing and building React.js applications 7+ years experience with web markup, including HTML5, CSS3, and Javascript up to and including ECMAScript 6 Demonstrable experience implementing SEO principles and ensuring that the application will adhere to them Good understanding of build tools, including Gulp, Bower, Webpack, and Yeoman Proficient understanding of client-side scripting and JavaScript frameworks, including jQuery Good understanding of other advanced JavaScript libraries and frameworks, such as AngularJS (vs 1 and 2), KnockoutJS, BackboneJS, Meteor, DurandalJS etc. Good understanding of asynchronous request handling, partial page updates, and AJAX Basic knowledge of image authoring tools, to be able to crop, resize, or perform small adjustments on an image. Familiarity with tools such as Gimp or Photoshop is a plus Working knowledge of NodeJS, including Express, Meteor, and other modules Proficient understanding of code versioning tools, such as Git / Mercurial / SVN  For more information about Autodata, please visit our company website: www.autodata.net. We thank all applicants for their interest however only those selected for an interview will be notified. Autodata Solutions is an equal opportunity employer. We are compliant with AODA legislation; if you require work related accommodations, please specify.
Title: Front-End Web Developer

Job_Description: Clearly is seeking a dynamic individual to add to the success of our Information Technology team as a Front End Web Developer. Founded in 2000 in Vancouver, Canada, Clearly has become the world’s largest online eyewear and contact lenses company. Clearly designs, produces and retails the largest selection of eyeglasses on the internet. We serve customers in more than 150 countries through the Clearly family of websites: our team is responsible for systems and support for multiple warehouses and web properties across Canada, the United States, Australia, New Zealand and Japan. What You Will Be Responsible For: Working closely with web designers and other creative specialists on customer facing E-Commerce websites Interacting with the backend developers to integrate solutions and delivery bug-free features Working with the Analytical team on 3rd party JavaScript pixels implementation, providing feedback and recommendations on optimizing solutions Writing clean, structured, efficient and well documented code, always strive for maximum web page performance Contributing regularly to discussions regarding internal process and system improvements in order to ensure maximum efficiency across the company, including suggesting technical solutions to problems Following consistent processes set by the team while looking to offer constructive suggestions around new tools and ideas to enhance processes Taking on DevOps responsibilities, such as troubleshooting and debugging applications after hours when there are urgent issues on production environment Evaluating new technologies, digging into the code to highlight and execute performance optimizations and more Handling client support issues as quickly and efficiently as possible with an appropriate resolution To be aware and open to the latest software development technologies and methodologies What You Need To Do Your Job: 3 years minimum experience in software development and solid understanding of development life cycle Comprehensive understanding of computer science fundamentals Strong skills in HTML5, JavaScript, ES6, and CSS (SASS/LESS pre-processor) Working experience with Foundation or Bootstrap frameworks Ability to write vanilla JavaScript without IDE and experience with frameworks/libraries such as React, Redux, JQuery, RequireJS Experience with node.js, Gulp, Grunt, Maven and Ant Experience with at least one version control system, preferably Git Experience with Test Driven Development and writing unit tests SEO knowledge specifically related to onsite optimization (desirable) Experience in Agile/Scrum software development methodologies. Strong development capability with client-side, object oriented and a passion for UI Self-starter with strong self-management skills Ability to organize and manage multiple priorities What We Offer You: Group Retirement Savings and Employee Shareholding programs Extended health, dental and vision benefits 100% MSP coverage Flexible spending account Progressive paid vacation plan Open concept Vancouver office, designed to inspire collaboration and innovation Gym for a nominal cost and free secure bike cages available in our building; across the street from Renfrew Skytrain station and the Central Valley Greenway bike path Underground secure parking Opportunities for career growth and development Company discount on contact lenses and glasses A company that celebrates successes and recognizes its team Our progressive employee benefits, thriving corporate culture and engaging work environment led to our recognition as one of Canada's 10 Most Admired Corporate Cultures. Our innovative programming and Development and Diversity initiatives have been recognized with the YWCA Women of Distinction Award. Our team's continued efforts to change the way the world sees, especially through our Change the View project, has been recognized as the Best in the Biz Most Socially Responsible Company of the Year. To succeed on our team you must have an entrepreneurial mindset that embraces challenges, and understands the potential of the Internet as an innovative tool to buy eyewear. Applying for this position will allow you to be a part of something incredible. Clearly is a company that thrives on a culture where we believe if you can envision it, you can do it. We thank everyone who took the time to apply for this position, however, only qualified applicants will be contacted.
Title: Front End Web Developer

Job_Description: Développeur Senior de logiciels front-end Vous désirez travailler sur l’art du « Connected car » et les solutions IoT (Internet des objets). Joignez-vous à nous pour faire partie de l'aventure en tant que Développeur Sr. de logiciels front-end de l'équipe télématique ! L'équipe est responsable de développer des applications de types Nuage et IoT, et la plate-forme de messagerie. Dans un environnement en mode Agile, l’équipe logiciel est en constante évolution améliorant les méthodologies et l'environnement de travail. Relevant du Chef d’équipe du développement des logiciels télématiques, vous devrez concevoir, développer et faire évoluer les services télématiques visant à évaluer le comportement de conducteurs d’automobiles. Les solutions sont composées d’équipements spécialisés dans les automobiles, d’apps sur téléphone intelligents et de systèmes back-end. Votre expérience en développement d’applications vous aidera à être un membre actif au développement de solutions, plus précisément au niveau du front-end. Vos principales responsabilités seront : Participer aux définitions des exigences pour les solutions web et UI pour les produits télématiques Fournir une analyse pour les solutions Assurer la facilité d'utilisation, la facilité de support, la robustesse, l'évolution et la sécurité des fonctionnalités : des éléments clés pour les solutions de conception recommandées Développer et coder les solutions web et UI Collaborer avec les autres membres de l’équipe (Mobile, Interface, Embarqué, Test, TI et Marketing) and nos partenaires externes lorsque requis Travailler dans un environnement en mode Agile-Sprint Participer à notre philosophie d’amélioration continue Qualifications : Baccalauréat en génie informatique ou équivalent Dix (10) années d’expérience en développement d’applications web Minimum d’une (1) année d’expérience en développement d’applications avec Angular 2 Expérience avec les technologies de cartographie UI (Google, etc.) Expérience avec les conceptions UI/UX Excellentes aptitudes en communication orale et écrite, français et anglais Atouts : Expérience en intégration de la télématique à haute disponibilité 24X7 ou des services IoT pour véhicules Expérience avec les technologies basées sur Java Architectures de micro-service incluant Spring Boot, Spring REST & Spring JPA Développement d’application web avec Angular 4 et PrimeNG Expérience au niveau de la conceptualisation de systèmes utilisant des services Web (REST, SOAP, XML/JSON) Expérience au niveau de la plate-forme de messagerie télématique de véhicules (traitement des messages GPS, traitement des alertes, configuration de l'appareil OTA) Expérience en technologie des services web Amazon incluant EC2, ECS, RDS, DynamoDB, CloudWatch Expérience en déploiement de l’application Docker et de la gestion du contenu Connaissances de Target Process ou Jira, Confluence, SVN/Git, Jenkins Expérience avec les technologies Microsoft, un atout (ASP.NET, IIS, C#, Visual Studio, MSSQL, etc.) Expérience avec Linux, un atout Forces et compétences : Travail d’équipe Axé sur les résultats Organisé, méthodique et proactif Forte aptitude à analyser, approche systémique Habileté à se concentrer et à prioriser  Senior Frontend Software Developer You want to work on state of the art connected car and IoT solutions. Join us and be part of the adventure as a Sr. Frontend Software Developer of the Telematics team! The team is responsible to develop cloud base and IoT applications, and messaging platform. In an Agile environment, the software group is in constant mutation improving methodologies and working environment. Reporting to the Team-Lead of the Telematics Software development, you will design, develop and evolve end-to-end telematics services used to assess end-users’ driving behavior and more. The solutions are composed of in-car devices, smartphone apps and backend systems. Your web side developer background will help you taking an active part in the development process specifically in the frontend. Your main responsibilities are: Participate in the business requirement definitions for web and UI solutions for telematics products Provide functional analysis for the solutions Ensure feature ease-of-use, ease-of-support, robustness, scalability and security, key ingredients to the recommended design solutions Develop and code web and UI solutions Collaborate with other teams (Mobile, Interface, Embedded, Test, IT Team and Marketing) and outsourced partners when required Work in an Agile-Sprint environment Participate in the Continuous Improvement philosophy Qualifications: Bachelor’s degree in computer science or equivalent 10 years of professional experiences in web application development 1 year + of experience with Angular 2 application development Experience with UI mapping technologies (Google, etc) Experience in UI/UX design Excellent communication verbal/written skills (English and French) Assets: Experience in integration of 24X7 high-availability vehicle telematics or IoT services Experience with Java based technologies Micro service architectures including Spring Boot, Spring REST & Spring JPA Thick client web application development with Angular 4 and PrimeNG Experience with designing systems using web services (REST, SOAP, XML/JSON) Experience with vehicle telematics messaging platform (GPS message processing, alert processing, OTA device configuration) Experience with amazon Web Services technologies including EC2, ECS, RDS, DynamoDB, CloudWatch Experience with docker application deployment and container management Knowledge of those tools: Target Process or Jira, Confluence, SVN/Git, Jenkins Asset experience with Microsoft technologies (ASP.NET, IIS, C#, Visual Studio, MSSQL, etc.) Asset experience with Linux Strengths and skills: Team work Result-oriented Organized, methodical and proactive Demonstrate strong analytical skills and system approach Able to keep focus and priority
Title: Développeur Sr Frontend Developer

Job_Description: About Breather --------------  Breather creates and curates a network of beautiful, on-demand private spaces that you can reserve and unlock via our web and mobile apps. We are live in 10 cities across 3 countries and backed by some of the best investors in NYC and Silicon Valley. We enable top companies to do more productive and inspired work and are growing quickly! We're venture-backed; we have big ambitions, and we want you to help us achieve them.  What to expect --------------  Breather’s engineering and product is organized in small, autonomous, self-directed teams, called pods, that are empowered to solve their customers’ needs. You will be part of the Booking & Access pod, whose mission encompasses a broad spectrum of the user journey, from making a reservation on the platform, through payment and accessing the room, generally ensuring that the user has the best experience possible.  ------  Our stack includes:  Node.js MongoDB RabbitMQ ElasticSearch Redis AWS  In this role, you will: -----------------------   Build: In collaboration with your cross-functional pod, you will design, build and iterate on new features that solve your customers’ problems and make them happy. You will architect backend systems that are fast, scalable and reliable, and design apis that are enjoyable to use. Code: At Breather, we want great developers who love and care about the craft of computer programming. You will write clean, tested, and maintainable code. Lead: You will help your teammates grow through example, code reviews, and mentoring. Plan: You will elaborate the roadmap with your teammates. As part of the backend functional team, you will help drive the long-term direction of our systems’ architecture.  About You: ----------  You are highly motivated and enjoy programming and building things. You know how to make backend services fast, scalable, maintainable, and enjoyable to use. You care about the craft of writing clean code. You see beauty in HTTP headers and JSON output. You have a solid understanding of networking, distributed systems, and UNIX. Ideally, you will also have experience with systems-level programming, Docker, and DevOps.  ------  In addition to experience with some of the technologies we use, you have the following:   A bachelor’s degree in Computer Science/Engineering, or equivalent 5 or more years in an engineering or development role Excellent communication and interpersonal skills The need to keep your skillset current; a thirst for knowledge  Bonus Points:  Links to live, on-the-web examples of your work (Github, Stack Overflow, etc.) You're familiar with our product and have some ideas on things you'd want to add or change  What We Value -------------  At Breather, our company values ( https://breather.com/culture ) are not only the principles that link us together in the way we work, but they also keep us aligned on the same path, all working towards connected goals. These standards are what guide us on our collective journey through space(s).  Perks and Benefits ------------------  We hope that you're excited by all the possibilities that come with working at Breather! In addition to our unique culture, we also offer these fun perks and benefits:   Be part of a well-funded, proven startup with big ambitions, competitive salary and company equity Work when you want, where you want, with the tools you want Company-funded travel to conferences & professional development events that interest you and benefit your career growth Access to comprehensive medical, vision, and dental coverage. Oh, and it’s on us Free access to the Breather network of over 400 spaces (and growing, fast!) Dog-friendly office - bring your dog to work, they’ll find plenty of friends waiting to play with them!
Title: Sr. Backend Software Engineer - Booking & Access

Job_Description: Company Profile  Morgan Stanley is a global financial services firm and a market leader in investment banking, securities, investment management and wealth management services. With offices in more than 43 countries, the people of Morgan Stanley are dedicated to providing our clients the finest thinking, products and services to help them achieve even the most challenging goals. As a market leader, the talent and passion of our people is critical to our success. We embrace integrity, excellence, team work and giving back.  Technology  The Technology division partners with our business units and leading technology companies to redefine how we do business in ever more global and dynamic financial markets.  Our sizeable investment in technology results in leading-edge tools, software, and systems. Our insights, applications, and infrastructure give a competitive edge to clients’ businesses—and to our own.  Enterprise Technology & Risk (ETR) is comprised of five primary areas  Core Infrastructure (CI) manages the infrastructure technology solutions to support the Firm’s daily operations, enable our businesses to expand to new markets, offer new client products, and comply with evolving regulations.•End User Technology (EUT) delivers core communication, collaboration and productivity tools across the Firm, including desktop and mobile devices, remote computing solutions, and multimedia services. •Quality Assurance & Production Management (QAPM) provides production management, quality assurance, and end user services for Institutional Securities and Support Services. QAPM also manages the Enterprise Command Center, Enterprise Systems Management, and Technology Disaster Recovery services.•Technology & Information Risk (TIR) delivers first-line defenses to manage risks to Firm technology. TIR oversees programs that protect and enable the business, ensure secure delivery of services to our clients, address the risks presented by an evolving threat landscape, and meet regulatory expectations. •Technology Business Development (TechBD) manages the Firm’s strategic relationships with external technology companies.  Position Description: The TEDRA Post Execution Processing QA Team is a highly innovative team covering Functional, Regression, Integration, and Automation testing in the Morgan Stanley Equities Middle Office space. The ideal candidate will be working in partnership with the Development and Business stakeholders globally. The team extensively uses Automation and Process Improvement as an enabler for quality, stability and efficiency in the service we provide.  The candidate should be adaptive to a continuous changing and fast paced environment, be able to successfully multi-task, and thrive in a dynamic, fully engaged QA role. The role will involve interacting with clients in the Business, developers, external vendors and other QA teams.  We are looking for a hands-on Technical QA Application Tester. The Candidate needs to be able to work with geographically dispersed Dev & QA team in a very dynamic, rapidly evolving and high pressure, high visibility project setting.  The candidate is expected to contribute in a hands-on fashion on the project as well as take ownership of various QA deliverables. The following will be the candidates key focus areas. - Passionate around automating end to end testing including frontend/backend applications.- Ability to use a wide variety of open source and in house technologies and tools.- Take a hands-on approach to implementing QA processes right from requirements analysis, test design, automation and analysis. - Own the quality and timeliness of delivery- Collaborate with Developers, Business and multiple global stakeholders to drive QA agenda & standards by engaging with them throughout the SDLC- Creative thinking and solution driven. - Communicate key issues and provide progress updates in a regular, accurate, timely fashion.  Required :  5+ years of hands on experience working on QA functional/automation testing or development with Bachelor degree or higher in computer science.- Good in UNIX, SQL Scripting such as (Shell/Perl/Python), and database concepts.- Ability to work on well documented Application Program Interface (API)’s in any languages but not restricted to Perl, Java, Python etc. and leveraging a range of in-house developed tools- Solid Test design skills, test case writing, automation and analysis.- Strong analytical ability and problem solving skills- Ability to learn new things, architectural level details, innovative testing approach.- Excellent interpersonal, written and communication skills are essential.- Working experience in Application Lifecycle Management (ALM)  Skills desired:  Agile software development experience, preferably Scrum - Previously worked in an investment banking domain - Continuous Integration tools like Jenkins  Knowledge of French and English are required.  Morgan Stanley is an equal opportunities employer. We work to provide a supportive and inclusive environment where all individuals can maximize their full potential.
Title: QA Application Tester 3108876

Job_Description: Under general direction, responsible for web-based application and related systems development. Responsible for development of application modules in a team environment that meet performance, scalability, architectural, quality and business requirements. Responsible for all stages of development, application/database design, coding, testing, and related documentation.  Key Areas of Responsibility  Working within an Agile team you will: Code elegant backend and front end cloud solutions  Design, update and maintain Automation Framework and Automation Tests  Review business requirements and provide estimates  Resolve bugs, and implement unit tests to improve quality  Maintain Continuous Integration/Continuous Deployment for API’ C# for Net Web API & WCF Services.  Automation Testing (Selenium would be an asset)  Confidence in coding JavaScript for the frontend side with some of the JavaScript and CSS libraries.  Experience with various relational DBs specifically Sql Server.  Unit testing and TDD with knowledge of one or more libraries: NUnit, QUnit, XUnit and NSubstitute  Can-do attitude, problem solver, collaborator in small Agile teams.  Knowledge of Agile and SOLID Principles and practices. Bachelor's degree in computer science or equivalent.  2+ years of programming experience.  2 years experience in online development.  Strong knowledge of C#, Microsoft SQL Server, Microsoft ASP.NET platform, Visual Studio, Internet technologies, HTML, XML as well as security techniques and web server familiarity. Job_Description: Shaping the future of cloud security solutions… We are ready for the next step… Are you? ------------------------------------------------------  VASCO Data Security is a global leader in trusted security with two-factor authentication, transaction data signing, document e-signature and identity management solutions designed for all businesses and government agencies. We secure access to data and applications in the cloud and provide a robust toolset for application developers to easily integrate security functions into their web-based and mobile applications. More than 10,000 customers in 100 countries rely on us to secure access, manage identities, verify transactions, simplify document signing and protect high value assets and systems.  Due to strong growth and the rising importance of our cloud solutions VASCO Data Security Montreal is looking for no less than 6 cloud solution developers!  Do you have a passion for “Cloud Solution Development” and "Java”? Do you look forward to working with the latest frameworks and technologies? Are you ready to join a world leader in IT security and an enthusiastic international SCRUM team of Java/Cloud Developers?  ---------------- Responsibilities ----------------  As Software Development Engineer Backend, you will:  be part of our Trusted Identity Platform (TID) team, a scrum team that implements and tests fully functional back-end and cloud security solutions define, develop, deliver and maintain micro services and backend applications develop Web services in Java to interact with internal components or third parties participate in all facets of a scrum based product development (backlog refinement, sprint planning, daily scrum, review, …) work in close collaboration with the Product Owner & Scrum Master assist the application manager and cloud operations administrator teams for solution delivery support customer & professional services during proof of concept, pilot, and integration  ------- Profile -------   You have a Bachelor/Master in Computer Science or Engineering (or equivalent practical experience) Required technical knowledge: You are an expert in Java(EE); preferably micro services development You have good experience in/knowledge of: Docker and Kubernetes Git REST/SOAP You are familiar with: Spring Boot, Spring Cloud (micro service) Continuous Integration, Cucumber, Gatling, Gradle Pro-activity, strong analytical skills, a problem solving attitude and a good planning & organization are competencies you can identify yourself with. Also team spirit, result orientation and a positive attitude are key to succeed in this role. You are bilingual Assets: Experience in agile development (preferably Scrum) Knowledge on BPMN, machine learning Experience in managing SQL databases – PL/SQL (Oracle, MS SQL Server, …) and experience with NoSQL database (CouchBase) Apache Tomcat, JavaScript, .NET  -------- We offer --------   IT Security is a hot topic in our current internet economy and is becoming more and more important every single day, even critical. We all want to prevent our accounts from being hacked, our online identities from being stolen and fraudsters from signing financial transactions.  We offer YOU the opportunity to work for a leading company and help us shape the future of Cloud Security Solutions. Your contribution can make the difference!  The opportunity to work within an international SCRUM team on “state of the art” cloud security solutions, who all share their passion for “cloud”, “java” and “security” A dynamic, informal and pleasant professional environment with room for initiative A startup mentality within an established international company Daily exposure to new and innovative ideas and motivated people An Onboarding training of minimum 2 days through in-house training in our Brussels Office Possibilities for personal development An international working environment with exposure to successful business cultures and practices  #LI-EK1

Job_Description: Think you're the best in Quality Assurance? We want you!  Questrade Technologies Group (QTG) acts as the back-bone for Questrade. They act as strategic partners with each business unit to help Questrade leverage technology to gain competitive advantage. The team is comprised of very skilled, very committed individuals working collaboratively. They collectively create a unique work environment that is fast-paced and challenging, but also very open and supportive. So are they the serious, geeky-types? No way! Fun, freedom, flexibility is how QTG members describe the work culture here.  And where does the Senior Quality Assurance Engineer fit into this?  The Quality Assurance Engineer will provide expertise in the area of QA activities for applications developed by the Questrade Technology Group (QTG), with particular focus on the trading platform, web components and high volume data flow and transactions. This individual may be allocated at times to work as part of teams following agile methodologies such as SCRUM.  What’s it like working as a Senior Quality Assurance Engineer at Questrade?  The Quality Assurance Engineer will be an individual very interested in technology, particularly backend services and client/server applications. Enjoys being part of a team who builds great tools using leading edge technologies. This individual understands the concept of testability and will work together with developers and designers, providing input into their work to ensure the final product can be tests efficiently using either manual or automated approaches.  Are YOU our next Senior Quality Assurance Engineer? You are if...  ✔You have a BS in computer science or related field  ✔You have a minimum of 5-10 years experience in a QA Engineering role  ✔You have knowledge of the software development life cycle, methodologies and testing knowledge  ✔You have solid knowledge of quality assurance techniques, testing concepts, methodologies and tools  ✔You have expert ability to apply quality assurance knowledge to in-depth testing and test plans  ✔You have the ability to apply concepts of unit, system, regression, product, integration and acceptance testing  ✔You have excellent analytical skills with the ability to investigrate and research multiple sources  ✔You have excellent interpersonal and oral/written communication skills  ✔You have knowledge of Python/Bash is an asset  ✔You have experience in C/C++ code base applications is an asset  ✔You have experience in automation testing or coding or backend services is an asset  ✔You have good knowledge of SQL databases  ✔You have advanced knowledge of trading systems and trading concepts, particularly within the equities realm, is considered a very important asset  ✔You have experience with testing high performance systems is an asset  ✔You have the ability to adapt and learn quickly with an testing tool  ✔You have excellent working knowledge of LINUX/UNIX and WINDOWS environments  ✔You have good understand of automation testing methodologies  ✔You have programming skills which is an asset
Title: Senior Quality Assurance Engineer

Job_Description: About Us  The Carswell Gould web team is a committed, talented, dynamic and forward thinking group of specialists. We are focused on using modern technologies to build brilliant, attractive and highly usable web projects that aim to deliver measurable business benefit to our wide ranging customer base.  We get excited about using our honed technology stack and analytical skills to solve the business challenges of others.  Using a mixture of PHP, Drupal, Symfony 2, Laravel as our backend stack and Sass, Javascript, jQuery on the frontend, we continually deliver success for our clients across a wide spectrum of industry sectors and organisation types.  About You  You will be working in a cross-discipline team, each with their own area of expertise but all with a broad spectrum of web development skills.  You will be mainly backend development focused but should have no concerns when asked to pick up other areas of work including frontend, server management (within development environments) and client and project management.  You will have commercial PHP development skills and a solid understanding of software development. This will either be from a relevant degree level qualification or demonstrable commercial experience. You will have experience using one of the main PHP MVC frameworks.  You will have a passion for learning and testing your knowledge in new areas of technology, both self initiated and team lead. You will enjoy sharing this with colleagues and potentially the web development community at large.  You are passionate about delivering highly usable web projects that are device independent and you understand the challenges involved in multi-platform web development.  Must Haves 5+ years commercial experience in web development in PHP or similar. If you haven’t had a full 4 years in PHP development then you must have a reasonable level of experience in PHP in a commercial environment. 3+ years experience of a PHP framework, Zend, Symfony, Laravel, etc. Good frontend (Javascript, HTML, CSS) skills. Strong understanding of version control. High level of attention to detail. Agency experience. Experience in responsive design.  Nice to Haves  Drupal experience. Wordpress experience. Experience in a CSS preprocessor (SASS, LESS). Bootstrap Experience. Experience in a Javascript framework.  About the work A mixture of of big builds, creative campaign and ongoing development working with a wide range of client and sectors.  About the deal £ depending on experience Lots of benefits and lots of coffee  If you’re interested in this exciting opportunity to join the best-connected agency on the south coast contact ed@carswellgould.co.uk

Job_Description: Awesense helps electric utilities improve grid efficiency by finding energy losses due to theft, errors and inefficiency. These losses cost in the billions worldwide and have a significant impact on greenhouse gasses. Awesense addresses this issue with an integrated system of IoT sensors and grid analytics software that provide true intelligence into the distribution grid. Our system places a special emphasis on risk-based identification of losses, and has a proven track record cutting losses in half within 3 years. We have customer around the world using our solutions. What You Will Be Doing. You will be writing really good web and mobile components with code that is clean and simple even when the concepts are complex. Code that other developers respect. Code that works. Why Join Us? Because what we do makes a difference. We develop products that help utility companies around the world save wasted energy, reduce C02 emissions, and increase public and worker safety. We were recently awarded Smart Grid Canada's 2015 Innovation Award and BC's top emerging 'Green' Company. Gartner named Awesense a Cool Vendor in Energy & Utilities for 2016. Who Will You Be Doing It With? You will be part of an integrated team of software developers, hardware engineers and data scientists. As part of the software team, you will be working with backend developers, testers, and other front end developers to design, develop and deliver our next generation software as well as customize our software for global customers. You will be writing web and mobile applications that allow our customers to quickly and easily access information from our Raptor 3 devices in the field. Front End Developer Responsibilities: Create properly built web applications; Build interactive front-end components for web platforms; Commit well crafted and designed code daily; Bring agile thinking to how you work and problem solve as well as how you work with your team; Design and build web application "plumbing"; Collaborate with a multi-disciplinary team of electrical engineers, mechanical engineers, data scientists, software testers, and software developers; Leverage your UI/UX experience to design, test, and ensure a well designed system that make our users' jobs easier; Participate in planning how we bring our designs to life and participate in daily scrums; Bring ideas to improve our software through your exploration and reading of new technologies and techniques; Other duties as part of a small software team to deliver a quality product. Qualifications: Degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering or related field or outstanding self-taught ability; 4+ years experience developing clean, properly built, well designed web and/or mobile applications; Fluency in one or more of JavaScript, HTML5, CSS3; Experience with Node, Ruby, AngularJS and modern JS libraries; Experience with various support tools such as Git, CI, and Grunt/Gulp; Some experience with databases. Compensation package includes salary, comprehensive benefits package and equity.    How to Apply If you are interested in making a difference in the world, with a talented and passionate team, working on interesting problems, while making some serious equity in the process, let us know.

Title: Web Developer

Job_Description: Description:   About Us\:  The AIR MILES® Rewards Program has earned the trust and support of more than two-thirds of Canadian households. For over two decades, we have helped our Partners use Canada’s most widely accepted loyalty currency, AIR MILES® reward miles, to influence customer behavior, drive profitability, and build long-term relationships.  Check us out – LoyaltyOne on Stack Overflow | LinkedIn | Glassdoor | Facebook |Twitter  Engineering Team Culture\:  We are polyglots\: We believe in using the best tech stack for the job. We’ve written scripts in Python and built APIs in Scala, Java, Akka, and Node.js. We deploy everything to the Cloud.  We pair program\: You pick your machine\: Windows or Mac. Our floors are open space with no cubicles or private offices, regularly pair programming and mobbing when working. Teams have hack days at least once a month when they take a break to work on anything they want, and most of the time their creations end up in our production environment. Communication is key to our approach, and we don't want to hinder it with walls, real or metaphorical.  We are Agile\: Development methodologies mean different things to different people. For us? We have a story card wall and release a few times a week. We keep the team in sync with daily stand-ups and have a retrospective once a month to discuss things that are going well and opportunities for improvements. We surround teams with everything they need, Scrum Masters to coach us on the process, Product Owners to make sense of the work, Pod Leaders to help with our careers and Competency Leads to facilitate technical design and provide mentorship in advanced technical skills.  Types of projects we work on\:   As part of the AM Next team, you will be building the next generation Air Miles Reward Program platform. This new Cloud-based platform will focus on quality and security while providing massive data scalability and real-time data ingestion, processing, and consumption. We are finding new ways of working that allow us to continuously improve delivery of value with high levels of cadence and quality.   Qualification:  What we look for in you\:  Ability and desire to work in our collaborative environment\: open team room, pair programming and fluid interactions with all products and operations teams  Focusing on building solutions utilizing an agile approach; leveraging close relationships with Product Managers, communicating and digesting real-time feedback, and working smart to build story cards on daily basis  You have experience building large scale distributed systems, based on reactive principles, that are flexible, loosely-coupled and scalable  You believe that Cloud is the future and you have experience managing some of them - AWS, Azure, Google Cloud Platform or IBM Cloud  We know there are endless tools and technologies, and we don’t expect you to come in as an expert on everything, but you are looking forward to experimenting and learning.  Air Miles Perks\:  Hack Days\: one day a month you work on projects that interest you to improve your craft   Training\: from hackathons to conferences, to instructor lead, building your competency is our priority About LoyaltyOne  LoyaltyOne is part of the successful Alliance Data family of companies that provide the full range of data-driven loyalty, marketing and credit solutions in more than 80 locations across the globe.  Working with more than 100 leading brands in the retail, financial services, grocery, petroleum retail, travel and hospitality industries to profitably change customer behavior. Through a team of businesses, including one of the leading coalition loyalty programs in the world, the AIR MILES® Reward Program, LoyaltyOne designs, delivers and manages a suite of services focused on consumer data, customer-centric retail strategies, direct-to-consumer marketing, loyalty consulting and more.   LoyaltyOne has broadened its horizons geographically by growing Precima in the European market. With the recent acquisition of BrandLoyalty in the Netherlands, LoyaltyOne has gained the expertise of a global leader in short-term loyalty campaigns, along with a client network that extends throughout Europe and Asia.     About ADS   Alliance Data® (NYSE\: ADS) is a leading global provider of data-driven marketing and loyalty solutions serving large, consumer-based industries. The Company creates and deploys customized solutions, enhancing the critical customer marketing experience; the result is measurably changing consumer behavior while driving business growth and profitability for some of today's most recognizable brands. Alliance Data helps its clients create and increase customer loyalty through solutions that engage millions of customers each day across multiple touch points using traditional, digital, mobile and emerging technologies. An S&P 500 and Fortune 500 company headquartered in Plano, Texas, Alliance Data consists of three businesses that together employ more than 16,000 associates at approximately 100 locations worldwide. www.alliancedata.com    Alliance Data is an Employment Opportunity employer. Accordingly, we will make reasonable accommodations to respond to the needs of people with disabilities in accordance with legislation.  Alliance Data participates in E-Verify.
Title: Backend Developer

Job_Description: Looking to work for an awesome team? You've come to the right place! Our developers are a tight-knit group, and we are pushing for substantial product development as we continue looking to grow the team in the next year. We value passion for quality, maintainable, and scalable code, and for building awesome products. A side benefit of developing for the restaurant industry is that once we’re done working hard, we have some great clients who can always provide amazing venues for unwinding with our close knit team. TouchBistro is looking for several Backend Developers at the Intermediate or Senior level here in our Toronto office. Our POS system is evolving and our customers are demanding more product capabilities. As a member of our agile Technology team, you will have the chance to work on our current or next-Gen product's web features. Our current stack is ReactJS and NodeJS but if you have worked with other frameworks that is also sufficient. To apply for this position, you must possess a minimum 1+ years of production experience using NodeJS and SQL databases. The development team is poised for growth and along with that comes with many opportunities to learn different skills as well as have a growth path internally.   YOUR DAY-to-DAY Using JavaScript, design & implement features to help our restaurant customers succeed Create a new API using NodeJS and SQL databases on the backend Keep Up-to-Date with best practices and tooling from the JavaScript community Fearlessly Collaborate with your team to solve problems and learn from failures   ALL ABOUT YOU Knowledge of modern JavaScript, HTML5, CSS3 1+ Years of Experience with NodeJS 3+ Years of experience using a backend language (we use Node, but Java, Ruby on Rails, Python, etc. is also acceptable) Some exposure to SQL or NoSQL databases Test Driven Development Experience working on teams in an agile-scrum environment 4 year College Diploma or University Degree  WHY CHOOSE US? TouchBistro is an award-winning iPad Point of Sale system, built for restaurant people by restaurant people. We’re a team of thinkers, builders, doers, and innovators. While many of us have experience working at restaurants, some of us just have a true passion for the industry. We’re venture backed by some of the best tech VCs in the world and are partnered with top innovators in the mobile, food, and payment industries. We’re global and growing! TouchBistro is used in more than 100 countries worldwide and has offices in NYC, Austin, Chicago, London and headquarters in Toronto. We’re a fast-moving, ever-evolving company on a mission to change the way restaurateurs do business and help them succeed through our products and services, but we need talented, passionate people to help! So, what do you say? Are you ready to become part of something awesome?  TouchBistro believes in fostering an inclusive workplace where all individuals have an opportunity to succeed. Requests for accommodation due to a disability can be made at any stage of the recruitment process.

Job_Description: Who we are: SPORTLOGiQ is the leading provider of advanced analytics data for professional sports teams and broadcast media. As a Senior Back End Developer, you will work with the product development team to develop our next generation advanced analytics platform, providing our users with powerful analysis tools using SPORTLOGiQ’s unique data set. This is a once-in-a-lifetime opportunity to help shape the future of sports analysis, coaching and media storytelling.What you'll do: Collaborating with the product development team to iteratively define, design and implement the backend of SPORTLOGiQ’s hockey analysis system, from data collection to data reporting and the web UI.Owning the back end software design and architecture.Define and implement the REST API used by data analysis and collection tools as well as the customer facing Web UIs.Optimizing API and database for maximum speed and scalabilityManage testing and ensure robustness of the backend infrastructure codeManaging the deployment toolchain * Working effectively with the product development and design team to ensure back end features meet front end requirements properly.What you need: Minimum 5+ years’ experience as a Back-End Developer, Database Developer or similar related role.Significant experience of building secure, scalable RESTful APIs (PHP, Python).Significant experience working with databases and datawarehousing systems (PostgreSQL)Experience using cloud based platforms such as AWS / HerokuExperience in C++ programming a plus.Experience with FFMPEG/h264 a plus.Proficient understanding of code versioning tools, such as GitBachelor’s degree in Computer Science, or Computer Engineering.Passion for hockey a nice plus!What we offer: Extremely competitive salary/bonus programCentralized and accessible location in trendy Mile-EndCompetitive benefits packageFlexible work scheduleJob Type: Full-timeEducation:Bachelor's

Job_Description: About Mazu  Mazu is a youth engagement company helping professional sports teams across the major leagues as well as other large brands communicate with their younger audience. Through the use of our B2B and B2C products Mazu’s mission is to reconnect brands and families. We take a value based approach in delivering innovative and engaging content and solutions.  The staff at Mazu enjoy a fun, open and energetic atmosphere. Most of our team is located in Kelowna, BC with a sprinkling of remote workers throughout North America. Our clients are some of the most interesting brands and are eager to try new innovative solutions.  Leading a team of developers working with the full stack, front end to backend to create dynamically driven mobile applications. You will work with the latest mobile technologies like Ionic, Cordova, IOS, Android and Progressive Web Applications. Responsibilities will include (but are not limited to): requirements, systems analysis, code creation, unit testing, feature planning and technical documentation. Code must be designed per responsive mobile design techniques to run across a wide range of devices.  Requirements  7+ years hands-on experience building highly scalable, secure, robust applications.  Demonstrated ability to lead, develop and deliver projects on time  Be collaborative and an empowering leader.  Be diligent, demonstrating clear ownership of assigned responsibilities.  Extensive experience with JavaScript, Node.  Familiar with mobile development tools like Cordova / Ionic  Wide experience in the handling and writing of APIs and JSON data structures  Proven experience in backend systems design  Must be able to lead a small team of developers with varying experience and expertise.  Desired Skills  Knowledge of common design patterns and their application.  Working knowledge of Android and IOS OS Application development.  Experience working with MySQL database design and administration. Working knowledge of Cassandra would be a bonus!  Experience working with Typescript.  Basic knowledge of Progressive Web Apps.  Experience working with HTML, CSS, XML, JQuery and MVC Frameworks  Familiar with Agile Methodologies (SCRUM)  Solid understanding of the full mobile development life cycle  Experience in testing and debugging  Experience working with JIRA and Confluence.  Location: Kelowna, British Columbia (Must be willing to relocate and eligible to work in Canada)  Department: Development  Employment Type: Full Time  Minimum Experience: Senior-level

Job_Description: Job Description   Main focus of this job is to develop cross platform Golang based software for LoopEdge product As our core product developer, you will be part of our agile development team Your team currently develops and maintains an IoT gateway device used in industrial automation. You will embrace developing within our CI/CD pipeline and have the opportunity to improve it our code will efficiently process millions of data measurements collected from industrial devices and facilitating data analysis You will work with your development lead, the front-end team and product management team during the identification, development and implementation of the work involved You will work with our Quality Assurance team making sure the code adheres to our quality standards Qualifications   1-3 years of Golang experience, experience with C/C++, Python or Node.js is a PLUS 5+ years backend/middle tier development experience 1+ years unit tests experience 1+ years of SQL/no-SQL experience Experience working within an Agile SDLC process Experience with Test Driven Development (TDD) Strong interpersonal, written, and oral communication skills Technical documentation skills Ability to present ideas in user-friendly language Self-motivated and directed, with keen attention to detail Able to prioritize and execute tasks in a high-pressure environment Devops mentality is a PLUS    Additional Information  Litmus Automation is an equal opportunity employer and considers qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, colour, religion, creed, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital status, national origin, ancestry, age (if the individual is 18 years of age or older), veteran status, disability, or any other protected class. For more information, please view the Equal Opportunity Employment details.  Company Culture Our mission is to help organizations innovate. We want to transform how they deploy and monetize Internet of Things solutions to create a smarter, connected ecosystem for their customers. We’re working to spread intelligence by enabling smarter solutions and improve lives. To keep up with this mission, we look for amazing people, who are humble, self-motivated, focused and above all - team players.
Title: Golang Software Engineer

Job_Description: Testeur AQ Sous la supervision du directeur de l’assurance qualité (AQ) et du chef d’équipe d’assurance de la qualité de l’équipe de Montréal, le testeur en AQ logicielle devra utiliser les divers outils de test que GEE Media mettra à sa disposition pour effectuer divers tests sur une grande variété de plateformes pour les nombreux projets en cours de développement. Le titulaire du poste de testeur AQ devra élaborer des scripts de test, créer des matrices de scénarios de test qui couvriront les diverses applications en cours de développement, et assurer le maintien de la base de connaissances interne relative aux tests en amont et en aval. Le testeur en AQ logicielle participera à de nombreuses livraisons de produits nécessitant l’interaction constante des directeurs et développeurs. Plus précisément, le poste comporte les tâches suivantes :  Planification de tests  Déterminer et analyser les exigences du client.  Créer et mettre en œuvre des plans de test.  Améliorer les méthodes et processus établis.  Estimer la charge de travail relative aux processus de test.  Concevoir et mettre en œuvre des scripts de test et des scénarios de test, en collaboration avec les autres membres de l’équipe.  Participer aux efforts d’amélioration et d’innovation en trouvant de nouvelles façons de faire et technologies. Tests et analyses  Participer aux efforts d’identification des principales causes de problèmes éprouvés, et soutenir les équipes de développement dans les tâches de dépannage.  Assurer la compatibilité des projets et informer les équipes de développement des préoccupations et des risques associés aux projets en cours. Établissement de rapports sur les tests  Assurer le suivi de la progression des tâches en cours ainsi que des estimations des arriérés de tâches, et informer les intervenants touchés des contraintes temporelles à respecter.  Communiquer les évaluations de risques et signaler les problèmes aux échelons supérieurs.  Utiliser les outils existants pour assurer le suivi des bogues, des exigences et des documents produits.  Documenter les connaissances en matière d’AQ et transmettre ces connaissances aux équipes internes au besoin.  Normaliser les rapports envoyés aux intervenants concernés. Qualifications  Minimum de 3 à 5 années d’expérience en testage d’assurance qualité logicielle dans un environnement de développement de grande échelle.  Expérience dans l’utilisation d’outils de gestion des tests et des erreurs comme Zephyr et JIRA.  Expérience en testage d’AQ des interfaces frontales et interfaces utilisateurs.  Expérience en testage d’AQ des interfaces frontales et interfaces dorsales et non-utilisateurs.  Expérience en environnement de ligne de commande Linux.  Expérience dans l’utilisation d’outils de gestion de source comme Git et d’outils de gestion des versions.  Capacité d’adopter des approches de tests manuels, automatisés ou semi-automatisés pour mettre en œuvre des scénarios de test.  Capacité de recommander diverses approches possibles pour résoudre un problème relativement aux activités de test, y compris par l’utilisation de différentes combinaisons d’outils et de techniques de test.  Fortes aptitudes en communication.  Aptitudes en leadership un atout.  Connaissance pratique des bases de données SQL.  Expérience en développement logiciel ou Web un atout.  Maîtrise du français et de l’anglais, à l’oral et à l’écrit, un atout.  Expérience en tests d’API et de services Web. Domaines d’intérêt et compétences intrinsèques  Ouverture d’esprit et capacité d’adaptation dans le cadre du mandat, volonté d’apprendre, esprit d’équipe, très bonnes aptitudes en communication, capacité de gestion de diverses priorités pour respecter les échéanciers, capacité de gérer plusieurs tâches simultanées, excellentes aptitudes en résolution de problèmes, autonomie et leadership. Key responsibilities Under the supervision of the QA manager and the Montreal QA Lead, the QA Software Tester will be utilizing the testing tools available at GEE Media to perform coverage on a variety of platforms for the many projects in development. This position will write test scripts, creating matrixes of test cases that will be covered for the variety of applications that are develop and maintain internal knowledge of the front-end and backend testing. The QA Software Tester will participate in multiple product deliveries that need constant interactions with managers and developers. More specifically, the job entails to:  Test planning  Identify and analyze client requirements;  Create and implement test plans;  Improve established processes and methodologies;  Estimate testing efforts;  Design and implement test scripts, test cases in collaboration with other team members;  Help raise the bar – finding new paths and technologies. Testing result analysis  Help identify root cause of issues found, assist development teams with troubleshooting issues;  Maintain compatibility and compliance concerns and risks well communicated to the development teams. Test reporting  Track progress of current tasks, estimations of backlog and communicate time constraints;  Communicate risk assessments and escalate issues;  Utilize current tools for tracking bugs, requirements and documentation;  Document QA knowledge and communicate them to internal teams when necessary;  Standardize the reports send to stakeholders. Qualifications  Minimum 3 to 5 years’ experience in Software Quality Assurance Testing of software in a large scale software development environment;  Experience in use of test management and error management tools like Zephyr and JIRA;  Experience in QA testing front-end / user interface;  Experience in QA testing back-end / non user interface;  Experience with Linux System command line;  Experience with Source management tools like Git and with build management tools;  Ability to use manual, automated or partly automated testing approaches to implementing test cases;  Ability to recommend several different possible approaches to solving any assigned testing activities including the use of different combinations of testing tools and techniques;  Strong communication skills;  Leadership ability is an asset  Working knowledge of SQL databases;  Software and Web Development experience is an asset;  French and English spoken and written, is an asset.  Experience in testing API’s, Web Services; Areas of interest and intrinsic competencies  O pen minded and flexible on mandate, willingness to learn, team spirit, very good communication skills, ability to manage priorities to meet deadlines, flexibility/multitasking, excellent problem-solving skills, autonomy and leadership.
Title: QA tester

Job_Description: What you do at AMD changes everything At AMD, we push the boundaries of what is possible. We believe in changing the world for the better by driving innovation in high-performance computing, graphics, and visualization technologies – building blocks for gaming, immersive platforms, and the data center. Developing great technology takes more than talent: it takes amazing people who understand collaboration, respect, and who will go the “extra mile” to achieve unthinkable results. It takes people who have the passion and desire to disrupt the status quo, push boundaries, deliver innovation, and change the world. If you have this type of passion, we invite you to take a look at the opportunities available to come join our team.    Help us write the software that makes sure AMD's platforms crush the competition! Our team writes large scale infrastructure software and tools using C#, Perl, Python, and C++ for Windows and Linux environments. Our software is utilized during all stages of product development across multiple AMD sites and includes distributed automation processes, web applications and databases to track millions of records generated by thousands of systems. We are constantly adapting our software development processes to manage the challenges we accept. Join us if you are passionate about solving problems and working with the latest technologies, both hardware and software! Visual Studio and C#.Net Deep understanding of all aspects constructing a service oriented enterprise system with an emphasis on the backend Experience working on both client and server side to produce high performance applications powered by scalable web services Experience in designing, development and testing of API using REST Solid object oriented programming, multi-threading and problem
