working knowledge of SQL Experience with modern ORM frameworks such as Entity Framework and NHibernate Sufficient understanding of non-relational data stores (such as MongoDB, Cassandra, Redis) Proven interpersonal skills Must be fluent in both written and spoken English Preferred Experience and Skills Fundamentals of front end tools and technologies including HTML/CSS, JavaScript, and front end frameworks and/or libraries, such as Angular 2+, React or Ember.js Ability to write clear, consistent, simple to use interfaces Experience with RabbitMQ and other messaging frameworks Experience with Mono and cross-platform development  Qualifications Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science/Computer Engineering, or equivalent Must have 3+ years of strong software development experience #LI-EM1 Job_Description: The Role The Pason Power team focuses on the monitoring and intelligent control of distributed energy storage systems. There will be a number of potential applications ranging from installation of energy storage with solar/PV systems to utility companies looking to build a responsive and adaptable electrical grid. You will have the opportunity to combine your experience with Pason’s in data acquisition and embedded control systems combined with cutting edge Internet of Things (IoT) and cloud technologies to provide a best in class solution. Educate your peers on what you have learned. Maintain and expand our suite of automated tests Implement security best practices and protections in our web applications and with our customer data Understand and contribute to the development of system architecture Travel to Houston 1-2 weeks per year to work in person with our technical team there  Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities Proficient with JavaScript Proficient in Python, Java, C/C++/C#, or other back-end languages Understanding of React.js or similar web frameworks Experience with databases (relational and NoSQL) Experience with RESTful APIs Familiarity with code versioning tools such as Git Proficient in Linux Experience in integration and unit testing Ability to work in a team or as an individual Experience with common front-end development tools such as Babel, Webpack, NPM, etc. Experience working with hardware / Internet of Things (IoT) device control systems Familiar with container technologies (Docker) Familiar with messaging protocols such as MQTT or AMQP Build automation / continuous integration / continuous delivery experience Experience Working in cloud environments (AWS, Google Cloud, Azure, etc)  Qualifications Education  Preferred Bachelors or better in Computer Science or related field. Bachelors or better in Engineering - Electrical and Computer or related field. Experience Required 6 years: or more of software development experience on commercial development teams Preferred Experience on complex and technically diverse projects would be an asset

Job_Description: We are currently looking for an energetic Senior Software Developer with a great sense of humour to join XE. The team develops the backend applications that power the most popular apps and websites relating to currency in the world. Our platform uses Amazon Web Services and the latest open source frameworks and technologies. In this role, you will work as a part of an Agile team creating RESTful APIs, Microservices and Serverless applications to serve our customers. This includes public-facing application such as XE Currency Data API, the backend application for our popular XE Currency mobile app, and the XE Currency Bot for Alexa, Google Assistant and Slack. Responsibilities Work as a part of an Agile team. Create RESTful APIs, Microservices and Serverless applications. Work in a small team to develop, maintain and enhance our backend systems running in AWS. Keep up on best practices for systems architecture. Understand scalable architectures in a cloud environment. Deliver quality code using best practices.  Qualifications Degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or related discipline. 5+ years of experience in one or more of the following: Java, JavaScript/Node.js, Python, C#. Ability to adapt quickly and develop in-depth technical understanding of new applications and complex technologies. A strong interest in using the latest AWS technologies (API Gateway, Lambda, Kinesis, etc.) Experience with Spring Framework and/or Spring Boot. Strong communication and collaboration skills. Exposure to Play Framework.   XE welcomes and encourages applications from people with disabilities. Please advise the Recruiter to ensure your accessibility needs are accommodated throughout the process. Information received relating to accommodation will be addressed confidentially.

Job_Description: Salary: Negotiable depending on experience  Who are we?  Copperleaf is committed to building a better world, one decision at a time. As one of the top 20 Fastest-Growing Software Companies in Canada, and winner of the BC Tech 2016 Emerging Company of the Year Award and 2017 Adoption of Technology Award, Copperleaf is a dynamic and disruptive organization offering exciting opportunities for growth and innovation. Our world-class decision analytics software, C55, empowers companies managing critical infrastructure to make faster, smarter, greener and more strategic investment decisions.  What’s it like here?  When you step into Copperleaf’s offices, you’ll find a culture that fosters excellence, and a world-class team of innovators that inspire one another to grow, learn, and improve. We cultivate an atmosphere of openness and support where all opinions and ideas are valued and encouraged, and where teamwork is key to success. Our flexible work environment fosters creativity, quality and balance.   The Opportunity:  Software developers at Copperleaf navigate complex problems with technical creativity to implement highly effective quality solutions. Copperleaf is revolutionizing physical asset management, our C55 software is an advanced decision analytics and optimization tool that allows organizations to make critical real-life choices impacting the functioning and forecast of their business model.  Our Predictive Analytics team create the engine that determines our client’s long-term risk profiles and analyzes the impact of asset interventions with respect to customer-specific value-measures. The role requires a mindset which is both theoretical and practical, and the desire to be involved with projects from research, proof of concept, and prototyping through to software implementation.  As a part of the Predictive Analytics team you will not only use your background in optimization problems, probability, or quantitative modelling to research and implement new functionality into our software product, you will also be able to help explain the product concepts and complex analytics in a way which can be easily understood by peers.  Your Skill Set:  Background in one or more of the following areas would be valued:  Developing sophisticated backends for web-based applications with C#, Microsoft.NET Framework, HTML5, JavaScript and relational databases. Design and implementation of large enterprise systems and understanding the impact of system changes Object-oriented programming Multithreaded, high performance applications Data structures and algorithms Mathematical modelling (Matlab/R/Python)  About you:  Be a team player in a dynamic environment. Able to work independently and provide self-direction Understand and communicate complex technical issues Focus on product-centric rather than technology-centric development Exercise strong technical skills with attention to detail in design, coding and review Be self- motivated, flexible, pragmatic, proactive and able to handle a variety of tasks Employ excellent interpersonal skills including teamwork, respect, courtesy & discretion Masters in one of the following disciplines: Applied Mathematics, Physics, Computer Science  We’re not hung up on how much experience you may have with a specific programming language or technology. However we like to see skill, passion and creativity in the work and projects you’ve completed.  Please email your CV/resume and a cover letter to careers@copperleaf.com
Title: Software Developer – Predictive Analytics

Hands on experience and knowledge in designing and developing applications using: Experience with e-learning, m-learning, SCORM/AICC/TinCan. Experience with LMS (Blackboard, Net Dimension). Object Oriented analysis and design using common design patterns. Java EE platforms, Spring Framework, Struts and MVC. XML, XSLT and JSON. Thorough knowledge of SQL and ORM technologies (Hibernate). Working experience with SQL, Stored Procedure programming and database schemas. Required Abilities Professional, friendly and courteous in all interactions with team members and business users. Ability to remain calm even under pressure and to perform well in a busy environment. An overall business approach that is both customer and results-oriented. Strong troubleshooting and problem solving skills. Strong analytical, communication and consultative skills. Strong team player; demonstrated ability to foster positive constructive working relationships. Ability to manage competing priorities and meet deadlines in time sensitive situations. Strong work ethic; detail-oriented, creative and resourceful. Department/Team The Department / Team: Moody’s Analytics, a division of Moody’s Corporation (NYSE: MCO), is the world’s leading provider of credit analysis and related tools, including quantitative credit risk models, credit analysis software, portfolio management analytics, economic research, financial data, pricing and valuation services, and specialized consulting services. Moody’s Analytics also distributes investor-oriented research and data developed by Moody’s Investors Service as part of its rating process, including in-depth research on major debt issuers, industry studies, and commentary on topical events.The Moody’s Analytics Financial Services Training and Certification business in Canada operates as the Canadian Securities Institute, the leading provider in Canada of financial learning, credentials and certification. Job CategoryEngineering & Technology Job Sub Category Software Engineering Graduate PositionExperienced Hire Working at Moody's Moody's is an essential component of the global capital markets, providing credit ratings, research, tools and analysis that contribute to transparent and integrated financial markets. Moody's Corporation (NYSE: MCO) is the parent company of Moody's Investors Service, which provides credit ratings and research covering debt instruments and securities, and Moody's Analytics, which offers leading-edge software, advisory services and research for credit and economic analysis and financial risk management. The Corporation, which reported revenue of $4.2 billion in 2017, employs approximately 11,900 people worldwide and maintains a presence in 41 countries. Further information is available at www.moodys.com. EEO Policy Moody’s is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, sexual orientation or any other characteristic protected by law. Moody’s is committed to maintaining an inclusive, diverse and accessible workplace. To this end, reasonable accommodations are available on request, and will take into account the particular accommodation needs of individual candidates. If you are selected and require accommodation during any stage of the recruitment process, you may send your request to AODA@moodys.com. Information provided during the accommodation process will be treated as confidential, and will be shared only to the extent required to properly administer accommodation requests. Securities Trading Policy (STP) Candidates for Moody's Corporation may be asked to disclose securities holdings pursuant to Moody’s Policy for Securities Trading and the requirements of the position. Employment is contingent upon compliance with the Policy, including remediation of positions in those holdings as necessary.

Job_Description: Want to work with the #1 Best Company to Work for as voted by Linkedin in March 2018?!  Our client, a leading Bank in Toronto, is hiring BIG DATA resources to work on leading-edge programs! Eagle is currently recruiting candidates for our client’s exclusive networking event where you will hear first-hand how the Bank is changing customer experience and how Banking is moving forward at a lightening pace.  The exclusive, invite only opportunity with allow you to get in front of IT hiring executives with one of Canada's leading and most innovative banks. Working in an Agile environment where you can be your authentic self, you'll have the power to make decisions and drive transformation.  What You'll Get: A seat at the table at one of Canada's leading financial institutions  The opportunity to be part of an innovative lab where no two days are ever the same  Exceptional work environment  Competitive compensation packages  Plenty of opportunity for advancement  What the Role Is: The BIG DATA Engineer will be part of a core team responsible for the development and support of the client’s strategic derivatives, valuation and trading risk platform. This is an exciting green field project that has started utilizing the latest in technology, DevOps and approach to deliver highly scalable technology solutions that touch all parts of the Bank’s business.  The team you will work with is known in the Bank as forward-thinking and exciting. The BIG DATA team is working on a global scale….expanding its footprint globally in Toronto, London and Singapore, working in parallel with a core team based in New York.  This engineering group covers a broad range of exercises and initiatives including requirements gathering, design specification, industry analysis, vendor engagement and analysis, software development, project management, financial management, test plans and execution, and operational standards implementation. Our client’s highly-coveted Engineers are interspersed amongst many areas of focus: innovation, design, execution, maintenance, strategy, portfolio management. We call all of these things incredible learning opportunities and no two assignments are ever the same.  There's room to grow in all of it!!!  As a BIG DATA Engineer, you are expected to build and evolve a variety of custom software and hardware solutions that enable various Bank products and ensure their future growth and viability from an architectural and technical perspective.  The platform is composed of numerous micro-services built on open source technologies. Our client prides themselves on leveraging modern tools and technologies that best solve modern business problems.  What You'll Bring: TOP candidates will bring their creative ideas and enthusiasm along with core BIG DATA experience. Software development work is 90% backend and 10% front-end development, so skills in these areas is a must.  To be successful in this role, candidates will bring a solid understanding of data structures and algorithms along with at least one of the following:  Proficiency in asynchronous and concurrent programming  Experience building and delivering scalable and distributed systems using various programming languages  Solid understanding of various approaches to data storage  Strong network programming experience  Experience building large scale distributed systems that have been successfully delivered to customers  Solid understanding of test-driven development and familiarity with best-of-breed tools and technologies  In-depth understanding of the Linux operating  This role is an opportunity to embrace change and witness amazing things happen – from the inside.  This is one of many full-time opportunities with an organization consistently ranked as one of Canada's most sought-after employers. They are only interested in hiring the best people and diversity is a top priority (as an example, women make up nearly 40% of its technology leadership team). All interested technology professionals who meet the requirements are invited to apply.  Successful applicants will be forwarded directly to the client, who will contact you with an exclusive invitation to an IT networking and hiring event in Toronto. You'll have the opportunity to meet and hear from senior technology executives and discuss specific opportunities.  Don’t miss out on this opportunity, apply online today!
Title: Big Data Engineer (Full-Stack Software Developer)

Job_Description: COMPANY PROFILE:  This company are making leaps and bounds with their use of technology to improve quality, speed, accuracy and efficiency. They develop, manufacture and market two-way data communications networks for electric, water and gas utilities.  JOB DESCRIPTION:  Working within a large complex system-oriented solution, including interfacing Java client applications with Oracle database technology, and trouble-shooting complex SQL queries on the backend. Other duties include but are not limited to:  Develop tests for software and administer in a continuously integrated environment. Assist with the transition of their current software to new architecture on the user facing interface. Mentor co-op students and junior staff though reviews, coaching and pairing in an informal setting. Execute future projects, often spanning multiple divisions, all while in constant communication with department or project managers. REQUIREMENTS:  Minimum of 5 years experience developing commercial grade applications and software architecture in a comparable setting. High level knowledge of Java, JavaScript, Angular, Hibernate, Spring and REST in a commercial setting. High standard of code quality Experience with the Agile or Scrum methodology BENEFITS:  3 weeks of vacation Dental, Extended Medical, Health Spending Account, MSP Paid, Onsite Gym, Paramedicals (Chiro etc), Transit Pass Dog friendly office, happy hour Fridays, staff lounge including foosball, pool table, x-box and ping pong.  HOW TO APPLY:  Please reply with a Microsoft Word version of your resume to: ksatija@impactrecruitment.ca quoting reference # 24036 or visit: http://www.impactrecruitment.ca/ to apply online. If you would like to speak with us directly regarding this role, please contact Karan Satija at 6046898687 Ext:275 for a confidential discussion.  Privacy and confidentiality are important to us; as such all applications are kept strictly confidential. We will not share your information with anyone without your prior approval. While we will only be considering qualified applicants for this particular role, if you are interested in pursuing an alternate career path, we would certainly be happy to speak with you about opportunities that fit your profile.
Title: FullStack Developer

Job_Description: one45 is a leader in cloud-based solutions for medical education management in North America. We’re on a mission to change medical education for the better by making educators more proactive and effective at training the next generation of doctors and health-care professionals.  Work somewhere incredible As a one45 full-stack developer you will be a member of an extremely passionate development team. We’re looking for enthusiastic and motivated software developers looking for new challenges in big data; including creating ingenious data integrations, rock solid ETL pipelines, and data visualizations that sing.  You’ll be responsible for developing core features from front-end UI to backend DB on a new and ambitious SaaS product looking to change the education landscape in massive ways.  Your responsibilities Create high-quality code  Work with Product Management, Customer Service and Development in cross-functional, Agile teams to design and develop new product features. Execute the full lifecycle of software development from initial design through development and testing to deployment. Write well designed, testable code that meets our coding standards. Contribute to test plans for manual and automated testing; develop automated tests.  Embark on a bold new adventure  Create and improve upon a brand new ambitious product currently in-development. Develop and implement policies to strengthen and improve the quality of evolving code. Guide and build database designs, implementation, refactoring and optimization efforts. Segment portions of functionality into modularized services for long term reliability. Train the padawans  Review & test other developers code and provide feedback. Focus on self-improvement and productivity gains for yourself and others. Coach and mentor junior developers to solve things faster and achieve higher velocity.  Your qualifications Required  Bachelor’s degree or equivalent in Computer Science or Software Engineering. 3+ years professional experience using PHP frameworks such as Laravel or Symfony. Comfortable working on the front-end and with responsive design. 3+ years experience with object oriented programming, PHP, MySQL, HTML5, CSS3, JavaScript / jQuery. Familiarity with front end build tools such as Grunt, Webpack, Gulp, Sass, etc. Experience using package management systems (i.e. composer, npm). Thorough understanding of relational database design and implementation. Professional experience working within a LAMP stack development environment. Strong understanding of UI/UX best practices. Comfortable utilizing a version control system, such as Git or Bitbucket.  Bonus experience  Design and implementation of Data visualizations with large data sets. Hands-on experience of writing, debugging, and optimizing ETL processes. Continuous integration knowledge involving Jenkins or equivalent integration tools. Familiarity with AWS technologies and Big Data. Mobile design using Angular and Ionic framework. Experience with REST API development and security. Site performance improvement and optimization knowledge.  Your qualifications At one45, we thrive on shared values and a constant desire to delight our customers beyond their wildest expectations. Working at one45, you’ll meet some of the brightest and most enthusiastic people the tech scene has to offer.  Benefits  Top notch employer paid extended healthcare, MSP coverage, dental, and life insurance. Personal days and flexible hours. Above industry average paid vacation each year. Weekly personal 1:1s with a focus on developing your career in the direction you want to go. Fully stocked kitchen with limitless snacks, sodas, fruit, etc. Legendary summer and winter staff parties. Monthly team events (team lunches, hikes, yearly Vancouver Sun Run Team, etc). In-office beer/wine + games (darts, board games, etc) for those quiet Friday afternoons.   Apply Now Sound like a fit? If so, we want to hear from you. Send us your resume to jobs@one45.com. When applying, please make the subject line “Full-Stack Developer (CPR) – Your Name”. Shortlisted candidates will be contacted for next steps. No phone calls or agencies please.
Title: Intermediate/Senior Full-Stack Developer (CPR Team)

Job_Description: At TradeRev, we know that our greatest asset is our people; they are and will always be the driving force behind our success. Whether that comes in the form of building a unique sales solution or innovating and evolving our product...we look to our employees to disrupt the norm and make their mark on the world.  We are looking for amazing Senior Backend Java Developers who have a passion to code, and create world class products. We want promising web and app developers who have a strong foundation of coding languages and the ability to problem solve. We’ll support and push you to a new level – not only from a training perspective but also with certifications and other industry tools to ensure you are always ahead of the curve. Requirements: Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering or equivalent Minimum 5 years experience of Java development building large scalable applications Experience implementing REST-based APIs Excellent skills and experience in some or all of following tech stacks: Back-end: Node.js, Java, Spring, Hibernate, Groovy, relational databases (eg. PostgreSQL,MySQL) and non-relational data storage (eg. MongoDB, Redis) How We Support You: With Great Skills comes Great Responsibilities. We understand that in order to attain and maintain amazing coding skills, it needs to be continually up to date, so we make sure you’re all covered when it comes to any professional development, conferences, and licenses. It’s on us.  Take a look at our other benefits here:http://work.traderev.com/  Why Work with Us? Our CIO and CTO are developers as well and work intimately with the team on all the apps, so your voice and work will be heard and recognized by the key decision-makers. You’ll be given the opportunity to own your project and have room to create and see your code in action. Growth is what we’re all about and that includes you and your career. We’ll let you carve out your niche as a member of our dev team. Freedom to be involved in delivering an exciting, disruptive product to an age-old industry and drive it into a new direction.  Our Core Values: Fun. Honest. Accountable. Brave.  Our Tech Stack Java, Angular.js, Node.js, HTML5, CSS3, Android, iOS (Swift), AWS, Spring, Groovy, NoSQL db, Elasticsearch, Redis/Memcached  We thank all applicants for their interest. Only candidates selected for an interview will be considered.  TradeRev is an equal opportunity employer committed to diversity. TradeRev is committed to providing employment in accordance with the Ontario Human Rights Code and the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act. Any assessment and selection materials or processes used during the recruitment process will be available in an accessible format to applicants with disabilities, upon request. If contacted for an interview, please advise Human Resources if you require disability-related accommodation.

Job_Description: Who are we? Machobear Studio is a local established tech studio seeking bright minds where you will be working with cross-functional teams that will take on exciting and challenging projects. Although you may not have all the skills required, we want you to be resourceful and willing to learn. If you are a dreamer who puts ideas into action, we want you!  What you'll be doing: Design and build industry specific solutions using the Blockchain technology within a fast-paced environment Demonstrate your expert level understanding of functional requirements and converting them into system specifications for development Involvement in developing Ethereum based Blockchain solutions with a focus on scalability, maintainability, security and high performance  What you bring to us: A degree in Computer Science Engineering or equivalent experience Developing Smart Contracts on Ethereum Blockchain platform A deep understanding of cryptography principles of Blockchain technologies, symmetric/asymmetric, public/private (PKI), hash functions, encryption/signatures Thorough understanding of the different Blockchain implementations Built and released distributed applications and have worked with the Ethereum and/or Bitcoin blockchain Experience with Solidity, Clojure, or Serpent  Bonuses: 2+ years experience with Reactive Native and Reach JS Strong experience with backend technologies including AWS, Kubernetes, MySQL/MariaDB, NodeJS and MongoDB  What to expect: Competitive base salary and year-end bonus (based on experience) Flexible work environment and hours Weekly office socials A fully stocked kitchen We’d love to hear from you. Forward your resume and link to your online GitHub account to career@machobear.ca

Job_Description: Voices.com offers talented and motivated Web Developers the opportunity to work in a dynamic and growing company. As the ideal Web Developer, you will work from an open concept environment and be set-up with a suite of Web development tools. Through internal advancement opportunities and a competitive salary you'll have the chance to create a career that you can be proud of. Don't miss your chance to join our winning team! Essential Job Functions & Responsibilities  Design and implement our web backend platform, fast  Evaluate and spec out new product development opportunities  Rapidly iterate on software projects  Research and advise on new technologies and improvements  Desire to work in a fast paced environment  Strong collaborative skills and ability to fulfill multiple roles  Attention to detail and quality  Skills Required  Experience in development of video/multimedia sites, community sites, or other web applications  Knowledge of social media, social networking and modern web apps  Familiar with Javascript, CSS, DHTML, XML, AJAX  In-depth knowledge of PHP, MySQL, and Apache  Expertise in Linux  Excellent presentation skills, relational skills, communication (telephone and email), dependable, reliable, ambitious, driven  Educational Requirements  3+ years experience in database-driven web site development  BS or MS in Computer Science or equivalent work experience  Equal Employment Opportunities  Voices.com values diversity. Title: Web Developer

Job_Description: Description:   About Us\:  The AIR MILES® Rewards Program has earned the trust and support of more than two-thirds of Canadian households. For over two decades, we have helped our Partners use Canada’s most widely accepted loyalty currency, AIR MILES® reward miles, to influence customer behavior, drive profitability, and build long-term relationships.  Check us out – LoyaltyOne on Stack Overflow | LinkedIn | Glassdoor | Facebook |Twitter  Engineering Team Culture\:  We are polyglots\: We believe in using the best tech stack for the job. We’ve written scripts in Python and built APIs in Scala, Java, Akka, and Node.js. We deploy everything to the Cloud.  We pair program\: You pick your machine\: Windows or Mac. Our floors are open space with no cubicles or private offices, regularly pair programming and mobbing when working. Teams have hack days at least once a month when they take a break to work on anything they want, and most of the time their creations end up in our production environment. Communication is key to our approach, and we don't want to hinder it with walls, real or metaphorical.  We are Agile\: Development methodologies mean different things to different people. For us? We have a story card wall and release a few times a week. We keep the team in sync with daily stand-ups and have a retrospective once a month to discuss things that are going well and opportunities for improvements. We surround teams with everything they need, Scrum Masters to coach us on the process, Product Owners to make sense of the work, Pod Leaders to help with our careers and Competency Leads to facilitate technical design and provide mentorship in advanced technical skills.  Types of projects we work on\:   As part of the AM Next team, you will be building the next generation Air Miles Reward Program platform. This new Cloud-based platform will focus on quality and security while providing massive data scalability and real-time data ingestion, processing, and consumption. We are finding new ways of working that allow us to continuously improve delivery of value with high levels of cadence and quality.   Qualification:  What we look for in you\:  Ability and desire to work in our collaborative environment\: open team room, pair programming and fluid interactions with all products and operations teams  Focusing on building solutions utilizing an agile approach; leveraging close relationships with Product Managers, communicating and digesting real-time feedback, and working smart to build story cards on daily basis  You have experience building large scale distributed systems, based on reactive principles, that are flexible, loosely-coupled and scalable  You believe that Cloud is the future and you have experience managing some of them - AWS, Azure, Google Cloud Platform or IBM Cloud  We know there are endless tools and technologies, and we don’t expect you to come in as an expert on everything, but you are looking forward to experimenting and learning.  Air Miles Perks\:  Hack Days\: one day a month you work on projects that interest you to improve your craft   Training\: from hackathons to conferences, to instructor lead, building your competency is our priority About LoyaltyOne  LoyaltyOne is part of the successful Alliance Data family of companies that provide the full range of data-driven loyalty, marketing and credit solutions in more than 80 locations across the globe.  Working with more than 100 leading brands in the retail, financial services, grocery, petroleum retail, travel and hospitality industries to profitably change customer behavior. Through a team of businesses, including one of the leading coalition loyalty programs in the world, the AIR MILES® Reward Program, LoyaltyOne designs, delivers and manages a suite of services focused on consumer data, customer-centric retail strategies, direct-to-consumer marketing, loyalty consulting and more.   LoyaltyOne has broadened its horizons geographically by growing Precima in the European market. With the recent acquisition of BrandLoyalty in the Netherlands, LoyaltyOne has gained the expertise of a global leader in short-term loyalty campaigns, along with a client network that extends throughout Europe and Asia.     About ADS   Alliance Data® (NYSE\: ADS) is a leading global provider of data-driven marketing and loyalty solutions serving large, consumer-based industries. The Company creates and deploys customized solutions, enhancing the critical customer marketing experience; the result is measurably changing consumer behavior while driving business growth and profitability for some of today's most recognizable brands. Alliance Data helps its clients create and increase customer loyalty through solutions that engage millions of customers each day across multiple touch points using traditional, digital, mobile and emerging technologies. An S&P 500 and Fortune 500 company headquartered in Plano, Texas, Alliance Data consists of three businesses that together employ more than 16,000 associates at approximately 100 locations worldwide. www.alliancedata.com    Alliance Data is an Employment Opportunity employer. Accordingly, we will make reasonable accommodations to respond to the needs of people with disabilities in accordance with legislation.  Alliance Data participates in E-Verify.
Title: Backend Developer

Job_Description: Looking to work for an awesome team? You've come to the right place! Our developers are a tight-knit group, and we are pushing for substantial product development as we continue looking to grow the team in the next year. We value passion for quality, maintainable, and scalable code, and for building awesome products. A side benefit of developing for the restaurant industry is that once we’re done working hard, we have some great clients who can always provide amazing venues for unwinding with our close knit team. TouchBistro is looking for several Backend Developers at the Intermediate or Senior level here in our Toronto office. Our POS system is evolving and our customers are demanding more product capabilities. As a member of our agile Technology team, you will have the chance to work on our current or next-Gen product's web features. Our current stack is ReactJS and NodeJS but if you have worked with other frameworks that is also sufficient. To apply for this position, you must possess a minimum 1+ years of production experience using NodeJS and SQL databases. The development team is poised for growth and along with that comes with many opportunities to learn different skills as well as have a growth path internally.   YOUR DAY-to-DAY Using JavaScript, design & implement features to help our restaurant customers succeed Create a new API using NodeJS and SQL databases on the backend Keep Up-to-Date with best practices and tooling from the JavaScript community Fearlessly Collaborate with your team to solve problems and learn from failures   ALL ABOUT YOU Knowledge of modern JavaScript, HTML5, CSS3 1+ Years of Experience with NodeJS 3+ Years of experience using a backend language (we use Node, but Java, Ruby on Rails, Python, etc. is also acceptable) Some exposure to SQL or NoSQL databases Test Driven Development Experience working on teams in an agile-scrum environment 4 year College Diploma or University Degree  WHY CHOOSE US? TouchBistro is an award-winning iPad Point of Sale system, built for restaurant people by restaurant people. We’re a team of thinkers, builders, doers, and innovators. While many of us have experience working at restaurants, some of us just have a true passion for the industry. We’re venture backed by some of the best tech VCs in the world and are partnered with top innovators in the mobile, food, and payment industries. We’re global and growing! TouchBistro is used in more than 100 countries worldwide and has offices in NYC, Austin, Chicago, London and headquarters in Toronto. We’re a fast-moving, ever-evolving company on a mission to change the way restaurateurs do business and help them succeed through our products and services, but we need talented, passionate people to help! So, what do you say? Are you ready to become part of something awesome?  TouchBistro believes in fostering an inclusive workplace where all individuals have an opportunity to succeed. Requests for accommodation due to a disability can be made at any stage of the recruitment process.
Title: Backend Developer

We allow people to live better lives by fixing the misalignment between when people get paid and when they need their money. Employers who pay with Instant enjoy greater access to the best employees as well as high employee retention and engagement. All of this translates into a better, more profitable business. We have started the payroll revolution and need talented passionate people to join the Modern Money Movement.We are dreamers who have a proven track record of making big things happen. We do this by inspiring ourselves and those we work with to do what others cannot do. We know that we must move together as a team, celebrate our successes, and above all learn quickly from the mistakes we know will be made due to the fast pace of our execution. We carry ourselves with urgency, honesty and integrity in everything we do. Together, we truly believe we can empower working lives.About the Team: We're a small but high-performing team of engineers, building SaaS and mobile technologies for a rapidly growing organization, led by a founding team with a proven track record.We embrace Agile and DevOps practices and tools to ensure the delivery of high quality software with a high release velocity. We have a well defined product and technology roadmap in support of a very healthy sales pipeline. We have a highly efficient flat structure and ambitious growth plans.Our stack is JavaScript-based (including with Node/Express microservices). Most importantly, we work in a collaborative environment of continuous learning - we expect you to challenge us as much as we challenge you!About You: You're an intermediate to senior full stack developer with JavaScript skills. You're passionate about building web and mobile applications and you’ve had experience delivering production-grade software.You thrive in fast-paced environments where you have lots of independence and ownership. You keep up-to-date with new technologies and trends, and you're eager to learn. You live and work with honesty and integrity, you carry your work with a healthy sense of urgency, you truly believe in teamwork, and you're not afraid to be held - or hold others - accountable for what must be done.What You'll Bring: Several years experience developing production-quality software at high scaleDegree in Computer Science, or equivalent experienceAbility to learn new technologies and paradigms rapidlyStrong JavaScript skillsFamiliarity with non-relational databases such as MongoDBProficiency in a Linux environmentDeep knowledge of web technologiesExcellent spoken and written EnglishBonus Assets: Test automationWorking in an Agile+DevOps development environmentWriting Node-based microservicesWriting microservices in a framework such as ExpressAny JavaScript framework such as Angular, React, or similarJOIN US!Are you so excited about taking on this challenge, and about what we stand for, that by now you can barely sit still? Then go ahead and send us your application, we would love to hear from you.We want authentic, passionate, hard-working people who will embrace this challenge, make it their personal goal to give it all they got, and leave a legacy while knowing that, by doing so, they are truly improving the lives of everyone that touches our solutions.Referral Reward: Know someone qualified for this role? You can receive a CAD $3,000 referral reward (paid 90 days after hire) by referring them to us.Job Type: Full-time

As a Senior Back End Developer, you will work with the product development team to develop our next generation advanced analytics platform, providing our users with powerful analysis tools using SPORTLOGiQ’s unique data set. This is a once-in-a-lifetime opportunity to help shape the future of sports analysis, coaching and media storytelling.What you'll do: Collaborating with the product development team to iteratively define, design and implement the backend of SPORTLOGiQ’s hockey analysis system, from data collection to data reporting and the web UI.Owning the back end software design and architecture.Define and implement the REST API used by data analysis and collection tools as well as the customer facing Web UIs.Optimizing API and database for maximum speed and scalabilityManage testing and ensure robustness of the backend infrastructure codeManaging the deployment toolchain * Working effectively with the product development and design team to ensure back end features meet front end requirements properly.What you need: Minimum 5+ years’ experience as a Back-End Developer, Database Developer or similar related role.Significant experience of building secure, scalable RESTful APIs (PHP, Python).Significant experience working with databases and datawarehousing systems (PostgreSQL)Experience using cloud based platforms such as AWS / HerokuExperience in C++ programming a plus.Experience with FFMPEG/h264 a plus.Proficient understanding of code versioning tools, such as GitBachelor’s degree in Computer Science, or Computer Engineering.Passion for hockey a nice plus!What we offer: Extremely competitive salary/bonus programCentralized and accessible location in trendy Mile-EndCompetitive benefits packageFlexible work scheduleJob Type: Full-timeEducation:Bachelor's

Job_Description: We believe that no enterprise should have to choose between data security, regulatory compliance, and ROI.  That’s why we’ve made it our mission to help organizations take full advantage of multi-cloud cost-efficiency, resilience, agility, and scale — with full assurance their data is protected, compliant and with IT controls that extend across the cloud.  We’ve reinvented software-defined object storage by combining the cost and resource efficiency of the object storage approach with exceptionally strong, blockchain-hardened data protection and the capacity to manage data on a petabyte scale.  We're growing rapidly, and we’re looking for a Blockchain Developer to join our team.  What does the job entail?  Blockchain is evolving quickly.  We’re building a brand-new team with an initial emphasis on research and rapid prototyping, though fully expect to launch production software in the very near future. This is an opportunity to join us as an early core team member and help define our product.  What does the successful candidate “look like”?  We’re a fast-paced start-up, so we need versatile self-starters who are motivated by new technologies and will jump right in. We’re not overly hung up on what languages you’re most comfortable with, but we are focused on hiring those with a learning mindset and are comfortable working in a rapidly evolving environment.  We don’t expect to find someone that is a perfect match to the details below, but here are the typical bullet points that we’re hoping you bring to the table:  5+ years of software development experience (Java/C/C++).  Experience developing and deploying backend applications.  Experience creating web services and RESTful APIs.  Understanding of cryptographic algorithms, application security architecture, security standards, and secure development best practices.  Distributed database experience.  Success working with customers, sales, and customer-focused teams to understand unique requirements.  A passion for agile development.  A great sense of humour : ) .  In a perfect world, you’d also have: Technical knowledge of public/private blockchains.  Experience developing distributed ledgers and smart contracts, and APIs for applications to interface with the blockchain.  Cryptography / computer security background, with expertise in any of FIPS 140-2, PKI, network security, IoT security, cloud security, web services security.  A strong understanding of DevOps, Jenkins, continuous build/test/deploy systems.  What’s in it for me?  We’re a small team with the heart of a start-up. We treat each and every person that joins us as a VIP, and everyone has the opportunity to make a significant impact on the success of our business. Although we don’t have a go-kart track and beach volleyball pit on our premises, we’re big on providing autonomy, mastery, and purpose, and ensuring that our employees have a strong life-work balance.  We create awesome technology with awesome technology, our leadership has been around the block a few times and knows what leading a rapid growth tech company is like, and we treat our people like our biggest asset and differentiator; because they are.  What can I expect when I submit my application?  Our recruitment partner – Pivot and Edge – will review your application and either schedule a conversation with you or let you know that we’re passing on your candidacy within 5 business days.  What does the interview process involve?  The first step is a conversation with Pivot and Edge. They’ll focus on the human side of things and answer any questions you may have. From there, we’ll provide an opportunity for those that exhibit a high potential to be successful in our environment to demonstrate their technical capabilities and then talk shop with some of our engineers and leaders. Assuming you’re one of our finalists, we’ll be sure to give you a tour of the office and introduce you to some of your future teammates.  We’re not just interviewing you.  We want to make sure that we’re the right fit for each other, so please feel encouraged to interview us at every step.  What is the target start date for this role?  We’re motivated to hire for this role now, though worst case scenario we’d like to have our new teammate onboard by the end of April.  What if I have more questions before I apply?  No worries at all! If you have additional questions prior to submitting your application, please feel free to reach out to John Fleischauer at Pivot and Edge. He accepts all connection requests on LinkedIn and does his best to reply to all messages within 24 hours.  About Us: Leonovus is a cloud solution software provider that offers the leading software-defined object storage solution (SDOSS) and governance, risk management and compliance (GRC) solution for the modern enterprise. Designed with the IT manager in mind, Leonovus’ patented algorithms virtualize, transform and disperse data across a network of on-premises, hybrid or multi-cloud storage nodes – allowing for the most secure yet internally accessible form of object-based data storage that provides GRC across the entire solution. The advanced architecture minimizes latency, optimizes availability, reduces remote backup costs and meets data sovereignty requirements. With its software and hardware agnostic design, Leonovus provides petabyte scalability and allows the enterprise to utilize its existing idle storage resources, extend the usable lifespan of depreciated resources and improve the enterprise’s overall ROI.  Leonovus is an equal opportunity employer. Should you require accommodation in any aspect of our selection process, please contact Vanessa Martone of Pivot and Edge at vanessa.martone@pivotandedge.com / 613-599-4339 x 224.
Title: Blockchain Developer

Job_Description: Hothead Games is 150 people that make free-to-play mobile games, located in Vancouver, British Columbia. We are one of the world’s top publishers in the first person shooter and sports genres. We move fast, we do amazing work and we have a lot of fun doing it.  Hothead’s Backend team is looking for a DevOps Engineer to join us. We support our games by building and operating server infrastructure that is highly scalable and fault tolerant. We strive for generalized automation of testing, provisioning, deployment, and capacity. We believe in building tools that empower and enable developers to self-serve. We work extensively with Amazon Web Services.  As an ideal candidate you want to work with a team to build something we can be proud of, that has been done right. You enjoy being relied upon. You are comfortable exploring unchartered territory, where the best technical decision is not clear up front, where you might make mistakes. You value the role of well-defined processes in running a smooth operation. You appreciate unit testing, measurement, automation, and configuration as code. You operate calmly and rationally under pressure, and are able to diagnose problems quickly and fix operational issues at their source. You devote time to keeping your knowledge state-of-the-art. Duties & Responsibilities Operate and continuously improve Hothead’s backend server infrastructure Work with game teams to build new backend features and infrastructure Expand automation, ensure all changes to capacity occur automatically Build tools that empower developers and front-line player support teams Optimize our delivery pipeline Requirements Experience with Amazon Web Services Fluency in modern web languages and frameworks, especially Python Proficient in Linux system administration 3+ years working experience (in comparable role - video game experience not required) Bachelor’s Degree in Engineering or Computer Science Bonus Points Databases: DynamoDB, Redis, SQL Configuration management: Chef, Ansible, Docker Metrics and Logs: Kibana, ElasticSearch, Logstash, Fluentd, Graphite, InfluxDB, Statsd, Grafana Monitoring and Alerting: Nagios, Datadog, Sensu, Shinken, PagerDuty This position is for our Vancouver office, located at 1555 West Pender Street, in beautiful Coal Harbour! Compensation includes salary, vacation and a great Extended Health and Dental package. Lots of other benefits including an in-house gym, RRSP Matching, company golfing, major/minor league sports event, summer BBQs, snacks, beer and amazing people to work with!
Title: DevOps Engineer

Job_Description: English version to follow  Venez changer le monde de la messagerie avec nous!  Smooch (www.smooch.io) donne le coup d’envoi à la prochaine vague d’innovation en matière de messagerie et transforme la façon dont les entreprises et les consommateurs communiquent. Notre nouvelle technologie de messagerie s’affaire à révolutionner et à humaniser les interactions entre les gens, les entreprises et la technologie.  Contribuez au plus grand tournant en matière de communication depuis des décennies.  Nous sommes à la recherche de développeur(e)s de logiciel mobile expérimenté(e)s voulant se joindre à notre équipe de Montréal pour développer principalement nos kits de développement (SDK) mobiles fournissant des interfaces usager (UI) conversationnelles et des interfaces de programmation (API) natives sur iOS et Android. Ces trousses mobiles sont soutenues par des services web sur HTTP ou websocket (Node.js, Express, ES6+, MongoDB, Redis, etc.). Vous contribuerez ainsi au développement d'une plateforme utilisée par des milliers de développeurs et des millions d’utilisateurs à travers le monde.  En tant que membre de l’équipe d'ingénierie, vous serez responsable de :  Développer les fonctionnalités de nos SDK mobiles, incluant les interfaces usager conversationnelles et les API natives.  Livrer des fonctionnalités de bout en bout en collaboration avec l'équipe et avec un haut niveau d'autonomie.  Écrire du code bien structuré et testé qui tient compte de la performance, la fiabilité, la compatibilité et la flexibilité de nos produits. Travailler avec les technologies les plus récentes et avancées dans une équipe d'ingénierie qui est toujours ouverte aux nouvelles idées.  À propos de vous : Vous êtes un(e) développeur(e) mobile talentueux(se) avec au moins 2 ans d'expérience professionnelle. Vous êtes à l'aise en Objective-C et très familier(ère) avec l'écosystème iOS. Vous avez un niveau d'intérêt similaire pour Android. Vous avez travaillé sur des solutions mobiles ou des composants utilisés par d'autres développeurs. Vous connaissez les principes REST et vous êtes prêt(e) à contribuer à l'implémentation d'API sur Node.js. Vous voulez collaborer avec une équipe dynamique qui vous inspirera et vous aidera chaque fois que vous serez bloqué(e).  À propos de Smooch: : Smooch est une startup de San Francisco/Montréal, soutenue par une équipe chevronnée d'entrepreneurs en technologie, d’ingénieurs logiciels, de conseillers et d'investisseurs.  Ce qui nous distingue vraiment, c’est d’abord et avant tout notre culture sympathique et notre raison d’être. Nous accordons une grande importance à la transparence, au sens de l'initiative et de la responsabilité, comme à la capacité de prendre des décisions et de les assumer. Nous aimons travailler fort tout en ayant du plaisir, et être solidaires dans le succès comme devant l’épreuve.  Ce que vous aimerez chez nous : Vous aurez la liberté de proposer des idées, le soutien nécessaire pour les concrétiser Vous aurez la chance de prendre des projets à bras-le-corps et d’être dans le feu de l’action. Nous avons appris à célébrer nos victoires et à apprendre de nos échecs, et nous voulons vous aider à donner le meilleur de vous-même. Notre politique de vacances généreuse ainsi que nos horaires (et nos lieux) de travail flexibles auront de quoi rendre vos amis jaloux. Nous vous encourageons et vous soutenons dans le développement continu de vos compétences, afin de vous permettre d’approfondir votre connaissance de l’industrie et de pousser votre expertise en matière de messagerie encore plus loin. Dans notre équipe, on a du fun . Nous sommes une gang de passionnés qui aiment leur travail, mais qui savent aussi s’amuser – jeux de sociétés, jeux vidéo, jeux de cartes, soirées cinéma, sport : ici, on ne s’ennuie jamais! Smooch organise et/ou commandite régulièrement des hackathons à l’intérieur comme à l’extérieur de nos bureaux. Situé à Montréal, en plein cœur du Mile-End – un repère de startups –, notre bureau offre une vue imprenable sur le quartier. Autres points bonis : nous sommes à deux pas du centre culturel du Mile-End et du meilleur café en ville.  --  Vous pensez avoir ce qu’il faut pour relever le défi? Nous invitons tous les gens brillants et ambitieux à se joindre à notre équipe en pleine croissance. Promis : ce sera l'une des expériences les plus plaisantes, mémorables, gratifiantes et importantes de votre carrière.  Veuillez noter que tous les candidats retenus devront se soumettre à une vérification de leurs antécédents.  -------------  Come change the world of messaging with us!  Smooch (www.smooch.io) is enabling the next wave of messaging and changing the way business and consumers communicate. Our new messaging technology is revolutionizing and humanizing how people interact with businesses and technology.  Be part of the biggest change in the way people communicate in decades.  We are seeking experienced Mobile Software Developers who are excited to join our team in Montreal. You’ll work on our mobile SDKs, which provide conversational UIs and native APIs (iOS, Android), and are backed by RESTful and websocket-based APIs (Node.js, Express, ES6+, MongoDB, Redis, etc). You’ll be involved in building a platform that is currently used by thousands of developers and millions of their end users around the world.  As part of the Software Development Team, you will: Expand the capabilities of our mobile native SDKs which provide conversational UIs to end users, expose native APIs to developers, and interact with our backend. Work with a high level of autonomy, owning features from start to finish, while being supported by an experienced team. Write well structured, unit tested code while taking into account the performance, reliability and scalability of our products. Work with the latest and greatest technologies within an engineering culture that is always open to new ideas. Use your own expertise to mentor us, your teammates.  About You: You are a proficient mobile developer with at least 2 years of professional experience under your belt. You are well-versed in Objective-C and very familiar with iOS frameworks and ecosystem. You have a similar level of interest on Android. You have worked on mobile frameworks or open sourced components used by other developers. You are familiar with RESTful APIs and open to contributing to their implementation (Node.js). You want to collaborate with a dynamic team that will give you help and inspiration whenever you get stuck.  About Smooch: Smooch is a venture-backed San Francisco/Montreal-based startup, led by a team of seasoned and successful technology entrepreneurs, software engineers, advisors and investors.  Our friendly culture, full transparency, and purpose is ultimately what really sets us apart. We value taking initiative and owning the accountability that comes with it. We thrive on working hard and playing well, sharing our wins and owning our failures.  You’ll love: The freedom to put ideas on the table, the support to see them through and the recognition for seeing your projects come to fruition. The opportunity to take ownership and have an impact. We know how to celebrate successes and learn from our failures. We want to help you do your best work with us. Our generous flexible vacation policy as well as flexible work hours (and location!). We invest in and support you in your continuing skills development, helping you to develop your industry knowledge and increase your expertise in the messaging space. A fun team environment. We are passionate about our work, and also know how to have fun – board & card games, movie nights, video games, and more! Our offices in the heart of the Mile-End start-up neighborhood with a million dollar view for everyone to enjoy. We are steps away from the cultural centre of Montreal’s Mile End as well as the best coffee in the city.  --  Think you're up to the challenge? We're inviting bright, ambitious & progressive people to join our growing team - we guarantee it will be one of your most enjoyable, memorable, rewarding, and important gigs of your career.  Please note that successful applicants will be required to undergo a background check.
Title: Mobile Software Developer / Développeur(e) de logiciel mobil...

Job_Description: Global Relay is the leading provider of cloud-based archiving, supervision, eDiscovery, and analytics for the global financial sector. We deliver services to 23,000 customers in 90 countries, including 22 of the top 25 global banks. Our market-leading archiving service supports email, instant messaging, Bloomberg®, Thomson Reuters, social media, mobile messaging, and more – with mobile, Outlook, and web access.  Our Global Operations & Development Center is located in Vancouver, BC, Canada. In addition, we have offices in six other cities across the world, including major financial centers like New York, Chicago, and London.  Over the years, we have won several major awards, including: Company of the Year from the BC Tech Association (2016) Canada’s 50 Best Small and Medium Employers (2014, 2015) Canada’s Top Employers for Young People (2014) Canada’s Top 10 Most Admired Corporate Cultures (2013, 2016) Canada’s Best Managed Companies (2013 - present)  We provide fantastic opportunities to individuals passionate about business and technology. For those with international business aspirations, we offer invaluable opportunities for doing business with some of the world’s largest, most influential firms. Our company is also perfect for those who want to create cool technology using massively scalable, big-data architecture, with a strong focus on mobile.  To learn more about our business, culture, and community involvement, visit www.globalrelay.com. The Role: The Software Development Engineer in Test (SDET) is a developer who specializes in writing code to test the product. They work directly with Developers, Product Managers and other SDETs to understand requirements and designs for upcoming changes, and to devise appropriate test strategies for those changes. They design and write the code for automated test cases and perform hands-on testing.  In this role you will be working directly with code in an established automation framework to test back-end services for large scale data processing. You will support the team’s release and testing efforts while growing and maintaining automated coverage and frameworks.  Role Responsibilities:  Define and automate test cases that verify product requirements Write code to support development of automated frameworks and tests Execute test cases using both automated and manual techniques Identify, report, and verify software defects Maintain test infrastructure and tools Participate in team planning and story grooming Conduct code reviews, improve and maintain quality of the automation code Document the automation framework, tools and infrastructure  Technical Skills Requirements:  Minimum 3 years of test development experience Strong understanding of either Java, C# or Python programming languages Experience with backend systems or APIs Experience with testing practices in an agile environment Experience with any of the following is an asset: Big data technology such as Hadoop, MongoDB, Kafka or SQL Performance testing with JMeter or similar tools Web services technology such as REST, JSON or Thrift Network protocols such as HTTP, TLS and TCP Continuous integration systems such as Bamboo or Jenkins Frontend automation with Selenium WebDriver Web technologies such as CSS3, HTML5 or Extend.JS (Sencha) Multi-threaded programming Design patterns  To Apply:  Think you’re a great fit for this job? Apply today with your cover letter and resume in one PDF document. No phone calls please. Applicants must be eligible to work in Canada.
Title: Intermediate Software Development Engineer in Test (Backend)

Job_Description: Job Summary: We’ve been named a Glassdoor Employee Choice winner, a San Francisco Business Times/Silicon Valley Business Journal Top 25 best place to work and one of the SBI 10 Best Companies to Sell for in 2016. Responsibilities:  We need a talented developer to join our frontend development team in Markham. You will participate in the development of Genesys Workforce Management product, which is deployed in the Cloud and on-premise with JavaScript front end and Java, C++ backend. You Will work with other team members to investigate design approaches, prototype new technology, and evaluate feasibility. You will participate in full development cycle including code review, unit testing - we are very serious about the code and product quality. You will be doing test automation as needed. You will assist with issue resolution in the existing and newly developed parts of the product. Advanced understanding of modern web development (e.g. HTML5, CSS3, LESS, etc.) Experience with modern JavaScript Frameworks (React, Vue, Flux, Angular, Backbone, jQuery, etc.) Ability to manually craft HTML and CSS. We put the customer at the center of everything we do and passionately believe that great customer engagement drives great business outcomes. More than 10,000 companies in more than 100 countries trust the industry’s #1 customer experience platform to orchestrate omnichannel customer journeys that eliminate silos and build lasting relationships. With a strong track record of innovation and a never-ending desire to be first, Genesys is the only company recognized by top industry analysts as a leader in both cloud and on-premise customer engagement solutions. Connect with Genesys via www.genesys.com, Twitter, Facebook, YouTube, LinkedIn, and the Genesys blog. Genesys is an equal opportunity employer committed to diversity in the workplace. We evaluate qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, disability, veteran status, and other protected characteristics. #LI-BJ1

You will be responsible for the design and development of our internal web based programs that are used in multiple departments. You must be comfortable working within a fast-paced environment. You must possess a keen sense of enthusiasm and attention to detail, as well as a sense of commitment and dedication to our team. As part of the DRW ( https://drw.com/ )family of companies, we work together with more than 800 colleagues in seven offices around the world.  We evolve as the markets do - moving quickly and thinking differently - but one thing that’s been constant is our investment in our employees and our community. Vigilant is a place of high expectations, deep curiosity, and constant collaboration, with some of the smartest, most passionate people you will meet.

Job_Description: We are looking for a strong Principal Software Developer, who will have an opportunity to lead, develop and design highly scalable and performant architectures across multiple teams and set the technical direction for the entire walmart.ca FE teams. You will be responsible for driving and building prototypes for complex and large initiatives while providing guidance and insight into deep technical and performance issues. As a Principal Software Developer, you will also lead the transition of our platform to micro-app architecture and help us in evaluating best technical choices for this transition and evangelize those technical choices to other teams. You will also work closely with Product Owners, UI/UX, and other senior engineering team members to define the future architecture and system design to support new business needs. Position Responsibilities Design and develop scalable, performant and responsive FE architecture for multiple teams. Able to understand, diagnose and then solve deep technical and performance issues across the platform. Able to set the technical direction and roadmap for the teams Lead architecture and design sessions with the teams Build proof-of-concepts to validate architectural and design choices and evangelize those technical choices to other teams. Design and architect fault-tolerant and highly performant API gateway layer which can interact with many other micro-services. Able to understand future business goals from Product Owners and make sure architecture and system design can support those goals. Actively participate in Code Reviews and, in growing and coaching of fellow team members. Canada Walmart DivisioneCommerce Qualifications BA/BS/MA/MS degree in Computer Science or closely related field or equivalent practical experience. 12+ years of software development experience working in NodeJS, Scala, Java, Ruby on Rails or Python. Strong knowledge of JavaScript, JavaScript Frameworks (React, Ember or Angular), CSS3, HTML5, asynchronous request handling, and AJAX in highly scalable and available applications. Strong understanding of all the different components (Frontend, Backend, Storage, Caching layer etc) of the web application and their interactions. Expert in building responsive UIs which are optimized for mobile devices. Experience with persistence and caching technologies (eg. MySql, Postgres, Memcache, Redis) Experience working with micro-services architecture and distributed systems. Solid understanding of building RESTful APIs. Ability to clearly and effectively communicate at all levels from development to executive levels. A history of open-source contribution is an asset. AccessibilityWalmart will accommodate the disability-related needs of applicants and associates as required by law.
Title: Principal Software Developer

Job_Description: In the last 5 years, Prodigy has gone from 3,000 to over 30,000,000 students across North America (including 80% of all Ontario students), and is currently the fastest growing educational startup in North America. By joining our team, you will have the opportunity to help an entire generation of students to LOVE learning while working alongside some of the brightest and most passionate people in education and gaming.  What you’ll do: Assist in guiding and supporting a new development team in downtown Toronto Lead and mentor multiple development teams and Technical Leads; enabling them to improve the product, ship code faster, and further their careers Make architectural decisions that will help us scale our product for the next 10 million students Work cross-functionally with an agile team including Product, UX & Design, Development, and QA Provide input on technical design and product features And much more... What you’ll need: Excellent communication skills A passion for user experience and performance Experience leading and managing product teams Experience designing high availability systems A solid understanding of JavaScript and HTML5 Experience with one or more JavaScript frameworks (Backbone, React, Angular, Vue.js, Ember, etc.) Experience writing API endpoints and working with databases (PostgreSQL, Dynamo DB, etc.) A love for learning and staying on top of the latest in web development Our core technologies: Backend: Node.js, GraphQL, Postgres, Dynamo DB, Redis, AWS Frontend: React, Backbone (legacy), ES6, SASS & BEM We Offer: Full health benefits A really generous gym and learning allowance Flexible working hours Opportunities for career growth The ability to impact the lives of millions of kids Snacks and a really good coffee machine We are an equal opportunity employer and are committed to providing employment accommodation in accordance with the Ontario Human Rights Code and the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act, 2005 (AODA). Prodigy Game will provide accommodations to job applicants with disabilities throughout the recruitment process. If you require an accommodation, please notify us and we will work with you to meet your needs.

Title: Software Development Engineer 1 (CARD2232)

Job_Description: User Experience Designer  ABOUT IT AT CN  CN harnesses the power of information every minute of every day to make better decisions. Almost every aspect of our business relies on technology; this is why CN invests around $100 million every year on IT projects and infrastructure. And with close to 1,000 in-house employees, CN’s IT team is more than a first-class technology shop – they’re railroaders, dedicated to enabling our people to work better and to helping our trains run safely.  WHY YOU WANT THIS JOB  The User-Experience Designer play a key role in enabling user/technology adoption, improving user engagement and trust in the application. This person is responsible to learn and understand how users work for producing creative user-centric experiences and application interfaces. Their role is to understand user pain points and areas of concern to match people’s needs with what is technologically feasible to provide maximum business and user values. As a User Experience Designer, you are conducting user research, creating journey maps and wireframes to define optimal system usability. You are also responsible to produce high fidelity Mock-ups, visual prototypes as well as initial UI code framework for front-end efficiency and cohesive backend integration. You collaborate with application and data designers to understand underneath business rules and data flow that needs to be consider for user interface design, support code development, and insure that product meets client need by conducting usability testing with Business.  You want this job because you advocate, at all time, user experience to improve user/technology adoption, reduce usability problem and increase user effectiveness in their day-to-day work. You have a solid experience in creating wireframes, storyboards, high fidelity mock-up and prototype. You have a technical background that enable you to support the front-end developers that are responsible for coding the UI framework. You are driven by innovation and up-to-date with the latest UI trends, techniques, and technologies with deep understanding of mobile-first and responsive design.  RESPONSIBILITIES Conduct user workshops and stakeholder interview to discover range of opportunities for experience improvement Facilitate client vision leading user experience workshops to determine target audiences, user needs, data requirements and compile them into user flows and storyboards Understand business rules, user-system interaction, data models and flows, to ideate and translate concept to begin laying out interfaces (wireframes) Understand and work with various technologies to determine the appropriate framework to produce the application Produce High-Fidelity Mockups and Prototypes Produce visual assets such as icons and visual style guide elements Improve proposed model through usability sessions and user feedback Document user interface behavior and interaction patternsCollaborate with UI developers to provide integration solutions for applications; ensuring the usability interface components are optimally performing well with dynamic data Drive usability testing with the business and adjust product to improve user experience REQUIREMENTS  Bachelor degree inComputer sciences or Software Engineering with a focus on Front-End Engineering and User Experience Design OR Bachelor degree in Graphic / Visual design (or equivalent training) Gradutate level education in human computer interaction or cognitive ergonomics is considered an asset Minimum of 5-7 years of relevant experience in using UX design best practices to design solutions, and a deep understanding of mobile-first, responsive design and Front-End Development Experience with Front-End Framework libraries, and custom integration using HTML5, CSS3 and Preprocessors (Both LESS and SASS), JavaScript (jQuery) Experience with vector-based and/or prototyping applications (Adobe Illustrator, Adobe Interactive Design, Sketch, Axure, MarvelApp, inVision) Familiar with Agile and Waterfall project methodologies Ability to work with business clients to understand detailed requirements and design complete user experiences that meet client needs and vision Understand the importance of user-centered design Bilingualism with high proficiency in English (spoken and written)   CN is an employment equity employer and we encourage all qualified candidates to apply. We thank all applicants for their interest, however, only candidates under consideration will be contacted. Please monitor your email on a regular basis, as communication is primarily made through email.
Title: User Experience Designer
